trans-unit.target: Yna newid pwy bynnag y gymynrodd ar ôl wedi clywed ei-y pechod yn unig ar y rhai sydd wedi ei newid. Yn wir, Allah yw gwrandawiad a gwybod.

trans-unit.source: But if one fears from the bequeather [some] error or sin and corrects that which is between them, there is no sin upon him. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ond os un yn ofni o bequeather [rai] gwall neu pechod ac yn cywiro sydd rhyngddynt, nid oes dim pechod arno. Yn wir, Allah yn Forgiving a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, decreed upon you is fasting as it was decreed upon those before you that you may become righteous -
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, a ddyfarnwyd ar chi yn ymprydio fel oedd ei dyfarnu ar y rheini cyn i chi y gallai ddod yn hoes dabloid-

trans-unit.source: [Fasting for] a limited number of days. So whoever among you is ill or on a journey [during them] - then an equal number of days [are to be made up]. And upon those who are able [to fast, but with hardship] - a ransom [as substitute] of feeding a poor person [each day]. And whoever volunteers excess - it is better for him. But to fast is best for you, if you only knew.
trans-unit.target: [Ymprydio am] nifer cyfyngedig o ddiwrnodau. Felly pwy bynnag ymhlith ydych yn sâl neu ar daith [ystod eu]-yna nifer cyfartal o diwrnod [yn yn y]. Ac ar y rheini sy'n gallu [i cyflym, ond gyda caledi]-pridwerth [fel rhodder] o fwydo person gwael [bob dydd]. A pwy bynnag gwirfoddolwyr dros ben-mae'n well iddo. Ond cyflym sydd orau i chi, os oeddech yn gwybod dim ond.

trans-unit.source: The month of Ramadhan [is that] in which was revealed the Qur'an, a guidance for the people and clear proofs of guidance and criterion. So whoever sights [the new moon of] the month, let him fast it; and whoever is ill or on a journey - then an equal number of other days. Allah intends for you ease and does not intend for you hardship and [wants] for you to complete the period and to glorify Allah for that [to] which He has guided you; and perhaps you will be grateful.
trans-unit.target: Y mis o Ramadhan [yn y] yn Datgelodd a oedd yn y Qur'an, canllawiau ar gyfer y bobl a'r proflenni canllawiau a meini prawf clir. Felly pwy bynnag golygfeydd [y lleuad newydd o'r] mis, gadewch ef yn gyflym; a pwy bynnag sydd yn sâl neu ar y siwrnai-yna nifer cyfartal o ddyddiau eraill. Mae'r Allah yn bwriadu er hwylustod ichi ac nad yw'n bwriadu ar gyfer caledi chi a [am] i chi gwblhau'r cyfnod a fawrygu'r Allah ar gyfer hwnnw [i] y mae wedi'i dywys chi; ac efallai y byddwch yn ddiolchgar.

trans-unit.source: And when My servants ask you, [O Muhammad], concerning Me - indeed I am near. I respond to the invocation of the supplicant when he calls upon Me. So let them respond to Me [by obedience] and believe in Me that they may be [rightly] guided.
trans-unit.target: A pan mae 'm gweision yn gofyn i chi, [O Muhammad], sy'n ymwneud â mi-yn wir yr wyf yn agos. Ymatebaf i gallu y ddeisyfydd pan y mae ef yn galw ar fy nghyfer Felly gadewch iddynt ymateb i mi [gan ufudddod] ac yn credu ynof y gall eu harwain [iawn].

trans-unit.source: It has been made permissible for you the night preceding fasting to go to your wives [for sexual relations]. They are clothing for you and you are clothing for them. Allah knows that you used to deceive yourselves, so He accepted your repentance and forgave you. So now, have relations with them and seek that which Allah has decreed for you. And eat and drink until the white thread of dawn becomes distinct to you from the black thread [of night]. Then complete the fast until the sunset. And do not have relations with them as long as you are staying for worship in the mosques. These are the limits [set by] Allah, so do not approach them. Thus does Allah make clear His ordinances to the people that they may become righteous.
trans-unit.target: Wedi ei wneud caniateir i chi y nos flaenorol ymprydio i fynd i eich gwragedd [am berthynas rywiol]. Maent yn dillad i chi a ydych yn dillad ar eu cyfer. Gwyr Allah a ddefnyddiwyd gennych chi twyllo eich hunain, felly mae'n derbyn eich edifeirwch a forgave chi. Felly, yn awr, mae cysylltiadau â nhw a cheisio sydd wedi Allah a ddyfarnwyd i chi. A bwyta ac yfed nes llinyn Gwyn dawn yn dod yn wahanol i chi ddu llinyn [nos]. Yna cwblhau fast tan machlud. Ac nad oes cysylltiadau â hwy cyhyd ag yr ydych yn aros ar gyfer addoli yn y mosg. Mae'r rhain yn y terfynau [set gan] Allah, felly peidiwch â chysylltu â hwy. Felly yw'r Allah yn egluro ei erlyniadau i bobl y gallant yn hoes dabloid.

trans-unit.source: And do not consume one another's wealth unjustly or send it [in bribery] to the rulers in order that [they might aid] you [to] consume a portion of the wealth of the people in sin, while you know [it is unlawful].
trans-unit.target: Ac nid yfed cyfoeth un arall yn gam nac anfon [yn llwgrwobrwyo] at y prennau mesur yn y Gorchymyn [gallai eu cymorth] i yfed dogn o'r cyfoeth o bobl mewn pechod, er y gwyddoch chi [Mae'n anghyfreithlon].

trans-unit.source: They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the new moons. Say, "They are measurements of time for the people and for Hajj." And it is not righteousness to enter houses from the back, but righteousness is [in] one who fears Allah. And enter houses from their doors. And fear Allah that you may succeed.
trans-unit.target: Maent yn gofyn ichi, [O Muhammad], am y lleuadau newydd. Dweud, "Maent yn mesuriadau amser ar gyfer y bobl a Hajj." Ac nid yw'n chyfiawnder i i fynd dai o gefn i, ond mae chyfiawnder i [yn] un sy'n ofni Allah. A rhowch tai oddi wrth eu drysau. Ac ofn Allah efallai byddwch yn llwyddo.

trans-unit.source: Fight in the way of Allah those who fight you but do not transgress. Indeed. Allah does not like transgressors.
trans-unit.target: Ymladd rhwystro Allah rhai sy'n ymladd chi ond nad ydych yn camddefnyddio'u. Yn wir. Nid Allah yn hoffi transgressors.

trans-unit.source: And kill them wherever you overtake them and expel them from wherever they have expelled you, and fitnah is worse than killing. And do not fight them at al-Masjid al- Haram until they fight you there. But if they fight you, then kill them. Such is the recompense of the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: A lladd eu lle bynnag ydych oddiweddyd iddynt ac ddiarddel iddynt o ble bynnag y wedi diarddel chi, a fitnah yn waeth na ladd. A wneud nid ymladd iddynt yn al-Masjid al-Haram hyd nes y byddant yn ei hymladd chi yno. Ond os Mae brwydro chi, yna ladd iddynt. O'r fath yn ad-dalu y disbelievers.

trans-unit.source: And if they cease, then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ac os ydynt yn peidio, yn wir, yna Allah yn Forgiving a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: Fight them until there is no [more] fitnah and [until] worship is [acknowledged to be] for Allah. But if they cease, then there is to be no aggression except against the oppressors.
trans-unit.target: Iddynt yn ymladd hyd nes y ceir nad oes fitnah [mwy] a [tan [Cydnabyddir yn] addoli] ar gyfer Allah. Ond os ydynt yn peidio, yna ceir fod unrhyw ymddygiad ymosodol ac eithrio erbyn y gormeswyr.

trans-unit.source: [Fighting in] the sacred month is for [aggression committed in] the sacred month, and for [all] violations is legal retribution. So whoever has assaulted you, then assault him in the same way that he has assaulted you. And fear Allah and know that Allah is with those who fear Him.
trans-unit.target: [Ymladd yn] y mis sanctaidd yw [wedi ymrwymo yn ymosodol] y mis sanctaidd, a'r ymyriadau [bob] yn dial cyfreithiol. Felly pwy bynnag wedi ymosod chi, yna ymosodiad ef yn yr un modd wedi iddo ymosod chi. Ac ofn Allah ac yn gwybod bod Allah gyda'r rhai sy'n ofni iddo.

trans-unit.source: And spend in the way of Allah and do not throw [yourselves] with your [own] hands into destruction [by refraining]. And do good; indeed, Allah loves the doers of good.
trans-unit.target: A gwario rhwystro Allah ac nad ydynt yn taflu [eich hunain] â'ch [ei hun] dwylo yn dinistrio [gan Nghynulliad]. A da ei wneud; yn wir, mae Allah wrth ei bodd phoenwn da.

trans-unit.source: And complete the Hajj and 'umrah for Allah. But if you are prevented, then [offer] what can be obtained with ease of sacrificial animals. And do not shave your heads until the sacrificial animal has reached its place of slaughter. And whoever among you is ill or has an ailment of the head [making shaving necessary must offer] a ransom of fasting [three days] or charity or sacrifice. And when you are secure, then whoever performs 'umrah [during the Hajj months] followed by Hajj [offers] what can be obtained with ease of sacrificial animals. And whoever cannot find [or afford such an animal] - then a fast of three days during Hajj and of seven when you have returned [home]. Those are ten complete [days]. This is for those whose family is not in the area of al-Masjid al-Haram. And fear Allah and know that Allah is severe in penalty.
trans-unit.target: A chwblhau yr Hajj a ' umrah i Allah. Ond os ydych yn rhwystro, yna [cynnig] Beth gellir cael yn rhwydd anifeiliaid aberthol. Ac nid oes eillio eich pennau nes anifail aberthol wedi cyrraedd ei lle lladd. A pwy bynnag ymhlith ydych yn sâl neu anhwylderau y pennaeth [gwneud eillio angenrheidiol rhaid cynnig] pridwerth o ymprydio [tri diwrnod] neu elusen neu aberth. A pan fyddwch yn ddiogel, yna pwy bynnag sy'n perfformio ' umrah [yn ystod y mis Hajj] yn dilyn Hajj [cynnig] Beth gellir cael yn rhwydd anifeiliaid aberthol. A phwy bynnag ni allwn ddod o hyd i [neu fforddio anifeiliaid o'r fath]-yna cyflym o dri diwrnod yn ystod yr Hajj a saith pan ydych wedi dychwelyd [cartref]. Rhai yn gyflawn ddeng [diwrnod]. Mae hyn ar gyfer y rhai nad yw eu teulu yn yr ardal o al-Masjid al-Haram. Ac ofn Allah ac yn gwybod bod Allah yn difrifol yn gosb.

trans-unit.source: Hajj is [during] well-known months, so whoever has made Hajj obligatory upon himself therein [by entering the state of ihram], there is [to be for him] no sexual relations and no disobedience and no disputing during Hajj. And whatever good you do - Allah knows it. And take provisions, but indeed, the best provision is fear of Allah. And fear Me, O you of understanding.
trans-unit.target: Hajj yn [mis] adnabyddus, felly pwy bynnag wedi gwneud Hajj yn orfodol ar ei hun ynddo [gan sy'n mynd i gyflwr ihram], mae [i fod iddo ef] unrhyw berthynas rywiol a oes anufudd-dod a ellir amau nad oes ystod Hajj. A beth bynnag da ydych-Allah yn gwybod hynny. A chymryd darpariaethau, ond yn wir, y ddarpariaeth orau yw ofn Allah. Ac ofn imi, O eich dealltwriaeth.

trans-unit.source: There is no blame upon you for seeking bounty from your Lord [during Hajj]. But when you depart from 'Arafat, remember Allah at al- Mash'ar al-Haram. And remember Him, as He has guided you, for indeed, you were before that among those astray.
trans-unit.target: Nid oes unrhyw fai arnoch chi ar gyfer ceisio bounty o eich Arglwydd [ystod Hajj]. Ond pan mae chi wyro oddi wrth ' Arafat, cofio Allah yn al-Mash'ar al-Haram. Ac yn ei gofio, fel y mae wedi'i dywys chi, yn wir, chi oedd cyn hynny ymysg y rhai ar gyfeiliorn.

trans-unit.source: Then depart from the place from where [all] the people depart and ask forgiveness of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Yna wyro oddi wrth y man lle mae [] bawb yn wyro a ofyn maddeuant Allah. Yn wir, Allah yn Forgiving a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: And when you have completed your rites, remember Allah like your [previous] remembrance of your fathers or with [much] greater remembrance. And among the people is he who says, "Our Lord, give us in this world," and he will have in the Hereafter no share.
trans-unit.target: A pan ydych wedi cwblhau eich defodau, yn cofio Allah fel eich cofio [blaenorol] eich tadau neu gyda cofio [] mwy. Ac ymhlith y bobl y mae'n sydd yn dweud, "Ein Arglwydd, yn rhoi inni yn y byd hwn", a bydd ganddo yn y o hyn ymlaen unrhyw gyfran.

trans-unit.source: But among them is he who says, "Our Lord, give us in this world [that which is] good and in the Hereafter [that which is] good and protect us from the punishment of the Fire."
trans-unit.target: Ond yn eu plith mae ef sydd yn dweud, "ein Arglwydd, roi inni yn y byd hwn [y mae] da ac yn y o hyn ymlaen [y mae] da ac i'n hamddiffyn rhag y gosb y tân."

trans-unit.source: Those will have a share of what they have earned, and Allah is swift in account.
trans-unit.target: Bydd rhai yn cael cyfran o'r hyn y maent wedi ei ennill, ac Allah yn gyflym yn cyfrif.

trans-unit.source: And remember Allah during [specific] numbered days. Then whoever hastens [his departure] in two days - there is no sin upon him; and whoever delays [until the third] - there is no sin upon him - for him who fears Allah. And fear Allah and know that unto Him you will be gathered.
trans-unit.target: A chofiwch Allah yn ystod diwrnod wedi'u rhifo [penodol]. Yna pwy bynnag cyflymu [ei ymadawiad] mewn dau ddiwrnod-nid oes dim pechod arno; a pwy bynnag oedi [tan y trydydd]-Nid oes dim pechod arno-iddo sy'n ofni Allah. A ofni Allah a gwybod y-unto iddo bydd eich casglu.

trans-unit.source: And of the people is he whose speech pleases you in worldly life, and he calls Allah to witness as to what is in his heart, yet he is the fiercest of opponents.
trans-unit.target: A pobl ef mae ei araith yn plesio chi mewn bywyd worldly, a geilw Allah i dyst ynghylch yr hyn sydd yn ei galon, ac eto mae'n fiercest gwrthwynebwyr.

trans-unit.source: And when he goes away, he strives throughout the land to cause corruption therein and destroy crops and animals. And Allah does not like corruption.
trans-unit.target: Ac ef pan aiff i ffwrdd, mae'r ymdrechu drwy gydol y tir i achosi llygredd ynddo a dinistrio cnydau ac anifeiliaid. Ac nad yw Allah yn hoffi Llygredigaeth.

trans-unit.source: And when it is said to him, "Fear Allah," pride in the sin takes hold of him. Sufficient for him is Hellfire, and how wretched is the resting place.
trans-unit.target: Ac pan ddywedir iddo, "Ofn Allah," Mae balchder yn y pechod yn cymryd gafael arno. Ddigonol iddo yn Hellfire, ac sut truenus yn y man gorffwys.

trans-unit.source: And of the people is he who sells himself, seeking means to the approval of Allah. And Allah is kind to [His] servants.
trans-unit.target: Ac mae pobl yn ef sy'n gwerthu ei hun, sy'n chwilio am ffordd i gymeradwyaeth Allah. Ac Allah yn garedig i [ei] weision.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, enter into Islam completely [and perfectly] and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.
trans-unit.target: O rydych sydd wedi credu, ymrwymo i Islam gwbl [a berffaith] ac nid yn dilyn ôl traed Satan. Yn wir, ef yw eich gelyn clir.

trans-unit.source: But if you deviate after clear proofs have come to you, then know that Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Ond os mae ddylech wyro ar ôl proflenni clir yn dod i chi, yna yn gwybod nad yw Allah i'w mawrygu yn allai a Wise.

trans-unit.source: Do they await but that Allah should come to them in covers of clouds and the angels [as well] and the matter is [then] decided? And to Allah [all] matters are returned.
trans-unit.target: Wneud iddynt aros am ond dylai bod Allah yn dod iddynt yn cwmpasu cymylau a angylion [hefyd] a [yna] penderfynir ar y mater? Ac mae materion [bob] yn dychwelyd i Allah.

trans-unit.source: Ask the Children of Israel how many a sign of evidence We have given them. And whoever exchanges the favor of Allah [for disbelief] after it has come to him - then indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
trans-unit.target: Plant Israel yn gofyn faint o arwydd o dystiolaeth rydym wedi rhoi iddynt. A pwy bynnag sydd yn cyfnewid favor Allah [ar gyfer anghrediniaeth] ar ei ôl wedi dod iddo-yna yn wir, Allah yn ddifrifol yn gosb.

trans-unit.source: Beautified for those who disbelieve is the life of this world, and they ridicule those who believe. But those who fear Allah are above them on the Day of Resurrection. And Allah gives provision to whom He wills without account.
trans-unit.target: Beautified ar gyfer y rhai a chredu yw bywyd y byd hwn, ac mae eu gwawdio rhai sy'n credu. Ond y rhai sy'n ofni Allah yn uwch eu ar dydd atgyfodi. A bydd Allah yn rhoi darpariaeth i bwy mae ef wills heb gyfrif.

trans-unit.source: Mankind was [of] one religion [before their deviation]; then Allah sent the prophets as bringers of good tidings and warners and sent down with them the Scripture in truth to judge between the people concerning that in which they differed. And none differed over the Scripture except those who were given it - after the clear proofs came to them - out of jealous animosity among themselves. And Allah guided those who believed to the truth concerning that over which they had differed, by His permission. And Allah guides whom He wills to a straight path.
trans-unit.target: Oedd dynolryw [o] un grefydd [cyn eu gwyriad]; yna mae'r Allah yn anfon y proffwydi fel bringers tidings da a warners ac anfon i lawr gyda hwy yr ysgrythurau mewn gwirionedd i farnu rhwng pobl ynghylch y lle yr oeddent yn wahanol. A oedd dim yn wahanol dros y ysgrythur ac eithrio'r rhai sy'n cael ei-ar ôl Daeth y proflenni clir iddynt-allan o eiddigeddus drwgdeimlad ymysg eu hunain. Ac roedd Allah arwain y rhai a gredai y gwirionedd ynghylch hynny sydd wedi eu bod yn wahanol, gan ei ganiatâd. A Allah hysbysiadau y mae ef yn wills i lwybr syth.

trans-unit.source: Or do you think that you will enter Paradise while such [trial] has not yet come to you as came to those who passed on before you? They were touched by poverty and hardship and were shaken until [even their] messenger and those who believed with him said, "When is the help of Allah?" Unquestionably, the help of Allah is near.
trans-unit.target: Neu a ydych yn credu y byddwch yn cychwyn baradwys er nad yw eto wedi fath treial i chi fel y daeth i'r rhai sy'n trosglwyddo cyn i chi? Oeddent yn cyffwrdd gan dlodi a chaledi ac roedd hysgwyd tan [hyd yn oed eu] Dywedodd messenger a rhai a gredai gydag ef, "Pryd y mae help Allah?" Yn ddiamau, y mae'r cymorth Allah yn agos.

trans-unit.source: They ask you, [O Muhammad], what they should spend. Say, "Whatever you spend of good is [to be] for parents and relatives and orphans and the needy and the traveler. And whatever you do of good - indeed, Allah is Knowing of it."
trans-unit.target: Maent yn gofyn ichi, [O Muhammad], beth y dylai ei wario. Dweud, "beth bynnag yr ydych yn ei wario da yw [] i rieni a pherthnasau a amddifad ac anghenus a o'r fath. A beth bynnag a wnewch o dda-yn wir, yw Allah yn gwybod amdano.

trans-unit.source: Fighting has been enjoined upon you while it is hateful to you. But perhaps you hate a thing and it is good for you; and perhaps you love a thing and it is bad for you. And Allah Knows, while you know not.
trans-unit.target: Ymladd wedi bod yn enjoined arnoch er ei bod yn gas i chi. Ond efallai mae eich casáu peth ac mae'n dda i chi; ac efallai wrth eich bodd yn beth a mae'n ddrwg i chi. A gwyr Allah, tra eich bod yn gwybod nad.

trans-unit.source: They ask you about the sacred month - about fighting therein. Say, "Fighting therein is great [sin], but averting [people] from the way of Allah and disbelief in Him and [preventing access to] al-Masjid al-Haram and the expulsion of its people therefrom are greater [evil] in the sight of Allah. And fitnah is greater than killing." And they will continue to fight you until they turn you back from your religion if they are able. And whoever of you reverts from his religion [to disbelief] and dies while he is a disbeliever - for those, their deeds have become worthless in this world and the Hereafter, and those are the companions of the Fire, they will abide therein eternally.
trans-unit.target: Maent yn gofyn ichi am y mis sanctaidd-am ymladd ynddo. Dweud, "ymladd ynddo yn wych [pechod], ond osgoi [pobl] o'r ffordd o Allah ac anghrediniaeth ef a [atal mynediad at] al-Masjid al-Haram a diarddel o'i phobl thelir yn fwy [drygioni] yng ngolwg Allah. A fitnah yn fwy na ladd. A byddant yn parhau i ymladd chi hyd nes y maent yn troi eich ôl gan eich crefydd os ydynt yn gallu. A pwy bynnag ohonoch yn dychwelyd o ei crefydd [i anghrediniaeth] ac yn marw tra fod yn disbeliever-ar gyfer y rhai, wedi eu gweithredoedd yn dod yn ddiwerth yn y byd hwn a y o hyn ymlaen, a rhai yn y cymdeithion y tân, bydd yn cadw at yr erthyglau fythol.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who have believed and those who have emigrated and fought in the cause of Allah - those expect the mercy of Allah. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, rhai sydd wedi credu a'r rhai sydd wedi ymfudo ac ymladd yn achos Allah-Mae rhai yn disgwyl drugaredd Allah. Ac Allah yn Forgiving a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: They ask you about wine and gambling. Say, "In them is great sin and [yet, some] benefit for people. But their sin is greater than their benefit." And they ask you what they should spend. Say, "The excess [beyond needs]." Thus Allah makes clear to you the verses [of revelation] that you might give thought.
trans-unit.target: Maent yn gofyn ichi am gwin a gamblo. Dweud, "ynddynt yw pechod mawr a [eto, rhai] o fudd i bobl. Ond eu pechod yn fwy na eu budd-dal." Ac maent yn gofyn i chi beth y dylai ei wario. Dweud, "Gormodedd [y tu hwnt i anghenion]." Felly mae Allah yn gwneud yn glir i chi y penillion [o ddatguddiad] y gallech roi meddwl.

trans-unit.source: To this world and the Hereafter. And they ask you about orphans. Say, "Improvement for them is best. And if you mix your affairs with theirs - they are your brothers. And Allah knows the corrupter from the amender. And if Allah had willed, He could have put you in difficulty. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Y byd hwn a y o hyn ymlaen. Ac maent yn gofyn ichi am blant amddifad. Dweud, "Mae gwella ar eu cyfer sydd orau. Ac os gymysgu eich materion gyda hwy-eich brodyr ydynt. A gwyr Allah yn y corrupter gan y amender. Ac os oedd Allah ewyllysio iddi, gallai fod wedi eich rhoi mewn anhawster. Yn wir, yw Allah i'w mawrygu yn allai a Wise.

trans-unit.source: And do not marry polytheistic women until they believe. And a believing slave woman is better than a polytheist, even though she might please you. And do not marry polytheistic men [to your women] until they believe. And a believing slave is better than a polytheist, even though he might please you. Those invite [you] to the Fire, but Allah invites to Paradise and to forgiveness, by His permission. And He makes clear His verses to the people that perhaps they may remember.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oes briodi merched polytheistic hyd nes y maent yn credu. A menyw gaethion believing yn well na polytheist, er y gallai hi eich plesio chi. Ac nid oes briodi dynion polytheistic [i fenywod eich] hyd nes y maent yn credu. A gaethion believing yn well na polytheist, er efallai ei fod yn plesio chi. Mae rhai [ydych] wahodd y tân, ond bydd Allah yn gwahodd i baradwys a maddeuant, drwy ei ganiatâd. Ac yn ei gwneud yn glir ei penillion i'r bobl hynny efallai y gall eu cofio.

trans-unit.source: And they ask you about menstruation. Say, "It is harm, so keep away from wives during menstruation. And do not approach them until they are pure. And when they have purified themselves, then come to them from where Allah has ordained for you. Indeed, Allah loves those who are constantly repentant and loves those who purify themselves."
trans-unit.target: Ac maent yn gofyn ichi am y mislif. Dweud, "Mae'n niweidio, felly cadwch oddi wrth gwragedd ystod mislif. Ac nid agwedd iddynt nes eu bod yn pur. A pan maent wedi puro eu hunain, yna daw'r iddynt lle y mae Allah hordeinio i chi. Yn wir, mae'r Allah wrth ei bodd yn rhai sy'n edifeiriol gyson ac wrth ei bodd yn rhai sy'n puro'r eu hunain.

trans-unit.source: Your wives are a place of sowing of seed for you, so come to your place of cultivation however you wish and put forth [righteousness] for yourselves. And fear Allah and know that you will meet Him. And give good tidings to the believers.
trans-unit.target: Eich gwragedd yn lle o hau hadau i chi, felly dewch i'ch lle tyfu Fodd bynnag y dymunwch ac rhoi blaen [chyfiawnder i] drosoch eich hunain. Ac ofn Allah ac yn gwybod y byddwch yn ymateb iddo. A rhoi tidings da y credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: And do not make [your oath by] Allah an excuse against being righteous and fearing Allah and making peace among people. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid yn gwneud [eich llw gan] Allah yn esgus erbyn cael eu hoes dabloid ac yn ofni Allah a gwneud heddwch ymhlith pobl. A Allah yn clywed ac yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: Allah does not impose blame upon you for what is unintentional in your oaths, but He imposes blame upon you for what your hearts have earned. And Allah is Forgiving and Forbearing.
trans-unit.target: Nid yw Allah yn gosod bai arnoch chi am beth yw anfwriadol yn eich llwon, ond mae ef yn gosod bai arnoch chi am beth y mae eich calonnau wedi ennill. Ac Allah yn Forgiving a Forbearing.

trans-unit.source: For those who swear not to have sexual relations with their wives is a waiting time of four months, but if they return [to normal relations] - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ar gyfer y rhai sy'n rhegi na i gael cysylltiadau rhywiol gyda eu gwragedd yn amser aros o bedwar mis, ond os fyddant yn dychwelyd [cysylltiadau arferol]-yn wir, yna Allah yn Forgiving a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: And if they decide on divorce - then indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Ac os byddant yn penderfynu ar ysgariad-yn wir, yna Allah yn clywed ac yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: Divorced women remain in waiting for three periods, and it is not lawful for them to conceal what Allah has created in their wombs if they believe in Allah and the Last Day. And their husbands have more right to take them back in this [period] if they want reconciliation. And due to the wives is similar to what is expected of them, according to what is reasonable. But the men have a degree over them [in responsibility and authority]. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Mae menywod wedi ysgaru yn aros yn aros am gyfnodau tri, ac nid yw'n gyfreithlon iddyn nhw guddio beth Allah wedi creu yn eu wombs os ydynt yn credu yn Allah ac yn y dydd diwethaf. Ac mae eu gwŷr mwy o hawl i fynd â hwy yn ôl yn hwn [cyfnod] os ydynt am cysoni. Ac oherwydd y gwragedd yn debyg i'r hyn a ddisgwylir ohonynt, yn ôl yr hyn sy'n rhesymol. Ond mae y dynion gradd drostynt [yn cyfrifoldeb a'r awdurdod]. A yw i'w Allah mawrygu yn allai a Wise.

trans-unit.source: Divorce is twice. Then, either keep [her] in an acceptable manner or release [her] with good treatment. And it is not lawful for you to take anything of what you have given them unless both fear that they will not be able to keep [within] the limits of Allah. But if you fear that they will not keep [within] the limits of Allah, then there is no blame upon either of them concerning that by which she ransoms herself. These are the limits of Allah, so do not transgress them. And whoever transgresses the limits of Allah - it is those who are the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Ysgariad yn ddwywaith. Yna, naill ai gadw [iddi] mewn modd derbyniol neu ei rhyddhau [hi] gyda thriniaeth da. Ac nid yw'n gyfreithlon i chi gymryd unrhyw beth o'r hyn rydych wedi rhoi iddynt oni bai Mae'r ddau yn ofni na fydd eu bod yn gallu cadw [yn] y terfynau Allah. Ond os ydych yn poeni y byddant yn eu cadw ni [yn] y terfynau Allah, yna nid oes unrhyw fai ar y naill neu'r llall ohonynt yn ymwneud â hynny y mae hi yn ransoms ei hun. Mae'r rhain yn y terfynau Allah, felly nid ydych yn camddefnyddio'u iddynt. A pwy bynnag pechu y terfynau Allah-mae'n rheini y tramgwyddo.

trans-unit.source: And if he has divorced her [for the third time], then she is not lawful to him afterward until [after] she marries a husband other than him. And if the latter husband divorces her [or dies], there is no blame upon the woman and her former husband for returning to each other if they think that they can keep [within] the limits of Allah. These are the limits of Allah, which He makes clear to a people who know.
trans-unit.target: Ac os mae ef wedi ysgaru hi [am y trydydd tro], yna nid yw'n gyfreithlon iddo ar ôl hynny tan [ar ôl] Mae hi'n priodi gŵr heblaw iddo. Ac os y gŵr olaf yn ysgaru hi [neu'n marw], nid oes unrhyw fai ar y ferch a'i gŵr cyn dychwelyd i'w gilydd os ydynt yn credu y gallant gadw [yn] y terfynau Allah. Mae'r rhain yn therfynau Allah, sy'n ei gwneud yn glir i bobl sydd yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: And when you divorce women and they have [nearly] fulfilled their term, either retain them according to acceptable terms or release them according to acceptable terms, and do not keep them, intending harm, to transgress [against them]. And whoever does that has certainly wronged himself. And do not take the verses of Allah in jest. And remember the favor of Allah upon you and what has been revealed to you of the Book and wisdom by which He instructs you. And fear Allah and know that Allah is Knowing of all things.
trans-unit.target: A pan mae gwahanu'r menywod ac [bron] eu bod wedi cyflawni eu tymor, naill ai eu cadw yn ôl termau derbyniol neu eu rhyddhau yn ôl termau dderbyniol, ac nid yw cadw hwy, yn bwriadu niwed, i camddefnyddio'u [yn eu herbyn]. Ac yn sicr mae pwy bynnag sy'n gwneud y cam ei hun. Ac nid ydynt yn penillion Allah yn gellweirus. A chofiwch favor Allah ar chi ac mae'r hyn a ddatgelwyd i chi o'r llyfr a'r doethineb y mae ef yn cyfarwyddo'r chi. Ac ofn Allah ac yn gwybod bod Allah yn gwybod am yr holl bethau.

trans-unit.source: And when you divorce women and they have fulfilled their term, do not prevent them from remarrying their [former] husbands if they agree among themselves on an acceptable basis. That is instructed to whoever of you believes in Allah and the Last Day. That is better for you and purer, and Allah knows and you know not.
trans-unit.target: A pan mae gwahanu'r menywod ac maent wedi cyflawni eu tymor, ei wneud yn eu hatal rhag remarrying eu gwŷr [gynt] os byddant yn cytuno ymysg eu hunain ar sail dderbyniol. Hynny yw rhoi cyfarwyddyd i bwy bynnag y cred ydych yn Allah ac yn y dydd diwethaf. Mae hynny'n well i chi ac yn burach, a gwyr Allah ac nid ydych yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: Mothers may breastfeed their children two complete years for whoever wishes to complete the nursing [period]. Upon the father is the mothers' provision and their clothing according to what is acceptable. No person is charged with more than his capacity. No mother should be harmed through her child, and no father through his child. And upon the [father's] heir is [a duty] like that [of the father]. And if they both desire weaning through mutual consent from both of them and consultation, there is no blame upon either of them. And if you wish to have your children nursed by a substitute, there is no blame upon you as long as you give payment according to what is acceptable. And fear Allah and know that Allah is Seeing of what you do.
trans-unit.target: Gall mamau fwydo eu plant dwy gwblhau blynyddoedd i bwy bynnag sy'n dymuno cwblhau nyrsio [cyfnod]. Ar y tad yw darpariaeth y mamau ac eu dillad yn ôl beth sy'n dderbyniol. Mae neb yn gyfrifol am fwy na rhinwedd ei swydd. Dylai unrhyw fam ei niweidio drwy ei phlentyn, a oes dad drwy ei blentyn. Ac ar y [tad] etifedd yn [ddyletswydd] fel [y tad]. Ac os ydynt y ddau yn dymuno diddyfnu drwy gydsyniad gan ddau ohonynt a'r ymgynghoriad, nid oes unrhyw fai ar y naill neu'r llall ohonynt. Ac os ydych am gael eich plant a nyrsio gan eilydd, nid oes unrhyw fai arnoch chi cyhyd ag y byddwch yn rhoi taliad yn ôl beth sy'n dderbyniol. A ofni Allah a gwybod bod Allah yn gweld yr hyn yr ydych yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: And those who are taken in death among you and leave wives behind - they, [the wives, shall] wait four months and ten [days]. And when they have fulfilled their term, then there is no blame upon you for what they do with themselves in an acceptable manner. And Allah is [fully] Acquainted with what you do.
trans-unit.target: A'r rhai sy'n cael eu cymryd mewn marwolaeth ymysg eich ac adael gwragedd tu ôl-eu, [gwragedd, bydd] aros pedwar mis a deg [diwrnod]. A phan maent wedi cyflawni eu tymor, yna nid oes unrhyw fai arnoch am yr hyn a wnânt gyda eu hunain mewn modd derbyniol. A yw Allah [llawn] yn gyfarwydd â beth yr ydych yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: There is no blame upon you for that to which you [indirectly] allude concerning a proposal to women or for what you conceal within yourselves. Allah knows that you will have them in mind. But do not promise them secretly except for saying a proper saying. And do not determine to undertake a marriage contract until the decreed period reaches its end. And know that Allah knows what is within yourselves, so beware of Him. And know that Allah is Forgiving and Forbearing.
trans-unit.target: Nid oes unrhyw fai arnoch chi ar gyfer y y cyfeiriwch [anuniongyrchol] ynghylch cynnig i fenywod neu beth yr ydych yn ei guddio o fewn eich hunain. Mae Allah yn gwybod y bydd gennych iddynt mewn cof. Ond peidio â rhoi addewid iddynt gyfrinachol ac eithrio dweud ddweud priodol. Ac nid ydynt yn penderfynu ymgymryd â contract briodas nes bod y cyfnod decreed yn cyrraedd diwedd ei. A gwybod bod Allah yn gwybod beth yw o fewn eich hunain, felly byddwch yn ofalus iddo. A gwybod bod Allah yn Forgiving ac Forbearing.

trans-unit.source: There is no blame upon you if you divorce women you have not touched nor specified for them an obligation. But give them [a gift of] compensation - the wealthy according to his capability and the poor according to his capability - a provision according to what is acceptable, a duty upon the doers of good.
trans-unit.target: Nid oes unrhyw fai arnoch os mae gwahanu'r menywod nid ydych wedi crybwyll nac yn rhwymedigaeth a bennir ar eu cyfer. Ond rhoi [rhodd o] iawndal-gyfoethog yn ôl ei gallu a'r tlawd yn ôl ei gallu – darpariaeth yn ôl beth sy'n dderbyniol, dyletswydd ar dudalenau da.

trans-unit.source: And if you divorce them before you have touched them and you have already specified for them an obligation, then [give] half of what you specified - unless they forego the right or the one in whose hand is the marriage contract foregoes it. And to forego it is nearer to righteousness. And do not forget graciousness between you. Indeed Allah, of whatever you do, is Seeing.
trans-unit.target: Ac os mae ysgariad iddynt cyn yr ydych wedi cyffwrdd â hwy ac wedi sydd eisoes wedi'u pennu ar eu cyfer rwymedigaeth, yna [Rhowch hanner yr hyn a nodoch-oni bai Mae maent yn ymwrthod hawl neu mae yr un yn eu llaw yn y contract i briodi ei foregoes.] Ac i ymwrthod yn nes at chyfiawnder i. A Peidiwch ag anghofio haelioni rhyngoch. Allah yn wir, beth bynnag yr ydych yn ei wneud, yn cael ei gweld.

trans-unit.source: Maintain with care the [obligatory] prayers and [in particular] the middle prayer and stand before Allah, devoutly obedient.
trans-unit.target: Gynnal gyda gofal y gweddïau [orfodol] ac [yn arbennig] gweddi canol a sefyll gerbron Allah, daer obedient.

trans-unit.source: And if you fear [an enemy, then pray] on foot or riding. But when you are secure, then remember Allah [in prayer], as He has taught you that which you did not [previously] know.
trans-unit.target: Ac os ydych yn poeni [gelyn, yna gweddïo] ar droed neu farchogaeth. Ond pan yr ydych yn ddiogel, yna cofiwch Allah [mewn gweddi], fel y mae wedi eich dysgu a na wnaethoch chi [gynt] yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: And those who are taken in death among you and leave wives behind - for their wives is a bequest: maintenance for one year without turning [them] out. But if they leave [of their own accord], then there is no blame upon you for what they do with themselves in an acceptable way. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: A yw rhai sy'n cael eu cymryd mewn marwolaeth ymysg eich a gwragedd yn gadael ar ei hôl hi-ar gyfer eu gwragedd cymynrodd: cynnal a chadw ar gyfer un flwyddyn heb [eu] yn troi allan. Ond os byddant yn gadael [o o'u gwirfodd], yna nid oes unrhyw fai arnoch am yr hyn a wnânt gyda eu hunain mewn ffordd dderbyniol. A yw i'w Allah mawrygu yn allai a Wise.

trans-unit.source: And for divorced women is a provision according to what is acceptable - a duty upon the righteous.
trans-unit.target: Ac ar gyfer menywod sydd wedi ysgaru darpariaeth yn ôl beth sy'n dderbyniol-dyletswydd ar y righteous.

trans-unit.source: Thus does Allah make clear to you His verses that you might use reason.
trans-unit.target: Felly yw Allah gwneud yn glir i chi ei penillion y gallech ddefnyddio rheswm.

trans-unit.source: Have you not considered those who left their homes in many thousands, fearing death? Allah said to them, "Die"; then He restored them to life. And Allah is full of bounty to the people, but most of the people do not show gratitude.
trans-unit.target: Nid ydych wedi ystyried rhai a adawodd eu cartrefi mewn miloedd lawer, ofni marwolaeth? Dywedodd Allah iddynt, "Marw"; Yna roedd ei hadfer i'w bywyd. A Allah yn llawn bounty i bobl, ond nid rhan fwyaf o bobl yn dangos diolchgarwch.

trans-unit.source: And fight in the cause of Allah and know that Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Ac ymladd yn achos Allah a gwybod bod Allah yn clywed ac yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: Who is it that would loan Allah a goodly loan so He may multiply it for him many times over? And it is Allah who withholds and grants abundance, and to Him you will be returned.
trans-unit.target: Pwy yw y byddai'r benthyciad Allah benthyciad reit dda fel y gall ei luosi iddo droeon dros? Ac mae'n Allah sy'n atal a grantiau digonedd, ac iddo ef y bydd eich dychwelyd.

trans-unit.source: Have you not considered the assembly of the Children of Israel after [the time of] Moses when they said to a prophet of theirs, "Send to us a king, and we will fight in the way of Allah "? He said, "Would you perhaps refrain from fighting if fighting was prescribed for you?" They said, "And why should we not fight in the cause of Allah when we have been driven out from our homes and from our children?" But when fighting was prescribed for them, they turned away, except for a few of them. And Allah is Knowing of the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Nid ydych wedi ystyried y Cynulliad plant Israel ar ôl [amser] Moses pan y dywedodd i broffwyd hwy, "anfon atom Bydd Brenin, ac yr ydym yn ymladd rhwystro Allah"? Meddai, "Fyddai chi efallai ymatal rhag ymladd os ymladd oedd rhagnodedig i chi?" Dywedodd, "a Pam dylem ni ymladd yn achos Allah pan ydym wedi cael eu gyrru allan gan ein cartrefi a chan ein plant?" Ond pan oedd yn ymladd yn erbyn presgripsiwn ar eu cyfer, yn troi i ffwrdd, ac eithrio ychydig ohonynt. Ac Allah yn gwybod y tramgwyddo.

trans-unit.source: And their prophet said to them, "Indeed, Allah has sent to you Saul as a king." They said, "How can he have kingship over us while we are more worthy of kingship than him and he has not been given any measure of wealth?" He said, "Indeed, Allah has chosen him over you and has increased him abundantly in knowledge and stature. And Allah gives His sovereignty to whom He wills. And Allah is all-Encompassing [in favor] and Knowing."
trans-unit.target: A dywedodd eu Proffwyd iddyn nhw, "yn wir, mae'r Allah anfon atoch Saul fel Brenin." Maent yn dweud, "Sut y gall ef gael kingship dros ein tra ydym yn fwy teilwng o kingship nag ef ac ni fod wedi cael unrhyw fesur cyfoeth?" Meddai, "yn wir, mae Allah dewis iddo dros chi ac wedi cynyddu iddo gwbl mewn gwybodaeth a statws. A bydd Allah yn rhoi ei sofraniaeth y mae ef yn wills. A Allah hollgynhwysol [yn favor] ac mae gwybod.

trans-unit.source: And their prophet said to them, "Indeed, a sign of his kingship is that the chest will come to you in which is assurance from your Lord and a remnant of what the family of Moses and the family of Aaron had left, carried by the angels. Indeed in that is a sign for you, if you are believers."
trans-unit.target: A dywedodd eu Proffwyd iddynt, "yn wir, yn arwydd o ei kingship yw y bydd y frest yn dod i chi y mae sicrwydd gan eich Arglwydd a goroesi o'r hyn y teulu o Moses a'r teulu Aaron wedi gadael, gan angylion. Yn wir yn hynny yn arwydd i chi, os ydych yn gredinwyr."

trans-unit.source: And when Saul went forth with the soldiers, he said, "Indeed, Allah will be testing you with a river. So whoever drinks from it is not of me, and whoever does not taste it is indeed of me, excepting one who takes [from it] in the hollow of his hand." But they drank from it, except a [very] few of them. Then when he had crossed it along with those who believed with him, they said, "There is no power for us today against Goliath and his soldiers." But those who were certain that they would meet Allah said, "How many a small company has overcome a large company by permission of Allah. And Allah is with the patient."
trans-unit.target: A pan Saul yn mynd ymlaen gyda y milwyr, dywedodd, "yn wir, bydd Allah yn profi chi gyda'r afon. Felly, nid yw pwy bynnag diodydd o'r imi, ac nid yw pwy bynnag sydd yn ei flasu yn wir mi, heblaw un sy'n cymryd [o'r] yn y Pant ei law." Ond eu bod yn yfed ohono, ac eithrio [iawn] ychydig ohonynt. Yna pan ei fod wedi croesi ynghyd â rhai a gredai gydag ef, dywedodd, "Nid oes unrhyw bŵer i ni heddiw yn erbyn Goliath a ei filwyr." Ond y rhai a oedd yn sicr y byddent yn cyfarfod Allah wedi dweud, "faint o gwmni bach wedi goresgyn cwmni mawr drwy ganiatâd Allah. A yw Allah gyda'r claf.

trans-unit.source: And when they went forth to [face] Goliath and his soldiers, they said, "Our Lord, pour upon us patience and plant firmly our feet and give us victory over the disbelieving people."
trans-unit.target: A pan aethant ymlaen i [wynebu] Goliath a ei filwyr, dywedodd, "Mae ein Arglwydd, tywallt arnom amynedd a planhigion gadarn ein traed ac yn rhoi inni fuddugoliaeth dros y bobl disbelieving."

trans-unit.source: So they defeated them by permission of Allah, and David killed Goliath, and Allah gave him the kingship and prophethood and taught him from that which He willed. And if it were not for Allah checking [some] people by means of others, the earth would have been corrupted, but Allah is full of bounty to the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Felly roedd eu trechu eu caniatâd Allah, a dywedodd David yn lladd Goliath, a Allah iddo'n kingship a prophethood a addysgir ef o'r hyn a oedd yn ewyllysio iddi. Ac os nad oedd ar gyfer gwirio golygu [rai] bobl gan eraill, byddai y ddaear wedi'i llygru Allah, ond Allah yn llawn bounty i'r byd.

trans-unit.source: These are the verses of Allah which We recite to you, [O Muhammad], in truth. And indeed, you are from among the messengers.
trans-unit.target: Mae'r rhain yn y penillion Allah a ydym yn adrodd i chi, [O Muhammad], mewn gwirionedd. A ydych yn wir, o blith y negeswyr.

trans-unit.source: Those messengers - some of them We caused to exceed others. Among them were those to whom Allah spoke, and He raised some of them in degree. And We gave Jesus, the Son of Mary, clear proofs, and We supported him with the Pure Spirit. If Allah had willed, those [generations] succeeding them would not have fought each other after the clear proofs had come to them. But they differed, and some of them believed and some of them disbelieved. And if Allah had willed, they would not have fought each other, but Allah does what He intends.
trans-unit.target: Hynny negeswyr-rhai ohonynt yn achosi inni i ragori ar eraill. Yn eu plith oedd y rhai y siaradodd Allah, ac AU Cododd rhai ohonynt mewn gradd. Rhoesom proflenni glir Iesu, mab Mary, ac rydym wedi cefnogi ef ag ysbryd pur. Os oedd Allah ewyllysio iddi, hynny cenedlaethau llwyddo iddynt byddai nid wedi ymladd gilydd wedi y proflenni glir ddod iddynt. Ond yr oeddent yn wahanol, ac mae rhai ohonynt yn credu a rhai ohonynt a ddysgais. Ac os oedd Allah ewyllysio iddi, ni fuasent wedi ymladd gilydd, ond mae'r Allah yw beth y mae'n bwriadu.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, spend from that which We have provided for you before there comes a Day in which there is no exchange and no friendship and no intercession. And the disbelievers - they are the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, gwariant a rydym wedi darparu i chi cyn y ceir unrhyw gyfnewid a oes cyfeillgarwch a oes intercession y dydd. Ac y disbelievers-eu yn y tramgwyddo.

trans-unit.source: Allah - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of [all] existence. Neither drowsiness overtakes Him nor sleep. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, and they encompass not a thing of His knowledge except for what He wills. His Kursi extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation tires Him not. And He is the Most High, the Most Great.
trans-unit.target: Allah-nid oes unrhyw Dduwdod ac eithrio ef, y byw erioed, y Sustainer o fodolaeth [bob]. Mae syrthni na'r llall yn goddiweddyd ef nac yn cysgu. Iddo ef y perthyn beth bynnag yn y nefoedd a beth bynnag sydd ar y ddaear. Pwy yw y gall eiriol gydag ef ac eithrio drwy ei ganiatâd? Ei fod yn gwybod beth yw [ar hyn o bryd] cyn iddynt a beth fydd ar ôl iddynt, a ydynt yn cynnwys nid peth ei wybodaeth heblaw am beth a wills ef. Mae ei Kursi yn ymestyn dros y nefoedd a'r ddaear, ac mae eu cadw yn tires ef ni. Ac ef yw y mwyaf uchel, y mwyaf mawr.

trans-unit.source: There shall be no compulsion in [acceptance of] the religion. The right course has become clear from the wrong. So whoever disbelieves in Taghut and believes in Allah has grasped the most trustworthy handhold with no break in it. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Ni fydd unrhyw orfodaeth yn [derbyn] crefydd. Y cwrs cywir wedi dod i'r amlwg o anghywir. Felly pwy bynnag sydd yn disbelieves yn Taghut ac yn credu mewn Allah wedi amgyffred y gafael llaw mwyaf dibynadwy gyda dim toriad ynddo. A Allah yn clywed ac yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: Allah is the ally of those who believe. He brings them out from darknesses into the light. And those who disbelieve - their allies are Taghut. They take them out of the light into darknesses. Those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide eternally therein.
trans-unit.target: Allah yn gynghreiriad y rhai sydd yn credu. Mae ef yn dod â nhw o darknesses i oleuni. A rhai a chredu-a'u cynghreiriaid yn Taghut. Eu bod yn mynd allan y goleuni i darknesses. Mae'r rheini'n cymdeithion y tân; Bydd maent yn glynu fythol ynddo.

trans-unit.source: Have you not considered the one who argued with Abraham about his Lord [merely] because Allah had given him kingship? When Abraham said, "My Lord is the one who gives life and causes death," he said, "I give life and cause death." Abraham said, "Indeed, Allah brings up the sun from the east, so bring it up from the west." So the disbeliever was overwhelmed [by astonishment], and Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
trans-unit.target: Nid ydych wedi ystyried yr un a ddadleuodd gyda'r Abraham am ei Arglwydd [ond] oherwydd roedd Allah wedi rhoi iddo kingship? Pan ddywedodd Abraham, "Fy Arglwydd yw un sy'n rhoi bywyd ac achosi marwolaeth," meddai, "rhoddaf bywyd a achosi marwolaeth." Dywedodd Abraham, 'yn wir, daw Allah haul o'r dwyrain, felly fagu ei o'r gorllewin." Felly yr oedd y disbeliever yn drech na [syndod], ac nid yw Allah yn arwain pobl gamwedd.

trans-unit.source: Or [consider such an example] as the one who passed by a township which had fallen into ruin. He said, "How will Allah bring this to life after its death?" So Allah caused him to die for a hundred years; then He revived him. He said, "How long have you remained?" The man said, "I have remained a day or part of a day." He said, "Rather, you have remained one hundred years. Look at your food and your drink; it has not changed with time. And look at your donkey; and We will make you a sign for the people. And look at the bones [of this donkey] - how We raise them and then We cover them with flesh." And when it became clear to him, he said, "I know that Allah is over all things competent."
trans-unit.target: Neu [ystyried enghraifft o'r fath] fel yr un a basiwyd gan trefgordd sydd wedi gostwng yn adfail. Meddai, "Sut bydd Allah yn dod â hyn i fywyd ar ôl ei farwolaeth?" Felly roedd Allah yn achosi iddo farw dros gant o flynyddoedd; Roedd ei hatgyfodi wedyn iddo. Meddai, "pa mor hir yr ydych wedi aros?" Dywedodd y dyn, "Wedi gorfod aros diwrnod neu rhan o ddiwrnod." Meddai, "yn hytrach, byddwch wedi aros blynyddoedd gant. Edrych ar eich bwyd a diod eich; yw wedi newid gydag amser. Ac edrych ar eich asyn; a byddwn yn gwneud arwydd ichi ar gyfer y bobl. Ac edrych ar esgyrn [asyn hwn]-sut yr ydym yn eu codi ac yna rydym yn ymdrin â hwy gyda cnawd." A pan ddaeth yn glir iddo, meddai, "Rwy'n gwybod bod Allah yn dros holl bethau cymwys."

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when Abraham said, "My Lord, show me how You give life to the dead." [Allah] said, "Have you not believed?" He said, "Yes, but [I ask] only that my heart may be satisfied." [Allah] said, "Take four birds and commit them to yourself. Then [after slaughtering them] put on each hill a portion of them; then call them - they will come [flying] to you in haste. And know that Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise."
trans-unit.target: [Yn sôn am] pan ddywedodd Abraham, "fy Arglwydd, dangos i mi sut ydych yn rhoi bywyd i y meirw." [Allah] yn dweud, "Yr ydych nid credu?" Dywedodd, "ie, ond [Gofynnaf] dim ond y gall fod yn fodlon fy nghalon." [Allah] dywedodd, "gymryd adar pedwar ac ymrwymo iddynt i chi'ch hun. Yna [ar ôl eu lladd nhw] yn rhoi ar bob hill cyfran ohonynt; yna eu galw-byddant yn dod [Dechrau'n Deg] i chi ar frys. A gwybod bod yw Allah i'w mawrygu yn allai a Wise.

trans-unit.source: The example of those who spend their wealth in the way of Allah is like a seed [of grain] which grows seven spikes; in each spike is a hundred grains. And Allah multiplies [His reward] for whom He wills. And Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Mae enghraifft o'r rhai sy'n treulio eu cyfoeth rhwystro Allah fel hadau [o rawn] sy'n tyfu spikes saith; pob pigyn yn gant o grawn. Ac mae'r Allah ac.uk [ei wobrwyo] am bwy mae ef wills. Ac Allah yn hollgynhwysol a gwybod.

trans-unit.source: Those who spend their wealth in the way of Allah and then do not follow up what they have spent with reminders [of it] or [other] injury will have their reward with their Lord, and there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
trans-unit.target: Bydd rhai sy'n treulio eu cyfoeth rhwystro Allah ac yna nid dilyn fyny beth maent wedi treulio gyda nodiadau atgoffa [o] neu anaf [arall] yn cael eu gwobrwyo gyda eu yr Arglwydd, ac ni fydd unrhyw ofn ynghylch eu, nac bydd maent yn galaru.

trans-unit.source: Kind speech and forgiveness are better than charity followed by injury. And Allah is Free of need and Forbearing.
trans-unit.target: Araith caredig a maddeuant yn well nag elusen ddilyn gan anaf. Ac Allah yn rhad ac am ddim o angen a Forbearing.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not invalidate your charities with reminders or injury as does one who spends his wealth [only] to be seen by the people and does not believe in Allah and the Last Day. His example is like that of a [large] smooth stone upon which is dust and is hit by a downpour that leaves it bare. They are unable [to keep] anything of what they have earned. And Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, wneud na all eich elusennau gyda nodiadau atgoffa neu anaf fel yw'r un sy'n treulio ei gyfoeth [ond] i'w gweld gan y bobl ac nid yw'n credu yn Allah ac yn y dydd diwethaf. Ei esiampl yn fel yn llyfn [mawr] garreg ar sydd yn llwch ac yn taro gan cawodydd trymion sy'n gadael yn noeth. Ydynt yn gallu [i gadw] unrhyw beth o'r hyn y maent wedi ei ennill. Ac nid yw Allah yn arwain y bobl disbelieving.

trans-unit.source: And the example of those who spend their wealth seeking means to the approval of Allah and assuring [reward for] themselves is like a garden on high ground which is hit by a downpour - so it yields its fruits in double. And [even] if it is not hit by a downpour, then a drizzle [is sufficient]. And Allah, of what you do, is Seeing.
trans-unit.target: Ac enghraifft o'r rhai sy'n treulio eu cyfoeth yn chwilio am ffordd i gymeradwyaeth Allah a sicrhau [gwobr am] Mae eu hunain fel gardd ar dir uchel sydd yn taro gan glaw trwm-felly bydd yn cyflawni ei ffrwyth yn dwbl. A [hyd yn oed] Os yw yn taro nid gan cawodydd trymion, yna sesno [yn ddigon]. A yw Allah, yr hyn yr ydych yn ei wneud, yn ei gweld.

trans-unit.source: Would one of you like to have a garden of palm trees and grapevines underneath which rivers flow in which he has from every fruit? But he is afflicted with old age and has weak offspring, and it is hit by a whirlwind containing fire and is burned. Thus does Allah make clear to you [His] verses that you might give thought.
trans-unit.target: Hoffai un ohonoch wedi gardd goed palmwydd a gwinwydden oddi tano y llif afonydd mewn sydd ganddo o bob ffrwyth? Ond mae'n dioddef â henaint ac mae'r epil wan, ac mae'n taro gan Gorwynt sy'n cynnwys tân ac yn llosgi. Felly yw'r Allah yn egluro i chi [ei] penillion y gallai roi meddwl.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, spend from the good things which you have earned and from that which We have produced for you from the earth. And do not aim toward the defective therefrom, spending [from that] while you would not take it [yourself] except with closed eyes. And know that Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy.
trans-unit.target: O sydd wedi credu, wario o'r pethau da sydd wedi ei ennill ac a ydym wedi cynhyrchu i chi o'r ddaear. Ac nid fwriad tuag at y diffygiol thelir, gwariant [o] er na fyddech chi'n cymryd ei [eich hun] ac eithrio llygaid ar gau. A gwybod bod Allah yn rhad ac am ddim o angen ac Praiseworthy.

trans-unit.source: Satan threatens you with poverty and orders you to immorality, while Allah promises you forgiveness from Him and bounty. And Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Mae Satan yn eich bygwth â thlodi a Gorchmynion chi i anfoesoldeb, tra mae'r Allah yn addo eich maddeuant iddo a bounty. Ac Allah yn hollgynhwysol a gwybod.

trans-unit.source: He gives wisdom to whom He wills, and whoever has been given wisdom has certainly been given much good. And none will remember except those of understanding.
trans-unit.target: Mae'n rhoi doethineb i bwy y mae ef wills, a pwy bynnag a roddwyd doethineb sicr Rhoddwyd llawer o ddaioni. A bydd yn cofio dim ac eithrio rhai o ddealltwriaeth.

trans-unit.source: And whatever you spend of expenditures or make of vows - indeed, Allah knows of it. And for the wrongdoers there are no helpers.
trans-unit.target: A beth bynnag y gwariant o'r gwariannau neu wneud o addo-yn wir, Allah yn gwybod amdano. Ac ar gyfer y tramgwyddo, nid oes unrhyw gynorthwywyr.

trans-unit.source: If you disclose your charitable expenditures, they are good; but if you conceal them and give them to the poor, it is better for you, and He will remove from you some of your misdeeds [thereby]. And Allah, with what you do, is [fully] Acquainted.
trans-unit.target: Os ydych chi'n datgelu eich gwariant elusennol, maent yn dda; ond os ydych yn cuddio nhw ac yn rhoi iddynt at y tlawd, mae'n well i chi, a bydd ei ddileu gennych rhai o'r eich camweddau [ac felly]. A gyda beth yr ydych yn ei wneud, yw Allah, [llawn] yn gyfarwydd.

trans-unit.source: Not upon you, [O Muhammad], is [responsibility for] their guidance, but Allah guides whom He wills. And whatever good you [believers] spend is for yourselves, and you do not spend except seeking the countenance of Allah. And whatever you spend of good - it will be fully repaid to you, and you will not be wronged.
trans-unit.target: Nid arnoch chi, [O Muhammad], [cyfrifoldeb ar gyfer] yw eu canllawiau, ond canllawiau Allah bwy mae ef wills. A beth bynnag da chi [credinwyr] Mae gwariant yn drosoch eich hunain, ac nid ydych yn treulio ac eithrio ceisio ystyried Allah. A beth bynnag yr ydych yn ei wario da-bydd yn llwyr ad-dalu i chi, ac ni Bydd ydych yn cam.

trans-unit.source: [Charity is] for the poor who have been restricted for the cause of Allah, unable to move about in the land. An ignorant [person] would think them self-sufficient because of their restraint, but you will know them by their [characteristic] sign. They do not ask people persistently [or at all]. And whatever you spend of good - indeed, Allah is Knowing of it.
trans-unit.target: [Yn elusen] ar gyfer y tlawd sydd wedi cyfyngu ar gyfer achos Allah, yn gallu symud o gwmpas yn y tir. Byddai [person] anwybodus yn meddwl eu bod yn hunangynhaliol oherwydd eu ffrwyno, ond byddwch yn gwybod iddynt gan eu arwydd [nodwedd]. Nid ydynt yn gofyn pobl gyson [neu o gwbl]. A beth bynnag yr ydych yn ei wario da-yn wir, Allah yn gwybod amdano.

trans-unit.source: Those who spend their wealth [in Allah 's way] by night and by day, secretly and publicly - they will have their reward with their Lord. And no fear will there be concerning them, nor will they grieve.
trans-unit.target: Bydd rhai sy'n treulio eu cyfoeth [yn Allah y ffordd] gan nos a dydd, gyfrinachol ac yn gyhoeddus-maent yn cael eu gwobrwyo gyda eu yr Arglwydd. A bydd unrhyw ofn yno yn ymwneud â hwy, na bydd iddynt alaru.

trans-unit.source: Those who consume interest cannot stand [on the Day of Resurrection] except as one stands who is being beaten by Satan into insanity. That is because they say, "Trade is [just] like interest." But Allah has permitted trade and has forbidden interest. So whoever has received an admonition from his Lord and desists may have what is past, and his affair rests with Allah. But whoever returns to [dealing in interest or usury] - those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide eternally therein.
trans-unit.target: Ni all rhai sy'n yfed ddiddordeb yn sefyll [ar dydd atgyfodi] ac eithrio fel un o stondinau sydd yn cael eu curo gan Satan i gwallgofrwydd. Mae hynny oherwydd maent yn dweud, "[ychydig] yw masnach yn hoffi diddordeb." Ond Allah a ganiateir masnach ac wedi gwahardd diddordeb. Felly pwy bynnag gafodd cheryddu gan ei Arglwydd a desists efallai beth yn y gorffennol, ac mae ei ddigwyddiad yn nwylo'r Allah. Ond pwy bynnag sydd yn dychwelyd i [delio mewn diddordeb neu usury] – yw'r rheini y cymdeithion y tân; Bydd maent yn glynu fythol ynddo.

trans-unit.source: Allah destroys interest and gives increase for charities. And Allah does not like every sinning disbeliever.
trans-unit.target: Mae'r Allah yn dinistrio diddordeb ac yn rhoi cynnydd ar gyfer elusennau. Ac nad yw Allah yn hoffi pob disbeliever sinning.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who believe and do righteous deeds and establish prayer and give zakah will have their reward with their Lord, and there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, bydd y rhai sydd yn credu a wneud gweithredoedd cyfiawn a sefydlu gweddi a rhoi zakah yn cael eu gwobrwyo gyda eu yr Arglwydd, ac ni fydd unrhyw ofn ynghylch eu, nac bydd maent yn galaru.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, fear Allah and give up what remains [due to you] of interest, if you should be believers.
trans-unit.target: O Mae chi sydd wedi credu, ofn Allah ac ildio yn parhau pa [oherwydd] o ddiddordeb, os dylai fod credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: And if you do not, then be informed of a war [against you] from Allah and His Messenger. But if you repent, you may have your principal - [thus] you do no wrong, nor are you wronged.
trans-unit.target: Ac os nad ydych, yna cael gwybod rhyfel [yn erbyn eich] gan Allah a ei negesydd. Ond os ydych yn edifarhau, efallai fod gennych eich prif-[felly] ydych ddim o'i le, nac yn eich cam.

trans-unit.source: And if someone is in hardship, then [let there be] postponement until [a time of] ease. But if you give [from your right as] charity, then it is better for you, if you only knew.
trans-unit.target: Ac os yw rhywun mewn caledi, yna [yn gadael yno] gohirio tan [amser o] Pa mor hawdd. Ond os ydych yn rhoi [gan eich hawl fel] elusen, yna yn well i chi, os oeddech yn gwybod yn unig.

trans-unit.source: And fear a Day when you will be returned to Allah. Then every soul will be compensated for what it earned, and they will not be treated unjustly.
trans-unit.target: Ac ofn dydd pan ydych chi yn dychwelyd i Allah. Bydd pob enaid ei ddigolledu wedyn beth y mae'n ei ennill, a bydd eu trin gam ni.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when you contract a debt for a specified term, write it down. And let a scribe write [it] between you in justice. Let no scribe refuse to write as Allah has taught him. So let him write and let the one who has the obligation dictate. And let him fear Allah, his Lord, and not leave anything out of it. But if the one who has the obligation is of limited understanding or weak or unable to dictate himself, then let his guardian dictate in justice. And bring to witness two witnesses from among your men. And if there are not two men [available], then a man and two women from those whom you accept as witnesses - so that if one of the women errs, then the other can remind her. And let not the witnesses refuse when they are called upon. And do not be [too] weary to write it, whether it is small or large, for its [specified] term. That is more just in the sight of Allah and stronger as evidence and more likely to prevent doubt between you, except when it is an immediate transaction which you conduct among yourselves. For [then] there is no blame upon you if you do not write it. And take witnesses when you conclude a contract. Let no scribe be harmed or any witness. For if you do so, indeed, it is [grave] disobedience in you. And fear Allah. And Allah teaches you. And Allah is Knowing of all things.
trans-unit.target: O sydd wedi credu, pan y byddwch yn gwneud contract i ddyled am dymor penodedig, ysgrifennwch ei i lawr. A gadewch i'r Ysgrifennydd ysgrifennu [TG] rhwng chi mewn cyfiawnder. Gadewch unrhyw Ysgrifennydd wrthod i ysgrifennu fel mae Allah yn dysgu iddo. Felly gadewch iddo ysgrifennu a gadewch yr un sydd wedi pennu rhwymedigaeth. A gadewch iddo ofni Allah, ei Arglwydd, ac nid gadael unrhyw beth allan ohono. Ond os yr un sydd â rhwymedigaeth yw dealltwriaeth gyfyngedig neu yn wan neu does dim modd i Orchymyn ei hun, yna gadewch warcheidwad ei bennu mewn cyfiawnder. A dwyn i dyst dau dyst o blith eich dynion. Mae ac os nad oes dau ddyn [ar gael], yna dyn a dwy fenyw o'r rheini yr ydych yn derbyn fel tystion-fel y gall os mae un o'r merched yn ymylu, yna y llall yn ei hatgoffa. A gadewch i ni y tystion wrthod pan gânt eu galw ar. A Peidiwch â bod yn [hefyd] wedi blino ysgrifennu, a yw'n bach neu fawr, ar gyfer ei thymor [penodol]. Dyna fwy unig yng ngolwg Allah ac yn gryfach fel tystiolaeth ac yn fwy tebygol o atal amheuaeth rhyngoch chi, ac eithrio pan yw'n trafodyn ar unwaith y byddwch yn cynnal ymysg eich gilydd. [Hynny] Nid oes unrhyw fai arnoch os nad ydych yn ei ysgrifennu. Ac tystion wrth ichi derfynu contract. Gadewch unrhyw Ysgrifennydd ei niweidio neu unrhyw dyst. Os oes ichi wneud hynny, yn wir, mae'n [mawr] anufudd-dod yn chi. Ac ofn Allah. Ac mae Allah yn eich addysgu. A gwybod am yr holl bethau yw Allah.

trans-unit.source: And if you are on a journey and cannot find a scribe, then a security deposit [should be] taken. And if one of you entrusts another, then let him who is entrusted discharge his trust [faithfully] and let him fear Allah, his Lord. And do not conceal testimony, for whoever conceals it - his heart is indeed sinful, and Allah is Knowing of what you do.
trans-unit.target: Os ydych ar daith ac ni allaf ddod o hyd i Ysgrifennydd, yna blaendal diogelwch [dylai fod] cymryd. Ac os mae un ohonoch yn ymddiried i un arall, yna gadewch ef sydd wedi ei ymddiried rhyddhau Mae ei Ymddiriedolaeth [gywir] a gadewch iddo ofni Allah, ei Arglwydd. Nid oes cuddio dyst, celu pwy bynnag-ei galon yn wir sinful, a Allah yn gwybod yr hyn yr ydych yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. Whether you show what is within yourselves or conceal it, Allah will bring you to account for it. Then He will forgive whom He wills and punish whom He wills, and Allah is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: Allah yn perthyn iddo beth bynnag yn y nefoedd a beth bynnag sydd yn y ddaear. A ydych yn dangos beth yw o fewn eich hunain neu guddio ei, bydd Allah yn dwyn chi i gyfrif am hynny. Yna bydd yn maddau pwy ef wills a chosbi y mae ef yn wills, ac yn Allah dros holl bethau yn gymwys.

trans-unit.source: The Messenger has believed in what was revealed to him from his Lord, and [so have] the believers. All of them have believed in Allah and His angels and His books and His messengers, [saying], "We make no distinction between any of His messengers." And they say, "We hear and we obey. [We seek] Your forgiveness, our Lord, and to You is the [final] destination."
trans-unit.target: Mae y negesydd yn credu mewn datgelwyd beth iddo ef gan ei Arglwydd, ac [felly] y credinwyr. Pob un ohonynt wedi credu mewn Allah a ei angylion a ei lyfrau a ei negeswyr, [dweud], "Rydym yn gwneud unrhyw wahaniaeth rhwng unrhyw un ei negeswyr." Ac maent yn dweud, "yr ydym yn clywed ac rydym yn ufuddhau. [Rydym] Eich maddeuant, ein yr Arglwydd, ac i chi yn y [daith]. "

trans-unit.source: Allah does not charge a soul except [with that within] its capacity. It will have [the consequence of] what [good] it has gained, and it will bear [the consequence of] what [evil] it has earned. "Our Lord, do not impose blame upon us if we have forgotten or erred. Our Lord, and lay not upon us a burden like that which You laid upon those before us. Our Lord, and burden us not with that which we have no ability to bear. And pardon us; and forgive us; and have mercy upon us. You are our protector, so give us victory over the disbelieving people."
trans-unit.target: Nid yw Allah yn codi enaid ac eithrio [â hynny o fewn] ei gallu. Bydd yn rhaid [o ganlyniad i] Pa [da] wedi ei ennill, a bydd hyn yn dwyn [o ganlyniad i] Pa [drygioni] wedi ei ennill. "Ein Arglwydd, nid yw yn gosod bai arnom os ydym wedi anghofio neu ochri. Ein yr Arglwydd, a lleyg nid arnom ni faich fel a osodwyd gennych ar y rhai ger ein bron. Ein yr Arglwydd, ac yn faich ein nid â hynny lle gallwn ni ddim gallu i gofio. A maddeuwch ni; a maddau i ni; a drugaredd arnom. Yr ydych yn ein protector, rhowch fuddugoliaeth dros y bobl disbelieving."

trans-unit.source: Alif, Lam, Meem.
trans-unit.target: Alif, Lam, Meem.

trans-unit.source: Allah - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence.
trans-unit.target: Allah-nid oes unrhyw Dduwdod ac eithrio ef, y byw erioed, y Sustainer o fodolaeth.

trans-unit.source: He has sent down upon you, [O Muhammad], the Book in truth, confirming what was before it. And He revealed the Torah and the Gospel.
trans-unit.target: Mae ef wedi anfon i lawr ar chi, [O Muhammad], y llyfr mewn gwirionedd, yn cadarnhau beth oedd ger ei fron. A datgelodd y Torah ac efengyl.

trans-unit.source: Before, as guidance for the people. And He revealed the Qur'an. Indeed, those who disbelieve in the verses of Allah will have a severe punishment, and Allah is exalted in Might, the Owner of Retribution.
trans-unit.target: O'r blaen, fel canllawiau ar gyfer y bobl. A datgelodd y Qur'an. Yn wir, bydd rhai a chredu yn y penillion Allah cosb difrifol, ac mae i'w Allah mawrygu yn efallai, perchennog dial.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, from Allah nothing is hidden in the earth nor in the heaven.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, gan Allah yw dim cudd yn y ddaear nac yn y nefoedd.

trans-unit.source: It is He who forms you in the wombs however He wills. There is no deity except Him, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Mae'n ef a ffurfio chi yn y wombs Fodd bynnag, mae ganddo wills. Nid oes unrhyw Dduwdod ac eithrio ef, Exalted yn efallai, yn y doeth.

trans-unit.source: It is He who has sent down to you, [O Muhammad], the Book; in it are verses [that are] precise - they are the foundation of the Book - and others unspecific. As for those in whose hearts is deviation [from truth], they will follow that of it which is unspecific, seeking discord and seeking an interpretation [suitable to them]. And no one knows its [true] interpretation except Allah. But those firm in knowledge say, "We believe in it. All [of it] is from our Lord." And no one will be reminded except those of understanding.
trans-unit.target: Ef sydd wedi anfon i lawr i chi, [O Muhammad], y llyfr; yn cael ei penillion [bod] union-maent yn sylfaen y llyfr-ac eraill amhenodol. O ran y rheini yn eu calonnau yw gwyriad [o'r gwir], byddant yn dilyn hynny ohono sy'n yn amhenodol, ceisio anghytgord a cheisio dehongliad [addas iddynt]. Ac ni wyr neb ei dehongliad [gwir] ac eithrio Allah. Ond dweud hynny gadarn mewn gwybodaeth, "Credwn ynddo. Gyd [] yn gan ein Arglwydd." A bydd unrhyw un yn cael eu hatgoffa ac eithrio rhai o ddealltwriaeth.

trans-unit.source: [Who say], "Our Lord, let not our hearts deviate after You have guided us and grant us from Yourself mercy. Indeed, You are the Bestower.
trans-unit.target: [Sy'n dweud], "ein Arglwydd, gadewch i ni ein calonnau wyro ar ôl i chi wedi ein tywys a grant inni gan eich hun drugaredd. Yn wir, yr ydych yn y Bestower.

trans-unit.source: Our Lord, surely You will gather the people for a Day about which there is no doubt. Indeed, Allah does not fail in His promise."
trans-unit.target: Ein Arglwydd, onid ydych Bydd casglu pobl ar gyfer diwrnod y nid oes unrhyw amheuaeth. Yn wir, yw'r Allah yn methu yn ei addewid."

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who disbelieve - never will their wealth or their children avail them against Allah at all. And it is they who are fuel for the Fire.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, rhai a chredu-byth bydd eu cyfoeth neu mae eu plant fanteisio ar iddynt erbyn Allah o gwbl. A hwy sy'n tanwydd ar gyfer y tân.

trans-unit.source: [Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and those before them. They denied Our signs, so Allah seized them for their sins. And Allah is severe in penalty.
trans-unit.target: [Hwy yw'r] fel arfer gan bobl Ffaro a hynny cyn iddynt. Iddynt wrthod ein arwyddion, felly roedd Allah yn hatafaelu iddynt am eu pechodau. A Allah yn ddifrifol yn gosb.

trans-unit.source: Say to those who disbelieve, "You will be overcome and gathered together to Hell, and wretched is the resting place."
trans-unit.target: Dweud i'r rhai a chredu, "byddwch yn goresgyn a gasglwyd at ei gilydd i uffern ac truenus yn y man gorffwys."

trans-unit.source: Already there has been for you a sign in the two armies which met - one fighting in the cause of Allah and another of disbelievers. They saw them [to be] twice their [own] number by [their] eyesight. But Allah supports with His victory whom He wills. Indeed in that is a lesson for those of vision.
trans-unit.target: Eisoes bu i chi arwydd yn y byddinoedd dau bodloni-un ymladd achos Allah ac un arall o disbelievers. Gwelsant iddyn nhw [fod] ddwywaith nifer eu [ei hun] [u] golwg. Ond mae'r Allah yn cefnogi gyda ei fuddugoliaeth ef mae ei wills. Yn wir yn hynny yn wers ar gyfer y rheini o weledigaeth.

trans-unit.source: Beautified for people is the love of that which they desire - of women and sons, heaped-up sums of gold and silver, fine branded horses, and cattle and tilled land. That is the enjoyment of worldly life, but Allah has with Him the best return.
trans-unit.target: Beautified i bobl yn y cariad yr hyn y maent yn eu dymuno-menywod a Mae'r meibion, symiau pentyrru i fyny o aur ac arian, ddirwy ceffylau sydd wedi'u brandio, a gwartheg tir tilled. Dyna y mwynhad o fywyd worldly, ond mae Allah gydag ef yr adenillion gorau.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Shall I inform you of [something] better than that? For those who fear Allah will be gardens in the presence of their Lord beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally, and purified spouses and approval from Allah. And Allah is Seeing of [His] servants -
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Byddaf yn eich hysbysu o'r [rhywbeth] gwell na hynny? Ar gyfer rhai sy'n ofni Allah yn gerddi ym mhresenoldeb yr Arglwydd eu oddi tano Mae afonydd yn llifo, lle maent yn glynu fythol, ac yn puro priod a chymeradwyo gan Allah. A yw Allah yn gweld gweision [ei]-

trans-unit.source: Those who say, "Our Lord, indeed we have believed, so forgive us our sins and protect us from the punishment of the Fire,"
trans-unit.target: Rhai hynny sy'n dweud, "Ein Arglwydd, yn wir yr ydym wedi credu, mor faddau inni ein pechodau ac i'n hamddiffyn rhag y gosb y tân"

trans-unit.source: The patient, the true, the obedient, those who spend [in the way of Allah], and those who seek forgiveness before dawn.
trans-unit.target: Y claf, y gwir, y obedient, rhai sy'n treulio [rhwystro Allah], a rhai sy'n ceisio maddeuant cyn dawn.

trans-unit.source: Allah witnesses that there is no deity except Him, and [so do] the angels and those of knowledge - [that He is] maintaining [creation] in justice. There is no deity except Him, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Allah tystion nad oes unrhyw Dduwdod ac eithrio ef, ac [felly] angylion a'r rhai gwybodaeth-[y mae] cynnal [creu] mewn cyfiawnder. Nid oes unrhyw Dduwdod ac eithrio ef, Exalted yn efallai, yn y doeth.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the religion in the sight of Allah is Islam. And those who were given the Scripture did not differ except after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. And whoever disbelieves in the verses of Allah, then indeed, Allah is swift in [taking] account.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, roedd crefydd yng ngolwg Allah yn Islam. Ac nid oedd rheini y rhoddwyd yr ysgrythur wahanol ac eithrio wedi gwybodaeth ddod iddynt-allan o eiddigeddus drwgdeimlad rhwng eu hunain. A pwy bynnag a disbelieves yn y penillion Allah, yna yn wir, Allah yn gyflym yn [gan] ystyried.

trans-unit.source: So if they argue with you, say, "I have submitted myself to Allah [in Islam], and [so have] those who follow me." And say to those who were given the Scripture and [to] the unlearned, "Have you submitted yourselves?" And if they submit [in Islam], they are rightly guided; but if they turn away - then upon you is only the [duty of] notification. And Allah is Seeing of [His] servants.
trans-unit.target: Felly, os y maent yn dadlau gyda chi, yn dweud, "wedi cyflwyno fy hun i Allah [yn Islam] a [felly wedi] rhai sy'n dilyn mi." A dweud i'r rheini y rhoddwyd yr ysgrythur a [i] unlearned, "Ydych chi wedi cyflwyno eich hunain?" A os ydynt yn cyflwyno [yn Islam], maent yn tywys; ond os maent yn troi i ffwrdd-yna i chi yn unig yr hysbysiad [dyletswydd]. A yw Allah yn gweld gweision [ei].

trans-unit.source: Those who disbelieve in the signs of Allah and kill the prophets without right and kill those who order justice from among the people - give them tidings of a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Rhai a chredu yn arwyddion o Allah ac yn lladd y proffwydi heb hawl a lladd y rhai sy'n Gorchymyn cyfiawnder o blith pobl-yn rhoi iddynt tidings cosb, poenus.

trans-unit.source: They are the ones whose deeds have become worthless in this world and the Hereafter, and for them there will be no helpers.
trans-unit.target: Hwy yw'r rhai y mae eu gweithredoedd yn troi'n ddiwerth yn y byd hwn a y o hyn ymlaen, ac ar eu cyfer ni fydd unrhyw gynorthwywyr.

trans-unit.source: Do you not consider, [O Muhammad], those who were given a portion of the Scripture? They are invited to the Scripture of Allah that it should arbitrate between them; then a party of them turns away, and they are refusing.
trans-unit.target: Nad ydych yn ystyried, [O Muhammad], rheini y rhoddwyd dogn o yr ysgrythurau? Fe'u gwahoddir i ysgrythur Allah, y dylid ei gyflafareddu rhyngddynt; yna y mae Plaid eu troi i ffwrdd, a ydynt yn ei wrthod.

trans-unit.source: That is because they say, "Never will the Fire touch us except for [a few] numbered days," and [because] they were deluded in their religion by what they were inventing.
trans-unit.target: Dyna gan ddweud, "fyddant byth y cyffyrddiad tân ohonom ac eithrio diwrnod wedi'u rhifo [ychydig]" a [oherwydd] oedd eich yn eu crefydd yn beth y cafodd ei dyfeisio.

trans-unit.source: So how will it be when We assemble them for a Day about which there is no doubt? And each soul will be compensated [in full for] what it earned, and they will not be wronged.
trans-unit.target: Felly, sut fydd pan feddyliwn am iddynt ar gyfer diwrnod y nid oes unrhyw amheuaeth? A bydd pob enaid yn cael eu digolledu [yn llawn ar gyfer] beth y mae'n ei ennill, ac ni Bydd maent yn cam.

trans-unit.source: Say, "O Allah, Owner of Sovereignty, You give sovereignty to whom You will and You take sovereignty away from whom You will. You honor whom You will and You humble whom You will. In Your hand is [all] good. Indeed, You are over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: Ddweud, "O Allah, perchennog o sofraniaeth, a roddwch sofraniaeth i bwy y bydd eich a gymerwch sofraniaeth oddi wrth bwy y byddwch yn. Cadw'r ydych chi bydd ac mae ydych y byddwch yn wylaidd. Yn eich llaw yn dda [bob]. Yn wir, yr ydych yn dros holl bethau yn gymwys.

trans-unit.source: You cause the night to enter the day, and You cause the day to enter the night; and You bring the living out of the dead, and You bring the dead out of the living. And You give provision to whom You will without account."
trans-unit.target: Yr ydych yn achosi y nos i fynd y diwrnod, ac yr ydych yn achosi y diwrnod i ddod y nos; a ydych yn dwyn allan y meirw byw, a ydych yn dwyn y meirw allan o byw. A ydych yn rhoi darpariaeth i bwy y bydd chi heb gyfrif.

trans-unit.source: Let not believers take disbelievers as allies rather than believers. And whoever [of you] does that has nothing with Allah, except when taking precaution against them in prudence. And Allah warns you of Himself, and to Allah is the [final] destination.
trans-unit.target: Gadewch i ni credinwyr gymryd disbelievers fel cynghreiriaid yn hytrach na credinwyr. A pwy bynnag [o] yn gwneud hynny gan ddim ag Allah, ac eithrio pan fydd cymryd rhagofalon yn eu herbyn yn ddoethineb. Ac mae'r Allah yn rhybuddio chi ei hun, ac i Allah yn y [daith].

trans-unit.source: Say, "Whether you conceal what is in your breasts or reveal it, Allah knows it. And He knows that which is in the heavens and that which is on the earth. And Allah is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "a ydych yn cuddio beth sydd yn eich bronnau neu'n ei ddatgelu, Allah yn gwybod iddo. A gwyr y sydd yn y nefoedd a'r hyn sydd ar y ddaear. A yw Allah dros holl bethau yn gymwys.

trans-unit.source: The Day every soul will find what it has done of good present [before it] and what it has done of evil, it will wish that between itself and that [evil] was a great distance. And Allah warns you of Himself, and Allah is Kind to [His] servants."
trans-unit.target: Y dydd bydd pob enaid ei chael wedi ei wneud o hyn o bryd da [ger ei fron] ac wedi ei wneud o ddrygioni, bydd hynny am fod rhwng ei hun a hwnnw [drygioni] yn bell iawn. Ac mae'r Allah yn rhybuddio chi ei hun, a Allah yw math [ei] weision."
