trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "If you should love Allah, then follow me, [so] Allah will love you and forgive you your sins. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, [O Muhammad], "os dylai caru Allah, yna Dilynwch fi, [felly] Bydd Allah yn caru chi ac yn maddau ichi eich pechodau. A Allah Forgiving a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Obey Allah and the Messenger." But if they turn away - then indeed, Allah does not like the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Ufuddhau Allah ac y negesydd." Ond os y maent yn troi i ffwrdd-yn wir, yna nid Allah yn hoffi y disbelievers.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah chose Adam and Noah and the family of Abraham and the family of 'Imran over the worlds -
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, dewisodd Allah Adam a Noah a theulu Abraham a'r teulu o ' Imran dros fyd-

trans-unit.source: Descendants, some of them from others. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Ddisgynyddion, rhai ohonynt oddi wrth eraill. A Allah yn clywed ac yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: [Mention, O Muhammad], when the wife of 'Imran said, "My Lord, indeed I have pledged to You what is in my womb, consecrated [for Your service], so accept this from me. Indeed, You are the Hearing, the Knowing."
trans-unit.target: [Sôn, O Muhammad], pan fydd y wraig o ' Imran Dywedodd, "fy Arglwydd, yn wir yr wyf wedi addo i chi beth yw yn fy groth, cysegrwyd [ar gyfer eich gwasanaeth], felly derbyn hyn oddi wrthyf. Yn wir, yr ydych yn y gwrandawiad, y mae gwybod."

trans-unit.source: But when she delivered her, she said, "My Lord, I have delivered a female." And Allah was most knowing of what she delivered, "And the male is not like the female. And I have named her Mary, and I seek refuge for her in You and [for] her descendants from Satan, the expelled [from the mercy of Allah]."
trans-unit.target: Ond pan y bu iddi gyflwyno iddi, dywedodd hi, "fy Arglwydd, wedi darparu benyw." Allah oedd gwybod rhan fwyaf o'r hyn y mae hi'n ei gyflawni, "ac nid yw y dyn fel y fenyw. A wyf wedi enwi ei Mary, a cheisiaf loches iddi yn eich ac [am] ei ddisgynyddion o Satan, diarddel [o drugaredd Allah]."

trans-unit.source: So her Lord accepted her with good acceptance and caused her to grow in a good manner and put her in the care of Zechariah. Every time Zechariah entered upon her in the prayer chamber, he found with her provision. He said, "O Mary, from where is this [coming] to you?" She said, "It is from Allah. Indeed, Allah provides for whom He wills without account."
trans-unit.target: Felly mae ei Arglwydd yn ei derbyn gyda derbyniad da ac yn achosi iddi i dyfu mewn ffordd dda a hi roi yng ngofal Zechariah. Bob tro y roesoch Zechariah arni yn y Siambr gweddi, canfu ei ddarpariaeth. Dywedodd, "O Mary, o lle mae hwn [dod] i chi?" Meddai, "Mae gan Allah. Yn wir, mae'r Allah darparu bwy mae ef wills heb gyfrif."

trans-unit.source: At that, Zechariah called upon his Lord, saying, "My Lord, grant me from Yourself a good offspring. Indeed, You are the Hearer of supplication."
trans-unit.target: Ar hynny, galwodd Zechariah ar ei Arglwydd, gan ddweud, "fy Arglwydd, grant mi eich hun epil da. Yn wir, yr ydych yn Hearer o supplication."

trans-unit.source: So the angels called him while he was standing in prayer in the chamber, "Indeed, Allah gives you good tidings of John, confirming a word from Allah and [who will be] honorable, abstaining [from women], and a prophet from among the righteous."
trans-unit.target: Fel angylion alw tra oedd ef yn sefyll mewn gweddi yn y Siambr, "yn wir, mae'r Allah yn rhoi ichi tidings da John, cadarnhau gair Allah a [fydd] Anrhydeddus, Ymatal [merched], ac yn broffwyd o blith y righteous."

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, how will I have a boy when I have reached old age and my wife is barren?" The angel said, "Such is Allah; He does what He wills."
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "Fy Arglwydd, sut bydd gennyf bachgen pan wyf wedi cyrraedd henaint ac mae fy ngwraig yn hesb?" Dywedodd yr angel, "o'r fath yw Allah; Gwna hyn iddo wills."

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, make for me a sign." He Said, "Your sign is that you will not [be able to] speak to the people for three days except by gesture. And remember your Lord much and exalt [Him with praise] in the evening and the morning."
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "Fy Arglwydd, gwneud i mi arwydd." Au Said, "eich arwydd yw na wnewch [yn gallu] siarad i bobl am dri diwrnod ac eithrio drwy ystum. A llawer yn cofio eich Arglwydd a exalt [ef gyda chanmoliaeth] yn y bore a gyda'r nos.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when the angels said, "O Mary, indeed Allah has chosen you and purified you and chosen you above the women of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: [Yn sôn am] pan fydd yr angylion wedi dweud, "O Mary, Allah yn wir dewis chi a puro eich ac eich dewis uchod y menywod y byd.

trans-unit.source: O Mary, be devoutly obedient to your Lord and prostrate and bow with those who bow [in prayer]."
trans-unit.target: O Mary, yn daer obedient at eich Arglwydd a prostrate a plygu gyda'r rhai sy'n plygu [mewn gweddi]. "

trans-unit.source: That is from the news of the unseen which We reveal to you, [O Muhammad]. And you were not with them when they cast their pens as to which of them should be responsible for Mary. Nor were you with them when they disputed.
trans-unit.target: Mae gan y newyddion am y unseen a ydym yn datgelu i chi, [O Muhammad]. Ac nid oeddech gyda hwy wrth iddynt fwrw eu pennau ynghylch pa un ohonynt ddylai fod yn gyfrifol am Mary. Nid oedd eich gyda hwy pan roeddent yn anghytuno ychwaith.

trans-unit.source: [And mention] when the angels said, "O Mary, indeed Allah gives you good tidings of a word from Him, whose name will be the Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary - distinguished in this world and the Hereafter and among those brought near [to Allah].
trans-unit.target: [A sôn am] pan ddywedodd yr angylion, "Mary O, yn wir mae Allah yn rhoi ichi tidings da gair oddi wrtho, bydd ei enw yn y Messiah, Iesu, fab i Mary-nodedig yn y byd hwn a y o hyn ymlaen ac ymysg y rhai dwyn ger [i Allah].

trans-unit.source: He will speak to the people in the cradle and in maturity and will be of the righteous."
trans-unit.target: Bydd ef yn siarad i bobl yn y crud ac yn aeddfedu a bydd o y righteous."

trans-unit.source: She said, "My Lord, how will I have a child when no man has touched me?" [The angel] said, "Such is Allah; He creates what He wills. When He decrees a matter, He only says to it, 'Be,' and it is.
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "Fy Arglwydd, sut bydd yn rhaid i blentyn pan oedd un dyn wedi cyffwrdd â mi?" [Yr angel] dywedodd, "o'r fath yw Allah; Mae ef yn creu beth a wills ef. Pan mae ef deddfir mater, dim ond meddai, 'Fod yn', ac mae.

trans-unit.source: And He will teach him writing and wisdom and the Torah and the Gospel
trans-unit.target: A fydd ef yn dysgu iddo ysgrifennu a doethineb a y Torah ac efengyl

trans-unit.source: And [make him] a messenger to the Children of Israel, [who will say], 'Indeed I have come to you with a sign from your Lord in that I design for you from clay [that which is] like the form of a bird, then I breathe into it and it becomes a bird by permission of Allah. And I cure the blind and the leper, and I give life to the dead - by permission of Allah. And I inform you of what you eat and what you store in your houses. Indeed in that is a sign for you, if you are believers.
trans-unit.target: A [yn gwneud iddo] negesydd i blant Israel, [pwy fydd yn dweud], ' yn wir yr wyf wedi dod i chi gyda'r arwydd o eich Arglwydd yn y dylunio wyf i chi o glai [sydd] fel ffurf aderyn, yna yr anadlu i mewn iddo a daw'n aderyn drwy ganiatâd Allah. A gwella yr y Deillion a leper y, a rhoddaf bywyd y meirw-drwy ganiatâd Allah. A rhoddaf wybod i chi beth yr ydych yn ei fwyta a beth yr ydych yn ei storio yn eich tai. Yn wir yn hynny yn arwydd i chi, os ydych yn gredinwyr.

trans-unit.source: And [I have come] confirming what was before me of the Torah and to make lawful for you some of what was forbidden to you. And I have come to you with a sign from your Lord, so fear Allah and obey me.
trans-unit.target: Ac [yr wyf wedi dod] cadarnhau beth oedd ger fy mron y Torah ac i'w gwneud yn gyfreithlon i chi rai o'r hyn oedd yn waharddedig i chi. Ac yr wyf wedi dod i chi gyda'r arwydd o eich Arglwydd, mor ofn Allah ac ufuddhau i mi.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. That is the straight path."
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, Allah yw fy Arglwydd a eich Arglwydd, felly addoli ef. Yn y llwybr syth.

trans-unit.source: But when Jesus felt [persistence in] disbelief from them, he said, "Who are my supporters for [the cause of] Allah?" The disciples said, "We are supporters for Allah. We have believed in Allah and testify that we are Muslims [submitting to Him].
trans-unit.target: Ond pan y teimlai Iesu [dyfalbarhad wrth] anghrediniaeth oddi wrthynt, dywedodd, "pwy yw fy cefnogwyr am [achos] Allah?" Dywedodd y disciples, "Rydym yn gefnogwyr i Allah. Rydym wedi credu mewn Allah a dystio ein bod Moslemiaid [cyflwyno iddo].

trans-unit.source: Our Lord, we have believed in what You revealed and have followed the messenger Jesus, so register us among the witnesses [to truth]."
trans-unit.target: Ein Arglwydd, yr ydym wedi credu mewn beth ydych wedi datgelu ac wedi dilyn y negesydd Iesu, felly ein cofrestr ymhlith y tystion [gwir]. "

trans-unit.source: And the disbelievers planned, but Allah planned. And Allah is the best of planners.
trans-unit.target: Ac y disbelievers cynllunio, ond cynlluniodd Allah. A Allah yw'r gorau o gynllunwyr.

trans-unit.source: [Mention] when Allah said, "O Jesus, indeed I will take you and raise you to Myself and purify you from those who disbelieve and make those who follow you [in submission to Allah alone] superior to those who disbelieve until the Day of Resurrection. Then to Me is your return, and I will judge between you concerning that in which you used to differ.
trans-unit.target: [Sôn am] pan ddywedodd Allah, "O Iesu, yn wir I bydd yn mynd â chi a chi godi i fi fy hun a puro'r chi gan y rheini a chredu a gwneud rhai sy'n dilyn chi [yn y cyflwyniad i Allah yn unig] uwch i'r rhai a chredu tan ddiwrnod yr atgyfodiad. Yna i mi yw eich enillion, a byddaf yn barnu rhwng chi ynghylch y y gwnaethoch eu defnyddio i fod yn wahanol.

trans-unit.source: And as for those who disbelieved, I will punish them with a severe punishment in this world and the Hereafter, and they will have no helpers."
trans-unit.target: O ran y rheini a ddysgais, bydd yr cosbi â chosbi difrifol yn y byd hwn a y o hyn ymlaen, a bydd ganddynt unrhyw gynorthwywyr."

trans-unit.source: But as for those who believed and did righteous deeds, He will give them in full their rewards, and Allah does not like the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Ond o ran y rhai sydd yn credu a oedd gweithredoedd cyfiawn, bydd yn rhoi iddynt yn llawn eu gwobrau, ac nad yw Allah yn hoffi y tramgwyddo.

trans-unit.source: This is what We recite to you, [O Muhammad], of [Our] verses and the precise [and wise] message.
trans-unit.target: Dyma beth yr ydym yn ei hadrodd i chi, [O Muhammad], [ein] penillion a neges union [a doeth].

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the example of Jesus to Allah is like that of Adam. He created Him from dust; then He said to him, "Be," and he was.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, yn yr enghraifft o Iesu i Allah fel Adam. Creodd ef o'r llwch; yna Dywedodd wrtho, "Fod yn", ac yr oedd.

trans-unit.source: The truth is from your Lord, so do not be among the doubters.
trans-unit.target: Y gwir yw eich Arglwydd, felly peidiwch â bod ymhlith yr amheuwyr.

trans-unit.source: Then whoever argues with you about it after [this] knowledge has come to you - say, "Come, let us call our sons and your sons, our women and your women, ourselves and yourselves, then supplicate earnestly [together] and invoke the curse of Allah upon the liars [among us]."
trans-unit.target: Yna pwy bynnag yn dadlau â chi amdano ar ôl [hwn] gwybodaeth wedi dod i chi-yn dweud, "dod, gadewch inni alw ein meibion a eich meibion, ein menywod a menywod eich, ein hunain a chi'ch hun, yna supplicate daer [gyda'i gilydd] a galw'r felltith Allah ar celwyddgwn [ymhlith ein]."

trans-unit.source: Indeed, this is the true narration. And there is no deity except Allah. And indeed, Allah is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, dyma y llais wir. Ac nid oes unrhyw Dduwdod ac eithrio Allah. Ac yn wir, Allah yn Exalted yn efallai, yn y doeth.

trans-unit.source: But if they turn away, then indeed - Allah is Knowing of the corrupters.
trans-unit.target: Ond os y maent yn troi i ffwrdd, yn wir-yna Allah yn gwybod y corrupters.

trans-unit.source: Say, "O People of the Scripture, come to a word that is equitable between us and you - that we will not worship except Allah and not associate anything with Him and not take one another as lords instead of Allah." But if they turn away, then say, "Bear witness that we are Muslims [submitting to Him]."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Pobl O ysgrythur, yn dod i'r gair sy'n deg rhwng ni a chi-y byddwn ni addoli ac eithrio Allah ac nid unrhyw beth yn cysylltu ag ef ac nid cymryd un arall fel Arglwyddi yn hytrach na Allah." Ond os y maent yn troi i ffwrdd, wedyn yn dweud, "Yn dwyn tyst yr ydym ar Foslemiaid [cyflwyno iddo]."

trans-unit.source: O People of the Scripture, why do you argue about Abraham while the Torah and the Gospel were not revealed until after him? Then will you not reason?
trans-unit.target: O bobl yr ysgrythur, pam ydych yn dadlau am Abraham tra datgelwyd y Torah ac efengyl nid tan ar ôl iddo? Yna bydd eich nid rheswm?

trans-unit.source: Here you are - those who have argued about that of which you have [some] knowledge, but why do you argue about that of which you have no knowledge? And Allah knows, while you know not.
trans-unit.target: Yma ydych-rhai sydd wedi dadlau am hynny y mae gennych [rai] gwybodaeth, ond pam ydych yn dadlau am hynny y mae gennych unrhyw wybodaeth? A gwyr Allah, tra eich bod yn gwybod nad.

trans-unit.source: Abraham was neither a Jew nor a Christian, but he was one inclining toward truth, a Muslim [submitting to Allah]. And he was not of the polytheists.
trans-unit.target: Abraham oedd Iddew nac yn Gristion, ond yr oedd yn un o inclining tuag at wirionedd, Moslem [cyflwyno i Allah]. Ac nad oedd o y polytheists.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the most worthy of Abraham among the people are those who followed him [in submission to Allah] and this prophet, and those who believe [in his message]. And Allah is the ally of the believers.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, mwyaf o deilwng o Abraham ymhlith y bobl yn rhai sy'n dilyn ef [yn y cyflwyniad i Allah] a'r Proffwyd hwn, a'r rhai sy'n credu [yn ei neges]. Ac Allah yn gynghreiriad y credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: A faction of the people of the Scripture wish they could mislead you. But they do not mislead except themselves, and they perceive [it] not.
trans-unit.target: Carfan o bobl y ysgrythur yn dymuno gellid eu eich camarwain. Ond nad oeddent yn camarwain heblaw hwy eu hunain, ac maent yn teimlo [TG] Nid.

trans-unit.source: O People of the Scripture, why do you disbelieve in the verses of Allah while you witness [to their truth]?
trans-unit.target: O bobl yr ysgrythur, pam a chredu yn y penillion Allah tra byddwch chi'n gweld [at eu gwir]?

trans-unit.source: O People of the Scripture, why do you confuse the truth with falsehood and conceal the truth while you know [it]?
trans-unit.target: O bobl yr ysgrythur, pam a ydych yn drysu rhwng y gwir gyda anwiredd ac gelu gwir er y gwyddoch [TG]?

trans-unit.source: And a faction of the People of the Scripture say [to each other], "Believe in that which was revealed to the believers at the beginning of the day and reject it at its end that perhaps they will abandon their religion,
trans-unit.target: A carfan o bobl yr ysgrythurau dweud [i gilydd], "yn credu yn hynny a datgelwyd i y credinwyr ar ddechrau'r dydd ac yn ei wrthod ar ei ddiwedd y efallai bydd gadael eu crefydd,

trans-unit.source: And do not trust except those who follow your religion." Say, "Indeed, the [true] guidance is the guidance of Allah. [Do you fear] lest someone be given [knowledge] like you were given or that they would [thereby] argue with you before your Lord?" Say, "Indeed, [all] bounty is in the hand of Allah - He grants it to whom He wills. And Allah is all-Encompassing and Wise."
trans-unit.target: Ac nid ymddiried ac eithrio rhai sy'n dilyn eich crefydd. Dweud, "yn wir, mae'r canllawiau [gwir] yn y canllawiau Allah. [A ydych yn ofni] rhag ofn i rywun rhoi [gwybodaeth] fel a roddwyd i chi, neu y byddent yn [ac felly] yn dadlau gyda chi cyn eich Arglwydd? " Dweud, "yn wir, bounty [bob] yn llaw Allah-ef grantiau ei y mae ef yn wills. A Allah hollgynhwysol a doeth.

trans-unit.source: He selects for His mercy whom He wills. And Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
trans-unit.target: Mae ef yn dewis am ei drugaredd ef mae ei wills. Ac y possessor o bounty mawr yn Allah.

trans-unit.source: And among the People of the Scripture is he who, if you entrust him with a great amount [of wealth], he will return it to you. And among them is he who, if you entrust him with a [single] silver coin, he will not return it to you unless you are constantly standing over him [demanding it]. That is because they say, "There is no blame upon us concerning the unlearned." And they speak untruth about Allah while they know [it].
trans-unit.target: Ac ymysg pobl y ysgrythur yn ef a, os mae eich ymddiried iddo gyda swm mawr [o gyfoeth], ef yn ei dychwelyd atoch. Ac yn eu plith mae ef a, os mae eich ymddiried iddo gyda darn arian arian [un], bydd ef nid ei dychwelyd atoch os nad ydych yn gyson yn sefydlog dros ef [anodd]. Mae hynny oherwydd maent yn dweud, "Nid oes unrhyw fai ar inni ynghylch y unlearned." Ac maent yn siarad untruth am Allah tra eu bod yn gwybod [TG].

trans-unit.source: But yes, whoever fulfills his commitment and fears Allah - then indeed, Allah loves those who fear Him.
trans-unit.target: Ond ie, pwy bynnag sy'n cyflawni ei ymrwymiad a'i ofnau Allah-yna yn wir, mae Allah wrth ei bodd rhai sy'n ofni iddo.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who exchange the covenant of Allah and their [own] oaths for a small price will have no share in the Hereafter, and Allah will not speak to them or look at them on the Day of Resurrection, nor will He purify them; and they will have a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, y rhai sydd yn cyfnewid y cyfamod Allah a llwon eu [ei hun] ar gyfer bydd pris bach wedi unrhyw gyfran o hyn ymlaen, ac ni Bydd Allah yn siarad â nhw neu edrych arnynt ar ddiwrnod yr atgyfodiad, nac ef bydd puro'r iddynt; a bydd ganddynt cosb poenus.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, there is among them a party who alter the Scripture with their tongues so you may think it is from the Scripture, but it is not from the Scripture. And they say, "This is from Allah," but it is not from Allah. And they speak untruth about Allah while they know.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, mae yn eu plith plaid sy'n newid yr ysgrythur â eu dafod felly efallai y credwch yn yr ysgrythur, ond nid yw'n gan yr ysgrythurau. Ac maent yn dweud, "Yw hwn gan Allah", ond nid yw'n gan Allah. Ac maent yn siarad untruth am Allah tra eu bod yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: It is not for a human [prophet] that Allah should give him the Scripture and authority and prophethood and then he would say to the people, "Be servants to me rather than Allah," but [instead, he would say], "Be pious scholars of the Lord because of what you have taught of the Scripture and because of what you have studied."
trans-unit.target: Mae'n nid ar gyfer dynol [Proffwyd] y dylai Allah roi iddo yr ysgrythur ac awdurdod a prophethood a wedyn byddai'n dweud y bobl, "yn weision i mi yn hytrach na Allah", ond [yn hytrach, byddai'n dweud], "Yn ysgolheigion duwiol Arglwydd oherwydd beth rydych wedi dysgu o yr ysgrythur ac oherwydd yr hyn yr ydych wedi astudio."

trans-unit.source: Nor could he order you to take the angels and prophets as lords. Would he order you to disbelief after you had been Muslims?
trans-unit.target: Ac ni allai ei Gorchymyn ichi gymryd y angylion a'r proffwydi fel Arglwyddi. Byddai'n Gorchymyn chi i anghrediniaeth ar ôl ichi oedd Foslemiaid?

trans-unit.source: And [recall, O People of the Scripture], when Allah took the covenant of the prophets, [saying], "Whatever I give you of the Scripture and wisdom and then there comes to you a messenger confirming what is with you, you [must] believe in him and support him." [Allah] said, "Have you acknowledged and taken upon that My commitment?" They said, "We have acknowledged it." He said, "Then bear witness, and I am with you among the witnesses."
trans-unit.target: A [gof, O bobl yr ysgrythur], pan gymerodd Allah y cyfamod y proffwydi, [dweud], 'beth bynnag roi ichi o'r ysgrythur a doethineb ac yna daw i chi negesydd cadarnhau beth yw gyda chi, chi [Rhaid] yn credu mewn iddo a chefnogi ef." [Allah] yn dweud, "Ydych chi wedi cydnabod ac wedi fy ymrwymiad ar hynny?" Maent yn dweud, "yr ydym wedi cydnabod hynny." Meddai, "yna yn dwyn tyst, ac yr wyf gyda chi ymysg y tystion."

trans-unit.source: And whoever turned away after that - they were the defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: A pwy bynnag droi i ffwrdd ar ôl hynny-yn defiantly anufudd.

trans-unit.source: So is it other than the religion of Allah they desire, while to Him have submitted [all] those within the heavens and earth, willingly or by compulsion, and to Him they will be returned?
trans-unit.target: Felly onid yw'n heblaw crefydd Allah maent yn eu dymuno, er iddo ef wedi cyflwyno [holl] hynny o fewn y nefoedd a'r ddaear, o'i wirfodd neu drwy orfodaeth, ac iddo cânt eu dychwelyd?

trans-unit.source: Say, "We have believed in Allah and in what was revealed to us and what was revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and the Descendants, and in what was given to Moses and Jesus and to the prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and we are Muslims [submitting] to Him."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "yr ydym yn credu yn Allah hyn a ddatgelwyd i ni a'r hyn a ddatgelwyd i Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, a disgynyddion, ac yn beth a roddwyd i Moses a Iesu a y proffwydi gan eu yr Arglwydd. Yr ydym yn gwneud unrhyw wahaniaeth rhwng unrhyw un ohonynt, ac rydym yn Foslemiaid [cyflwyno] iddo ef."

trans-unit.source: And whoever desires other than Islam as religion - never will it be accepted from him, and he, in the Hereafter, will be among the losers.
trans-unit.target: A pwy bynnag sy'n dymuno heblaw Islam fel crefydd-byth y caiff ei dderbyn ganddo ef, ac o hyn ymlaen, bydd ef, yn ymhlith y rhai ar eu colled.

trans-unit.source: How shall Allah guide a people who disbelieved after their belief and had witnessed that the Messenger is true and clear signs had come to them? And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
trans-unit.target: Sut bydd Allah yn tywys pobl sydd wedi bod yn dyst bod y negesydd yn wir ac roedd arwyddion clir wedi dod â nhw a ddysgais ar ôl eu cred? Ac nid yw Allah yn arwain y bobl gamwedd.

trans-unit.source: Those - their recompense will be that upon them is the curse of Allah and the angels and the people, all together,
trans-unit.target: Bydd rhai-eu iawndal yn bod arnynt yn y felltith Allah ac angylion a'r bobl, gyd gyda'i gilydd,

trans-unit.source: Abiding eternally therein. The punishment will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved.
trans-unit.target: Ufudd i'r fythol ynddo. Bydd y gosb yn ysgafnhau nid ar eu cyfer, ac ni fydd eu reprieved.

trans-unit.source: Except for those who repent after that and correct themselves. For indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ac eithrio ar gyfer y rhai sydd yn edifarhau ar ôl hynny a cywiro eu hunain. Yn wir, Allah yn Forgiving ac yn Merciful.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who reject the message after their belief and then increase in disbelief - never will their [claimed] repentance be accepted, and they are the ones astray.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, y rhai sydd yn gwrthod y neges ar ôl eu cred ac yna cynyddu mewn anghrediniaeth-byth y bydd eu pedair [oedd] yn cael eu derbyn, ac maent yn y rhai ar gyfeiliorn.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who disbelieve and die while they are disbelievers - never would the [whole] capacity of the earth in gold be accepted from one of them if he would [seek to] ransom himself with it. For those there will be a painful punishment, and they will have no helpers.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, y rhai a chredu ac yn marw tra eu bod yn disbelievers-byth y byddai derbyn y gallu [gyfan] y ddaear mewn aur o un ohonynt os byddai [ceisio] wystlon ei hun â hi. Ar gyfer y rhai y bydd yn cosbi poenus, a bydd ganddynt unrhyw gynorthwywyr.

trans-unit.source: Never will you attain the good [reward] until you spend [in the way of Allah] from that which you love. And whatever you spend - indeed, Allah is Knowing of it.
trans-unit.target: Byth bydd eich cyrraedd da [gwobr] hyd nes y byddwch yn ei wario [rhwystro Allah] a ydych yn eu caru. A beth bynnag eich gwariant-yn wir, yw Allah yn gwybod amdano.

trans-unit.source: All food was lawful to the Children of Israel except what Israel had made unlawful to himself before the Torah was revealed. Say, [O Muhammad], "So bring the Torah and recite it, if you should be truthful."
trans-unit.target: Oedd y bwyd i gyd yn gyfreithlon i blant Israel ac eithrio beth Israel wedi gwneud anghyfreithlon ei hun cyn datgelwyd y Torah. Dweud, [O Muhammad], "Felly ddwyn y Torah a'i hadrodd, os y dylech fod yn onest."

trans-unit.source: And whoever invents about Allah untruth after that - then those are [truly] the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: A dyfeisio pwy bynnag am Allah untruth ar ôl hynny-yna yn rhai [yn wir] y tramgwyddo.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Allah has told the truth. So follow the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth; and he was not of the polytheists."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Mae Allah wedi dweud y gwir. Felly yn dilyn crefydd o Abraham, inclining tuag at wirionedd; ac nid oedd o y polytheists.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the first House [of worship] established for mankind was that at Makkah - blessed and a guidance for the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, y Tŷ cyntaf [o addoli] a sefydlwyd ar gyfer dynolryw oedd ar blentyndod-bendithio a canllawiau ar gyfer y byd.

trans-unit.source: In it are clear signs [such as] the standing place of Abraham. And whoever enters it shall be safe. And [due] to Allah from the people is a pilgrimage to the House - for whoever is able to find thereto a way. But whoever disbelieves - then indeed, Allah is free from need of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Yn ei arwyddion clir [fel] lle sefydlog Abraham. A fydd pwy bynnag sy'n dod i mewn yn ddiogel. A [fod] i Allah gan bobl yw pererindod i'r tŷ-pwy bynnag sydd yn gallu dod o hyd i ffordd iddi. Ond pwy bynnag a disbelieves-yna yn wir, yn rhydd o angen o fyd Allah.

trans-unit.source: Say, "O People of the Scripture, why do you disbelieve in the verses of Allah while Allah is Witness over what you do?"
trans-unit.target: Yn dweud, 'O bobl o'r ysgrythur, pam a chredu yn y penillion Allah er bod Allah yn dyst dros beth yr ydych yn ei wneud?'

trans-unit.source: Say, "O People of the Scripture, why do you avert from the way of Allah those who believe, seeking to make it [seem] deviant, while you are witnesses [to the truth]? And Allah is not unaware of what you do."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "pobl O ysgrythur, pam ydych chi osgoi o'r ffordd o Allah rhai sy'n credu, yn ceisio gwneud ei [ymddangos] gwyrdröedig, tra ydych dystion [gwir]? Ac nid yw Allah yn ymwybodol o'r hyn yr ydych yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, if you obey a party of those who were given the Scripture, they would turn you back, after your belief, [to being] unbelievers.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, os yw eich bod yn ufuddhau yn blaid rheini y rhoddwyd yr ysgrythur, byddai droi eich ôl, ar ôl eich cred, [i] unbelievers.

trans-unit.source: And how could you disbelieve while to you are being recited the verses of Allah and among you is His Messenger? And whoever holds firmly to Allah has [indeed] been guided to a straight path.
trans-unit.target: A sut y gallai chredu er i chi ei roi y penillion Allah ac ymhlith chi yw ei negesydd? A pwy bynnag sy'n dal yn gadarn i Allah [yn wir] wedi'i harwain i lwybr syth.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, fear Allah as He should be feared and do not die except as Muslims [in submission to Him].
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, ofn Allah fel y dylai ef yn ofni ac yn wneud yn marw ac eithrio fel Moslemiaid [yn y cyflwyniad iddo].

trans-unit.source: And hold firmly to the rope of Allah all together and do not become divided. And remember the favor of Allah upon you - when you were enemies and He brought your hearts together and you became, by His favor, brothers. And you were on the edge of a pit of the Fire, and He saved you from it. Thus does Allah make clear to you His verses that you may be guided.
trans-unit.target: A gynnal gadarn y rhaff Allah gyda'i gilydd ac nid oes yn cael ei rannu. A chofiwch favor Allah arnoch-pan oeddech yn elynion a daeth eich calonnau ynghyd a ddaethoch, gan ei favor, brodyr. A oeddech chi ar ymyl y pwll y tân, a achubodd chi ohono. Felly yw Allah gwneud yn glir i chi ei penillion y gall eich harwain.

trans-unit.source: And let there be [arising] from you a nation inviting to [all that is] good, enjoining what is right and forbidding what is wrong, and those will be the successful.
trans-unit.target: A gadewch yno yn [deillio] eich gwahodd genedl i [popeth], enjoining beth sy'n iawn a da Rhestra beth sydd o'i le, a rhai y bydd yn llwyddiannus.

trans-unit.source: And do not be like the ones who became divided and differed after the clear proofs had come to them. And those will have a great punishment.
trans-unit.target: A Peidiwch â bod fel y rhai a daeth yn rhannu ac yn wahanol ar ôl Roedd y proflenni glir yn dod iddynt. A bydd rhai yn cael cosb mawr.

trans-unit.source: On the Day [some] faces will turn white and [some] faces will turn black. As for those whose faces turn black, [to them it will be said], "Did you disbelieve after your belief? Then taste the punishment for what you used to reject."
trans-unit.target: Ar y diwrnod y bydd wynebau [rai] droi Gwyn a bydd wynebau [rai] ddu. O ran y rhai sy'n troi eu hwynebau duon, [iddynt bydd dweud], "oedd eich chredu ar ôl eich cred? Yna flas y gosb ar gyfer beth yr ydych yn ei defnyddio i wrthod."

trans-unit.source: But as for those whose faces will turn white, [they will be] within the mercy of Allah. They will abide therein eternally.
trans-unit.target: Ond fel yn achos rhai bydd yn troi eu hwynebau Gwyn, [fydd] o fewn drugaredd Allah. Bydd maent yn glynu ynddo fythol.

trans-unit.source: These are the verses of Allah. We recite them to you, [O Muhammad], in truth; and Allah wants no injustice to the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Mae'r rhain yn y penillion Allah. Rydym yn eu hadrodd i chi, [O Muhammad], mewn gwirionedd; ac mae Allah am unrhyw anghyfiawnder i fyd.

trans-unit.source: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And to Allah will [all] matters be returned.
trans-unit.target: Allah yn perthyn iddo beth bynnag yn y nefoedd a beth bynnag sydd ar y ddaear. A bydd materion [bob] yn cael eu dychwelyd i Allah.

trans-unit.source: You are the best nation produced [as an example] for mankind. You enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong and believe in Allah. If only the People of the Scripture had believed, it would have been better for them. Among them are believers, but most of them are defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: Yr ydych yn y genedl gorau a gynhyrchwyd [fel enghraifft] ar gyfer dynolryw. Rydych yn enjoin hyn sydd yn iawn a a'n gwaredo beth sydd o'i le ac yn credu mewn Allah. Os mai dim ond roedd pobl y ysgrythur yn credu, byddai wedi bod yn well iddynt. Yn eu plith mae credinwyr, ond mae'r rhan fwyaf ohonynt yn defiantly anufudd.

trans-unit.source: They will not harm you except for [some] annoyance. And if they fight you, they will show you their backs; then they will not be aided.
trans-unit.target: Ni bydd niwed chi ac eithrio [rai] annifyrrwch. Ac os byddant yn ei hymladd chi, maent yn dangos eu cefnau; chi yna bydd iddynt nad yw fod o gymorth.

trans-unit.source: They have been put under humiliation [by Allah] wherever they are overtaken, except for a covenant from Allah and a rope from the Muslims. And they have drawn upon themselves anger from Allah and have been put under destitution. That is because they disbelieved in the verses of Allah and killed the prophets without right. That is because they disobeyed and [habitually] transgressed.
trans-unit.target: Mae maent wedi'u rhoi dan waradwydd [gan Allah] lle bynnag y maent yn goddiweddyd, ac eithrio Cyfamod gan Allah a rhaff gan y Mwslimiaid. Ac maent wedi tynnu arnynt eu hunain dicter gan Allah ac wedi'u rhoi dan amddifadedd. Mae hynny oherwydd maent yn ddysgais yn y penillion Allah ac yn lladd y proffwydi heb hawl. Mae hynny oherwydd maent yn disobeyed ac yn camweddu [yn gyson].

trans-unit.source: They are not [all] the same; among the People of the Scripture is a community standing [in obedience], reciting the verses of Allah during periods of the night and prostrating [in prayer].
trans-unit.target: Nid ydynt [bob] yr un peth; ymysg pobl y ysgrythur yn gymuned sefydlog [mewn ufudddod], adrodd penillion Allah yn ystod cyfnodau y nos a prostrating [yn gweddi].

trans-unit.source: They believe in Allah and the Last Day, and they enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong and hasten to good deeds. And those are among the righteous.
trans-unit.target: Credant yn Allah ac yn y dydd diwethaf, a enjoin beth sy'n iawn a a'n gwaredo beth sydd o'i le maent a brysuro i weithredoedd da. A rhai ymhlith y righteous.

trans-unit.source: And whatever good they do - never will it be removed from them. And Allah is Knowing of the righteous.
trans-unit.target: Da beth bynnag a wnânt-byth y bydd cael gwared ohonynt. A gwybod y righteous yw Allah.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who disbelieve - never will their wealth or their children avail them against Allah at all, and those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, rhai a chredu-byth bydd eu cyfoeth neu mae eu plant fanteisio ar iddynt erbyn Allah o gwbl, ac mae'r rheini'n cymdeithion y tân; Bydd maent yn glynu ynddo fythol.

trans-unit.source: The example of what they spend in this worldly life is like that of a wind containing frost which strikes the harvest of a people who have wronged themselves and destroys it. And Allah has not wronged them, but they wrong themselves.
trans-unit.target: Enghraifft o'r hyn y gallant ei wario yn y bywyd worldly hwn fel y gwynt sy'n cynnwys frost sydd yn taro y cynhaeaf o bobl sydd wedi cam eu hunain a ei ddinistrio. Ac wedi Allah Nid cam iddynt, ond mae rhywbeth o'i le eu hunain.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not take as intimates those other than yourselves, for they will not spare you [any] ruin. They wish you would have hardship. Hatred has already appeared from their mouths, and what their breasts conceal is greater. We have certainly made clear to you the signs, if you will use reason.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, nid cymryd fel intimates heblaw eich hunain, y rhai nid ydynt chi sbario [unrhyw] adfail. Dymunant byddai gennych caledi. Mae casineb eisoes wedi ymddangos o eu cegau, a beth y mae eu bronnau yn ei guddio yn fwy. Rydym yn sicr wedi clir i chi yr arwyddion, os byddwch yn defnyddio'r rheswm.

trans-unit.source: Here you are loving them but they are not loving you, while you believe in the Scripture - all of it. And when they meet you, they say, "We believe." But when they are alone, they bite their fingertips at you in rage. Say, "Die in your rage. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts."
trans-unit.target: Yma y mae yn eu caru, ond nid ydynt yn caru chi, tra ydych yn credu yn yr ysgrythur-i gyd. A pan fyddant yn bodloni chi, maent yn dweud, "Rydym yn credu." Ond pan fyddant yn unig, mae brathu eu bysedd chi mewn dicter. Dweud, "yn eich dicter yn marw. Yn wir, Allah yn gwybod hynny o fewn y bronnau.

trans-unit.source: If good touches you, it distresses them; but if harm strikes you, they rejoice at it. And if you are patient and fear Allah, their plot will not harm you at all. Indeed, Allah is encompassing of what they do.
trans-unit.target: Os mae'r da yn cyffwrdd chi, mae yn distresses iddynt; ond os mae niwed sy'n eich taro, yn llawenhau yn ei. A os ydych yn glaf, ac yn ofni Allah, bydd eu plot nid ydych niwed o gwbl. Yn wir, yw Allah sy'n cwmpasu o'r hyn y maent yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: And [remember] when you, [O Muhammad], left your family in the morning to post the believers at their stations for the battle [of Uhud] - and Allah is Hearing and Knowing -
trans-unit.target: A [gofio] pan adawodd eich teulu chi, [O Muhammad], yn y bore i post y credinwyr yn eu gorsafoedd ar gyfer brwydr [Uhud]-ac Allah yw gwrandawiad a gwybod-

trans-unit.source: When two parties among you were about to lose courage, but Allah was their ally; and upon Allah the believers should rely.
trans-unit.target: Pan mae'r ddwy blaid ymhlith yr oeddech ar fin colli dewrder, ond Allah oedd eu cynghreiriad; a dylai y credinwyr yn dibynnu ar Allah.

trans-unit.source: And already had Allah given you victory at [the battle of] Badr while you were few in number. Then fear Allah; perhaps you will be grateful.
trans-unit.target: Ac eisoes wedi Allah rhoi ichi buddugoliaeth ar [brwydr] Badr tra oeddech ychydig mewn nifer. Yna ofn Allah; Efallai y byddwch yn ddiolchgar.

trans-unit.source: [Remember] when you said to the believers, "Is it not sufficient for you that your Lord should reinforce you with three thousand angels sent down?
trans-unit.target: [Cofiwch] pan ddywedasoch i y credinwyr, "ai nid yw'n ddigonol i chi a dylai eich Arglwydd yn atgyfnerthu eich gyda'r angylion tair mil a anfonwyd i lawr?

trans-unit.source: Yes, if you remain patient and conscious of Allah and the enemy come upon you [attacking] in rage, your Lord will reinforce you with five thousand angels having marks [of distinction]
trans-unit.target: Ie, os ydych yn parhau i fod yn amyneddgar ac yn ymwybodol o'r Allah a bod y gelyn yn dod i chi ymosod yn [ar] mewn dicter, bydd eich Arglwydd yn atgyfnerthu'r chi gyda'r angylion bum mil yn cael marciau [o'r gwahaniaeth]

trans-unit.source: And Allah made it not except as [a sign of] good tidings for you and to reassure your hearts thereby. And victory is not except from Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise -
trans-unit.target: A gwnaeth Allah yn ddim heblaw fel [arwydd o] tidings da i chi ac i dawelu meddwl eich calonnau ac felly. Ac nid yw buddugoliaeth ac eithrio gan Allah, Exalted yn efallai, yn y doeth-

trans-unit.source: That He might cut down a section of the disbelievers or suppress them so that they turn back disappointed.
trans-unit.target: Efallai fod torri adran o y disbelievers neu guddio iddynt fel y byddant yn troi yn ôl yn siomedig.

trans-unit.source: Not for you, [O Muhammad, but for Allah], is the decision whether He should [cut them down] or forgive them or punish them, for indeed, they are wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Nid i chi, [O Muhammad, ond i Allah], mae y benderfyniad a dylai fod [Torri i lawr] neu maddau iddynt neu cosbi, yn wir, eu bod yn tramgwyddo.

trans-unit.source: And to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: A Allah yn perthyn iddo beth bynnag yn y nefoedd a beth bynnag sydd ar y ddaear. Mae ef yn maddau bwy mae'n wills ac yn cosbi bwy mae ef wills. Ac Allah yn Forgiving a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not consume usury, doubled and multiplied, but fear Allah that you may be successful.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, nad ydynt yn yfed usury, dyblu a lluosi, ond ofn Allah y gallech fod yn llwyddiannus.

trans-unit.source: And fear the Fire, which has been prepared for the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Ac ofn y tân, a baratowyd ar gyfer y disbelievers.

trans-unit.source: And obey Allah and the Messenger that you may obtain mercy.
trans-unit.target: Ac ufuddhau Allah ac y negesydd y gallwch gael drugaredd.

trans-unit.source: And hasten to forgiveness from your Lord and a garden as wide as the heavens and earth, prepared for the righteous
trans-unit.target: A brysuro i maddeuant gan eich Arglwydd a gardd mor eang ag y nefoedd a'r ddaear, yn barod ar gyfer y righteous

trans-unit.source: Who spend [in the cause of Allah] during ease and hardship and who restrain anger and who pardon the people - and Allah loves the doers of good;
trans-unit.target: Sy'n treulio [yn achos Allah] ystod hwylustod a chaledi a sy'n atal dicter ac sy'n maddeuwch y bobl-a Mae Allah yn dwlu phoenwn da;

trans-unit.source: And those who, when they commit an immorality or wrong themselves [by transgression], remember Allah and seek forgiveness for their sins - and who can forgive sins except Allah? - and [who] do not persist in what they have done while they know.
trans-unit.target: A'r rhai sydd, pan fyddant yn ymrwymo anfoesoldeb neu anghywir eu hunain [erbyn tresmasiad], cofio Allah a cheisio maddeuant am eu pechodau-ac sy'n gallu maddau pechodau ac eithrio Allah? -ac nid oes [sydd] barhau yn hyn y maent wedi ei wneud tra eu bod yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: Those - their reward is forgiveness from their Lord and gardens beneath which rivers flow [in Paradise], wherein they will abide eternally; and excellent is the reward of the [righteous] workers.
trans-unit.target: Rhai-eu gwobr yw maddeuant gan eu Arglwydd a gerddi o dan y llif afonydd [yn baradwys], lle y bydd eu glynu fythol; a rhagorol yw gwobrwyo gweithwyr [hoes dabloid].

trans-unit.source: Similar situations [as yours] have passed on before you, so proceed throughout the earth and observe how was the end of those who denied.
trans-unit.target: Sefyllfaoedd tebyg [fel eich un chi] trosglwyddo cyn i chi, felly fwrw ymlaen drwy gydol y ddaear ac arsylwi sut yr oedd diwedd y rhai sy'n gwrthod.

trans-unit.source: This [Qur'an] is a clear statement to [all] the people and a guidance and instruction for those conscious of Allah.
trans-unit.target: Hwn [Qur'an] yw datganiad clir i [] bawb a'r canllawiau a chyfarwyddiadau ar gyfer hynny ymwybodol Allah.

trans-unit.source: So do not weaken and do not grieve, and you will be superior if you are [true] believers.
trans-unit.target: Felly beidio â gwanhau ac nid oes grieve, ac y bydd uwch os ydych yn [gwir] credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: If a wound should touch you - there has already touched the [opposing] people a wound similar to it. And these days [of varying conditions] We alternate among the people so that Allah may make evident those who believe and [may] take to Himself from among you martyrs - and Allah does not like the wrongdoers -
trans-unit.target: Os dylai briw yn cyffwrdd chi-Mae eisoes wedi cyffwrdd pobl [croes] briw tebyg iddo. A y dyddiau hyn [amrywio amodau] bob yn ail rydym ymhlith y bobl fel y gall Allah wneud amlwg rhai sy'n credu ac [Gall] gymryd ei hun o blith merthyron chi-a nid Allah yn hoffi y tramgwyddo-

trans-unit.source: And that Allah may purify the believers [through trials] and destroy the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: A bod Allah puro'r credinwyr [drwy dreialon] a dinistrio y disbelievers.

trans-unit.source: Or do you think that you will enter Paradise while Allah has not yet made evident those of you who fight in His cause and made evident those who are steadfast?
trans-unit.target: Neu a ydych yn credu y byddwch yn cychwyn baradwys er nad yw eto wedi Allah yn gwneud amlwg rhai ohonoch sydd yn ymladd yn ei achosi ac yn gwneud yn amlwg rhai sy'n gadarn?

trans-unit.source: And you had certainly wished for martyrdom before you encountered it, and you have [now] seen it [before you] while you were looking on.
trans-unit.target: Ac wedi dymuno am martyrdom yn sicr cyn ichi wynebodd ei, a ydych chi wedi gweld ei [yn awr] [cyn i chi] tra oeddech chi am chwilio.

trans-unit.source: Muhammad is not but a messenger. [Other] messengers have passed on before him. So if he was to die or be killed, would you turn back on your heels [to unbelief]? And he who turns back on his heels will never harm Allah at all; but Allah will reward the grateful.
trans-unit.target: Nid yw Muhammad ond negesydd. Mae negeswyr [arall] wedi pasio cyn iddo. Felly os oedd yn farw neu gael eu lladd, byddai chi droi yn ôl ar eich sodlau [i'r unbelief]? A byth ef a troi yn ôl ar ei sodlau niwed Allah bob; ond bydd Allah yn gwobrwyo y ddiolchgar.

trans-unit.source: And it is not [possible] for one to die except by permission of Allah at a decree determined. And whoever desires the reward of this world - We will give him thereof; and whoever desires the reward of the Hereafter - We will give him thereof. And we will reward the grateful.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid yw'n [bosibl] i un farw heblaw drwy ganiatâd Allah yn ordinhad yn benderfynol. A pwy bynnag sy'n dymuno y wobr y byd hwn-byddwn yn rhoi iddo a pwy bynnag sy'n dymuno gwobrwyo o hyn ymlaen-byddwn yn rhoi iddo ohono. A byddwn yn gwobrwyo y ddiolchgar.

trans-unit.source: And how many a prophet [fought and] with him fought many religious scholars. But they never lost assurance due to what afflicted them in the cause of Allah, nor did they weaken or submit. And Allah loves the steadfast.
trans-unit.target: A faint o Proffwyd [ymladd a] gydag ef ymladd llawer o ysgolheigion crefyddol. Ond byddent byth yn colli sicrwydd oherwydd hyn yn eu dioddef yn achos Allah, nac oedd eu gwanhau neu gyflwyno. Ac mae Allah wrth ei bodd y gadarn.

trans-unit.source: And their words were not but that they said, "Our Lord, forgive us our sins and the excess [committed] in our affairs and plant firmly our feet and give us victory over the disbelieving people."
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oedd eu geiriau ond bod nhw'n dweud, "Mae ein Arglwydd, maddau inni ein pechodau a gormodedd [ymrwymo] yn ein materion blannu gadarn ein traed a rhoi inni fuddugoliaeth dros y bobl disbelieving."

trans-unit.source: So Allah gave them the reward of this world and the good reward of the Hereafter. And Allah loves the doers of good.
trans-unit.target: Felly Allah Rhoddodd y wobr y byd hwn a gwobrwyo da o y o hyn ymlaen. Ac mae Allah yn dwlu phoenwn da.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, if you obey those who disbelieve, they will turn you back on your heels, and you will [then] become losers.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, os yw eich bod yn ufuddhau rhai a chredu, bydd droi eich ôl ar eich sodlau, ac [yna] byddwch yn dod ar eu colled.

trans-unit.source: But Allah is your protector, and He is the best of helpers.
trans-unit.target: Ond Allah yn eich protector, ac ef yw'r gorau o gynorthwywyr.

trans-unit.source: We will cast terror into the hearts of those who disbelieve for what they have associated with Allah of which He had not sent down [any] authority. And their refuge will be the Fire, and wretched is the residence of the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Bydd yn bwrw terfysg calonnau o'r rhai a chredu am beth maent wedi sy'n gysylltiedig ag Allah sydd wedi anfon nid i lawr [unrhyw] awdurdod. A bydd eu lloches yn y tân, a truenus yn breswylfa y tramgwyddo.

trans-unit.source: And Allah had certainly fulfilled His promise to you when you were killing the enemy by His permission until [the time] when you lost courage and fell to disputing about the order [given by the Prophet] and disobeyed after He had shown you that which you love. Among you are some who desire this world, and among you are some who desire the Hereafter. Then he turned you back from them [defeated] that He might test you. And He has already forgiven you, and Allah is the possessor of bounty for the believers.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn sicr roedd Allah yn cyflawni ei addewid i chi pan ydych yn lladd y gelyn gan ei ganiatâd tan [amser] pan ydych colli dewrder a gostyngodd i amau ynghylch y Gorchymyn [a roddir gan y Proffwyd] a disobeyed ar ôl ei fod wedi dangos chi sydd wrth eich bodd. Ymhlith eich awydd rhai sydd yn y byd hwn, ac ymhlith eich awydd rhai y o hyn ymlaen. Yna trodd eich ôl oddi wrthynt [trechu] y gallai ei fod yn profi chi. Ac wedi maddau ichi eisoes, a Allah yw y possessor o'r bounty y credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: [Remember] when you [fled and] climbed [the mountain] without looking aside at anyone while the Messenger was calling you from behind. So Allah repaid you with distress upon distress so you would not grieve for that which had escaped you [of victory and spoils of war] or [for] that which had befallen you [of injury and death]. And Allah is [fully] Acquainted with what you do.
trans-unit.target: [Cofiwch] pan chi [dianc a] dringo [y Mynydd] heb edrych ar unrhyw un o'r neilltu tra oedd y negesydd yn galw chi o'r tu ôl. Felly roedd Allah ad-dalu eich gyda gofid ar drallod felly byddai ydych nid galaru am sydd wedi dianc chi [o fuddugoliaeth ac ysbail rhyfel] neu [am] sydd wedi taro chi [o anafiadau a marwolaethau]. A yw Allah [llawn] yn gyfarwydd â beth yr ydych yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: Then after distress, He sent down upon you security [in the form of] drowsiness, overcoming a faction of you, while another faction worried about themselves, thinking of Allah other than the truth - the thought of ignorance, saying, "Is there anything for us [to have done] in this matter?" Say, "Indeed, the matter belongs completely to Allah." They conceal within themselves what they will not reveal to you. They say, "If there was anything we could have done in the matter, some of us would not have been killed right here." Say, "Even if you had been inside your houses, those decreed to be killed would have come out to their death beds." [It was] so that Allah might test what is in your breasts and purify what is in your hearts. And Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts.
trans-unit.target: Yna ar ôl trallod, anfonodd ef i lawr ar eich diogelwch [ar ffurf] syrthni, goresgyn carfan, chi, tra bod y garfan arall yn poeni am eu hunain, meddwl Allah heblaw y gwir-y syniad o anwybodaeth, yn dweud, "oes unrhyw beth i ni [wedi] yn y mater hwn?" Dweud, "Yn wir, mae'r mater yn perthyn llwyr i Allah." Eu bod yn cuddio'r o fewn eu hunain beth nad ydynt yn bydd datgelu i chi. Maent yn dweud, "Os oedd unrhyw beth y gallem fod wedi gwneud yn y mater, byddai rhai ohonom ni wedi cael eu lladd yma." Dweud, "hyd yn oed os oeddech wedi eich tai y tu mewn, roedd y rhai a ddyfarnwyd i gael eu lladd wedi dod allan i welyau eu marwolaeth." [Ydoedd] fel y gallai Allah brofi beth sydd yn eich bronnau a puro'r beth sydd yn eich calonnau. Ac Allah yn gwybod hynny o fewn y bronnau.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those of you who turned back on the day the two armies met, it was Satan who caused them to slip because of some [blame] they had earned. But Allah has already forgiven them. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Forbearing.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, y rhai ohonoch sy'n troi'n ôl ar ddiwrnod y byddinoedd dau gyfarfod, yr oedd Satan sy'n achosi iddynt lithro oherwydd rhai [bai] oedd eu bod yn ennill. Ond mae'r Allah yn maddau iddynt eisoes. Yn wir, Allah yn Forgiving a Forbearing.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not be like those who disbelieved and said about their brothers when they traveled through the land or went out to fight, "If they had been with us, they would not have died or have been killed," so Allah makes that [misconception] a regret within their hearts. And it is Allah who gives life and causes death, and Allah is Seeing of what you do.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, peidiwch â bod fel y rheini a ddywedodd am eu brodyr, pan fyddant yn un drwy y tir neu yn mynd i ymladd, "Pe baent wedi bod gyda ni, byddai eu nid wedi marw neu wedi cael eu lladd" a ddysgais, felly mae'r Allah yn gwneud [camsyniad] gofid o fewn eu calonnau. Ac mae'n Allah sy'n rhoi bywyd ac achosi marwolaeth, ac yn Allah yn gweld yr hyn yr ydych yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: And if you are killed in the cause of Allah or die - then forgiveness from Allah and mercy are better than whatever they accumulate [in this world].
trans-unit.target: Ac os lleddir ydych yn achos Allah neu marw-maddeuant gan Allah a drugaredd yn well na beth bynnag y maent yn ei greu [yn y byd hwn].

trans-unit.source: And whether you die or are killed, unto Allah you will be gathered.
trans-unit.target: A a ydych yn marw neu'n cael eu lladd,-unto Allah bydd eich casglu.

trans-unit.source: So by mercy from Allah, [O Muhammad], you were lenient with them. And if you had been rude [in speech] and harsh in heart, they would have disbanded from about you. So pardon them and ask forgiveness for them and consult them in the matter. And when you have decided, then rely upon Allah. Indeed, Allah loves those who rely [upon Him].
trans-unit.target: Felly gan drugaredd oddi wrth Allah, [O Muhammad], yr oeddech yn llym â nhw. Ac os oeddech wedi anghwrtais [yn araith] a llym yn y galon, byddai wedi chwalu gan amdanoch chi. Felly maddeuwch iddynt ofyn maddeuant iddynt ac ymgynghori â hwy yn y mater. A pan ydych wedi penderfynu, yn dibynnu wedyn ar Allah. Yn wir, mae Allah wrth fodd rhai sy'n dibynnu [arno].

trans-unit.source: If Allah should aid you, no one can overcome you; but if He should forsake you, who is there that can aid you after Him? And upon Allah let the believers rely.
trans-unit.target: Nid oes unrhyw un os dylai Allah yn gymorth ichi, gellir goresgyn chi; ond os dylai iddo gefnu ar chi, pwy sydd y gall fod o gymorth ichi ar ôl iddo? A gadewch Allah Mae y credinwyr yn dibynnu arnynt.

trans-unit.source: It is not [attributable] to any prophet that he would act unfaithfully [in regard to war booty]. And whoever betrays, [taking unlawfully], will come with what he took on the Day of Resurrection. Then will every soul be [fully] compensated for what it earned, and they will not be wronged.
trans-unit.target: Nid yw unrhyw Proffwyd y byddai'n gweithredu unfaithfully [o ran rhyfel booty] [priodoli]. Ac wedi bradychu pwy bynnag, [cymryd yn anghyfreithlon], bydd yn dod â beth a aeth ar dydd atgyfodi. Yna bydd pob enaid gael [] eu digolledu'n llawn am beth y mae'n ei ennill, ac ni Bydd maent yn cam.

trans-unit.source: So is one who pursues the pleasure of Allah like one who brings upon himself the anger of Allah and whose refuge is Hell? And wretched is the destination.
trans-unit.target: Felly, yn un sy'n mynd ar drywydd y pleser o Allah fel un sydd yn dwyn ar ei hun y dicter Allah ac mae eu lloches yn uffern? A truenus yn y gyrchfan.

trans-unit.source: They are [varying] degrees in the sight of Allah, and Allah is Seeing of whatever they do.
trans-unit.target: Maent yn [] amrywiol yn y golwg Allah, a yw Allah yn gweld o beth bynnag y maent yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: Certainly did Allah confer [great] favor upon the believers when He sent among them a Messenger from themselves, reciting to them His verses and purifying them and teaching them the Book and wisdom, although they had been before in manifest error.
trans-unit.target: Yn sicr oedd Allah yn rhoi [iawn] favor ar y credinwyr pan anfonodd ef yn eu plith negesydd eu hunain, gan adrodd iddynt ei penillion a phwmpio iddynt a'u haddysgu y llyfr a doethineb, er eu bod wedi bod cyn mewn camgymeriad amlwg.

trans-unit.source: Why [is it that] when a [single] disaster struck you [on the day of Uhud], although you had struck [the enemy in the battle of Badr] with one twice as great, you said, "From where is this?" Say, "It is from yourselves." Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: Pam [ydyw y] pan roedd yn drychineb [un] taro chi [ar y diwrnod o Uhud], er wedi ichi daro'r [y gelyn yn y frwydr o Badr] gydag un ddwywaith mor fawr, dywedodd, "o ble mae hwn?" Dweud, "Mae'n o eich hunain." Yn wir, yw Allah dros holl bethau yn gymwys.

trans-unit.source: And what struck you on the day the two armies met was by permission of Allah that He might make evident the [true] believers.
trans-unit.target: A beth taro chi ar y diwrnod y byddinoedd dau bodloni drwy ganiatâd Allah y gallai gwneud amlwg y credinwyr [gwir].

trans-unit.source: And that He might make evident those who are hypocrites. For it was said to them, "Come, fight in the way of Allah or [at least] defend." They said, "If we had known [there would be] fighting, we would have followed you." They were nearer to disbelief that day than to faith, saying with their mouths what was not in their hearts. And Allah is most Knowing of what they conceal -
trans-unit.target: Ac y gallai wneud amlwg sydd yn rhagrithwyr. Ar ei gyfer a ddywedodd iddynt, "Dod, ymladd rhwystro Allah neu amddiffyn [o leiaf]." Dywedodd, "pe byddem wedi gwybod [Bydd] ymladd, byddai wedi dilyn chi." Roeddent yn nes at anghrediniaeth y diwrnod hwnnw na ffydd, â'u cegau yn dweud nad oedd hyn yn eu calonnau. A Allah yn gwybod fwyaf o beth y maent yn ei gelu-

trans-unit.source: Those who said about their brothers while sitting [at home], "If they had obeyed us, they would not have been killed." Say, "Then prevent death from yourselves, if you should be truthful."
trans-unit.target: Rhai hynny a ddywedodd am eu brodyr tra'n eistedd [yn y cartref], "Os oedd iddynt ufuddhau inni, byddai eu nid wedi cael eu lladd." Dweud, "yna rhag iddynt farw o eich hunain, os y dylech fod yn onest."

trans-unit.source: And never think of those who have been killed in the cause of Allah as dead. Rather, they are alive with their Lord, receiving provision,
trans-unit.target: A byth yn meddwl am y rheini sydd wedi'u lladd yn achos Allah fel marw. Yn hytrach, maent yn fyw gyda eu Arglwydd, sy'n derbyn darpariaeth,

trans-unit.source: Rejoicing in what Allah has bestowed upon them of His bounty, and they receive good tidings about those [to be martyred] after them who have not yet joined them - that there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
trans-unit.target: Llawenydd yn pa Allah wedi dod iddynt am ei bounty, a gânt tidings da am y rheini [yn martyred] ar ôl iddynt nad ydynt eto hwy-ni fydd unrhyw ofn ynghylch eu, ac ni bydd iddynt alaru.

trans-unit.source: They receive good tidings of favor from Allah and bounty and [of the fact] that Allah does not allow the reward of believers to be lost -
trans-unit.target: Maent yn ei dderbyn tidings da o favor gan Allah a bounty a [o'r ffaith] nad yw Allah yn caniatáu gwobr o gredinwyr i'w golli-

trans-unit.source: Those [believers] who responded to Allah and the Messenger after injury had struck them. For those who did good among them and feared Allah is a great reward -
trans-unit.target: Hynny credinwyr a ymatebodd i Allah ac y negesydd ar ôl cael anaf yn taro hwy. Ar gyfer y rheini oedd da ymhlith hwy a ofnir Allah yw gwobr mawr-

trans-unit.source: Those to whom hypocrites said, "Indeed, the people have gathered against you, so fear them." But it [merely] increased them in faith, and they said, "Sufficient for us is Allah, and [He is] the best Disposer of affairs."
trans-unit.target: Mae rhai y dywedodd rhagrithwyr, "yn wir, mae pobl yn casglu yn eich erbyn, felly yn ofni iddynt." Ond [ond] cynyddodd iddynt mewn ffydd, a dywedodd, "digonol i ni yn Allah, ac [Mae'n] y Disposer gorau o'r materion."

trans-unit.source: So they returned with favor from Allah and bounty, no harm having touched them. And they pursued the pleasure of Allah, and Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
trans-unit.target: Felly Dychwelasant gyda favor gan Allah a bounty, unrhyw niwed yn cael eu crybwyll. A oeddent yn anelu ato y pleser o Allah, a Allah yw y possessor o'r bounty mawr.

trans-unit.source: That is only Satan who frightens [you] of his supporters. So fear them not, but fear Me, if you are [indeed] believers.
trans-unit.target: Dyna'r unig Satan sydd yn dychryn [ydych] ei chefnogwyr. Felly iddynt ofni nad, ond ofn imi, os ydych yn [yn wir] credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: And do not be grieved, [O Muhammad], by those who hasten into disbelief. Indeed, they will never harm Allah at all. Allah intends that He should give them no share in the Hereafter, and for them is a great punishment.
trans-unit.target: A Peidiwch alaru, [O Muhammad], gan y rhai sy'n cyflymu mewn anghrediniaeth. Yn wir, bydd iddynt byth niwed Allah bob. Mae'r Allah yn bwriadu y dylai roi cosb mawr i iddynt yw unrhyw gyfran yn y o hyn ymlaen, ac ar eu cyfer.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who purchase disbelief [in exchange] for faith - never will they harm Allah at all, and for them is a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, mae rhai sy'n prynu anghrediniaeth [yn gyfnewid] am ffydd-bydd byth yn eu niwed Allah bob, ac am eu cosbi poenus.

trans-unit.source: And let not those who disbelieve ever think that [because] We extend their time [of enjoyment] it is better for them. We only extend it for them so that they may increase in sin, and for them is a humiliating punishment.
trans-unit.target: A gadewch Mae nid y rhai a chredu erioed yn credu ei bod yn well iddynt [oherwydd] ydym yn ymestyn eu amser [o fwynhad]. Dim ond inni ei ymestyn iddynt fel y gall cynnydd mewn pechod, ac iddynt hwy yn cosbi bychanol.

trans-unit.source: Allah would not leave the believers in that [state] you are in [presently] until He separates the evil from the good. Nor would Allah reveal to you the unseen. But [instead], Allah chooses of His messengers whom He wills, so believe in Allah and His messengers. And if you believe and fear Him, then for you is a great reward.
trans-unit.target: Ni byddai Allah yn gadael y credinwyr yn yr wladwriaeth ydych mewn [ar hyn o bryd] hyd nes y mae ef yn gwahanu y drygioni y da. Ac ni byddai Allah yn dangos i chi y unseen. Ond [yn hytrach], bydd Allah yn dewis ei negeswyr bwy AU ewyllysiau, felly yn credu yn Allah a ei negeswyr. Ac os rydych yn credu ac yn ofni iddo, yna i chi yn wobr wych.

trans-unit.source: And let not those who [greedily] withhold what Allah has given them of His bounty ever think that it is better for them. Rather, it is worse for them. Their necks will be encircled by what they withheld on the Day of Resurrection. And to Allah belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth. And Allah, with what you do, is [fully] Acquainted.
trans-unit.target: A gadewch nid y rhai sy'n atal [farus] Pa Allah wedi rhoi iddynt o ei bounty erioed yn credu ei bod yn well iddynt. Yn hytrach, mae'n waeth iddynt. Bydd eu gyddfau yn amgylchynu gan beth maent yn ôl dydd atgyfodi. Ac i Allah yn perthyn treftadaeth y nefoedd a'r ddaear. A gyda beth yr ydych yn ei wneud, yw Allah, [llawn] yn gyfarwydd.

trans-unit.source: Allah has certainly heard the statement of those [Jews] who said, "Indeed, Allah is poor, while we are rich." We will record what they said and their killing of the prophets without right and will say, "Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire.
trans-unit.target: Yn sicr mae'r Allah wedi clywed datganiad o hynny Iddewon a ddywedodd, "Yn wir, Allah yn wael, er ein bod yn gyfoethog." Ni bydd yn cofnodi'r hyn y maent yn ei ddweud ac yn eu lladd y proffwydi heb hawl a bydd dweud, "blas y gosb y tân llosgi.

trans-unit.source: That is for what your hands have put forth and because Allah is not ever unjust to [His] servants."
trans-unit.target: Mae hynny ar gyfer beth y mae eich dwylo wedi ei rhoi ymlaen ac oherwydd nid yw Allah erioed anghyfiawn i weision [ei]. "

trans-unit.source: [They are] those who said, "Indeed, Allah has taken our promise not to believe any messenger until he brings us an offering which fire [from heaven] will consume." Say, "There have already come to you messengers before me with clear proofs and [even] that of which you speak. So why did you kill them, if you should be truthful?"
trans-unit.target: [Maent] rhai a ddywedodd, "Yn wir, Allah wedi cymryd ein haddewid ni i gredu unrhyw negesydd hyd nes y daw ef ni gynnig y tân [o'r nefoedd] Bydd yfed." Dweud, "Mae wedi eisoes wedi dod i chi negeswyr cyn imi â proflenni clir ac [hyd yn oed] a ydych yn siarad. Felly pam wnaeth eich lladd hwy, os dylai fod yn eirwir?'

trans-unit.source: Then if they deny you, [O Muhammad] - so were messengers denied before you, who brought clear proofs and written ordinances and the enlightening Scripture.
trans-unit.target: Yna os maent yn gwadu'r chi, [O Muhammad]-felly roedd negeswyr gwadu cyn i chi, a gyflwynodd proflenni clir a deunyddiau ysgrifenedig a ysgrythur ddadlennol.

trans-unit.source: Every soul will taste death, and you will only be given your [full] compensation on the Day of Resurrection. So he who is drawn away from the Fire and admitted to Paradise has attained [his desire]. And what is the life of this world except the enjoyment of delusion.
trans-unit.target: Bydd pob enaid yn blasu marwolaeth, a dim ond byddwch yn cael eich iawndal [llawn] ar dydd atgyfodi. Felly, ef sy'n tynnu oddi wrth y tân ac yn cyfaddef i baradwys wedi cyrraedd [ei awydd]. A sut beth yw bywyd y byd hwn ac eithrio y mwynhad o dwyll.

trans-unit.source: You will surely be tested in your possessions and in yourselves. And you will surely hear from those who were given the Scripture before you and from those who associate others with Allah much abuse. But if you are patient and fear Allah - indeed, that is of the matters [worthy] of determination.
trans-unit.target: Eich siawns eu profi yn eich eiddo ac yn eich hunain. Ac oni byddwch yn clywed gan y rhai a rhoddwyd yr ysgrythur cyn i chi a gan y rheini sy'n cysylltu eraill â Allah llawer o gam-drin. Ond os ydych yn glaf ac yn ofni Allah-yn wir, dyna y materion [deilwng] penderfyniad.

trans-unit.source: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Allah took a covenant from those who were given the Scripture, [saying], "You must make it clear to the people and not conceal it." But they threw it away behind their backs and exchanged it for a small price. And wretched is that which they purchased.
trans-unit.target: A [sôn, O Muhammad], pan gymerodd Allah cyfamod o rheini y rhoddwyd yr ysgrythur, [dweud], "chi rhaid gwneud yn glir i bobl ac nid ei gelu." Ond maent yn ei daflu i ffwrdd tu ôl i'w cefnau ac mae'n eu cyfnewid am bris bach. A yw truenus hynny a brynwyd ganddynt.

trans-unit.source: And never think that those who rejoice in what they have perpetrated and like to be praised for what they did not do - never think them [to be] in safety from the punishment, and for them is a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: A byth yn meddwl nad nid-rhai sy'n llawenhau yn yr hyn maent wnaeth gyflawnir ac fel i i'w canmol am hyn y maent byth yn credu iddynt [fod] yn diogelwch rhag y gosb, ac iddynt hwy yn cosbi poenus.

trans-unit.source: And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and Allah is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: Ac i Allah yn perthyn ddominiwn y nefoedd a'r ddaear, ac yn Allah dros holl bethau yn gymwys.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and the earth and the alternation of the night and the day are signs for those of understanding.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, yn creu y nefoedd a'r ddaear ac yn newid y nos a dydd yn arwyddion ar gyfer y rheini o ddealltwriaeth.

trans-unit.source: Who remember Allah while standing or sitting or [lying] on their sides and give thought to the creation of the heavens and the earth, [saying], "Our Lord, You did not create this aimlessly; exalted are You [above such a thing]; then protect us from the punishment of the Fire.
trans-unit.target: Sy'n cofio Allah tra'n sefyll neu eistedd neu [gorwedd] ar eu ochr a rhoi ystyriaeth i greu y nefoedd a'r ddaear, [dweud], "ein Arglwydd, chi oedd nid creu hyn ddigyfeiriad; yr ydych i'w mawrygu [uchod o'r fath yn beth]; Yna, i'n hamddiffyn rhag y gosb y tân.

trans-unit.source: Our Lord, indeed whoever You admit to the Fire - You have disgraced him, and for the wrongdoers there are no helpers.
trans-unit.target: Ein Arglwydd, yn wir pwy bynnag ydych yn cyfaddef y tân-yr ydych yn cywilyddio'n ef, ac ar gyfer y tramgwyddo, nid oes unrhyw gynorthwywyr.

trans-unit.source: Our Lord, indeed we have heard a caller calling to faith, [saying], 'Believe in your Lord,' and we have believed. Our Lord, so forgive us our sins and remove from us our misdeeds and cause us to die with the righteous.
trans-unit.target: Ein Arglwydd, yn wir yr ydym wedi clywed galwr yn galw i ffydd, [dweud], 'Credu yn eich Arglwydd,' ac yr ydym wedi credu. Ein Arglwydd, felly maddeuwch inni ein pechodau a dileu oddi wrthym ni ein camweddau a achosi inni farw gyda y righteous.

trans-unit.source: Our Lord, and grant us what You promised us through Your messengers and do not disgrace us on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed, You do not fail in [Your] promise."
trans-unit.target: Ein Arglwydd, grant wrthym beth ydych yn ei addo inni drwy eich negeswyr a ni wneud ein disgrace ar dydd atgyfodi. Yn wir, a ydych yn methu yn [ch] addewid."

trans-unit.source: And their Lord responded to them, "Never will I allow to be lost the work of [any] worker among you, whether male or female; you are of one another. So those who emigrated or were evicted from their homes or were harmed in My cause or fought or were killed - I will surely remove from them their misdeeds, and I will surely admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow as reward from Allah, and Allah has with Him the best reward."
trans-unit.target: A ymatebodd eu yr Arglwydd iddynt, "byth byddaf yn caniatáu eu colli gwaith [unrhyw] gweithiwr ymhlith chi, boed yn wryw neu fenyw; yr ydych yn un arall. Felly rhai a ymfudo neu eu troi allan o'u cartrefi neu a niweidiwyd yn fy achos neu ymladd neu oedd lladd-byddaf yn sicr yn dileu ohonynt o'u camweddau, a bydd siawns cyfaddef iddynt i gerddi o dan y llif afonydd fel gwobr gan Allah, ac mae Allah gydag ef y gwobrwyo gorau. "

trans-unit.source: Be not deceived by the [uninhibited] movement of the disbelievers throughout the land.
trans-unit.target: Nid yn eu twyllo gan y mudiad [ddirwystr] o disbelievers drwy gydol y tir.

trans-unit.source: [It is but] a small enjoyment; then their [final] refuge is Hell, and wretched is the resting place.
trans-unit.target: [Mae'n ond] mwynhad bach; yna eu lloches [terfynol] yn uffern, ac truenus yn y man gorffwys.

trans-unit.source: But those who feared their Lord will have gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding eternally therein, as accommodation from Allah. And that which is with Allah is best for the righteous.
trans-unit.target: Ond bydd rhai sydd yn ofni yr Arglwydd eu gerddi o dan y llif afonydd, ufudd i'r fythol ynddo, fel llety gan Allah. Ac mae hynny'n sydd ag Allah gorau ar gyfer y righteous.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, among the People of the Scripture are those who believe in Allah and what was revealed to you and what was revealed to them, [being] humbly submissive to Allah. They do not exchange the verses of Allah for a small price. Those will have their reward with their Lord. Indeed, Allah is swift in account.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, ymysg pobl y ysgrythur yn rhai sy'n credu yn Allah a datgelwyd beth i chi a beth a datgelwyd iddynt, [yn] ostyngedig ostyngedig i Allah. Wneud iddynt nid yn cyfnewid penillion Allah am bris bach. Bydd rhai yn cael eu gwobrwyo gyda eu yr Arglwydd. Yn wir, Allah yn gyflym yn cyfrif.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, persevere and endure and remain stationed and fear Allah that you may be successful.
trans-unit.target: O Mae chi sydd wedi credu, dyfalbarhau a dioddef ac yn parhau i fod wedi eu gosod ac yn ofni Allah y gallech fod yn llwyddiannus.

trans-unit.source: O mankind, fear your Lord, who created you from one soul and created from it its mate and dispersed from both of them many men and women. And fear Allah, through whom you ask one another, and the wombs. Indeed Allah is ever, over you, an Observer.
trans-unit.target: O dynolryw, yn ofni eich Arglwydd, sy'n creu eich enaid un a creu ohoni ei ffrind a gwasgaredig o ddau ohonynt lawer o ddynion a menywod. Ac ofn Allah, trwy bwy y mae ei ofyn un arall, ac y wombs. Yn wir erioed, yw Allah dros chi, sylwedydd.

trans-unit.source: And give to the orphans their properties and do not substitute the defective [of your own] for the good [of theirs]. And do not consume their properties into your own. Indeed, that is ever a great sin.
trans-unit.target: A rhoi i plant amddifad eu heiddo a nid oes rhodder y diffygiol [o eich hunain] er lles [nhw]. Ac nad ydynt yn yfed eu heiddo i eich hun. Yn wir, dyna erioed yn bechod mawr.

trans-unit.source: And if you fear that you will not deal justly with the orphan girls, then marry those that please you of [other] women, two or three or four. But if you fear that you will not be just, then [marry only] one or those your right hand possesses. That is more suitable that you may not incline [to injustice].
trans-unit.target: Ac os ydych yn poeni y byddwch nid yn ymdrin gyfiawn â merched amddifad, yna briodi rhai sy'n eich plesio chi o fenywod [arall], dau neu dri neu bedwar. Ond os ydych yn poeni bod chi fydd nid yn unig, yna [briodi yn unig] un neu hynny mae meddu ar eich llaw dde. Mae hynny'n fwy addas fel y gall eich inclein nid [i anghyfiawnder].

trans-unit.source: And give the women [upon marriage] their [bridal] gifts graciously. But if they give up willingly to you anything of it, then take it in satisfaction and ease.
trans-unit.target: A roi y menywod [ar briodas] eu rhoddion [ceffylau] mor garedig. Ond os y maent yn rhoi o'u gwirfodd i chi unrhyw beth ohono, yna yn cymryd boddhad a hwylustod.

trans-unit.source: And do not give the weak-minded your property, which Allah has made a means of sustenance for you, but provide for them with it and clothe them and speak to them words of appropriate kindness.
trans-unit.target: A gwneud nid rhoi y gwan eich eiddo, sy'n Allah wedi gwneud ffordd o chynnal i chi, ond darparu ar eu cyfer a sydyn iawn a siarad â geiriau eu caredigrwydd priodol.

trans-unit.source: And test the orphans [in their abilities] until they reach marriageable age. Then if you perceive in them sound judgement, release their property to them. And do not consume it excessively and quickly, [anticipating] that they will grow up. And whoever, [when acting as guardian], is self-sufficient should refrain [from taking a fee]; and whoever is poor - let him take according to what is acceptable. Then when you release their property to them, bring witnesses upon them. And sufficient is Allah as Accountant.
trans-unit.target: A phrofi amddifad [yn eu galluoedd] nes iddynt gyrraedd oedran marriageable. Os bydd eich barn chi yn eu doethineb, rhyddhau eu eiddo iddynt. Ac nad ydynt yn yfed yn ormodol ac yn gyflym, [rhagweld] y byddant yn tyfu. A phwy bynnag, [pan yn gweithredu fel gwarcheidwad], yn hunangynhaliol dylid ymatal [rhag cymryd ffi]; pwy bynnag yn wael a gadewch iddo gymryd yn ôl beth sy'n dderbyniol. Yna pan fyddwch yn rhyddhau eu heiddo iddynt, yn dwyn tystion arnynt. Ac mae digon o Allah fel cyfrifydd.

trans-unit.source: For men is a share of what the parents and close relatives leave, and for women is a share of what the parents and close relatives leave, be it little or much - an obligatory share.
trans-unit.target: Dynion yw cyfran y rhieni a pherthnasau agos absenoldeb, ac ar gyfer menywod yn gyfran o'r hyn y rhieni a pherthnasau agos yn gadael, ychydig neu lawer-rhannu orfodol.

trans-unit.source: And when [other] relatives and orphans and the needy are present at the [time of] division, then provide for them [something] out of the estate and speak to them words of appropriate kindness.
trans-unit.target: A phan [arall] perthnasau a amddifad ac anghenus yn bresennol yn yr adran [amser], wedyn ddarparu ar eu cyfer [rhywbeth] tu allan i'r ystad ac siarad geiriau eu caredigrwydd priodol.

trans-unit.source: And let those [executors and guardians] fear [injustice] as if they [themselves] had left weak offspring behind and feared for them. So let them fear Allah and speak words of appropriate justice.
trans-unit.target: A gadewch i'r rhai Mae [Ysgutorion a gwarcheidwaid] ofn [anghyfiawnder] fel pe bai ei [] wedi gadael epil wan ar ôl ac yn ofni iddynt. Felly gadewch iddynt ofni Allah a siarad geiriau cyfiawnder priodol.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who devour the property of orphans unjustly are only consuming into their bellies fire. And they will be burned in a Blaze.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, dim ond rhai a devour yr eiddo o blant amddifad o gam yn yfed i tân eu boliau. A bydd eu llosgi mewn tanbaid.

trans-unit.source: Allah instructs you concerning your children: for the male, what is equal to the share of two females. But if there are [only] daughters, two or more, for them is two thirds of one's estate. And if there is only one, for her is half. And for one's parents, to each one of them is a sixth of his estate if he left children. But if he had no children and the parents [alone] inherit from him, then for his mother is one third. And if he had brothers [or sisters], for his mother is a sixth, after any bequest he [may have] made or debt. Your parents or your children - you know not which of them are nearest to you in benefit. [These shares are] an obligation [imposed] by Allah. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Mae Allah yn cyfarwyddo'r chi ynghylch eich plant: ar gyfer y dyn, beth yw cyfartal i gyfran o ferched dau. Ond os oes [ond] merched, dau neu fwy, ar eu cyfer yw dwy ran o dair o ystad yr un. Ac os oes dim ond un, iddi hi yn hanner. Ac ar gyfer rhieni, i bob un ohonynt yn chweched dosbarth ei ystâd os gadawodd plant. Ond os oes ganddo unrhyw blant a Mae rhieni [unig] yn etifeddu oddi wrtho, wedyn am ei fam yn draean. Ac os oedd ganddo frawd [neu chwiorydd], ar gyfer ei fam yn chweched dosbarth, ar ôl unrhyw gymynrodd ef [efallai wedi] gwneud neu ddyled. Eich rhieni neu eich plant-y gwyddoch nad sydd yn agosaf i chi mewn budd-dal. [Mae cyfrannau hyn] rhwymedigaeth [osodir] gan Allah. Yn wir, Allah yn gwybod erioed ac yn ddoeth.

trans-unit.source: And for you is half of what your wives leave if they have no child. But if they have a child, for you is one fourth of what they leave, after any bequest they [may have] made or debt. And for the wives is one fourth if you leave no child. But if you leave a child, then for them is an eighth of what you leave, after any bequest you [may have] made or debt. And if a man or woman leaves neither ascendants nor descendants but has a brother or a sister, then for each one of them is a sixth. But if they are more than two, they share a third, after any bequest which was made or debt, as long as there is no detriment [caused]. [This is] an ordinance from Allah, and Allah is Knowing and Forbearing.
trans-unit.target: Ac i chi yw hanner pa gwragedd eich gadael os oes ganddynt unrhyw blentyn. Ond os oes ganddynt blentyn, i chi yw pedwerydd un o beth fyddant yn gadael, ar ôl unrhyw gymynrodd maent [efallai wedi] gwneud neu ddyled. A gwragedd y pedwerydd un os byddwch yn gadael unrhyw blentyn. Ond os byddwch yn gadael plentyn, yna ar eu cyfer yn wythfed o beth byddwch chi'n gadael, ar ôl unrhyw gymynrodd chi [Gall] gwneud neu ddyled.
