Ac os dyn neu fenyw yn gadael ascendants nac yn ddisgynyddion ond mae brawd neu chwaer, yna ar gyfer pob un ohonynt yn chweched dosbarth. Ond os ydynt yn fwy na dau, maent yn rhannu trydydd, ar ôl unrhyw gymynrodd a wnaed neu ddyled, cyhyd ag y mae unrhyw draul [achosir]. [Mae hwn] Ordnans gan Allah, a Allah yn gwybod ac yn Forbearing.

trans-unit.source: These are the limits [set by] Allah, and whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger will be admitted by Him to gardens [in Paradise] under which rivers flow, abiding eternally therein; and that is the great attainment.
trans-unit.target: Mae'r rhain yn y terfynau [set gan] Allah, a pwy bynnag ufudd i Allah a Messenger ei caiff eu derbyn gan iddo i gerddi [yn baradwys] o dan y llif afonydd, ufudd i'r fythol ynddo; a dyna y cyrhaeddiad mawr.

trans-unit.source: And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger and transgresses His limits - He will put him into the Fire to abide eternally therein, and he will have a humiliating punishment.
trans-unit.target: A pwy bynnag disobeys Allah a Messenger ei a pechu ei terfynau-bydd yn eu rhoi iddo yn tân i gadw at fythol ynddo, a bydd yn rhaid cosbi bychanol.

trans-unit.source: Those who commit unlawful sexual intercourse of your women - bring against them four [witnesses] from among you. And if they testify, confine the guilty women to houses until death takes them or Allah ordains for them [another] way.
trans-unit.target: I'r rheini sy'n ymrwymo cyfathrach rywiol anghyfreithlon eich merched-yn dod â herbyn pedair [tystion] o blith chi. Ac os mae nhw'n dystio, gyfyngu merched euog i dai hyd nes y mae marwolaeth yn eu cymryd neu mae Allah yn ordains iddynt [arall] ffordd.

trans-unit.source: And the two who commit it among you, dishonor them both. But if they repent and correct themselves, leave them alone. Indeed, Allah is ever Accepting of repentance and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ac y ddau sy'n ymrwymo iddo ymhlith chi, dishonor ddau ohonynt. Ond os byddant yn edifarhau ac yn cywiro eu hunain, gadael llonydd iddynt. Yn wir, byth yw Allah dderbyn pedair a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: The repentance accepted by Allah is only for those who do wrong in ignorance [or carelessness] and then repent soon after. It is those to whom Allah will turn in forgiveness, and Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Pedair a dderbynnir gan Allah yn unig ar gyfer y rhai sydd o'i le mewn anwybodaeth [neu ddiofalwch] ac yna edifarhau cyn gynted ar ôl. Mae'n rhai i bwy bydd Allah yn troi yn maddeuant, a Allah yn gwybod erioed ac yn ddoeth.

trans-unit.source: But repentance is not [accepted] of those who [continue to] do evil deeds up until, when death comes to one of them, he says, "Indeed, I have repented now," or of those who die while they are disbelievers. For them We have prepared a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Ond nid yw pedair [Derbyniwyd] y rhai sy'n [parhau i] wneud gweithredoedd anfad hyd at pan ddaw marwolaeth un ohonynt, meddai, "Yn wir, rwyf wedi edifarhau nawr," neu y rhai sy'n marw tra byddant yn disbelievers. Iddynt, rydym wedi paratoi cosb poenus.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, it is not lawful for you to inherit women by compulsion. And do not make difficulties for them in order to take [back] part of what you gave them unless they commit a clear immorality. And live with them in kindness. For if you dislike them - perhaps you dislike a thing and Allah makes therein much good.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, nid yw'n gyfreithlon i chi etifeddu menywod drwy orfodaeth. Ac nid gwneud anawsterau ar eu cyfer er mwyn cymryd rhan o beth roesoch iddynt oni byddant yn ymrwymo anfoesoldeb clir [yn ôl]. Ac yn byw gyda nhw yn garedig. Os ydych yn hoffi iddynt-efallai nad ydych chi'n hoffi beth a wna Allah yn weithredol llawer da.

trans-unit.source: But if you want to replace one wife with another and you have given one of them a great amount [in gifts], do not take [back] from it anything. Would you take it in injustice and manifest sin?
trans-unit.target: Ond os ydych am le un wraig arall ac wedi rhoi llawer un ohonynt [yn rhoddion], nid ydynt yn [yn ôl] o unrhyw beth. A fyddech yn cymryd anghyfiawnder ac amlygu pechod?

trans-unit.source: And how could you take it while you have gone in unto each other and they have taken from you a solemn covenant?
trans-unit.target: A sut y gallai gymryd ei tra byddwch wedi-unto gilydd ac wedi cymryd gennych cyfamod drymaidd?

trans-unit.source: And do not marry those [women] whom your fathers married, except what has already occurred. Indeed, it was an immorality and hateful [to Allah] and was evil as a way.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oes briodi hynny [merched] bwy roedd eich tadau yn briod, ac eithrio hyn eisoes wedi digwydd. Yn wir, yr oedd yr anfoesoldeb a chas [i Allah] a oedd drygioni fel ffordd.

trans-unit.source: Prohibited to you [for marriage] are your mothers, your daughters, your sisters, your father's sisters, your mother's sisters, your brother's daughters, your sister's daughters, your [milk] mothers who nursed you, your sisters through nursing, your wives' mothers, and your step-daughters under your guardianship [born] of your wives unto whom you have gone in. But if you have not gone in unto them, there is no sin upon you. And [also prohibited are] the wives of your sons who are from your [own] loins, and that you take [in marriage] two sisters simultaneously, except for what has already occurred. Indeed, Allah is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Gwaherddir i chi [ar gyfer priodas] yn eich mamau, eich merched, eich chwiorydd, eich tad chwiorydd, chwiorydd eich mam, eich brawd merched, merched eich chwaer, eich mamau [llaeth] a ydych chi, eich chwiorydd drwy nyrsio, mamau eich gwragedd, a eich cam-merched o dan warcheidiaeth eich [anwyd] eich gwragedd nyrsio-unto bwy yr ydych wedi mynd mewn. Ond os nad ydych wedi mynd-unto iddynt, nid oes dim pechod arnoch. A [gwahardd hefyd yn] wragedd eich meibion sydd gan eich [ei hun] loins, ac a gymerwch [yn briodas] dwy chwaer ar yr un pryd, ac eithrio ar gyfer hyn eisoes wedi digwydd. Yn wir, bod Allah yn faddeugar a tosturiol erioed.

trans-unit.source: And [also prohibited to you are all] married women except those your right hands possess. [This is] the decree of Allah upon you. And lawful to you are [all others] beyond these, [provided] that you seek them [in marriage] with [gifts from] your property, desiring chastity, not unlawful sexual intercourse. So for whatever you enjoy [of marriage] from them, give them their due compensation as an obligation. And there is no blame upon you for what you mutually agree to beyond the obligation. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Ac [gwahardd hefyd i chi holl] briod menywod ac eithrio y rhai yn eich dwylo hawl meddu ar. [Mae hwn] ordinhad Allah arnoch. Ac yn gyfreithlon i ydych [pob eraill] tu hwnt i hyn, [Darparwyd] y dylech geisio eu [yn briodas] [rhoddion o] eich eiddo, dynodir diweirdeb, cyfathrach rywiol yn anghyfreithlon. Felly ar gyfer beth bynnag byddwch yn mwynhau [o briodas] oddi wrthynt, rhoi iddynt eu iawndal sydd yn ddyledus fel rhwymedigaeth. Ac nid oes unrhyw fai arnoch chi ar gyfer beth a gytunwch i'r ddwy ochr i tu hwnt y rhwymedigaeth. Yn wir, Allah yn gwybod erioed ac yn ddoeth.

trans-unit.source: And whoever among you cannot [find] the means to marry free, believing women, then [he may marry] from those whom your right hands possess of believing slave girls. And Allah is most knowing about your faith. You [believers] are of one another. So marry them with the permission of their people and give them their due compensation according to what is acceptable. [They should be] chaste, neither [of] those who commit unlawful intercourse randomly nor those who take [secret] lovers. But once they are sheltered in marriage, if they should commit adultery, then for them is half the punishment for free [unmarried] women. This [allowance] is for him among you who fears sin, but to be patient is better for you. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: A pwy bynnag eich plith ni all [] y modd i briodi merched am ddim, gan gredu, yna [Efallai iddo briodi] o'r rheini yn eich dwylo hawl yn meddu ar o gredu merched gaethion. Ac Allah yn gwybod fwyaf am eich ffydd. [Credinwyr] yr ydych yn un arall. Felly iddynt briodi gyda chaniatâd eu pobl ac yn rhoi iddynt eu iawndal sydd yn ddyledus yn ôl beth sy'n dderbyniol. [Dylai fod] dilychwin iawn, nid y rheini sy'n ymrwymo cyfathrach rywiol anghyfreithlon ar hap na'r rhai sy'n cymryd cariadon [gyfrinach]. Ond unwaith maent yn gwarchod yn briodas, os dylid ymrwymo adultery, yna ar eu cyfer yn hanner y gosb ar gyfer menywod [dibriod] am ddim. Yn hwn [lwfans] iddo ef eich plith sy'n ofni pechod, ond i fod yn amyneddgar yn well i chi. Ac Allah yn Forgiving a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: Allah wants to make clear to you [the lawful from the unlawful] and guide you to the [good] practices of those before you and to accept your repentance. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Mae'r Allah yn awyddus i wneud yn glir i chi [y gyfreithlon gan y anghyfreithlon] ac yn eich tywys at yr arferion [da] y rhai cyn i chi ac i dderbyn eich pedair. Ac Allah yn gwybod a Wise.

trans-unit.source: Allah wants to accept your repentance, but those who follow [their] passions want you to digress [into] a great deviation.
trans-unit.target: Mae am dderbyn eich pedair Allah, ond mae'r rhai sy'n dilyn [eu] angerdd am i chi grwydro [i] gwyriad mawr.

trans-unit.source: And Allah wants to lighten for you [your difficulties]; and mankind was created weak.
trans-unit.target: Ac mae'r Allah am ysgafnhau'r i chi [eich anawsterau]; a chrëwyd dynolryw yn wan.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not consume one another's wealth unjustly but only [in lawful] business by mutual consent. And do not kill yourselves [or one another]. Indeed, Allah is to you ever Merciful.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, nad ydynt yn yfed un arall cyfoeth gam ond dim ond [yn gyfreithlon] busnes drwy gydsyniad. Ac nid oes lladd eich hunain [neu un arall]. Yn wir, Allah yw i chi erioed tosturiol.

trans-unit.source: And whoever does that in aggression and injustice - then We will drive him into a Fire. And that, for Allah, is [always] easy.
trans-unit.target: A pwy bynnag sy'n gwneud hynny mewn ymddygiad ymosodol ac anghyfiawnder-yna bydd yn sbarduno iddo yn y tân. A hynny, ar gyfer Allah, [hawdd bob amser yw].

trans-unit.source: If you avoid the major sins which you are forbidden, We will remove from you your lesser sins and admit you to a noble entrance [into Paradise].
trans-unit.target: Os chi osgoi bechodau mawr a waherddir chi, byddwn yn tynnu oddi ar eich eich pechodau llai ac yn chi gyfaddef i fynedfa noble [i baradwys].

trans-unit.source: And do not wish for that by which Allah has made some of you exceed others. For men is a share of what they have earned, and for women is a share of what they have earned. And ask Allah of his bounty. Indeed Allah is ever, of all things, Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid am hynny y gwnaeth Allah Mae rhai ohonoch chi yn fwy nag eraill. Ar gyfer dynion yn gyfran o'r hyn y maent wedi ei ennill, ac ar gyfer menywod yn gyfran o'r hyn y maent wedi ei ennill. A gofyn i Allah ei bounty. Yn wir erioed, yw Allah yr holl bethau, mae gwybod.

trans-unit.source: And for all, We have made heirs to what is left by parents and relatives. And to those whom your oaths have bound [to you] - give them their share. Indeed Allah is ever, over all things, a Witness.
trans-unit.target: Ac i bawb, rydym wedi gwneud hetifeddion i'r hyn sy'n weddill gan rieni a pherthnasau. Ac i'r rheini y mae eich llwon wedi clymu [i chi]-rhoi iddynt eu rhannu. Yn wir Allah yw erioed, dros holl bethau, tyst.

trans-unit.source: Men are in charge of women by [right of] what Allah has given one over the other and what they spend [for maintenance] from their wealth. So righteous women are devoutly obedient, guarding in [the husband's] absence what Allah would have them guard. But those [wives] from whom you fear arrogance - [first] advise them; [then if they persist], forsake them in bed; and [finally], strike them. But if they obey you [once more], seek no means against them. Indeed, Allah is ever Exalted and Grand.
trans-unit.target: Mae dynion yn gyfrifol am fenywod gan [hawl] beth y mae Allah wedi ei rhoi un dros y llall, a beth maent yn ei wario [ar gyfer cynnal a chadw] gan eu cyfoeth. Felly mae menywod hoes dabloid yn daer obedient, gwarchod yn absenoldeb [y gŵr] Pa Allah, byddai'n rhaid iddynt warchod. Ond hynny [gwragedd] oddi wrtho eich bod yn ofni haerllugrwydd-cynghori [gyntaf]; [yna os maent yn parhau], eu hanghofio yn y gwely; a [yn olaf], streic iddynt. Ond os ydynt yn ufuddhau chi [unwaith yn rhagor], chwilio am unrhyw ffordd yn eu herbyn. Yn wir, Allah yn erioed i'w mawrygu ac yn Grand.

trans-unit.source: And if you fear dissension between the two, send an arbitrator from his people and an arbitrator from her people. If they both desire reconciliation, Allah will cause it between them. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Acquainted [with all things].
trans-unit.target: Ac os ydych yn poeni gynnen rhwng y ddau, fel cymrodeddwr gan ei bobl ac fel cymrodeddwr anfon gan ei bobl. Os Mae'r ddau yn dymuno cysoni, bydd Allah yn ei achosi rhyngddynt. Yn wir, Allah yn gwybod erioed a gyfarwydd [gyda'r holl bethau].

trans-unit.source: Worship Allah and associate nothing with Him, and to parents do good, and to relatives, orphans, the needy, the near neighbor, the neighbor farther away, the companion at your side, the traveler, and those whom your right hands possess. Indeed, Allah does not like those who are self-deluding and boastful.
trans-unit.target: Mae addoli Allah a cysylltiol dim ag ef, a rhieni yn gwneud da, ac i berthnasau, amddifad, yr anghenus, gan agos, ymhellach i ffwrdd, mae gan y cydymaith ar eich ochr chi, o'r fath a rhai ohonynt yn eich dwylo hawl meddu ar. Yn wir, nad yw'n Allah yn hoffi rhai sy'n twyllo eu hunain ac ymffrostgar.

trans-unit.source: Who are stingy and enjoin upon [other] people stinginess and conceal what Allah has given them of His bounty - and We have prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment -
trans-unit.target: Sy'n cybyddlyd a enjoin ar stinginess [arall] pobl ac yn cuddio pa Allah wedi rhoi iddynt am ei bounty-ac mae wedi paratoi ar gyfer y disbelievers cosb bychanol-

trans-unit.source: And [also] those who spend of their wealth to be seen by the people and believe not in Allah nor in the Last Day. And he to whom Satan is a companion - then evil is he as a companion.
trans-unit.target: A [hefyd] y rhai sy'n treulio eu cyfoeth yn cael ei weld gan y bobl ac yn credu nad ydynt yn Allah, nac yn y dydd diwethaf. Ac ef y Satan yn gydymaith-yna drygioni yw ef fel cydymaith.

trans-unit.source: And what [harm would come] upon them if they believed in Allah and the Last Day and spent out of what Allah provided for them? And Allah is ever, about them, Knowing.
trans-unit.target: A beth [niwed byddai dod] arnynt os ydynt yn credu mewn Allah a diwrnod olaf a dreuliwyd allan o'r hyn a ddarperir Allah ar eu cyfer? A yw Allah erioed, am iddynt, mae gwybod.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah does not do injustice, [even] as much as an atom's weight; while if there is a good deed, He multiplies it and gives from Himself a great reward.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, Allah nid yw anghyfiawnder, [hyd yn oed] cymaint ag atom pwysau; tra os oes gweithred dda, mae'n ac.uk iddo ac yn rhoi gwobr mawr ei hun.

trans-unit.source: So how [will it be] when We bring from every nation a witness and we bring you, [O Muhammad] against these [people] as a witness?
trans-unit.target: Felly sut [fydd] pan ydym yn dwyn o bob cenedl tyst ac inni ddod â chi, [O Muhammad] erbyn hyn [pobl] fel tyst?

trans-unit.source: That Day, those who disbelieved and disobeyed the Messenger will wish they could be covered by the earth. And they will not conceal from Allah a [single] statement.
trans-unit.target: Y diwrnod hwnnw, bydd rhai a disobeyed y negesydd a ddysgais am iddynt y gellid eu cynnwys gan y ddaear. Ac iddynt ni chuddiaf gan Allah [un] datganiad.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not approach prayer while you are intoxicated until you know what you are saying or in a state of janabah, except those passing through [a place of prayer], until you have washed [your whole body]. And if you are ill or on a journey or one of you comes from the place of relieving himself or you have contacted women and find no water, then seek clean earth and wipe over your faces and your hands [with it]. Indeed, Allah is ever Pardoning and Forgiving.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, wneud nid dull gweddi tra byddwch yn meddwi hyd nes y gwyddoch beth yr ydych yn ei ddweud neu mewn cyflwr o janabah, ac eithrio rhai sy'n pasio drwy'r [lle y weddi], hyd nes y byddwch wedi golchi [eich corff cyfan]. Mae ac os ydych yn sâl neu ar y siwrnai neu daw un ohonoch y lle o leddfu ei hun neu yr ydych yn cysylltu â menywod ac yn canfod dim dŵr, yna ceisio ddaear glân a sychu dros eich wynebau a eich dwylo [â]. Yn wir, Allah yn Pardoning a faddeugar erioed.

trans-unit.source: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the Scripture, purchasing error [in exchange for it] and wishing you would lose the way?
trans-unit.target: Nid ydych wedi gweld rhai a rhoddwyd dogn o ysgrythur, prynu gwall [yn gyfnewid am ei] ac sy'n dymuno chi byddai colli y ffordd?

trans-unit.source: And Allah is most knowing of your enemies; and sufficient is Allah as an ally, and sufficient is Allah as a helper.
trans-unit.target: A Allah yw'r rhan fwyaf o wybod eich gelynion; a yw Allah fel cynghreiriad yn ddigonol, ac mae digon o Allah fel cynorthwy-ydd.

trans-unit.source: Among the Jews are those who distort words from their [proper] usages and say, "We hear and disobey" and "Hear but be not heard" and "Ra'ina," twisting their tongues and defaming the religion. And if they had said [instead], "We hear and obey" and "Wait for us [to understand]," it would have been better for them and more suitable. But Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, so they believe not, except for a few.
trans-unit.target: Ymysg yr Iddewon yw'r rhai sy'n ystumio geiriau gan eu defnydd [iawn] a dweud, "Rydym yn clywed a torri'r" a "Hear ond nid yn clywed" a "Ra'ina," troi eu dafod a o'r crefydd. Ac os byddant wedi dweud [yn hytrach], "Rydym yn gwrando ac yn ufuddhau i" a "Aros i ni [i ddeall]," byddai wedi bod yn well iddynt ac yn fwy addas. Ond wedi Allah yn melltithio iddynt ar gyfer eu anghrediniaeth, fel y maent yn credu nad yw, heblaw am ychydig.

trans-unit.source: O you who were given the Scripture, believe in what We have sent down [to Muhammad], confirming that which is with you, before We obliterate faces and turn them toward their backs or curse them as We cursed the sabbath-breakers. And ever is the decree of Allah accomplished.
trans-unit.target: O ydych y rhoddwyd yr ysgrythur, yn credu mewn beth yr ydym wedi anfon i lawr [i Muhammad], cadarnhau a bod gyda chi, cyn Rydym yn dileu wynebau ac iddynt droi tuag at eu cefnau neu eu melltithio fel rydym yn melltithio y Saboth-torwyr. Ac yn yr ordinhad Allah a gyflawnwyd erioed.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah does not forgive association with Him, but He forgives what is less than that for whom He wills. And he who associates others with Allah has certainly fabricated a tremendous sin.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, nid yw Allah yn maddau Cymdeithas ag ef, ond mae ei fod yn maddau beth yn llai na'r hyn y mae ef yn wills. Ac yn sicr ef a associates eraill gyda Allah wedi ffugio pechod aruthrol.

trans-unit.source: Have you not seen those who claim themselves to be pure? Rather, Allah purifies whom He wills, and injustice is not done to them, [even] as much as a thread [inside a date seed].
trans-unit.target: Nid ydych wedi gweld rhai sy'n honni eu bod yn pur? Yn hytrach, mae'r Allah buro bwy mae ef wills, ac anghyfiawnder nid gwneir iddynt, [hyd yn oed] yn gymaint fel llinyn [tu mewn a hadau dyddiad].

trans-unit.source: Look how they invent about Allah untruth, and sufficient is that as a manifest sin.
trans-unit.target: Edrych sut y mae dyfeisio am Allah untruth, a digon yw fel pechod amlwg.

trans-unit.source: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the Scripture, who believe in superstition and false objects of worship and say about the disbelievers, "These are better guided than the believers as to the way"?
trans-unit.target: Nid ydych wedi gweld rhai a rhoddwyd dogn o yr ysgrythur, sy'n credu mewn superstition a gwrthrychau ffug o addoli a dweud am y disbelievers, "yn rhain well arweiniad nag y credinwyr ynghylch y ffordd"?

trans-unit.source: Those are the ones whom Allah has cursed; and he whom Allah curses - never will you find for him a helper.
trans-unit.target: Dyma'r rhai ohonynt Allah wedi melltithio; a bwy felltithion Allah-byth bydd chi o hyd iddo gynorthwy-ydd.

trans-unit.source: Or have they a share of dominion? Then [if that were so], they would not give the people [even as much as] the speck on a date seed.
trans-unit.target: Neu wedi eu cyfran o ddominiwn? Yna [os a oedd hynny], ni roddant y bobl [hyd yn oed fel] speck ar hadau dyddiad.

trans-unit.source: Or do they envy people for what Allah has given them of His bounty? But we had already given the family of Abraham the Scripture and wisdom and conferred upon them a great kingdom.
trans-unit.target: Neu nid ydynt yn eiddigeddus pobl ar gyfer Allah wedi rhoi iddynt am ei bounty? Ond eisoes wedi rhoi i'r teulu o Abraham ysgrythur a doethineb a roddwyd iddynt yn Deyrnas mawr.

trans-unit.source: And some among them believed in it, and some among them were averse to it. And sufficient is Hell as a blaze.
trans-unit.target: A rhai yn eu plith yn credu ynddo, ac roedd rhai yn eu plith yn osgoi iddo. Ac mae digon o uffern fel tanbaid.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who disbelieve in Our verses - We will drive them into a Fire. Every time their skins are roasted through We will replace them with other skins so they may taste the punishment. Indeed, Allah is ever Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, y rhai a chredu yn ein penillion-bydd eu gyrru yn y tân. Bob tro yn eu crwyn yn rhost drwy bydd rhoi yn eu lle o wisgoedd eraill fel y gall eu blas y gosb. Yn wir, yw Allah erioed i'w mawrygu yn allai a Wise.

trans-unit.source: But those who believe and do righteous deeds - We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide forever. For them therein are purified spouses, and We will admit them to deepening shade.
trans-unit.target: Ond y rhai sy'n credu a gwneud gweithredoedd cyfiawn-bydd inni gyfaddef i gerddi o dan afonydd sy'n llifo, lle eu bod yn cadw am byth. Ar eu cyfer yn erthyglau priod wedi'u puro, a bydd yn cyfaddef iddynt i ddyfnhau cysgod.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah commands you to render trusts to whom they are due and when you judge between people to judge with justice. Excellent is that which Allah instructs you. Indeed, Allah is ever Hearing and Seeing.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, mae Allah yn hawlio chi i rendr ymddiriedolaethau i bwy y maent yn ddyledus a pan farnwch rhwng pobl farnu yn gyfiawnder. Rhagorol yw sy'n eich cyfarwyddo Allah. Yn wir, Allah yn erioed clyw a gweld.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, obey Allah and obey the Messenger and those in authority among you. And if you disagree over anything, refer it to Allah and the Messenger, if you should believe in Allah and the Last Day. That is the best [way] and best in result.
trans-unit.target: O ydych sydd wedi credu, ufuddhau Allah ac ufuddhau y negesydd a'r rhai mewn awdurdod yn eich plith. Ac os ydych yn anghytuno dros unrhyw beth, gyfeirio at Allah a Messenger, os ddylech gredu yn Allah ac yn y dydd diwethaf. Dyna'r gorau [ffordd] a'r gorau yn ganlyniad.

trans-unit.source: Have you not seen those who claim to have believed in what was revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what was revealed before you? They wish to refer legislation to Taghut, while they were commanded to reject it; and Satan wishes to lead them far astray.
trans-unit.target: Nid ydych wedi gweld rhai sy'n honni eu bod wedi credu yn yr hyn a ddatgelwyd i chi, [O Muhammad], a'r hyn a ddatgelwyd cyn i chi? Maent yn dymuno cyfeirio deddfwriaeth i Taghut, tra roedd tuag atynt ei wrthod; ac mae Satan yn dymuno arwain iddynt lawer ar gyfeiliorn.

trans-unit.source: And when it is said to them, "Come to what Allah has revealed and to the Messenger," you see the hypocrites turning away from you in aversion.
trans-unit.target: A phan ddywedir iddynt, "Dod i beth Allah wedi datgelu a Messenger," yr ydych yn gweld y rhagrithwyr yn troi oddi wrth ichi mewn gwrthwynebiad.

trans-unit.source: So how [will it be] when disaster strikes them because of what their hands have put forth and then they come to you swearing by Allah, "We intended nothing but good conduct and accommodation."
trans-unit.target: Felly sut y [fydd] pan mae'r drychineb yn taro eu oherwydd hyn wedi eu dwylo ymlaen ac yna maent yn dod i chi rhegi gan Allah, "ein bwriad oedd dim ond ymddygiad da a llety."

trans-unit.source: Those are the ones of whom Allah knows what is in their hearts, so turn away from them but admonish them and speak to them a far-reaching word.
trans-unit.target: Dyma'r rhai o bwy mae Allah yn gwybod beth sydd yn eu calonnau, felly droi oddi arnynt ond admonish iddynt a siarad â nhw air pellgyrhaeddol.

trans-unit.source: And We did not send any messenger except to be obeyed by permission of Allah. And if, when they wronged themselves, they had come to you, [O Muhammad], and asked forgiveness of Allah and the Messenger had asked forgiveness for them, they would have found Allah Accepting of repentance and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ac na fyddem yn anfon unrhyw negesydd ac eithrio i fod yn ufuddhau drwy ganiatâd Allah. Ac os, pan roedd eu cam eu hunain, wedi i chi, [O Muhammad], ac roedd gofyn maddeuant Allah a y negesydd yn gofyn maddeuant iddynt, byddai wedi bod Allah yn derbyn pedair a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: But no, by your Lord, they will not [truly] believe until they make you, [O Muhammad], judge concerning that over which they dispute among themselves and then find within themselves no discomfort from what you have judged and submit in [full, willing] submission.
trans-unit.target: Ond na, gan eich Arglwydd, ni wnânt [yn wir] yn credu hyd nes y bydd yn gwneud i chi, [O Muhammad], farnu ynghylch hynny y maent anghydfod ymysg eu hunain, ac wedyn yn canfod o fewn eu hunain unrhyw anghysur o'r hyn yr ydych wedi ei barnu a chyflwyno mewn cyflwyniad [llawn, barod].

trans-unit.source: And if We had decreed upon them, "Kill yourselves" or "Leave your homes," they would not have done it, except for a few of them. But if they had done what they were instructed, it would have been better for them and a firmer position [for them in faith].
trans-unit.target: Ac os oedd yn dyfarnu arnynt, 'Lladd eich hun' neu "Gadael eich cartrefi," byddai nad ydynt wedi gwneud, ac eithrio ychydig ohonynt. Ond os ydynt wedi gwneud hyn y maent yn cyfarwyddo, byddai wedi bod yn well iddynt hwy a'r sefyllfa gadarnach [ar eu cyfer mewn ffydd].

trans-unit.source: And then We would have given them from Us a great reward.
trans-unit.target: Ac yna byddai Rydym wedi rhoi iddynt gan ein gwobr mawr.

trans-unit.source: And We would have guided them to a straight path.
trans-unit.target: A byddai yn wedi arwain i lwybr syth.

trans-unit.source: And whoever obeys Allah and the Messenger - those will be with the ones upon whom Allah has bestowed favor of the prophets, the steadfast affirmers of truth, the martyrs and the righteous. And excellent are those as companions.
trans-unit.target: A pwy bynnag ufudd i Allah ac y negesydd-fydd y rheini gyda y rhai ar bwy mae Allah wedi rhoi'r favor y proffwydi, y affirmers gadarn o wirionedd, y merthyron a y righteous. Ac yn ardderchog rheini fel cymdeithion.

trans-unit.source: That is the bounty from Allah, and sufficient is Allah as Knower.
trans-unit.target: Dyna bounty gan Allah, a digon yw Allah fel Knower.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, take your precaution and [either] go forth in companies or go forth all together.
trans-unit.target: O sydd wedi credu, cymerwch eich rhagofalon ac mae [naill ai] yn mynd ymlaen mewn cwmnïau neu fynd ymlaen gyda'i gilydd.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, there is among you he who lingers behind; and if disaster strikes you, he says, "Allah has favored me in that I was not present with them."
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, mae eich plith ef a lingers ar ei hôl hi; ac os mae'r drychineb yn taro chi, meddai, "wedi Allah ffafriol imi fod yn bresennol gyda hwy."

trans-unit.source: But if bounty comes to you from Allah, he will surely say, as if there had never been between you and him any affection. "Oh, I wish I had been with them so I could have attained a great attainment."
trans-unit.target: Ond os bounty daw i chi oddi wrth Allah, oni bydd yn dweud, fel pe bai erioed wedi bod rhyngoch chi a iddo unrhyw hoffter. "O, dymunaf oedd yn bod gyda hwy fel y gallai wedi cyrraedd cyrhaeddiad mawr."

trans-unit.source: So let those fight in the cause of Allah who sell the life of this world for the Hereafter. And he who fights in the cause of Allah and is killed or achieves victory - We will bestow upon him a great reward.
trans-unit.target: Felly, gadewch y frwydr mewn achos Allah sy'n gwerthu bywyd y byd hwn ar gyfer y o hyn ymlaen. Ac ef a ymladd yn achos Allah ac yn lladd neu cyflawni buddugoliaeth-fydd Rydym yn rhoi gwobr mawr arno.

trans-unit.source: And what is [the matter] with you that you fight not in the cause of Allah and [for] the oppressed among men, women, and children who say, "Our Lord, take us out of this city of oppressive people and appoint for us from Yourself a protector and appoint for us from Yourself a helper?"
trans-unit.target: A beth yw [y mater] gyda chi y mae eich ymladd nid yn achos Allah a [i] y dan orthrwm ymhlith dynion, menywod a phlant sy'n dweud, "Mae ein Arglwydd, ein tynnu ni allan y ddinas hon o bobl gormesol a benodi i ni gan eich hun protector a benodi i ni gan eich hun cynorthwy-ydd?"

trans-unit.source: Those who believe fight in the cause of Allah, and those who disbelieve fight in the cause of Taghut. So fight against the allies of Satan. Indeed, the plot of Satan has ever been weak.
trans-unit.target: Rhai sy'n credu ymladd yn achos Allah, a rhai a chredu ymladd yn achosi Taghut. Felly ymladd yn erbyn lluoedd y cynghreiriaid Satan. Yn wir, byth y plot o Satan wedi bod yn wan.

trans-unit.source: Have you not seen those who were told, "Restrain your hands [from fighting] and establish prayer and give zakah"? But then when fighting was ordained for them, at once a party of them feared men as they fear Allah or with [even] greater fear. They said, "Our Lord, why have You decreed upon us fighting? If only You had postponed [it for] us for a short time." Say, The enjoyment of this world is little, and the Hereafter is better for he who fears Allah. And injustice will not be done to you, [even] as much as a thread [inside a date seed]."
trans-unit.target: Nid ydych wedi gweld rhai a dywedwyd wrthym, "Atal eich dwylo [rhag ymladd] a sefydlu gweddi a rhoi zakah"? Ond wedyn pan oedd yn ymladd yn hordeinio iddynt, ar unwaith yn blaid eu ofnai dynion fel eu bod yn ofni Allah neu gyda [hyd yn oed] mwy o ofn. Maent yn dweud, "ein Arglwydd, pam yr ydych a ddyfarnwyd arnom ymladd? Os mai dim ond roedd chi ohirio [ei] ni am gyfnod byr. " Ddweud, y mwynhad y byd hwn yn fawr, ac y o hyn ymlaen yn well ar gyfer AU sy'n ofni Allah. Ac ni Bydd anghyfiawnder ei wneud i chi, [hyd yn oed] yn gymaint fel llinyn [tu mewn a hadau dyddiad]."

trans-unit.source: Wherever you may be, death will overtake you, even if you should be within towers of lofty construction. But if good comes to them, they say, "This is from Allah "; and if evil befalls them, they say, "This is from you." Say, "All [things] are from Allah." So what is [the matter] with those people that they can hardly understand any statement?
trans-unit.target: Ble bynnag y byddwch, bydd marwolaeth yn goddiweddyd chi, hyd yn oed os dylai fod o fewn tyrau o adeiladu canmoladwy. Ond os da yn dod iddynt, maent yn dweud, "Dyma gan Allah"; ac os mae drygioni yn befalls iddynt, maent yn dweud, "Dyma chi." Dweud, "[popeth] yn oddi wrth Allah." Felly beth yw'r [y mater] gyda'r bobl hynny y gallant prin ddeall unrhyw ddatganiad?

trans-unit.source: What comes to you of good is from Allah, but what comes to you of evil, [O man], is from yourself. And We have sent you, [O Muhammad], to the people as a messenger, and sufficient is Allah as Witness.
trans-unit.target: Beth sy'n dod i chi da gan Allah, ond beth a ddaw atoch o ddrygioni, [O dyn], oddi wrth eich hun. Ac rydym wedi anfon atoch, [O Muhammad], i bobl fel negesydd, a digon yw Allah fel tyst.

trans-unit.source: He who obeys the Messenger has obeyed Allah; but those who turn away - We have not sent you over them as a guardian.
trans-unit.target: Ef a ufudd y negesydd wedi ufuddhau Allah; ond y rhai sy'n troi i ffwrdd-nad ydym wedi anfon chi dros iddynt fel gwarcheidwad.

trans-unit.source: And they say, "[We pledge] obedience." But when they leave you, a group of them spend the night determining to do other than what you say. But Allah records what they plan by night. So leave them alone and rely upon Allah. And sufficient is Allah as Disposer of affairs.
trans-unit.target: Ac maent yn dweud, "[Rydym yn addo] ufudddod." Ond pan fyddant yn gadael chi, grŵp ohonynt yn treulio y nos benderfynu ei wneud na beth yr ydych yn ei ddweud. Ond mae'r Allah yn cofnodi beth maent yn ei cynllun gan nos. Felly gadael llonydd iddynt, ac yn dibynnu ar Allah. Ac mae digon o Allah fel Disposer o faterion.

trans-unit.source: Then do they not reflect upon the Qur'an? If it had been from [any] other than Allah, they would have found within it much contradiction.
trans-unit.target: Yna nid ydynt yn adlewyrchu ar y Qur'an? Pe buasai gan [unrhyw] heblaw Allah, byddai wedi bod yn llawer o anghysondeb.

trans-unit.source: And when there comes to them information about [public] security or fear, they spread it around. But if they had referred it back to the Messenger or to those of authority among them, then the ones who [can] draw correct conclusions from it would have known about it. And if not for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy, you would have followed Satan, except for a few.
trans-unit.target: A phan y daw iddynt wybodaeth am ddiogelwch [gyhoeddus] neu ofn, y maent yn lledaenu ei o gwmpas. Ond os oedd eu cyfeirio yn ôl y negesydd neu awdurdod yn eu plith, byddai y rhai a [Gall] dod i gasgliadau cywir ohono wedi gwybod amdano. Ac os nad ar gyfer favor Allah ar chi ac yn ei drugaredd, byddai wedi dilyn Satan, heblaw am ychydig.

trans-unit.source: So fight, [O Muhammad], in the cause of Allah; you are not held responsible except for yourself. And encourage the believers [to join you] that perhaps Allah will restrain the [military] might of those who disbelieve. And Allah is greater in might and stronger in [exemplary] punishment.
trans-unit.target: Felly yn ymladd, [O Muhammad], yn achos Allah; Nid ydych Cynhelir gyfrifol ac eithrio eich hun. Ac annog credinwyr [i ymuno â chi] Efallai bydd Allah yn ffrwyno grym [milwrol] rhai a chredu. Ac Allah yn fwy yn y gallai ac yn gryfach yn cosbi [rhagorol].

trans-unit.source: Whoever intercedes for a good cause will have a reward therefrom; and whoever intercedes for an evil cause will have a burden therefrom. And ever is Allah, over all things, a Keeper.
trans-unit.target: Pwy bynnag a intercedes ar gyfer achos da bydd wedi gwobr oddi yno; a pwy bynnag a intercedes ar gyfer achos drwg bydd baich thelir. Ac byth yn Allah, dros holl bethau, ceidwad.

trans-unit.source: And when you are greeted with a greeting, greet [in return] with one better than it or [at least] return it [in a like manner]. Indeed, Allah is ever, over all things, an Accountant.
trans-unit.target: A [yn ôl] chyfarch pan ydych yn cyfarch gyda chyfarchiad, gydag un well nag neu ddychwelyd [o leiaf] yn [mewn ffordd debyg]. Yn wir, Allah yw erioed, dros holl bethau, cyfrifydd.

trans-unit.source: Allah - there is no deity except Him. He will surely assemble you for [account on] the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt. And who is more truthful than Allah in statement.
trans-unit.target: Allah-nid oes unrhyw Dduwdod ac eithrio ef. Siawns ei fod yn ymgynnull chi [cyfrif ar] dydd atgyfodi, y nid oes unrhyw amheuaeth. A phwy sy'n fwy gonest nag Allah mewn datganiad.

trans-unit.source: What is [the matter] with you [that you are] two groups concerning the hypocrites, while Allah has made them fall back [into error and disbelief] for what they earned. Do you wish to guide those whom Allah has sent astray? And he whom Allah sends astray - never will you find for him a way [of guidance].
trans-unit.target: Beth yw [y mater] gyda chi [eich bod yn] dau grŵp ynghylch y rhagrithwyr, tra mae'r Allah wedi iddynt syrthio ôl [Gwall ac anghrediniaeth] ar gyfer beth y maent yn ei ennill. A ydych yn dymuno arwain rhai y mae'r Allah wedi anfon ar gyfeiliorn? Ac iddo ef anfon Allah ar gyfeiliorn-byth a wnewch ddod o hyd iddo ffordd [o canllawiau].

trans-unit.source: They wish you would disbelieve as they disbelieved so you would be alike. So do not take from among them allies until they emigrate for the cause of Allah. But if they turn away, then seize them and kill them wherever you find them and take not from among them any ally or helper.
trans-unit.target: Dymunant byddai eich chredu fel y maent ddysgais felly byddai chi fel ei gilydd. Felly peidiwch â mynd o blith y cynghreiriaid iddynt hyd nes y byddant yn allfudo am achos Allah. Ond os y maent yn troi i ffwrdd, yna ymafael ynddynt a lladd iddynt lle bynnag y byddwch yn dod o hyd iddynt ac cymryd nid o blith eu unrhyw gyfaill neu gynorthwy-ydd.

trans-unit.source: Except for those who take refuge with a people between yourselves and whom is a treaty or those who come to you, their hearts strained at [the prospect of] fighting you or fighting their own people. And if Allah had willed, He could have given them power over you, and they would have fought you. So if they remove themselves from you and do not fight you and offer you peace, then Allah has not made for you a cause [for fighting] against them.
trans-unit.target: Heblaw am y rhai sydd yn cymryd lloches gyda phobl rhwng eich hunain a bwy yn cytuniad neu'r rhai sy'n dod i chi, eu calonnau dan straen [y posibilrwydd o] ymladd chi neu ymladd eu pobl eu hunain. Ac os oedd Allah ewyllysio iddi, gallai fod wedi rhoi eu pŵer dros eich, a byddai wedi ymladd chi. Felly os iddynt dynnu eu hunain oddi ar eich ac nad ydych yn ymladd ac gynnig chi heddwch, yna Allah nid yw wedi i chi achos [ar gyfer ymladd] yn eu herbyn.

trans-unit.source: You will find others who wish to obtain security from you and [to] obtain security from their people. Every time they are returned to [the influence of] disbelief, they fall back into it. So if they do not withdraw from you or offer you peace or restrain their hands, then seize them and kill them wherever you overtake them. And those - We have made for you against them a clear authorization.
trans-unit.target: Fe welwch eraill sydd am gael sicrwydd gennych ac i gael nawdd gan eu pobl. Bob tro y cânt eu dychwelyd i [dylanwad] anghrediniaeth, byddant yn syrthio ôl i'r. Felly os nad ydynt yn dynnu oddi arnoch neu gynnig chi heddwch neu ffrwyno eu dwylo, yna ymafael ynddynt a lladd iddynt lle bynnag y mae eich goddiweddyd iddynt. A hynny-yr ydym wedi gwneud i chi yn eu herbyn awdurdodi clir.

trans-unit.source: And never is it for a believer to kill a believer except by mistake. And whoever kills a believer by mistake - then the freeing of a believing slave and a compensation payment presented to the deceased's family [is required] unless they give [up their right as] charity. But if the deceased was from a people at war with you and he was a believer - then [only] the freeing of a believing slave; and if he was from a people with whom you have a treaty - then a compensation payment presented to his family and the freeing of a believing slave. And whoever does not find [one or cannot afford to buy one] - then [instead], a fast for two months consecutively, [seeking] acceptance of repentance from Allah. And Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Ac byth yn gredwr i ladd yn gredwr ac eithrio drwy gamgymeriad. A pwy bynnag sy'n lladd yn gredwr drwy gamgymeriad-yna ryddhau caethion believing a daliad iawndal a gyflwynwyd i deulu'r ymadawedig [Mae angen] oni roddant [hyd eu hawl fel] elusen. Ond os oedd yr ymadawedig gan bobl rhyfela chi ac ef oedd yn gredwr-yna [ond] rhyddhau believing gaethion; ac os oedd gan bobl gyda phwy mae gennych gytundeb-taliad digolledu eu cyflwyno i'w deulu a'i ryddhau caethion believing. Ac nid yw pwy bynnag canfod [un neu na allant fforddio prynu un]-yna [yn hytrach], cyflym am ddau fis olynol, [am] yn derbyn pedair gan Allah. A Allah yn gwybod erioed ac yn ddoeth.

trans-unit.source: But whoever kills a believer intentionally - his recompense is Hell, wherein he will abide eternally, and Allah has become angry with him and has cursed him and has prepared for him a great punishment.
trans-unit.target: Ond pwy bynnag sy'n lladd yn gredwr yn fwriadol-ei ad-dalu yn uffern, lle bydd yn glynu yn fythol, ac Allah wedi dod yn flin gydag ef a wedi melltithio iddo ac wedi paratoi ar ei gyfer cosbi mawr.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when you go forth [to fight] in the cause of Allah, investigate; and do not say to one who gives you [a greeting of] peace "You are not a believer," aspiring for the goods of worldly life; for with Allah are many acquisitions. You [yourselves] were like that before; then Allah conferred His favor upon you, so investigate. Indeed Allah is ever, with what you do, Acquainted.
trans-unit.target: O sydd wedi credu, pan fyddwch yn mynd ymlaen [i ymladd] yn achos Allah, ymchwilio i; ac nid yn dweud i un sydd yn rhoi i chi [cyfarchiad o] heddwch "Nid ydych yn gredwr," sy'n dyheu am y nwyddau worldly bywyd; ar gyfer Allah yn llawer o ychwanegiadau at y stoc. Chi [eich hun] oedd fel hynny cyn; yna y dywedodd Allah a roddwyd ei favor arnoch, ymchwilio i hynny. Yn wir yw Allah erioed, gyda beth yr ydych yn ei wneud, yn gyfarwydd.

trans-unit.source: Not equal are those believers remaining [at home] - other than the disabled - and the mujahideen, [who strive and fight] in the cause of Allah with their wealth and their lives. Allah has preferred the mujahideen through their wealth and their lives over those who remain [behind], by degrees. And to both Allah has promised the best [reward]. But Allah has preferred the mujahideen over those who remain [behind] with a great reward -
trans-unit.target: Nid cyfartal yn gredinwyr hynny sy'n weddill [cartref]-ac eithrio pobl anabl-ac yn y mujahideen, [sy'n ymdrechu ac ymladd] mewn achos Allah gyda eu cyfoeth a'u bywydau. Mae Allah yn well y mujahideen drwy eu cyfoeth a'u bywydau dros y rheini sy'n aros [ar ôl], gradd. Ac i ddau Allah wedi addo y gorau [gwobr]. Ond mae'r Allah yn well y mujahideen dros y rheini sy'n aros [tu ôl] gyda gwobr mawr-

trans-unit.source: Degrees [of high position] from Him and forgiveness and mercy. And Allah is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Graddau [o sefyllfa uchel] oddi wrtho a maddeuant a drugaredd. A bod Allah yn faddeugar a tosturiol erioed.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those whom the angels take [in death] while wronging themselves - [the angels] will say, "In what [condition] were you?" They will say, "We were oppressed in the land." The angels will say, "Was not the earth of Allah spacious [enough] for you to emigrate therein?" For those, their refuge is Hell - and evil it is as a destination.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, rhai y mae yr angylion yn cymryd [mewn marwolaeth] tra wronging eu hunain-[angylion] bydd yn dweud, "yn beth cyflwr oeddech chi?" Byddant yn dweud, "oedd yn gormesu yn y tir." Bydd yr angylion yn dweud, "Nid oedd y ddaear Allah [ddigon] mawr i chi er mwyn allfudo ynddo?" Ar gyfer y rheini, eu lloches yn uffern-ac anfad ydyw fel cyrchfan.

trans-unit.source: Except for the oppressed among men, women and children who cannot devise a plan nor are they directed to a way -
trans-unit.target: Heblaw am y dan orthrwm ymhlith dynion, menywod a phlant sy'n ni ellir dyfeisio cynllun nac yn cyfeirio at ffordd-

trans-unit.source: For those it is expected that Allah will pardon them, and Allah is ever Pardoning and Forgiving.
trans-unit.target: Ar gyfer y rheini, disgwylir y bydd Allah yn maddeuwch iddynt, ac Allah yn Pardoning a faddeugar erioed.

trans-unit.source: And whoever emigrates for the cause of Allah will find on the earth many [alternative] locations and abundance. And whoever leaves his home as an emigrant to Allah and His Messenger and then death overtakes him - his reward has already become incumbent upon Allah. And Allah is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: A pwy bynnag a emigrates am achos Allah bydd yn ei chael ar y ddaear llawer o leoliadau [arall] a digonedd. A pwy bynnag yn gadael ei gartref fel mae emigrant i Allah a Messenger ei ac yna i farwolaeth yn goddiweddyd ef-eisoes wedi ei gwobrwyo dod yn ddyletswydd ar Allah. A bod Allah yn faddeugar a tosturiol erioed.

trans-unit.source: And when you travel throughout the land, there is no blame upon you for shortening the prayer, [especially] if you fear that those who disbelieve may disrupt [or attack] you. Indeed, the disbelievers are ever to you a clear enemy.
trans-unit.target: A pan fyddwch yn teithio ledled y wlad, nid oes unrhyw fai arnoch chi ar gyfer byrhau y weddi, [enwedig] Os ydych yn poeni y gall rhai a chredu amharu ar [neu ymosod ar] chi. Yn wir, y disbelievers yn erioed i chi gelyn clir.

trans-unit.source: And when you are among them and lead them in prayer, let a group of them stand [in prayer] with you and let them carry their arms. And when they have prostrated, let them be [in position] behind you and have the other group come forward which has not [yet] prayed and let them pray with you, taking precaution and carrying their arms. Those who disbelieve wish that you would neglect your weapons and your baggage so they could come down upon you in one [single] attack. But there is no blame upon you, if you are troubled by rain or are ill, for putting down your arms, but take precaution. Indeed, Allah has prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment.
trans-unit.target: A pan fyddwch yn eu plith, ac yn eu harwain mewn gweddi, gadewch i grŵp o iddynt sefyll [mewn gweddi] gyda chi a gadewch iddynt gario eu breichiau. A pan maent wedi prostrated, gadewch iddynt fod [mewn sefyllfa] tu ôl i chi ac wedi y grŵp arall yn dod ymlaen sydd wedi nid [eto] rhoi'r bai arnom a gadewch iddynt yn gweddo gyda chi, cymryd rhagofalon a chynnal eu breichiau. Mae rhai a chredu yn dymuno y byddai esgeuluso eich arfau a eich bagiau fel y gallent ddod i lawr i chi yn un ymosodiad [un]. Ond nid oes unrhyw fai arnoch chi, os ydych yn cythryblus glaw neu sâl, am roi i lawr eich breichiau, ond cymryd rhagofalon. Yn wir, mae'r Allah yn paratoi ar gyfer y disbelievers cosb bychanol.

trans-unit.source: And when you have completed the prayer, remember Allah standing, sitting, or [lying] on your sides. But when you become secure, re-establish [regular] prayer. Indeed, prayer has been decreed upon the believers a decree of specified times.
trans-unit.target: A chofiwch, pan fyddwch wedi cwblhau'r y weddi, Allah sefyll, eistedd, neu [gorwedd] ar eich ochr. Ond pan ydych yn ddiogel, gweddi [rheolaidd] ail-sefydlu. Yn wir, mae gweddi wedi dyfarnu ar y credinwyr ordinhad o amserau penodedig.

trans-unit.source: And do not weaken in pursuit of the enemy. If you should be suffering - so are they suffering as you are suffering, but you expect from Allah that which they expect not. And Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oes gwanhau wrth fynd ar drywydd y gelyn. Os dylai fod yn dioddef-felly maent yn dioddef fel eich bod yn dioddef, ond yr ydych yn disgwyl oddi wrth Allah hynny y maent yn disgwyl ni. A Allah yn gwybod erioed ac yn ddoeth.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], the Book in truth so you may judge between the people by that which Allah has shown you. And do not be for the deceitful an advocate.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, yr ydym wedi datgelu i chi, [O Muhammad], y llyfr mewn gwirionedd fel y gall farnu rhwng y bobl hynny sydd wedi bod Allah yn dangos ichi. Ac ni wneud fod ar gyfer y dwyllodrus eiriolwr.

trans-unit.source: And seek forgiveness of Allah. Indeed, Allah is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: A cheisio maddeuant Allah. Yn wir, bod Allah yn faddeugar a tosturiol erioed.

trans-unit.source: And do not argue on behalf of those who deceive themselves. Indeed, Allah loves not one who is a habitually sinful deceiver.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid yn dadlau ar ran y rhai sydd yn twyllo eu hunain. Yn wir, mae'r Allah wrth ei bodd yn un sy'n deceiver gyson sinful.

trans-unit.source: They conceal [their evil intentions and deeds] from the people, but they cannot conceal [them] from Allah, and He is with them [in His knowledge] when they spend the night in such as He does not accept of speech. And ever is Allah, of what they do, encompassing.
trans-unit.target: Eu bod yn cuddio'r [eu bwriadau drwg a gweithredoedd] gan y bobl, ond ni ellir eu cuddio [eu] gan Allah, ac mae ef gyda hwy [yn ei wybodaeth] pan fyddant yn treulio y nos yn fel nad yw'n derbyn araith. A byth yn Allah, o'r hyn y maent yn ei wneud, yn cwmpasu.

trans-unit.source: Here you are - those who argue on their behalf in [this] worldly life - but who will argue with Allah for them on the Day of Resurrection, or who will [then] be their representative?
trans-unit.target: Yma rydych chi-rhai pwy a ddadlau ar eu rhan yn y bywyd worldly [hwn]-ond pwy bydd ddadlau gyda Allah iddynt ar ddiwrnod yr atgyfodiad, neu [yna] pwy fydd yn eu cynrychioli?

trans-unit.source: And whoever does a wrong or wrongs himself but then seeks forgiveness of Allah will find Allah Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: A pwy bynnag yw'r cam neu wrongs ei hun ond wedyn yn ceisio maddeuant Allah bydd canfod maddeugar Allah ac Merciful.

trans-unit.source: And whoever commits a sin only earns it against himself. And Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Ac mae pwy bynnag sy'n ymrwymo bechod dim ond ennill yn erbyn ei hun. A Allah yn gwybod erioed ac yn ddoeth.

trans-unit.source: But whoever earns an offense or a sin and then blames it on an innocent [person] has taken upon himself a slander and manifest sin.
trans-unit.target: Ond pwy bynnag sy'n ennill offense neu bechod ac yna ei beio ar rhai dieuog [person] wedi cymryd ar ei hun yn bechod enllib ac amlwg.

trans-unit.source: And if it was not for the favor of Allah upon you, [O Muhammad], and His mercy, a group of them would have determined to mislead you. But they do not mislead except themselves, and they will not harm you at all. And Allah has revealed to you the Book and wisdom and has taught you that which you did not know. And ever has the favor of Allah upon you been great.
trans-unit.target: Byddai ac os nad oedd ar gyfer favor Allah ar chi, [O Muhammad], ac ei drugaredd, grŵp ohonynt wedi penderfynu eich camarwain. Ond nad oeddent yn camarwain ac eithrio eu hunain, ac nid eu bydd niwed chi o gwbl. Ac mae'r Allah yn dangos i chi y llyfr a doethineb ac wedi dysgu hynny a oedd nad ydych yn gwybod eich. Ac erioed favor Allah chi wedi bod yn wych.

trans-unit.source: No good is there in much of their private conversation, except for those who enjoin charity or that which is right or conciliation between people. And whoever does that seeking means to the approval of Allah - then We are going to give him a great reward.
trans-unit.target: A oes dim da yn llawer o eu sgwrs breifat, ac eithrio rhai sy'n enjoin elusen neu sy'n hawl neu cymodi rhwng pobl. A pwy bynnag sy'n gwneud hynny'n golygu ceisio cymeradwyo Allah-yna ydym yn mynd i roi gwobr mawr iddo.

trans-unit.source: And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him and follows other than the way of the believers - We will give him what he has taken and drive him into Hell, and evil it is as a destination.
trans-unit.target: A pwy bynnag sydd yn gwrthwynebu y negesydd ar ôl canllawiau wedi dod yn amlwg iddo ef ac yn dilyn heblaw am y ffordd y credinwyr-bydd rhoi iddo beth y mae wedi eu cymryd ac ef yn eu gyrru i uffern, ac anfad ydyw fel cyrchfan.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah does not forgive association with Him, but He forgives what is less than that for whom He wills. And he who associates others with Allah has certainly gone far astray.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, nid yw Allah yn maddau Cymdeithas ag ef, ond mae ei fod yn maddau beth yn llai na'r hyn y mae ef yn wills. Ac mae ef a associates eraill gyda Allah yn sicr wedi mynd yn bell ar gyfeiliorn.

trans-unit.source: They call upon instead of Him none but female [deities], and they [actually] call upon none but a rebellious Satan.
trans-unit.target: Maent yn galw arnynt yn hytrach na ef dim ond mae'r fenyw [duwdod], ac maent yn galw [mewn gwirionedd] ar dim ond Satan gwrthryfelgar.

trans-unit.source: Whom Allah has cursed. For he had said, "I will surely take from among Your servants a specific portion.
trans-unit.target: Bwy Allah wedi melltithio. Ar gyfer oedd wedi dweud, "Onid af o blith eich gweision dogn penodol.

trans-unit.source: And I will mislead them, and I will arouse in them [sinful] desires, and I will command them so they will slit the ears of cattle, and I will command them so they will change the creation of Allah." And whoever takes Satan as an ally instead of Allah has certainly sustained a clear loss.
trans-unit.target: Bydd yn camarwain iddynt, a bydd yr ennyn eu dyheadau [sinful], a bydd yn ennyn iddynt felly bydd eu chânt y clustiau gwartheg, a bydd yn ennyn iddynt fel y byddant yn newid greu Allah." A bwy bynnag sy'n cymryd Satan fel wedi cynghreiriad yn hytrach na bod Allah yn sicr yn cynnal golled glir.

trans-unit.source: Satan promises them and arouses desire in them. But Satan does not promise them except delusion.
trans-unit.target: Mae Satan yn addo iddynt ac yn ennyn awydd ynddynt. Ond nid yw Satan yn addo iddynt ac eithrio rhithdyb.

trans-unit.source: The refuge of those will be Hell, and they will not find from it an escape.
trans-unit.target: Bydd y lloches o'r rheini yn uffern, ac ni chânt ei ddianc.

trans-unit.source: But the ones who believe and do righteous deeds - We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. [It is] the promise of Allah, [which is] truth, and who is more truthful than Allah in statement.
trans-unit.target: Ond y rhai sydd yn credu a gwneud gweithredoedd cyfiawn-bydd iddynt gyfaddef i gerddi o dan y llif afonydd, lle y bydd iddynt gadw am byth. [Mae'n] yr addewid o Allah, [sydd] gwir, ac sydd yn fwy gonest nag Allah mewn datganiad.

trans-unit.source: Paradise is not [obtained] by your wishful thinking nor by that of the People of the Scripture. Whoever does a wrong will be recompensed for it, and he will not find besides Allah a protector or a helper.
trans-unit.target: Nid yw paradwys [cael] gan eich ofer na chan y bobl o yr ysgrythur. Pwy bynnag sy'n gwneud anghywir bydd eu had-dalu ar ei gyfer, ac ni wêl ar wahân i Allah protector neu gynorthwy-ydd.

trans-unit.source: And whoever does righteous deeds, whether male or female, while being a believer - those will enter Paradise and will not be wronged, [even as much as] the speck on a date seed.
trans-unit.target: A pwy bynnag sy'n gwneud gweithredoedd cyfiawn, boed yn wryw neu fenyw, er eu bod yn credu'n-hynny bydd Rhowch baradwys ac ni bydd yn cam, [hyd yn oed fel] speck ar hadau dyddiad.

trans-unit.source: And who is better in religion than one who submits himself to Allah while being a doer of good and follows the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth? And Allah took Abraham as an intimate friend.
trans-unit.target: A phwy sy'n well mewn crefydd nag un sy'n cyflwyno ei hun i Allah er eu bod yn berson sy'n gweithredu o da ac yn dilyn crefydd o Abraham, inclining tuag at y gwir? A chymerodd Allah Abraham fel ffrind personol agos.

trans-unit.source: And to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And ever is Allah, of all things, encompassing.
trans-unit.target: A Allah yn perthyn iddo beth bynnag yn y nefoedd a beth bynnag sydd ar y ddaear. Ac byth yn Allah, yr holl bethau, sy'n cwmpasu.

trans-unit.source: And they request from you, [O Muhammad], a [legal] ruling concerning women. Say, "Allah gives you a ruling about them and [about] what has been recited to you in the Book concerning the orphan girls to whom you do not give what is decreed for them - and [yet] you desire to marry them - and concerning the oppressed among children and that you maintain for orphans [their rights] in justice." And whatever you do of good - indeed, Allah is ever Knowing of it.
trans-unit.target: Ac maent yn gofyn gennych chi, [O Muhammad], [cyfreithiol] dyfarniad yn ymwneud â menywod. Dweud, "Mae Allah rhoi dyfarniad amdanynt ac am beth mae wedi'i roi i chi yn y llyfr ynghylch y merched amddifad i bwy na roddwch beth a ddyfarnwyd iddynt-ac [eto] Mae eich awydd i briodi iddynt-ac ynghylch y dan orthrwm ymhlith plant, a bod eich bod yn cadw ar gyfer plant amddifad [eu hawliau] mewn cyfiawnder." A beth bynnag a wnewch o dda-yn wir, yw Allah erioed yn gwybod amdano.

trans-unit.source: And if a woman fears from her husband contempt or evasion, there is no sin upon them if they make terms of settlement between them - and settlement is best. And present in [human] souls is stinginess. But if you do good and fear Allah - then indeed Allah is ever, with what you do, Acquainted.
trans-unit.target: Ac os ofnau menyw gan ei gŵr dirmyg neu osgoi talu, nid oes dim pechod arnynt os byddant yn gwneud telerau setliad rhyngddynt-a setliad sydd orau. A hyn o bryd yn eneidiau [dynol] yn stinginess. Ond os da a ofni Allah-yna yn wir yw Allah erioed, gyda'r hyn yr ydych yn ei wneud, gyfarwydd.

trans-unit.source: And you will never be able to be equal [in feeling] between wives, even if you should strive [to do so]. So do not incline completely [toward one] and leave another hanging. And if you amend [your affairs] and fear Allah - then indeed, Allah is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: A byddwch byth yn gallu bod yn cyfartal [mewn teimlad] rhwng gwragedd, hyd yn oed os dylai chi ymdrechu [i'w wneud]. Felly wneud inclein gwbl [tuag at un] a gadael hongian arall. Ac os ydych yn diwygio [eich materion] ac ofn Allah-yn wir, yna Allah yn faddeugar a tosturiol erioed.

trans-unit.source: But if they separate [by divorce], Allah will enrich each [of them] from His abundance. And ever is Allah Encompassing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Ond os byddant yn gwahanu [gan ysgariad], bydd Allah yn cyfoethogi pob [ohonynt] gan ei helaethrwydd. Ac byth yn cwmpasu Allah a Wise.

trans-unit.source: And to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And We have instructed those who were given the Scripture before you and yourselves to fear Allah. But if you disbelieve - then to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And ever is Allah Free of need and Praiseworthy.
trans-unit.target: A Allah yn perthyn iddo beth bynnag yn y nefoedd a beth bynnag sydd ar y ddaear. Ac yr ydym wedi cyfarwyddo rheini y rhoddwyd yr ysgrythur cyn ichi a chi ofn Allah. Mae'r ond os mae eich chredu-wedyn i Allah yn perthyn beth bynnag yn y nefoedd a beth bynnag sydd ar y ddaear. Ac byth yn Allah am ddim angen a Praiseworthy.

trans-unit.source: And to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And sufficient is Allah as Disposer of affairs.
trans-unit.target: A Allah yn perthyn iddo beth bynnag yn y nefoedd a beth bynnag sydd ar y ddaear. Ac mae digon o Allah fel Disposer o faterion.

trans-unit.source: If He wills, He can do away with you, O people, and bring others [in your place]. And ever is Allah competent to do that.
trans-unit.target: Os mae ef wills, mae'n gwneud i ffwrdd â chi, O bobl, ac ddod â phobl eraill [yn eich lle]. A yw Allah yn gymwys i wneud hynny erioed.

trans-unit.source: Whoever desires the reward of this world - then with Allah is the reward of this world and the Hereafter. And ever is Allah Hearing and Seeing.
trans-unit.target: Pwy bynnag sy'n dymuno y wobr yn y byd hwn-yna gyda Allah yw'r wobr y byd hwn a y o hyn ymlaen. Ac erioed yw Allah yn clywed a gweld.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, be persistently standing firm in justice, witnesses for Allah, even if it be against yourselves or parents and relatives. Whether one is rich or poor, Allah is more worthy of both. So follow not [personal] inclination, lest you not be just. And if you distort [your testimony] or refuse [to give it], then indeed Allah is ever, with what you do, Acquainted.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, fod yn gyson gadarn Sefydlog mewn cyfiawnder, tystion am Allah, hyd yn oed os yn erbyn eich hunain neu rieni a pherthnasau. Pa un a yw cyfoethog neu dlawd, Allah yn fwy teilwng o ddau. Felly yn dilyn nid awydd [personol], rhag ofn nad ydych yn unig. Ac os ydych yn ystumio [eich dyst] neu wrthod [Mae'n], yna yn wir erioed, yw Allah gyda beth yr ydych yn ei wneud, yn gyfarwydd.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, believe in Allah and His Messenger and the Book that He sent down upon His Messenger and the Scripture which He sent down before. And whoever disbelieves in Allah, His angels, His books, His messengers, and the Last Day has certainly gone far astray.
trans-unit.target: O ydych sydd wedi credu, yn credu mewn Allah a Messenger ei a'r llyfr a anfonwyd ganddo i lawr ar ei negesydd a ysgrythur a anfonodd i lawr cyn. Ac wedi mynd ar gyfeiliorn lawer pwy bynnag a disbelieves yn Allah, ei angylion, ei lyfrau, ei negeswyr, a diwrnod olaf yn sicr.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who have believed then disbelieved, then believed, then disbelieved, and then increased in disbelief - never will Allah forgive them, nor will He guide them to a way.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, credai rhai sy'n credu, mae ddysgais, yna, ddysgais yna, ac yna cynyddu mewn anghrediniaeth-byth bydd Allah yn maddau iddynt, nac yn ei harwain at ffordd.

trans-unit.source: Give tidings to the hypocrites that there is for them a painful punishment -
trans-unit.target: Roi tidings y rhagrithwyr nad oes iddynt cosb boenus-

trans-unit.source: Those who take disbelievers as allies instead of the believers. Do they seek with them honor [through power]? But indeed, honor belongs to Allah entirely.
trans-unit.target: Rhai sy'n cymryd disbelievers fel cynghreiriaid yn lle y credinwyr. A ydynt yn chwilio gyda hwy anrhydedd honno [drwy bŵer]? Ond yn wir, y mae yn fraint yn perthyn i Allah yn gyfan gwbl.

trans-unit.source: And it has already come down to you in the Book that when you hear the verses of Allah [recited], they are denied [by them] and ridiculed; so do not sit with them until they enter into another conversation. Indeed, you would then be like them. Indeed Allah will gather the hypocrites and disbelievers in Hell all together -
trans-unit.target: Ac wedi iddo eisoes yn dod i lawr i chi yn y llyfr pan fyddwch chi'n clywed y penillion Allah [oes], eu bod yn gwrthod [eu] a gwawdio; Felly nid yw yn sefyll gyda hwy hyd nes iddynt ddechrau yn sgwrs arall. Yn wir, yna byddai gennych fel nhw. Yn wir y bydd Allah yn casglu y rhagrithwyr a disbelievers yn uffern gyda'i gilydd-

trans-unit.source: Those who wait [and watch] you. Then if you gain a victory from Allah, they say, "Were we not with you?" But if the disbelievers have a success, they say [to them], "Did we not gain the advantage over you, but we protected you from the believers?" Allah will judge between [all of] you on the Day of Resurrection, and never will Allah give the disbelievers over the believers a way [to overcome them].
trans-unit.target: Y rhai sy'n aros [a gwylio] chi. Yna os mae byddwch yn ennill buddugoliaeth oddi wrth Allah, maent yn dweud, "Nid oeddem gyda chi?" Ond os oes gan y disbelievers yn llwyddiant, maent yn dweud [iddyn nhw], "oedd yn ennill mantais dros chi, ond yr ydym yn eich diogelu rhag y credinwyr?" Bydd Allah yn barnu rhwng [ohonynt] Mae chi ar y diwrnod atgyfodiad, a byth bydd Allah yn rhoi y disbelievers dros y credinwyr [i'w goresgyn].

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the hypocrites [think to] deceive Allah, but He is deceiving them. And when they stand for prayer, they stand lazily, showing [themselves to] the people and not remembering Allah except a little,
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, y rhagrithwyr [meddwl i] twyllo Allah, ond yn ei dwyllo iddynt. Ac wrth sefyll ar gyfer gweddi, maent yn sefyll yn ddiog, dangos [eu hunain i] y bobl ac nid cofio Allah ac eithrio ychydig,

trans-unit.source: Wavering between them, [belonging] neither to the believers nor to the disbelievers. And whoever Allah leaves astray - never will you find for him a way.
trans-unit.target: Petruso rhyngddynt, [perthyn] i y credinwyr nac i y disbelievers. A pwy bynnag Allah gadael ar gyfeiliorn-byth gwelwch iddo ffordd.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not take the disbelievers as allies instead of the believers. Do you wish to give Allah against yourselves a clear case?
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, nid ydynt yn disbelievers fel cynghreiriaid yn lle y credinwyr. Ydych yn dymuno rhoi Allah erbyn eich hunain achos clir?

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the hypocrites will be in the lowest depths of the Fire - and never will you find for them a helper -
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, bydd y rhagrithwyr yn ddyfnderoedd isaf y tân-a byth fe welwch ar gyfer eu cynorthwy-

trans-unit.source: Except for those who repent, correct themselves, hold fast to Allah, and are sincere in their religion for Allah, for those will be with the believers. And Allah is going to give the believers a great reward.
trans-unit.target: Ac eithrio'r rhai sydd yn edifarhau, cywiro eu hunain, cynnal cyflym i Allah, a yn ddiffuant yn eu crefydd i Allah, ar gyfer y rheini fydd y credinwyr. A yw Allah yn mynd i roi gwobr mawr y credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: What would Allah do with your punishment if you are grateful and believe? And ever is Allah Appreciative and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Beth fyddai Allah? gyda eich cosbi os byddwch yn ddiolchgar ac yn credu Ac byth yn Allah yn werthfawrogol a gwybod.

trans-unit.source: Allah does not like the public mention of evil except by one who has been wronged. And ever is Allah Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Nid Allah yn hoffi sôn am cyhoeddus drygioni ac eithrio gan un sydd wedi cael cam. Ac byth yn gwrandawiad Allah a gwybod.

trans-unit.source: If [instead] you show [some] good or conceal it or pardon an offense - indeed, Allah is ever Pardoning and Competent.
trans-unit.target: [Yn hytrach] Os ydych yn dangos [rai] da neu guddio ei neu os maddeuwch offense-yn wir, Allah yn erioed Pardoning a chymwys.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who disbelieve in Allah and His messengers and wish to discriminate between Allah and His messengers and say, "We believe in some and disbelieve in others," and wish to adopt a way in between -
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, y rhai a chredu yn Allah a ei negeswyr a dymuniad i wahaniaethu rhwng Allah a ei negeswyr a dweud, "Rydym yn credu mewn rhai a chredu mewn eraill," ac yn dymuno mabwysiadu ffordd rhwng-

trans-unit.source: Those are the disbelievers, truly. And We have prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment.
trans-unit.target: Rhai yn disbelievers, yn wirioneddol. Ac mae wedi paratoi ar gyfer y disbelievers cosb bychanol.

trans-unit.source: But they who believe in Allah and His messengers and do not discriminate between any of them - to those He is going to give their rewards. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ond hwy sydd yn credu mewn Allah a ei negeswyr a pheidio â gwahaniaethu rhwng unrhyw un ohonynt-i'r rhai ei fod yn mynd i roi eu gwobrau. Ac byth yn maddeugar Allah a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: The People of the Scripture ask you to bring down to them a book from the heaven. But they had asked of Moses [even] greater than that and said, "Show us Allah outright," so the thunderbolt struck them for their wrongdoing. Then they took the calf [for worship] after clear evidences had come to them, and We pardoned that. And We gave Moses a clear authority.
trans-unit.target: Mae pobl y ysgrythur yn gofyn i chi gael llyfr gan y nefoedd iddynt. Ond wedi gofyn o Moses [hyd yn oed yn] fwy nag a dywedodd, "Yn dangos inni Allah llwyr," felly roedd y daranfollt yn taro hwy ar gyfer eu gamwedd. Yna cymerodd iddynt y lloi [ar gyfer addoli] ar ôl clir wedi dangos iddynt, ac yr ydym yn pardoned y. A rhoddodd Moses i awdurdod clir.

trans-unit.source: And We raised over them the mount for [refusal of] their covenant; and We said to them, "Enter the gate bowing humbly", and We said to them, "Do not transgress on the sabbath", and We took from them a solemn covenant.
trans-unit.target: A godwyd gennym dros eu mount ar gyfer [gwrthod] eu cyfamod; Dywedasom wrthynt, "Rhowch y giât consortia ostyngedig", ac yr ydym yn dweud iddyn nhw, "Oes na camddefnyddio'u ar y Saboth" a cawsom gan eu cyfamod drymaidd.

trans-unit.source: And [We cursed them] for their breaking of the covenant and their disbelief in the signs of Allah and their killing of the prophets without right and their saying, "Our hearts are wrapped". Rather, Allah has sealed them because of their disbelief, so they believe not, except for a few.
trans-unit.target: A [Rydym yn melltithio iddynt] ar gyfer eu torri y cyfamod a eu anghrediniaeth yn arwyddion o Allah a eu lladd y proffwydi heb hawl ac yn eu dweud, "Mae ein calonnau lapio". Yn hytrach, mae'r Allah selio iddynt oherwydd eu hanghrediniaeth, felly maent yn credu nad yw, heblaw am ychydig.

trans-unit.source: And [We cursed them] for their disbelief and their saying against Mary a great slander,
trans-unit.target: A [Rydym yn melltithio iddynt] ar gyfer eu hanghrediniaeth a'u eu dweud erbyn Mary enllib mawr,

trans-unit.source: And [for] their saying, "Indeed, we have killed the Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary, the messenger of Allah." And they did not kill him, nor did they crucify him; but [another] was made to resemble him to them. And indeed, those who differ over it are in doubt about it. They have no knowledge of it except the following of assumption. And they did not kill him, for certain.
trans-unit.target: A [i] eu dweud, "yn wir, y wedi lladd y Meseia, Iesu, fab i Mary, y negesydd Allah." Ac nid ydynt yn ei ladd, nac oedd eu bod yn crucify iddo; ond gwnaed [arall] ef yn ymdebygu iddynt. Ac yn wir, rhai sy'n anghytuno ag ef ar amheuaeth yn ei gylch. Mae ganddynt unrhyw wybodaeth ohono ac eithrio y canlynol o dybiaeth. Ac nid oedd lladd ef, i rai.

trans-unit.source: Rather, Allah raised him to Himself. And ever is Allah Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Yn hytrach, cododd Allah wrtho iddo'i hun. Ac byth yn Allah i'w mawrygu yn allai a Wise.

trans-unit.source: And there is none from the People of the Scripture but that he will surely believe in Jesus before his death. And on the Day of Resurrection he will be against them a witness.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oes gan bobl yr ysgrythur ond y bydd ef yn sicr yn credu yn Iesu cyn ei farwolaeth. Ac ar ddiwrnod yr atgyfodiad ef fydd yn eu herbyn yn dyst.

trans-unit.source: For wrongdoing on the part of the Jews, We made unlawful for them [certain] good foods which had been lawful to them, and for their averting from the way of Allah many [people],
trans-unit.target: Am ddrwgweithredu gan yr Iddewon, a wnaethom yn anghyfreithlon am eu bwydydd da [penodol] a oedd wedi bod yn gyfreithlon iddynt, ac am eu osgoi o'r ffordd o Allah llawer o [pobl],

trans-unit.source: And [for] their taking of usury while they had been forbidden from it, and their consuming of the people's wealth unjustly. And we have prepared for the disbelievers among them a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Ac am eu bod yn cymryd o usury tra roedd maent wedi'u gwahardd rhag ei, ac eu yfed o gyfoeth y bobl gam. Ac mae wedi paratoi ar gyfer y disbelievers yn eu plith cosb poenus.

trans-unit.source: But those firm in knowledge among them and the believers believe in what has been revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what was revealed before you. And the establishers of prayer [especially] and the givers of zakah and the believers in Allah and the Last Day - those We will give a great reward.
trans-unit.target: Ond mae hynny gadarn mewn gwybodaeth ymhlith iddynt ac y credinwyr yn credu yn hyn wedi dangos i chi, [O Muhammad], a'r hyn a ddatgelwyd ger eich bron. Ac y establishers y weddi [enwedig] a rhoddwyr zakah a'r credinwyr yn Allah a diwrnod olaf-rhai byddwn yn rhoi gwobr mawr.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], as We revealed to Noah and the prophets after him. And we revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, the Descendants, Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and Solomon, and to David We gave the book [of Psalms].
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, yr ydym wedi datgelu i chi, [O Muhammad], fel y datgelwyd inni i Noah a y proffwydi ar ei ôl. A ydym yn datgelu i Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, y disgynyddion, Iesu, swydd, Jonah, Aaron, a Solomon, ac i David ydym Rhoddodd y llyfr [o Salmau].

trans-unit.source: And [We sent] messengers about whom We have related [their stories] to you before and messengers about whom We have not related to you. And Allah spoke to Moses with [direct] speech.
trans-unit.target: A [Anfonwyd] am bwy ydym wedi ymwneud [eu straeon] i chi cyn y negeswyr a negeswyr am bwy wedi nid ydym yn perthyn i chi. A Allah siarad i Moses gyda araith [uniongyrchol].

trans-unit.source: [We sent] messengers as bringers of good tidings and warners so that mankind will have no argument against Allah after the messengers. And ever is Allah Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: [Anfonwyd] negeswyr fel bringers tidings da a warners fel na fydd dynolryw nad oes dadl yn erbyn Allah ar ôl y negeswyr. Ac byth yn Allah i'w mawrygu yn allai a Wise.

trans-unit.source: But Allah bears witness to that which He has revealed to you. He has sent it down with His knowledge, and the angels bear witness [as well]. And sufficient is Allah as Witness.
trans-unit.target: Ond bydd Allah yn dyst i'r hyn sydd wedi ei datgelu i chi. Y mae wedi ei anfon i lawr gyda ei wybodaeth, ac mae yr angylion yn dwyn tyst [hefyd]. Ac mae digon o Allah fel tyst.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of Allah have certainly gone far astray.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, mae rhai a chredu ac osgoi [pobl] o'r ffordd o Allah yn sicr wedi mynd lawer ar gyfeiliorn.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who disbelieve and commit wrong [or injustice] - never will Allah forgive them, nor will He guide them to a path.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, rhai a chredu ac ymrwymo anghywir [neu anghyfiawnder]-byth bydd Allah yn maddau iddynt, ac ni bydd ef yn eu tywys i lwybr.

trans-unit.source: Except the path of Hell; they will abide therein forever. And that, for Allah, is [always] easy.
trans-unit.target: Ac eithrio y llwybr o uffern; Bydd eu cadw at erthyglau am byth. A hynny, ar gyfer Allah, [hawdd bob amser yw].

trans-unit.source: O Mankind, the Messenger has come to you with the truth from your Lord, so believe; it is better for you. But if you disbelieve - then indeed, to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. And ever is Allah Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: O dynolryw, y negesydd wedi dod i chi gyda y gwir gan eich Arglwydd, felly yn credu; Mae'n well i chi. Mae'r ond os mae eich chredu-yn wir, yna i Allah yn perthyn beth bynnag sydd yn y nefoedd a'r ddaear. Ac byth yn gwybod Allah a Wise.

trans-unit.source: O People of the Scripture, do not commit excess in your religion or say about Allah except the truth. The Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary, was but a messenger of Allah and His word which He directed to Mary and a soul [created at a command] from Him. So believe in Allah and His messengers. And do not say, "Three"; desist - it is better for you. Indeed, Allah is but one God. Exalted is He above having a son. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And sufficient is Allah as Disposer of affairs.
trans-unit.target: O bobl yr ysgrythur, nid ymrwymo gormodol yn eich crefydd nac yn ei ddweud am Allah ac eithrio y gwir. Oedd y Messiah, Iesu, fab i Mary, ond negesydd Allah a ei air y cyfarwyddodd ef i Mary ac enaid [creu yn Gorchymyn] oddi wrtho. Felly yn credu mewn Allah a ei negeswyr. Ac nid yn dweud, "Tri"; Ymatal-mae'n well i chi. Yn wir, yw Allah ond un Duw. I'w mawrygu yn ef uchod gael mab. Iddo ef y perthyn beth bynnag yn y nefoedd a beth bynnag sydd ar y ddaear. Ac mae digon o Allah fel Disposer o faterion.

trans-unit.source: Never would the Messiah disdain to be a servant of Allah, nor would the angels near [to Him]. And whoever disdains His worship and is arrogant - He will gather them to Himself all together.
trans-unit.target: Byddai byth y dirmyg Messiah was Allah, na byddai angylion ger [iddo ef]. A pwy disdains ei addoli ac yn drahaus-ef bydd eu casglu i ei hun gyda'i gilydd.

trans-unit.source: And as for those who believed and did righteous deeds, He will give them in full their rewards and grant them extra from His bounty. But as for those who disdained and were arrogant, He will punish them with a painful punishment, and they will not find for themselves besides Allah any protector or helper.
trans-unit.target: Ac ag i'r rhai sy'n credu a oedd gweithredoedd cyfiawn, ei fod yn rhoi iddynt yn llawn eu gwobrau ac yn grant iddynt yn ychwanegol gan ei bounty. Ond o ran y rhai a disdained ac a oedd yn drahaus, bydd ef eu cosbi â chosbi boenus, ac ni chânt eu hunain yn ogystal â Allah unrhyw protector neu gynorthwy-ydd.

trans-unit.source: O mankind, there has come to you a conclusive proof from your Lord, and We have sent down to you a clear light.
trans-unit.target: O dynolryw, wedi dod i chi brawf pendant o eich Arglwydd, ac rydym wedi anfon i lawr at eich goleuni clir.

trans-unit.source: So those who believe in Allah and hold fast to Him - He will admit them to mercy from Himself and bounty and guide them to Himself on a straight path.
trans-unit.target: Felly mae'r rhai sy'n credu yn Allah a gafael yn gyflym iddo-bydd iddynt gyfaddef i drugaredd gan ei hun a bounty ac yn eu tywys i ei hun ar y llwybr syth.

trans-unit.source: They request from you a [legal] ruling. Say, "Allah gives you a ruling concerning one having neither descendants nor ascendants [as heirs]." If a man dies, leaving no child but [only] a sister, she will have half of what he left. And he inherits from her if she [dies and] has no child. But if there are two sisters [or more], they will have two-thirds of what he left. If there are both brothers and sisters, the male will have the share of two females.
