Allah makes clear to you [His law], lest you go astray. And Allah is Knowing of all things.
trans-unit.target: Maent yn gofyn am eich dyfarniad [cyfreithiol]. Dweud, "Mae Allah yn rhoi dyfarniad ynghylch un i chi cael ddisgynyddion nac ascendants [fel hetifeddion]." Os bydd yn ddyn marw, gadael plentyn dim ond [ond] chwaer, bydd ganddi hanner o beth ei fod yn ei gadael. Ac yn ei etifeddu gan ei os hi [marw a] Mae unrhyw blentyn. Ond os oes dwy chwaer [neu fwy], bydd ganddynt ddwy ran o dair o beth ei fod yn ei gadael. Os oes brodyr a chwiorydd, bydd y dyn yn cael y gyfran o ferched dau. Allah yn egluro i chi [ei gyfraith], rhag ofn y byddwch yn mynd ar gyfeiliorn. A gwybod am yr holl bethau yw Allah.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, fulfill [all] contracts. Lawful for you are the animals of grazing livestock except for that which is recited to you [in this Qur'an] - hunting not being permitted while you are in the state of ihram. Indeed, Allah ordains what He intends.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, gyflawni [holl] contractau. Gyfreithlon i chi yn y anifeiliaid pori da byw ac eithrio hynny sy'n ei roi i chi [yn y Qur'an]-hela Nid tra byddwch yn y wladwriaeth o ihram cael eu caniatáu. Yn wir, mae'r Allah yn ordains beth y mae'n bwriadu.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not violate the rites of Allah or [the sanctity of] the sacred month or [neglect the marking of] the sacrificial animals and garlanding [them] or [violate the safety of] those coming to the Sacred House seeking bounty from their Lord and [His] approval. But when you come out of ihram, then [you may] hunt. And do not let the hatred of a people for having obstructed you from al-Masjid al-Haram lead you to transgress. And cooperate in righteousness and piety, but do not cooperate in sin and aggression. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, wneud tarfu ar y defodau Allah neu'r [sancteiddrwydd] y mis sanctaidd neu [esgeulustod y marcio o] yr anifeiliaid aberthol a garlanding [eu] neu [Torri diogelwch] rhai sy'n dod i'r tŷ sanctaidd ceisio bounty gan eu Arglwydd a chymeradwyo [ei]. Ond pan ydych yn dod allan o'r ihram, yna [Gallwch] hela. A Peidiwch â gadael y casineb pobl ar gyfer cael eich rhwystro rhag al-Masjid al-Haram arwain chi camddefnyddio'u. A gydweithredu yn piety a chyfiawnder i, ond nid oes gydweithredu mewn pechod ac ymddygiad ymosodol. Ac ofn Allah; yn wir, Allah yn ddifrifol yn gosb.

trans-unit.source: Prohibited to you are dead animals, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than Allah, and [those animals] killed by strangling or by a violent blow or by a head-long fall or by the goring of horns, and those from which a wild animal has eaten, except what you [are able to] slaughter [before its death], and those which are sacrificed on stone altars, and [prohibited is] that you seek decision through divining arrows. That is grave disobedience. This day those who disbelieve have despaired of [defeating] your religion; so fear them not, but fear Me. This day I have perfected for you your religion and completed My favor upon you and have approved for you Islam as religion. But whoever is forced by severe hunger with no inclination to sin - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Gwaherddir i chi yn anifeiliaid marw, gwaed, cnawd moch, a'r hyn sydd wedi'i neilltuo i heblaw Allah, a [anifeiliaid hynny] lladd gan tagu neu gan ergyd treisgar neu gostyngiad hir pennaeth neu gan goring cyrn, a rhai o anifeiliaid gwyllt wedi bwyta, ac eithrio beth lladd chi [yn gallu] [cyn ei farwolaeth] , a'r rhai sydd yn eu haberthu ar allorau cerrig, a [gwahardd] y dylech geisio penderfyniad drwy divining saethau. Mae hynny'n ddifrifol anufudd-dod. Y diwrnod hwn yn rhai a chredu wedi despaired i [drechu'r] eich crefydd; felly iddynt ofni nad, ond ofn Me. Berffeithio diwrnod hwn rhaid i chi eich crefydd a gwblhau fy favor arnoch ac wedi cymeradwyo ichi Islam fel crefydd. Ond pwy bynnag sy'n cael ei gorfodi gan newyn difrifol gyda unrhyw awydd i pechod-yna yn wir, Allah yn Forgiving a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: They ask you, [O Muhammad], what has been made lawful for them. Say, "Lawful for you are [all] good foods and [game caught by] what you have trained of hunting animals which you train as Allah has taught you. So eat of what they catch for you, and mention the name of Allah upon it, and fear Allah." Indeed, Allah is swift in account.
trans-unit.target: Maent yn gofyn ichi, [O Muhammad], beth a wnaethpwyd gyfreithlon iddynt. Dweud, "gyfreithlon ar gyfer ydych bwydydd da [bob] ac [dal gan gêm] beth yr ydych wedi hyfforddi anifeiliaid hela a ydych yn hyfforddi'n fel Allah wedi dysgu chi. Felly fwyta o'r hyn y maent yn ei ddal i chi, a sôn am yr enw Allah arno, ac ofn Allah." Yn wir, Allah yn gyflym yn cyfrif.

trans-unit.source: This day [all] good foods have been made lawful, and the food of those who were given the Scripture is lawful for you and your food is lawful for them. And [lawful in marriage are] chaste women from among the believers and chaste women from among those who were given the Scripture before you, when you have given them their due compensation, desiring chastity, not unlawful sexual intercourse or taking [secret] lovers. And whoever denies the faith - his work has become worthless, and he, in the Hereafter, will be among the losers.
trans-unit.target: Diwrnod hwn [bob] da Mae bwydydd wedi'u gwneud yn gyfreithlon, a bwyd o'r rheiny roedd cael yr ysgrythur yn gyfreithlon i chi eich bwyd yn gyfreithlon ar eu cyfer. A [gyfreithlon mewn priodas yn] menywod dilychwin iawn o blith y credinwyr a dilychwin iawn o ferched o blith y rhai sy'n cael yr ysgrythur cyn i chi, pan ydych wedi rhoi iddynt eu iawndal sydd yn ddyledus, dynodir diweirdeb, cyfathrach rywiol yn anghyfreithlon neu gariadon cymryd [gyfrinach]. A pwy bynnag sydd yn gwadu y ffydd-Daeth ei waith yn ddiwerth, ac o hyn ymlaen, bydd ef, yn ymhlith y rhai ar eu colled.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when you rise to [perform] prayer, wash your faces and your forearms to the elbows and wipe over your heads and wash your feet to the ankles. And if you are in a state of janabah, then purify yourselves. But if you are ill or on a journey or one of you comes from the place of relieving himself or you have contacted women and do not find water, then seek clean earth and wipe over your faces and hands with it. Allah does not intend to make difficulty for you, but He intends to purify you and complete His favor upon you that you may be grateful.
trans-unit.target: O Mae chi sydd wedi credu, pan fydd gennych yn codi i [berfformio] gweddi, olchi eich wynebau a mwytho eich i y nerth a sychu dros eich pennau a golchwch eich traed i y fferau sy'n cael. Ac os ydych mewn cyflwr o janabah, yna puro'r eich hunain. Ond os ydych yn sâl neu ar y siwrnai neu daw un ohonoch y lle o leddfu ei hun neu wedi cysylltu â menywod a nad ydych ddod o hyd i ddŵr, ac yna geisio lân y ddaear ac yn sychu dros eich wynebau a dwylo gydag ef. Nid Allah yn bwriadu gwneud anhawster i chi, ond mae'n bwriadu puro'r chi a chwblhau ei favor arnoch chi y gallech fod yn ddiolchgar.

trans-unit.source: And remember the favor of Allah upon you and His covenant with which He bound you when you said, "We hear and we obey"; and fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts.
trans-unit.target: A chofiwch favor Allah ar eich a cyfamod ei y mae ef yn rhwymo chi pan ydych yn dweud, "yr ydym yn clywed ac ufuddhau ydym"; ac ofn Allah. Yn wir, Allah yn gwybod hynny o fewn y bronnau.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, be persistently standing firm for Allah, witnesses in justice, and do not let the hatred of a people prevent you from being just. Be just; that is nearer to righteousness. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
trans-unit.target: O Mae chi sydd wedi credu, bod yn gyson yn sefyll yn gadarn ar gyfer Allah, tystion mewn cyfiawnder, a Peidiwch â gadael y casineb pobl eich atal rhag bod yn unig. Yn unig; Mae hynny'n agosach at chyfiawnder i. Ac ofn Allah; yn wir, yw Allah yn gyfarwydd â beth yr ydych yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: Allah has promised those who believe and do righteous deeds [that] for them there is forgiveness and great reward.
trans-unit.target: Allah wedi addo rhai sy'n credu ac yn gwneud gweithredoedd hoes dabloid [] iddynt bod maddeuant a gwobrwyo mawr.

trans-unit.source: But those who disbelieve and deny Our signs - those are the companions of Hellfire.
trans-unit.target: Ond y rhai a chredu yn gwadu ein arwyddion-rhai yn chymdeithion Hellfire.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, remember the favor of Allah upon you when a people determined to extend their hands [in aggression] against you, but He withheld their hands from you; and fear Allah. And upon Allah let the believers rely.
trans-unit.target: O sydd wedi credu, cofiwch favor Allah arnoch pan fydd pobl yn benderfynol i ymestyn eu dwylo [mewn ymddygiad ymosodol] yn eich erbyn, ond oedd ef yn ei ddal yn ôl eu dwylo ac ofn Allah. A gadewch Allah Mae y credinwyr yn dibynnu arnynt.

trans-unit.source: And Allah had already taken a covenant from the Children of Israel, and We delegated from among them twelve leaders. And Allah said, "I am with you. If you establish prayer and give zakah and believe in My messengers and support them and loan Allah a goodly loan, I will surely remove from you your misdeeds and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow. But whoever of you disbelieves after that has certainly strayed from the soundness of the way."
trans-unit.target: Ac roedd Allah eisoes wedi cymryd cyfamod o blant Israel, a ddirprwywyd gennym o blith eu arweinwyr deuddeg. A dywedodd Allah, "Rwy'n gyda chi. Os ydych yn sefydlu gweddi a rhoi zakah ac yn credu yn fy negeswyr ac yn eu cefnogi ac benthyciad Allah benthyciad reit dda, byddaf yn sicr dynnu oddi ar eich eich camweddau a chi gyfaddef i gerddi o dan y llif afonydd. Ond pwy bynnag ohonoch disbelieves ar ôl bod yn sicr wedi crwydro o'r cadernid y ffordd.

trans-unit.source: So for their breaking of the covenant We cursed them and made their hearts hard. They distort words from their [proper] usages and have forgotten a portion of that of which they were reminded. And you will still observe deceit among them, except a few of them. But pardon them and overlook [their misdeeds]. Indeed, Allah loves the doers of good.
trans-unit.target: Felly ar gyfer eu torri y cyfamod felltithio iddynt a gwneud eu calonnau yn galed. Maent yn ystumio geiriau gan eu defnydd [iawn] ac wedi anghofio cyfran o hwnnw yn cael eu hatgoffa. A bydd eich dal yn arsylwi dichell yn eu plith, ac eithrio ychydig ohonynt. Ond maddeuwch iddynt a diystyru [o'u camweddau]. Yn wir, mae Allah wrth ei bodd phoenwn da.

trans-unit.source: And from those who say, "We are Christians" We took their covenant; but they forgot a portion of that of which they were reminded. So We caused among them animosity and hatred until the Day of Resurrection. And Allah is going to inform them about what they used to do.
trans-unit.target: A gan y rheini sy'n dweud, "Rydym yn Gristnogion" gwnaethom eu cyfamod; ond anghofiodd eu cyfran o hwnnw yn cael eu hatgoffa. Felly rydym yn achosi ymysg eu gelyniaeth a chasineb tan dydd atgyfodi. A yw Allah yn mynd i roi gwybod iddynt am beth y maen nhw'n ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: O People of the Scripture, there has come to you Our Messenger making clear to you much of what you used to conceal of the Scripture and overlooking much. There has come to you from Allah a light and a clear Book.
trans-unit.target: O bobl o'r ysgrythur, wedi dod i chi Messenger ein gwneud clir i chi llawer o beth chi ddefnyddio i guddio o'r ysgrythur y ac anwybyddu llawer. Mae wedi dod i chi oddi wrth Allah golau a llyfr clir.

trans-unit.source: By which Allah guides those who pursue His pleasure to the ways of peace and brings them out from darknesses into the light, by His permission, and guides them to a straight path.
trans-unit.target: Mae Allah hysbysiadau rhai sy'n dilyn ei bleser i ffyrdd o heddwch a dod â nhw o darknesses yn y goleuni, trwy ei ganiatâd, a hysbysiadau iddynt i lwybr syth.

trans-unit.source: They have certainly disbelieved who say that Allah is Christ, the son of Mary. Say, "Then who could prevent Allah at all if He had intended to destroy Christ, the son of Mary, or his mother or everyone on the earth?" And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them. He creates what He wills, and Allah is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: Wedi eu sicr ddysgais sy'n dweud bod Allah yw Crist, mab y Mary. Dweud, "Yna a gallai atal Allah bob os oedd ei fod yn bwriadu dinistrio Crist, mab y Mary, neu fam neu pawb ar y ddaear?" Ac i Allah yn perthyn ddominiwn y nefoedd, y ddaear a beth bynnag sydd rhyngddynt. Mae ef wedi creu ef beth a wills, ac Allah yw'r dros holl bethau yn gymwys.

trans-unit.source: But the Jews and the Christians say, "We are the children of Allah and His beloved." Say, "Then why does He punish you for your sins?" Rather, you are human beings from among those He has created. He forgives whom He wills, and He punishes whom He wills. And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, and to Him is the [final] destination.
trans-unit.target: Ond yr Iddewon a y Cristnogion yn dweud, "Rydym yn blant Allah a ei annwyl." Dweud, "Yna pam yw fod eich cosbi am eich pechodau?" Yn hytrach, yr ydych yn fodau dynol o blith y rhai mae ef wedi creu. Mae ef yn maddau y mae ef yn wills, ac mae ef yn cosbi bwy mae ef wills. Allah yn perthyn iddo ddominiwn y nefoedd a'r ddaear a beth bynnag yw rhyngddynt, ac iddo yn y [daith].

trans-unit.source: O People of the Scripture, there has come to you Our Messenger to make clear to you [the religion] after a period [of suspension] of messengers, lest you say, "There came not to us any bringer of good tidings or a warner." But there has come to you a bringer of good tidings and a warner. And Allah is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: O bobl o'r ysgrythur, wedi dod i chi ein Messenger ei gwneud yn glir i chi [y grefydd] ar ôl cyfnod [o atal] o negeseuwyr, rhag ofn y dywedwch, "yna ddaeth nid i ni bringer unrhyw tidings da neu warner." Ond mae wedi dod i chi bringer o tidings da a warner. A yw Allah dros holl bethau yn gymwys.

trans-unit.source: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Moses said to his people, "O my people, remember the favor of Allah upon you when He appointed among you prophets and made you possessors and gave you that which He had not given anyone among the worlds.
trans-unit.target: A [sôn, O Muhammad], pan ddywedodd Moses at ei bobl, "O fy pobl, cofiwch favor Allah arnoch pan benodwyd ymhlith eich proffwydi a gwneud eich rhentwyr a roddodd ichi sydd wedi ni roddodd unrhyw un ymhlith y fyd.

trans-unit.source: O my people, enter the Holy Land which Allah has assigned to you and do not turn back [from fighting in Allah 's cause] and [thus] become losers."
trans-unit.target: O 'm pobl, y tir sanctaidd, Allah wedi cael eu haseinio i chi wneud ni droi yn ôl [o ymladd yn achos Allah y] a [felly] fod ar eu colled."

trans-unit.source: They said, "O Moses, indeed within it is a people of tyrannical strength, and indeed, we will never enter it until they leave it; but if they leave it, then we will enter."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "Moses O, yn wir o fewn ei yn bobl o nerth tyrannical, ac yn wir, byddwn byth yn mynd yn nes iddynt adael ond os byddant yn gadael iddo, yna byddwn yn mynd.

trans-unit.source: Said two men from those who feared [to disobey] upon whom Allah had bestowed favor, "Enter upon them through the gate, for when you have entered it, you will be predominant. And upon Allah rely, if you should be believers."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd dau ddyn gan y rhai sy'n ofni [torri'r] ar bwy oedd Allah wedi rhoi'r favor, "Rhowch arnynt drwy'r gât, ar gyfer pan rydych wedi'i nodi, y byddwch yn bennaf. A Allah yn dibynnu arnynt, os dylai fod credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: They said, "O Moses, indeed we will not enter it, ever, as long as they are within it; so go, you and your Lord, and fight. Indeed, we are remaining right here."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "O Moses, yn wir bydd ni ddarparwn, erioed, cyhyd ag y maent o fewn Felly ewch, chi a eich Arglwydd, ac ymladd. Yn wir, yr ydym yn weddill yma."

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "My Lord, indeed I do not possess except myself and my brother, so part us from the defiantly disobedient people."
trans-unit.target: [Moses] dywedodd, "Fy Arglwydd, yn wir oes ganddynt heblaw fi fy hun a fy mrawd, felly rhan ohonom gan y bobl defiantly anufudd."

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "Then indeed, it is forbidden to them for forty years [in which] they will wander throughout the land. So do not grieve over the defiantly disobedient people."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd [Allah], "yna yn wir, mae ei yn waharddedig iddynt am ddeugain mlynedd [yn y] Bydd iddyn nhw grwydro drwy gydol y tir. Felly wneud nid galaru dros y bobl defiantly anufudd."

trans-unit.source: And recite to them the story of Adam's two sons, in truth, when they both offered a sacrifice [to Allah], and it was accepted from one of them but was not accepted from the other. Said [the latter], "I will surely kill you." Said [the former], "Indeed, Allah only accepts from the righteous [who fear Him].
trans-unit.target: Ac adrodd iddynt y stori o ddau fab Adam, mewn gwirionedd, pan fydd y ddau yn cynnig aberthu [i Allah], ac fe'i derbyniwyd gan un ohonynt ond ni dderbyniwyd oddi wrth y llall. Dywedodd [yr olaf], 'bydd i siawns yn lladd chi.' Dywedodd [hen], "yn wir, mae'r Allah dim ond derbyn o righteous [sy'n ofni iddo].

trans-unit.source: If you should raise your hand against me to kill me - I shall not raise my hand against you to kill you. Indeed, I fear Allah, Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Os y dylech godi eich llaw yn fy lladd fi-erbyn byddwn ni yn godi fy llaw yn eich lladd chi erbyn. Yn wir, mae arnaf ofn Allah, Arglwydd y byd.

trans-unit.source: Indeed I want you to obtain [thereby] my sin and your sin so you will be among the companions of the Fire. And that is the recompense of wrongdoers."
trans-unit.target: Yn wir yr wyf am ichi gael fy pechod a eich pechod [ac felly] felly byddwch yn ymhlith y cymdeithion y tân. Ac y mae iawndal tramgwyddo.

trans-unit.source: And his soul permitted to him the murder of his brother, so he killed him and became among the losers.
trans-unit.target: A oedd ei enaid yn caniatáu iddo lofruddio ei frawd, felly ei ladd ef a daeth ymhlith y rhai ar eu colled.

trans-unit.source: Then Allah sent a crow searching in the ground to show him how to hide the disgrace of his brother. He said, "O woe to me! Have I failed to be like this crow and hide the body of my brother?" And he became of the regretful.
trans-unit.target: Yna anfonodd Allah crow chwilio yn y ddaear i ddangos sut i guddio gwarth ei frawd ef. Dywedodd, "gwae O i mi! Yr wyf wedi methu fel hwn crow a guddio y corff o fy mrawd?" Ac aeth yn o y destun gofid.

trans-unit.source: Because of that, We decreed upon the Children of Israel that whoever kills a soul unless for a soul or for corruption [done] in the land - it is as if he had slain mankind entirely. And whoever saves one - it is as if he had saved mankind entirely. And our messengers had certainly come to them with clear proofs. Then indeed many of them, [even] after that, throughout the land, were transgressors.
trans-unit.target: Oherwydd hynny, rydym yn datgan ar y plant Israel fod pwy bynnag sy'n lladd enaid oni bai am enaid neu lygredd [wneud] yn y tir-mae'n fel os oedd ef wedi rhoi TAW dynolryw yn gyfan gwbl. A pwy bynnag yn arbed un-mae'n fel pe wedi iddo achub dynolryw yn gyfan gwbl. Ac yn sicr roedd ein negeswyr yn dod atynt gyda proflenni clir. Yna yn wir roedd llawer ohonynt, [hyd yn oed] ar ôl hynny, drwy gydol y tir, yn transgressors.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the penalty for those who wage war against Allah and His Messenger and strive upon earth [to cause] corruption is none but that they be killed or crucified or that their hands and feet be cut off from opposite sides or that they be exiled from the land. That is for them a disgrace in this world; and for them in the Hereafter is a great punishment,
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, y gosb i'r rheini a ryfela yn erbyn Allah a Messenger ei ac ymdrechu ar ddaear [i achosi] llygredigaeth yn dim ond bod iddynt gael eu lladd neu crucified neu eu dwylo a thraed fod yn torri oddi wrth ochr gyferbyn neu maent yn eich alltudio o'r tir. Mae hynny'n iddynt warth yn y byd hwn; ac ar eu cyfer yn y o hyn ymlaen Mae cosb mawr,

trans-unit.source: Except for those who return [repenting] before you apprehend them. And know that Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ac eithrio'r rhai sy'n dychwelyd [bechaduriaid] cyn i chi eu deall. A gwybod bod Allah yn Forgiving a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, fear Allah and seek the means [of nearness] to Him and strive in His cause that you may succeed.
trans-unit.target: O rydych sydd wedi credu, ofn Allah a chwilio am y ffordd [o agosatrwydd] iddo ef ac ymdrechu yn achosi ei efallai byddwch yn llwyddo.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who disbelieve - if they should have all that is in the earth and the like of it with it by which to ransom themselves from the punishment of the Day of Resurrection, it will not be accepted from them, and for them is a painful punishment
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, y rhai a chredu-os dylent gael popeth yn y ddaear ac yn y blaen arno ag ef gan sydd eu hunain yn wystl o gosbi dydd atgyfodi, bydd derbyn oddi wrthynt, ac iddynt hwy yn cosbi boenus

trans-unit.source: They will wish to get out of the Fire, but never are they to emerge therefrom, and for them is an enduring punishment.
trans-unit.target: Bydd dymunant gael allan y tân, ond maent byth i'r golwg thelir, a iddynt yw'r gosb parhaol.

trans-unit.source: [As for] the thief, the male and the female, amputate their hands in recompense for what they committed as a deterrent [punishment] from Allah. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: [Ag] y lleidr, y gwryw a benyw y, amputate eu dwylo mewn ad-daliad am yr hyn y maent yn ymrwymo fel rhwystr [cosbi] gan Allah. A yw i'w Allah mawrygu yn allai a Wise.

trans-unit.source: But whoever repents after his wrongdoing and reforms, indeed, Allah will turn to him in forgiveness. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ond pwy bynnag a edifarhao ar ôl ei gamwedd a diwygiadau, yn wir, Allah bydd droi ato mewn maddeuant. Yn wir, Allah yn Forgiving a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: Do you not know that to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth? He punishes whom He wills and forgives whom He wills, and Allah is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: Nad ydych yn gwybod bod Allah yn perthyn iddo ddominiwn y nefoedd a'r ddaear? Mae ef yn cosbi pwy ef wills a maddau y mae ef yn wills, ac yn Allah dros holl bethau yn gymwys.

trans-unit.source: O Messenger, let them not grieve you who hasten into disbelief of those who say, "We believe" with their mouths, but their hearts believe not, and from among the Jews. [They are] avid listeners to falsehood, listening to another people who have not come to you. They distort words beyond their [proper] usages, saying "If you are given this, take it; but if you are not given it, then beware." But he for whom Allah intends fitnah - never will you possess [power to do] for him a thing against Allah. Those are the ones for whom Allah does not intend to purify their hearts. For them in this world is disgrace, and for them in the Hereafter is a great punishment.
trans-unit.target: O Messenger, gadewch iddynt nid galaru chi sy'n cyflymu i anghrediniaeth o'r rheiny sy'n dweud, "Credwn" â' u cegau, ond mae eu calonnau yn credu ni, ac o blith yr Iddewon. [Maent] gwrandawyr brwd i anwiredd, gwrando ar bobl arall nad ydynt wedi dod i chi. Maent yn ystumio geiriau tu hwnt i eu defnyddio gyfer [iawn], yn dweud "Os ydych yn ystyried hyn, ei gymryd; ond os nad ydych yn cael ei, yna cofiwch." Ond y mae'r Allah yn bwriadu fitnah-byth y bydd meddu ar [pŵer i wneud] iddo ef peth erbyn Allah. Dyma'r rhai am bwy Allah nid yn bwriadu puro'r eu calonnau. Iddynt yn y byd hwn yn warthus, ac ar eu cyfer yn y o hyn ymlaen yn cosbi mawr.

trans-unit.source: [They are] avid listeners to falsehood, devourers of [what is] unlawful. So if they come to you, [O Muhammad], judge between them or turn away from them. And if you turn away from them - never will they harm you at all. And if you judge, judge between them with justice. Indeed, Allah loves those who act justly.
trans-unit.target: [Maent] gwrandawyr brwd i anwiredd, devourers o [sydd] anghyfreithlon. Felly os ydynt yn dod i chi, [O Muhammad], farnu rhyngddynt neu droi oddi arnynt. A os ydych yn galluogi oddi arnynt-byth bydd eu niwed chi o gwbl. Ac os ydych yn barnu, farnu rhyngddynt â chyfiawnder. Yn wir, mae'r Allah wrth ei bodd yn rhai sydd yn gweithredu'n gyfiawn.

trans-unit.source: But how is it that they come to you for judgement while they have the Torah, in which is the judgement of Allah? Then they turn away, [even] after that; but those are not [in fact] believers.
trans-unit.target: Ond y maent yn dod i chi ar gyfer dyfarniad tra bod ganddynt y Torah, y mae y dyfarniad Allah? Yna maent yn troi i ffwrdd, [hyd yn oed] ar ôl hynny; ond nid yw'r [yn wir] credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We sent down the Torah, in which was guidance and light. The prophets who submitted [to Allah] judged by it for the Jews, as did the rabbis and scholars by that with which they were entrusted of the Scripture of Allah, and they were witnesses thereto. So do not fear the people but fear Me, and do not exchange My verses for a small price. And whoever does not judge by what Allah has revealed - then it is those who are the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, rydym yn anfon i lawr y Torah, yr oedd yn canllawiau a golau. Y proffwydi a gyflwynodd [i Allah] barnu yn ôl gan yr Iddewon, fel y gwnaeth rabbis ac ysgolheigion gan hynny y maent yn ymddiried ysgrythur Allah, ac roeddent yn dystion iddi. Felly nid ofni y bobl ond ofn imi, ac nid oes cyfnewid fy penillion am bris bach. Ac nid yw pwy bynnag barnu gan beth Allah wedi datgelu-yna mae'n rhai sydd yn y disbelievers.

trans-unit.source: And We ordained for them therein a life for a life, an eye for an eye, a nose for a nose, an ear for an ear, a tooth for a tooth, and for wounds is legal retribution. But whoever gives [up his right as] charity, it is an expiation for him. And whoever does not judge by what Allah has revealed - then it is those who are the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: A hordeinio iddynt, ynddynt bywyd ar gyfer bywyd, llygad am lygad, trwyn trwyn, clust am glust, dannedd ar gyfer dannedd, ac ar gyfer clwyfau yn dial cyfreithiol. Ond pwy bynnag sy'n rhoi [hyd ei hawl fel] elusen, mae'n expiation iddo. Ac nid yw pwy bynnag barnu gan beth Allah wedi datgelu-yna mae'n rheini y tramgwyddo.

trans-unit.source: And We sent, following in their footsteps, Jesus, the son of Mary, confirming that which came before him in the Torah; and We gave him the Gospel, in which was guidance and light and confirming that which preceded it of the Torah as guidance and instruction for the righteous.
trans-unit.target: A anfonwyd gennym, yn dilyn eu hesiampl, yn cadarnhau Iesu, fab i Mary, a ddaeth ger ei fron yn y Torah; a rhoddodd iddo yr efengyl, yr oedd yn canllawiau a golau ac yn cadarnhau y a'i rhagflaenodd o y Torah fel canllawiau a chyfarwyddiadau ar gyfer y righteous.

trans-unit.source: And let the People of the Gospel judge by what Allah has revealed therein. And whoever does not judge by what Allah has revealed - then it is those who are the defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: A gadael i bobl y barnwr efengyl gan beth Allah wedi datgelu ynddo. Ac nid yw pwy bynnag barnu gan beth Allah wedi datgelu-yna mae'n rhai sy'n defiantly anufudd.

trans-unit.source: And We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], the Book in truth, confirming that which preceded it of the Scripture and as a criterion over it. So judge between them by what Allah has revealed and do not follow their inclinations away from what has come to you of the truth. To each of you We prescribed a law and a method. Had Allah willed, He would have made you one nation [united in religion], but [He intended] to test you in what He has given you; so race to [all that is] good. To Allah is your return all together, and He will [then] inform you concerning that over which you used to differ.
trans-unit.target: Ac yr ydym wedi datgelu i chi, [O Muhammad], y llyfr mewn gwirionedd, cadarnhau a a'i rhagflaenodd yr ysgrythur ac fel maen prawf dros ei. Felly farnu rhyngddynt gan Datgelodd Allah ac nid yn dilyn prawf eu pellter oddi wrth beth wedi dod i chi am y gwir. I bob un ohonoch Rydym yn rhagnodi cyfraith a dull. Roedd Allah ewyllysio iddi, byddai wedi ichi un genedl [Unedig mewn crefydd], ond [oedd yn bwriadu] i chi brofi beth roddodd chi; hil felly i [popeth] da. I Allah yw yn dychwelyd eich gilydd, a fydd ef [] yn sail i chi ynghylch y dros y gwnaethoch eu defnyddio i fod yn wahanol.

trans-unit.source: And judge, [O Muhammad], between them by what Allah has revealed and do not follow their inclinations and beware of them, lest they tempt you away from some of what Allah has revealed to you. And if they turn away - then know that Allah only intends to afflict them with some of their [own] sins. And indeed, many among the people are defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: A barnwr, [O Muhammad], rhwng iddynt gan beth Allah wedi datgelu ac nad ddilyn eu prawf pellter a Gochelwch rhag iddynt, rhag ofn bod eich temtio oddi wrth rai o'r hyn y mae Allah wedi datgelu i chi. Ac os maent yn troi i ffwrdd-yna gwybod bod Allah yn unig yn bwriadu effeithio arnynt gyda rhai o bechodau eu [ei hun]. Ac yn wir, mae llawer ymhlith y bobl yn defiantly anufudd.

trans-unit.source: Then is it the judgement of [the time of] ignorance they desire? But who is better than Allah in judgement for a people who are certain [in faith].
trans-unit.target: Yna mae ei barn am [amser] anwybodaeth y maent yn eu dymuno? Ond sydd yn well na Allah mewn dyfarniad ar gyfer pobl sy'n rhai [mewn ffydd].

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not take the Jews and the Christians as allies. They are [in fact] allies of one another. And whoever is an ally to them among you - then indeed, he is [one] of them. Indeed, Allah guides not the wrongdoing people.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, nid ydynt yn yr Iddewon a Cristnogion fel cynghreiriaid. [Yn wir], maent yn gynghreiriaid un arall. A phwy bynnag cynghreiriad iddynt ymhlith chi-yna yn wir, ef yw [un] ohonynt. Yn wir, mae'r Allah yn tywys nid y bobl gamwedd.

trans-unit.source: So you see those in whose hearts is disease hastening into [association with] them, saying, "We are afraid a misfortune may strike us." But perhaps Allah will bring conquest or a decision from Him, and they will become, over what they have been concealing within themselves, regretful.
trans-unit.target: Fel y gwelwch hynny yn eu calonnau Mae clefyd yn prysuro i [Cymdeithas gyda] iddynt, yn dweud, "yr ydym yn ofni efallai yn anffawd yn taro ein." Ond efallai y bydd Allah yn dod â goresgyniad neu benderfyniad oddi wrtho, a byddant yn, dros beth y mae wedi'u cuddio o fewn eu hunain, destun gofid.

trans-unit.source: And those who believe will say, "Are these the ones who swore by Allah their strongest oaths that indeed they were with you?" Their deeds have become worthless, and they have become losers.
trans-unit.target: A'r rhai sydd yn credu bydd yn dweud, "hyn yw'r rhai sydd arnyn gan Allah eu llwon cryfaf yn wir eu bod gyda chi?" Mae eu gweithredoedd wedi dod yn ddiwerth, ac maent wedi dod ar eu colled.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, whoever of you should revert from his religion - Allah will bring forth [in place of them] a people He will love and who will love Him [who are] humble toward the believers, powerful against the disbelievers; they strive in the cause of Allah and do not fear the blame of a critic. That is the favor of Allah; He bestows it upon whom He wills. And Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, pwy bynnag ohonoch fod o fantais gan ei crefydd-Allah ddod ymlaen [lle iddynt] fydd Mae cariad a bydd sy'n caru ef [sydd] yn wylaidd tuag at y credinwyr, yn rymus yn erbyn y disbelievers; maent yn ymdrechu yn achos Allah ac nid ofni y bai o feirniad. Dyna favor Allah; Mae ef yn ei roi ei y mae ef wills. Ac Allah yn hollgynhwysol a gwybod.

trans-unit.source: Your ally is none but Allah and [therefore] His Messenger and those who have believed - those who establish prayer and give zakah, and they bow [in worship].
trans-unit.target: Eich gynghreiriad yw dim ond Allah a [felly] ei negesydd a rhai sydd wedi credu-y rhai sy'n sefydlu gweddi a rhoi zakah, a Plygant [yn addoli].

trans-unit.source: And whoever is an ally of Allah and His Messenger and those who have believed - indeed, the party of Allah - they will be the predominant.
trans-unit.target: A pwy bynnag cynghreiriad Allah a Messenger ei a rhai sydd wedi credu-yn wir, y blaid Allah-bydd Prif.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, take not those who have taken your religion in ridicule and amusement among the ones who were given the Scripture before you nor the disbelievers as allies. And fear Allah, if you should [truly] be believers.
trans-unit.target: O sydd wedi credu, cymerwch nid y rhai sydd wedi eich crefydd mewn gwawd a difyrion ymhlith y rhai a rhoddwyd yr ysgrythur cyn i chi nac y disbelievers fel cynghreiriaid. Ac ofn Allah, os [yn wir] Dylech fod credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: And when you call to prayer, they take it in ridicule and amusement. That is because they are a people who do not use reason.
trans-unit.target: A pan fyddwch yn ffonio i weddi, maent yn cymryd ei mewn gwawd a diddanwch. Mae hynny oherwydd eu bod yn bobl nad ydynt yn defnyddio'r rheswm.

trans-unit.source: Say, "O People of the Scripture, do you resent us except [for the fact] that we have believed in Allah and what was revealed to us and what was revealed before and because most of you are defiantly disobedient?"
trans-unit.target: Ddweud, "O bobl yr ysgrythur, wneud hynny'n eich digio wrthym ac eithrio [ar gyfer y ffaith] yr ydym wedi credu yn Allah a hyn a ddatgelwyd i ni a beth a datgelwyd cyn ac oherwydd bod rhan fwyaf ohonoch yn defiantly anufudd?"

trans-unit.source: Say, "Shall I inform you of [what is] worse than that as penalty from Allah? [It is that of] those whom Allah has cursed and with whom He became angry and made of them apes and pigs and slaves of Taghut. Those are worse in position and further astray from the sound way."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Byddaf yn eich hysbysu o'r [sydd] yn waeth na hynny fel cosb gan Allah? [Ei] rhai bwy Allah wedi melltithio, a gyda phwy Daeth ddig ac yn gwneud iddynt epaod a moch a caethweision o Taghut. Rhai yn waeth mewn sefyllfa ac ymhellach ar gyfeiliorn oddi ar y ffordd gadarn.

trans-unit.source: And when they come to you, they say, "We believe." But they have entered with disbelief [in their hearts], and they have certainly left with it. And Allah is most knowing of what they were concealing.
trans-unit.target: A pan fyddant yn dod i chi, maent yn dweud, "Rydym yn credu." Ond maen nhw'n dechrau gydag anghrediniaeth [yn eu calonnau], ac yn sicr maent wedi gadael ag ef. A Allah yw'r rhan fwyaf o wybod beth y maent yn cuddio.

trans-unit.source: And you see many of them hastening into sin and aggression and the devouring of [what is] unlawful. How wretched is what they have been doing.
trans-unit.target: A ydych yn gweld llawer ohonynt yn prysuro i pechod ac ymddygiad ymosodol a devouring o [sydd] anghyfreithlon. Sut truenus yw beth y maent wedi ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: Why do the rabbis and religious scholars not forbid them from saying what is sinful and devouring what is unlawful? How wretched is what they have been practicing.
trans-unit.target: Pam gwneud y rabbis ac mae ysgolheigion crefyddol Nid a'n gwaredo rhag dweud beth yw sinful a devouring hyn yn anghyfreithlon? Truenus sut mae hyn wedi bod yn ymarfer.

trans-unit.source: And the Jews say, "The hand of Allah is chained." Chained are their hands, and cursed are they for what they say. Rather, both His hands are extended; He spends however He wills. And that which has been revealed to you from your Lord will surely increase many of them in transgression and disbelief. And We have cast among them animosity and hatred until the Day of Resurrection. Every time they kindled the fire of war [against you], Allah extinguished it. And they strive throughout the land [causing] corruption, and Allah does not like corrupters.
trans-unit.target: A dywed yr Iddewon, "yn y llaw Allah chlymu." Chadwyno yn eu dwylo, a felltithio a ydynt ar gyfer beth y maent yn ei ddweud. Yn hytrach, estynnir ddau ei ddwylo; Mae'n treulio Fodd bynnag y mae ef wills. Ac sydd wedi cael ei ddatgelu i chi gan eich Arglwydd bydd siawns yn cynyddu llawer ohonynt yn tramgwyddiad ac anghrediniaeth. Ac y mae yn bwrw yn eu plith drwgdeimlad a chasineb tan dydd atgyfodi. Bob tro y maent yn kindled y tân rhyfel [yn erbyn eich], roedd Allah yn diffodd ei. Ac maent yn ymdrechu drwy gydol y llygredd tir [achosi], ac nad yw Allah yn hoffi corrupters.

trans-unit.source: And if only the People of the Scripture had believed and feared Allah, We would have removed from them their misdeeds and admitted them to Gardens of Pleasure.
trans-unit.target: A os mai dim ond pobl yr ysgrythurau wedi credu ac yn ofni Allah, byddai wedi tynnu oddi ar eu eu camweddau a dderbynnir hwy i gerddi pleser.

trans-unit.source: And if only they upheld [the law of] the Torah, the Gospel, and what has been revealed to them from their Lord, they would have consumed [provision] from above them and from beneath their feet. Among them are a moderate community, but many of them - evil is that which they do.
trans-unit.target: Ac os mai dim ond oedd yn cael eu cadarnhau [cyfraith] y Torah, yr efengyl, ac mae'r hyn a ddatgelwyd iddynt gan eu yr Arglwydd, eu byddai wedi hyfed [ddarpariaeth] Fry a torri eu traed. Yn eu plith mae cymuned cymedrol, ond llawer ohonynt-mae drygioni a wnânt.

trans-unit.source: O Messenger, announce that which has been revealed to you from your Lord, and if you do not, then you have not conveyed His message. And Allah will protect you from the people. Indeed, Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.
trans-unit.target: O Messenger, gyhoeddi sydd wedi cael ei ddatgelu i chi gan eich Arglwydd, ac os nad ydych, yna yr ydych nid cyfleu ei neges. A bydd Allah yn eich diogelu rhag y bobl. Yn wir, yw Allah nid canllaw y bobl disbelieving.

trans-unit.source: Say, "O People of the Scripture, you are [standing] on nothing until you uphold [the law of] the Torah, the Gospel, and what has been revealed to you from your Lord." And that which has been revealed to you from your Lord will surely increase many of them in transgression and disbelief. So do not grieve over the disbelieving people.
trans-unit.target: Ddweud, "O bobl yr ysgrythur, chi [sefyll] ar ddim nes arddelwch [cyfraith] y Torah, yr efengyl, ac mae'r hyn a ddatgelwyd i chi gan eich Arglwydd." Ac sydd wedi cael ei ddatgelu i chi gan eich Arglwydd bydd siawns yn cynyddu llawer ohonynt yn tramgwyddiad ac anghrediniaeth. Felly wneud nid galaru dros y bobl disbelieving.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who have believed [in Prophet Muhammad] and those [before Him] who were Jews or Sabeans or Christians - those [among them] who believed in Allah and the Last Day and did righteousness - no fear will there be concerning them, nor will they grieve.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, y rheini sydd wedi credu [yn Proffwyd Muhammad] a rhai [cyn iddo] oedd yn Iddewon neu Sabeans neu Cristnogion-rhai [rhyngddynt] a gredai yn Allah ac yn y dydd diwethaf a oedd chyfiawnder i-bydd unrhyw ofn yno yn ymwneud â hwy, na bydd iddynt alaru.

trans-unit.source: We had already taken the covenant of the Children of Israel and had sent to them messengers. Whenever there came to them a messenger with what their souls did not desire, a party [of messengers] they denied, and another party they killed.
trans-unit.target: Rydym eisoes wedi cymryd y cyfamod plant Israel, ac wedi anfon i negeswyr iddynt. Pryd bynnag y deuai iddynt negesydd gyda eu heneidiau beth oedd dymuniad nid, parti [o negeswyr] eu hamddifadu, a plaid arall iddynt gael eu lladd.

trans-unit.source: And they thought there would be no [resulting] punishment, so they became blind and deaf. Then Allah turned to them in forgiveness; then [again] many of them became blind and deaf. And Allah is Seeing of what they do.
trans-unit.target: Ac y credent y byddai unrhyw gosb [dilynol], felly daethant yn ddall ac yn fyddar. Yna trodd Allah iddynt mewn maddeuant; yna [eto] llawer ohonynt Daeth yn ddall ac yn fyddar. A yw Allah yn gweld yr hyn y maent yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: They have certainly disbelieved who say, "Allah is the Messiah, the son of Mary" while the Messiah has said, "O Children of Israel, worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord." Indeed, he who associates others with Allah - Allah has forbidden him Paradise, and his refuge is the Fire. And there are not for the wrongdoers any helpers.
trans-unit.target: Wedi eu sicr ddysgais sy'n dweud, "Allah yw y Meseia, mab y Mary" tra y mae y Messiah yn dweud, "O plant Israel, addoli Allah, fy Arglwydd a eich Arglwydd." Yn wir, ef a associates eraill gyda Allah-Allah wedi gwahardd iddo baradwys, ac mae ei loches yn y tân. Ac nid oes ar gyfer y tramgwyddo unrhyw gynorthwywyr.

trans-unit.source: They have certainly disbelieved who say, "Allah is the third of three." And there is no god except one God. And if they do not desist from what they are saying, there will surely afflict the disbelievers among them a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Wedi eu sicr ddysgais sy'n dweud, "Allah yw y trydydd o dri." Ac nid oes Duw ac eithrio un Duw. Ac os wneud iddynt beidio ag ymatal rhag beth maent yn ei ddweud, mae fydd yn sicr yn taro'r disbelievers yn eu plith cosb poenus.

trans-unit.source: So will they not repent to Allah and seek His forgiveness? And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Felly ni byddant yn edifarhau i Allah a ofyn ei faddeuant? Ac Allah yn Forgiving a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: The Messiah, son of Mary, was not but a messenger; [other] messengers have passed on before him. And his mother was a supporter of truth. They both used to eat food. Look how We make clear to them the signs; then look how they are deluded.
trans-unit.target: Nid oedd y Meseia, mab Mary, ond negesydd; Mae negeswyr [arall] wedi pasio cyn iddo. Ac roedd ei fam yn gefnogwr o wirionedd. Defnyddio'r ddau i fwyta bwyd. Edrych sut y gwnawn clir iddynt yr arwyddion; yna yn edrych sut y maent yn eich.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Do you worship besides Allah that which holds for you no [power of] harm or benefit while it is Allah who is the Hearing, the Knowing?"
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Wneud ydych yn addoli ar wahân i Allah hynny sy'n dal i chi oes [pŵer o] niwed neu fudd tra mae'n Allah sydd yn y gwrandawiad, y mae gwybod?"

trans-unit.source: Say, "O People of the Scripture, do not exceed limits in your religion beyond the truth and do not follow the inclinations of a people who had gone astray before and misled many and have strayed from the soundness of the way."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "pobl O o'r ysgrythur, yn fwy na terfynau yn eich crefydd tu hwnt y gwir ac nid yn dilyn prawf pellter o bobl a oedd wedi mynd ar gyfeiliorn cyn ac wedi camarwain llawer ac wedi crwydro o'r cadernid y ffordd."

trans-unit.source: Cursed were those who disbelieved among the Children of Israel by the tongue of David and of Jesus, the son of Mary. That was because they disobeyed and [habitually] transgressed.
trans-unit.target: Felltithio oedd y rhai a ddysgais ymhlith plant Israel gan y tafod o David a Iesu, fab i Mary. Yr oedd oherwydd maent yn disobeyed ac yn camweddu [yn gyson].

trans-unit.source: They used not to prevent one another from wrongdoing that they did. How wretched was that which they were doing.
trans-unit.target: Roeddent yn defnyddio nid i un arall yn ei atal rhag gamwedd a wnaethant. Sut truenus oedd yr oeddent yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: You see many of them becoming allies of those who disbelieved. How wretched is that which they have put forth for themselves in that Allah has become angry with them, and in the punishment they will abide eternally.
trans-unit.target: Byddwch yn gweld llawer ohonynt cynghreiriaid yn dod yn rhai sy'n ddysgais. Sut truenus yw bod y maent wedi rhoi blaen eu hunain fod Allah wedi dod yn ddig gyda hwy, ac yn cosbi y bydd glynu fythol.

trans-unit.source: And if they had believed in Allah and the Prophet and in what was revealed to him, they would not have taken them as allies; but many of them are defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: Ac os oedd eu bod yn credu mewn Allah a y Proffwyd a beth a datgelwyd iddo, byddai wedi cymryd hwy fel cynghreiriaid; ond mae llawer ohonynt yn defiantly anufudd.

trans-unit.source: You will surely find the most intense of the people in animosity toward the believers [to be] the Jews and those who associate others with Allah; and you will find the nearest of them in affection to the believers those who say, "We are Christians." That is because among them are priests and monks and because they are not arrogant.
trans-unit.target: Sicr cewch bobl fwyaf dwys yn drwgdeimlad tuag at y credinwyr [i] yr Iddewon a'r rhai sy'n cysylltu eraill â Allah; a gwelwch agosaf ohonynt mewn anwyldeb tuag at y credinwyr rheini sydd yn dweud, "Rydym yn Gristnogion." Mae hynny oherwydd yn eu plith mae offeiriaid a mynachod a oherwydd nid ydynt yn drahaus.

trans-unit.source: And when they hear what has been revealed to the Messenger, you see their eyes overflowing with tears because of what they have recognized of the truth. They say, "Our Lord, we have believed, so register us among the witnesses.
trans-unit.target: A pan fyddant yn clywed beth wedi cael ei ddatgelu i y negesydd, y gwelwch eu llygaid dagrau yn orlawn o oherwydd beth maent wedi cydnabod y gwirionedd. Maent yn dweud, "ein Arglwydd, yr ydym yn credu, felly gofrestru ein ymysg y tystion.

trans-unit.source: And why should we not believe in Allah and what has come to us of the truth? And we aspire that our Lord will admit us [to Paradise] with the righteous people."
trans-unit.target: A Pam dylem ni chredwn mewn Allah a beth wedi dod i ni am y gwir? A gobeithiwn y bydd ein Arglwydd yn cyfaddef inni [i baradwys] gyda'r bobl hoes dabloid.

trans-unit.source: So Allah rewarded them for what they said with gardens [in Paradise] beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. And that is the reward of doers of good.
trans-unit.target: Felly roedd Allah yn gwobrwyo iddynt am yr hyn maent yn ei ddweud gyda gerddi [yn baradwys] o dan y llif afonydd, yn lle eu bod yn cadw fythol. A dyna y wobr o dudalenau da.

trans-unit.source: But those who disbelieved and denied Our signs - they are the companions of Hellfire.
trans-unit.target: Ond y rhai sy'n gwrthod ein arwyddion-a ddysgais maent yn gyd-deithwyr Hellfire.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not prohibit the good things which Allah has made lawful to you and do not transgress. Indeed, Allah does not like transgressors.
trans-unit.target: O ydych sydd wedi credu, yn gwahardd y pethau da sydd Allah wedi gwneud yn gyfreithlon i chi ac nid ydych yn camddefnyddio'u. Yn wir, nid Allah yn hoffi transgressors.

trans-unit.source: And eat of what Allah has provided for you [which is] lawful and good. And fear Allah, in whom you are believers.
trans-unit.target: A bwyta o beth mae Allah wedi darparu i chi [sydd] gyfreithlon a da. Ac ofn Allah, yn bwy ydych credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: Allah will not impose blame upon you for what is meaningless in your oaths, but He will impose blame upon you for [breaking] what you intended of oaths. So its expiation is the feeding of ten needy people from the average of that which you feed your [own] families or clothing them or the freeing of a slave. But whoever cannot find [or afford it] - then a fast of three days [is required]. That is the expiation for oaths when you have sworn. But guard your oaths. Thus does Allah make clear to you His verses that you may be grateful.
trans-unit.target: Ni bydd Allah yn gosod bai arnoch chi am beth yn ddiystyr yn eich llwon, ond bydd gosod bai arnoch am [Torri] beth yr ydych yn bwriadu llwon. Felly mae ei expiation yn bwydo deg o bobl anghenus o'r cyfartaledd o hynny yr ydych chi fwydo eich [ei hun] teuluoedd neu dillad iddynt neu ryddhau caethion. Ond pwy bynnag ni allwn ddod o hyd i [neu ei fforddio]-yna cyflym o dri diwrnod [Mae angen]. Dyna y expiation ar gyfer llwon pan ydych wedi tyngu. Ond gochel eich llwon. Felly yw Allah gwneud yn glir i chi ei penillion y gallech fod yn ddiolchgar.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, indeed, intoxicants, gambling, [sacrificing on] stone alters [to other than Allah], and divining arrows are but defilement from the work of Satan, so avoid it that you may be successful.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, yn wir, sylweddau meddwol, gamblo, [aberthu ar] Mae'r garreg yn newid [i eraill na Allah], ac yn saethau divining ond defilement o'r gwaith o Satan, felly osgoi y gallech fod yn llwyddiannus.

trans-unit.source: Satan only wants to cause between you animosity and hatred through intoxicants and gambling and to avert you from the remembrance of Allah and from prayer. So will you not desist?
trans-unit.target: Mae Satan yn unig am i achosi rhwng eich drwgdeimlad a chasineb drwy sylweddau meddwol a gamblo ac i osgoi eich cofio Allah a gweddi. Felly bydd gennych nid yn ymatal?

trans-unit.source: And obey Allah and obey the Messenger and beware. And if you turn away - then know that upon Our Messenger is only [the responsibility for] clear notification.
trans-unit.target: A ufuddhau Allah a ufuddhau y negesydd a byddwch yn ofalus. Os ydych yn galluogi i ffwrdd-yna gwybod bod ar ein Messenger yn unig [y cyfrifoldeb dros] hysbysiad yn glir.

trans-unit.source: There is not upon those who believe and do righteousness [any] blame concerning what they have eaten [in the past] if they [now] fear Allah and believe and do righteous deeds, and then fear Allah and believe, and then fear Allah and do good; and Allah loves the doers of good.
trans-unit.target: Nid oes ar y rhai sy'n credu ac a chyfiawnder i [] bai ynghylch beth maent wedi ei fwyta [yn y gorffennol] Os [nawr] ofn Allah a credu a gwnânt gweithredoedd cyfiawn, ac yna ofn Allah a yn credu, ac yna ofn Allah ac wneud daioni; ac mae Allah yn dwlu phoenwn da.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, Allah will surely test you through something of the game that your hands and spears [can] reach, that Allah may make evident those who fear Him unseen. And whoever transgresses after that - for him is a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, Allah bydd siawns eich profi drwy rhywbeth o'r gêm a eich dwylo a gwaywffyn [Gall] yn cyrraedd, y caiff Allah wneud amlwg rhai sy'n ofni iddo unseen. A pwy bynnag pechu ar ôl hynny-iddo yn cosbi poenus.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not kill game while you are in the state of ihram. And whoever of you kills it intentionally - the penalty is an equivalent from sacrificial animals to what he killed, as judged by two just men among you as an offering [to Allah] delivered to the Ka'bah, or an expiation: the feeding of needy people or the equivalent of that in fasting, that he may taste the consequence of his deed. Allah has pardoned what is past; but whoever returns [to violation], then Allah will take retribution from him. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, wneud nid lladd gêm tra byddwch yn y wladwriaeth o ihram. A pwy bynnag ohonoch ei lladd yn fwriadol-y gosb yn gyfatebol o anifeiliaid aberthol i iddo gael ei ladd, fel y barnwyd gan ddau dynion yn unig eich plith fel cynnig [i Allah] i y Ka'bah, neu expiation: bwydo pobl anghenus neu gyfwerth â hynny yn ymprydio, efallai ei fod yn blasu o ganlyniad i weithred ei. Mae Allah yn pardoned hyn sydd yn y gorffennol; ond pwy bynnag a dychwelyd [i groes], yna bydd Allah yn cymryd dial oddi wrtho. A yw i'w Allah mawrygu yn allai a'r perchennog dial.

trans-unit.source: Lawful to you is game from the sea and its food as provision for you and the travelers, but forbidden to you is game from the land as long as you are in the state of ihram. And fear Allah to whom you will be gathered.
trans-unit.target: Gyfreithlon i chi gêm o'r môr a bwyd ei fel darpariaeth i chi ac y teithwyr, ond ni chaniateir i chi gêm oddi wrth y tir cyn belled â'u ydych mewn cyflwr ihram. Ac ofn y cesglir eich Allah.

trans-unit.source: Allah has made the Ka'bah, the Sacred House, standing for the people and [has sanctified] the sacred months and the sacrificial animals and the garlands [by which they are identified]. That is so you may know that Allah knows what is in the heavens and what is in the earth and that Allah is Knowing of all things.
trans-unit.target: Mae'r Allah wedi gwneud y Ka'bah, y Tŷ sanctaidd, y bobl yn sefyll ac [wedi cyfiawnhau] y mis sanctaidd ac anifeiliaid aberthol a y llawryfon [y cawsant eu dynodi]. Dyna felly efallai y gwyddoch bod Allah yn gwybod beth sydd yn y nefoedd a beth sydd yn y ddaear a bod Allah yn gwybod am yr holl bethau.

trans-unit.source: Know that Allah is severe in penalty and that Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Gwybod bod Allah yn difrifol mewn cosb a bod Allah yn Forgiving ac yn Merciful.

trans-unit.source: Not upon the Messenger is [responsibility] except [for] notification. And Allah knows whatever you reveal and whatever you conceal.
trans-unit.target: Nid ar y negesydd [cyfrifoldeb yw] ac eithrio [am] hysbysiad. A gwyr Allah beth bynnag yr ydych yn ei ddatgelu a beth bynnag yr ydych yn ei guddio.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Not equal are the evil and the good, although the abundance of evil might impress you." So fear Allah, O you of understanding, that you may be successful.
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Nid cyfartal yn y drwg a'r da, er efallai y digonedd o ddrygioni bwysleisio chi." Felly ofn Allah, O eich dealltwriaeth, sydd efallai yn llwyddiannus.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not ask about things which, if they are shown to you, will distress you. But if you ask about them while the Qur'an is being revealed, they will be shown to you. Allah has pardoned that which is past; and Allah is Forgiving and Forbearing.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, nid gofyn am y pethau sydd, os dangosir nhw i chi, bydd drallod chi. Ond os ydych yn gofyn amdanynt tra yn y Qur'an yn cael ei datgelu, bydd eu dangos i chi. Mae Allah yn pardoned sydd yn y gorffennol; ac Allah yn Forgiving a Forbearing.

trans-unit.source: A people asked such [questions] before you; then they became thereby disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Pobl wedi gofyn cwestiynau o'r fath [] cyn i chi; yna daethant gan disbelievers.

trans-unit.source: Allah has not appointed [such innovations as] bahirah or sa'ibah or wasilah or ham. But those who disbelieve invent falsehood about Allah, and most of them do not reason.
trans-unit.target: Mae'r Allah nad penodi [mentrau o'r fath fel] bahirah neu sa'ibah neu wasilah neu ham. Ond mae rhai a chredu yn dyfeisio anwiredd am Allah, ac yn gwneud rhan fwyaf ohonynt heb reswm.

trans-unit.source: And when it is said to them, "Come to what Allah has revealed and to the Messenger," they say, "Sufficient for us is that upon which we found our fathers." Even though their fathers knew nothing, nor were they guided?
trans-unit.target: A phan ddywedir iddynt, "Dod i beth Allah wedi datgelu a Messenger," maent yn dweud, "Digonol i ni yw bod y cawsom ein tadau." Hyd yn oed os oedd eu tadau yn gwybod dim, nac yn eu harwain?

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, upon you is [responsibility for] yourselves. Those who have gone astray will not harm you when you have been guided. To Allah is you return all together; then He will inform you of what you used to do.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, chi yw [cyfrifoldeb am] eich hunain. Nid pan ydych wedi bod yn arwain y bydd rhai sydd wedi mynd ar gyfeiliorn niwed ichi. I Allah yw eich dychwelyd cyfan at ei gilydd; yna bydd yn eich hysbysu ynghylch beth yr ydych yn ei defnyddio i wneud.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, testimony [should be taken] among you when death approaches one of you at the time of bequest - [that of] two just men from among you or two others from outside if you are traveling through the land and the disaster of death should strike you. Detain them after the prayer and let them both swear by Allah if you doubt [their testimony, saying], "We will not exchange our oath for a price, even if he should be a near relative, and we will not withhold the testimony of Allah. Indeed, we would then be of the sinful."
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, dyst [dylid cymryd] ymysg chi pan mae marwolaeth un o'r eich dulliau ar adeg gymynrodd-[sef] dynion dim ond dau o blith chi neu ddau eraill o'r tu allan os ydych yn teithio drwy y tir a dylai y drychineb o farwolaeth streic chi. Eu cadw ar ôl y weddi a gadewch iddynt dyngu gan Allah os oes gennych amheuaeth [eu dyst, dweud], "bydd nid gyfnewid ein llw am bris, hyd yn oed os dylai fod yn berthynas agos, a bydd fyddwn yn atal y dystiolaeth gan Allah. Yn wir, yna byddai gennym o y sinful."

trans-unit.source: But if it is found that those two were guilty of perjury, let two others stand in their place [who are] foremost [in claim] from those who have a lawful right. And let them swear by Allah, "Our testimony is truer than their testimony, and we have not transgressed. Indeed, we would then be of the wrongdoers."
trans-unit.target: Ond os gwelir bod y ddau yn euog o anudon, gadewch ddwy eraill sefyll yn eu lle [sydd] flaenaf [yn hawlio] gan y rheini sydd â hawl gyfreithlon. A gadewch iddynt Mae rhegi gan Allah, "ein dyst yn fwy gwir na wed, ac yr ydym ni camweddu. Yn wir, yna byddai gennym o y tramgwyddo."

trans-unit.source: That is more likely that they will give testimony according to its [true] objective, or [at least] they would fear that [other] oaths might be taken after their oaths. And fear Allah and listen; and Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
trans-unit.target: Mae hynny'n fwy tebygol y byddant yn rhoi dyst yn ôl ei [gwir] amcan, neu [o leiaf] y byddent yn ofni y gallai llwon [arall] yn cael eu cymryd ar ôl eu llwon. Ac ofn Allah a gwrando; ac nid yw Allah yn arwain y bobl defiantly anufudd.

trans-unit.source: [Be warned of] the Day when Allah will assemble the messengers and say, "What was the response you received?" They will say, "We have no knowledge. Indeed, it is You who is Knower of the unseen"
trans-unit.target: [Rhybuddio o] y dydd pan y bydd Allah yn cydosod y negeswyr a dweud, "Beth oedd yr ymateb a gawsoch?" Byddant yn dweud, "Mae gennym ddim gwybodaeth. Yn wir, mae'n chi pwy yw Knower unseen y"

trans-unit.source: [The Day] when Allah will say, "O Jesus, Son of Mary, remember My favor upon you and upon your mother when I supported you with the Pure Spirit and you spoke to the people in the cradle and in maturity; and [remember] when I taught you writing and wisdom and the Torah and the Gospel; and when you designed from clay [what was] like the form of a bird with My permission, then you breathed into it, and it became a bird with My permission; and you healed the blind and the leper with My permission; and when you brought forth the dead with My permission; and when I restrained the Children of Israel from [killing] you when you came to them with clear proofs and those who disbelieved among them said, "This is not but obvious magic."
trans-unit.target: [Y dydd] pan bydd Allah yn dweud, "O Iesu, mab Mary, cofio fy favor arnoch chi ac ar eich mam wrth imi eich cefnogi gyda ysbryd pur a siaradodd i bobl yn y crud ac yn aeddfedu; a [cofio] pan oeddwn yn dysgu chi ysgrifennu a doethineb a y Torah ac efengyl; a pan y cynlluniwyd o glai [beth oedd] fel y ffurflen o adar gyda fy caniatâd, yna roedd chi hanadlu i mewn iddo, a daeth adar gyda fy caniatâd; ac roedd chi wella y Deillion a leper fy caniatâd; a phan y daeth eich blaen y meirw gyda fy caniatâd; ac wrth fy atal plant Israel rhag [lladd] Dywedodd chi pan ddaethoch iddynt â proflenni clir a'r rhai a ddysgais yn eu plith, "Hwn nid yw ond amlwg hud."

trans-unit.source: And [remember] when I inspired to the disciples, "Believe in Me and in My messenger Jesus." They said, "We have believed, so bear witness that indeed we are Muslims [in submission to Allah]."
trans-unit.target: A [cofio] pan fy ysbrydoli i y disciples, "Credu mewn mi ac yn fy negesydd Iesu." Maent yn dweud, "yr ydym wedi credu, fel arth tyst yn wir ein bod yn Foslemiaid [yn y cyflwyniad i Allah]."

trans-unit.source: [And remember] when the disciples said, "O Jesus, Son of Mary, can your Lord send down to us a table [spread with food] from the heaven? [Jesus] said," Fear Allah, if you should be believers."
trans-unit.target: [A cofio] pan ddywedodd y disciples, "O Iesu, mab Mary, gall eich anfon yr Arglwydd i lawr i ni Tabl [lledaenu gyda bwyd] gan y nefoedd? [Iesu] dywedodd,"ofn Allah, os dylai fod credinwyr."

trans-unit.source: They said, "We wish to eat from it and let our hearts be reassured and know that you have been truthful to us and be among its witnesses."
trans-unit.target: Maent yn dweud, "dymunwn i fwyta ohono a gadael ein calonnau fod yn dawel eu a gwybod eich bod wedi bod yn onest â ni ac ymhlith ei dystion."

trans-unit.source: Said Jesus, the son of Mary, "O Allah, our Lord, send down to us a table [spread with food] from the heaven to be for us a festival for the first of us and the last of us and a sign from You. And provide for us, and You are the best of providers."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd Iesu, fab i Mary, "O Allah, ein Arglwydd, anfon i lawr i ni Tabl [lledaenu gyda bwyd] o'r nefoedd i fod i ni yn ŵyl ar gyfer y cyntaf inni a'r olaf ohonom ac arwydd oddi wrthych. A darparu i ni, a ydych yn y darparwyr gorau."

trans-unit.source: Allah said, "Indeed, I will sent it down to you, but whoever disbelieves afterwards from among you - then indeed will I punish him with a punishment by which I have not punished anyone among the worlds."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd Allah, "Gwnaf yn wir, ei hanfon i lawr i chi, ond pwy bynnag disbelieves wedyn o blith chi-yna yn wir bydd yn cosbi ef gyda cosb y mae yr nid cosbi unrhyw un ymhlith y fyd."

trans-unit.source: And [beware the Day] when Allah will say, "O Jesus, Son of Mary, did you say to the people, 'Take me and my mother as deities besides Allah?'" He will say, "Exalted are You! It was not for me to say that to which I have no right. If I had said it, You would have known it. You know what is within myself, and I do not know what is within Yourself. Indeed, it is You who is Knower of the unseen.
trans-unit.target: A [Gochelwch rhag y dydd] pan bydd Allah yn dweud, "oedd O Iesu, mab Mary, yr ydych yn dweud y bobl, 'cymryd fi a fy mam fel duwdod ar wahân i Allah?'" Bydd ef yn dweud, "i'w mawrygu ydych! Nid oedd i mi ddweud bod y mae unrhyw hawl. Os oedd yn dweud hynny, byddech yn gwybod hynny. Gwyddoch beth yw o fewn fy hun, ac nid wyf yn gwybod beth yw o fewn eich hun. Yn wir, mae'n chi pwy yw Knower y unseen.

trans-unit.source: I said not to them except what You commanded me - to worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord. And I was a witness over them as long as I was among them; but when You took me up, You were the Observer over them, and You are, over all things, Witness.
trans-unit.target: Dywedais nid ar eu cyfer ac eithrio beth yr ydych yn gyfrifol am fi-i addoli Allah, fy Arglwydd a eich Arglwydd. Ac yr oeddwn yn dyst dros iddynt cyhyd ag yr oeddwn yn mysg; ond pan ymgymerodd chi â mi i, yr oeddech yn yr Observer drostynt, a ydych, dros holl bethau, tyst.

trans-unit.source: If You should punish them - indeed they are Your servants; but if You forgive them - indeed it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Os dylai eich cosbi-yn wir maent yn eich gweision; ond os y maddeuwch imi iddynt-yn wir mae'n chi sydd Exalted yn efallai, yn y doeth.

trans-unit.source: Allah will say, "This is the Day when the truthful will benefit from their truthfulness." For them are gardens [in Paradise] beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever, Allah being pleased with them, and they with Him. That is the great attainment.
trans-unit.target: Bydd Allah yn dweud, "Hwn yw y dydd pan y geirwir bydd ELWa eu onestrwydd." Ar eu cyfer yn gerddi [yn baradwys] o dan y llif afonydd, lle bydd yn cadw at yr am byth, Allah yn falch gyda hwy, ac maent gydag ef. Mae cyrhaeddiad mawr.

trans-unit.source: To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is within them. And He is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: I Allah yn perthyn ddominiwn y nefoedd a'r ddaear a beth bynnag sydd o fewn eu. Ac mae dros holl bethau yn gymwys.

trans-unit.source: [All] praise is [due] to Allah, who created the heavens and the earth and made the darkness and the light. Then those who disbelieve equate [others] with their Lord.
trans-unit.target: Canmoliaeth [bob] yn [] i Allah, sydd wedi creu y nefoedd a'r ddaear a gwneud y tywyllwch a goleuni. Yna mae rhai a chredu yn cyfateb [eraill] gyda eu yr Arglwydd.

trans-unit.source: It is He who created you from clay and then decreed a term and a specified time [known] to Him; then [still] you are in dispute.
trans-unit.target: Ef sy'n creu eich clai ac yna a ddyfarnwyd y tymor ac amser penodedig [enw] iddo ef; [o hyd] yna ydych mewn anghydfod.

trans-unit.source: And He is Allah, [the only deity] in the heavens and the earth. He knows your secret and what you make public, and He knows that which you earn.
trans-unit.target: Ac ef yw Allah, [yr unig Dduwdod] yn y nefoedd a'r ddaear. Gwyr eich cyfrinach a beth a wnewch cyhoeddus, a gwyr y byddwch yn ennill.

trans-unit.source: And no sign comes to them from the signs of their Lord except that they turn away therefrom.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oes arwydd y daw iddynt arwyddion eu Arglwydd heblaw y maent yn troi i ffwrdd thelir.

trans-unit.source: For they had denied the truth when it came to them, but there is going to reach them the news of what they used to ridicule.
trans-unit.target: Ar gyfer maent wedi gwrthod y gwir pan mae'n dod iddynt, ond yn y newyddion am yr hyn y maen nhw'n ei gwawdio yn eu cyrraedd.

trans-unit.source: Have they not seen how many generations We destroyed before them which We had established upon the earth as We have not established you? And We sent [rain from] the sky upon them in showers and made rivers flow beneath them; then We destroyed them for their sins and brought forth after them a generation of others.
trans-unit.target: Ni welwyd faint o genedlaethau yn dinistrio ein cyn iddynt sy'n inni sefydlu ar y ddaear fel yr ydym wedi sefydlu nad ydych? Ac anfonwyd [glaw o] yr awyr arnynt mewn cawodydd a llif afonydd wnaed oddi tano; yna eu dinistrio am eu pechodau a dwyn ymlaen ar ôl eu cenhedlaeth o eraill.

trans-unit.source: And even if We had sent down to you, [O Muhammad], a written scripture on a page and they touched it with their hands, the disbelievers would say, "This is not but obvious magic."
trans-unit.target: Ac hyd yn oed os ydym wedi anfon i lawr i chi, [O Muhammad], ysgrythur ysgrifenedig ar dudalen a gwnaethant gyffwrdd ei gyda'u dwylo, byddai y disbelievers yn dweud, "Nid yw hwn ond amlwg hud."

trans-unit.source: And they say, "Why was there not sent down to him an angel?" But if We had sent down an angel, the matter would have been decided; then they would not be reprieved.
trans-unit.target: Ac maent yn dweud, "pam mae nid anfonwyd i lawr iddo ef yn angel?" Ond pe baem wedi anfon i lawr yn angel, byddai mater wedi'u penderfynu; yna byddai maent nid yn reprieved.

trans-unit.source: And if We had made him an angel, We would have made him [appear as] a man, and We would have covered them with that in which they cover themselves.
trans-unit.target: Ac os oedd yn ei gwneud yn angel, byddem wedi gwneud iddo [ymddangos fel] byddai yn ddyn, ac yr ydym wedi ymdrin â hwy â hynny y maent yn eu cynnwys eu hunain.

trans-unit.source: And already were messengers ridiculed before you, but those who mocked them were enveloped by that which they used to ridicule.
trans-unit.target: Ac eisoes yn negeswyr yn gwawdio cyn i chi, ond roedd rhai sy'n gwawdio eu lyncu'r gan hynny a ddefnyddiwyd ganddynt i gwawdio.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Travel through the land; then observe how was the end of the deniers."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "yn teithio drwy y tir; yna arsylwi sut oedd diwedd y llosg."

trans-unit.source: Say, "To whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth?" Say, "To Allah." He has decreed upon Himself mercy. He will surely assemble you for the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt. Those who will lose themselves [that Day] do not believe.
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "I bwy perthyn beth bynnag sydd yn y nefoedd a'r ddaear?" Dweud, "I Allah." Mae ef a ddyfarnwyd ei hun ar drugaredd. Yn ei siawns ymgynnull chi ar gyfer diwrnod yr atgyfodiad, y nid oes unrhyw amheuaeth. Y rhai a fydd yn colli eu hunain [y diwrnod hwnnw] Nid credu.

trans-unit.source: And to Him belongs that which reposes by night and by day, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Ac a reposes gan nos a dydd yn perthyn iddo, ac ei fod yn y gwrandawiad, y mae gwybod.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Is it other than Allah I should take as a protector, Creator of the heavens and the earth, while it is He who feeds and is not fed?" Say, [O Muhammad], "Indeed, I have been commanded to be the first [among you] who submit [to Allah] and [was commanded], 'Do not ever be of the polytheists.' "
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Yw ei heblaw Allah dylai yn cymryd fel protector, Crëwr y nefoedd a'r ddaear, tra ef sy'n bwydo ac nid yw eu bwydo?" Dweud, [O Muhammad], "yn wir, yr wedi bod yn gyfrifol i fod y cyntaf [ymysg eich] sydd yn cyflwyno [Allah] a [enillodd oedd], 'Peidiwch â erioed bod o y polytheists.' "

trans-unit.source: Say, "Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Yn wir yr wyf yn ofni, os wyf dylid torri'r fy Arglwydd, y gosb o ddiwrnod gwych."

trans-unit.source: He from whom it is averted that Day - [Allah] has granted him mercy. And that is the clear attainment.
trans-unit.target: Ef o bwy mae'n osgoi y diwrnod hwnnw-wedi [Allah] yn ganiataol iddo ef drugaredd. A dyna y cyrhaeddiad clir.

trans-unit.source: And if Allah should touch you with adversity, there is no remover of it except Him. And if He touches you with good - then He is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: Ac os dylai Allah yn eich cyffwrdd ag adfyd, nid oes unrhyw remover ohoni ac eithrio ef. Ac os mae cyffwrdd â chi gyda da-yna mae'n dros holl bethau yn gymwys.

trans-unit.source: And He is the subjugator over His servants. And He is the Wise, the Acquainted [with all].
trans-unit.target: Ac ef yw y subjugator dros ei weision. Ac mae y Wise, Acquainted [gyda'r holl].

trans-unit.source: Say, "What thing is greatest in testimony?" Say, "Allah is witness between me and you. And this Qur'an was revealed to me that I may warn you thereby and whomever it reaches. Do you [truly] testify that with Allah there are other deities?" Say, "I will not testify [with you]." Say, "Indeed, He is but one God, and indeed, I am free of what you associate [with Him]."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Dyna beth yw'r mwyaf yn dyst?" Dweud, "Allah yn dyst rhyngof fi a chi. A datgelwyd y Qur'an i mi y gall eich rhybuddio gan a phwy bynnag y mae'n cyrraedd. Wneud [yn wir] dystio bod y duwdod eraill gyda Allah?" Dweud, "bydd nid dystio [gyda chi]." Dweud, "Yn wir, mae'n ond un Duw, ac yn wir, yr wyf yn rhad ac am ddim o beth yr ydych yn cysylltu [gydag ef]."

trans-unit.source: Those to whom We have given the Scripture recognize it as they recognize their [own] sons. Those who will lose themselves [in the Hereafter] do not believe.
trans-unit.target: Mae rhai i bwy yr ydym wedi rhoi yr ysgrythur yn ei hadnabod fel eu bod yn cydnabod eu [ei hun] meibion. Ni chredwn y rhai a fydd yn colli eu hunain [yn o hyn ymlaen].

trans-unit.source: And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allah a lie or denies His verses? Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed.
trans-unit.target: Ac sydd yn anghyfiawn fwy nag un sy'n dyfeisio am Allah celwydd neu yn gwadu ei penillion? Yn wir, bydd y tramgwyddo yn llwyddo.

trans-unit.source: And [mention, O Muhammad], the Day We will gather them all together; then We will say to those who associated others with Allah, "Where are your 'partners' that you used to claim [with Him]?"
trans-unit.target: A [sôn, O Muhammad], bydd y diwrnod eu casglu bob gyda'i gilydd; yna bydd yn dweud i'r rheini y mae eraill yn gysylltiedig â Allah, "Ble mae eich 'partneriaid' a ddefnyddiwyd gennych i hawlio [gydag ef]?"

trans-unit.source: Then there will be no [excuse upon] examination except they will say, "By Allah, our Lord, we were not those who associated."
trans-unit.target: Yna bydd heb arholiad [esgus ar] ac eithrio maent yn dweud, "Gan Allah, ein Arglwydd, nid oeddem rhai sy'n gysylltiedig."

trans-unit.source: See how they will lie about themselves. And lost from them will be what they used to invent.
trans-unit.target: Weld sut y maent yn gorwedd amdanynt eu hunain. A gollwyd oddi wrthynt yn beth maent yn ei defnyddio i ddyfeisio.

trans-unit.source: And among them are those who listen to you, but We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And if they should see every sign, they will not believe in it. Even when they come to you arguing with you, those who disbelieve say, "This is not but legends of the former peoples."
trans-unit.target: Ac yn eu plith mae rhai sydd yn gwrando arnoch chi, ond yr ydym wedi gosod dros eu calonnau gorchuddion, rhag ofn eu bod yn ei deall, ac yn eu clustiau byddardod. Ac os dylent weld pob arwydd, nad ydynt yn credu ynddo. Hyd yn oed pan fyddant yn dod i chi ddadlau â chi, rhai a chredu dweud, "hwn nid yw ond chwedlau o bobloedd gynt."

trans-unit.source: And they prevent [others] from him and are [themselves] remote from him. And they do not destroy except themselves, but they perceive [it] not.
trans-unit.target: Ac maent yn atal [eraill] oddi wrtho ac yn [eu] o bell oddi wrtho. Ac nad ydynt yn dinistrio ac eithrio eu hunain, ond maent yn teimlo [TG] Nid.

trans-unit.source: If you could but see when they are made to stand before the Fire and will say, "Oh, would that we could be returned [to life on earth] and not deny the signs of our Lord and be among the believers."
trans-unit.target: Os gallech weld ond pan gânt eu gwneud i sefyll cyn y tân a bydd yn dweud, "o, byddai y gellid dychwelyd [bywyd ar y ddaear] ac nid gwadu arwyddion ein Arglwydd a ymhlith y credinwyr."

trans-unit.source: But what they concealed before has [now] appeared to them. And even if they were returned, they would return to that which they were forbidden; and indeed, they are liars.
trans-unit.target: Ond beth y maent yn ei chuddio cyn [nawr] wedi ymddangos iddynt. A hyd yn oed os oedd eu dychwelyd, eu bod yn dychwelyd i'r hyn a oedd yn gwahardd; ac yn wir, maent yn gelwyddgwn.

trans-unit.source: And they say, "There is none but our worldly life, and we will not be resurrected."
trans-unit.target: Ac maent yn dweud, "Nid oes dim ond ein bywyd worldly, ac ni bydd inni atgyfodi."

trans-unit.source: If you could but see when they will be made to stand before their Lord. He will say, "Is this not the truth?" They will say, "Yes, by our Lord." He will [then] say, "So taste the punishment because you used to disbelieve."
trans-unit.target: Os gallech weld ond pan fydd eu gwneud i sefyll gerbron yr Arglwydd eu. Bydd ef yn dweud, "Hwn nid yw y gwir?" Maent yn dweud, "Ie, gan ein Arglwydd." Bydd [] dweud wedyn, "Felly blas y cosbi oherwydd rydych yn defnyddio beidio â chredu."

trans-unit.source: Those will have lost who deny the meeting with Allah, until when the Hour [of resurrection] comes upon them unexpectedly, they will say, "Oh, [how great is] our regret over what we neglected concerning it," while they bear their burdens on their backs. Unquestionably, evil is that which they bear.
trans-unit.target: Bydd rhai wedi colli sydd yn gwadu y cyfarfod gyda Allah, tan yr awr [o atgyfodi] pan arnynt yn annisgwyl, byddant yn dweud, "o, [sut mawr yw] ein gofid dros beth yr ydym yn cael eu hesgeuluso ynghylch," tra y maent yn dwyn eu beichiau ar eu cefnau. Yn ddiamau, drwg yw y maent yn dwyn.

trans-unit.source: And the worldly life is not but amusement and diversion; but the home of the Hereafter is best for those who fear Allah, so will you not reason?
trans-unit.target: Ac nid yw y bywyd worldly ond difyrion a dargyfeirio; ond gorau ar gyfer y rhai sy'n ofni Allah yw cartref y o hyn ymlaen, felly a wnewch chi, nid rheswm?

trans-unit.source: We know that you, [O Muhammad], are saddened by what they say. And indeed, they do not call you untruthful, but it is the verses of Allah that the wrongdoers reject.
trans-unit.target: Rydym yn gwybod bod yn chi, [O Muhammad], tristáu gan hyn a ddywedant. Ac yn wir, ni alwant eich bod yn gelwyddog, ond mae'n penillion Allah y mae y tramgwyddo yn gwrthod.

trans-unit.source: And certainly were messengers denied before you, but they were patient over [the effects of] denial, and they were harmed until Our victory came to them. And none can alter the words of Allah. And there has certainly come to you some information about the [previous] messengers.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn sicr roedd negeswyr yn gwadu ger eich bron, ond roeddynt yn amyneddgar dros [effeithiau] gwadu, ac maent yn niweidio nes ein buddugoliaeth ddod iddynt. A dim yn gallu newid y geiriau Allah. Ac yna yn sicr wedi i chi rhywfaint o wybodaeth am y negeswyr [blaenorol].

trans-unit.source: And if their evasion is difficult for you, then if you are able to seek a tunnel into the earth or a stairway into the sky to bring them a sign, [then do so]. But if Allah had willed, He would have united them upon guidance. So never be of the ignorant.
trans-unit.target: Ac os yw eu osgoi talu yn anodd i chi, yna os ydych yn gallu ceisio twnnel yn y ddaear neu risiau i'r awyr i dwyn arwydd, [yna wneud hynny]. Ond os oedd Allah ewyllysio iddi, byddai ef wedi Unedig iddynt ar canllawiau. Felly byth fod yr anwybodus.

trans-unit.source: Only those who hear will respond. But the dead - Allah will resurrect them; then to Him they will be returned.
trans-unit.target: Dim ond y rhai sy'n clywed y bydd ymateb. Ond bydd y meirw-Allah yn atgyfodi'r iddynt; yna iddo cânt eu dychwelyd.
