trans-unit.source: And they say, "Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?" Say, "Indeed, Allah is Able to send down a sign, but most of them do not know."
trans-unit.target: Ac maent yn dweud, "pam arwydd nad anfonwyd i lawr iddo ef gan ei Arglwydd?" Dweud, "Yn wir, Allah yn gallu anfon i lawr yr arwydd, ond nid rhan fwyaf ohonynt yn gwybod."

trans-unit.source: And there is no creature on [or within] the earth or bird that flies with its wings except [that they are] communities like you. We have not neglected in the Register a thing. Then unto their Lord they will be gathered.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oes unrhyw creature ar [neu o fewn] y ddaear neu aderyn a hedfan gyda ei adenydd ac eithrio [bod] cymunedau fel chi. Rydym ni esgeuluso yn beth yn y gofrestr. Yna-unto eu Arglwydd fydd eu casglu.

trans-unit.source: But those who deny Our verses are deaf and dumb within darknesses. Whomever Allah wills - He leaves astray; and whomever He wills - He puts him on a straight path.
trans-unit.target: Ond mae rhai sy'n gwadu bod ein penillion byddar a mud o fewn darknesses. Pwy bynnag a wills Allah-gadael ar gyfeiliorn; a bwy bynnag a wills ef-mae'n rhoi iddo ar lwybr syth.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Have you considered: if there came to you the punishment of Allah or there came to you the Hour - is it other than Allah you would invoke, if you should be truthful?"
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "ydych chi wedi ystyried: os deuai cosbi Allah i chi neu ddaeth yno i chi yr awr-ydyw heblaw Allah chi byddai galw'r, os dylai fod yn eirwir?"

trans-unit.source: No, it is Him [alone] you would invoke, and He would remove that for which you invoked Him if He willed, and you would forget what you associate [with Him].
trans-unit.target: Na, mae'n byddai ef [unig] Byddai ydych yn galw'r, ac ef yn dileu hynny y dywedodd chi yn dilyn ef os oedd yn ewyllysio iddi, a byddai yr ydych yn anghofio beth yr ydych yn cysylltu [gydag ef].

trans-unit.source: And We have already sent [messengers] to nations before you, [O Muhammad]; then We seized them with poverty and hardship that perhaps they might humble themselves [to Us].
trans-unit.target: Ac yr ydym eisoes wedi anfon [negeswyr] Cenhedloedd cyn i chi, [O Muhammad]; Rydym wedyn yn hatafaelu iddynt gyda tlodi a chaledi y efallai gallai maent yn ddiymhongar eu hunain [atom].

trans-unit.source: Then why, when Our punishment came to them, did they not humble themselves? But their hearts became hardened, and Satan made attractive to them that which they were doing.
trans-unit.target: Wedyn pam, pan ddaeth ein cosbi iddynt, oedd iddynt nid yn ddiymhongar eu hunain? Ond daeth yn eu calonnau wedi caledu, a Satan yn gwneud yn ddeniadol iddynt a oeddent yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: So when they forgot that by which they had been reminded, We opened to them the doors of every [good] thing until, when they rejoiced in that which they were given, We seized them suddenly, and they were [then] in despair.
trans-unit.target: Felly pan anghofiodd eu bod y maent wedi'u hatgoffa, agorwyd iddynt y drysau o bob peth [da] nes, pan y maent yn llawenhau oherwydd hynny y caent, manteisio arnynt yn sydyn, ac roeddent yn [] mewn anobaith.

trans-unit.source: So the people that committed wrong were eliminated. And praise to Allah, Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Felly roedd y bobl yn ymrwymedig anghywir yn cael eu dileu. A chanmoliaeth i Allah, Arglwydd y byd.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Have you considered: if Allah should take away your hearing and your sight and set a seal upon your hearts, which deity other than Allah could bring them [back] to you?" Look how we diversify the verses; then they [still] turn away.
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "ydych chi wedi ystyried: Os gymryd i ffwrdd eich clyw a golwg eich Allah a gosod sêl ar eich calonnau, pa Dduwdod ac eithrio Allah gellid dod â hwy [yn ôl] i chi?" Edrych sut yr ydym yn arallgyfeirio y penillion; yna maent [o hyd] yn troi i ffwrdd.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Have you considered: if the punishment of Allah should come to you unexpectedly or manifestly, will any be destroyed but the wrongdoing people?"
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "ydych chi wedi ystyried: os dylid cosbi Allah yn dod i chi annisgwyl neu yn amlwg, bydd dinistrio unrhyw un ond pobl gamwedd?"

trans-unit.source: And We send not the messengers except as bringers of good tidings and warners. So whoever believes and reforms - there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
trans-unit.target: A ydym yn anfon nid y negeswyr ac eithrio fel bringers tidings da a warners. Felly, pwy bynnag sy'n credu a diwygiadau-ni fydd unrhyw ofn ynghylch eu, ac ni bydd iddynt alaru.

trans-unit.source: But those who deny Our verses - the punishment will touch them for their defiant disobedience.
trans-unit.target: Ond mae rhai sy'n gwadu bod ein penillion-bydd y gosb yn eu cyffwrdd ar gyfer eu herio anufudd-dod.

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "I do not tell you that I have the depositories [containing the provision] of Allah or that I know the unseen, nor do I tell you that I am an angel. I only follow what is revealed to me." Say, "Is the blind equivalent to the seeing? Then will you not give thought?"
trans-unit.target: Dweud, [O Muhammad], "wneud ni ddweud wrthych fod gennyf y depositories [sy'n cynnwys y ddarpariaeth] Allah neu y gwn y unseen, nac a dweud wrthych fy mod yn angel. Dim ond rwy'n dilyn beth yw datgelu i mi." Dweud, "Mae y Deillion yn cyfateb i weld y? Wedyn na roddwch chi feddwl?"

trans-unit.source: And warn by the Qur'an those who fear that they will be gathered before their Lord - for them besides Him will be no protector and no intercessor - that they might become righteous.
trans-unit.target: A rhybuddio gan y Qur'an rheini sy'n ofni y bydd eu casglu cyn eu Arglwydd-iddynt ar wahân iddo bydd yn oes protector ac intercessor oes-y gallai ddod yn hoes dabloid.

trans-unit.source: And do not send away those who call upon their Lord morning and afternoon, seeking His countenance. Not upon you is anything of their account and not upon them is anything of your account. So were you to send them away, you would [then] be of the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: A Peidiwch ag anfon i ffwrdd rheini sydd yn galw ar eu Arglwydd y bore a'r prynhawn, yn ceisio ei ystyried. Nid arnoch chi unrhyw beth eu cyfrif ac nid arnynt yn unrhyw beth o eich cyfrif. Fel y byddwch yn eu hanfon i ffwrdd, chi [yna] byddai y tramgwyddo.

trans-unit.source: And thus We have tried some of them through others that the disbelievers might say, "Is it these whom Allah has favored among us?" Is not Allah most knowing of those who are grateful?
trans-unit.target: Ac felly yr ydym wedi ceisio rhai ohonynt drwy eraill y gallai ddweud y disbelievers, "Yw ei rhain bwy Allah wedi ffafriol ymhlith ein?" Yw Allah ni wybod rhan fwyaf o'r rheini yn ddiolchgar?

trans-unit.source: And when those come to you who believe in Our verses, say, "Peace be upon you. Your Lord has decreed upon Himself mercy: that any of you who does wrong out of ignorance and then repents after that and corrects himself - indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful."
trans-unit.target: A pan ddaw rhai i chi sydd yn credu yn ein penillion, gan ddweud, "fod heddwch arnoch. Wedi eich Arglwydd a ddyfarnwyd ei hun ar drugaredd: bod pob un ohonoch a yw'n anghywir allan o anwybodaeth a edifarhao ar ôl hynny wedyn ac yn cywiro ei hun-yn wir, ei fod yn Forgiving a Merciful. "

trans-unit.source: And thus do We detail the verses, and [thus] the way of the criminals will become evident.
trans-unit.target: Ac felly yr ydym yn manylu y penillion, a [felly] Bydd y ffordd y troseddwyr wedi dod yn amlwg.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Indeed, I have been forbidden to worship those you invoke besides Allah." Say, "I will not follow your desires, for I would then have gone astray, and I would not be of the [rightly] guided."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Yn wir, yr wyf wedi gwahardd i addoli y rhai ydych yn galw'r heblaw Allah." Dweud, "ni ddilynaf eich dyheadau, byddai yna fod wedi mynd ar gyfeiliorn, ac ni fyddai'n o dan arweiniad [iawn]."

trans-unit.source: Say, "Indeed, I am on clear evidence from my Lord, and you have denied it. I do not have that for which you are impatient. The decision is only for Allah. He relates the truth, and He is the best of deciders."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "yn wir, yr wyf ar dystiolaeth glir o fy Arglwydd, a ydych wedi gwadu hynny. Nid oes gennyf yr ydych yn dyheu amdanynt. Mae'r penderfyniad yn unig ar gyfer Allah. Cyfeiria ef y gwir, ac mae y gorau o deciders."

trans-unit.source: Say, "If I had that for which you are impatient, the matter would have been decided between me and you, but Allah is most knowing of the wrongdoers."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Pe bai gennyf yr ydych yn dyheu amdanynt, byddai penderfynu y mater rhwng fi a chi, ond Allah yn gwybod fwyaf am y tramgwyddo."

trans-unit.source: And with Him are the keys of the unseen; none knows them except Him. And He knows what is on the land and in the sea. Not a leaf falls but that He knows it. And no grain is there within the darknesses of the earth and no moist or dry [thing] but that it is [written] in a clear record.
trans-unit.target: A gydag ef yn allweddi unseen; Mae dim yn gwybod iddynt ac eithrio ef. A gwyr ef beth yw ar y tir ac yn y môr. Mae yn y dail yn disgyn ond y gwyr ef. A oes unrhyw grawn o fewn y darknesses y ddaear a oes llaith neu sych [peth] ond ei fod yn [ysgrifenedig] mewn cofnod clir.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who takes your souls by night and knows what you have committed by day. Then He revives you therein that a specified term may be fulfilled. Then to Him will be your return; then He will inform you about what you used to do.
trans-unit.target: Ac ef sy'n cymryd eich eneidiau gan nos ac yn gwybod beth yr ydych wedi ymrwymo erbyn diwrnod. Yna mae ef revives chi ynddo y gall tymor penodedig yn cael eu cyflawni. Yna iddo fydd eich dychwelyd; yna bydd ef yn eich hysbysu am beth yr ydych yn ei defnyddio i wneud.

trans-unit.source: And He is the subjugator over His servants, and He sends over you guardian-angels until, when death comes to one of you, Our messengers take him, and they do not fail [in their duties].
trans-unit.target: Ac ef yw y subjugator dros ei weision, ac mae'n anfon dros eich gwarcheidwad angylion nes, pan ddaw marwolaeth i un ohonoch, mae ein negeswyr yn mynd ag ef, ac nid ydynt [yn eu dyletswyddau].

trans-unit.source: Then they His servants are returned to Allah, their true Lord. Unquestionably, His is the judgement, and He is the swiftest of accountants.
trans-unit.target: Yna cânt eu ei weision yn dychwelyd i Allah, eu Arglwydd wir. Yn ddiamau, y dyfarniad yw ei, ac ef yw y cyflymaf o gyfrifwyr.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Who rescues you from the darknesses of the land and sea [when] you call upon Him imploring [aloud] and privately, 'If He should save us from this [crisis], we will surely be among the thankful.' "
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "pwy rescues chi o darknesses tir a môr [pan] ydych yn galw arno yn imploring [yn uchel] ac yn breifat, 'os dylai fod yn ein cadw rhag hwn [argyfwng], oni byddwn ymysg y ddiolchgar.' "

trans-unit.source: Say, "It is Allah who saves you from it and from every distress; then you [still] associate others with Him."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Mae'n Allah sy'n arbed chi ohono ac o bob gofid; yna mae chi [o hyd] cysylltiol eraill gydag ef."

trans-unit.source: Say, "He is the [one] Able to send upon you affliction from above you or from beneath your feet or to confuse you [so you become] sects and make you taste the violence of one another." Look how We diversify the signs that they might understand.
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Mae'n [un] yn gallu anfon ar eich cystuddiau'n uwchben chi neu torri eich traed neu drysu chi [felly mae chi ddod] sectau a gwneud chi Mae blas y trais yn un arall." Edrych sut yr ydym yn arallgyfeirio yr arwyddion y gallai eu deall.

trans-unit.source: But your people have denied it while it is the truth. Say, "I am not over you a manager."
trans-unit.target: Ond mae eich pobl wedi gwadu ei er ei bod yn y gwir. Dweud, "Nid wyf dros eich rheolwr."

trans-unit.source: For every happening is a finality; and you are going to know.
trans-unit.target: Ar gyfer pob digwydd yn derfynol; a ydych yn mynd i wybod.

trans-unit.source: And when you see those who engage in [offensive] discourse concerning Our verses, then turn away from them until they enter into another conversation. And if Satan should cause you to forget, then do not remain after the reminder with the wrongdoing people.
trans-unit.target: A pan fyddwch yn gweld rhai sy'n ymgysylltu mewn disgwrs [sarhaus] ynghylch ein penillion, yna troi oddi arnynt nes iddynt gychwyn i sgwrs arall. Ac os dylai Satan yn achosi i anghofio chi, yna nid ydynt yn aros ar ôl atgoffa gyda'r bobl gamwedd.

trans-unit.source: And those who fear Allah are not held accountable for the disbelievers at all, but [only for] a reminder - that perhaps they will fear Him.
trans-unit.target: A yw'r rheini sy'n ofni Allah nid yn atebol am y disbelievers o gwbl, ond [am] nodyn atgoffa-y efallai byddant yn ofni iddo.

trans-unit.source: And leave those who take their religion as amusement and diversion and whom the worldly life has deluded. But remind with the Qur'an, lest a soul be given up to destruction for what it earned; it will have other than Allah no protector and no intercessor. And if it should offer every compensation, it would not be taken from it. Those are the ones who are given to destruction for what they have earned. For them will be a drink of scalding water and a painful punishment because they used to disbelieve.
trans-unit.target: A gadael y rhai sy'n cymryd eu crefydd fel difyrrwch a dargyfeirio a phwy y bywyd worldly wedi deluded. Ond atgoffa gyda y Qur'an, rhag ofn fod enaid yn rhoi'r gorau i'w dinistrio am beth y mae'n ei ennill; Bydd yn rhaid eithrio Allah oes protector ac unrhyw intercessor. Ac os dylai gynnig bob iawndal, byddai nid ei ohono. Dyma'r rhai sy'n cael eu rhoi i ddistryw am beth y maent wedi ei ennill. Ar gyfer eu fydd diod o sgaldio dŵr a chosbi boenus oherwydd maen nhw'n ei chredu.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Shall we invoke instead of Allah that which neither benefits us nor harms us and be turned back on our heels after Allah has guided us? [We would then be] like one whom the devils enticed [to wander] upon the earth confused, [while] he has companions inviting him to guidance, [calling], 'Come to us.' " Say, "Indeed, the guidance of Allah is the [only] guidance; and we have been commanded to submit to the Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Bydd alw yn hytrach na Allah na manteision inni nac yn niweidio ein a gael eu troi'n ôl ar ein sodlau ar ôl Allah wedi'n harwain ni? [Byddem wedyn] fel un a oedd y devils llwyddwyd i annog [i grwydro] ar wyneb y ddaear yn ddryslyd, [er] oedd ganddo cymdeithion wahodd i'r canllawiau, [galw], 'daw i ni.' "Dweud," yn wir, y canllawiau Allah y [canllawiau yn unig]; ac wedi wedi bod yn gyfrifol i gyflwyno i Arglwydd y byd.

trans-unit.source: And to establish prayer and fear Him." And it is He to whom you will be gathered.
trans-unit.target: Ac i sefydlu gweddi ac ofn iddo. Ac ef i bwy y bydd eich casglu.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who created the heavens and earth in truth. And the day He says, "Be," and it is, His word is the truth. And His is the dominion [on] the Day the Horn is blown. [He is] Knower of the unseen and the witnessed; and He is the Wise, the Acquainted.
trans-unit.target: Ac ef a greodd y nefoedd a'r ddaear mewn gwirionedd. Ac y diwrnod a dywed, "yn", ac mae'n, y gwir yw ei air. Ac ef yn y ddominiwn [ar] y diwrnod yw y cyrn yn chwythu. [Mae'n] Knower y unseen a welir; ac y doeth, Acquainted y mae ef.

trans-unit.source: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham said to his father Azar, "Do you take idols as deities? Indeed, I see you and your people to be in manifest error."
trans-unit.target: A [sôn, O Muhammad], pan ddywedodd Abraham i dad Azar, "a ydych yn cymryd dod ynghyd fel duwdod? Yn wir, gwelaf chi eich pobl i fod mewn camgymeriad amlwg."

trans-unit.source: And thus did We show Abraham the realm of the heavens and the earth that he would be among the certain [in faith]
trans-unit.target: Ac felly oedd yn dangos Abraham yr amgylchfyd y nefoedd a'r ddaear y byddai'n ymhlith rhai [mewn ffydd]

trans-unit.source: So when the night covered him [with darkness], he saw a star. He said, "This is my lord." But when it set, he said, "I like not those that disappear."
trans-unit.target: Felly pan roedd y noson yn cynnwys ef [gyda dywyllwch], gwelodd seren. Dywedodd, "Dyma fy Arglwydd." Ond pan osododd, meddai ef, "Rwy'n hoffi nid y rhai sydd yn diflannu."

trans-unit.source: And when he saw the moon rising, he said, "This is my lord." But when it set, he said, "Unless my Lord guides me, I will surely be among the people gone astray."
trans-unit.target: A pan welodd y lleuad yn codi, dywedodd, "Dyma fy Arglwydd." Ond pan osododd, meddai ef, "Oni bai y mae fy Arglwydd yn rhoi arweiniad i mi, bydd yn sicr yn ymhlith y bobl wedi mynd ar gyfeiliorn."

trans-unit.source: And when he saw the sun rising, he said, "This is my lord; this is greater." But when it set, he said, "O my people, indeed I am free from what you associate with Allah.
trans-unit.target: A pan welodd yr haul yn codi, dywedodd, "Dyma fy Arglwydd; Mae hyn yn fwy." Ond pan osododd, dywedodd, "O 'm pobl, yn wir yr wyf yn rhydd o beth yr ydych yn cysylltu â Allah.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, I have turned my face toward He who created the heavens and the earth, inclining toward truth, and I am not of those who associate others with Allah."
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, yr wyf wedi troi fy wyneb tuag at ef a greodd y nefoedd a'r ddaear, inclining tuag at wirionedd, ac nid wyf yn rhai sy'n cysylltu eraill â Allah."

trans-unit.source: And his people argued with him. He said, "Do you argue with me concerning Allah while He has guided me? And I fear not what you associate with Him [and will not be harmed] unless my Lord should will something. My Lord encompasses all things in knowledge; then will you not remember?
trans-unit.target: A dadleuodd ei bobl gydag ef. Meddai, "Nid ydych yn dadlau gyda mi ynghylch Allah tra mae wedi'i dywys mi? Ac nid hyn yn eich cysylltu ag ef yn ofni [a bydd ni ddylid niweidio] oni ddylai fy Arglwydd bydd rhywbeth. Mae fy Arglwydd yn cwmpasu'r holl bethau mewn gwybodaeth; yna bydd nad ydych yn cofio?

trans-unit.source: And how should I fear what you associate while you do not fear that you have associated with Allah that for which He has not sent down to you any authority? So which of the two parties has more right to security, if you should know?
trans-unit.target: A sut dylai ofnaf beth ydych yn ei gysylltu tra nid ydych yn ofni eich bod wedi sy'n gysylltiedig ag Allah y ef ni anfon i lawr i chi unrhyw awdurdod? Felly pa un o'r ddwy blaid wedi mwy o hawl i sicrwydd, os dylech wybod?

trans-unit.source: They who believe and do not mix their belief with injustice - those will have security, and they are [rightly] guided.
trans-unit.target: Sy'n credu ac nid gymysgu eu cred ag anghyfiawnder-hynny bydd ganddynt ddiogelwch, ac yn eu harwain [iawn].

trans-unit.source: And that was Our [conclusive] argument which We gave Abraham against his people. We raise by degrees whom We will. Indeed, your Lord is Wise and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: A dyna oedd ein dadl [bendant] a roddodd Abraham ydym erbyn ei bobl. Rydym yn codi gan graddau y byddwn. Yn wir, eich Arglwydd yw Wise a gwybod.

trans-unit.source: And We gave to Abraham, Isaac and Jacob - all [of them] We guided. And Noah, We guided before; and among his descendants, David and Solomon and Job and Joseph and Moses and Aaron. Thus do We reward the doers of good.
trans-unit.target: A roesom i Abraham, Isaac a Jacob – pob un [ohonynt] arweiniad inni. A Noah, dan arweiniad cyn; ac ymhlith ei ddisgynyddion, David a Solomon a swyddi a Joseph a Moses ac Aaron. Felly, nid ydym yn gwobrwyo phoenwn da.

trans-unit.source: And Zechariah and John and Jesus and Elias - and all were of the righteous.
trans-unit.target: A Zechariah a John a'r Iesu a Elias-a phawb yn y righteous.

trans-unit.source: And Ishmael and Elisha and Jonah and Lot - and all [of them] We preferred over the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Ac Ishmael a Eleisha a Jonah a llawer-a holl [ohonynt] yn well gennym dros y byd.

trans-unit.source: And [some] among their fathers and their descendants and their brothers - and We chose them and We guided them to a straight path.
trans-unit.target: A [rai] ymysg eu tadau a eu disgynyddion a eu brodyr-a dewisom iddynt ac rydym wedi eu harwain i lwybr syth.

trans-unit.source: That is the guidance of Allah by which He guides whomever He wills of His servants. But if they had associated others with Allah, then worthless for them would be whatever they were doing.
trans-unit.target: Dyna y canllawiau y mae'r ef tywys pwy AU ewyllysiau o ei weision Allah. Ond os oedd sy'n gysylltiedig eraill â Allah, yna ddiwerth iddynt fyddai beth bynnag yr oeddent yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: Those are the ones to whom We gave the Scripture and authority and prophethood. But if the disbelievers deny it, then We have entrusted it to a people who are not therein disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Dyma'r rhai i bwy a rhoesom yr ysgrythur ac awdurdod a prophethood. Ond os mae y disbelievers yn ei wadu, yna yr ydym wedi ymddiried iddo i bobl nad ydynt yn disbelievers yn weithredol.

trans-unit.source: Those are the ones whom Allah has guided, so from their guidance take an example. Say, "I ask of you for this message no payment. It is not but a reminder for the worlds."
trans-unit.target: Dyma'r rhai ohonynt Allah wedi tywys, felly eu canllawiau gymryd enghraifft. Dweud, "Gofynnaf I chi ar gyfer y neges hon unrhyw daliad. Nid yw ond yn ein hatgoffa am y byd."

trans-unit.source: And they did not appraise Allah with true appraisal when they said, "Allah did not reveal to a human being anything." Say, "Who revealed the Scripture that Moses brought as light and guidance to the people? You [Jews] make it into pages, disclosing [some of] it and concealing much. And you were taught that which you knew not - neither you nor your fathers." Say, "Allah [revealed it]." Then leave them in their [empty] discourse, amusing themselves.
trans-unit.target: Ac oedd ni arfarnu Allah gydag arfarniad wir pan y dywedodd, "wnaeth Allah nid ddatgelu i'r bod dynol unrhyw beth." Dweud, "sy'n dangos yr ysgrythur a gyflwynodd Moses fel golau ac arweiniad i bobl? [Iddewon] Fe'i gwnewch i dudalennau, datgelu [rhai o'r] Mae'n ac yn cuddio llawer. A dysgwyd chi y gwyddech na-ydych chi na'r eich tadau. Dweud, "Allah [Datgelodd]." Yna gadael iddynt yn eu disgwrs [gwag], ddoniol eu hunain.

trans-unit.source: And this is a Book which We have sent down, blessed and confirming what was before it, that you may warn the Mother of Cities and those around it. Those who believe in the Hereafter believe in it, and they are maintaining their prayers.
trans-unit.target: A dyma'r llyfr yr ydym wedi'u hanfon i lawr, yn bendithio ac yn cadarnhau beth oedd ger ei fron, y gall eich rhybuddio mam dinasoedd a rhai o'i amgylch. Mae'r rhai sy'n credu yn y o hyn ymlaen yn credu ynddo, ac eu bod yn cynnal eu gweddïau.

trans-unit.source: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah or says, "It has been inspired to me," while nothing has been inspired to him, and one who says, "I will reveal [something] like what Allah revealed." And if you could but see when the wrongdoers are in the overwhelming pangs of death while the angels extend their hands, [saying], "Discharge your souls! Today you will be awarded the punishment of [extreme] humiliation for what you used to say against Allah other than the truth and [that] you were, toward His verses, being arrogant."
trans-unit.target: Ac sydd yn anghyfiawn fwy nag un sy'n dyfeisio celwydd am Allah neu sy'n dweud, "Mae'n wedi'i ysbrydoli i mi," er dim wedi'i ysbrydoli iddo, ac yn un sydd yn dweud, "Bydd ddatgelu [rhywbeth] fel hyn wedi datgelu Allah." Ac os gallai ond gweld pan fydd y tramgwyddo yn pangs llethol o farwolaeth tra mae yr angylion yn ymestyn eu dwylo, [dweud], "rhyddhau eich eneidiau! Heddiw chi dyfernir cosbi cywilydd [eithafol] am beth yr ydych yn ei defnyddio i ddweud erbyn Allah heblaw y gwir a [y], tuag at ei penillion, bod yn haerllug."

trans-unit.source: [It will be said to them], "And you have certainly come to Us alone as We created you the first time, and you have left whatever We bestowed upon you behind you. And We do not see with you your 'intercessors' which you claimed that they were among you associates [of Allah]. It has [all] been severed between you, and lost from you is what you used to claim."
trans-unit.target: [Bydd dweud iddynt], "ac wedi dod atom yn unig yn sicr yn creu chi y tro cyntaf, a ydych wedi gadael beth bynnag a roesom arnoch tu ôl i chi. Ac nid ydym yn gweld gyda chi eich 'intercessors' a oedd yn honni eu bod ymhlith associates [o Allah]. Mae [holl] wedi'u hollti rhwng chi, ac colli chi yw beth yr ydych yn ei ddefnyddio i hawlio."

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah is the cleaver of grain and date seeds. He brings the living out of the dead and brings the dead out of the living. That is Allah; so how are you deluded?
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, Allah yn cleaver hadau grawn a dyddiad. Mae ef yn byw y tu allan i'r meirw yn dwyn ac yn dwyn y meirw byw y tu allan i'r. Dyna Allah; Felly, sut y byddwch yn deluded?

trans-unit.source: [He is] the cleaver of daybreak and has made the night for rest and the sun and moon for calculation. That is the determination of the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.
trans-unit.target: [Mae'n] cleaver o daybreak, ac wedi y nos ar gyfer gweddill yr haul a'r Lleuad ar gyfer y cyfrifiad. Dyna'r penderfyniad y Exalted yn gwybod y gallai.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who placed for you the stars that you may be guided by them through the darknesses of the land and sea. We have detailed the signs for a people who know.
trans-unit.target: Ac ef sy'n rhoi i chi y sêr efallai eich bod yn cael eu llywio gan iddynt drwy y darknesses y tir a'r môr. Rydym wedi nodi yr arwyddion ar gyfer pobl sy'n gwybod.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who produced you from one soul and [gave you] a place of dwelling and of storage. We have detailed the signs for a people who understand.
trans-unit.target: Ac ef a chi a gynhyrchir o un enaid a [Rhoddodd chi] yn lle o annedd a storio. Rydym wedi nodi yr arwyddion ar gyfer pobl sy'n deall.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who sends down rain from the sky, and We produce thereby the growth of all things. We produce from it greenery from which We produce grains arranged in layers. And from the palm trees - of its emerging fruit are clusters hanging low. And [We produce] gardens of grapevines and olives and pomegranates, similar yet varied. Look at [each of] its fruit when it yields and [at] its ripening. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.
trans-unit.target: Ac ef sy'n anfon i lawr glaw o'r awyr, ac rydym yn cynhyrchu ac felly y twf yr holl bethau. Rydym yn cynhyrchu ei gwyrddni y Rydym yn cynhyrchu grawn yn cael ei drefnu mewn haenau. Ac o goed palmwydd-newydd ei ffrwythau yn glystyrau sy'n hongian yn isel. A [Rydym] gerddi gwinwydden ac olifau a pomegranates, tebyg eto yn amrywio. Edrych ar [y] ei ffrwythau pan y bydd yn cyflawni ac ar ei a'r llall. Yn wir yn hynny yn arwyddion ar gyfer pobl sydd yn credu.

trans-unit.source: But they have attributed to Allah partners - the jinn, while He has created them - and have fabricated for Him sons and daughters. Exalted is He and high above what they describe
trans-unit.target: Ond wedi eu priodoli i Allah partneriaid-y jinn, tra y mae ef wedi creu eu-ac wedi ffugio iddo feibion a merched. Mae i'w mawrygu ef a uchel uchod beth maent yn ei disgrifio

trans-unit.source: [He is] Originator of the heavens and the earth. How could He have a son when He does not have a companion and He created all things? And He is, of all things, Knowing.
trans-unit.target: [Mae'n] Cychwynnwr y nefoedd a'r ddaear. Sut gallai ganddo fab pan nad oes ganddo cydymaith a grewyd ganddo holl bethau? Ac mae ef, o'r holl bethau, mae gwybod.

trans-unit.source: That is Allah, your Lord; there is no deity except Him, the Creator of all things, so worship Him. And He is Disposer of all things.
trans-unit.target: Dyna Allah, eich Arglwydd; Nid oes Dduwdod ac eithrio ef, y crëwr yr holl bethau, felly addoli ef. Ac Disposer yr holl bethau mae ef.

trans-unit.source: Vision perceives Him not, but He perceives [all] vision; and He is the Subtle, the Acquainted.
trans-unit.target: Mae'r weledigaeth yn meddwl iddo nid, ond wêl [holl] gweledigaeth; ac mae y Subtle, y Acquainted.

trans-unit.source: There has come to you enlightenment from your Lord. So whoever will see does so for [the benefit of] his soul, and whoever is blind [does harm] against it. And [say], "I am not a guardian over you."
trans-unit.target: Mae wedi dod i oleuo chi gan eich Arglwydd. Felly mae pwy bynnag a fydd yn gwneud hynny ar gyfer [budd] ei enaid, a phwy bynnag ddall [wneud niwed] yn ei erbyn. Ac [dweud], "Nid wyf gwarcheidwad dros chi."

trans-unit.source: And thus do We diversify the verses so the disbelievers will say, "You have studied," and so We may make the Qur'an clear for a people who know.
trans-unit.target: Ac felly yr ydym yn arallgyfeirio y penillion hynny bydd y disbelievers yn dweud, "yr ydych wedi astudio", ac felly y gall wneud y Qur'an glir ar gyfer pobl sy'n gwybod.

trans-unit.source: Follow, [O Muhammad], what has been revealed to you from your Lord - there is no deity except Him - and turn away from those who associate others with Allah.
trans-unit.target: Yn dilyn, [O Muhammad], mae'r hyn a ddatgelwyd i chi gan eich Arglwydd-nid oes unrhyw Dduwdod ac eithrio ef-a throi oddi wrth y rheini sy'n cysylltu eraill â Allah.

trans-unit.source: But if Allah had willed, they would not have associated. And We have not appointed you over them as a guardian, nor are you a manager over them.
trans-unit.target: Ond os oedd Allah ewyllysio iddi, na byddai iddynt cysylltiedig. A ydym wedi nid penodi chi dros iddynt fel gwarcheidwad, nac ydych yn rheolwr dros iddynt.

trans-unit.source: And do not insult those they invoke other than Allah, lest they insult Allah in enmity without knowledge. Thus We have made pleasing to every community their deeds. Then to their Lord is their return, and He will inform them about what they used to do.
trans-unit.target: A Peidiwch â difro rhai mae nhw'n galw'r heblaw Allah, rhag ofn iddynt Mae sarhad Allah mewn elyniaeth heb wybodaeth. Felly rydym wedi braf i bob cymuned eu gweithredoedd. Yna eu yr Arglwydd yn eu dychwelyd, a bydd yn rhoi gwybod iddynt am beth maent yn ei ddefnyddio i wneud.

trans-unit.source: And they swear by Allah their strongest oaths that if a sign came to them, they would surely believe in it. Say, "The signs are only with Allah." And what will make you perceive that even if a sign came, they would not believe.
trans-unit.target: Ac y mae iddynt dyngu gan Allah eu llwon cryfaf os daeth arwydd iddynt, byddai eu bod siawns credu ynddo. Dweud, "yr arwyddion yn unig gyda Allah." A beth fydd yn gwneud ichi ystyried bod hyd yn oed os daeth arwydd, byddai nad ydynt yn credu.

trans-unit.source: And We will turn away their hearts and their eyes just as they refused to believe in it the first time. And We will leave them in their transgression, wandering blindly.
trans-unit.target: A byddwn yn troi i ffwrdd eu calonnau ac yn eu llygaid fel y gwrthododd y tro cyntaf yn credu ynddo. A byddwn yn gadael iddynt yn eu tramgwyddiad, crwydro ddall.

trans-unit.source: And even if We had sent down to them the angels [with the message] and the dead spoke to them [of it] and We gathered together every [created] thing in front of them, they would not believe unless Allah should will. But most of them, [of that], are ignorant.
trans-unit.target: A hyd yn oed os ydym wedi anfon i lawr atynt Mae angylion [gyda'r neges] a meirw yn siarad â hwy [o] a gasglwyd gennym gyda'i gilydd bob peth [Crëwyd] o'u blaenau, byddai ni chredant oni ddylai bydd Allah. Ond mae'r rhan fwyaf ohonynt, [y], anwybodus.

trans-unit.source: And thus We have made for every prophet an enemy - devils from mankind and jinn, inspiring to one another decorative speech in delusion. But if your Lord had willed, they would not have done it, so leave them and that which they invent.
trans-unit.target: Ac felly yr ydym wedi gwneud ar gyfer y Proffwyd bob gelyn-devils dynolryw a jinn, ysbrydoli i un arall araith addurnol yn rhithdyb. Mae ond os eich Arglwydd wedi ewyllysio iddi, nad ydynt wedi gwneud hynny, felly yn gadael iddynt ac y mae eu dyfeisio.

trans-unit.source: And [it is] so the hearts of those who disbelieve in the Hereafter will incline toward it and that they will be satisfied with it and that they will commit that which they are committing.
trans-unit.target: A [Mae'n] felly bydd y calonnau y rhai a chredu yn y o hyn ymlaen yn inclein tuag at ei ac y byddant yn fodlon ag ef ac y byddant yn cyflawni hynny y maent yn ymrwymo.

trans-unit.source: [Say], "Then is it other than Allah I should seek as judge while it is He who has revealed to you the Book explained in detail?" And those to whom We [previously] gave the Scripture know that it is sent down from your Lord in truth, so never be among the doubters.
trans-unit.target: [Dweud], "Yna heblaw Allah a dylai ofyn am fel barnwr tra ef sydd wedi dangos i chi y llyfr eglurir yn fanwl?" A rhai i bwy ydym [gynt] Rhoddodd y ysgrythur yn gwybod bod ei anfon i lawr gan eich Arglwydd mewn gwirionedd, felly byth fod ymhlith yr amheuwyr.

trans-unit.source: And the word of your Lord has been fulfilled in truth and in justice. None can alter His words, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
trans-unit.target: A gair yr Arglwydd eich wedi'i gyflawni mewn gwirionedd ac mewn cyfiawnder. Gall dim newid ei eiriau, ac mae yn y gwrandawiad, y mae gwybod.

trans-unit.source: And if you obey most of those upon the earth, they will mislead you from the way of Allah. They follow not except assumption, and they are not but falsifying.
trans-unit.target: Ac os yw eich bod yn ufuddhau rhan fwyaf o'r rhai ar y ddaear, maent yn camarwain chi o'r ffordd o Allah. Maent yn dilyn nid ac eithrio dybiaeth, ac nid ydynt ond yn ffugio.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who strays from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, eich Arglwydd yn gwybod fwyaf o sy'n crwydro oddi ar ei ffordd, ac mae'n gwybod fwyaf o dan arweiniad [iawn].

trans-unit.source: So eat of that [meat] upon which the name of Allah has been mentioned, if you are believers in His verses.
trans-unit.target: Felly fwyta [cig] ar sydd wedi bod yn enw Allah grybwyll, os ydych yn gredinwyr yn ei penillion.

trans-unit.source: And why should you not eat of that upon which the name of Allah has been mentioned while He has explained in detail to you what He has forbidden you, excepting that to which you are compelled. And indeed do many lead [others] astray through their [own] inclinations without knowledge. Indeed, your Lord - He is most knowing of the transgressors.
trans-unit.target: A pam dylai nid bwyta o hynny y crybwyllwyd enw Allah tra y mae ef wedi egluro yn fanwl i chi beth ei fod wedi gwahardd chi, ac eithrio bod y byddwch yn gorfodi. Ac yn wir yn gwneud llawer o arwain [eraill] ar gyfeiliorn drwy eu [ei hun] prawf pellter heb wybodaeth. Yn wir, eich Arglwydd-mae'n gwybod fwyaf am y transgressors.

trans-unit.source: And leave what is apparent of sin and what is concealed thereof. Indeed, those who earn [blame for] sin will be recompensed for that which they used to commit.
trans-unit.target: A gadael yr hyn sy'n amlwg o'r pechod a beth yw cuddio ohono. Yn wir, bydd y rhai sy'n ennill pechod [bai am] eu had-dalu am hynny a ddefnyddiwyd ganddynt i ymrwymo.

trans-unit.source: And do not eat of that upon which the name of Allah has not been mentioned, for indeed, it is grave disobedience. And indeed do the devils inspire their allies [among men] to dispute with you. And if you were to obey them, indeed, you would be associators [of others with Him].
trans-unit.target: Ac nid bwyta o hynny y crybwyllwyd enw Allah nid, yn wir, yn anufudd-dod mawr. Ac yn wir wneud y devils yn ysbrydoli eu cynghreiriaid [ymysg dynion] i anghytuno â chi. Ac os ydych yn ufuddhau iddynt, yn wir, byddai gennych associators [o eraill gydag ef].

trans-unit.source: And is one who was dead and We gave him life and made for him light by which to walk among the people like one who is in darkness, never to emerge therefrom? Thus it has been made pleasing to the disbelievers that which they were doing.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn un a oedd wedi marw a iddo'n bywyd ac yn gwneud iddo ysgafn i gerdded ymysg y bobl fel un sydd yn y tywyllwch, byth i'r golwg thelir? Felly wedi ei wneud yn dda y disbelievers hynny a oeddent yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: And thus We have placed within every city the greatest of its criminals to conspire therein. But they conspire not except against themselves, and they perceive [it] not.
trans-unit.target: Ac felly yr ydym wedi gosod o fewn pob dinas fwyaf ei troseddwyr i cynllwynio ynddo. Ond mae eu bod yn cynllwynio nid ac eithrio erbyn eu hunain, a welant [TG] ni.

trans-unit.source: And when a sign comes to them, they say, "Never will we believe until we are given like that which was given to the messengers of Allah." Allah is most knowing of where He places His message. There will afflict those who committed crimes debasement before Allah and severe punishment for what they used to conspire.
trans-unit.target: A pan ddaw'r arwydd iddynt, maent yn dweud, "byth bydd Credwn nes inni fel hynny a roddwyd i negeswyr Allah." Allah yw'r rhan fwyaf o wybod o ble mae ei neges. Ni fydd yn taro'r rhai sydd wedi ymrwymo i ddiraddio troseddau cyn Allah a chosbi difrifol am beth maent yn ei defnyddio i cynllwynio.

trans-unit.source: So whoever Allah wants to guide - He expands his breast to [contain] Islam; and whoever He wants to misguide - He makes his breast tight and constricted as though he were climbing into the sky. Thus does Allah place defilement upon those who do not believe.
trans-unit.target: Felly pwy bynnag Allah yn dymuno arwain-mae ef yn ehangu ei fron [cynnwys] Islam; a pwy bynnag yr hoffai ei weld yn misguide-Mae e'n ei fron tynn ac yn gyfyngedig fel er ei fod yn dringo i'r awyr. Felly, yw Allah yn gosod defilement ar y rhai nad ydynt yn credu.

trans-unit.source: And this is the path of your Lord, [leading] straight. We have detailed the verses for a people who remember.
trans-unit.target: A dyma'r llwybr eich Arglwydd, [arwain] yn syth. Rydym wedi nodi y penillion ar gyfer pobl sydd yn cofio.

trans-unit.source: For them will be the Home of Peace with their Lord. And He will be their protecting friend because of what they used to do.
trans-unit.target: Ar eu cyfer fydd cartref heddwch gyda eu yr Arglwydd. A bydd ef yn eu ffrind diogelu oherwydd maen nhw'n ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: And [mention, O Muhammad], the Day when He will gather them together [and say], "O company of jinn, you have [misled] many of mankind." And their allies among mankind will say, "Our Lord, some of us made use of others, and we have [now] reached our term, which you appointed for us." He will say, "The Fire is your residence, wherein you will abide eternally, except for what Allah wills. Indeed, your Lord is Wise and Knowing."
trans-unit.target: A [sôn, O Muhammad], y diwrnod pan ef bydd eu casglu gyda'i gilydd [a dweud], "cwmni O jinn, mae gennych [camarwain] llawer o ddynol ryw." A bydd eu cynghreiriaid ymysg dynolryw yn dweud, "ein Arglwydd, rhai ohonom yn defnyddio eraill, ac yr ydym wedi cyrraedd ein tymor, a wnaethoch benodi i ni [nawr]." Bydd ef yn dweud, "y tân yn eich preswylfa, lle bydd chi lynu fythol, heblaw am beth a wills Allah. Yn wir, eich Arglwydd yn Wise ac mae gwybod."

trans-unit.source: And thus will We make some of the wrongdoers allies of others for what they used to earn.
trans-unit.target: Ac felly byddwn yn gwneud rhai o'r tramgwyddo y cynghreiriaid eraill ar gyfer beth y maen nhw'n ei ennill.

trans-unit.source: "O company of jinn and mankind, did there not come to you messengers from among you, relating to you My verses and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?" They will say, "We bear witness against ourselves"; and the worldly life had deluded them, and they will bear witness against themselves that they were disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: "Cwmni O jinn a dynolryw, mae na ddaeth i chi negeswyr o blith chi, sy'n ymwneud â chi fy penillion a rhybuddio chi y cyfarfod y diwrnod hwn chi?" Byddant yn dweud, "cofio dystio yn erbyn ein hunain"; a oedd y bywyd worldly yn deluded iddynt, a byddant yn dwyn tyst erbyn eu hunain eu bod yn disbelievers.

trans-unit.source: That is because your Lord would not destroy the cities for wrongdoing while their people were unaware.
trans-unit.target: Mae hynny oherwydd y byddai eich Arglwydd nid dinistrio y dinasoedd am gamwedd tra roedd eu pobl yn ymwybodol.

trans-unit.source: And for all are degrees from what they have done. And your Lord is not unaware of what they do.
trans-unit.target: Ac ar gyfer yr holl raddau o beth maent wedi'i wneud. Ac nid yw eich Arglwydd yn ymwybodol o'r hyn y maent yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: And your Lord is the Free of need, the possessor of mercy. If He wills, he can do away with you and give succession after you to whomever He wills, just as He produced you from the descendants of another people.
trans-unit.target: Ac mae eich Arglwydd yn rhydd o angen, y possessor o drugaredd. Os AU ewyllysiau, gall ef wneud i ffwrdd â chi a rhoi olyniaeth ar ôl i chi pwy bynnag a wills ef, fel ei fod yn unig cynhyrchodd chi o ddisgynyddion pobl arall.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, what you are promised is coming, and you will not cause failure [to Allah].
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, beth yr ydych yn addo dod, ac nid chi fydd achosi methiant [i Allah].

trans-unit.source: Say, "O my people, work according to your position; [for] indeed, I am working. And you are going to know who will have succession in the home. Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed.
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Mae O 'm pobl, gwaith yn ôl eich sefyllfa; [am] yn wir, yr wyf yn gweithio. A ydych yn mynd i wybod pwy fydd yn cael olyniaeth yn y cartref. Yn wir, bydd y tramgwyddo yn llwyddo.

trans-unit.source: And the polytheists assign to Allah from that which He created of crops and livestock a share and say, "This is for Allah," by their claim, "and this is for our partners [associated with Him]." But what is for their "partners" does not reach Allah, while what is for Allah - this reaches their "partners." Evil is that which they rule.
trans-unit.target: Ac mae y polytheists yn cael ei neilltuo i Allah a Creodd cnydau a da byw cyfran a dweud, "hwn yw i Allah," gan eu hawliad, "ac mae hyn ar gyfer ein partneriaid [sy'n gysylltiedig ag ef]." Ond nid yw beth yw eu "partneriaid" yn cyrraedd Allah, tra'n beth yw Allah-Mae hyn yn cyrraedd eu "bartneriaid". Yw drygioni sydd yn eu dyfarnu.

trans-unit.source: And likewise, to many of the polytheists their partners have made [to seem] pleasing the killing of their children in order to bring about their destruction and to cover them with confusion in their religion. And if Allah had willed, they would not have done so. So leave them and that which they invent.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn yr un modd, i lawer o polytheists y mae eu partneriaid yn wedi [i ymddangos] braf lladd eu plant er mwyn sicrhau eu dinistrio ac ymdrin â hwy gyda dryswch yn eu crefydd. Ac os oedd Allah ewyllysio iddi, byddai nad ydynt wedi gwneud hynny. Felly gadael iddynt ac y mae eu dyfeisio.

trans-unit.source: And they say, "These animals and crops are forbidden; no one may eat from them except whom we will," by their claim. And there are those [camels] whose backs are forbidden [by them] and those upon which the name of Allah is not mentioned - [all of this] an invention of untruth about Him. He will punish them for what they were inventing.
trans-unit.target: Ac maent yn dweud, "Mae hyn anifeiliaid a chnydau gwahardd; Gall unrhyw un fwyta ohonynt ac eithrio hwy, byddwn yn"gan eu hawliad. Ac mae hynny [camelod] eu cefnau yn gwahardd [eu] a rhai arno yr enw Allah yn crybwyll-[hyn oll] dyfeisiad o ddweud anwiredd am iddo. Bydd ef yn eu cosbi ar gyfer beth y cafodd ei dyfeisio.

trans-unit.source: And they say, "What is in the bellies of these animals is exclusively for our males and forbidden to our females. But if it is [born] dead, then all of them have shares therein." He will punish them for their description. Indeed, He is Wise and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Ac maent yn dweud, "beth sydd yn y Boliau anifeiliaid hyn yn unig ar gyfer ein dynion a gwahardd i ein menywod. Ond os yw'n marw [anwyd], yna mae pob un ohonynt wedi gyfranddaliadau ynddo. Bydd ef yn eu cosbi am eu disgrifiad. Yn wir, mae Wise a gwybod.

trans-unit.source: Those will have lost who killed their children in foolishness without knowledge and prohibited what Allah had provided for them, inventing untruth about Allah. They have gone astray and were not [rightly] guided.
trans-unit.target: Bydd rhai wedi colli sy'n eu lladd eu plant mewn ffolineb heb wybodaeth a waherddir beth Allah wedi darparu ar eu cyfer, dyfeisio untruth am Allah. Maent wedi mynd ar gyfeiliorn ac nad oedd arweiniad [iawn].

trans-unit.source: And He it is who causes gardens to grow, [both] trellised and untrellised, and palm trees and crops of different [kinds of] food and olives and pomegranates, similar and dissimilar. Eat of [each of] its fruit when it yields and give its due [zakah] on the day of its harvest. And be not excessive. Indeed, He does not like those who commit excess.
trans-unit.target: Ac ef a mae'n sy'n achosi gerddi i dyfu, [i'r ddau] trellised a untrellised, ac arbed coed a chnydau o wahanol [math o] olifau a bwyd a pomegranates, yn debyg ac yn annhebyg. Fwyta [pob un o'r] ei ffrwythau pan yields a rhoi ei dyledus [zakah] ar ddiwrnod ei gynhaeaf. Ac nid yn ormodol. Yn wir, nid yw'n hoffi'r i'r rheini sy'n ymrwymo gormodol.

trans-unit.source: And of the grazing livestock are carriers [of burdens] and those [too] small. Eat of what Allah has provided for you and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.
trans-unit.target: Ac y da byw sy'n pori yn gludwyr [o'r beichiau] a hynny [hefyd] bach. Fwyta o beth Allah wedi darparu i chi ac nid yn dilyn ôl traed Satan. Yn wir, ef yw eich gelyn clir.

trans-unit.source: [They are] eight mates - of the sheep, two and of the goats, two. Say, "Is it the two males He has forbidden or the two females or that which the wombs of the two females contain? Inform me with knowledge, if you should be truthful."
trans-unit.target: [Maent] wyth ffrindiau-y defaid, dau ac y geifr, dau. Dweud, "Mae'n Gwrywod dau wedi ei gwahardd neu ferched dau neu y mae wombs o ferched dau yn cynnwys? Rhoi gwybod i mi gyda gwybodaeth, os y dylech fod yn onest."

trans-unit.source: And of the camels, two and of the cattle, two. Say, "Is it the two males He has forbidden or the two females or that which the wombs of the two females contain? Or were you witnesses when Allah charged you with this? Then who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah to mislead the people by [something] other than knowledge? Indeed, Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people."
trans-unit.target: Ac o y camelod, yn ddwy ac y gwartheg, dau. Dweud, "Mae'n Gwrywod dau wedi ei gwahardd neu ferched dau neu y mae wombs o ferched dau yn cynnwys? Neu oedd eich tystion pan roedd Allah a godir chi gyda hyn? Yna sydd yn anghyfiawn fwy nag un sy'n dyfeisio celwydd am Allah i gamarwain pobl gan [rhywbeth] ac eithrio gwybodaeth? Yn wir, yw Allah nid canllaw y bobl gamwedd."

trans-unit.source: Say, "I do not find within that which was revealed to me [anything] forbidden to one who would eat it unless it be a dead animal or blood spilled out or the flesh of swine - for indeed, it is impure - or it be [that slaughtered in] disobedience, dedicated to other than Allah. But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit], then indeed, your Lord is Forgiving and Merciful."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Nid wyf yn gweld o fewn y datgelwyd i mi [Dim] gwaharddwyd i un a fyddai yn ei fwyta oni bai ei fod anifail marw neu roedd gwaed yn cael ei ollwng allan neu gig moch-yn wir, ei Mae amhur-neu ei [sy'n cael eu lladd yn] anufudd-dod, yn ymroddedig i heblaw Allah. Ond pwy bynnag yw gorfodi [gan reidrwydd], dynodir [TG] nac tramgwyddus [ei derfyn], ac yna yn wir, eich Arglwydd yn Forgiving a Merciful. "

trans-unit.source: And to those who are Jews We prohibited every animal of uncloven hoof; and of the cattle and the sheep We prohibited to them their fat, except what adheres to their backs or the entrails or what is joined with bone. [By] that We repaid them for their injustice. And indeed, We are truthful.
trans-unit.target: Ac i'r rhai sy'n Roedd Iddewon ydym wedi gwahardd pob anifail o carnau uncloven; a gwartheg a defaid y gwaherddir ydym iddynt eu braster, ac eithrio hyn yn glynu wrth eu cefnau, neu yr Ymysgaroedd neu beth wedi ymuno ag asgwrn. [Gan] hynny inni ad-dalu iddynt am eu anghyfiawnder. Ac yn wir, yr ydym yn dweud y gwir.

trans-unit.source: So if they deny you, [O Muhammad], say, "Your Lord is the possessor of vast mercy; but His punishment cannot be repelled from the people who are criminals."
trans-unit.target: Felly os maent yn gwadu'r chi, [O Muhammad], yn dweud, "eich Arglwydd yn possessor o drugaredd helaeth; ond ni all ei chosbi yn cadw draw ohono gan y bobl sydd yn droseddwyr.

trans-unit.source: Those who associated with Allah will say, "If Allah had willed, we would not have associated [anything] and neither would our fathers, nor would we have prohibited anything." Likewise did those before deny until they tasted Our punishment. Say, "Do you have any knowledge that you can produce for us? You follow not except assumption, and you are not but falsifying."
trans-unit.target: Bydd rhai sy'n gysylltiedig â Allah yn dweud, "Os oedd Allah ewyllysio iddi, nid ydym wedi cysylltiedig [Dim] a ychwaith yn byddai'n ein tadau, na fyddai wedi wahardd unrhyw beth." Yn yr un modd oedd rhai cyn gwadu nes oedd eu blasu ein cosbi. Dweud, "a oes gennych unrhyw wybodaeth y gallwch ei gyflwyno i ni? Dilynwch ni ac eithrio dybiaeth, ac nad ydych ond yn ffugio. "

trans-unit.source: Say, "With Allah is the far-reaching argument. If He had willed, He would have guided you all."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "gyda Allah yw'r ddadl bellgyrhaeddol. Os oedd yn ewyllysio iddi, byddai ef wedi arwain chi i gyd."

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "Bring forward your witnesses who will testify that Allah has prohibited this." And if they testify, do not testify with them. And do not follow the desires of those who deny Our verses and those who do not believe in the Hereafter, while they equate [others] with their Lord.
trans-unit.target: Dweud, [O Muhammad], "Dwyn ymlaen eich tystion a bydd yn tystio fod Allah wedi gwahardd hyn." Ac os mae dystio, wneud yn tystio nid gyda nhw. Ac nid yn dilyn dymuniadau y rhai sydd yn gwadu ein penillion a'r rhai nad ydynt yn credu mewn o hyn ymlaen, tra mae eu cyfateb [eraill] eu yr Arglwydd.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Come, I will recite what your Lord has prohibited to you. [He commands] that you not associate anything with Him, and to parents, good treatment, and do not kill your children out of poverty; We will provide for you and them. And do not approach immoralities - what is apparent of them and what is concealed. And do not kill the soul which Allah has forbidden [to be killed] except by [legal] right. This has He instructed you that you may use reason."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "dod, bydd adrodd beth y mae eich Arglwydd ei wahardd i chi. [Mae ef yn hawlio] Nid eich cysylltu unrhyw beth ag ef, ac i rieni, triniaeth dda, ac nid oes lladd eich plant allan o dlodi; Byddwn yn rhoi i chi a nhw. Ac nid agwedd immoralities-yr hyn sy'n amlwg iddynt a beth yw cuddio. Ac nid oes lladd enaid a Allah wedi gwahardd [i gael eu lladd] ac eithrio drwy hawl [cyfreithiol]. Hyn wedi rhoi cyfarwyddyd chi y gallwch ddefnyddio rheswm. "

trans-unit.source: And do not approach the orphan's property except in a way that is best until he reaches maturity. And give full measure and weight in justice. We do not charge any soul except [with that within] its capacity. And when you testify, be just, even if [it concerns] a near relative. And the covenant of Allah fulfill. This has He instructed you that you may remember.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oes dull eiddo yr amddifad ac eithrio mewn ffordd sy'n gorau nes iddo gyrraedd aeddfedrwydd. A rhoi Mesur llawn a phwysau mewn cyfiawnder. Nid ydym yn codi unrhyw enaid ac eithrio [â hynny o fewn] ei gallu. A phan mae dystio, yn unig, hyd yn oed os [Mae'n ymwneud] i berthynas agos. A chyflawni y cyfamod Allah. Hyn wedi rhoi cyfarwyddyd chi efallai eich bod yn cofio.

trans-unit.source: And, [moreover], this is My path, which is straight, so follow it; and do not follow [other] ways, for you will be separated from His way. This has He instructed you that you may become righteous.
trans-unit.target: Ac [hefyd], dyma fy llwybr, sydd yn syth, felly ei ddilyn; ac nid yn dilyn ffordd [arall], i chi yn cael eu gwahanu oddi wrth ei ffordd. Hyn wedi rhoi cyfarwyddyd chi y gallai ddod yn hoes dabloid.

trans-unit.source: Then We gave Moses the Scripture, making complete [Our favor] upon the one who did good and as a detailed explanation of all things and as guidance and mercy that perhaps in [the matter of] the meeting with their Lord they would believe.
trans-unit.target: Yna y rhoesom Moses yr ysgrythur, gwneud gwblhau [ein favor] ar yr un a wnaeth yn dda ac fel esboniad manwl o'r holl bethau ac fel canllawiau a'r drugaredd efallai yn [y mater o] y cyfarfod gyda'r Arglwydd eu credu byddai.

trans-unit.source: And this [Qur'an] is a Book We have revealed [which is] blessed, so follow it and fear Allah that you may receive mercy.
trans-unit.target: A hwn [Qur'an] a llyfr Rydym wedi datgelu [sydd] bendithio, felly yn ei ddilyn ac yn ofni Allah y gallech dderbyn drugaredd.

trans-unit.source: [We revealed it] lest you say, "The Scripture was only sent down to two groups before us, but we were of their study unaware,"
trans-unit.target: [Rydym yn datgelu ei] rhag ofn y dywedwch, "dim ond anfonwyd yr ysgrythur i lawr i ddau grŵp ger ein bron, ond yr oeddem yn eu hastudiaeth ymwybodol,"

trans-unit.source: Or lest you say, "If only the Scripture had been revealed to us, we would have been better guided than they." So there has [now] come to you a clear evidence from your Lord and a guidance and mercy. Then who is more unjust than one who denies the verses of Allah and turns away from them? We will recompense those who turn away from Our verses with the worst of punishment for their having turned away.
trans-unit.target: Neu rhag ofn y dywedwch, "os mai dim ond datgelwyd yr ysgrythur i ni, byddem wedi well dan arweiniad na nhw." Felly mae wedi [nawr] yn dod i chi tystiolaeth glir gan eich Arglwydd a canllawiau a drugaredd. Yna sydd yn anghyfiawn mwy nag un sydd yn gwadu y penillion Allah ac yn troi i ffwrdd oddi wrthynt? Bydd yn talu rhai sy'n troi oddi wrth ein penillion gyda'r gwaethaf o gosb i gael eu troi i ffwrdd.

trans-unit.source: Do they [then] wait for anything except that the angels should come to them or your Lord should come or that there come some of the signs of your Lord? The Day that some of the signs of your Lord will come no soul will benefit from its faith as long as it had not believed before or had earned through its faith some good. Say, "Wait. Indeed, we [also] are waiting."
trans-unit.target: Wneud iddynt [yna] yn aros am unrhyw beth heblaw y dylai angylion yn dod i iddynt neu eich Arglwydd dylid dod neu y mae yn dod rhai o arwyddion eich Arglwydd? Bydd y diwrnod y daw rhai o'r arwyddion eich Arglwydd oes enaid yn elwa o'i ffydd cyhyd ag y mae'n credu nad cyn neu wedi ennill trwy ei ffydd rhai da. Dweud, "aros. Yn wir, [hefyd] yr ydym yn aros."

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who have divided their religion and become sects - you, [O Muhammad], are not [associated] with them in anything. Their affair is only [left] to Allah; then He will inform them about what they used to do.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, nid yw rhai sy'n rhannu eu crefydd ac yn dod yn sectau-chi, [O Muhammad], [gysylltiedig] gyda nhw mewn unrhyw beth. Eu mater yn unig [chwith] i Allah; yna bydd yn rhoi gwybod iddynt am beth maent yn ei ddefnyddio i wneud.

trans-unit.source: Whoever comes [on the Day of Judgement] with a good deed will have ten times the like thereof [to his credit], and whoever comes with an evil deed will not be recompensed except the like thereof; and they will not be wronged.
trans-unit.target: Pwy bynnag ddaw [ar y diwrnod dyfarniad] gyda gweithred dda bydd deg gwaith tebyg ohono [ei credyd], a bwy bynnag a ddaw gyda'r weithred anfad bydd nid eu had-dalu ac eithrio tebyg ac ni Bydd maent yn cam.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Indeed, my Lord has guided me to a straight path - a correct religion - the way of Abraham, inclining toward truth. And he was not among those who associated others with Allah."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "yn wir, mae fy Arglwydd a 'm harweiniodd i lwybr syth-grefydd gywir-y ffordd o Abraham, inclining tuag at wirionedd. Ac nid oedd ymysg y rhai sy'n gysylltiedig eraill â Allah.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Indeed, my prayer, my rites of sacrifice, my living and my dying are for Allah, Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "yn wir, fy ngweddi, fy defodau aberthu, fy byw a marw fy yn Allah, Arglwydd y byd.

trans-unit.source: No partner has He. And this I have been commanded, and I am the first [among you] of the Muslims."
trans-unit.target: Oes partner ganddo. A hyn yr wyf wedi'i enillodd, ac yr wyf yn y cyntaf [ymhlith eich] y Moslemiaid.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Is it other than Allah I should desire as a lord while He is the Lord of all things? And every soul earns not [blame] except against itself, and no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return, and He will inform you concerning that over which you used to differ."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Mae'n heblaw Allah dylai yn awydd fel Arglwydd er ei fod yn yr Arglwydd yr holl bethau? Ac y mae pob enaid yn ennill nid [beio] ac eithrio erbyn ei hun, a bydd unrhyw cludo o'r beichiau yn ysgwyddo'r baich o un arall. Yna i eich Arglwydd yn eich ffurflen a bydd yn rhoi gwybod i chi ynghylch y dros y gwnaethoch eu defnyddio i fod yn wahanol.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who has made you successors upon the earth and has raised some of you above others in degrees [of rank] that He may try you through what He has given you. Indeed, your Lord is swift in penalty; but indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ac ef a wnaeth eich olynwyr ar wyneb y ddaear ac wedi codi rhai ohonoch uchod eraill mewn graddau [o safle] y gall geisio chi drwy hyn wedi rhoi ichi. Yn wir, eich Arglwydd yn gyflym yn gosb; ond yn wir, ei fod yn Forgiving a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: Alif, Lam, Meem, Sad.
trans-unit.target: Alif, Lam, Meem, trist.

trans-unit.source: [This is] a Book revealed to you, [O Muhammad] - so let there not be in your breast distress therefrom - that you may warn thereby and as a reminder to the believers.
trans-unit.target: [Mae hwn] Mae'r llyfr yn datgelu i chi, [O Muhammad]-felly gadewch na cheir yn eich gofid fron thelir-y gall eich rhybuddio felly'n ac i atgoffa y credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: Follow, [O mankind], what has been revealed to you from your Lord and do not follow other than Him any allies. Little do you remember.
trans-unit.target: Ddilyn, [O dynolryw], mae'r hyn a ddatgelwyd i chi gan eich Arglwydd ac nid yw yn dilyn unrhyw gynghreiriaid eraill nag ef. Ychydig a ydych yn cofio.

trans-unit.source: And how many cities have We destroyed, and Our punishment came to them at night or while they were sleeping at noon.
trans-unit.target: A dinasoedd faint yr ydym wedi dinistrio, a daeth ein cosbi iddynt yn y nos neu tra oeddent yn cysgu ganol dydd.

trans-unit.source: And their declaration when Our punishment came to them was only that they said, "Indeed, we were wrongdoers!"
trans-unit.target: A dim ond eu datganiad pan ddaeth ein cosbi iddynt oedd y dywedasant, "Yn wir, rydym yn tramgwyddo!"

trans-unit.source: Then We will surely question those to whom [a message] was sent, and We will surely question the messengers.
trans-unit.target: Yna bydd siawns yn cwestiynu rhai i bwy anfonwyd [neges], a byddwn yn sicr yn ei holi y negeswyr.

trans-unit.source: Then We will surely relate [their deeds] to them with knowledge, and We were not [at all] absent.
trans-unit.target: Wedyn bydd gennym siawns ymwneud [eu gweithredoedd] iddynt gyda gwybodaeth, ac nid oeddem yn absennol [bob].

trans-unit.source: And the weighing [of deeds] that Day will be the truth. So those whose scales are heavy - it is they who will be the successful.
trans-unit.target: A y phwyso'r [gweithredoedd] y dydd bydd y gwir. Felly, mae'r eu graddfeydd yn drwm-hwy a fydd yn llwyddiannus.

trans-unit.source: And those whose scales are light - they are the ones who will lose themselves for what injustice they were doing toward Our verses.
trans-unit.target: A'r rhai sydd â graddfeydd yn ysgafn-hwy yw'r rhai a fydd yn colli eu hunain ar gyfer anghyfiawnder beth oeddent yn ei wneud tuag at ein penillion.

trans-unit.source: And We have certainly established you upon the earth and made for you therein ways of livelihood. Little are you grateful.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn sicr rydym wedi sefydlu chi ar wyneb y ddaear a gwneud i chi ynddo ffyrdd o fywoliaeth. Ychydig a ydych yn ddiolchgar.

trans-unit.source: And We have certainly created you, [O Mankind], and given you [human] form. Then We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam"; so they prostrated, except for Iblees. He was not of those who prostrated.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn sicr rydym wedi creu chi, [O dynolryw], a ydych yn rhoi ffurflen [dynol]. Yna yr ydym yn dweud i'r angylion, "Prostrate i Adam"; fel y maent yn prostrated, heblaw am Iblees. Nid oedd y rhai a prostrated.

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "What prevented you from prostrating when I commanded you?" [Satan] said, "I am better than him. You created me from fire and created him from clay."
trans-unit.target: [Allah] yn dweud, "Hyn eich rhwystro rhag prostrating pan enillodd yr ydych?" [Satan] a dywedodd, "yr wyf yn well nag ef. Mae eich creu mi o'r tân a grëwyd ef o glai.

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "Descend from Paradise, for it is not for you to be arrogant therein. So get out; indeed, you are of the debased.
trans-unit.target: [Allah] yn dweud, "disgyn o baradwys, am nad yw'n i chi fod yn drahaus ynddo. Felly ewch allan; yn wir, yr ydych o danseilio y.

trans-unit.source: [Satan] said, "Reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."
trans-unit.target: [Satan] a dywedodd, "Mi yn arbed tan y diwrnod maent yn atgyfodi."

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "Indeed, you are of those reprieved."
trans-unit.target: [Allah] dywedodd, "Yn wir, chi yn rhai reprieved."

trans-unit.source: [Satan] said, "Because You have put me in error, I will surely sit in wait for them on Your straight path.
trans-unit.target: [Satan] yn dweud, "gan fod wedi fy rhoi mewn camgymeriad, bydd siawns eistedd yn aros iddynt ar eich llwybr syth.

trans-unit.source: Then I will come to them from before them and from behind them and on their right and on their left, and You will not find most of them grateful [to You]."
trans-unit.target: Yna bydd yn dod iddynt o'r cyn iddynt ac o'r tu ôl iddynt ac ar eu hawl ac ar eu gadael, ac ni welwch rhan fwyaf ohonynt ddiolchgar [i chi]."

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "Get out of Paradise, reproached and expelled. Whoever follows you among them - I will surely fill Hell with you, all together."
trans-unit.target: [Allah] dywedodd, "allan o baradwys, reproached ac yn ei ddiarddel. Pwy bynnag sy'n eich dilyn yn eu plith-Onid wyf bydd llenwi'r uffern gyda chi, cyfan at ei gilydd."

trans-unit.source: And "O Adam, dwell, you and your wife, in Paradise and eat from wherever you will but do not approach this tree, lest you be among the wrongdoers."
trans-unit.target: A "O Adam, myfyrio, chi a eich gwraig, yn baradwys a bwyta o ble bynnag y mae yn bydd, ond nid oes dull y goeden hon, rhag ofn y bydd chi ymhlith y tramgwyddo.

trans-unit.source: But Satan whispered to them to make apparent to them that which was concealed from them of their private parts. He said, "Your Lord did not forbid you this tree except that you become angels or become of the immortal."
trans-unit.target: Ond sibrydodd Satan iddynt i wneud yn amlwg iddynt nad oedd sy'n cuddio oddi wrthynt eu rhannau preifat. Meddai, "oedd eich Arglwydd ni a'n gwaredo chi goeden hon heblaw y dod yn angylion neu dod o yr anfarwol."

trans-unit.source: And he swore [by Allah] to them, "Indeed, I am to you from among the sincere advisors."
trans-unit.target: A rhegodd [gan Allah] iddynt, "yn wir, yr wyf i chi o blith y cynghorwyr ddiffuant."

trans-unit.source: So he made them fall, through deception. And when they tasted of the tree, their private parts became apparent to them, and they began to fasten together over themselves from the leaves of Paradise. And their Lord called to them, "Did I not forbid you from that tree and tell you that Satan is to you a clear enemy?"
trans-unit.target: Felly y gwnaeth iddynt gwympo, trwy Ddichell. A pan oedd eu bod yn blasu y goeden, daeth yn amlwg iddynt yn eu rhannau preifat, a dechreuon nhw Caewch gyda'i gilydd dros eu hunain gan y dail o baradwys. A galwodd eu yr Arglwydd iddynt, "oedd nid a'n gwaredo chi o y goeden a dweud wrthych mai Satan yw eich gelyn clir?"

trans-unit.source: They said, "Our Lord, we have wronged ourselves, and if You do not forgive us and have mercy upon us, we will surely be among the losers."
trans-unit.target: Maent yn dweud, "Arglwydd ein, rydym wedi cam ein hunain, ac os nad ydych yn maddau inni ac yn wedi drugaredd arnom, byddwn yn sicr ymhlith y rhai ar eu colled."

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "Descend, being to one another enemies. And for you on the earth is a place of settlement and enjoyment for a time."
trans-unit.target: [Allah] dywedodd, "Descend, yn elynion i un arall. Ac i chi ar y ddaear yn lle o setliad a mwynhad am amser.

trans-unit.source: He said, "Therein you will live, and therein you will die, and from it you will be brought forth."
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "ynddo bydd ydych yn byw, ac ynddo bydd byddwch yn marw, ac o Bydd ydych yn dod ymlaen."

trans-unit.source: O children of Adam, We have bestowed upon you clothing to conceal your private parts and as adornment. But the clothing of righteousness - that is best. That is from the signs of Allah that perhaps they will remember.
trans-unit.target: O plant Adam, wedi roesom ar eich dillad i guddio eich rhannau preifat ac fel addurn. Ond y dillad o chyfiawnder i-dyna'r gorau. Mae gan yr arwyddion Allah efallai y byddant yn eu cofio.

trans-unit.source: O children of Adam, let not Satan tempt you as he removed your parents from Paradise, stripping them of their clothing to show them their private parts. Indeed, he sees you, he and his tribe, from where you do not see them. Indeed, We have made the devils allies to those who do not believe.
trans-unit.target: O plant Adam, gadewch i ni Satan demtio chi fel y dileodd eich rhieni o baradwys, cael gwared arnynt eu dillad eu hunain i ddangos iddynt eu rhannau preifat. Yn wir, ef yn gweld chi, ef a ei tribe, o lle na allwch weld iddynt. Yn wir, rydym wedi gwneud y cynghreiriaid devils i'r rhai nad ydynt yn credu.

trans-unit.source: And when they commit an immorality, they say, "We found our fathers doing it, and Allah has ordered us to do it." Say, "Indeed, Allah does not order immorality. Do you say about Allah that which you do not know?"
trans-unit.target: A pan maent yn ymrwymo anfoesoldeb, maent yn dweud, "Cawsom ein tadau yn ei wneud, ac mae Allah yn archebu inni wneud hynny." Dweud, "yn wir, yw Allah nid Gorchymyn anfoesoldeb. Ydych chi'n ei ddweud am Allah sy'n nad ydych yn gwybod?"

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "My Lord has ordered justice and that you maintain yourselves [in worship of Him] at every place [or time] of prostration, and invoke Him, sincere to Him in religion." Just as He originated you, you will return [to life] -
trans-unit.target: Dweud, [O Muhammad], "fy Arglwydd wedi archebu cyfiawnder a bod chi gynnal eich hunain [yn addoli iddo] ar bob lle [neu amser] prostration, ac yn galw'r ef, yn ddiffuant iddo mewn crefydd." Yn union fel roedd ef yn tarddu chi, byddwch yn dychwelyd [oes]-

trans-unit.source: A group [of you] He guided, and a group deserved [to be in] error. Indeed, they had taken the devils as allies instead of Allah while they thought that they were guided.
trans-unit.target: Grŵp [o] ef yn ei harwain, ac roedd grŵp yn haeddu [yn] gwall. Yn wir, wedi cymryd y devils fel cynghreiriaid yn hytrach na Allah er y credai eu bod yn eu harwain.

trans-unit.source: O children of Adam, take your adornment at every masjid, and eat and drink, but be not excessive. Indeed, He likes not those who commit excess.
trans-unit.target: O Mae plant Adam, cymryd eich addurn ar bob masjid, ac yn bwyta ac yn yfed, ond fod nid yn ormodol. Yn wir, mae'n hoffi nid y rhai sy'n ymrwymo gormodol.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Who has forbidden the adornment of Allah which He has produced for His servants and the good [lawful] things of provision?" Say, "They are for those who believe during the worldly life [but] exclusively for them on the Day of Resurrection." Thus do We detail the verses for a people who know.
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Sydd wedi gwahardd yr addurn Allah sydd ganddo wedi cynhyrchu ar gyfer ei weision a pethau [gyfreithlon] da o ddarpariaeth?" Dweud, "Maent yn ar gyfer y rhai sydd yn credu yn ystod bywyd worldly [ond] yn gyfan gwbl ar eu cyfer ar ddiwrnod atgyfodi." Felly rydym yn manylu y penillion ar gyfer pobl sy'n gwybod.

trans-unit.source: Say, "My Lord has only forbidden immoralities - what is apparent of them and what is concealed - and sin, and oppression without right, and that you associate with Allah that for which He has not sent down authority, and that you say about Allah that which you do not know."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "dim ond wedi fy Arglwydd yn gwahardd immoralities-yr hyn sy'n amlwg ohonynt a beth yw cuddio-a phechod, a gorthrwm heb hawl, ac y mae eich cysylltu ag Allah fod y mae ni anfon i lawr awdurdod, ac eich bod yn dweud am Allah sy'n nad ydych yn gwybod."

trans-unit.source: And for every nation is a [specified] term. So when their time has come, they will not remain behind an hour, nor will they precede [it].
trans-unit.target: Ac ar gyfer pob gwlad yn derm [penodol]. Felly pan fydd eu hamser wedi dod, ni fyddant yn aros tu ôl i awr, neu bydd eu rhagflaenu [TG].

trans-unit.source: O children of Adam, if there come to you messengers from among you relating to you My verses, then whoever fears Allah and reforms - there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
trans-unit.target: O plant Adam, os ddod yno i chi negeswyr o blith chi sy'n ymwneud â chi fy penillion, yna pwy bynnag ofni Allah a diwygiadau-ni fydd unrhyw ofn sy'n ymwneud â hwy, na fydd iddynt alaru.

trans-unit.source: But the ones who deny Our verses and are arrogant toward them - those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.
trans-unit.target: Ond y rhai sydd yn gwadu ein penillion ac yn drahaus tuag atynt-rhai yn y cymdeithion y tân; Bydd maent yn glynu ynddo fythol.

trans-unit.source: And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allah a lie or denies His verses? Those will attain their portion of the decree until when Our messengers come to them to take them in death, they will say, "Where are those you used to invoke besides Allah?" They will say, "They have departed from us," and will bear witness against themselves that they were disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Ac sydd yn anghyfiawn fwy nag un sy'n dyfeisio am Allah celwydd neu yn gwadu ei penillion? Bydd rhai yn ennill eu cyfran o'r ordinhad y tan pan ddaw ein negeswyr iddynt eu cymryd mewn marwolaeth, byddant yn dweud, "Ble mae rhai a ddefnyddiwyd gennych i alw ar wahân i Allah?" Byddant yn dweud, "wedi iddynt ymadael oddi wrthym ni", a bydd Arth yn dyst erbyn eu hunain y maent yn disbelievers.

trans-unit.source: [Allah] will say, "Enter among nations which had passed on before you of jinn and mankind into the Fire." Every time a nation enters, it will curse its sister until, when they have all overtaken one another therein, the last of them will say about the first of them "Our Lord, these had misled us, so give them a double punishment of the Fire. He will say, "For each is double, but you do not know."
trans-unit.target: [Allah] bydd yn dweud, "Rhowch ymysg cenhedloedd sydd wedi pasio cyn i chi jinn a dynolryw yn tân." Bob tro y mae'r genedl yn llifo, bydd ei melltithio ei chwaer tan pan maent wedi holl goddiweddyd un arall ynddo, bydd yr olaf ohonynt yn dweud am y cyntaf ohonynt 'ein Arglwydd, mae'r rhain wedi ein camarwain, felly rhowch cosbi dwbl y tân. Bydd yn dweud, "ar gyfer pob un yn ddwbl, ond nad ydych yn gwybod."

trans-unit.source: And the first of them will say to the last of them, "Then you had not any favor over us, so taste the punishment for what you used to earn."
trans-unit.target: A bydd y gyntaf ohonynt yn dweud yr olaf ohonynt, 'yna oedd gennych nid unrhyw favor dros inni, felly blas y gosb ar gyfer beth yr ydych yn ei defnyddio i ennill."

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who deny Our verses and are arrogant toward them - the gates of Heaven will not be opened for them, nor will they enter Paradise until a camel enters into the eye of a needle. And thus do We recompense the criminals.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, rhai sydd yn gwadu ein penillion ac yn drahaus tuag atynt-y clwydi of Heaven nid agorir iddynt, na byddant yn mynd i baradwys nes Mae'r camel yn llunio llygad y nodwydd. Ac felly ei wneud yn ad-dalu y troseddwyr.

trans-unit.source: They will have from Hell a bed and over them coverings [of fire]. And thus do We recompense the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Bydd ganddynt o uffern gwely a dros eu gorchuddion [o dân]. Ac felly ei wneud yn ad-dalu y tramgwyddo.

trans-unit.source: But those who believed and did righteous deeds - We charge no soul except [within] its capacity. Those are the companions of Paradise; they will abide therein eternally.
trans-unit.target: Ond y rhai sy'n credu a oedd gweithredoedd cyfiawn-Rydym yn codi unrhyw enaid ac eithrio [yn] ei gallu. Mae'r rheini'n chymdeithion o baradwys; Bydd maent yn glynu ynddo fythol.

trans-unit.source: And We will have removed whatever is within their breasts of resentment, [while] flowing beneath them are rivers. And they will say, "Praise to Allah, who has guided us to this; and we would never have been guided if Allah had not guided us. Certainly the messengers of our Lord had come with the truth." And they will be called, "This is Paradise, which you have been made to inherit for what you used to do."
trans-unit.target: A fydd wedi symud beth bynnag sydd o fewn eu bronnau drwgdeimlad, [tra bod] yn llifo oddi tanyn nhw yn afonydd. A byddant yn dweud, "ganmol i Allah, sydd wedi'n harwain ni i hyn; a byddai gennym erioed wedi fy nhywys os oedd Allah yn ein harwain ni. Yn sicr roedd y Negeswyr erbyn ein Arglwydd wedi dod â gwir." A bydd eu galw, "Dyma baradwys, a wnaed i etifeddu beth yr ydych yn ei defnyddio i wneud."

trans-unit.source: And the companions of Paradise will call out to the companions of the Fire, "We have already found what our Lord promised us to be true. Have you found what your Lord promised to be true?" They will say, "Yes." Then an announcer will announce among them, "The curse of Allah shall be upon the wrongdoers."
trans-unit.target: A bydd y cymdeithion o baradwys yn galw allan i gyd-deithwyr y tân, "Rydym wedi eisoes wedi canfod ein Arglwydd addo ein bod yn wir. A oedd eich Arglwydd yn addo fod yn wir?" Byddant yn dweud, "Do." Yna bydd welir yn cyhoeddi yn eu plith, "Bydd y felltith Allah yn ar y tramgwyddo."

trans-unit.source: Who averted [people] from the way of Allah and sought to make it [seem] deviant while they were, concerning the Hereafter, disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Sydd yn osgoi [pobl] o'r ffordd o Allah ac yn ceisio ei gwneud yn [ymddangos] gwyrdröedig tra oedd, maent yn ymwneud â ' o hyn ymlaen, disbelievers.

trans-unit.source: And between them will be a partition, and on [its] elevations are men who recognize all by their mark. And they call out to the companions of Paradise, "Peace be upon you." They have not [yet] entered it, but they long intensely.
trans-unit.target: A rhwng eu fydd pared, ac ar [ei] drychiadau dynion sy'n cydnabod oll gan eu marc. Ac maent yn galw i gyd-deithwyr paradwys, "fod heddwch arnoch." Mae eu nid [eto] ymuno, ond maent yn hir ddwys.

trans-unit.source: And when their eyes are turned toward the companions of the Fire, they say, "Our Lord, do not place us with the wrongdoing people."
trans-unit.target: A pan eu llygaid yn troi tuag at y cymdeithion y tân, maent yn dweud, "Ein Arglwydd, peidiwch â rhoi inni gyda'r bobl gamwedd."

trans-unit.source: And the companions of the Elevations will call to men [within Hell] whom they recognize by their mark, saying, "Of no avail to you was your gathering and [the fact] that you were arrogant."
trans-unit.target: A chymdeithion y gweddluniau, bydd galw i ddynion [o fewn uffern] hwy eu bod yn cydnabod drwy eu marc, yn dweud, "ofer i chi oedd eich casglu ac [am] eich bod yn haerllug."

trans-unit.source: [Allah will say], "Are these the ones whom you [inhabitants of Hell] swore that Allah would never offer them mercy? Enter Paradise, [O People of the Elevations]. No fear will there be concerning you, nor will you grieve."
trans-unit.target: [Bydd Allah yn dweud], "Mae'r rhain yn rhai y dywedodd chi [drigolion uffern] arnyn y byddai Allah byth yn cynnig iddynt drugaredd? Rhowch paradwys, [O bobl y gweddluniau]. Bydd unrhyw ofn yno yn ymwneud â chi, ac ni bydd eich grieve."

trans-unit.source: And the companions of the Fire will call to the companions of Paradise, "Pour upon us some water or from whatever Allah has provided you." They will say, "Indeed, Allah has forbidden them both to the disbelievers."
trans-unit.target: A bydd y cymdeithion y tân yn galw i chymdeithion o baradwys, "tywallt arnom rhai dŵr neu o ba bynnag Allah wedi rhoi i chi." Byddant yn dweud, "Yn wir, mae Allah yn waharddedig iddynt i y disbelievers."

trans-unit.source: Who took their religion as distraction and amusement and whom the worldly life deluded." So today We will forget them just as they forgot the meeting of this Day of theirs and for having rejected Our verses.
