trans-unit.target: [A gymerodd eu crefydd fel gwrthdyniad a difyrion a phwy oedd y bywyd worldly deluded." Felly heddiw bydd anghofio amdanynt fel y maent anghofiodd y cyfarfod ar y diwrnod hwn hwy ac ar gyfer cael gwrthod ein penillion.

trans-unit.source: And We had certainly brought them a Book which We detailed by knowledge - as guidance and mercy to a people who believe.
trans-unit.target: Ac rydym yn sicr wedi eu llyfr sydd gennym manwl gan wybodaeth-fel canllawiau a drugaredd i bobl sydd yn credu.

trans-unit.source: Do they await except its result? The Day its result comes those who had ignored it before will say, "The messengers of our Lord had come with the truth, so are there [now] any intercessors to intercede for us or could we be sent back to do other than we used to do?" They will have lost themselves, and lost from them is what they used to invent.
trans-unit.target: Wneud iddynt aros am heblaw ei ganlyniad? Daw y dydd ei ganlyniad sydd wedi anwybyddu ei cyn bydd yn dweud, "oedd y Negeswyr erbyn ein Arglwydd wedi dod gyda y gwir, felly oes [nawr] unrhyw intercessors i eiriol drosom neu gallech anfon ôl i wneud heblaw arferem wneud?" Maent wedi colli eu hunain, ac wedi colli oddi wrthynt yn beth maent yn ei defnyddio i ddyfeisio.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, your Lord is Allah, who created the heavens and earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne. He covers the night with the day, [another night] chasing it rapidly; and [He created] the sun, the moon, and the stars, subjected by His command. Unquestionably, His is the creation and the command; blessed is Allah, Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, eich Arglwydd yn Allah, sy'n creu y nefoedd a'r ddaear yn chwe diwrnod ac yna ei hun yn sefydlu uchod i'r Orsedd. Mae'n ymdrin â y nos ar y diwrnod, [nos arall] ymlid yn gyflym; a [Creodd] yr haul, y lleuad, a'r sêr, yn destun gan ei orchymyn. Yn ddiamau, ei Mae creu a Gorchymyn; bendithio yn Allah, Arglwydd y byd.

trans-unit.source: Call upon your Lord in humility and privately; indeed, He does not like transgressors.
trans-unit.target: Yn galw ar eich Arglwydd mewn gwyleidd-dra ac yn breifat; yn wir, nid yw'n hoffi'r transgressors.

trans-unit.source: And cause not corruption upon the earth after its reformation. And invoke Him in fear and aspiration. Indeed, the mercy of Allah is near to the doers of good.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn achosi llygredd nid ar wyneb y ddaear ar ôl ei diwygiad Protestannaidd. A galw'r ef mewn ofn a dyhead. Yn wir, yn drugaredd Allah ger phoenwn da.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy until, when they have carried heavy rainclouds, We drive them to a dead land and We send down rain therein and bring forth thereby [some] of all the fruits. Thus will We bring forth the dead; perhaps you may be reminded.
trans-unit.target: Ac ef sy'n anfon y gwyntoedd tidings mor dda cyn ei drugaredd tan pan maent wedi rainclouds trwm, rydym yn eu gyrru i dir marw a rydym yn anfon i lawr glaw ynddo ac yn dwyn ymlaen gan [rai] o'r holl ffrwythau. Felly byddwn yn cyflwyno y meirw; Efallai y gall eich atgoffa.

trans-unit.source: And the good land - its vegetation emerges by permission of its Lord; but that which is bad - nothing emerges except sparsely, with difficulty. Thus do We diversify the signs for a people who are grateful.
trans-unit.target: Ac y tir da-ei llystyfiant ddod i'r amlwg drwy ganiatâd ei Arglwydd; ond y sydd yn drwg-dim byd yn dod i'r amlwg ac eithrio yn denau, gydag anhawster. Felly rydym yn arallgyfeirio yr arwyddion ar gyfer pobl sy'n ddiolchgar.

trans-unit.source: We had certainly sent Noah to his people, and he said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a tremendous Day.
trans-unit.target: Yn sicr rydym wedi anfon Noah at ei bobl, a dywedodd, "O 'm pobl, addoli Allah; Mae gennych unrhyw Dduwdod heblaw iddo. Yn wir, mae arnaf ofn ichi cosbi aruthrol y dydd.

trans-unit.source: Said the eminent among his people, "Indeed, we see you in clear error."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd yr enwog ymysg ei bobl, "yn wir, rydym yn gweld chi mewn camgymeriad amlwg."

trans-unit.source: [Noah] said, "O my people, there is not error in me, but I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd [Noah], "O fy pobl, nid oes gwall yn imi, ond yr wyf yn negesydd o Arglwydd y byd."

trans-unit.source: I convey to you the messages of my Lord and advise you; and I know from Allah what you do not know.
trans-unit.target: Trosglwyddo negeseuon fy Arglwydd i chi ac yn rhoi cyngor i chi; a gwn o Allah beth nad ydych yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: Then do you wonder that there has come to you a reminder from your Lord through a man from among you, that he may warn you and that you may fear Allah so you might receive mercy."
trans-unit.target: Yna rhaid i chi ofyn hynny mae wedi dod i chi ein hatgoffa gan eich Arglwydd drwy dyn o blith chi, y gall ef eich rhybuddio a bod efallai eich bod yn ofni Allah fel efallai y cewch drugaredd."

trans-unit.source: But they denied him, so We saved him and those who were with him in the ship. And We drowned those who denied Our signs. Indeed, they were a blind people.
trans-unit.target: Ond maent gwadodd iddo, felly rydym yn arbed ef a'r rhai a oedd gydag ef yn y llong. A ydym yn rhai sy'n gwadu arwyddion ein boddi. Yn wir, maent yn bobl ddall.

trans-unit.source: And to the 'Aad [We sent] their brother Hud. He said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. Then will you not fear Him?"
trans-unit.target: Ac at y ' Aad [anfonasom] eu brawd Hud. Dywedodd, "O 'm pobl, addoli Allah; Mae gennych unrhyw Dduwdod heblaw iddo. Yna bydd eich nid ofni iddo?"

trans-unit.source: Said the eminent ones who disbelieved among his people, "Indeed, we see you in foolishness, and indeed, we think you are of the liars."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd yr enwog rhai ddysgais ymysg ei bobl, "yn wir, byddwn yn eich gweld yn ffolineb, ac yn wir, yr ydym yn meddwl eich bod yn y celwyddgwn."

trans-unit.source: [Hud] said, "O my people, there is not foolishness in me, but I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd [Hud], "O fy pobl, nid oes ffolineb yn imi, ond yr wyf yn negesydd o Arglwydd y byd."

trans-unit.source: I convey to you the messages of my Lord, and I am to you a trustworthy adviser.
trans-unit.target: Yr wyf yn cyfleu i chi negeseuon o fy Arglwydd, a fi i chi ymgynghorydd dibynadwy.

trans-unit.source: Then do you wonder that there has come to you a reminder from your Lord through a man from among you, that he may warn you? And remember when He made you successors after the people of Noah and increased you in stature extensively. So remember the favors of Allah that you might succeed.
trans-unit.target: Wedyn a ydych yn synnu bod yna wedi dod i chi ein hatgoffa o eich Arglwydd drwy dyn o blith chi, y gall ef eich rhybuddio? A chofiwch, pan gwnaeth eich olynwyr ar ôl pobl Noah a chi cynyddodd yn statws helaeth. Felly cofiwch favors Allah efallai byddwch yn llwyddo.

trans-unit.source: They said, "Have you come to us that we should worship Allah alone and leave what our fathers have worshipped? Then bring us what you promise us, if you should be of the truthful."
trans-unit.target: Maent yn dweud, "rydych wedi cyrraedd i ni y dylem addoli Allah yn unig a gadael yr hyn y mae ein tadau wedi addoli? Yna dwyn inni eich addewid inni, os dylai fod o y geirwir."

trans-unit.source: [Hud] said, "Already have defilement and anger fallen upon you from your Lord. Do you dispute with me concerning [mere] names you have named them, you and your fathers, for which Allah has not sent down any authority? Then wait; indeed, I am with you among those who wait."
trans-unit.target: [Hud] yn dweud, "eisoes wedi defilement a dicter disgyn arnoch gan eich Arglwydd. A ydych yn gwadu'r gyda mi ynghylch enwau [ond] wedi eich enw arnynt, chi a eich tadau, y yw Allah wedi anfon i lawr unrhyw awdurdod? Yna aros; yn wir, yr wyf â chi ymhlith y rhai sy'n aros."

trans-unit.source: So We saved him and those with him by mercy from Us. And We eliminated those who denied Our signs, and they were not [at all] believers.
trans-unit.target: Er mwyn cadw ein ef a rhai gydag ef gan drugaredd oddi wrthym ni. A ydym yn dileu rhai sy'n gwadu arwyddion ein, ac nad oeddent yn [o gwbl] credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: And to the Thamud [We sent] their brother Salih. He said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. There has come to you clear evidence from your Lord. This is the she-camel of Allah [sent] to you as a sign. So leave her to eat within Allah 's land and do not touch her with harm, lest there seize you a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Ac i Thamud y [anfonasom] eu brawd Salih. Dywedodd, "O 'm pobl, addoli Allah; Mae gennych unrhyw Dduwdod heblaw iddo. Mae wedi dod i mae eich tystiolaeth glir o eich Arglwydd. Dyma hi-camel Allah [Anfonwyd] i chi fel arwydd. Felly adael ei fwyta o fewn tir y Allah a Peidiwch â chyffwrdd hi â niwed, rhag ofn i chi yno yn ymafael cosb poenus.

trans-unit.source: And remember when He made you successors after the 'Aad and settled you in the land, [and] you take for yourselves palaces from its plains and carve from the mountains, homes. Then remember the favors of Allah and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption."
trans-unit.target: Ac yn cofio pan wnaeth olynwyr ar ôl ichi y ' Aad a setlo Mae chi yn y tir, [a] chi gymryd drosoch palasau gan ei gorlifdiroedd ac eithriadau o'r mynyddoedd, cartrefi. Yna cofiwch favors Allah ac nid oes ymrwymo cam-drin ar y ddaear, gwasgaru llygredd.

trans-unit.source: Said the eminent ones who were arrogant among his people to those who were oppressed - to those who believed among them, "Do you [actually] know that Salih is sent from his Lord?" They said, "Indeed we, in that with which he was sent, are believers."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd y rhai enwog a oedd yn drahaus ymysg ei bobl i'r rhai sy'n eu gormesu-i'r rhai sydd yn credu yn eu plith, "[mewn gwirionedd] wyddoch chi bod Salih ei anfon gan ei Arglwydd?" Maent yn dweud, "yn wir, yr anfonwyd ef, yn gredinwyr.

trans-unit.source: Said those who were arrogant, "Indeed we, in that which you have believed, are disbelievers."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd y rheini a oedd yn drahaus, "yn wir, a ydych wedi credu, yn disbelievers.

trans-unit.source: So they hamstrung the she-camel and were insolent toward the command of their Lord and said, "O Salih, bring us what you promise us, if you should be of the messengers."
trans-unit.target: Felly maent yn rhwystro hi-camel ac roedd digywilydd tuag at y feistrolaeth ar eu Arglwydd a dywedodd, "O Salih, ddod â ni'n eich addewid inni, os dylai fod o y negeswyr."

trans-unit.source: So the earthquake seized them, and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.
trans-unit.target: Felly roedd y daeargryn yn hatafaelu iddynt, a daeth y maent yn eu cartref [cyrff] wedi gostwng yn dueddol o.

trans-unit.source: And he turned away from them and said, "O my people, I had certainly conveyed to you the message of my Lord and advised you, but you do not like advisors."
trans-unit.target: Ac yn troi i ffwrdd oddi wrthynt a dweud, "O fy pobl, sicr wedi yn cyfleu'r neges o fy Arglwydd i chi ac yn eich hysbysu, ond nad ydych yn hoffi cynghorwyr."

trans-unit.source: And [We had sent] Lot when he said to his people, "Do you commit such immorality as no one has preceded you with from among the worlds?
trans-unit.target: A [wedi inni anfon] llawer pan ddywedodd ei bobl, "a ydych yn ymrwymo'r anfoesoldeb o'r fath fel unrhyw un wedi rhagflaenu i chi o blith y fyd?

trans-unit.source: Indeed, you approach men with desire, instead of women. Rather, you are a transgressing people."
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, mae eich dull dynion ag awydd, yn hytrach na menywod. Yn hytrach, yr ydych yn bobl sy'n camweddu sawl gwaith."

trans-unit.source: But the answer of his people was only that they said, "Evict them from your city! Indeed, they are men who keep themselves pure."
trans-unit.target: Ond yr ateb ei bobl oedd dim ond y dywedasant, "troi allan o eich Dinas! Yn wir, maent yn ddynion sy'n cadw eu hunain yn pur."

trans-unit.source: So We saved him and his family, except for his wife; she was of those who remained [with the evildoers].
trans-unit.target: Felly yr ydym yn arbed iddo ef a'i deulu, ac eithrio ei wraig; Roedd hi o'r rhai sydd yn aros [evildoers].

trans-unit.source: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones]. Then see how was the end of the criminals.
trans-unit.target: A ydym yn bwrw glaw arnynt glaw [o gerrig]. Yna i weld sut yr oedd diwedd y troseddwyr.

trans-unit.source: And to [the people of] Madyan [We sent] their brother Shu'ayb. He said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. There has come to you clear evidence from your Lord. So fulfill the measure and weight and do not deprive people of their due and cause not corruption upon the earth after its reformation. That is better for you, if you should be believers.
trans-unit.target: Ac [y bobl] Madyan [anfonasom] eu brawd Shu'ayb. Dywedodd, "O 'm pobl, addoli Allah; Mae gennych unrhyw Dduwdod heblaw iddo. Mae wedi dod i mae eich tystiolaeth glir o eich Arglwydd. Felly wireddu y Mesur a'r pwysau a wneud Nid amddifadu pobl o'u dyledus ac achosi llygredd nid ar wyneb y ddaear ar ôl ei diwygiad Protestannaidd. Mae hynny'n well i chi, os dylai fod credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: And do not sit on every path, threatening and averting from the way of Allah those who believe in Him, seeking to make it [seem] deviant. And remember when you were few and He increased you. And see how was the end of the corrupters.
trans-unit.target: A ydynt yn eistedd ar bob llwybr, sy'n bygwth ac osgoi o'r ffordd o Allah rhai sydd yn credu ynddo, yn ceisio gwneud ei [ymddangos] gwyrdröedig. A cofio pan oeddech ychydig a chi cynyddodd ef. A gweld sut yr oedd diwedd y corrupters.

trans-unit.source: And if there should be a group among you who has believed in that with which I have been sent and a group that has not believed, then be patient until Allah judges between us. And He is the best of judges."
trans-unit.target: Ac os dylai fod grŵp eich plith a oedd wedi credu bod y wyf wedi'u hanfon a grŵp wedi credu ni, yna fod claf tan beirniaid Allah rhyngom. Ac ef yw'r gorau o feirniaid.

trans-unit.source: Said the eminent ones who were arrogant among his people, "We will surely evict you, O Shu'ayb, and those who have believed with you from our city, or you must return to our religion." He said, "Even if we were unwilling?"
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd y rhai enwog a oedd yn drahaus ymysg ei bobl, "bydd gennym siawns troi allan chi, O Shu'ayb, a'r rhai sydd wedi credu gyda chi gan ein dinas, neu rhaid i chi ddychwelyd at ein crefydd. Meddai, "hyd yn oed pe baem yn anfodlon?"

trans-unit.source: We would have invented against Allah a lie if we returned to your religion after Allah had saved us from it. And it is not for us to return to it except that Allah, our Lord, should will. Our Lord has encompassed all things in knowledge. Upon Allah we have relied. Our Lord, decide between us and our people in truth, and You are the best of those who give decision."
trans-unit.target: Byddai Rydym wedi dyfeisio erbyn Allah celwydd pe baem yn dychwelyd at eich crefydd ar ôl Roedd Allah wedi ein hachub rhag iddo. Ac nid yw inni ddychwelyd iddo heblaw y dylai Allah, ein Arglwydd, bydd. Mae ein Arglwydd yn cwmpasu holl bethau mewn gwybodaeth. Ar Allah yr ydym wedi dibynnu. Benderfynu ein Arglwydd, rhyngom ni a ein pobl mewn gwirionedd, a ydych yn y gorau o'r rheini sy'n rhoi penderfyniad."

trans-unit.source: Said the eminent ones who disbelieved among his people, "If you should follow Shu'ayb, indeed, you would then be losers."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd y rhai enwog a ddysgais ymysg ei bobl, "os dylech ddilyn Shu'ayb, yn wir, chi wedyn byddai rhai ar eu colled.

trans-unit.source: So the earthquake seized them, and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.
trans-unit.target: Felly roedd y daeargryn yn hatafaelu iddynt, a daeth y maent yn eu cartref [cyrff] wedi gostwng yn dueddol o.

trans-unit.source: Those who denied Shu'ayb - it was as though they had never resided there. Those who denied Shu'ayb - it was they who were the losers.
trans-unit.target: Rhai sy'n gwadu Shu'ayb-Roedd fel petai wedi oeddent byth yn byw yno. Rhai sy'n gwadu Shu'ayb-mai hwy oedd y rhai ar eu colled.

trans-unit.source: And he turned away from them and said, "O my people, I had certainly conveyed to you the messages of my Lord and advised you, so how could I grieve for a disbelieving people?"
trans-unit.target: Ac yn troi i ffwrdd oddi wrthynt a dweud, "O fy pobl, oedd yn sicr yn cael eu cyfleu i chi negeseuon o fy Arglwydd ac cynghorir chi, felly sut y gallai yr grieve i bobl disbelieving?"

trans-unit.source: And We sent to no city a prophet [who was denied] except that We seized its people with poverty and hardship that they might humble themselves [to Allah].
trans-unit.target: A anfonwyd at unrhyw ddinas Proffwyd [pwy oedd ei wrthod] heblaw y Rydym yn hatafaelu a'i phobl â tlodi a chaledi y gallai yn ddiymhongar eu hunain [i Allah].

trans-unit.source: Then We exchanged in place of the bad [condition], good, until they increased [and prospered] and said, "Our fathers [also] were touched with hardship and ease." So We seized them suddenly while they did not perceive.
trans-unit.target: Yna rydym yn cyfnewid lle y drwg [Cyflwr], da, hyd nes y byddant yn cynyddu [ac yn ffynnu] a dywedodd, "ein tadau [hefyd] yn cyffwrdd â chaledi a hwylustod." Er mwyn inni manteisio arnynt yn sydyn er nad oeddent yn gweld.

trans-unit.source: And if only the people of the cities had believed and feared Allah, We would have opened upon them blessings from the heaven and the earth; but they denied [the messengers], so We seized them for what they were earning."
trans-unit.target: Ac os mai dim ond pobl y dinasoedd oedd yn credu ac yn ofni Allah, byddai Rydym wedi agor iddynt bendithion o y nefoedd a'r ddaear; ond gwadodd nhw [y negeswyr], fel yr ydym wedi manteisio arnynt am beth maent yn ei ennill.

trans-unit.source: Then, did the people of the cities feel secure from Our punishment coming to them at night while they were asleep?
trans-unit.target: Yna, oedd y bobl o'r dinasoedd deimlo'n ddiogel gan ein cosbi yn dod iddynt yn ystod y nos tra eu bod yn cysgu?

trans-unit.source: Or did the people of the cities feel secure from Our punishment coming to them in the morning while they were at play?
trans-unit.target: Neu a oedd pobl y dinasoedd yn teimlo yn ddiogel rhag ein cosbi yn dod iddynt yn y bore tra oeddent yn chwarae?

trans-unit.source: Then did they feel secure from the plan of Allah? But no one feels secure from the plan of Allah except the losing people.
trans-unit.target: Wedyn oedd iddynt deimlo'n ddiogel o'r cynllun Allah? Ond nid oes unrhyw un yn teimlo diogel o'r cynllun Allah ac eithrio pobl golli.

trans-unit.source: Has it not become clear to those who inherited the earth after its [previous] people that if We willed, We could afflict them for their sins? But We seal over their hearts so they do not hear.
trans-unit.target: Nid yw wedi dod yn amlwg i'r rhai sydd wedi etifeddu y ddaear ar ôl ei bobl [blaenorol] bod os ydym yn ewyllysio iddi, gallai ein effeithio arnynt am eu pechodau? Ond rydym yn sêl dros eu calonnau fel nad ydynt yn clywed.

trans-unit.source: Those cities - We relate to you, [O Muhammad], some of their news. And certainly did their messengers come to them with clear proofs, but they were not to believe in that which they had denied before. Thus does Allah seal over the hearts of the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Y dinasoedd hynny-yr ydym yn ymwneud â chi, [O Muhammad], rhai o'r eu newyddion. Ac yn sicr oedd eu negeswyr yn dod atynt gyda proflenni clir, ond nid oeddent yn credu yn hynny a oedd wedi eu hamddifadu o cyn. Felly yw Allah yn sêl dros calon y disbelievers.

trans-unit.source: And We did not find for most of them any covenant; but indeed, We found most of them defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: Ac ni welsom i'r rhan fwyaf ohonynt unrhyw cyfamod; ond yn wir, gwelsom rhan fwyaf ohonynt defiantly anufudd.

trans-unit.source: Then We sent after them Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his establishment, but they were unjust toward them. So see how was the end of the corrupters.
trans-unit.target: Yna anfonwyd ar ôl iddynt Moses gyda'r arwyddion ein Ffaro a ei sefydlu, ond roeddent yn anghyfiawn tuag atynt. Felly weld sut yr oedd diwedd y corrupters.

trans-unit.source: And Moses said, "O Pharaoh, I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds
trans-unit.target: A dywedodd Moses, 'O Ffaro, I 'm negesydd oddi wrth yr Arglwydd o fyd

trans-unit.source: [Who is] obligated not to say about Allah except the truth. I have come to you with clear evidence from your Lord, so send with me the Children of Israel."
trans-unit.target: [Sydd] rheidrwydd i beidio â dweud am Allah ac eithrio y gwir. Yr wyf wedi dod i chi gyda thystiolaeth glir o eich Arglwydd, anfon felly gyda mi plant Israel.

trans-unit.source: [Pharaoh] said, "If you have come with a sign, then bring it forth, if you should be of the truthful."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd [Ffaro], "Os ydych yn dod ag arwydd, yna ei ddwyn ymlaen, os dylai fod o y geirwir."

trans-unit.source: So Moses threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent, manifest.
trans-unit.target: Felly, taflodd Moses a'i staff, ac yn sydyn yr oedd serpent, amlygu.

trans-unit.source: And he drew out his hand; thereupon it was white [with radiance] for the observers.
trans-unit.target: A thynnodd allan ei law; rhydd oedd Gwyn [gyda radiance] ar gyfer yr arsylwyr.

trans-unit.source: Said the eminent among the people of Pharaoh, "Indeed, this is a learned magician
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd enwog ymhlith pobl Ffaro, "yn wir, dyma ddysgwyd consuriwr

trans-unit.source: Who wants to expel you from your land [through magic], so what do you instruct?"
trans-unit.target: Pwy sydd am i ddiarddel chi o'ch tir [drwy hud], felly beth ydych chi'n gyfarwyddo? "

trans-unit.source: They said, "Postpone [the matter of] him and his brother and send among the cities gatherers
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "ohirio'r [y mater o] ef ei frawd a'i anfon ymhlith casglwyr dinasoedd

trans-unit.source: Who will bring you every learned magician."
trans-unit.target: A bydd dod â chi bob magician ddysgwyd."

trans-unit.source: And the magicians came to Pharaoh. They said, "Indeed for us is a reward if we are the predominant."
trans-unit.target: A daeth y magicians i Ffaro. Dywedodd, "yn wir i ni yn wobr os ydym prif."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Yes, and, [moreover], you will be among those made near [to me]."
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "ie, a, [hefyd], chi fydd ymysg y rhai a wnaed ger [i mi]."

trans-unit.source: They said, "O Moses, either you throw [your staff], or we will be the ones to throw [first]."
trans-unit.target: Maent yn dweud, "O Moses, naill ai ydych yn taflu [eich staff], neu fydd y rhai i daflu [gyntaf]."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Throw," and when they threw, they bewitched the eyes of the people and struck terror into them, and they presented a great [feat of] magic.
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "Taflu," a phan taflodd, maent yn bewitched llygaid pobl ac yn taro terfysg i mewn iddynt, ac a gyflwynwyd ganddynt hud fawr [gamp o].

trans-unit.source: And We inspired to Moses, "Throw your staff," and at once it devoured what they were falsifying.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn ein hysbrydoli i Moses, "Taflu eich staff," ac ar unwaith oedd ei devoured hyn y cafodd ei ffugio.

trans-unit.source: So the truth was established, and abolished was what they were doing.
trans-unit.target: Felly oedd y gwir yn sefydlu, ac yn diddymu oedd beth yr oeddent yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: And Pharaoh and his people were overcome right there and became debased.
trans-unit.target: Ac roedd Ffaro a ei bobl oresgyn iawn yno a daeth danseilio.

trans-unit.source: And the magicians fell down in prostration [to Allah].
trans-unit.target: A syrthiodd y magicians i lawr yn prostration [i Allah].

trans-unit.source: They said, "We have believed in the Lord of the worlds,
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "yr ydym wedi credu yn yr Arglwydd y byd,

trans-unit.source: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."
trans-unit.target: Yr Arglwydd Moses ac Aaron."

trans-unit.source: Said Pharaoh, "You believed in him before I gave you permission. Indeed, this is a conspiracy which you conspired in the city to expel therefrom its people. But you are going to know.
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd Ffaro, "chi Credai ef cyn rhoi eich caniatâd. Yn wir, mae hyn yn gynllwyn a chi oedd yn cynllwynio yn y ddinas i ddiarddel thelir a'i phobl. Ond byddwch yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides; then I will surely crucify you all."
trans-unit.target: Byddaf yn sicr yn torri'r oddi ar eich dwylo a eich traed ar ochrau gwahanol; yna bydd yr siawns crucify chi i gyd."

trans-unit.source: They said, "Indeed, to our Lord we will return.
trans-unit.target: Maent yn dweud, "yn wir, i Arglwydd ein byddwn yn dychwelyd.

trans-unit.source: And you do not resent us except because we believed in the signs of our Lord when they came to us. Our Lord, pour upon us patience and let us die as Muslims [in submission to You]."
trans-unit.target: Ac a dderbynioch inni ac eithrio nid oherwydd ein bod yn credu mewn arwyddion ein Arglwydd pan ddaethant i ni. Mae ein Arglwydd, tywallt arnom amynedd a gadewch inni yn marw fel Moslemiaid [yn cyflwyno i chi].

trans-unit.source: And the eminent among the people of Pharaoh said," Will you leave Moses and his people to cause corruption in the land and abandon you and your gods?" [Pharaoh] said, "We will kill their sons and keep their women alive; and indeed, we are subjugators over them."
trans-unit.target: Ac enwog ymhlith pobl Ffaro a dweud,"byddwch yn gadael Moses a ei bobl i achosi llygredd yn y tir a rhoi'r gorau i chi ac yn eich duwiau?" Dywedodd [Ffaro], "Byddwn yn lladd eu meibion ac yn cadw eu menywod yn fyw; ac yn wir, rydym yn subjugators drostynt."

trans-unit.source: Said Moses to his people, "Seek help through Allah and be patient. Indeed, the earth belongs to Allah. He causes to inherit it whom He wills of His servants. And the [best] outcome is for the righteous."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd Moses at ei bobl, "ofyn am gymorth drwy Allah ac yn amyneddgar. Yn wir, y mae y ddaear yn perthyn i Allah. Mae ef yn achosi i etifeddu ei y mae ef yn wills ei weision. A canlyniad [gorau] ar gyfer y righteous.

trans-unit.source: They said, "We have been harmed before you came to us and after you have come to us." He said, "Perhaps your Lord will destroy your enemy and grant you succession in the land and see how you will do."
trans-unit.target: Maent yn dweud, "rydym wedi'i niweidio cyn ichi ddod i ni, ac ar ôl i chi wedi dod i ni." Meddai, "Efallai eich Arglwydd bydd dinistrio eich gelyn grant chi olyniaeth yn y tir a gweld sut y gwnewch chi."

trans-unit.source: And We certainly seized the people of Pharaoh with years of famine and a deficiency in fruits that perhaps they would be reminded.
trans-unit.target: A ydym yn sicr yn hatafaelu bobl Ffaro gyda blynyddoedd o newyn a diffyg mewn ffrwythau y efallai byddai eu hatgoffa.

trans-unit.source: But when good came to them, they said, "This is ours [by right]." And if a bad [condition] struck them, they saw an evil omen in Moses and those with him. Unquestionably, their fortune is with Allah, but most of them do not know.
trans-unit.target: Ond pan ddaeth da iddynt, maent yn dweud, "Dyma ein [gan hawl]." Ac os oedd drwg [Cyflwr] yn taro hwy, gwelodd argoelir drygioni yn Moses a'r rhai sydd gydag ef. Yn ddiamau, mae eu ffawd â Allah, ond nid rhan fwyaf ohonynt yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: And they said, "No matter what sign you bring us with which to bewitch us, we will not be believers in you."
trans-unit.target: A dywedodd, "waeth pa arwydd ichi ddod â ni i bewitch ein, ni fyddwn yn gredinwyr yn chi."

trans-unit.source: So We sent upon them the flood and locusts and lice and frogs and blood as distinct signs, but they were arrogant and were a criminal people.
trans-unit.target: Felly rydym yn anfon arnynt y llifogydd a locusts a llau a llyffantod a gwaed fel arwyddion pendant, ond roeddent yn drahaus ac yn bobl troseddol.

trans-unit.source: And when the punishment descended upon them, they said, "O Moses, invoke for us your Lord by what He has promised you. If you [can] remove the punishment from us, we will surely believe you, and we will send with you the Children of Israel."
trans-unit.target: A phan oedd y gosb yn disgyn arnynt, dywedodd, "O Moses, galw'r inni eich Arglwydd erbyn hyn wedi addo ichi. Os [Gall] ddileu'r gosb oddi wrthym ni, siawns nad ydym yn eich credu, a byddwn yn anfon gyda chi blant Israel."

trans-unit.source: But when We removed the punishment from them until a term which they were to reach, then at once they broke their word.
trans-unit.target: Ond pan fydd gennym y gosb eu dileu tan y tymor oedd arnynt i gyrraedd, yna ar unwaith iddynt dorri eu gair.

trans-unit.source: So We took retribution from them, and We drowned them in the sea because they denied Our signs and were heedless of them.
trans-unit.target: Felly, cymerasom dial oddi wrthynt, ac rydym yn eu boddi yn y môr oherwydd roeddent yn gwadu ein arwyddion ac yn heedless iddynt.

trans-unit.source: And We caused the people who had been oppressed to inherit the eastern regions of the land and the western ones, which We had blessed. And the good word of your Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel because of what they had patiently endured. And We destroyed [all] that Pharaoh and his people were producing and what they had been building.
trans-unit.target: A achoswyd inni y bobl a oedd wedi'u gormesu etifeddu'r rhanbarth dwyreiniol y tir a'r rhai gorllewinol, a ydym wedi bendithio. Ac yr oedd gair da eich Arglwydd yn cyflawni ar gyfer plant Israel oherwydd hyn y maent wedi ddioddef amyneddgar. A ydym yn dinistrio [bob] y Ffaro a ei bobl oedd cynhyrchu a beth oedd wedi ei adeiladu.

trans-unit.source: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea; then they came upon a people intent in devotion to [some] idols of theirs. They said, "O Moses, make for us a god just as they have gods." He said, "Indeed, you are a people behaving ignorantly.
trans-unit.target: A gwnaethom plant Israel ar draws y môr; yna daethant ar fwriad pobl mewn ymroddiad i [rai] dod ynghyd o nhw. Maent yn dweud, "O Moses, yn gwneud i ni Duw fel y maent wedi duwiau." Meddai, "yn wir, yr ydych yn bobl sy'n ymddwyn yn ignorantly.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those [worshippers] - destroyed is that in which they are [engaged], and worthless is whatever they were doing."
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, hynny [addolwyr]-dinistrio yw lle mae'r [ymgysylltu], ac yn ddiwerth, beth bynnag yr oeddent yn ei wneud. "

trans-unit.source: He said, "Is it other than Allah I should desire for you as a god while He has preferred you over the worlds?"
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "Yw ei heblaw Allah dylai awydd i chi fel Duw tra y mae yn well ganddo chi dros fyd?"

trans-unit.source: And [recall, O Children of Israel], when We saved you from the people of Pharaoh, [who were] afflicting you with the worst torment - killing your sons and keeping your women alive. And in that was a great trial from your Lord.
trans-unit.target: A [gof, plant Israel O], pan rydym yn arbed chi o bobl o Ffaro, [oedd] sydd yn effeithio ar eich gyda'r boen gwaethaf-ladd eich meibion a cadw eich menywod yn fyw. Ac yn hynny o beth roedd treial mawr gan eich Arglwydd.

trans-unit.source: And We made an appointment with Moses for thirty nights and perfected them by [the addition of] ten; so the term of his Lord was completed as forty nights. And Moses said to his brother Aaron, "Take my place among my people, do right [by them], and do not follow the way of the corrupters."
trans-unit.target: Ac yr ydym yn gwneud apwyntiad gyda Moses am noson ar hugain ac yn ei berffeithio iddynt gan [ychwanegu] deg; Felly, cwblhawyd tymor ei Arglwydd fel nosweithiau deugain. A dywedodd Moses i frawd Aaron, "fy yn digwydd ymysg pobl fy, wneud iawn [gan] ac nid yn dilyn y ffordd o y corrupters."

trans-unit.source: And when Moses arrived at Our appointed time and his Lord spoke to him, he said, "My Lord, show me [Yourself] that I may look at You." [Allah] said, "You will not see Me, but look at the mountain; if it should remain in place, then you will see Me." But when his Lord appeared to the mountain, He rendered it level, and Moses fell unconscious. And when he awoke, he said, "Exalted are You! I have repented to You, and I am the first of the believers."
trans-unit.target: A pan Moses cyrhaeddodd ein amser penodedig ac yn ei siarad yr Arglwydd iddo, meddai ef, "Fy Arglwydd, dangos i mi [eich hun] bod efallai yn edrych arnoch chi." [Allah] dywedodd, "Bydd chi fy ngweld, ond edrych ar y Mynydd; Os dylai aros yn ei le, yna byddwch yn gweld Me." Ond pan ymddengys fod ei Arglwydd yn y Mynydd, roedd ef yn ei rendro yn lefel, a gostyngodd Moses yn anymwybodol. A phan oedd ei ddeffro, meddai ef, "i'w mawrygu ydych! Rwyf wedi edifarhau i chi a fi yw'r cyntaf y credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "O Moses, I have chosen you over the people with My messages and My words [to you]. So take what I have given you and be among the grateful."
trans-unit.target: [Allah] yn dweud, "O Moses, wedi dewis chi dros y bobl gyda fy negeseuon a 'm geiriau [i]. Felly gymryd beth yr yn rhoi ichi ac ymhlith y ddiolchgar.

trans-unit.source: And We wrote for him on the tablets [something] of all things - instruction and explanation for all things, [saying], "Take them with determination and order your people to take the best of it. I will show you the home of the defiantly disobedient."
trans-unit.target: A ysgrifennodd ydym iddo ar y tabledi [rhywbeth] am yr holl bethau-cyfarwyddiadau ac esboniad ar gyfer holl bethau, [dweud], "yn eu cymryd gyda phenderfyniad a Gorchymyn eich pobl i gymryd y gorau ohono. Dangosaf ichi yn gartref i defiantly anufudd."

trans-unit.source: I will turn away from My signs those who are arrogant upon the earth without right; and if they should see every sign, they will not believe in it. And if they see the way of consciousness, they will not adopt it as a way; but if they see the way of error, they will adopt it as a way. That is because they have denied Our signs and they were heedless of them.
trans-unit.target: Bydd troi oddi wrth fy arwyddion rheini sy'n drahaus ar wyneb y ddaear heb hawl; ac os dylent weld pob arwydd, nad ydynt yn credu ynddo. Ac os ydynt yn gweld y ffordd yn mynd yn anymwybodol, bydd eu nid yn ei fabwysiadu fel ffordd; ond os ydynt yn gweld y ffordd y gwall, byddant yn ei mabwysiadu fel ffordd. Mae hynny oherwydd mae nhw wedi gwadu ein arwyddion ac roeddent yn heedless ohonynt.

trans-unit.source: Those who denied Our signs and the meeting of the Hereafter - their deeds have become worthless. Are they recompensed except for what they used to do?
trans-unit.target: Rhai sydd yn gwadu ein arwyddion a chyfarfod o hyn ymlaen-mae eu gweithredoedd wedi dod yn ddiwerth. Yn eu had-dalu ac eithrio beth maen nhw'n ei wneud?

trans-unit.source: And the people of Moses made, after [his departure], from their ornaments a calf - an image having a lowing sound. Did they not see that it could neither speak to them nor guide them to a way? They took it [for worship], and they were wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: A pobl Moses gwnaeth, ar ôl [ei ymadawiad], o addurniadau eu llo-delwedd cael sain lowing. Nad oeddent yn gweld y gallai nad yw'n siarad â hwy nac yn eu tywys i ffordd? Cymerodd yr [ar gyfer addoli], ac roeddent yn tramgwyddo.

trans-unit.source: And when regret overcame them and they saw that they had gone astray, they said, "If our Lord does not have mercy upon us and forgive us, we will surely be among the losers."
trans-unit.target: A pan yr gofid yn goresgyn iddynt a gwelodd eu bod wedi mynd ar gyfeiliorn, dywedodd, "Os nad yw'n ein Arglwydd wedi drugaredd arnom a Maddeuwch inni, byddwn yn sicr yn ymhlith y rhai ar eu colled."

trans-unit.source: And when Moses returned to his people, angry and grieved, he said, "How wretched is that by which you have replaced me after [my departure]. Were you impatient over the matter of your Lord?" And he threw down the tablets and seized his brother by [the hair of] his head, pulling him toward him. [Aaron] said, "O son of my mother, indeed the people oppressed me and were about to kill me, so let not the enemies rejoice over me and do not place me among the wrongdoing people."
trans-unit.target: A pan y dychwelodd Moses ei bobl, yn ddig ac alaru, dywedodd, "sut truenus yw bod gan y byddwch wedi disodli mi ar ôl [fy ymadawiad]. A oeddech yn ddiamynedd dros y mater hwn o eich Arglwydd?" Ac ef taflodd i lawr y tabledi ac yn hatafaelu ei frawd gan [wallt] ei ben, ei dynnu'r tuag at iddo. Dywedodd [Aaron], "Mae mab O fy mam, yn wir mi gormesu y bobl a oedd ar fin lladd fi, felly gadewch nid gelynion lawenhau na mi ac nad ydynt yn gosod mi ymysg y bobl gamwedd."

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "My Lord, forgive me and my brother and admit us into Your mercy, for You are the most merciful of the merciful."
trans-unit.target: [Moses] dywedodd, "Mae fy Arglwydd, maddau i mi ac i fy mrawd a inni gyfaddef i eich drugaredd, ar gyfer ydych chi'n fwyaf tosturiol o y tosturiol.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who took the calf [for worship] will obtain anger from their Lord and humiliation in the life of this world, and thus do We recompense the inventors [of falsehood].
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, a gymerodd y lloi [ar gyfer addoli] Bydd gael dicter gan eu Arglwydd a chywilydd ym mywyd y byd hwn, ac felly ei wneud yn ad-dalu dyfeiswyr [anwiredd].

trans-unit.source: But those who committed misdeeds and then repented after them and believed - indeed your Lord, thereafter, is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ond mae rhai sy'n ymrwymedig camweddau a wedyn yn edifarhau ar ôl iddynt ac yn credu-eich Arglwydd yn wir, ar ôl hynny, Forgiving a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: And when the anger subsided in Moses, he took up the tablets; and in their inscription was guidance and mercy for those who are fearful of their Lord.
trans-unit.target: A pan oedd y dicter yn tawelu yn Moses, dechreuodd y tabledi; ac yn eu arysgrifio Roedd canllawiau a drugaredd i'r rhai sydd yn ofni yr Arglwydd eu.

trans-unit.source: And Moses chose from his people seventy men for Our appointment. And when the earthquake seized them, he said, "My Lord, if You had willed, You could have destroyed them before and me [as well]. Would You destroy us for what the foolish among us have done? This is not but Your trial by which You send astray whom You will and guide whom You will. You are our Protector, so forgive us and have mercy upon us; and You are the best of forgivers.
trans-unit.target: A dewisodd Moses o bobl ei saith deg o ddynion ar gyfer ein penodiad. A pan roedd y daeargryn yn hatafaelu iddynt, meddai ef, "fy Arglwydd, os ydych wedi ewyllysio iddi, chi gallai wedi dinistrio iddynt cyn ac mi [hefyd]. Byddech yn chwalu inni ar gyfer beth ffôl ein plith wedi ei wneud? Nid yw hyn ond eich treial a anfonwch ar gyfeiliorn bwy y byddwch yn a'r Canllaw y byddwch. Yr ydych yn ein Protector, felly maddeuwch inni ac wedi drugaredd arnom ni; a ydych yn y gorau o forgivers.

trans-unit.source: And decree for us in this world [that which is] good and [also] in the Hereafter; indeed, we have turned back to You." [Allah] said, "My punishment - I afflict with it whom I will, but My mercy encompasses all things." So I will decree it [especially] for those who fear Me and give zakah and those who believe in Our verses -
trans-unit.target: A ordinhad i ni yn y byd hwn [y mae] da a [hefyd] yn o hyn ymlaen; yn wir, yr ydym wedi troi ôl i chi." Meddai [Allah], "fy cosbi-yr effeithio gyda ei cyfer byddaf, ond mae fy drugaredd yn cwmpasu'r holl bethau." Felly bydd yr ei ddyfarniad [enwedig] ar gyfer y rhai sy'n ofni mi a rhoi zakah a'r rhai sydd yn credu mewn penillion ein-

trans-unit.source: Those who follow the Messenger, the unlettered prophet, whom they find written in what they have of the Torah and the Gospel, who enjoins upon them what is right and forbids them what is wrong and makes lawful for them the good things and prohibits for them the evil and relieves them of their burden and the shackles which were upon them. So they who have believed in him, honored him, supported him and followed the light which was sent down with him - it is those who will be the successful.
trans-unit.target: Rhai sy'n dilyn y negesydd, y Proffwyd unlettered, y maent yn ei chael yn hyn yr oedd ganddynt y Torah a'r efengyl, sy'n enjoins iddynt beth sy'n iawn a gwahardd iddynt beth sydd o'i le a gwneud yn gyfreithlon iddynt y pethau da a gwahardd ar eu cyfer y drygioni a lleddfu'r iddynt eu baich a hualau a oedd arnynt. Felly maent sydd wedi credu iddo, honored ef, cefnogi ef ac yn dilyn y golau a anfonwyd i lawr ag ef-mae rhai a fydd yn llwyddiannus.

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "O mankind, indeed I am the Messenger of Allah to you all, [from Him] to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. There is no deity except Him; He gives life and causes death." So believe in Allah and His Messenger, the unlettered prophet, who believes in Allah and His words, and follow him that you may be guided.
trans-unit.target: Dweud, [O Muhammad], "O dynolryw, yn wir yr wyf yn negesydd Allah i chi gyd, [o ef] i bwy perthyn ddominiwn y nefoedd a'r ddaear. Nid oes unrhyw Dduwdod ac eithrio ef; Mae'n rhoi bywyd ac yn achosi marwolaeth." Felly yn credu mewn Allah a ei negesydd, y Proffwyd unlettered, sy'n credu yn Allah ac yn ei eiriau, a dilyn ef y gall eich harwain.

trans-unit.source: And among the people of Moses is a community which guides by truth and by it establishes justice.
trans-unit.target: Ymhlith y bobl o Moses yn gymuned sy'n llywio'r gan gwir a gan ei sefydlu cyfiawnder.

trans-unit.source: And We divided them into twelve descendant tribes [as distinct] nations. And We inspired to Moses when his people implored him for water, "Strike with your staff the stone," and there gushed forth from it twelve springs. Every people knew its watering place. And We shaded them with clouds and sent down upon them manna and quails, [saying], "Eat from the good things with which We have provided you." And they wronged Us not, but they were [only] wronging themselves.
trans-unit.target: A rhannu'n inni eu Cenhedloedd llwythau descendant [fel gwahanol] deuddeg. Ac yn ein hysbrydoli i Moses pan ei bobl ef erfyniodd ar gyfer dŵr, "Taro gyda'ch staff y garreg," a Mae gushed blaen o'r ffynhonnau deuddeg. Bob pobl yn gwybod ei le dŵr. Ac yr ydym yn eu cysgodi â cymylau ac yn anfon i lawr arnynt Mae'r manna a sofliâr, [dweud], "bwyta o'r pethau da yr ydym wedi darparu chi." Ac roedd eu cam wrthym ni, ond [ond] maent yn wronging eu hunain.

trans-unit.source: And [mention, O Muhammad], when it was said to them, "Dwell in this city and eat from it wherever you will and say, 'Relieve us of our burdens,' and enter the gate bowing humbly; We will [then] forgive you your sins. We will increase the doers of good [in goodness and reward]."
trans-unit.target: A [sôn, O Muhammad], pan ddywedwyd iddynt, "i aros yn y ddinas hon a bwyta ohono lle bynnag y mae bydd a dweud, 'Yn ein rhyddhau rhag ein beichiau', a rhowch y giât consortia yn ostyngedig; Bydd gennym [yna] yn maddau ichi eich pechodau. Byddwn yn cynyddu phoenwn da [yn dyn a gwobrwyo]."

trans-unit.source: But those who wronged among them changed [the words] to a statement other than that which had been said to them. So We sent upon them a punishment from the sky for the wrong that they were doing.
trans-unit.target: Ond rhai a cam yn eu plith newid [y geiriau] i ddatganiad heblaw hynny a ddywedodd iddynt. Felly anfonwyd arnynt cosb gan sky ar gyfer anghywir yr oeddent yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: And ask them about the town that was by the sea - when they transgressed in [the matter of] the sabbath - when their fish came to them openly on their sabbath day, and the day they had no sabbath they did not come to them. Thus did We give them trial because they were defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: A gofyn iddynt am y dref oedd y môr-pan roedd eu camweddu yn [y mater o] y Saboth-pan ddaeth eu pysgod iddynt agored ar eu dydd Saboth, a dydd a oedd ganddynt unrhyw Saboth ni ddaethant iddynt. Felly oedd roi eu treial oherwydd eu bod yn defiantly anufudd.

trans-unit.source: And when a community among them said, "Why do you advise [or warn] a people whom Allah is [about] to destroy or to punish with a severe punishment?" they [the advisors] said, "To be absolved before your Lord and perhaps they may fear Him."
trans-unit.target: A phan cymunedol ymhlith eu dweud, "pam ydych chi'n cynghori [neu yn rhybuddio] bobl bwy yw Allah [am] i ddinistrio neu gosbi â chosbi difrifol?" meddai nhw [y cynghorwyr], "i gael ei ryddhau cyn y gall eich Arglwydd ac efallai eu bod yn ofni iddo."

trans-unit.source: And when they forgot that by which they had been reminded, We saved those who had forbidden evil and seized those who wronged, with a wretched punishment, because they were defiantly disobeying.
trans-unit.target: A pan anghofiodd y gan y maent wedi cael ein hatgoffa, arbed gennym rhai sydd wedi gwahardd drygioni a rhai sydd yn cam, â cosb truenus, yn hatafaelu oherwydd roedd iddynt dorri'r defiantly.

trans-unit.source: So when they were insolent about that which they had been forbidden, We said to them, "Be apes, despised."
trans-unit.target: Felly pan oeddent digywilydd am hynny a oedd wedi eu bod wedi'u gwahardd, dywedasom wrthynt, "Yn epaod, gasáu."

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when your Lord declared that He would surely [continue to] send upon them until the Day of Resurrection those who would afflict them with the worst torment. Indeed, your Lord is swift in penalty; but indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: A [sôn am] pan oedd eich Arglwydd yn datgan y byddai siawns [parhau i] anfon arnynt tan dydd atgyfodi rhai a byddai effeithio arnynt gyda'r boen gwaethaf. Yn wir, eich Arglwydd yn gyflym yn gosb; ond yn wir, ei fod yn Forgiving a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: And We divided them throughout the earth into nations. Of them some were righteous, and of them some were otherwise. And We tested them with good [times] and bad that perhaps they would return [to obedience].
trans-unit.target: A ydym eu rhannu ledled y ddaear yn Cenhedloedd. Ohonynt oedd rhai cyfiawn, ac iddynt oedd rhai fel arall. A ydym yn eu profi gyda da [gwaith] a drwg y efallai y byddai dychwelyd [i ufudddod].

trans-unit.source: And there followed them successors who inherited the Scripture [while] taking the commodities of this lower life and saying, "It will be forgiven for us." And if an offer like it comes to them, they will [again] take it. Was not the covenant of the Scripture taken from them that they would not say about Allah except the truth, and they studied what was in it? And the home of the Hereafter is better for those who fear Allah, so will you not use reason?
trans-unit.target: Ac wedyn eu holynwyr sy'n etifeddu yr ysgrythur tra'n cymryd y nwyddau hyn bywyd is a dweud, "bydd yn maddau i ni." Ac os daw cynnig tebyg iddynt, byddant yn [eto]. Nid oedd y cyfamod o ysgrythur a gymerwyd oddi wrthynt y byddent yn dweud nid am Allah ac eithrio y gwir, ac astudiodd beth oedd ynddi? Ac yn gartref i y o hyn ymlaen yn well ar gyfer y rhai sy'n ofni Allah, felly byddwch nid yn defnyddio'r rheswm?

trans-unit.source: But those who hold fast to the Book and establish prayer - indeed, We will not allow to be lost the reward of the reformers.
trans-unit.target: Ond rhai sy'n dal yn gyflym at y llyfr a sefydlu gweddi-yn wir, ni fyddwn yn caniatáu i wobrwyo y Diwygwyr yn cael eu colli.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when We raised the mountain above them as if it was a dark cloud and they were certain that it would fall upon them, [and Allah said], "Take what We have given you with determination and remember what is in it that you might fear Allah."
trans-unit.target: [Yn sôn am] pan godasom y mynydd uwchlaw iddynt fel os oedd cwmwl tywyll ac roeddent yn sicr y byddai'n gyfrifoldeb arnynt, [a dywedodd Allah], "gymryd beth rydym wedi ei rhoi ichi gyda phenderfyniad ac yn cofio beth mae'n ei bod efallai eich bod yn ofni Allah."

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when your Lord took from the children of Adam - from their loins - their descendants and made them testify of themselves, [saying to them], "Am I not your Lord?" They said, "Yes, we have testified." [This] - lest you should say on the day of Resurrection, "Indeed, we were of this unaware."
trans-unit.target: [Yn sôn am] pan eich Arglwydd gymerodd gan blant Adam-o loins eu-eu disgynyddion a gwneud iddynt dystio eu hunain, [dweud iddynt], "Nid wyf yn eich Arglwydd?" Maent yn dweud, "Ie, yr ydym yn tystio." [Hyn]-rhag ofn y dylech ddweud ar ddiwrnod yr atgyfodiad, "Yn wir, roeddem yn hyn anymwybodol."

trans-unit.source: Or [lest] you say, "It was only that our fathers associated [others in worship] with Allah before, and we were but descendants after them. Then would You destroy us for what the falsifiers have done?"
trans-unit.target: Neu [rhag ofn] ydych yn dweud, "oedd ein tadau sy'n gysylltiedig [eraill yn addoli] gyda Allah cyn hynny, ac yr oeddem ond disgynyddion ar ôl iddynt. Byddai chi ddinistrio wedyn inni am yr hyn y mae y falsifiers yn ei wneud?"

trans-unit.source: And thus do We [explain in] detail the verses, and perhaps they will return.
trans-unit.target: Ac felly wneud [egluro mewn] yn rhoi manylion y penillion, ac efallai byddant yn dychwelyd.

trans-unit.source: And recite to them, [O Muhammad], the news of him to whom we gave [knowledge of] Our signs, but he detached himself from them; so Satan pursued him, and he became of the deviators.
trans-unit.target: Ac adrodd iddynt, [O Muhammad], y newyddion o ef i bwy a rhoesom [gwybodaeth o] Roedd ein arwyddion, ond mae'n datgysylltu ei hun oddi wrthynt; Felly roedd Satan yn dilyn ef, ac aeth yn o y deviators.

trans-unit.source: And if We had willed, we could have elevated him thereby, but he adhered [instead] to the earth and followed his own desire. So his example is like that of the dog: if you chase him, he pants, or if you leave him, he [still] pants. That is the example of the people who denied Our signs. So relate the stories that perhaps they will give thought.
trans-unit.target: Ac os ydym wedi ewyllysio iddi, gallai Rydym wedi dyrchafu'n ef felly, ond mae'n cadw [yn hytrach] at y ddaear ac yn dilyn ei hun awydd. Felly mae ei esiampl fel y ci: Os heliwch chi iddo, mae ei bants, neu os byddwch yn gadael iddo, mae ef [o hyd] pants. Mae hynny'n enghraifft o'r bobl sy'n gwrthod ein arwyddion. Felly ymwneud y straeon y efallai byddant yn rhoi meddwl.

trans-unit.source: How evil an example [is that of] the people who denied Our signs and used to wrong themselves.
trans-unit.target: Pa mor anfad enghraifft [yw] y bobl sy'n gwrthod ein arwyddion a ddefnyddir i anghywir eu hunain.

trans-unit.source: Whoever Allah guides - he is the [rightly] guided; and whoever He sends astray - it is those who are the losers.
trans-unit.target: Pwy bynnag a hysbysiadau Allah-mae'n dan arweiniad [iawn]; a pwy bynnag anfon ar gyfeiliorn-Mae rhai sydd ar eu colled.

trans-unit.source: And We have certainly created for Hell many of the jinn and mankind. They have hearts with which they do not understand, they have eyes with which they do not see, and they have ears with which they do not hear. Those are like livestock; rather, they are more astray. It is they who are the heedless.
trans-unit.target: Ac yr ydym yn sicr wedi creu am uffern llawer o jinn a dynolryw. Mae ganddynt nad ydynt yn deall y calonnau, mae ganddynt lygaid y nad ydynt yn gweld, ac mae ganddynt glustiau na maent yn clywed y. Mae'r rheini'n fel da byw; yn hytrach, maent yn fwy ar gyfeiliorn. Mae'n nhw sydd yn y heedless.

trans-unit.source: And to Allah belong the best names, so invoke Him by them. And leave [the company of] those who practice deviation concerning His names. They will be recompensed for what they have been doing.
trans-unit.target: A Allah yn perthyn iddynt enwau gorau, felly iddo alw arnynt. A gadael [y cwmni o] rhai sy'n arfer gwyriad ynghylch ei enwau. Bydd iawndal iddynt am beth y maent wedi ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: And among those We created is a community which guides by truth and thereby establishes justice.
trans-unit.target: Ac ymysg y rhai rydym wedi creu cymuned sy'n tywys gan gwir a thrwy hynny sefydlu cyfiawnder.

trans-unit.source: But those who deny Our signs - We will progressively lead them [to destruction] from where they do not know.
trans-unit.target: Ond y rhai sydd yn gwadu ein arwyddion-yn raddol arwain iddynt [at ddinistrio] o'r lle nad ydynt yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: And I will give them time. Indeed, my plan is firm.
trans-unit.target: A bydd yn rhoi amser iddynt. Yn wir, mae fy cynllun yn gadarn.

trans-unit.source: Then do they not give thought? There is in their companion [Muhammad] no madness. He is not but a clear warner.
trans-unit.target: Yna nid ydynt yn rhoi ystyriaeth? Nid oes yn eu cydymaith [Muhammad] oes gwallgofrwydd. Nid yw ond warner clir.

trans-unit.source: Do they not look into the realm of the heavens and the earth and everything that Allah has created and [think] that perhaps their appointed time has come near? So in what statement hereafter will they believe?
trans-unit.target: Ydyn nhw'n nid yn edrych ar yr amgylchfyd y nefoedd a y ddaear a phopeth a greodd Allah ac yn [barn] fod eu amser penodedig efallai wedi dod ger? Felly yn hyn datganiad o hyn ymlaen byddant yn credu?

trans-unit.source: Whoever Allah sends astray - there is no guide for him. And He leaves them in their transgression, wandering blindly.
trans-unit.target: Pwy bynnag Allah anfon ar gyfeiliorn-nid oes unrhyw arweiniad iddo. Ac mae yn eu gadael yn eu tramgwyddiad, crwydro ddall.

trans-unit.source: They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the Hour: when is its arrival? Say, "Its knowledge is only with my Lord. None will reveal its time except Him. It lays heavily upon the heavens and the earth. It will not come upon you except unexpectedly." They ask you as if you are familiar with it. Say, "Its knowledge is only with Allah, but most of the people do not know."
trans-unit.target: Maent yn gofyn ichi, [O Muhammad], am yr awr: pan yw ei fod wedi cyrraedd? Dweud, "ei wybodaeth yn unig gyda fy Arglwydd. Bydd dim yn datgelu ei amser ac eithrio ef. Mae'n gosod drwm ar y nefoedd a'r ddaear. Ni fydd arnoch ac eithrio annisgwyl." Maent yn gofyn ichi fel os ydych yn gyfarwydd ag ef. Dweud, "ei gwybodaeth yn unig gyda Allah, ond nid rhan fwyaf o bobl yn gwybod."

trans-unit.source: Say, "I hold not for myself [the power of] benefit or harm, except what Allah has willed. And if I knew the unseen, I could have acquired much wealth, and no harm would have touched me. I am not except a warner and a bringer of good tidings to a people who believe."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "cynhaliaf nid drosof fy hun [pŵer] ELWa neu niwed, ac eithrio beth Allah wedi ewyllysio iddi. Ac os gwyddwn y unseen, gallai wedi meithrin llawer o gyfoeth, a byddai unrhyw niwed wedi cyffwrdd â mi. Nid wyf ac eithrio warner a bringer o tidings da i bobl sydd yn credu."

trans-unit.source: It is He who created you from one soul and created from it its mate that he might dwell in security with her. And when he covers her, she carries a light burden and continues therein. And when it becomes heavy, they both invoke Allah, their Lord, "If You should give us a good [child], we will surely be among the grateful."
trans-unit.target: Mae'n ef a creu eich enaid un a creu ohoni ei ffrind y gallai ef bendroni mewn diogelwch gyda hi. A pan mae'n ymdrin â hi, yn cario baich ysgafn ac yn parhau yn weithredol. A pan ddaw'n trwm, mae'r ddau yn galw'r Allah, eu yr Arglwydd, "os dylech roi da [plant], oni byddwn ymysg y ddiolchgar."

trans-unit.source: But when He gives them a good [child], they ascribe partners to Him concerning that which He has given them. Exalted is Allah above what they associate with Him.
trans-unit.target: Ond pan mae'n rhoi iddynt da [plant], fe briodolant partneriaid iddo ynghylch hynny a roddodd iddynt. I'w mawrygu yw Allah uchod beth yr oeddent yn cysylltu ag ef.

trans-unit.source: Do they associate with Him those who create nothing and they are [themselves] created?
trans-unit.target: Nid cysylltu gydag ef rhai sy'n creu dim ac maent [eu hunain] yn creu?

trans-unit.source: And the false deities are unable to [give] them help, nor can they help themselves.
trans-unit.target: Ac y duwdod ffug yn methu â [Rhowch] iddynt eich helpu, nac yn gallu helpu eu hunain.

trans-unit.source: And if you [believers] invite them to guidance, they will not follow you. It is all the same for you whether you invite them or you are silent.
trans-unit.target: Ac os chi [credinwyr] iddynt wahodd y canllawiau, ni fyddant yn dilyn chi. Mae'n gyd yr un fath i chi p'un a eu gwahodd neu os ydych yn dawel.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those you [polytheists] call upon besides Allah are servants like you. So call upon them and let them respond to you, if you should be truthful.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, y rhai ydych [polytheists] yn galw ar wahân i Allah yn weision fel chi. Felly yn galw ar iddynt a gadael iddynt ymateb i chi, os y dylech fod yn onest.

trans-unit.source: Do they have feet by which they walk? Or do they have hands by which they strike? Or do they have eyes by which they see? Or do they have ears by which they hear? Say, [O Muhammad], "Call your 'partners' and then conspire against me and give me no respite.
trans-unit.target: A oes ganddynt draed gan gerdded? Neu a ydynt yn cael eu yn taro y dwylo? Neu a oes ganddynt lygaid y maent yn gweld? Neu a oes ganddynt glustiau a glywant? Dweud, mae [O Muhammad], "ffoniwch eich 'partneriaid' a wedyn cynllwynio yn fy erbyn a rhowch mi dim gofal seibiant.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, my protector is Allah, who has sent down the Book; and He is an ally to the righteous.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, fy protector yn Allah, sydd wedi anfon i lawr y llyfr; ac ef yw cynghreiriad i y righteous.

trans-unit.source: And those you call upon besides Him are unable to help you, nor can they help themselves."
trans-unit.target: A y rhai ydych yn galw ar wahân iddo yn gallu eich helpu, nac y gallan nhw helpu eu hunain."

trans-unit.source: And if you invite them to guidance, they do not hear; and you see them looking at you while they do not see.
trans-unit.target: Ac os eu gwahodd i'r canllawiau, nad ydynt yn clywed; a ydych yn eu gweld yn edrych ar eich er nad ydynt yn gweld.

trans-unit.source: Take what is given freely, enjoin what is good, and turn away from the ignorant.
trans-unit.target: Gymryd beth a roddir yn rhydd, enjoin beth sy'n dda, ac yn troi i ffwrdd oddi wrth yr anwybodus.

trans-unit.source: And if an evil suggestion comes to you from Satan, then seek refuge in Allah. Indeed, He is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Ac os daw'r awgrym drwg i chi gan Satan, wedyn yn ceisio lloches yn Allah. Yn wir, mae gwrandawiad ac mae gwybod.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who fear Allah - when an impulse touches them from Satan, they remember [Him] and at once they have insight.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, rhai sy'n ofni Allah-pan byrfyfyr yn cyffwrdd â hwy gan Satan, maent yn cofio [ef] ac ar unwaith fod ganddynt ddealltwriaeth.

trans-unit.source: But their brothers - the devils increase them in error; then they do not stop short.
trans-unit.target: Ond eu brodyr-y devils eu cynyddu mewn camgymeriad; yna nid yw eu stopio byr.

trans-unit.source: And when you, [O Muhammad], do not bring them a sign, they say, "Why have you not contrived it?" Say, "I only follow what is revealed to me from my Lord. This [Qur'an] is enlightenment from your Lord and guidance and mercy for a people who believe."
trans-unit.target: A pan ydych, [O Muhammad], nid yn cyflwyno iddynt arwydd, maent yn dweud, "pam wedi chi nid yn ffuantus iddo?" Dweud, "dim ond rwy'n dilyn beth yw datgelu i mi gan fy Arglwydd. Hwn [Qur'an] yn eglurhad gan yr Arglwydd, eich arweiniad a drugaredd ar gyfer pobl sydd yn credu.

trans-unit.source: So when the Qur'an is recited, then listen to it and pay attention that you may receive mercy.
trans-unit.target: Felly pan y Qur'an roi, yna gwrando arno a sylw y gallech dderbyn drugaredd.

trans-unit.source: And remember your Lord within yourself in humility and in fear without being apparent in speech - in the mornings and the evenings. And do not be among the heedless.
trans-unit.target: A chofiwch eich Arglwydd o fewn eich hun mewn gwyleidd-dra ac mewn ofn, heb fod yn amlwg yn araith-yn y bore a gyda'r nos. A Peidiwch â bod ymhlith y heedless.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who are near your Lord are not prevented by arrogance from His worship, and they exalt Him, and to Him they prostrate.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, rhai sy'n agos at eich Arglwydd yn atal haerllugrwydd ar ei addoli, ac mae eu exalt iddo, ac mae eu prostrate iddo.

trans-unit.source: They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the bounties [of war]. Say, "The [decision concerning] bounties is for Allah and the Messenger." So fear Allah and amend that which is between you and obey Allah and His Messenger, if you should be believers.
trans-unit.target: Maent yn gofyn ichi, [O Muhammad], am y bounties [o rhyfel]. Dweud, "[ynghylch penderfyniad] bounties yw Allah a y negesydd." Felly ofni Allah a diwygio sydd rhyngoch chi ac ufuddhau Allah a ei negesydd, os dylai fod credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: The believers are only those who, when Allah is mentioned, their hearts become fearful, and when His verses are recited to them, it increases them in faith; and upon their Lord they rely -
trans-unit.target: Y credinwyr yn unig y rheini sydd, pan sonnir am Allah, eu calonnau yn ofnus, ac wrth ei penillion yn ei roi iddynt, mae'n cynyddu iddynt yn y ffydd; ac maent yn dibynnu ar eu Arglwydd-

trans-unit.source: The ones who establish prayer, and from what We have provided them, they spend.
trans-unit.target: Y rhai sy'n sefydlu gweddi, ac o'r hyn yr ydym wedi darparu iddynt, maent yn treulio.

trans-unit.source: Those are the believers, truly. For them are degrees [of high position] with their Lord and forgiveness and noble provision.
trans-unit.target: Mae'r rheini yn y credinwyr, yn wirioneddol. Ar eu cyfer yn raddau [o sefyllfa uchel] gyda eu Arglwydd a maddeuant a darpariaeth aruchel.

trans-unit.source: [It is] just as when your Lord brought you out of your home [for the battle of Badr] in truth, while indeed, a party among the believers were unwilling,
trans-unit.target: [Mae'n] yn union fel pan ddaeth eich Arglwydd chi o'ch cartref [ar gyfer y frwydr o Badr] mewn gwirionedd, tra yn wir, blaid ymysg y credinwyr yn amharod,

trans-unit.source: Arguing with you concerning the truth after it had become clear, as if they were being driven toward death while they were looking on.
trans-unit.target: Dadlau gyda chi ynghylch y gwir ar ôl wedi dod yn glir, fel pe yn cael ei yrru tuag at farwolaeth tra roeddent yn edrych.

trans-unit.source: [Remember, O believers], when Allah promised you one of the two groups - that it would be yours - and you wished that the unarmed one would be yours. But Allah intended to establish the truth by His words and to eliminate the disbelievers
trans-unit.target: [Cofiwch, O gredinwyr], pan Allah addawodd eich Mae un o'r ddau grwpiau-y byddai'n gywir-ac ydych yn dymuno y byddai yr un unarmed yn gywir. Ond roedd Allah y bwriad i sefydlu y gwir gan ei eiriau, ac i ddileu y disbelievers

trans-unit.source: That He should establish the truth and abolish falsehood, even if the criminals disliked it.
trans-unit.target: Y dylid sefydlu y gwir a diddymu'r anwiredd, hyd yn oed os oedd y troseddwyr yn ei gasau.

trans-unit.source: [Remember] when you asked help of your Lord, and He answered you, "Indeed, I will reinforce you with a thousand from the angels, following one another."
trans-unit.target: [Cofiwch] pan Gofynasoch helpu eich Arglwydd, ac atebodd, "yn wir, bydd ategaf eich gyda mil o angylion, un arall yn dilyn."

trans-unit.source: And Allah made it not but good tidings and so that your hearts would be assured thereby. And victory is not but from Allah. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: A gwnaeth Allah yn tidings nid ond da ac fel y byddai eich calonnau fod yn sicr felly. Ac nid yw buddugoliaeth ond gan Allah. Yn wir, yw Allah i'w mawrygu yn allai a Wise.

trans-unit.source: [Remember] when He overwhelmed you with drowsiness [giving] security from Him and sent down upon you from the sky, rain by which to purify you and remove from you the evil [suggestions] of Satan and to make steadfast your hearts and plant firmly thereby your feet.
trans-unit.target: [Cofiwch] pan ydych yn llethu gyda diogelwch syrthni [rhoi] oddi wrtho a anfonwyd i lawr i chi gan y sky, glaw sy'n puro'r chi a chael gwared o ddrygioni [awgrymiadau] Satan ac i wneud eich calonnau yn gadarn a planhigion gadarn gan eich traed.

trans-unit.source: [Remember] when your Lord inspired to the angels, "I am with you, so strengthen those who have believed. I will cast terror into the hearts of those who disbelieved, so strike [them] upon the necks and strike from them every fingertip."
trans-unit.target: [Cofiwch] pan oedd eich Arglwydd yn cael eu hysbrydoli i angylion, 'yr wyf gyda chi, felly chryfhau'r rheini sydd wedi credu. I Bydd bwrw terfysg calonnau o'r rhai a ddysgais, felly [eu] streic ar gyddfau a streic oddi wrthynt bob blaen bys."

trans-unit.source: That is because they opposed Allah and His Messenger. And whoever opposes Allah and His Messenger - indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
trans-unit.target: Mae hynny oherwydd yr oeddent yn gwrthwynebu Allah a ei negesydd. A pwy bynnag yn gwrthwynebu'r Allah a ei negesydd-yn wir, Allah yn ddifrifol yn gosb.

trans-unit.source: "That [is yours], so taste it." And indeed for the disbelievers is the punishment of the Fire.
trans-unit.target: "Y [yn gywir], felly ei flasu." Ac yn wir ar gyfer y disbelievers yw'r gosb y tân.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when you meet those who disbelieve advancing [for battle], do not turn to them your backs [in flight].
trans-unit.target: O wneud eich sydd wedi credu, pan fyddwch yn cyfarfod rhai a chredu hyrwyddo [ar gyfer brwydr], nid troi iddynt eich cefnau [yn hedfan].

trans-unit.source: And whoever turns his back to them on such a day, unless swerving [as a strategy] for war or joining [another] company, has certainly returned with anger [upon him] from Allah, and his refuge is Hell - and wretched is the destination.
trans-unit.target: Pwy bynnag yn troi ei gefn iddynt ar ddiwrnod o'r fath, oni swerving [fel strategaeth] ar gyfer rhyfel neu ymuno â chwmni [arall], mae yn sicr a ddychwelwyd â dicter [arno] gan Allah, a ei lloches yn uffern-a truenus yn y gyrchfan.

trans-unit.source: And you did not kill them, but it was Allah who killed them. And you threw not, [O Muhammad], when you threw, but it was Allah who threw that He might test the believers with a good test. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oedd eich lladd, ond oedd yn Allah sy'n lladd eu. A ydych taflodd ni, [O Muhammad], pan taflodd chi, ond yr oedd Allah sy'n taflodd y gallai ei fod yn profi y credinwyr gyda phrawf da. Yn wir, Allah yw gwrandawiad a gwybod.

trans-unit.source: That [is so], and [also] that Allah will weaken the plot of the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Y [yn hynny], a [hefyd] Bydd bod Allah yn gwanhau'r plot y disbelievers.

trans-unit.source: If you [disbelievers] seek the victory - the defeat has come to you. And if you desist [from hostilities], it is best for you; but if you return [to war], We will return, and never will you be availed by your [large] company at all, even if it should increase; and [that is] because Allah is with the believers.
trans-unit.target: Pe baech [disbelievers] yn ceisio y fuddugoliaeth-wedi drechu yn dod atoch. Ac os mae eich ymatal [rhag gelyniaeth], mae'n well i chi; ond os byddwch yn dychwelyd [i ryfel], byddwn yn dychwelyd, a byth bydd chi fod wedi manteisio ar eich cwmni [mawr] o gwbl, hyd yn oed os dylai gynyddu; [yn] oherwydd bod Allah yn gyda y credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, obey Allah and His Messenger and do not turn from him while you hear [his order].
trans-unit.target: O Mae chi sydd wedi credu, ufuddhau Allah a Messenger ei a heb droi oddi wrtho tra ydych yn clywed [ei Gorchymyn].

trans-unit.source: And do not be like those who say, "We have heard," while they do not hear.
trans-unit.target: A Peidiwch â bod fel y rhai sy'n dweud, "yr ydym wedi clywed," er nad ydynt yn clywed.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the worst of living creatures in the sight of Allah are the deaf and dumb who do not use reason.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, y gwaethaf o greaduriaid byw yng ngolwg Allah yn y byddar ac addysg nad ydynt yn defnyddio rheswm.

trans-unit.source: Had Allah known any good in them, He would have made them hear. And if He had made them hear, they would [still] have turned away, while they were refusing.
trans-unit.target: Roedd Allah yn hysbys unrhyw da ynddynt, byddai ef wedi eu clywed. Ac os oedd wedi eu gwneud yn clywed, fydden nhw [o hyd] wedi troi i ffwrdd, tra roedd eu gwrthod.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, respond to Allah and to the Messenger when he calls you to that which gives you life. And know that Allah intervenes between a man and his heart and that to Him you will be gathered.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, ymateb i Allah a y negesydd pan fydd ef yn galw chi i'r hyn a rhoi eich bywyd. A gwybod bod Allah yn ymyrryd rhwng dyn a ei galon a bod iddo bydd eich casglu.

trans-unit.source: And fear a trial which will not strike those who have wronged among you exclusively, and know that Allah is severe in penalty.
trans-unit.target: Ac ofn treial sy'n ni bydd yn taro'r rhai sydd wedi cam ymhlith eich unig, ac yn gwybod bod Allah yn difrifol yn gosb.

trans-unit.source: And remember when you were few and oppressed in the land, fearing that people might abduct you, but He sheltered you, supported you with His victory, and provided you with good things - that you might be grateful.
trans-unit.target: A chofiwch, pan oeddech yn ychydig o dan orthrwm ac yn y tir, gan ofni y gallai pobl cymdeithsaol chi, ond mae ef gwarchod chi, eich cefnogi gyda ei fuddugoliaeth, a darparu chi gyda pethau da-y gallech fod yn ddiolchgar.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not betray Allah and the Messenger or betray your trusts while you know [the consequence].
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, peidiwch bradychu Allah ac y negesydd na bradychu eich ymddiriedolaethau er y gwyddoch [y canlyniad].

trans-unit.source: And know that your properties and your children are but a trial and that Allah has with Him a great reward.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn gwybod bod eich eiddo a eich plant ond treial a bod gan Allah gydag ef gwobr mawr.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, if you fear Allah, He will grant you a criterion and will remove from you your misdeeds and forgive you. And Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, os ydych yn poeni bod Allah, grant addysg uwch bydd ydych maen prawf a bydd yn tynnu oddi ar eich eich camweddau ac yn maddau ichi. Ac y possessor o bounty mawr yn Allah.

trans-unit.source: And [remember, O Muhammad], when those who disbelieved plotted against you to restrain you or kill you or evict you [from Makkah]. But they plan, and Allah plans. And Allah is the best of planners.
trans-unit.target: A [cofio, O Muhammad], pan oedd rhai a ddysgais yn cynllwynio yn eich atal chi neu yn eich lladd neu eich troi allan [blentyndod] erbyn. Ond maent yn cynllunio, a chynlluniau Allah. A Allah yw'r gorau o gynllunwyr.

trans-unit.source: And when Our verses are recited to them, they say, "We have heard. If we willed, we could say [something] like this. This is not but legends of the former peoples."
trans-unit.target: Ac wrth ein penillion yn ei roi iddynt, maent yn dweud, "Rydym wedi clywed. Os ydym yn ewyllysio iddi, gallem ddweud [rhywbeth] fel hyn. Nid yw hyn ond chwedlau o bobloedd gynt."

trans-unit.source: And [remember] when they said, "O Allah, if this should be the truth from You, then rain down upon us stones from the sky or bring us a painful punishment."
trans-unit.target: A [cofio] pan maent yn dweud, "O Allah, os dylai hyn fod y gwir gennych, yna bwrw glaw i lawr ar ein gwarthaf cerrig o'r awyr neu ddwyn ein cosbi poenus."

trans-unit.source: But Allah would not punish them while you, [O Muhammad], are among them, and Allah would not punish them while they seek forgiveness.
trans-unit.target: Ond byddai Allah cosbi nid tra ydych, [O Muhammad], yn eu plith, a byddai Allah cosbi nid tra bydd yn ceisio maddeuant.

trans-unit.source: But why should Allah not punish them while they obstruct [people] from al-Masjid al- Haram and they were not [fit to be] its guardians? Its [true] guardians are not but the righteous, but most of them do not know.
trans-unit.target: Ond pam dylai Allah nid cosbi tra maent yn rhwystro [pobl] gan al-Masjid al-Haram, a nid oedd [yn addas i fod yn] ei warcheidwaid? Nid yw ei warcheidwaid [gwir] ond y righteous, ond nid rhan fwyaf ohonynt yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: And their prayer at the House was not except whistling and handclapping. So taste the punishment for what you disbelieved.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oedd eu gweddi yn y tŷ ac eithrio chwibanu a handclapping. Felly blas y gosb ar gyfer hyn a ddysgais chi.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who disbelieve spend their wealth to avert [people] from the way of Allah. So they will spend it; then it will be for them a [source of] regret; then they will be overcome. And those who have disbelieved - unto Hell they will be gathered.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, mae rhai a chredu yn treulio eu cyfoeth i osgoi [pobl] o'r ffordd o Allah. Felly bydd ei wario; yna bydd yn iddynt ofid [ffynhonnell]; yna y bydd eu goresgyn. A'r rhai sydd wedi ddysgais--unto uffern y maent yn ei chasglu.

trans-unit.source: [This is] so that Allah may distinguish the wicked from the good and place the wicked some of them upon others and heap them all together and put them into Hell. It is those who are the losers.
trans-unit.target: [Mae hwn] fel y gall Allah yn gwahaniaethu y drwg y da a lle mae y drwg rhai ohonynt ar eraill a rannu eu gilydd a'u rhoi ar uffern. Mae'n rhai sydd ar eu colled.

trans-unit.source: Say to those who have disbelieved [that] if they cease, what has previously occurred will be forgiven for them. But if they return [to hostility] - then the precedent of the former [rebellious] peoples has already taken place.
trans-unit.target: Dweud i'r rheini sydd wedi ddysgais [bod] os ydynt yn peidio, beth wedi digwydd o'r blaen bydd maddau iddynt. Ond os byddant yn dychwelyd [i elyniaeth]-yna y cynsail o bobloedd [gwrthryfelgar] gyn eisoes wedi digwydd.

trans-unit.source: And fight them until there is no fitnah and [until] the religion, all of it, is for Allah. And if they cease - then indeed, Allah is Seeing of what they do.
trans-unit.target: Ac iddynt ymladd nes nid oes dim fitnah a [nes] crefydd, y cyfan ohono, yw Allah. Ac os ydynt yn peidio-yn wir, yna mae'n Allah yn gweld yr hyn y maent yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: But if they turn away - then know that Allah is your protector. Excellent is the protector, and Excellent is the helper.
trans-unit.target: Ond os y maent yn troi i ffwrdd-yna gwybod bod Allah yn eich protector. Ardderchog yn y protector, ac ardderchog yn yr helpwr.

trans-unit.source: And know that anything you obtain of war booty - then indeed, for Allah is one fifth of it and for the Messenger and for [his] near relatives and the orphans, the needy, and the [stranded] traveler, if you have believed in Allah and in that which We sent down to Our Servant on the day of criterion - the day when the two armies met. And Allah, over all things, is competent.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn gwybod bod unrhyw beth eich bod yn cael rhyfel booty-yna yn wir, i Allah yn un rhan o bump ohono y negesydd ac ar gyfer [ei] ger perthnasau ac yr amddifad, yr anghenus, ac o'r fath [sownd], os yr ydych yn credu yn Allah a bod ein hanfon i lawr at was ein ar ddiwrnod y maen prawf-y diwrnod pan y cyfarfu y byddinoedd dau. Ac Allah, dros holl bethau, yn gymwys.

trans-unit.source: [Remember] when you were on the near side of the valley, and they were on the farther side, and the caravan was lower [in position] than you. If you had made an appointment [to meet], you would have missed the appointment. But [it was] so that Allah might accomplish a matter already destined - that those who perished [through disbelief] would perish upon evidence and those who lived [in faith] would live upon evidence; and indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: [Cofiwch] pan oeddech ar ochr agos y Cwm, a oeddent ar yr ochr hirach, ac y garafán yn is [yn] na chi. Os rydych chi wedi'i wneud apwyntiad [i ddiwallu], byddai wedi colli y penodiad. Ond [ydoedd] fel bod Allah allai gyflawni mater eisoes yn tynghedu-y byddai'r rhai sy'n farw [trwy anghrediniaeth] yn dirywio ar dystiolaeth a'r rhai sy'n byw [mewn ffydd] Byddai byw ar dystiolaeth; ac yn wir, Allah yn clywed ac yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: [Remember, O Muhammad], when Allah showed them to you in your dream as few; and if He had shown them to you as many, you [believers] would have lost courage and would have disputed in the matter [of whether to fight], but Allah saved [you from that]. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
trans-unit.target: [Cofiwch, O Muhammad], pan ddangosodd Allah iddynt i chi yn eich breuddwyd fel ychydig; ac os oedd ef wedi dangos i chi fel llawer, chi [credinwyr] byddai wedi colli dewrder a byddai wedi dadlau yn y mater [o p'un ai i ymladd], ond achubodd Allah [chi o hynny]. Yn wir, ei fod yn gwybod hynny o fewn y bronnau.

trans-unit.source: And [remember] when He showed them to you, when you met, as few in your eyes, and He made you [appear] as few in their eyes so that Allah might accomplish a matter already destined. And to Allah are [all] matters returned.
trans-unit.target: A [cofio] pan ei fod yn dangos iddynt i chi, pan gyfarfu'r chi, fel ychydig yn eich llygaid, ac a wnaeth eich [ymddangos] fel ychydig yn eu llygaid fel y gallai Allah gyflawni mater tynghedu eisoes. Ac mae materion [bob] yn dychwelyd i Allah.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when you encounter a company [from the enemy forces], stand firm and remember Allah much that you may be successful.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, pan fyddwch yn wynebu cwmni [gan y lluoedd gelyn], sefyll yn gadarn ac yn cofio Allah llawer y gallech fod yn llwyddiannus.
