trans-unit.target: Nid yw gwneud [yn gyfartal] gyda Allah Dduwdod arall a [ac felly] yn ceryddu a rhoi'r gorau.

trans-unit.source: And your Lord has decreed that you not worship except Him, and to parents, good treatment. Whether one or both of them reach old age [while] with you, say not to them [so much as], "uff," and do not repel them but speak to them a noble word.
trans-unit.target: Ac wedi eich Arglwydd a ddyfarnwyd nid Mae ydych yn addoli ac eithrio ef, ac i rieni, triniaeth dda. A Mae un neu ddau ohonynt yn cyrraedd oedran hen [tra bod] gyda chi, ddweud nid iddynt hwy [cymaint fel], "uff," ac nid a ddefnyddiwyd hwy ond siarad gair nobl iddynt.

trans-unit.source: And lower to them the wing of humility out of mercy and say, "My Lord, have mercy upon them as they brought me up [when I was] small."
trans-unit.target: A is iddynt yr adain o wyleidd-dra allan o drugaredd a dweud, "fy Arglwydd, wedi drugaredd arnynt fel y daethant mi fyny [pan oeddwn yn] bach."

trans-unit.source: Your Lord is most knowing of what is within yourselves. If you should be righteous [in intention] - then indeed He is ever, to the often returning [to Him], Forgiving.
trans-unit.target: Eich Arglwydd yn gwybod rhan fwyaf o'r hyn sydd o fewn eich hunain. Os dylid hoes dabloid [mewn bwriad]-yna yn wir ef yw erioed, yn aml yn dychwelyd [iddo ef], Forgiving.

trans-unit.source: And give the relative his right, and [also] the poor and the traveler, and do not spend wastefully.
trans-unit.target: A rhoi cymharol ei hawl, a [hefyd] y tlawd a o'r fath, a nid treulio wastraffus.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the wasteful are brothers of the devils, and ever has Satan been to his Lord ungrateful.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, gwastraffus yn brodyr y devils, ac erioed fu Satan ei Arglwydd yn anniolchgar.

trans-unit.source: And if you [must] turn away from the needy awaiting mercy from your Lord which you expect, then speak to them a gentle word.
trans-unit.target: Ac os chi [Rhaid] droi oddi wrth aros am drugaredd anghenus o eich Arglwydd y byddwch yn disgwyl, yna siarad iddynt addfwyn gair.

trans-unit.source: And do not make your hand [as] chained to your neck or extend it completely and [thereby] become blamed and insolvent.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid gwneud eich llaw [fel] chadwyno eich gwddf nac yn ymestyn ei llwyr a [ac felly] fod bai ac yn fethdalwr.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, your Lord extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]. Indeed He is ever, concerning His servants, Acquainted and Seeing.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, mae eich Arglwydd yn ymestyn darpariaeth ar eu cyfer mae'n wills ac yn cyfyngu ar [TG]. Yn wir mae'n erioed, ynghylch ei weision, yn gyfarwydd a gweld.

trans-unit.source: And do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for them and for you. Indeed, their killing is ever a great sin.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oes lladd eich plant rhag ofn tlodi. Rydym yn darparu ar eu cyfer ac i chi. Yn wir, erioed eu lladd yn bechod mawr.

trans-unit.source: And do not approach unlawful sexual intercourse. Indeed, it is ever an immorality and is evil as a way.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oes dull cyfathrach rywiol anghyfreithlon. Yn wir, mae'n erioed anfoesoldeb a yw drygioni fel ffordd.

trans-unit.source: And do not kill the soul which Allah has forbidden, except by right. And whoever is killed unjustly - We have given his heir authority, but let him not exceed limits in [the matter of] taking life. Indeed, he has been supported [by the law].
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oes lladd enaid a Allah wedi gwahardd, ac eithrio drwy hawl. A pwy bynnag yw lladd ar gam-rydym wedi rhoi awdurdod ei etifedd, ond gadewch iddo fod yn fwy na terfynau yn [y mater o] cymryd bywyd. Yn wir, cefnogwyd ef [gan y gyfraith].

trans-unit.source: And do not approach the property of an orphan, except in the way that is best, until he reaches maturity. And fulfill [every] commitment. Indeed, the commitment is ever [that about which one will be] questioned.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oes dull eiddo yn amddifad, ac eithrio yn y ffordd sydd orau, nes iddo gyrraedd aeddfedrwydd. A chyflawni ymrwymiad [bob]. Yn wir, mae'r ymrwymiad yn erioed [y ynghylch pa un fydd] holi.

trans-unit.source: And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with an even balance. That is the best [way] and best in result.
trans-unit.target: A rhoi Mesur llawn pan fyddwch yn mesur, ac yn pwyso a Mesur gyda'r cydbwysedd hyd yn oed. Dyna'r gorau [ffordd] a'r gorau yn ganlyniad.

trans-unit.source: And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed, the hearing, the sight and the heart - about all those [one] will be questioned.
trans-unit.target: A wneud na mynd ar drywydd hynny y mae gennych unrhyw wybodaeth. Yn wir, bydd y clyw, y golwg a galon-am holl hynny [un] yn cael ei holi.

trans-unit.source: And do not walk upon the earth exultantly. Indeed, you will never tear the earth [apart], and you will never reach the mountains in height.
trans-unit.target: Ac nad ydych yn cerdded ar wyneb y ddaear exultantly. Yn wir, byth yn rhwygo y ddaear [rhyngddynt], ac y byddwch byth yn cyrraedd y mynyddoedd o uchder.

trans-unit.source: All that - its evil is ever, in the sight of your Lord, detested.
trans-unit.target: I gyd-mae ei drygioni erioed, yng ngolwg eich Arglwydd, detested.

trans-unit.source: That is from what your Lord has revealed to you, [O Muhammad], of wisdom. And, [O mankind], do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity, lest you be thrown into Hell, blamed and banished.
trans-unit.target: Yn hynny o beth y mae eich Arglwydd wedi datgelu i chi, [O Muhammad], o ddoethineb. A [O dynolryw], nid gwneud [yn gyfartal] gyda Allah Mae Dduwdod arall, rhag ofn cael eich taflu i uffern, y bai a banished.

trans-unit.source: Then, has your Lord chosen you for [having] sons and taken from among the angels daughters? Indeed, you say a grave saying.
trans-unit.target: Yna, wedi eich Arglwydd yn eich dewis ar gyfer [bod] meibion a gymerwyd o blith y merched angylion? Yn wir, dywedwch chi ddweud mawr.

trans-unit.source: And We have certainly diversified [the contents] in this Qur'an that mankind may be reminded, but it does not increase the disbelievers except in aversion.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn sicr rydym wedi arallgyfeirio [cynnwys] yn y Qur'an y gall atgoffa dynolryw, ond nid yw'n ei gynyddu y disbelievers ac eithrio mewn gwrthwynebiad.

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "If there had been with Him [other] gods, as they say, then they [each] would have sought to the Owner of the Throne a way."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, [O Muhammad], "pe bai ag ef [arall] duwiau, fel y dywedant, yna byddai [bob] maent wedi ceisio i berchennog yr Orsedd yn ffordd."

trans-unit.source: Exalted is He and high above what they say by great sublimity.
trans-unit.target: I'w mawrygu yw ef a uchel uwchlaw'r hyn a ddywedant gan sublimity mawr.

trans-unit.source: The seven heavens and the earth and whatever is in them exalt Him. And there is not a thing except that it exalts [Allah] by His praise, but you do not understand their [way of] exalting. Indeed, He is ever Forbearing and Forgiving.
trans-unit.target: Mae y nefoedd saith ac yn y ddaear a beth bynnag sydd ynddynt yn exalt iddo. Ac nid yw yn beth heblaw y mae ei exalts [Allah] gan ei ganmol, ond nid ydych yn deall eu [ffordd o] exalting. Yn wir, mae Forbearing erioed ac yn faddeugar.

trans-unit.source: And when you recite the Qur'an, We put between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter a concealed partition.
trans-unit.target: A pan mae chi adrodd y Qur'an, rhoesom rhyngoch chi a rhai nad ydynt yn credu mewn o hyn ymlaen y pared guddiedig.

trans-unit.source: And We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And when you mention your Lord alone in the Qur'an, they turn back in aversion.
trans-unit.target: Ac yr ydym wedi gosod dros eu calonnau gorchuddion, rhag ofn eu bod yn ei deall, ac yn eu clustiau byddardod. Ac mae pan ydych yn sôn am eich Arglwydd yn unig yn y Qur'an, yn troi yn ôl mewn gwrthwynebiad.

trans-unit.source: We are most knowing of how they listen to it when they listen to you and [of] when they are in private conversation, when the wrongdoers say, "You follow not but a man affected by magic."
trans-unit.target: Rydym yn gwybod fwyaf o sut y maen nhw'n gwrando ar iddo pan eu bod yn gwrando i chi ac o pan fyddant yn sgwrs breifat, pan ddywed y tramgwyddo, "Dilynwch ni ond dyn yr effeithir arnynt gan hud."

trans-unit.source: Look how they strike for you comparisons; but they have strayed, so they cannot [find] a way.
trans-unit.target: Edrych sut y mae eu taro ar gyfer eich cymariaethau; ond maent wedi crwydro, felly ni allant [canfod] ffordd.

trans-unit.source: And they say, "When we are bones and crumbled particles, will we [truly] be resurrected as a new creation?"
trans-unit.target: Ac maent yn dweud, "pan ydym esgyrn a briwsioni gronynnau, bydd gennym [yn wir] atgyfodi fel creu newydd?"

trans-unit.source: Say, "Be you stones or iron
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "fod eich cerrig neu haearn

trans-unit.source: Or [any] creation of that which is great within your breasts." And they will say, "Who will restore us?" Say, "He who brought you forth the first time." Then they will nod their heads toward you and say, "When is that?" Say, "Perhaps it will be soon -
trans-unit.target: Neu greu [unrhyw] hynny sy'n wych o fewn eich bronnau. A byddant yn dweud, "pwy bydd yn adfer ein?" Dweud, "ef a dod ymlaen â chi y tro cyntaf." Wedyn byddant yn nodio eu pennau tuag at eich ac yn dweud, "Pryd y mae hynny?" Dweud, "efallai bydd yn fuan-

trans-unit.source: On the Day He will call you and you will respond with praise of Him and think that you had not remained [in the world] except for a little."
trans-unit.target: Ar y diwrnod y bydd ef yn galw chi a byddwch yn ymateb gyda chanmoliaeth iddo a chredaf nad oedd eich [yn y byd] heblaw am ychydig.

trans-unit.source: And tell My servants to say that which is best. Indeed, Satan induces [dissension] among them. Indeed Satan is ever, to mankind, a clear enemy.
trans-unit.target: A dywedwch i 'm gweision i ddweud bod y gorau. Yn wir, mae Satan yn cymell [gynnen] yn eu plith. Yn wir Satan yw erioed, dynolryw, gelyn clir.

trans-unit.source: Your Lord is most knowing of you. If He wills, He will have mercy upon you; or if He wills, He will punish you. And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], over them as a manager.
trans-unit.target: Eich Arglwydd yn gwybod fwyaf ohonoch. Os mae ef wills, bydd ganddo drugaredd arnoch; neu os y mae ef yn wills, bydd ef yn eich cosbi. Ac nad ydym wedi anfon chi, [O Muhammad], dros eu fel rheolwr.

trans-unit.source: And your Lord is most knowing of whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And We have made some of the prophets exceed others [in various ways], and to David We gave the book [of Psalms].
trans-unit.target: A yw eich Arglwydd rhan fwyaf o wybod pwy bynnag sydd yn y nefoedd a'r ddaear. Ac yr ydym wedi gwneud rhai eraill yn fwy na'r [mewn amrywiol ffyrdd] y proffwydi, ac i David, rhoesom y llyfr [o Salmau].

trans-unit.source: Say, "Invoke those you have claimed [as gods] besides Him, for they do not possess the [ability for] removal of adversity from you or [for its] transfer [to someone else]."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "galw'r rhai yr ydych wedi honni [fel duwiau] heblaw ef, am na fyddai dileu'r [gallu] adfyd oddi wrthych ganddynt neu [ar gyfer ei] trosglwyddo [i rywun arall]."

trans-unit.source: Those whom they invoke seek means of access to their Lord, [striving as to] which of them would be nearest, and they hope for His mercy and fear His punishment. Indeed, the punishment of your Lord is ever feared.
trans-unit.target: Mae'r rhai y mae eu galw'r geisio mynedfeydd i Arglwydd eu, [ymdrechu i] Pa un ohonynt fyddai agosaf, ac maent yn gobeithio am ei drugaredd a ofni ei gosbi. Yn wir, yn cosbi eich Arglwydd yn ofni erioed.

trans-unit.source: And there is no city but that We will destroy it before the Day of Resurrection or punish it with a severe punishment. That has ever been in the Register inscribed.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oes yr un ddinas ond y byddwn yn ei ddinistrio cyn dydd atgyfodi neu ei gosbi â chosbi difrifol. Mae hynny erioed wedi bod yn y gofrestr arsgrifio.

trans-unit.source: And nothing has prevented Us from sending signs except that the former peoples denied them. And We gave Thamud the she-camel as a visible sign, but they wronged her. And We send not the signs except as a warning.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oes dim wedi ein hatal rhag anfon arwyddion heblaw y gwadodd bobloedd cyn iddynt. A rhoddodd Thamud y camel hi fel arwydd gweladwy, ond roedd eu cam iddi. A ydym yn anfon nid yr arwyddion ac eithrio fel rhybudd.

trans-unit.source: And [remember, O Muhammad], when We told you, "Indeed, your Lord has encompassed the people." And We did not make the sight which We showed you except as a trial for the people, as was the accursed tree [mentioned] in the Qur'an. And We threaten them, but it increases them not except in great transgression.
trans-unit.target: A [cofio, O Muhammad], pan ydym wedi dweud wrthych, "Yn wir, eich Arglwydd wedi cwmpasu pobl." Ac ni wnaethom golwg a oedd yn dangos inni chi ac eithrio fel prawf ar gyfer y bobl, fel yr oedd y goeden accursed [at] yn y Qur'an. A ydym yn eu bygwth, ond mae'n cynyddu eu nid ac eithrio yn y tramgwyddiad mawr.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when We said to the angles, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He said, "Should I prostrate to one You created from clay?"
trans-unit.target: A [sôn am] pan y dywedasom wrth yr onglau, "Prostrate i Adam," ac y maent yn prostrated, heblaw am Iblees. Meddai, "Dylai prostrate i un chi a greodd o'r clai?"

trans-unit.source: [Iblees] said, "Do You see this one whom You have honored above me? If You delay me until the Day of Resurrection, I will surely destroy his descendants, except for a few."
trans-unit.target: [Iblees] yn dweud, "gwelwch hyn un bwy ydych wedi honored uchod mi? Os byddwch yn oedi mi tan dydd atgyfodi, bydd fy siawns ddinistrio a'i ddisgynyddion, heblaw am ychydig."

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "Go, for whoever of them follows you, indeed Hell will be the recompense of you - an ample recompense.
trans-unit.target: [Allah] yn dweud, 'Mae arni, ar gyfer pwy bynnag ohonynt yn dilyn chi, yn wir y bydd uffern yn ad-dalu i chi-digon o iawndal.

trans-unit.source: And incite [to senselessness] whoever you can among them with your voice and assault them with your horses and foot soldiers and become a partner in their wealth and their children and promise them." But Satan does not promise them except delusion.
trans-unit.target: A gymell [i ynfydrwydd] pwy bynnag gallwch yn eu plith gyda eich llais ac iddynt ymosod â'ch ceffylau a milwyr traed a dod yn bartner yn eu cyfoeth a eu plant a addo iddynt. " Ond nid yw Satan yn addo iddynt ac eithrio rhithdyb.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, over My [believing] servants there is for you no authority. And sufficient is your Lord as Disposer of affairs.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, dros fy weision [believing] ceir i chi unrhyw awdurdod. Ac mae digon o eich Arglwydd fel Disposer o faterion.

trans-unit.source: It is your Lord who drives the ship for you through the sea that you may seek of His bounty. Indeed, He is ever, to you, Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Mae'n eich Arglwydd sy'n gyrru y llong i chi trwy y môr a gall ofyn am o ei bounty. Yn wir, mae'n erioed, i chi, Merciful.

trans-unit.source: And when adversity touches you at sea, lost are [all] those you invoke except for Him. But when He delivers you to the land, you turn away [from Him]. And ever is man ungrateful.
trans-unit.target: A pan mae adfyd yn cyffwrdd â chi ar y môr, yn colli [bob] hynny ichi alw ar wahân iddo. Ond pan fydd yn traddodi ichi ar y tir, mae eich troi i ffwrdd [oddi wrtho]. Ac byth yn dyn yn anniolchgar.

trans-unit.source: Then do you feel secure that [instead] He will not cause a part of the land to swallow you or send against you a storm of stones? Then you would not find for yourselves an advocate.
trans-unit.target: Yna ydych chi'n teimlo yn ddiogel nad [yn hytrach] bydd ef yn achosi rhan o'r tir i lyncu chi neu anfon yn eich erbyn storm o gerrig? Yna ni welwch drosoch eiriolwr.

trans-unit.source: Or do you feel secure that He will not send you back into the sea another time and send upon you a hurricane of wind and drown you for what you denied? Then you would not find for yourselves against Us an avenger.
trans-unit.target: Neu ydych chi'n teimlo yn ddiogel na fydd yn anfon chi'n ôl i'r môr arall amser ac anfon chi corwynt gwynt a eich boddi am beth yr ydych yn ei gwadu? Yna ni welwch drosoch eich hunain yn ein herbyn avenger.

trans-unit.source: And We have certainly honored the children of Adam and carried them on the land and sea and provided for them of the good things and preferred them over much of what We have created, with [definite] preference.
trans-unit.target: Ac rydym wedi sicr honored plant Adam a eu cynnal ar y tir a'r môr a ddarperir ar eu cyfer o'r pethau da a hwy yn well dros lawer o'r hyn yr ydym wedi creu, â dewis [pendant].

trans-unit.source: [Mention, O Muhammad], the Day We will call forth every people with their record [of deeds]. Then whoever is given his record in his right hand - those will read their records, and injustice will not be done to them, [even] as much as a thread [inside the date seed].
trans-unit.target: [Sôn, O Muhammad], bydd y diwrnod yn galw ymlaen bob pobl gyda'u record [o weithredoedd]. Yna rhoddir pwy bynnag ei record yn ei law dde-bydd rhai yn darllen eu cofnodion, ac anghyfiawnder nid gwneir iddynt, [hyd yn oed] yn gymaint fel llinyn [tu mewn y hadau dyddiad].

trans-unit.source: And whoever is blind in this [life] will be blind in the Hereafter and more astray in way.
trans-unit.target: A pwy bynnag sydd yn ddall yn y [bywyd] hwn bydd yn ddall yn y o hyn ymlaen a mwy ar gyfeiliorn mewn ffordd.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, they were about to tempt you away from that which We revealed to you in order to [make] you invent about Us something else; and then they would have taken you as a friend.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, roeddent yn fin eich temtio oddi wrth hynny yr ydym wedi datgelu i chi er mwyn [] ichi ddyfeisio amdanom ni rhywbeth arall; ac yna byddai maent wedi cymryd chi fel ffrind.

trans-unit.source: And if We had not strengthened you, you would have almost inclined to them a little.
trans-unit.target: Ac os nad ydym wedi cryfhau chi, byddai ydych wedi bron yn dueddol iddynt ychydig.

trans-unit.source: Then [if you had], We would have made you taste double [punishment in] life and double [after] death. Then you would not find for yourself against Us a helper.
trans-unit.target: Yna [os oedd gennych], byddem wedi gwneud eich bywyd dwbl [gorfforol mewn] Flas a dwbl [ar ôl] marwolaeth. Yna ni welwch eich hun yn ein herbyn cynorthwy-ydd.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, they were about to drive you from the land to evict you therefrom. And then [when they do], they will not remain [there] after you, except for a little.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, roeddent am i chi yrru oddi ar y tir i'ch troi allan thelir. Ac yna [pan fyddan nhw'n gwneud], byddant nid yn aros [Mae] ar eich ôl, heblaw am ychydig.

trans-unit.source: [That is Our] established way for those We had sent before you of Our messengers; and you will not find in Our way any alteration.
trans-unit.target: [Dyna ein] sefydlu ffordd ar gyfer y rhai yr ydym wedi anfon cyn ichi am ein negeseuwyr; ac ni welwch yn ein ffordd unrhyw newid.

trans-unit.source: Establish prayer at the decline of the sun [from its meridian] until the darkness of the night and [also] the Qur'an of dawn. Indeed, the recitation of dawn is ever witnessed.
trans-unit.target: Sefydlu gweddi ar y dirywiad yn yr haul [gan ei meridian] tan y tywyllwch y nos a [hefyd] Qur'an dawn. Yn wir, yn dyst erioed i lefaru o dawn.

trans-unit.source: And from [part of] the night, pray with it as additional [worship] for you; it is expected that your Lord will resurrect you to a praised station.
trans-unit.target: Ac o [rhan o] y nos, yn gweddo ag ef fel [addoli] ychwanegol i chi; Disgwylir y bydd eich Arglwydd yn atgyfodi'r chi i orsaf canmol.

trans-unit.source: And say, "My Lord, cause me to enter a sound entrance and to exit a sound exit and grant me from Yourself a supporting authority."
trans-unit.target: A dweud, "Fy Arglwydd, achosi mi Rhowch fynedfa gadarn i ymadael ymadael gadarn a mi grant gan eich hun yn cefnogi awdurdod."

trans-unit.source: And say, "Truth has come, and falsehood has departed. Indeed is falsehood, [by nature], ever bound to depart."
trans-unit.target: A dweud, "Mae gwir wedi dod, ac wedi ymadael anwiredd. Yn wir mae anwiredd, [gan natur], erioed yn rhwym i wyro."

trans-unit.source: And We send down of the Qur'an that which is healing and mercy for the believers, but it does not increase the wrongdoers except in loss.
trans-unit.target: A anfonwn i lawr o'r Qur'an sydd yn iachau a drugaredd y credinwyr, ond nid yw'n ei gynyddu y tramgwyddo ac eithrio yn colli.

trans-unit.source: And when We bestow favor upon the disbeliever, he turns away and distances himself; and when evil touches him, he is ever despairing.
trans-unit.target: A pan ydym yn rhoi favor ar y disbeliever, mae'n troi i ffwrdd ac yn pellhau ei hun; a pan mae drygioni yn cyffwrdd ag ef, yw iddo erioed anobeithio.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Each works according to his manner, but your Lord is most knowing of who is best guided in way."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "bob yn gweithio yn ôl ei ffordd, ond eich Arglwydd yn gwybod fwyaf o gorau sydd yn tywys yn ffordd."

trans-unit.source: And they ask you, [O Muhammad], about the soul. Say, "The soul is of the affair of my Lord. And mankind have not been given of knowledge except a little."
trans-unit.target: Ac maent yn gofyn ichi, [O Muhammad], am yr enaid. Dweud, "yr enaid yn ddigwyddiad o fy Arglwydd. Ac ni roddwyd dynolryw o wybodaeth ac eithrio ychydig.

trans-unit.source: And if We willed, We could surely do away with that which We revealed to you. Then you would not find for yourself concerning it an advocate against Us.
trans-unit.target: Ac os ydym yn ewyllysio iddi, gellid yn sicr wneud i ffwrdd â hynny yr ydym wedi datgelu i chi. Yna ni welwch eich hun ynghylch ei eiriolwr yn ein herbyn.

trans-unit.source: Except [We have left it with you] as a mercy from your Lord. Indeed, His favor upon you has ever been great.
trans-unit.target: Ac eithrio [yr ydym wedi'i adael gyda chi] fel drugaredd oddi wrth eich Arglwydd. Yn wir, erioed ei favor chi wedi bod yn wych.

trans-unit.source: Say, "If mankind and the jinn gathered in order to produce the like of this Qur'an, they could not produce the like of it, even if they were to each other assistants."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Os oedd dynolryw a y jinn a gasglwyd er mwyn cynhyrchu o'r Qur'an hwn, ni allai'r tebyg, hyd yn oed os oeddent i gilydd cynorthwywyr."

trans-unit.source: And We have certainly diversified for the people in this Qur'an from every [kind] of example, but most of the people refused [anything] except disbelief.
trans-unit.target: Ac mae gennym yn sicr wedi arallgyfeirio i bobl yn y Qur'an o bob [] enghraifft o'r math, ond mae'r rhan fwyaf o bobl wedi gwrthod [Dim] ac eithrio anghrediniaeth.

trans-unit.source: And they say, "We will not believe you until you break open for us from the ground a spring.
trans-unit.target: Ac maent yn dweud, "ni chredwn yr ydych hyd nes i chi dorri agored i ni o'r ddaear y gwanwyn.

trans-unit.source: Or [until] you have a garden of palm tress and grapes and make rivers gush forth within them in force [and abundance]
trans-unit.target: Neu [nes] Mae gennych ardd o palmwydd gush afonydd tress a grawnwin a gwneud blaen oddi mewn iddynt yn rym [a digonedd]

trans-unit.source: Or you make the heaven fall upon us in fragments as you have claimed or you bring Allah and the angels before [us]
trans-unit.target: Neu yr ydych yn gwneud y nefoedd yn disgyn arnom ni mewn tameidiau fel yr ydych wedi honni neu byddwch yn dod â Allah ac angylion cyn [ein]

trans-unit.source: Or you have a house of gold or you ascend into the sky. And [even then], we will not believe in your ascension until you bring down to us a book we may read." Say, "Exalted is my Lord! Was I ever but a human messenger?"
trans-unit.target: Neu mae gennych tŷ o aur neu mae eich rhedfa i'r awyr. A [hyd yn oed wedyn], bydd nad ydym yn credu yn eich Dyrchafael hyd nes y byddwch yn dod â i lawr i ni gallwn ddarllen llyfr. Dweud, "i'w mawrygu yn fy Arglwydd! Roedd yr erioed ond negesydd dynol?"

trans-unit.source: And what prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them except that they said, "Has Allah sent a human messenger?"
trans-unit.target: A beth yn rhwystro pobl rhag gredu pan ddaeth canllawiau iddynt heblaw y dywedodd, "Mae gan Allah anfonwyd negesydd dynol?"

trans-unit.source: Say, "If there were upon the earth angels walking securely, We would have sent down to them from the heaven an angel [as a] messenger."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "os oedd ar angylion y ddaear yn cerdded yn ddiogel, byddem wedi anfon i lawr iddynt gan y nefoedd yn angel [fel] negesydd."

trans-unit.source: Say, "Sufficient is Allah as Witness between me and you. Indeed he is ever, concerning His servants, Acquainted and Seeing."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "digonol yw Allah fel tyst rhwng fi a chi. Yn wir mae'n erioed, ynghylch ei weision, yn gyfarwydd a gweld."

trans-unit.source: And whoever Allah guides - he is the [rightly] guided; and whoever He sends astray - you will never find for them protectors besides Him, and We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection [fallen] on their faces - blind, dumb and deaf. Their refuge is Hell; every time it subsides We increase them in blazing fire.
trans-unit.target: A pwy bynnag a hysbysiadau Allah-mae'n dan arweiniad [iawn]; ac yn anfon ar gyfeiliorn pwy bynnag-ni fyddwch yn gwybod iddynt diogelwyr ar wahân iddo, a bydd eu casglu ar ddiwrnod yr atgyfodiad [wedi gostwng] yn ar eu hwynebau-ddall, mud a byddar. Eu lloches yn uffern; bob tro y mae yn tawelu'n inni eu cynyddu yn arloesol tân.

trans-unit.source: That is their recompense because they disbelieved in Our verses and said, "When we are bones and crumbled particles, will we [truly] be resurrected [in] a new creation?"
trans-unit.target: Mae hynny'n eu iawndal oherwydd maent yn ddysgais yn ein penillion ac yn dweud, "pan ydym esgyrn a briwsioni gronynnau, bydd gennym [yn wir] atgyfodi [yn] creu newydd?"

trans-unit.source: Do they not see that Allah, who created the heavens and earth, is [the one] Able to create the likes of them? And He has appointed for them a term, about which there is no doubt. But the wrongdoers refuse [anything] except disbelief.
trans-unit.target: Nid ydynt yn gweld bod Allah, a greodd y nefoedd a'r ddaear, [un] yn gallu creu hoff ohonynt? Ac wedi penodwyd iddynt yn y tymor, a nid oes unrhyw amheuaeth. Ond y tramgwyddo yn gwrthod [Dim] ac eithrio anghrediniaeth.

trans-unit.source: Say [to them], "If you possessed the depositories of the mercy of my Lord, then you would withhold out of fear of spending." And ever has man been stingy.
trans-unit.target: Dweud [iddyn nhw], "os Roedd ydych yn meddu depositories o drugaredd fy Arglwydd, yna byddai chi atal y tu allan i'r ofn o wariant." Ac erioed wedi dyn cybyddlyd.

trans-unit.source: And We had certainly given Moses nine evident signs, so ask the Children of Israel [about] when he came to them and Pharaoh said to him, "Indeed I think, O Moses, that you are affected by magic."
trans-unit.target: Ac yn sicr rydym wedi rhoi Moses naw arwyddion amlwg, felly gofynnwch plant Israel am pan ddaeth iddynt a dywedodd Ffaro iddo, "yn wir, credaf, O Moses, effeithio arnoch drwy hud a lledrith.

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "You have already known that none has sent down these [signs] except the Lord of the heavens and the earth as evidence, and indeed I think, O Pharaoh, that you are destroyed."
trans-unit.target: [Moses] yn dweud, "yr ydych eisoes yn hysbys bod dim wedi anfon i lawr [arwyddion hyn] ac eithrio yr Arglwydd y nefoedd a'r ddaear fel tystiolaeth, ac yn wir yr wyf yn credu, O Ffaro, eich bod yn dinistrio."

trans-unit.source: So he intended to drive them from the land, but We drowned him and those with him all together.
trans-unit.target: Felly ei fod yn bwriadu eu gyrru oddi ar y tir, ond boddi ein ef a'r rhai ag ef gyda'i gilydd.

trans-unit.source: And We said after Pharaoh to the Children of Israel, "Dwell in the land, and when there comes the promise of the Hereafter, We will bring you forth in [one] gathering."
trans-unit.target: Dywedasom ar ôl Ffaro i blant Israel, "i aros yn y tir a pan y daw yr addewid o y o hyn ymlaen, byddwn yn eich blaen yn [un] casglu.

trans-unit.source: And with the truth We have sent the Qur'an down, and with the truth it has descended. And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.
trans-unit.target: Y gwir Rydym wedi anfon y Qur'an i lawr, ac y gwir wedi iddo ymostwng. Ac nad ydym wedi anfon chi, [O Muhammad], ac eithrio fel bringer o tidings da a warner.

trans-unit.source: And [it is] a Qur'an which We have separated [by intervals] that you might recite it to the people over a prolonged period. And We have sent it down progressively.
trans-unit.target: A [Mae'n] gallai Qur'an ac yr ydym wedi gwahanu'r [gan gyfnodau] eich bod hadrodd i bobl dros gyfnod estynedig. Ac wedi inni ei hanfon i lawr yn raddol.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Believe in it or do not believe. Indeed, those who were given knowledge before it - when it is recited to them, they fall upon their faces in prostration,
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "yn credu ynddo neu nid credu. Yn wir, y rheini y rhoddwyd gwybodaeth cyn-pan yn ei roi iddynt, maent yn dod ar eu hwynebau yn prostration,

trans-unit.source: And they say, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, the promise of our Lord has been fulfilled."
trans-unit.target: Ac maent yn dweud, "i'w mawrygu yn ein Arglwydd! Yn wir, yr addewid o ein Arglwydd wedi'i gyflawni."

trans-unit.source: And they fall upon their faces weeping, and the Qur'an increases them in humble submission.
trans-unit.target: Ac maent yn dod ar eu hwynebau yn wylo, ac mae'r Qur'an yn cynyddu eu yn cyflwyno ostyngedig.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Call upon Allah or call upon the Most Merciful. Whichever [name] you call - to Him belong the best names." And do not recite [too] loudly in your prayer or [too] quietly but seek between that an [intermediate] way.
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "yn galw ar Allah neu yn galw ar y rhai mwyaf Merciful. Pa bynnag [enw] yn eich galw-iddo perthyn enwau gorau. " A gwneud nid adrodd uchel [hefyd] yn eich gweddi neu [hefyd] yn dawel ond yn ceisio rhwng y ffordd [Canolradd].

trans-unit.source: And say, "Praise to Allah, who has not taken a son and has had no partner in [His] dominion and has no [need of a] protector out of weakness; and glorify Him with [great] glorification."
trans-unit.target: A dweud, "canmoliaeth i Allah, sydd nad yw wedi cymryd y mab ac wedi cael unrhyw bartner yn ddominiwn [ei] ac unrhyw [Mae angen] protector allan o wendid; ac iddo fawrygu'r â mawrygu [mawr].

trans-unit.source: [All] praise is [due] to Allah, who has sent down upon His Servant the Book and has not made therein any deviance.
trans-unit.target: Canmoliaeth [bob] yn [] i Allah, sydd wedi anfon i lawr ar ei was y llyfr ac nid yw wedi gwneud hynny unrhyw deviance.

trans-unit.source: [He has made it] straight, to warn of severe punishment from Him and to give good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds that they will have a good reward
trans-unit.target: [Mae wedi'i gwneud yn] syth, i rybuddio am gosbi difrifol oddi wrtho a rhoi tidings da i gredinwyr sy'n gwneud gweithredoedd cyfiawn y bydd ganddynt wobr da

trans-unit.source: In which they will remain forever
trans-unit.target: Y byddant yn aros am byth

trans-unit.source: And to warn those who say, "Allah has taken a son."
trans-unit.target: Ac i rybuddio rheini sydd yn dweud, "Allah wedi mab."

trans-unit.source: They have no knowledge of it, nor had their fathers. Grave is the word that comes out of their mouths; they speak not except a lie.
trans-unit.target: Ganddynt unrhyw wybodaeth am hynny, nac wedi eu tadau. Bedd yw y gair a ddaw allan o'u cegau; byddant yn siarad nid ac eithrio celwydd.

trans-unit.source: Then perhaps you would kill yourself through grief over them, [O Muhammad], if they do not believe in this message, [and] out of sorrow.
trans-unit.target: Yna efallai byddai eich lladd eich hun drwy galar drostynt, [O Muhammad], os nad ydynt yn credu yn y neges hon, [a] allan o'r tristwch.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We have made that which is on the earth adornment for it that We may test them [as to] which of them is best in deed.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, yr ydym wedi bod sy'n ar yr addurn y ddaear am ei bod yn bosibl inni brofi [am] Pa un ohonynt sydd orau yn y weithred.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, We will make that which is upon it [into] a barren ground.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, byddwn yn gwneud hynny a dyna arno [i] dir hesb.

trans-unit.source: Or have you thought that the companions of the cave and the inscription were, among Our signs, a wonder?
trans-unit.target: Neu a ydych wedi meddwl bod cymdeithion yr Ogof a arysgrifio yn, ymysg ein arwyddion, pa ryfedd?

trans-unit.source: [Mention] when the youths retreated to the cave and said, "Our Lord, grant us from Yourself mercy and prepare for us from our affair right guidance."
trans-unit.target: [Cyfeiriad] pan fydd y bobl ifanc cilio i yr Ogof ac yn dweud, "Mae ein Arglwydd, yn ein grant gan eich hun drugaredd a baratoi i ni gan ein canllawiau cywir ar y mater."

trans-unit.source: So We cast [a cover of sleep] over their ears within the cave for a number of years.
trans-unit.target: Rydym felly yn bwrw [clawr o gysgu] dros eu clustiau o fewn y Ogof am nifer o flynyddoedd.

trans-unit.source: Then We awakened them that We might show which of the two factions was most precise in calculating what [extent] they had remained in time.
trans-unit.target: Yna rydym yn dihuno hwy y gallai ddangos a o garfanau dau oedd yn fwyaf manwl gywir i gyfrifo i ba raddau maent wedi aros mewn amser.

trans-unit.source: It is We who relate to you, [O Muhammad], their story in truth. Indeed, they were youths who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance.
trans-unit.target: Mae'n ein sy'n ymwneud â chi, [O Muhammad], eu stori mewn gwirionedd. Yn wir, yr oeddent yn bobl ifanc sy'n credu yn yr Arglwydd eu, ac yr ydym yn eu codi yn y canllawiau.

trans-unit.source: And We made firm their hearts when they stood up and said, "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. Never will we invoke besides Him any deity. We would have certainly spoken, then, an excessive transgression.
trans-unit.target: A gwnaethom cadarn eu calonnau wrth iddynt sefyll a dweud, "Mae ein Arglwydd yn yr Arglwydd y nefoedd a'r ddaear. Byth bydd alw ar wahân iddo unrhyw Dduwdod. Byddai Rydym wedi sicr siarad, yna, tramgwyddiad gormodol.

trans-unit.source: These, our people, have taken besides Him deities. Why do they not bring for [worship of] them a clear authority? And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allah a lie?"
trans-unit.target: Wedi hyn, ein pobl, yn ogystal â iddo duwdod. Pam nid ydynt yn cyflwyno i [addoli o] iddynt awdurdod clir? Ac sydd yn anghyfiawn fwy nag un sy'n dyfeisio am Allah celwydd?"

trans-unit.source: [The youths said to one another], "And when you have withdrawn from them and that which they worship other than Allah, retreat to the cave. Your Lord will spread out for you of His mercy and will prepare for you from your affair facility."
trans-unit.target: [Y bobl ifanc wedi dweud wrth un arall], "a pan ydych wedi tynnu'n ôl o'r iddynt ac y maent yn addoli eraill na Allah, encilio i o'r ogof. [Bydd eich Arglwydd lledaenu i chi o ei drugaredd a bydd yn paratoi i chi gan eich cyfleuster ddigwyddiad."

trans-unit.source: And [had you been present], you would see the sun when it rose, inclining away from their cave on the right, and when it set, passing away from them on the left, while they were [laying] within an open space thereof. That was from the signs of Allah. He whom Allah guides is the [rightly] guided, but he whom He leaves astray - never will you find for him a protecting guide.
trans-unit.target: A [Roedd ydych yn bresennol], byddech yn gweld yr haul pan gododd, inclining oddi wrth eu Ogof ar y dde, a pan osododd, trosglwyddo oddi arnynt ar y chwith, er eu bod yn [gosod] o fewn gofod agored ohono. Yr oedd gan yr arwyddion Allah. Bwy mae'r Allah yn tywys yw [iawn] llaw, ond ei fod ef yn gadael ar gyfeiliorn-byth gwelwch iddo canllaw amddiffyn.

trans-unit.source: And you would think them awake, while they were asleep. And We turned them to the right and to the left, while their dog stretched his forelegs at the entrance. If you had looked at them, you would have turned from them in flight and been filled by them with terror.
trans-unit.target: A byddech yn meddwl yn effro, er eu bod yn cysgu. A throesom hwy i'r dde ac i'r chwith, tra roedd eu cŵn yn ymestyn ei forelegs wrth y fynedfa. Os ydych wedi edrych arnynt, byddech wedi troi oddi wrthynt yn hedfan ac wedi'u llenwi gan iddynt gyda terfysg.

trans-unit.source: And similarly, We awakened them that they might question one another. Said a speaker from among them, "How long have you remained [here]?" They said, "We have remained a day or part of a day." They said, "Your Lord is most knowing of how long you remained. So send one of you with this silver coin of yours to the city and let him look to which is the best of food and bring you provision from it and let him be cautious. And let no one be aware of you.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn yr un modd, yr ydym yn dihuno hwy y gallai cwestiwn un arall. Dywedodd siaradwr o blith iddynt, "pa mor hir wedi ichi aros [yma]?" Maent yn dweud, "Rydym wedi aros diwrnod neu rhan o ddiwrnod." Maent yn dweud, "eich Arglwydd yn gwybod fwyaf o pa mor hir a arhosodd chi. Felly un ohonoch gyda hon geiniog arian chi anfon at y ddinas a gadewch iddo edrych yn y gorau o'r bwyd ac yn dod â chi ddarpariaeth ohono a gadewch iddo fod yn ofalus. Ac na foed i neb fod yn ymwybodol o chi.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, if they come to know of you, they will stone you or return you to their religion. And never would you succeed, then - ever."
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, os ydynt yn dod i wybod eich, maent yn carreg chi neu yn eich dychwelyd eu crefydd. A byth y byddai chi lwyddo, yna-byth.

trans-unit.source: And similarly, We caused them to be found that they [who found them] would know that the promise of Allah is truth and that of the Hour there is no doubt. [That was] when they disputed among themselves about their affair and [then] said, "Construct over them a structure. Their Lord is most knowing about them." Said those who prevailed in the matter, "We will surely take [for ourselves] over them a masjid."
trans-unit.target: Ac yn yr un modd, yr ydym yn achosi iddynt i'w gweld nhw [sy'n canfod eu] y byddai gwybod bod addewid y bydd Allah yn wirionedd a yr awr nid oes unrhyw amheuaeth. [Yr oedd] pan maent yn anghytuno ymysg eu hunain am eu ddigwyddiad ac [yna] dywedodd, "adeiladu dros eu strwythur. Eu yr Arglwydd yn gwybod fwyaf amdanynt. Dywedodd rhai a orfu yn y mater, "Byddwn yn sicr yn cymryd [drosom ein hunain] dros eu masjid."

trans-unit.source: They will say there were three, the fourth of them being their dog; and they will say there were five, the sixth of them being their dog - guessing at the unseen; and they will say there were seven, and the eighth of them was their dog. Say, [O Muhammad], "My Lord is most knowing of their number. None knows them except a few. So do not argue about them except with an obvious argument and do not inquire about them among [the speculators] from anyone."
trans-unit.target: Byddant yn dweud yr oedd tri, y pedwerydd ohonynt yn cael eu ci; a byddant yn dweud yr oedd pump, chwech ohonynt yn cael eu ci-yn dyfalu am y unseen; a byddant yn dweud yr oedd saith, ac yr wythfed ohonynt yn eu cŵn. Dweud, [O Muhammad], "fy Arglwydd yn gwybod fwyaf eu nifer. Mae dim yn gwybod iddynt ac eithrio ychydig. Felly nid dadlau amdanynt ac eithrio gyda dadl amlwg a wneud nid holi iddynt ymhlith [hapfasnachwyr] gan neb.

trans-unit.source: And never say of anything, "Indeed, I will do that tomorrow,"
trans-unit.target: A byth yn dweud unrhyw beth, "yn wir, byddaf yn gwneud hynny yfory"

trans-unit.source: Except [when adding], "If Allah wills." And remember your Lord when you forget [it] and say, "Perhaps my Lord will guide me to what is nearer than this to right conduct."
trans-unit.target: Ac eithrio [wrth ychwanegu], "Os mae Allah wills." A chofio eich Arglwydd pan fyddwch yn anghofio [TG] ac yn dweud, "Efallai bydd fy Arglwydd canllaw wrthyf i beth yn nes na hyn i ymddygiad cywir."

trans-unit.source: And they remained in their cave for three hundred years and exceeded by nine.
trans-unit.target: Ac maent yn aros yn eu Ogof am dri chant o flynyddoedd ac yn rhagori ar gan naw.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Allah is most knowing of how long they remained. He has [knowledge of] the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. How Seeing is He and how Hearing! They have not besides Him any protector, and He shares not His legislation with anyone."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Allah yn gwybod fwyaf o pa mor hir roeddent yn parhau. Mae ganddo [wybodaeth o] unseen [agweddau] y nefoedd a'r ddaear. Gweld sut mae ef a sut clyw! Ganddynt nid heblaw iddo unrhyw protector, ac nid ei deddfwriaeth rhannu gydag unrhyw un. "

trans-unit.source: And recite, [O Muhammad], what has been revealed to you of the Book of your Lord. There is no changer of His words, and never will you find in other than Him a refuge.
trans-unit.target: Ac adrodd, [O Muhammad], mae'r hyn a ddatgelwyd i chi o'r llyfr eich Arglwydd. Nid oes unrhyw newid o eiriau, a byth cewch yn heblaw iddo loches.

trans-unit.source: And keep yourself patient [by being] with those who call upon their Lord in the morning and the evening, seeking His countenance. And let not your eyes pass beyond them, desiring adornments of the worldly life, and do not obey one whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance and who follows his desire and whose affair is ever [in] neglect.
trans-unit.target: A chadw eich hun claf [drwy fod yn] gyda'r rhai sy'n galw ar yr Arglwydd eu yn y bore a gyda'r nos, sy'n ceisio ei ystyried. A gadewch Mae nid eich llygaid yn mynd y tu hwnt iddynt, dynodir adornments bywyd worldly, a nid oes ufuddhau un erioed yn ei galon Rydym wedi heedless ein cofio ac sy'n dilyn ei awydd ei ddigwyddiad [yn] esgeulustod.

trans-unit.source: And say, "The truth is from your Lord, so whoever wills - let him believe; and whoever wills - let him disbelieve." Indeed, We have prepared for the wrongdoers a fire whose walls will surround them. And if they call for relief, they will be relieved with water like murky oil, which scalds [their] faces. Wretched is the drink, and evil is the resting place.
trans-unit.target: A dweud, "y gwir yw gan eich Arglwydd, felly pwy bynnag wills-gadewch ef yn credu; a pwy bynnag ewyllysiau-Gadewch iddo chredu. Yn wir, rydym wedi paratoi ar gyfer y tramgwyddo tân bydd eu waliau yn eu hamgylchynu. Ac os maent yn galw am ryddhad, y byddant yn falch gyda dŵr fel olew tywyll, a scalds [eu] wynebau. Truenus yn y ddiod, a drygioni yn y man gorffwys.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - indeed, We will not allow to be lost the reward of any who did well in deeds.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, y rheini sydd wedi credu ac wedi gwneud gweithredoedd cyfiawn-yn wir, ni fyddwn yn caniatáu i wobrwyo unrhyw rai a wnaeth yn dda yn weithredoedd yn cael eu colli.

trans-unit.source: Those will have gardens of perpetual residence; beneath them rivers will flow. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and will wear green garments of fine silk and brocade, reclining therein on adorned couches. Excellent is the reward, and good is the resting place.
trans-unit.target: Bydd rhai wedi gerddi preswylio parhaol; Bydd o dan afonydd yn llifo. Byddant yn addurno'r ynddo gyda breichledau o aur a bydd yn gwisgo gwisgoedd gwyrdd silk iawn a brocade, ledorwedd gyda hi ynddo ar addurno'r gwelyau. Ardderchog yn y wobr, a da yw'r lle gorffwys.

trans-unit.source: And present to them an example of two men: We granted to one of them two gardens of grapevines, and We bordered them with palm trees and placed between them [fields of] crops.
trans-unit.target: A chyflwyno iddynt yn enghraifft o ddau ddyn: Rydym yn ganiataol i un ohonynt yn gerddi dau o gwinwydden, a hwy yn ffinio â choed palmwydd a gosod rhyngddynt [meysydd] cnydau.

trans-unit.source: Each of the two gardens produced its fruit and did not fall short thereof in anything. And We caused to gush forth within them a river.
trans-unit.target: Mae pob un o'r gerddi dau llunio ei ffrwythau ac nad oedd yn dod byr ohono mewn unrhyw beth. Ac rydym wedi achosi i gush ymlaen ynddynt afon.

trans-unit.source: And he had fruit, so he said to his companion while he was conversing with him, "I am greater than you in wealth and mightier in [numbers of] men."
trans-unit.target: Ac yr oedd ffrwyth, fel y dywedodd i a'i gydymaith tra oedd ef yn sgwrsio gydag ef, "yr wyf yn fwy na chi mewn cyfoeth a mightier mewn dynion [nifer]."

trans-unit.source: And he entered his garden while he was unjust to himself. He said, "I do not think that this will perish - ever.
trans-unit.target: Ac aeth ei ardd tra ei fod yn anghyfiawn i ei hun. Meddai, "Nid wyf yn credu y bydd hyn yn marw – erioed.

trans-unit.source: And I do not think the Hour will occur. And even if I should be brought back to my Lord, I will surely find better than this as a return."
trans-unit.target: Ac ni chredaf y bydd yn digwydd yr awr. A hyd yn oed os dylid ei dwyn yn ôl i fy Arglwydd, bydd siawns i gael gwell na hyn yn gyfnewid.

trans-unit.source: His companion said to him while he was conversing with him, "Have you disbelieved in He who created you from dust and then from a sperm-drop and then proportioned you [as] a man?
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd ei gydymaith iddo tra oedd ef yn sgwrsio gydag ef, "yr ydych ddysgais mewn AU sy'n creu chi o'r llwch, ac yna o ostyngiad sberm ac wedyn yr ydych yn dosbarthu [fel] dyn?

trans-unit.source: But as for me, He is Allah, my Lord, and I do not associate with my Lord anyone.
trans-unit.target: Ond mi, ef yw Allah, fy Arglwydd, ac nid wyf yn cysylltu gyda fy Arglwydd neb.

trans-unit.source: And why did you, when you entered your garden, not say, 'What Allah willed [has occurred]; there is no power except in Allah '? Although you see me less than you in wealth and children,
trans-unit.target: A pam na wnaethoch chi, pan roesoch chi eich gardd, na dweud, ' beth Allah ewyllysio iddi [wedi digwydd]; Nid oes unrhyw bŵer ac eithrio yn Allah '? Er y byddwch yn fy ngweld llai nag ydych mewn cyfoeth a phlant,

trans-unit.source: It may be that my Lord will give me [something] better than your garden and will send upon it a calamity from the sky, and it will become a smooth, dusty ground,
trans-unit.target: Mae'n bosibl y bydd fy Arglwydd yn rhoi i mi [rhywbeth] well na eich gardd ac yn anfon arno drychineb o'r awyr, a bydd yn daear llyfn, llychlyd,

trans-unit.source: Or its water will become sunken [into the earth], so you would never be able to seek it."
trans-unit.target: Neu fydd wedi suddo [i'r ddaear], ei dŵr felly fyddai chi byth geisio.

trans-unit.source: And his fruits were encompassed [by ruin], so he began to turn his hands about [in dismay] over what he had spent on it, while it had collapsed upon its trellises, and said, "Oh, I wish I had not associated with my Lord anyone."
trans-unit.target: Ac roedd ei ffrwyth yn cwmpasu [gan adfail], felly dechreuodd i droi ei ddwylo am [mewn siom] dros beth ef wedi ei wario ar hynny, er bod ei dymchwel ar ei delltwaith, a dywedodd, "O, dymunaf oedd gennyf nad yw'n gysylltiedig â fy Arglwydd neb."

trans-unit.source: And there was for him no company to aid him other than Allah, nor could he defend himself.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oedd iddo unrhyw gwmni i'w gynorthwyo ac eithrio Allah, na allai ei amddiffyn ei hun.

trans-unit.source: There the authority is [completely] for Allah, the Truth. He is best in reward and best in outcome.
trans-unit.target: Yr awdurdod Mae [llwyr] i Allah, y gwir. Ef yw gorau yn gwobrwyo a gorau yn y canlyniad.

trans-unit.source: And present to them the example of the life of this world, [its being] like rain which We send down from the sky, and the vegetation of the earth mingles with it and [then] it becomes dry remnants, scattered by the winds. And Allah is ever, over all things, Perfect in Ability.
trans-unit.target: A cyflwyno iddynt yr enghraifft o fywyd y byd hwn, [a'i bod] fel glaw a anfonwn i lawr o'r awyr, a Mae llystyfiant y ddaear mingles gyda hi a [yna] daw'n olion sych, gwasgaru gan y gwyntoedd. Ac Allah erioed, dros holl bethau, perffaith mewn gallu.

trans-unit.source: Wealth and children are [but] adornment of the worldly life. But the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for [one's] hope.
trans-unit.target: [Ond] addurn o fywyd worldly yw'r cyfoeth a phlant. Ond y gweithredoedd da a pharhaus yn well eich Arglwydd ar gyfer gwobrwyo a gobaith gwell i [un].

trans-unit.source: And [warn of] the Day when We will remove the mountains and you will see the earth prominent, and We will gather them and not leave behind from them anyone.
trans-unit.target: A [rhybuddio] y dydd pan fydd cael gwared ar y mynyddoedd a byddwch yn gweld y ddaear yn amlwg, a byddwn yn eu casglu ac yn gadael iddynt unrhyw un.

trans-unit.source: And they will be presented before your Lord in rows, [and He will say], "You have certainly come to Us just as We created you the first time. But you claimed that We would never make for you an appointment."
trans-unit.target: A chânt eu cyflwyno ger bron eich Arglwydd yn rhesi, [a bydd yn dweud], "chi yn sicr wedi i ni yn union fel yr ydym yn creu chi y tro cyntaf. Ond honasoch y byddem byth yn gwneud i chi apwyntiad.

trans-unit.source: And the record [of deeds] will be placed [open], and you will see the criminals fearful of that within it, and they will say, "Oh, woe to us! What is this book that leaves nothing small or great except that it has enumerated it?" And they will find what they did present [before them]. And your Lord does injustice to no one.
trans-unit.target: A rhoddir y cofnod [o weithredoedd] [agored], a byddwch yn gweld y troseddwyr yn ofni bod ynddo, a byddant yn dweud, "o, gwae i ni! Beth yw y llyfr hwn a gadael dim bach neu fawr ac eithrio bod wedi mae'n cyfrif ei? A byddant yn canfod beth oedd maent yn cyflwyno [cyn iddynt]. A yw eich Arglwydd anghyfiawnder i unrhyw un.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He was of the jinn and departed from the command of his Lord. Then will you take him and his descendants as allies other than Me while they are enemies to you? Wretched it is for the wrongdoers as an exchange.
trans-unit.target: A [sôn am] pan dywedasom i'r angylion, "Prostrate i Adam," ac y maent yn prostrated, heblaw am Iblees. Ef oedd y jinn a gwyro o'r Gorchymyn ei Arglwydd. Yna a gymerwch ef ac a'i ddisgynyddion fel cynghreiriaid heblaw fi tra eu bod yn elynion i chi? Mae ar gyfer y tramgwyddo fel cyfnewid truenus.

trans-unit.source: I did not make them witness to the creation of the heavens and the earth or to the creation of themselves, and I would not have taken the misguiders as assistants.
trans-unit.target: Ni wneuthum iddynt yn dyst i greu y nefoedd a'r ddaear neu i greu eu hunain, a byddai wedi cymryd y misguiders fel cynorthwywyr ni.

trans-unit.source: And [warn of] the Day when He will say, "Call 'My partners' whom you claimed," and they will invoke them, but they will not respond to them. And We will put between them [a valley of] destruction.
trans-unit.target: A [rhybuddio] y dydd pan y bydd yn dweud, "galw 'Fy partneriaid' bwy honasoch," a bydd eu galw'r iddynt, ond ni wnaiff ymateb iddynt. A byddwn yn rhoi rhyngddynt [Dyffryn o] dinistrio.

trans-unit.source: And the criminals will see the Fire and will be certain that they are to fall therein. And they will not find from it a way elsewhere.
trans-unit.target: A bydd y troseddwyr yn gweld y tân a bydd yn sicr eu bod yn syrthio ynddo. Ac ni byddant yn canfod ei ffordd mewn mannau eraill.

trans-unit.source: And We have certainly diversified in this Qur'an for the people from every [kind of] example; but man has ever been, most of anything, [prone to] dispute.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn sicr rydym wedi arallgyfeirio yn y Qur'an hwn ar gyfer pobl o bob [math o] enghraifft; ond bu dyn erioed, y rhan fwyaf o unrhyw beth, [dueddol] anghydfod.

trans-unit.source: And nothing has prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them and from asking forgiveness of their Lord except that there [must] befall them the [accustomed] precedent of the former peoples or that the punishment should come [directly] before them.
trans-unit.target: A dim wedi atal pobl rhag gredu pan daeth canllawiau iddynt a gofyn [Rhaid] maddeuant eu Arglwydd ac eithrio bod yna yn digwydd iddynt y cynsail [gyfarwydd] o bobloedd gynt neu y dylai'r gosb ddod [uniongyrchol] ger eu bron.

trans-unit.source: And We send not the messengers except as bringers of good tidings and warners. And those who disbelieve dispute by [using] falsehood to [attempt to] invalidate thereby the truth and have taken My verses, and that of which they are warned, in ridicule.
trans-unit.target: A ydym yn anfon nid y negeswyr ac eithrio fel bringers tidings da a warners. A'r rhai a chredu anghydfod drwy [ddefnyddio] anwiredd ceisio [] annilysu'r gan y gwir ac wedi cymryd fy penillion, a bod y maent yn rhybuddio, mewn gwawd.

trans-unit.source: And who is more unjust than one who is reminded of the verses of his Lord but turns away from them and forgets what his hands have put forth? Indeed, We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And if you invite them to guidance - they will never be guided, then - ever.
trans-unit.target: Ac sydd yn anghyfiawn fwy nag un sy'n Atgoffir y penillion o ei Arglwydd ond troi oddi wrthynt ac yn anghofio beth y mae ei ddwylo wedi ei rhoi ymlaen? Yn wir, rydym wedi rhoi dros eu calonnau gorchuddion, rhag ofn eu bod yn ei deall, ac yn eu clustiau byddardod. Ac os eu gwahodd i'r canllawiau-byddant byth yn cael arweiniad, yna-byth.

trans-unit.source: And your Lord is the Forgiving, full of mercy. If He were to impose blame upon them for what they earned, He would have hastened for them the punishment. Rather, for them is an appointment from which they will never find an escape.
trans-unit.target: A yw eich Arglwydd y Forgiving, yn llawn o drugaredd. Pe bai'n gosod bai arnynt am beth y maent yn ei ennill, byddai ef wedi cyflymu iddynt y gosb. Yn hytrach, ar eu cyfer yn benodiad gan y byddant byth yn canfod dianc.

trans-unit.source: And those cities - We destroyed them when they wronged, and We made for their destruction an appointed time.
trans-unit.target: A dinasoedd hynny-inni ddinistrio iddynt pan roedd eu cam, a wnaethom ar gyfer eu difa yn amser penodedig.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when Moses said to his servant, "I will not cease [traveling] until I reach the junction of the two seas or continue for a long period."
trans-unit.target: [Yn sôn am] pan y dywedodd Moses ei was, "Bydd ni ddod i ben [teithio] tan cyrraedd y gyffordd y moroedd dau, neu barhau am gyfnod hir."

trans-unit.source: But when they reached the junction between them, they forgot their fish, and it took its course into the sea, slipping away.
trans-unit.target: Ond wrth iddynt gyrraedd y gyffordd rhyngddynt, anghofiodd maent eu pysgod, a chymerodd ei gwrs i'r môr, llithro i ffwrdd.

trans-unit.source: So when they had passed beyond it, [Moses] said to his boy, "Bring us our morning meal. We have certainly suffered in this, our journey, [much] fatigue."
trans-unit.target: Felly pan maent wedi pasio tu hwnt i hynny, dywedodd [Moses] ei bachgen, "dod â inni ein bore bwyd. Yr ydym yn sicr wedi dioddef yn hyn, yn ein taith, blinder [o]."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Did you see when we retired to the rock? Indeed, I forgot [there] the fish. And none made me forget it except Satan - that I should mention it. And it took its course into the sea amazingly".
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "aethoch chi i weld pan ydym wedi ymddeol i y Graig? Yn wir, anghofiais [Mae] y pysgod. A gwnaeth dim imi anghofio ei ac eithrio Satan-y dylem grybwyll hynny. A, cymerodd ei gwrs i'r môr yn rhyfeddol.

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "That is what we were seeking." So they returned, following their footprints.
trans-unit.target: [Moses] dywedodd, "Dyna beth yr oeddem yn chwilio am." Felly roedd eu dychwelyd, yn dilyn eu hôl troed.

trans-unit.source: And they found a servant from among Our servants to whom we had given mercy from us and had taught him from Us a [certain] knowledge.
trans-unit.target: Ac maent wedi dod yn was o blith ein gweision i bwy yr ydym wedi rhoi drugaredd oddi wrthym ni ac wedi bod yn dysgu iddo oddi wrthym ar wybodaeth [penodol].

trans-unit.source: Moses said to him, "May I follow you on [the condition] that you teach me from what you have been taught of sound judgement?"
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd Moses wrtho, "gall ddilyn chi ar [y cyflwr] y mae eich addysgu mi o ydych chi wedi'i ddysgu o barn gadarn?"

trans-unit.source: He said, "Indeed, with me you will never be able to have patience.
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "yn wir, gyda mi byddwch byth yn gallu cael amynedd.

trans-unit.source: And how can you have patience for what you do not encompass in knowledge?"
trans-unit.target: A sut y gallwch gael amynedd ar gyfer beth nad ydych gwmpasu mewn gwybodaeth?"

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "You will find me, if Allah wills, patient, and I will not disobey you in [any] order."
trans-unit.target: [Moses] yn dweud, "gwelwch fi, os bydd Allah ewyllysiau, claf, ac nid torri'r chi yn y Gorchymyn [unrhyw]."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Then if you follow me, do not ask me about anything until I make to you about it mention."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "yna os Dilynwch fi, peidiwch â gofyn imi am unrhyw beth hyd nes y gwnaf i chi amdano yn sôn am."

trans-unit.source: So they set out, until when they had embarked on the ship, al-Khidh r tore it open. [Moses] said, "Have you torn it open to drown its people? You have certainly done a grave thing."
trans-unit.target: Felly maent yn nodi, hyd nes pan maent wedi cychwyn ar y llong, roedd ymchwil al-Khidh yn ei Torrodd yn agored. [Moses] yn dweud, "yr ydych wedi cefnu yn agored i foddi ei bobl? Yr ydych yn sicr wedi gwneud difrifol peth."

trans-unit.source: [Al-Khidh r] said, "Did I not say that with me you would never be able to have patience?"
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd [r Al-Khidh], "Ni ddywedais y gyda mi byddech byth yn gallu cael amynedd?"

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "Do not blame me for what I forgot and do not cover me in my matter with difficulty."
trans-unit.target: [Moses] yn dweud, "Nid beio imi am hyn a anghofio ac nid yn ymdrin â mi yn fy mater gydag anhawster."

trans-unit.source: So they set out, until when they met a boy, al-Khidh r killed him. [Moses] said, "Have you killed a pure soul for other than [having killed] a soul? You have certainly done a deplorable thing."
trans-unit.target: Felly maent yn nodi, hyd nes pan gyfarfu yn fachgen, roedd r al-Khidh ei ladd ef. Dywedodd [Moses], "chi wedi lladd enaid pur ar gyfer heblaw [ar ôl lladd] enaid? Yr ydych yn sicr wedi gwneud alaethus peth."

trans-unit.source: [Al-Khidh r] said, "Did I not tell you that with me you would never be able to have patience?"
trans-unit.target: [Al-Khidh r] yn dweud, "Oedd ni ddweud wrthych y gyda mi byddech byth yn gallu cael amynedd?"

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "If I should ask you about anything after this, then do not keep me as a companion. You have obtained from me an excuse."
trans-unit.target: [Moses] yn dweud, "os dylai ofyn ichi am unrhyw beth ar ôl hyn, yna nid yw yn cadw fy fel cydymaith. Wedi ichi oddi wrth imi esgus."

trans-unit.source: So they set out, until when they came to the people of a town, they asked its people for food, but they refused to offer them hospitality. And they found therein a wall about to collapse, so al-Khidh r restored it. [Moses] said, "If you wished, you could have taken for it a payment."
trans-unit.target: Felly maent yn nodi, hyd nes pan ddaethon nhw at y bobl o'r dref, gofynnodd ei bobl ar gyfer bwyd, ond gwrthododd gynnig lletygarwch. Ac maent wedi dod ynddo wal fin disgyn, felly roedd r al-Khidh yn ei hadfer. [Moses] yn dweud, "Os ydych yn dymuno, gellid byddwch wedi iddo daliad."

trans-unit.source: [Al-Khidh r] said, "This is parting between me and you. I will inform you of the interpretation of that about which you could not have patience.
trans-unit.target: [Al-Khidh r] yn dweud, "Mae hyn yn isosod rhwng fi a chi. Byddwn yn eich hysbysu o'r dehongli o hynny y gallai nid gennych amynedd.

trans-unit.source: As for the ship, it belonged to poor people working at sea. So I intended to cause defect in it as there was after them a king who seized every [good] ship by force.
trans-unit.target: O ran y llong, roedd ei yn perthyn i bobl dlawd a gweithio ar y môr. Fel yr oeddwn yn bwriadu achosi diffyg ynddo fel yr oedd ar ôl eu Brenin sydd yn hatafaelu bob llong a [da] gan rym.

trans-unit.source: And as for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared that he would overburden them by transgression and disbelief.
trans-unit.target: Ac o ran y bachgen, yr oedd ei rieni credinwyr, ac yr ydym yn ofni y byddai iddo eu gorlwytho gan tramgwyddiad ac anghrediniaeth.

trans-unit.source: So we intended that their Lord should substitute for them one better than him in purity and nearer to mercy.
trans-unit.target: Felly rydym yn bwriadu y dylai eu Arglwydd rhodder iddynt un gwell nag ef mewn purdeb ac yn agosach at drugaredd.

trans-unit.source: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and there was beneath it a treasure for them, and their father had been righteous. So your Lord intended that they reach maturity and extract their treasure, as a mercy from your Lord. And I did it not of my own accord. That is the interpretation of that about which you could not have patience."
trans-unit.target: Ac ag ar gyfer y wal, roedd yn perthyn i ddau fachgen amddifad yn y ddinas, a oedd yn drysor ar eu cyfer oddi tano, ac wedi eu tad hoes dabloid. Felly oedd eich Arglwydd yn bwriadu bod yn cyrraedd aeddfedrwydd ac echdynnu eu Trysor, fel drugaredd gan yr Arglwydd eich. A gwneuthum hynny nid o fy hun cytundeb. Yn dehongli o hynny y gallai nid gennych amynedd.

trans-unit.source: And they ask you, [O Muhammad], about Dhul-Qarnayn. Say, "I will recite to you about him a report."
trans-unit.target: Ac maent yn gofyn ichi, [O Muhammad], am Dhul-Qarnayn. Dweud, "Bydd adrodd i chi am ei adroddiad."

trans-unit.source: Indeed We established him upon the earth, and We gave him to everything a way.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir yr ydym yn sefydlu ef ar wyneb y ddaear, a rhoddodd ef i bopeth ffordd.

trans-unit.source: So he followed a way
trans-unit.target: Er mwyn iddo ddilyn ffordd

trans-unit.source: Until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it [as if] setting in a spring of dark mud, and he found near it a people. Allah said, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, either you punish [them] or else adopt among them [a way of] goodness."
trans-unit.target: Tan, pan gyrhaeddodd y lleoliad yr haul, ei chael hi [fel pe] gosod yn y gwanwyn o fwd tywyll, a chanfu ei fod ger ei bobl. Allah a dywedodd, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, naill ai yn eich cosbi [eu] neu fel arall fabwysiadu ymysg eu [ffordd o] Duw."

trans-unit.source: He said, "As for one who wrongs, we will punish him. Then he will be returned to his Lord, and He will punish him with a terrible punishment.
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "ag un sy'n camweddau, bydd ein cosbi ef. Yna bydd yr Arglwydd ei dychwelyd iddo, a bydd ef yn cosbi'r ef â chosbi ofnadwy.

trans-unit.source: But as for one who believes and does righteousness, he will have a reward of Paradise, and we will speak to him from our command with ease."
trans-unit.target: Ond ag un sydd yn credu a chyfiawnder i yw, bydd ganddo gwobr o baradwys, a bydd yn siarad ag ef gan ein Gorchymyn yn rhwydd."

trans-unit.source: Then he followed a way
trans-unit.target: Yna dilynodd ffordd

trans-unit.source: Until, when he came to the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had not made against it any shield.
trans-unit.target: Nes, pan ddaeth i godi yr haul, yn ei chael hi'n codi ar bobl ar eu cyfer ni wedi gwneud yn ei erbyn unrhyw darian.

trans-unit.source: Thus. And We had encompassed [all] that he had in knowledge.
trans-unit.target: Felly. A ydym wedi cwmpasu [pob un] yr oedd ef mewn gwybodaeth.

trans-unit.source: Then he followed a way
trans-unit.target: Yna dilynodd ffordd

trans-unit.source: Until, when he reached [a pass] between two mountains, he found beside them a people who could hardly understand [his] speech.
trans-unit.target: Nes, pan gyrhaeddodd [Cerdyn] rhwng dau fynydd, gwelai pobl sy'n prin gellid deall [ei] araith wrth eu hymyl.

trans-unit.source: They said, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, indeed Gog and Magog are [great] corrupters in the land. So may we assign for you an expenditure that you might make between us and them a barrier?"
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, yn wir, Gog a Magog yn [mawr] corrupters yn y tir. Felly efallai inni neilltuo ar gyfer eich gwariant y gallech wneud yn rhwystr rhyngom ni a nhw? "

trans-unit.source: He said, "That in which my Lord has established me is better [than what you offer], but assist me with strength; I will make between you and them a dam.
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "y mae fy Arglwydd sefydlu mi dyna well [na'r hyn a gynigiwch], ond fy nghynorthwyo gyda nerth; Bydd gwneud rhwng chi a nhw argae.

trans-unit.source: Bring me sheets of iron" - until, when he had leveled [them] between the two mountain walls, he said, "Blow [with bellows]," until when he had made it [like] fire, he said, "Bring me, that I may pour over it molten copper."
trans-unit.target: Ddod â mi dalenni haearn"-tan, pan ei fod wedi ati [eu] rhwng y waliau Mynydd ddau, meddai,"Ergyd [gyda Megin yr],"tan pan ei fod wedi gwneud ei [fel] tân, dywedodd," dod â mi, sydd efallai yn Arllwyswch ei copr dawdd. "

trans-unit.source: So Gog and Magog were unable to pass over it, nor were they able [to effect] in it any penetration.
trans-unit.target: Felly roedd Gog a Magog yn methu pasio drosto, nac yr oeddent yn gallu [effaith] ynddo unrhyw treiddiad.

trans-unit.source: [Dhul-Qarnayn] said, "This is a mercy from my Lord; but when the promise of my Lord comes, He will make it level, and ever is the promise of my Lord true."
trans-unit.target: [Dhul-Qarnayn] dywedodd, "Mae hyn yn drugaredd oddi wrth fy Arglwydd; ond pan ddaw yr addewid o fy Arglwydd, bydd ei gwneud lefel, ac mae addewid o fy Arglwydd wir erioed."

trans-unit.source: And We will leave them that day surging over each other, and [then] the Horn will be blown, and We will assemble them in [one] assembly.
trans-unit.target: A byddwn yn gadael iddynt y diwrnod hwnnw yn cwtogwn dros ei gilydd, a [yna] y bydd chwythu y corn, a ydym yn ymgynnull iddynt yn y Cynulliad [un].

trans-unit.source: And We will present Hell that Day to the Disbelievers, on display -
trans-unit.target: A byddwn yn cyflwyno uffern y dydd i y Disbelievers, arddangos-

trans-unit.source: Those whose eyes had been within a cover [removed] from My remembrance, and they were not able to hear.
trans-unit.target: Nid oedd rhai wedi eu llygaid o fewn clawr [Dilëwyd] o 'm cofio, ac maent yn gallu clywed.

trans-unit.source: Then do those who disbelieve think that they can take My servants instead of Me as allies? Indeed, We have prepared Hell for the disbelievers as a lodging.
trans-unit.target: Yna a rhai a chredu yn credu y gallant eu cymryd fy gweision yn hytrach na mi fel cynghreiriaid? Yn wir, rydym wedi paratoi uffern am y disbelievers fel llety.

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "Shall we [believers] inform you of the greatest losers as to [their] deeds?
trans-unit.target: Dweud, [O Muhammad], "bydd [credinwyr] yn eich hysbysu o'r colledwyr mwyaf yn yr un modd i [eu] gweithredoedd?

trans-unit.source: [They are] those whose effort is lost in worldly life, while they think that they are doing well in work."
trans-unit.target: [Maent] rhai ei ymdrech yn cael ei golli yn worldly bywyd, tra bod y credant eu bod yn gwneud yn dda yn y gwaith. "

trans-unit.source: Those are the ones who disbelieve in the verses of their Lord and in [their] meeting Him, so their deeds have become worthless; and We will not assign to them on the Day of Resurrection any importance.
trans-unit.target: Dyma'r rhai a chredu yn y penillion o eu Arglwydd a [eu] yn cyfarfod ag ef, fel y mae eu gweithredoedd wedi dod yn ddiwerth; a bydd gennym ni neilltuo iddynt ar dydd atgyfodi unrhyw bwysigrwydd.

trans-unit.source: That is their recompense - Hell - for what they denied and [because] they took My signs and My messengers in ridicule.
trans-unit.target: Hynny yw eu daliad-uffern-am beth y maent yn ei wrthod a [oherwydd] yn cymryd fy arwyddion a fy negeswyr yn gwawdio.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - they will have the Gardens of Paradise as a lodging,
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, y rheini sydd wedi credu ac wedi gwneud gweithredoedd cyfiawn-bydd ganddynt erddi paradwys fel llety,

trans-unit.source: Wherein they abide eternally. They will not desire from it any transfer.
trans-unit.target: Lle eu bod yn cadw fythol. Bydd eu nid awydd o unrhyw drosglwyddo.

trans-unit.source: Say, "If the sea were ink for [writing] the words of my Lord, the sea would be exhausted before the words of my Lord were exhausted, even if We brought the like of it as a supplement."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "pe y môr yn inc ar gyfer [ysgrifennu] byddai geiriau fy Arglwydd, y môr yn disbyddu cyn y geiriau o fy Arglwydd i ben, hyd yn oed os daethom tebyg ohono fel Atodiad."

trans-unit.source: Say, "I am only a man like you, to whom has been revealed that your god is one God. So whoever would hope for the meeting with his Lord - let him do righteous work and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "yr wyf yn unig yn ddyn fel chi, i bwy mae wedi datgelu bod eich Duw yn un Duw. Felly mae pwy bynnag byddai gobaith ar gyfer y cyfarfod gyda'r Arglwydd ei-Gadewch iddo wneud righteous gweithio ac nid cysylltiol yn addoliad yr Arglwydd ei unrhyw un.

trans-unit.source: Kaf, Ha, Ya, 'Ayn, Sad.
trans-unit.target: Kaf, Ha, Ya, ' Ayn, trist.

trans-unit.source: [This is] a mention of the mercy of your Lord to His servant Zechariah
trans-unit.target: [Mae hwn] sôn am drugaredd eich Arglwydd i ei was Zechariah

trans-unit.source: When he called to his Lord a private supplication.
trans-unit.target: Pan y galwodd at ei Arglwydd supplication preifat.

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, indeed my bones have weakened, and my head has filled with white, and never have I been in my supplication to You, my Lord, unhappy.
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "fy Arglwydd, yn wir wedi fy esgyrn yn gwanhau, ac mae fy mhen yn llenwi â Gwyn, ac yr wyf erioed wedi bod yn fy supplication i chi, fy Arglwydd, yn anhapus.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, I fear the successors after me, and my wife has been barren, so give me from Yourself an heir
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, ofnaf olynwyr ar fy ôl i, ac mae fy ngwraig wedi bod yn hesb, felly mi roi gan eich hun etifedd

trans-unit.source: Who will inherit me and inherit from the family of Jacob. And make him, my Lord, pleasing [to You]."
trans-unit.target: Pwy fydd yn etifeddu'r mi ac etifeddu gan y teulu o Jacob. Ac yn gwneud iddo, fy Arglwydd, braf [ydych].

trans-unit.source: [He was told], "O Zechariah, indeed We give you good tidings of a boy whose name will be John. We have not assigned to any before [this] name."
trans-unit.target: [Dywedwyd wrtho], "O Zechariah, yn wir yn rhoi chi tidings da bachgen fydd John yn ei enw. Nid ydym wedi dyrannu unrhyw cyn enw [hwn]."

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, how will I have a boy when my wife has been barren and I have reached extreme old age?"
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "Fy Arglwydd, sut bydd gennyf bachgen pan fu fy ngwraig yn hesb ac yr wyf wedi cyrraedd henaint eithafol?"

trans-unit.source: [An angel] said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, for I created you before, while you were nothing.' "
trans-unit.target: [Angel] dywedodd, "[fydd] felly; eich Arglwydd yn dweud, 'Mae'n hawdd i mi, ar gyfer creu chi o'r blaen, tra oeddech dim.' "

trans-unit.source: [Zechariah] said, "My Lord, make for me a sign." He said, "Your sign is that you will not speak to the people for three nights, [being] sound."
trans-unit.target: [Zechariah] yn dweud, "Fy Arglwydd, gwneud i mi arwydd." Meddai, "eich arwydd yw y bydd nad ydych yn siarad i bobl am dair noson, [yn] gadarn."

trans-unit.source: So he came out to his people from the prayer chamber and signaled to them to exalt [Allah] in the morning and afternoon.
trans-unit.target: Felly mae'n ddaeth allan i ei bobl yn y Siambr gweddi a oedd yn arwydd iddynt i exalt [Allah] yn y bore a'r prynhawn.

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "O John, take the Scripture with determination." And We gave him judgement [while yet] a boy
trans-unit.target: [Allah] yn dweud, "Mae O John, gymryd yr ysgrythur gyda phenderfyniad." A rhoddodd ef dyfarniad [tra eto] bachgen

trans-unit.source: And affection from Us and purity, and he was fearing of Allah
trans-unit.target: Ac anwyldeb gan ni a phurdeb, ac yr oedd ef yn ofni Allah

trans-unit.source: And dutiful to his parents, and he was not a disobedient tyrant.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn ufudd at ei rieni, ac mae'n nid tyrant anufudd.

trans-unit.source: And peace be upon him the day he was born and the day he dies and the day he is raised alive.
trans-unit.target: A heddwch yn arno y diwrnod y cafodd ei eni ac yn y dydd y bydd ef yn marw ac y diwrnod yw codi fyw.

trans-unit.source: And mention, [O Muhammad], in the Book [the story of] Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place toward the east.
trans-unit.target: A sôn, [O Muhammad], yn y llyfr [stori] Mary, pan wnaeth ei dynnu'n ôl gan ei theulu i waith tuag at y dwyrain.

trans-unit.source: And she took, in seclusion from them, a screen. Then We sent to her Our Angel, and he represented himself to her as a well-proportioned man.
trans-unit.target: Ac fe aeth, yn neilltuaeth, sgrîn. Yna rydym yn anfon at ei Angel ein, ac roedd yn cynrychioli ei hun iddi fel dyn da ystafell gymesur.

trans-unit.source: She said, "Indeed, I seek refuge in the Most Merciful from you, [so leave me], if you should be fearing of Allah."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "yn wir, yr wyf yn chwilio am loches yn fwyaf Merciful gennych, [felly yn gadael imi], os dylai ydych yn ofni Allah."

trans-unit.source: He said, "I am only the messenger of your Lord to give you [news of] a pure boy."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "yr wyf yn unig y negesydd o eich Arglwydd i roi i chi [newyddion] bachgen pur."

trans-unit.source: She said, "How can I have a boy while no man has touched me and I have not been unchaste?"
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "Sut alla i gael fachgen tra wedi oes dyn yn cyffwrdd â mi, ac nid wyf wedi unchaste?"

trans-unit.source: He said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, and We will make him a sign to the people and a mercy from Us. And it is a matter [already] decreed.' "
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "[fydd] felly; Mae eich Arglwydd yn dweud, ' Mae'n hawdd i mi, a byddwn yn gwneud iddo yn arwydd i bobl a drugaredd oddi wrthym ni. Ac mae'n fater a ddyfarnwyd [eisoes].' "

trans-unit.source: So she conceived him, and she withdrew with him to a remote place.
trans-unit.target: Felly roedd hi'n llunio ef, a Tynnodd hi gydag ef i le pell.

trans-unit.source: And the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm tree. She said, "Oh, I wish I had died before this and was in oblivion, forgotten."
trans-unit.target: Ac roedd poenau geni plant yn ei gyrru i gefnffordd o goeden gledr. Dywedodd, "O, dymunaf wedi marw cyn hyn ac yn oedd mynd i ebargofiant, anghofio."

trans-unit.source: But he called her from below her, "Do not grieve; your Lord has provided beneath you a stream.
trans-unit.target: Ond galwodd hi dan hi, "wneud nid galaru; Mae eich Arglwydd wedi darparu o dan eich Nant.

trans-unit.source: And shake toward you the trunk of the palm tree; it will drop upon you ripe, fresh dates.
trans-unit.target: Ac ysgwyd tuag at eich gefnffordd y coed palmwydd; y bydd yn syrthio ar eich aeddfed, ffres dyddiadau.

trans-unit.source: So eat and drink and be contented. And if you see from among humanity anyone, say, 'Indeed, I have vowed to the Most Merciful abstention, so I will not speak today to [any] man.' "
trans-unit.target: Felly fwyta ac yfed ac yn fodlon. Ac os gwelwch o blith dynoliaeth unrhyw un, yn dweud, 'Yn wir, wedi yr wyf wedi addo y mwyaf tosturiol ymatal, felly ni siaradaf heddiw [unrhyw] dyn.' "

trans-unit.source: Then she brought him to her people, carrying him. They said, "O Mary, you have certainly done a thing unprecedented.
trans-unit.target: Yna daeth â hi ef at ei bobl, cario ef. Maent yn dweud, "O Mary, sicr a wnaethoch yn beth nas gwelwyd o'r blaen.

trans-unit.source: O sister of Aaron, your father was not a man of evil, nor was your mother unchaste."
trans-unit.target: O chwaer Aaron, eich tad nid oedd yn ddyn drwg, ac nid oedd eich mam unchaste."

trans-unit.source: So she pointed to him. They said, "How can we speak to one who is in the cradle a child?"
trans-unit.target: Fel y cyfeiriodd hi ato. Maent yn dweud, 'Sut gall inni siarad â'r un sydd yn y crud plentyn?'

trans-unit.source: [Jesus] said, "Indeed, I am the servant of Allah. He has given me the Scripture and made me a prophet.
trans-unit.target: [Iesu] yn dweud, 'yn wir, I 'm gwas Allah. Mae wedi rhoi imi yr ysgrythur a gwneud i mi yn broffwyd.

trans-unit.source: And He has made me blessed wherever I am and has enjoined upon me prayer and zakah as long as I remain alive
trans-unit.target: A wnaeth imi bendithio lle bynnag yr wyf, a Mae enjoined arnaf gweddi a zakah cyhyd ag y bydd yn dal I fyw

trans-unit.source: And [made me] dutiful to my mother, and He has not made me a wretched tyrant.
trans-unit.target: A [gwnaeth i mi] ufudd i fy mam, ac ni wnaeth mi tyrant truenus.

trans-unit.source: And peace is on me the day I was born and the day I will die and the day I am raised alive."
trans-unit.target: A heddwch ar mi dydd y cefais fy ngeni a y diwrnod a bydd yn ei marw ac y dydd Rwy'n codi yn fyw.

trans-unit.source: That is Jesus, the son of Mary - the word of truth about which they are in dispute.
