trans-unit.source: Do you not see that Allah drives clouds? Then He brings them together, then He makes them into a mass, and you see the rain emerge from within it. And He sends down from the sky, mountains [of clouds] within which is hail, and He strikes with it whom He wills and averts it from whom He wills. The flash of its lightening almost takes away the eyesight.
trans-unit.target: Nid ydych yn gweld bod Allah yn gyrru cymylau? Yna mae ef â hwy ynghyd, yna mae ef yn eu gwneud i màs, a ydych yn gweld y glaw yn deillio o'i fewn. A mae'n anfon i lawr o'r awyr, mynyddoedd [o gymylau] y yn cesair, a mae'n taro â phwy AU ewyllysiau a averts ei gan bwy y mae ef wills. Mae fflach o ysgafnhau ei bron yn y golwg i ffwrdd.

trans-unit.source: Allah alternates the night and the day. Indeed in that is a lesson for those who have vision.
trans-unit.target: Mae'r Allah AU eraill y nos a dydd. Yn wir yn hynny yn wers ar gyfer y rhai sydd â gweledigaeth.

trans-unit.source: Allah has created every [living] creature from water. And of them are those that move on their bellies, and of them are those that walk on two legs, and of them are those that walk on four. Allah creates what He wills. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: Mae Allah wedi creu pob creature [byw] o'r dŵr. Ohonynt yn rhai sy'n symud ar eu boliau, ac ohonynt yn rhai sy'n cerdded ar ddwy goes ac ohonynt yn rhai sy'n cerdded ar bedwar. Mae Allah yn creu beth a wills ef. Yn wir, yw Allah dros holl bethau yn gymwys.

trans-unit.source: We have certainly sent down distinct verses. And Allah guides whom He wills to a straight path.
trans-unit.target: Yn sicr rydym wedi anfon i lawr penillion penodol. A Allah hysbysiadau y mae ef yn wills i lwybr syth.

trans-unit.source: But the hypocrites say, "We have believed in Allah and in the Messenger, and we obey"; then a party of them turns away after that. And those are not believers.
trans-unit.target: Ond y rhagrithwyr yn dweud, "yr ydym yn credu yn Allah ac yn y negesydd, ac rydym yn ufuddhau i"; yna mae Plaid ohonynt yn troi i ffwrdd ar ôl hynny. Ac nid yn rhai credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: And when they are called to [the words of] Allah and His Messenger to judge between them, at once a party of them turns aside [in refusal].
trans-unit.target: A pan gânt eu galw i [geiriau] Allah ac ei negesydd i farnu rhyngddynt, ar unwaith yn blaid eu troi o'r neilltu [yn gwrthod].

trans-unit.source: But if the right is theirs, they come to him in prompt obedience.
trans-unit.target: Ond os yw'r hawl yn hwy, maent yn dod ato mewn ufudddod prydlon.

trans-unit.source: Is there disease in their hearts? Or have they doubted? Or do they fear that Allah will be unjust to them, or His Messenger? Rather, it is they who are the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: A oes clefyd yn eu calonnau? Neu maent wedi amau? Neu nid ydynt yn ofni y bydd Allah yn anghyfiawn iddynt hwy, neu ei negesydd? Yn hytrach, mae'n nhw sy'n y tramgwyddo.

trans-unit.source: The only statement of the [true] believers when they are called to Allah and His Messenger to judge between them is that they say, "We hear and we obey." And those are the successful.
trans-unit.target: Yr unig ddatganiad y credinwyr [gwir] pan gânt eu galw i Allah a Messenger ei i farnu rhyngddynt yw bod nhw'n dweud, "yr ydym yn clywed ac ufuddhau ydym." A yw'r rheini yn llwyddiannus.

trans-unit.source: And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger and fears Allah and is conscious of Him - it is those who are the attainers.
trans-unit.target: A pwy bynnag ufudd i Allah a Messenger ei ac ofnau Allah ac mae'n ymwybodol iddo-mae'n rheini y gyrraeddwyr.

trans-unit.source: And they swear by Allah their strongest oaths that if you ordered them, they would go forth [in Allah 's cause]. Say, "Do not swear. [Such] obedience is known. Indeed, Allah is Acquainted with that which you do."
trans-unit.target: Ac y mae iddynt dyngu gan Allah eu llwon cryfaf os ydych gorchmynnodd iddynt, byddent yn mynd ymlaen [yn achos y Allah]. Dweud, "wneud nid rhegi. Gelwir y dinasydd [o'r fath]. Yn wir, yw Allah yn gyfarwydd â hynny a ydych."

trans-unit.source: Say, "Obey Allah and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away - then upon him is only that [duty] with which he has been charged, and upon you is that with which you have been charged. And if you obey him, you will be [rightly] guided. And there is not upon the Messenger except the [responsibility for] clear notification."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Obey Allah ac ufuddhau y negesydd; ond os ydych yn troi i ffwrdd-yna arno yn unig [ddyletswydd honno] ag y mae ef ei gyhuddo, ac arnoch chi yw bod yr ydych wedi eu cyhuddo. Ac os yw eich bod yn ufuddhau iddo, bydd eich harwain [iawn]. Ac nid oes ar y negesydd ac eithrio hysbysiad clir [cyfrifoldeb am]."

trans-unit.source: Allah has promised those who have believed among you and done righteous deeds that He will surely grant them succession [to authority] upon the earth just as He granted it to those before them and that He will surely establish for them [therein] their religion which He has preferred for them and that He will surely substitute for them, after their fear, security, [for] they worship Me, not associating anything with Me. But whoever disbelieves after that - then those are the defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: Mae Allah wedi addo rhai sydd wedi credu eich plith a gwneud gweithredoedd cyfiawn a bydd grant addysg uwch oni iddynt olyniaeth [i'r awdurdod] ar y ddaear fel y rhoddodd ei i'r rheini cyn iddynt ac a fydd yn sicr yn sefydlu ar eu cyfer [hynny] eu crefydd sydd well ganddo iddynt ac y bydd ef yn sicr yn dirprwyo ar eu rhan, ar ôl eu hofn , diogelwch, [i] Mae nhw'n addoli'n imi, nid unrhyw beth cyfeillachu â Me. Ond pwy bynnag a disbelieves ar ôl hynny-ac yna y rhai yn defiantly anufudd.

trans-unit.source: And establish prayer and give zakah and obey the Messenger - that you may receive mercy.
trans-unit.target: A sefydlu gweddi a rhoi zakah a ufuddhau Messenger-y gallech dderbyn drugaredd.

trans-unit.source: Never think that the disbelievers are causing failure [to Allah] upon the earth. Their refuge will be the Fire - and how wretched the destination.
trans-unit.target: Byth yn meddwl bod y disbelievers yn achosi methiant [i Allah] ar wyneb y ddaear. Bydd eu lloches yn y tân-a sut truenus y gyrchfan.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, let those whom your right hands possess and those who have not [yet] reached puberty among you ask permission of you [before entering] at three times: before the dawn prayer and when you put aside your clothing [for rest] at noon and after the night prayer. [These are] three times of privacy for you. There is no blame upon you nor upon them beyond these [periods], for they continually circulate among you - some of you, among others. Thus does Allah make clear to you the verses; and Allah is Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, gadewch rheini yn eich dwylo hawl meddu ar ac mae'r rheini nid [eto] cyrraedd glasoed ymysg chi ofyn caniatâd chi [cyn mynd i mewn] ar dair gwaith: cyn y weddi dawn ac pan fyddwch yn rhoi o'r neilltu eich dillad [ar gyfer gweddill] am hanner dydd ac ar ôl y weddi nos. [Mae'r rhain] deirgwaith o breifatrwydd i chi. Nid oes unrhyw fai arnoch nac arnynt tu hwnt [cyfnodau hyn], am iddynt ddosbarthu'r barhaus ymysg chi-rhai ohonoch, ymhlith eraill. Felly yw Allah gwneud yn glir i chi y penillion; ac Allah yn gwybod a Wise.

trans-unit.source: And when the children among you reach puberty, let them ask permission [at all times] as those before them have done. Thus does Allah make clear to you His verses; and Allah is Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: A pan fydd y plant ymysg eich cyrraedd glasoed, gadewch iddynt ofyn caniatâd [ar bob adeg] fel y rhai ger eu bron wedi ei wneud. Felly yw Allah gwneud yn glir i chi ei penillion; ac Allah yn gwybod a Wise.

trans-unit.source: And women of post-menstrual age who have no desire for marriage - there is no blame upon them for putting aside their outer garments [but] not displaying adornment. But to modestly refrain [from that] is better for them. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: A menywod o oedran ôl-menstrual sydd wedi oes awydd ar gyfer priodas-nid oes unrhyw fai arnynt am roi o'r neilltu eu gwisgoedd allanol [ond] Nid arddangos addurn. Ond i gymedrol osgoi [hynny] yn well ar eu cyfer. A Allah yn clywed ac yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: There is not upon the blind [any] constraint nor upon the lame constraint nor upon the ill constraint nor upon yourselves when you eat from your [own] houses or the houses of your fathers or the houses of your mothers or the houses of your brothers or the houses of your sisters or the houses of your father's brothers or the houses of your father's sisters or the houses of your mother's brothers or the houses of your mother's sisters or [from houses] whose keys you possess or [from the house] of your friend. There is no blame upon you whether you eat together or separately. But when you enter houses, give greetings of peace upon each other - a greeting from Allah, blessed and good. Thus does Allah make clear to you the verses [of ordinance] that you may understand.
trans-unit.target: Mae yna nid ar gyfyngiadau ddall [unrhyw] nac ar y cyfyngiad cloff nac ar y cyfyngiad sâl na chi pan fyddwch yn bwyta gan eich [ei hun] tai neu dai eich tadau neu dai eich mamau neu dŷ eich brodyr neu dŷ eich chwiorydd neu dŷ eich tad brodyr neu dŷ eich tad chwiorydd neu dŷ brodyr eich mam neu dai o chwiorydd eich mam neu [o dai] eu allweddi a byddwch yn meddu ar neu [o'r tŷ] eich cyfaill. Nid oes unrhyw fai arnoch chi p'un a ydych yn bwyta gyda'i gilydd neu ar wahân. Ond pan fyddwch yn mynd o dai, yn rhoi cyfarchion heddwch ar ei gilydd-cyfarchiad gan Allah, Bendigaid a da. Felly yw Allah gwneud yn glir i chi y penillion [o Ordnans] hynny efallai eich bod yn deall.

trans-unit.source: The believers are only those who believe in Allah and His Messenger and, when they are [meeting] with him for a matter of common interest, do not depart until they have asked his permission. Indeed, those who ask your permission, [O Muhammad] - those are the ones who believe in Allah and His Messenger. So when they ask your permission for something of their affairs, then give permission to whom you will among them and ask forgiveness for them of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Y credinwyr yn unig y rhai sy'n credu yn Allah a Messenger ei ac, pan maent yn [cyfarfod] gydag ef am fater sydd o ddiddordeb cyffredin, nad ydym yn gwyro hyd nes y maent wedi gofyn ei ganiatâd. Yn wir, y rhai sy'n gofyn am eich caniatâd, [O Muhammad]-Dyma'r rhai sy'n credu mewn Allah a ei negesydd. Felly pan fyddant yn gofyn eich caniatâd ar gyfer rhywbeth eu materion, yna rhoi caniatâd i bwy mae bydd yn eu plith a gofyn maddeuant iddynt Allah. Yn wir, Allah yn Forgiving a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: Do not make [your] calling of the Messenger among yourselves as the call of one of you to another. Already Allah knows those of you who slip away, concealed by others. So let those beware who dissent from the Prophet's order, lest fitnah strike them or a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Nid yw gwneud [ch] galw y negesydd ymysg eich gilydd fel y galwad o un ohonoch i un arall. Eisoes mae Allah yn gwybod rhai ohonoch a oedd i ffwrdd, ymadael yn cuddio gan eraill. Felly gadewch Mae rhai Gochelwch rhag sy'n anghydweld â Gorchymyn y Proffwyd, rhag ofn fitnah taro hwy neu eu cosbi poenus.

trans-unit.source: Unquestionably, to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. Already He knows that upon which you [stand] and [knows] the Day when they will be returned to Him and He will inform them of what they have done. And Allah is Knowing of all things.
trans-unit.target: Yn ddiamau, Allah yn perthyn iddo beth bynnag sydd yn y nefoedd a'r ddaear. Eisoes fe wyr fod arno chi [sefyll] a [wyr] y dydd pan y cânt eu dychwelyd iddo a bydd yn rhoi gwybod iddynt am yr hyn y maent wedi'i wneud. A gwybod am yr holl bethau yw Allah.

trans-unit.source: Blessed is He who sent down the Criterion upon His Servant that he may be to the worlds a warner -
trans-unit.target: Bendithio ef a anfonwyd i lawr y maen prawf ar ei was ef fod i fyd warner-yw

trans-unit.source: He to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and who has not taken a son and has not had a partner in dominion and has created each thing and determined it with [precise] determination.
trans-unit.target: AU i bwy perthyn ddominiwn y nefoedd ac yn y ddaear ac sy'n nad yw wedi cymryd y mab ac nid yw wedi bod yn bartner yn ddominiwn ac wedi creu pob peth a mae'n benderfynol gyda phenderfyniad [penodol].

trans-unit.source: But they have taken besides Him gods which create nothing, while they are created, and possess not for themselves any harm or benefit and possess not [power to cause] death or life or resurrection.
trans-unit.target: Ond maent wedi eu cymryd ar wahân iddo duwiau sy'n creu dim, tra yn eu creu, ac nid ar gyfer eu hunain yn meddu ar unrhyw niwed neu ELWa ac nid yn meddu ar [pŵer i achosi] atgyfodi neu bywyd neu farwolaeth.

trans-unit.source: And those who disbelieve say, "This [Qur'an] is not except a falsehood he invented, and another people assisted him in it." But they have committed an injustice and a lie.
trans-unit.target: A rhai a chredu yn dweud, "Nid yw hwn [Qur'an] ac eithrio anwiredd a dyfeisiodd ef, a helpodd pobl arall iddo yn ei." Ond eu bod wedi bod yn anghyfiawnder a celwydd.

trans-unit.source: And they say, "Legends of the former peoples which he has written down, and they are dictated to him morning and afternoon."
trans-unit.target: Ac maent yn dweud, "chwedlau o bobloedd hen a mae wedi ysgrifennu i lawr, ac sy'n eu pennu iddo bore a'r prynhawn."

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "It has been revealed by He who knows [every] secret within the heavens and the earth. Indeed, He is ever Forgiving and Merciful."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, [O Muhammad], "datgelwyd gan ef a gwyr [bob] gyfrinach o fewn y nefoedd a'r ddaear. Yn wir, mae'n faddeugar a tosturiol erioed."

trans-unit.source: And they say, "What is this messenger that eats food and walks in the markets? Why was there not sent down to him an angel so he would be with him a warner?
trans-unit.target: Ac maent yn dweud, beth yw negesydd hwn sydd yn bwyta bwyd ac yn cerdded yn y marchnadoedd? Pam mae nid anfonwyd i lawr iddo ef yn angel felly byddai'n gydag ef warner?

trans-unit.source: Or [why is not] a treasure presented to him [from heaven], or does he [not] have a garden from which he eats?" And the wrongdoers say, "You follow not but a man affected by magic."
trans-unit.target: Neu [pam nad yw] yn drysor a gyflwynwyd iddo [o'r nefoedd], neu nid oes [] ganddo ardd y mae e'n ei fwyta? " A dywed y tramgwyddo, "Dilynwch ni ond dyn yr effeithir arnynt gan hud."

trans-unit.source: Look how they strike for you comparisons; but they have strayed, so they cannot [find] a way.
trans-unit.target: Edrych sut y mae eu taro ar gyfer eich cymariaethau; ond maent wedi crwydro, felly ni allant [canfod] ffordd.

trans-unit.source: Blessed is He who, if He willed, could have made for you [something] better than that - gardens beneath which rivers flow - and could make for you palaces.
trans-unit.target: Bendithio yw ef sydd, os oedd yn ewyllysio iddi, gallai wedi gwneud i chi [peth] yn well na hynny-gerddi o dan y llif afonydd-a allai wneud i chi palasau.

trans-unit.source: But they have denied the Hour, and We have prepared for those who deny the Hour a Blaze.
trans-unit.target: Ond mae nhw wedi gwadu yr awr, ac rydym wedi paratoi ar gyfer y rhai sydd yn gwadu yr awr tanbaid.

trans-unit.source: When the Hellfire sees them from a distant place, they will hear its fury and roaring.
trans-unit.target: Pan fydd y Hellfire yn eu gweld o le pell, byddant yn clywed ei ffyrnigrwydd a rhuo.

trans-unit.source: And when they are thrown into a narrow place therein bound in chains, they will cry out thereupon for destruction.
trans-unit.target: A pan maent yn taflu lle cul ynddo yn rhwym mewn cadwynau, bydd grio yn dod i'w dinistrio.

trans-unit.source: [They will be told], "Do not cry this Day for one destruction but cry for much destruction."
trans-unit.target: [Bydd wrthynt], "wylo y diwrnod hwn i'w dinistrio un ond cri am ddinistrio llawer."

trans-unit.source: Say, "Is that better or the Garden of Eternity which is promised to the righteous? It will be for them a reward and destination.
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "yw gwell neu ardd Eternity sy'n cael ei addo i y righteous? Bydd yn eu gwobrwyo ac yn gyrchfan.

trans-unit.source: For them therein is whatever they wish, [while] abiding eternally. It is ever upon your Lord a promise [worthy to be] requested.
trans-unit.target: Iddynt hwy ynddo yn beth bynnag yr oeddent yn ei dymuno, tra ufudd i'r fythol. Mae'n erioed ar eich Arglwydd addewid [deilwng i'w] gofyn am.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] the Day He will gather them and that which they worship besides Allah and will say, "Did you mislead these, My servants, or did they [themselves] stray from the way?"
trans-unit.target: [Yn sôn am] Bydd y dydd yn casglu iddynt ac y maent yn addoli ar wahân i Allah a bydd yn dweud, "oedd eich camarwain rhain, 'm gweision, neu byddant [eu] oedd yn crwydro oddi ar y ffordd?"

trans-unit.source: They will say, "Exalted are You! It was not for us to take besides You any allies. But You provided comforts for them and their fathers until they forgot the message and became a people ruined."
trans-unit.target: Byddant yn dweud, "i'w mawrygu ydych! Nid oedd i ni gymryd heblaw chi unrhyw cynghreiriaid. Ond rhoddodd eich cysuron iddynt hwy a'u tadau nes maent wedi anghofio y neges a daeth pobl yn cael eu difetha.

trans-unit.source: So they will deny you, [disbelievers], in what you say, and you cannot avert [punishment] or [find] help. And whoever commits injustice among you - We will make him taste a great punishment.
trans-unit.target: Felly y maent yn gwadu chi, [disbelievers], yn yr hyn a ddywedwch, ac ni allwch osgoi [cosbi] neu [canfod] help. A pwy bynnag ymrwymo anghyfiawnder ymysg chi-bydd yn gwneud iddo flas cosb mawr.

trans-unit.source: And We did not send before you, [O Muhammad], any of the messengers except that they ate food and walked in the markets. And We have made some of you [people] as trial for others - will you have patience? And ever is your Lord, Seeing.
trans-unit.target: Ac na fyddem yn anfon ger eich bron, [O Muhammad], unrhyw un y negeswyr heblaw eu bod yn bwyta bwyd ac yn cerdded yn y marchnadoedd. Ac yr ydym wedi gwneud rhai o'r chi [pobl] fel prawf ar gyfer eraill-bydd gennych amynedd? A yw eich Arglwydd, erioed weld.

trans-unit.source: And those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, "Why were not angels sent down to us, or [why] do we [not] see our Lord?" They have certainly become arrogant within themselves and [become] insolent with great insolence.
trans-unit.target: A'r rheini nid yn disgwyl cyfarfod â ni yn dweud, "pam anfonwyd nid angylion i lawr i ni, neu [pam] [na] welwn ein Arglwydd?" Maent wedi sicr ddod yn drahaus o fewn eu hunain ac [yn] digywilydd gyda haerllugrwydd mawr.

trans-unit.source: The day they see the angels - no good tidings will there be that day for the criminals, and [the angels] will say, "Prevented and inaccessible."
trans-unit.target: Y diwrnod y maent yn gweld yr angylion-oes tidings da fydd y diwrnod hwnnw ar gyfer y troseddwyr, ac bydd [angylion] yn dweud, "atal ac anhygyrch.

trans-unit.source: And We will regard what they have done of deeds and make them as dust dispersed.
trans-unit.target: A byddwn yn ystyried beth y maent wedi'i wneud o weithredoedd ac yn eu gwneud fel llwch a gwasgaredig.

trans-unit.source: The companions of Paradise, that Day, are [in] a better settlement and better resting place.
trans-unit.target: Chymdeithion o baradwys, y dydd, yn [yn] setliad gwell a gwell fan gorffwys.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] the Day when the heaven will split open with [emerging] clouds, and the angels will be sent down in successive descent.
trans-unit.target: A sôn y dydd pan fydd y nefoedd rhaniad agored gyda cymylau [newydd], ac anfonir yr angylion i lawr yn olynol o dras [am].

trans-unit.source: True sovereignty, that Day, is for the Most Merciful. And it will be upon the disbelievers a difficult Day.
trans-unit.target: Sofraniaeth wirioneddol, y dydd, yw y mwyaf tosturiol. A fydd ar y disbelievers dydd anodd.

trans-unit.source: And the Day the wrongdoer will bite on his hands [in regret] he will say, "Oh, I wish I had taken with the Messenger a way.
trans-unit.target: Ac y diwrnod bydd y drwgweithredwr cnoi ar ei ddwylo [o ofid] ef yn dweud, "o, dymunaf oeddwn i wedi cymryd gyda negesydd y ffordd.

trans-unit.source: Oh, woe to me! I wish I had not taken that one as a friend.
trans-unit.target: O, gwae i mi! Hoffwn pe na fyddai'r wedi bod un fel ffrind.

trans-unit.source: He led me away from the remembrance after it had come to me. And ever is Satan, to man, a deserter."
trans-unit.target: Arweiniodd fi i ffwrdd oddi wrth y cofio ar ôl iddo ddod i mi. Ac erioed mae Satan, i dyn, deserter.

trans-unit.source: And the Messenger has said, "O my Lord, indeed my people have taken this Qur'an as [a thing] abandoned."
trans-unit.target: Ac y negesydd wedi dweud, "O fy Arglwydd, yn wir mae fy pobl wedi cymryd y Qur'an fel [peth] gadael."

trans-unit.source: And thus have We made for every prophet an enemy from among the criminals. But sufficient is your Lord as a guide and a helper.
trans-unit.target: Ac felly yr ydym wedi gwneud ar gyfer y Proffwyd bob gelyn o blith y troseddwyr. Ond digon yw eich Arglwydd fel canllaw a cynorthwy-ydd.

trans-unit.source: And those who disbelieve say, "Why was the Qur'an not revealed to him all at once?" Thus [it is] that We may strengthen thereby your heart. And We have spaced it distinctly.
trans-unit.target: A rhai a chredu yn dweud, "Pam y Qur'an nid datgelwyd iddo ar unwaith?" Felly [Mae'n] bod efallai y bydd yn cryfhau gan eich calon. Ac yr ydym at ei gilydd mae'n unigryw.

trans-unit.source: And they do not come to you with an argument except that We bring you the truth and the best explanation.
trans-unit.target: Ac ni ddeuant atoch gyda dadl heblaw y rhown y gwir ac yr esboniad gorau.

trans-unit.source: The ones who are gathered on their faces to Hell - those are the worst in position and farthest astray in [their] way.
trans-unit.target: Y rhai sydd yn casglu ar eu hwynebau i uffern-yw'r rhai gwaethaf mewn sefyllfa a mannau pellaf ar gyfeiliorn yn eu ffordd [eu].

trans-unit.source: And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture and appointed with him his brother Aaron as an assistant.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn sicr yr ydym wedi rhoi Moses yr ysgrythur ac yn penodi gydag ef ei frawd Aaron fel cynorthwy-ydd.

trans-unit.source: And We said, "Go both of you to the people who have denied Our signs." Then We destroyed them with [complete] destruction.
trans-unit.target: A ydym yn dweud, "Ddau ohonoch yn mynd i'r bobl sydd wedi gwadu ein arwyddion." Yna rydym yn dinistrio eu â dinistrio [llawn].

trans-unit.source: And the people of Noah - when they denied the messengers, We drowned them, and We made them for mankind a sign. And We have prepared for the wrongdoers a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: A pobl Noah-pan oedd yn gwadu y negeswyr, ein boddi iddynt, a gwneud iddynt ar gyfer dynolryw yn arwydd. Ac mae wedi paratoi ar gyfer y tramgwyddo cosb poenus.

trans-unit.source: And [We destroyed] 'Aad and Thamud and the companions of the well and many generations between them.
trans-unit.target: A [dinistrio ein] ' Aad a Thamud a chymdeithion y dda a genedlaethau lawer rhyngddynt.

trans-unit.source: And for each We presented examples [as warnings], and each We destroyed with [total] destruction.
trans-unit.target: Ac ar gyfer pob Cyflwynwyd enghreifftiau [fel rhybuddion], a dinistrio pob rydym â dinistrio [gyfanswm].

trans-unit.source: And they have already come upon the town which was showered with a rain of evil. So have they not seen it? But they are not expecting resurrection.
trans-unit.target: Ac maent eisoes wedi dod ar y dref a oedd yn pentyrru diolchiadau glaw o ddrygioni. Felly nid ydynt wedi gweld ei? Ond nid oeddent yn disgwyl atgyfodi.

trans-unit.source: And when they see you, [O Muhammad], they take you not except in ridicule, [saying], "Is this the one whom Allah has sent as a messenger?
trans-unit.target: A pan fyddant yn gweld chi, [O Muhammad], maent yn cymryd chi nid ac eithrio mewn gwawd, [dweud], "Dyma un ohonynt Allah wedi anfon fel negesydd?

trans-unit.source: He almost would have misled us from our gods had we not been steadfast in [worship of] them." But they are going to know, when they see the punishment, who is farthest astray in [his] way.
trans-unit.target: Bron byddai wedi ein camarwain gan ein duwiau nid ydym wedi bod yn gadarn yn [addoli o] iddynt. " Ond maent yn mynd i wybod, pan maent yn gweld y gosb, sydd ar gyfeiliorn mannau pellaf yn ei ffordd [ei].

trans-unit.source: Have you seen the one who takes as his god his own desire? Then would you be responsible for him?
trans-unit.target: Ydych chi wedi gweld yr un sy'n cymryd fel Duw ei awydd ei hun? Yna byddech yn gyfrifol amdano?

trans-unit.source: Or do you think that most of them hear or reason? They are not except like livestock. Rather, they are [even] more astray in [their] way.
trans-unit.target: Neu a ydych yn credu bod rhan fwyaf ohonynt yn clywed neu reswm? Nid ydynt ac eithrio fel da byw. Yn hytrach, maent yn [yn] fwy ar gyfeiliorn yn eu ffordd [eu].

trans-unit.source: Have you not considered your Lord - how He extends the shadow, and if He willed, He could have made it stationary? Then We made the sun for it an indication.
trans-unit.target: Ydych chi wedi ystyried eich Arglwydd yn nad-sut y mae ef yn ymestyn yr wrthblaid, ac os oedd yn ewyllysio iddi, gallai fod wedi'i gyflwyno yn llonydd? Yna rydym yn gwneud yr haul ar ei gyfer yn arwydd.

trans-unit.source: Then We hold it in hand for a brief grasp.
trans-unit.target: Yna rydym yn cynnal ei mewn llaw ar gyfer dealltwriaeth byr.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who has made the night for you as clothing and sleep [a means for] rest and has made the day a resurrection.
trans-unit.target: Ac ef a wnaeth y nos i chi fel dillad a gweddill cysgu [modd] a wnaed y diwrnod atgyfodiad.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy, and We send down from the sky pure water
trans-unit.target: Ac ef sy'n anfon y gwyntoedd fel tidings da cyn ei drugaredd, a byddwn yn ei anfon i lawr o'r dŵr pur sky

trans-unit.source: That We may bring to life thereby a dead land and give it as drink to those We created of numerous livestock and men.
trans-unit.target: Gall ddod â bywyd i gan dir marw a roi fel diod i rheini rydym yn creu o nifer o ddynion a da byw.

trans-unit.source: And We have certainly distributed it among them that they might be reminded, but most of the people refuse except disbelief.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn sicr rydym wedi dosbarthu yn mysg y gellid eu hatgoffa, ond mae'r rhan fwyaf o bobl yn gwrthod ac eithrio anghrediniaeth.

trans-unit.source: And if We had willed, We could have sent into every city a warner.
trans-unit.target: Ac os ydym wedi ewyllysio iddi, gallai Rydym wedi anfon i bob dinas warner.

trans-unit.source: So do not obey the disbelievers, and strive against them with the Qur'an a great striving.
trans-unit.target: Felly ni ufuddhau i'r disbelievers, ac ymdrechu yn eu herbyn gyda y Qur'an ymdrechu mawr.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who has released [simultaneously] the two seas, one fresh and sweet and one salty and bitter, and He placed between them a barrier and prohibiting partition.
trans-unit.target: Ac ef sydd wedi rhyddhau [ar yr un pryd] y moroedd dau, un ffres a melys ac un hallt a chwerw, ac yr oedd yn gosod rhyngddynt yn rhwystr a gwahardd pared.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who has created from water a human being and made him [a relative by] lineage and marriage. And ever is your Lord competent [concerning creation].
trans-unit.target: Ac ef sydd wedi creu o'r dŵr bod dynol a gwneud iddo [berthynas gan] linach a phriodas. Ac byth yn eich Arglwydd yn gymwys [ynghylch creu].

trans-unit.source: But they worship rather than Allah that which does not benefit them or harm them, and the disbeliever is ever, against his Lord, an assistant [to Satan].
trans-unit.target: Ond mae eu bod yn addoli yn hytrach na Allah sy'n nad yw'n fudd iddynt nac niwed iddynt, ac y disbeliever erioed, erbyn ei Arglwydd, cynorthwy-ydd [i Satan].

trans-unit.source: And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.
trans-unit.target: Ac nad ydym wedi anfon chi, [O Muhammad], ac eithrio fel bringer o tidings da a warner.

trans-unit.source: Say, "I do not ask of you for it any payment - only that whoever wills might take to his Lord a way."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Nid wyf yn gofyn ichi amdano unrhyw daliad-dim ond bod pwy bynnag wills gallai cymryd i Arglwydd ei ffordd."

trans-unit.source: And rely upon the Ever-Living who does not die, and exalt [Allah] with His praise. And sufficient is He to be, with the sins of His servants, Acquainted -
trans-unit.target: A dibynnu arno erioed-byw pwy nad yw yn marw, a exalt [Allah] ei ganmol. Ac mae digon o ef i fod, gyda bechodau ei weision, yn gyfarwydd-

trans-unit.source: He who created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six days and then established Himself above the Throne - the Most Merciful, so ask about Him one well informed.
trans-unit.target: Ef a greodd y nefoedd a y ddaear a'r hyn sydd rhyngddynt yn chwe diwrnod ac yna ei hun yn sefydlu uchod i'r Orsedd-tosturiol, felly gofynnwch am iddo un doeth.

trans-unit.source: And when it is said to them, "Prostrate to the Most Merciful," they say, "And what is the Most Merciful? Should we prostrate to that which you order us?" And it increases them in aversion.
trans-unit.target: A pan mae'n cael ei ddweud wrthynt, "Prostrate i y mwyaf tosturiol," maent yn dweud, "a beth yw y mwyaf Merciful? [Dylai ein prostrate i'r hyn y mae eich Gorchymyn inni?" Ac mae'n cynyddu eu mewn gwrthwynebiad.

trans-unit.source: Blessed is He who has placed in the sky great stars and placed therein a [burning] lamp and luminous moon.
trans-unit.target: Yn ffodus mae ef sydd wedi gosod yn y sêr mawr sky a gosod ynddo lamp [llosgi] a'r lleuad llewychol.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who has made the night and the day in succession for whoever desires to remember or desires gratitude.
trans-unit.target: Ac ef a wnaeth y nos a dydd yn olyniaeth ar gyfer pwy bynnag sy'n dymuno cofio neu yn dymuno diolch.

trans-unit.source: And the servants of the Most Merciful are those who walk upon the earth easily, and when the ignorant address them [harshly], they say [words of] peace,
trans-unit.target: A gweision mwyaf tosturiol yn rhai sydd yn cerdded ar wyneb y ddaear yn hawdd, a pan mae yr anwybodus ymdrin â hwy [hallt], maent yn dweud [geiriau] heddwch,

trans-unit.source: And those who spend [part of] the night to their Lord prostrating and standing [in prayer]
trans-unit.target: A'r rheini sy'n treulio [rhan o] y nos i Arglwydd eu prostrating ac yn sefyll [gweddi]

trans-unit.source: And those who say, "Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Hell. Indeed, its punishment is ever adhering;
trans-unit.target: A'r rhai sydd yn dweud, "ein Arglwydd, osgoi oddi wrthym ni y gosb o uffern. Yn wir, mae ei chosbi yn glynu erioed;

trans-unit.source: Indeed, it is evil as a settlement and residence."
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, yn anfad fel setliad a preswylio.

trans-unit.source: And [they are] those who, when they spend, do so not excessively or sparingly but are ever, between that, [justly] moderate
trans-unit.target: A [ydynt] rhai a, pan fo gwariant, yn gwneud hynny nid yn ormodol neu yn gynnil ond yn yn erioed, rhwng, [gyfiawn] cymedrol

trans-unit.source: And those who do not invoke with Allah another deity or kill the soul which Allah has forbidden [to be killed], except by right, and do not commit unlawful sexual intercourse. And whoever should do that will meet a penalty.
trans-unit.target: A'r rhai nad ydynt yn galw'r ag Allah Dduwdod arall neu ladd yr enaid a Allah wedi gwahardd [i gael eu lladd], ac eithrio drwy hawl, ac nid nid cyfathrach rywiol anghyfreithlon ymrwymo. A pwy ddylai wneud hynny bydd yn talu'r gosb.

trans-unit.source: Multiplied for him is the punishment on the Day of Resurrection, and he will abide therein humiliated -
trans-unit.target: Lluosi iddo yw'r gosb ar ddiwrnod yr atgyfodiad, ac bydd ef yn glynu yn benisel ynddo-

trans-unit.source: Except for those who repent, believe and do righteous work. For them Allah will replace their evil deeds with good. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ar wahân i'r rheini sydd yn edifarhau, credu a gwneud gwaith hoes dabloid. Iddynt bydd Allah yn disodli eu gweithredoedd drwg yn dda. Ac byth yn maddeugar Allah a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: And he who repents and does righteousness does indeed turn to Allah with [accepted] repentance.
trans-unit.target: A yw ef a edifarhao a chyfiawnder i yw yn wir yn troi at Allah gyda pedair [derbyn].

trans-unit.source: And [they are] those who do not testify to falsehood, and when they pass near ill speech, they pass by with dignity.
trans-unit.target: A [ydynt] rheini wneud nid dystio i anwiredd, ac wrth iddynt basio ger araith sâl, maen nhw'n pasio gydag urddas.

trans-unit.source: And those who, when reminded of the verses of their Lord, do not fall upon them deaf and blind.
trans-unit.target: A hynny sydd, pan Atgoffodd y penillion o eu yr Arglwydd, nid ydynt yn dod iddynt yn fyddar a dall.

trans-unit.source: And those who say, "Our Lord, grant us from among our wives and offspring comfort to our eyes and make us an example for the righteous."
trans-unit.target: A'r rhai sydd yn dweud, "ein Arglwydd, grant inni o blith ein gwragedd ac epil cysur i ein llygaid ac yn ein gwneud yn esiampl ar gyfer y righteous."

trans-unit.source: Those will be awarded the Chamber for what they patiently endured, and they will be received therein with greetings and [words of] peace.
trans-unit.target: Bydd rhai yn cael y Siambr am hyn y maent yn ei ddioddef amyneddgar, a bydd yn derbyn erthyglau gyda chyfarchion a [geiriau o] heddwch.

trans-unit.source: Abiding eternally therein. Good is the settlement and residence.
trans-unit.target: Ufudd i'r fythol ynddo. Da yn y setliad a preswylio.

trans-unit.source: Say, "What would my Lord care for you if not for your supplication?" For you [disbelievers] have denied, so your denial is going to be adherent.
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Beth fyddai fy Arglwydd gofal i chi os nad ar gyfer eich supplication?" Ar gyfer ydych [disbelievers] wedi gwadu, felly eich gwadu yn mynd i fod yn driw.

trans-unit.source: Ta, Seen, Meem.
trans-unit.target: Dreth gyngo, gweld, Meem.

trans-unit.source: These are the verses of the clear Book.
trans-unit.target: Mae'r rhain yn y penillion y llyfr clir.

trans-unit.source: Perhaps, [O Muhammad], you would kill yourself with grief that they will not be believers.
trans-unit.target: Efallai, [O Muhammad], chi fyddai'n lladd eich hun gyda galar na bydd yn gredinwyr.

trans-unit.source: If We willed, We could send down to them from the sky a sign for which their necks would remain humbled.
trans-unit.target: Os ydym yn ewyllysio iddi, gallem anfon i lawr iddynt gan y sky yn arwydd y byddai eu gyddfau parhau ostyngedig.

trans-unit.source: And no revelation comes to them anew from the Most Merciful except that they turn away from it.
trans-unit.target: A oes datgeliad yn dod iddynt o'r newydd o mwyaf tosturiol heblaw y maent yn troi i ffwrdd.

trans-unit.source: For they have already denied, but there will come to them the news of that which they used to ridicule.
trans-unit.target: Mae nhw wedi gwadu eisoes, ond daw iddynt y newyddion hynny a ddefnyddiwyd ganddynt i gwawdio.

trans-unit.source: Did they not look at the earth - how much We have produced therein from every noble kind?
trans-unit.target: Ni byddant yn edrych ar y ddaear-faint yr ydym yn cynhyrchu erthyglau o bob math aruchel?

trans-unit.source: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir yn hynny yn arwydd, ond nid oedd rhan fwyaf ohonynt yn gredinwyr.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, eich Arglwydd-mae'n Exalted yn efallai, y Merciful.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when your Lord called Moses, [saying], "Go to the wrongdoing people -
trans-unit.target: A [sôn am] pan alwodd eich Arglwydd Moses, [dweud], "ewch at y bobl gamwedd-

trans-unit.source: The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear Allah?"
trans-unit.target: Pobl Ffaro. Byddant nid yn ofni Allah?"

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, indeed I fear that they will deny me
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "fy Arglwydd, yn wir mae arnaf ofn y bydd gwrthod mi

trans-unit.source: And that my breast will tighten and my tongue will not be fluent, so send for Aaron.
trans-unit.target: Ac y bydd fy fron yn tynhau ac ni fydd fy nhafod yn rhugl, felly anfon am Aaron.

trans-unit.source: And they have upon me a [claim due to] sin, so I fear that they will kill me."
trans-unit.target: Ac mae ganddynt ar mi bechod [cais am fin], felly ofnaf y bydd fy lladd."

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "No. Go both of you with Our signs; indeed, We are with you, listening.
trans-unit.target: [Allah] dywedodd, "Rhif Ewch chi gyda ein arwyddion; yn wir, yr ydym gyda chi, yn gwrando.

trans-unit.source: Go to Pharaoh and say, 'We are the messengers of the Lord of the worlds,
trans-unit.target: Ewch i Ffaro a dweud, ' Rydym yn negeswyr Arglwydd y byd,

trans-unit.source: [Commanded to say], "Send with us the Children of Israel."'"
trans-unit.target: [Enillodd dweud], "Anfon gyda ni y plant Israel." ' "

trans-unit.source: [Pharaoh] said, "Did we not raise you among us as a child, and you remained among us for years of your life?
trans-unit.target: [Ffaro] dywedodd, "oedd nad ydym yn codi eich ein plith fel plentyn, ac arhosodd chi ein plith am flynyddoedd eich bywyd?

trans-unit.source: And [then] you did your deed which you did, and you were of the ungrateful."
trans-unit.target: A [yna] y gwnaethoch eich gweithred y gwnaethoch chi, ac yr oeddech o y anniolchgar.

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "I did it, then, while I was of those astray.
trans-unit.target: [Moses] yn dweud, "Fe wnes I, wedyn, tra yr oeddwn y rhai ar gyfeiliorn.

trans-unit.source: So I fled from you when I feared you. Then my Lord granted me wisdom and prophethood and appointed me [as one] of the messengers.
trans-unit.target: Felly rwyf yn dianc oddi wrthych pan wyf yn ofni eich. Yna mae fy Arglwydd yn ganiataol mi doethineb a prophethood ac yn penodi mi [fel un] o y negeswyr.

trans-unit.source: And is this a favor of which you remind me - that you have enslaved the Children of Israel?"
trans-unit.target: A yw hyn favor yn fy atgoffa-eich bod wedi gaeth plant Israel?"

trans-unit.source: Said Pharaoh, "And what is the Lord of the worlds?"
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd Ffaro, "a beth yw yr Arglwydd o fyd?"

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "The Lord of the heavens and earth and that between them, if you should be convinced."
trans-unit.target: [Moses] ddywedodd, "Yr Arglwydd y nefoedd a'r ddaear a bod rhyngddynt, os dylai fod yn argyhoeddedig."

trans-unit.source: [Pharaoh] said to those around him, "Do you not hear?"
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd [Ffaro] rhai o'i gwmpas, "Nid ydych yn clywed?"

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "Your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers."
trans-unit.target: [Moses] fod, "eich Arglwydd ac Arglwydd eich cyndeidiau yn gyntaf.

trans-unit.source: [Pharaoh] said, "Indeed, your 'messenger' who has been sent to you is mad."
trans-unit.target: [Ffaro] dywedodd, "Yn wir, mae eich 'negesydd' a anfonwyd atoch chi yn wallgof."

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "Lord of the east and the west and that between them, if you were to reason."
trans-unit.target: [Moses] wedi dweud, "Arglwydd y dwyrain a Gorllewin a rhwng iddynt, pe baech yn rheswm."

trans-unit.source: [Pharaoh] said, "If you take a god other than me, I will surely place you among those imprisoned."
trans-unit.target: [Ffaro] yn dweud, "Os ydych yn cymryd Duw heblaw fi, oni rhoddaf ichi ymhlith hynny eu carcharu."

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "Even if I brought you proof manifest?"
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd [Moses], "hyd yn oed pe byddwn yn cyflwyno chi brawf amlwg?"

trans-unit.source: [Pharaoh] said, "Then bring it, if you should be of the truthful."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd [Ffaro], "ac yna dod ag ef, os dylai fod o y geirwir."

trans-unit.source: So [Moses] threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent manifest.
trans-unit.target: Felly taflodd [Moses] a'i staff, ac yn sydyn roedd yn amlwg serpent.

trans-unit.source: And he drew out his hand; thereupon it was white for the observers.
trans-unit.target: A thynnodd allan ei law; Rhydd yr oedd Gwyn ar gyfer yr arsylwyr.

trans-unit.source: [Pharaoh] said to the eminent ones around him, "Indeed, this is a learned magician.
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd [Ffaro] i y rhai enwog o'i gwmpas, "yn wir, dyma ddysgwyd consuriwr.

trans-unit.source: He wants to drive you out of your land by his magic, so what do you advise?"
trans-unit.target: Mae ef am i chi yrru allan eich tir gan ei hud, felly beth ydych chi ei gynghori? "

trans-unit.source: They said, "Postpone [the matter of] him and his brother and send among the cities gatherers
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "ohirio'r [y mater o] ef ei frawd a'i anfon ymhlith casglwyr dinasoedd

trans-unit.source: Who will bring you every learned, skilled magician."
trans-unit.target: A bydd dod â chi bob magician medrus, dysgu."

trans-unit.source: So the magicians were assembled for the appointment of a well-known day.
trans-unit.target: Felly Casglwyd y magicians ar gyfer penodi adnabyddus y dydd.

trans-unit.source: And it was said to the people, "Will you congregate
trans-unit.target: A dywedwyd y bobl, "Bydd ydych yn ymgynnull

trans-unit.source: That we might follow the magicians if they are the predominant?"
trans-unit.target: Y gallai dilyn y magicians os ydynt y Prif?"

trans-unit.source: And when the magicians arrived, they said to Pharaoh, "Is there indeed for us a reward if we are the predominant?"
trans-unit.target: A pan gyrhaeddodd y magicians, dywedodd i Ffaro, "oes yn wir ar gyfer ein gwobr os ydym prif?"

trans-unit.source: He said, "Yes, and indeed, you will then be of those near [to me]."
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "ie, ac yn wir, yna byddwch y rhai ger [i mi]."

trans-unit.source: Moses said to them, "Throw whatever you will throw."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd Moses iddynt, "taflu beth bynnag y bydd ei daflu."

trans-unit.source: So they threw their ropes and their staffs and said, "By the might of Pharaoh, indeed it is we who are predominant."
trans-unit.target: Felly maent yn taflu eu rhaffau ac eu staff ac yn dweud, "Gan y gallai o Ffaro, yn wir mae'n ydym sy'n bennaf."

trans-unit.source: Then Moses threw his staff, and at once it devoured what they falsified.
trans-unit.target: Yna taflodd Moses a'i staff, ac ar unwaith oedd yn devoured yr hyn y maent yn ei ffugio.

trans-unit.source: So the magicians fell down in prostration [to Allah].
trans-unit.target: Felly syrthiodd y magicians i lawr yn prostration [i Allah].

trans-unit.source: They said, "We have believed in the Lord of the worlds,
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "yr ydym wedi credu yn yr Arglwydd y byd,

trans-unit.source: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."
trans-unit.target: Yr Arglwydd Moses ac Aaron."

trans-unit.source: [Pharaoh] said, "You believed Moses before I gave you permission. Indeed, he is your leader who has taught you magic, but you are going to know. I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will surely crucify you all."
trans-unit.target: [Ffaro] yn dweud, "byddwch Credai Moses cyn rhoi eich caniatâd. Yn wir, eich arweinydd sydd wedi dysgu hud i chi, ond byddwch yn gwybod. Byddaf yn sicr yn torri'r oddi ar eich dwylo a eich traed ar ochrau gwahanol, ac yn sicr bydd yr crucify chi i gyd.

trans-unit.source: They said, "No harm. Indeed, to our Lord we will return.
trans-unit.target: Maent yn dweud, "dim niwed. Yn wir, i Arglwydd ein byddwn yn dychwelyd.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, we aspire that our Lord will forgive us our sins because we were the first of the believers."
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, ein nod yw y bydd ein Arglwydd faddau inni ein pechodau oherwydd ni oedd y cyntaf y credinwyr."

trans-unit.source: And We inspired to Moses, "Travel by night with My servants; indeed, you will be pursued."
trans-unit.target: Ac yn ein hysbrydoli i Moses, "teithio gan nos gyda 'm gweision; yn wir, bydd byddwch yn mynd ar drywydd."

trans-unit.source: Then Pharaoh sent among the cities gatherers
trans-unit.target: Yna anfonodd Ffaro ymhlith y dinasoedd casglwyr

trans-unit.source: [And said], "Indeed, those are but a small band,
trans-unit.target: [A dywedodd], "yn wir, mae'r rheini'n ond band bach,

trans-unit.source: And indeed, they are enraging us,
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, y maent yn cythruddo inni,

trans-unit.source: And indeed, we are a cautious society... "
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, yr ydym yn gymdeithas ofalus... "

trans-unit.source: So We removed them from gardens and springs
trans-unit.target: Felly rydym yn eu tynnu o'r gerddi a'r springs

trans-unit.source: And treasures and honorable station -
trans-unit.target: A trysorau a gorsaf Anrhydeddus-

trans-unit.source: Thus. And We caused to inherit it the Children of Israel.
trans-unit.target: Felly. A achoswyd inni etifeddu ei plant Israel.

trans-unit.source: So they pursued them at sunrise.
trans-unit.target: Felly roedd eu dilyn nhw yn yr gwawr.

trans-unit.source: And when the two companies saw one another, the companions of Moses said, "Indeed, we are to be overtaken!"
trans-unit.target: A pan yn y ddau cwmnïau Gwelodd un arall, chymdeithion Moses wedi dweud, "Rydym yn wir, i gael ei goddiweddyd!"

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "No! Indeed, with me is my Lord; He will guide me."
trans-unit.target: [Moses] yn dweud, "na! Yn wir, gyda mi yn fy Arglwydd; Bydd yn ganllaw i mi."

trans-unit.source: Then We inspired to Moses, "Strike with your staff the sea," and it parted, and each portion was like a great towering mountain.
trans-unit.target: Rydym wedyn yn eu hysbrydoli i Moses, "Taro gyda'ch staff y môr," ac roedd ei ildio, ac roedd pob dogn fel mynydd mawr gawr.

trans-unit.source: And We advanced thereto the pursuers.
trans-unit.target: A ydym yn uwch iddi y pursuers.

trans-unit.source: And We saved Moses and those with him, all together.
trans-unit.target: A ydym yn arbed Moses a'r rhai sydd gydag ef, gyda'i gilydd.

trans-unit.source: Then We drowned the others.
trans-unit.target: Yna rydym yn boddi eraill.

trans-unit.source: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir yn hynny yn arwydd, ond nid oedd rhan fwyaf ohonynt yn gredinwyr.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, eich Arglwydd-mae'n Exalted yn efallai, y Merciful.

trans-unit.source: And recite to them the news of Abraham,
trans-unit.target: Ac adrodd iddynt y newyddion am Abraham,

trans-unit.source: When he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?"
trans-unit.target: Pan ddywedodd ei dad a ei bobl, "beth ydych chi addoli?"

trans-unit.source: They said, "We worship idols and remain to them devoted."
trans-unit.target: Maent yn dweud, "Addoli dod ynghyd a neilltuir iddynt yn parhau i fod."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Do they hear you when you supplicate?
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "wneud yn eich clywed pan mae eich supplicate?

trans-unit.source: Or do they benefit you, or do they harm?"
trans-unit.target: Neu wneud iddynt o fudd i chi, neu maent yn gwneud niwed?"

trans-unit.source: They said, "But we found our fathers doing thus."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "ond cawsom ein tadau yn gwneud felly."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Then do you see what you have been worshipping,
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "yna y gwelwch beth ydych wedi ei addoli,

trans-unit.source: You and your ancient forefathers?
trans-unit.target: Chi ac yn eich cyndadau hynafol?

trans-unit.source: Indeed, they are enemies to me, except the Lord of the worlds,
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, maent yn elynion i mi, ac eithrio yr Arglwydd y byd,

trans-unit.source: Who created me, and He [it is who] guides me.
trans-unit.target: Pwy a greodd mi, ac AU [Mae'n sydd] rhoi arweiniad imi.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who feeds me and gives me drink.
trans-unit.target: Ac ef sy'n bwydo mi ac yn rhoi diod i mi.

trans-unit.source: And when I am ill, it is He who cures me
trans-unit.target: A pan fydda i'n sâl, ef sy'n iacháu mi

trans-unit.source: And who will cause me to die and then bring me to life
trans-unit.target: Ac sydd yn achosi i marw a fi wedyn yn dod â mi

trans-unit.source: And who I aspire that He will forgive me my sin on the Day of Recompense."
trans-unit.target: A pwy yr wyf yn dyheu am y bydd yn maddau imi fy pechod ar y dydd o ad-dalu.

trans-unit.source: [And he said], "My Lord, grant me authority and join me with the righteous.
trans-unit.target: [A dywedodd], "Mae fy Arglwydd, mi grant awdurdod ac ymuno â mi gyda y righteous.

trans-unit.source: And grant me a reputation of honor among later generations.
trans-unit.target: A mi grant enw o fraint ymysg cenedlaethau diweddarach.

trans-unit.source: And place me among the inheritors of the Garden of Pleasure.
trans-unit.target: Ac mi ymysg etifeddu o ardd bleser.

trans-unit.source: And forgive my father. Indeed, he has been of those astray.
trans-unit.target: A maddau fy nhad. Yn wir, mae wedi bod y rhai ar gyfeiliorn.

trans-unit.source: And do not disgrace me on the Day they are [all] resurrected -
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oes disgrace mi ar y diwrnod maent i [holl] yn eu atgyfodi-

trans-unit.source: The Day when there will not benefit [anyone] wealth or children
trans-unit.target: Y dydd pan fydd na budd [rhywun] cyfoeth neu blant

trans-unit.source: But only one who comes to Allah with a sound heart."
trans-unit.target: Ond dim ond un sy'n dod i Allah gyda chalon gadarn.

trans-unit.source: And Paradise will be brought near [that Day] to the righteous.
trans-unit.target: A bydd paradwys yn dod ger [y diwrnod hwnnw] i y righteous.

trans-unit.source: And Hellfire will be brought forth for the deviators,
trans-unit.target: A bydd Hellfire yn dod ymlaen ar gyfer y deviators,

trans-unit.source: And it will be said to them, "Where are those you used to worship
trans-unit.target: A bydd rhai yn dweud iddyn nhw, "ble mae rhai ddefnyddiwyd gennych i addoli

trans-unit.source: Other than Allah? Can they help you or help themselves?"
trans-unit.target: Eraill na Allah? Gall eu helpu chi neu helpu eu hunain?"

trans-unit.source: So they will be overturned into Hellfire, they and the deviators
trans-unit.target: Felly y bydd gael ei wrthdroi yn Hellfire, y maent, ac y deviators

trans-unit.source: And the soldiers of Iblees, all together.
trans-unit.target: A milwyr y Iblees, gyda'i gilydd.

trans-unit.source: They will say while they dispute therein,
trans-unit.target: Byddant yn dweud tra maent yn anghydfod ynddo,

trans-unit.source: "By Allah, we were indeed in manifest error
trans-unit.target: "Gan Allah, roeddem yn wir mewn camgymeriad amlwg

trans-unit.source: When we equated you with the Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Pan ydym yn cyfateb chi gyda yr Arglwydd y byd.

trans-unit.source: And no one misguided us except the criminals.
trans-unit.target: A oedd unrhyw un yn annoeth inni ac eithrio troseddwyr.

trans-unit.source: So now we have no intercessors
trans-unit.target: Felly mae gennym ni intercessors

trans-unit.source: And not a devoted friend.
trans-unit.target: A ffrind canolbwyntio.

trans-unit.source: Then if we only had a return [to the world] and could be of the believers... "
trans-unit.target: Yna os dim ond wedi dychwelyd [i'r byd] a gellid y credinwyr... "

trans-unit.source: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir yn hynny yn arwydd, ond nid oedd rhan fwyaf ohonynt yn gredinwyr.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, eich Arglwydd-mae'n Exalted yn efallai, y Merciful.

trans-unit.source: The people of Noah denied the messengers
trans-unit.target: Gwadodd y bobl o Noah y Negeswyr erbyn

trans-unit.source: When their brother Noah said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?
trans-unit.target: Pan ddywedodd eu brawd Noah iddynt, "Bydd ydych nid ofni Allah?

trans-unit.source: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, yr wyf i chi negesydd dibynadwy.

trans-unit.source: So fear Allah and obey me.
trans-unit.target: Felly ofn Allah ac ufuddhau i mi.

trans-unit.source: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid wyf yn gofyn ichi amdano unrhyw daliad. Fy taliad yn unig gan yr Arglwydd y byd.

trans-unit.source: So fear Allah and obey me."
trans-unit.target: Felly yn ofni Allah ac ufuddhau i mi.

trans-unit.source: They said, "Should we believe you while you are followed by the lowest [class of people]?"
trans-unit.target: Maent yn dweud, "Os credwn chi tra byddwch yn dilyn y isaf [dosbarth o bobl]?"

trans-unit.source: He said, "And what is my knowledge of what they used to do?
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "a beth yw fy ngwybodaeth o beth maen nhw'n ei wneud?

trans-unit.source: Their account is only upon my Lord, if you [could] perceive.
trans-unit.target: Eu cyfrif yn unig ar fy Arglwydd, os [gellid] yn eich barn chi.

trans-unit.source: And I am not one to drive away the believers.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid wyf yn un i'w gyrru i ffwrdd y credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: I am only a clear warner."
trans-unit.target: Yr wyf yn unig warner clir."

trans-unit.source: They said, "If you do not desist, O Noah, you will surely be of those who are stoned."
trans-unit.target: Maent yn dweud, "Os nad ydych yn ymatal, O Noah, byddwch yn sicr yn o'r rheini yn llabyddio."

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, indeed my people have denied me.
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "fy Arglwydd, yn wir fy pobl wedi gwadu imi.

trans-unit.source: Then judge between me and them with decisive judgement and save me and those with me of the believers."
trans-unit.target: Farnu rhwng fi a nhw wedyn â dyfarniad pendant ac arbed mi a'r rhai gyda mi y credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: So We saved him and those with him in the laden ship.
trans-unit.target: Felly rydym yn arbed ef a rhai gydag ef yn y llong llwythog.

trans-unit.source: Then We drowned thereafter the remaining ones.
trans-unit.target: Yna boddi wedi hynny y rhai sy'n weddill.

trans-unit.source: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir yn hynny yn arwydd, ond nid oedd rhan fwyaf ohonynt yn gredinwyr.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, eich Arglwydd-mae'n Exalted yn efallai, y Merciful.

trans-unit.source: 'Aad denied the messengers
trans-unit.target: ' Gwadodd Aad y Negeswyr erbyn

trans-unit.source: When their brother Hud said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?
trans-unit.target: Pan ddywedodd eu Hud brawd iddynt, "Bydd ydych nid ofni Allah?

trans-unit.source: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, yr wyf i chi negesydd dibynadwy.

trans-unit.source: So fear Allah and obey me.
trans-unit.target: Felly ofn Allah ac ufuddhau i mi.

trans-unit.source: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid wyf yn gofyn ichi amdano unrhyw daliad. Fy taliad yn unig gan yr Arglwydd y byd.

trans-unit.source: Do you construct on every elevation a sign, amusing yourselves,
trans-unit.target: Mae llunio ar bob dyrchafiad arwydd, ddoniol eich hunain,

trans-unit.source: And take for yourselves palaces and fortresses that you might abide eternally?
trans-unit.target: A chymryd drosoch palasau a cadarnleoedd y gallai gadw at fythol?

trans-unit.source: And when you strike, you strike as tyrants.
trans-unit.target: A chi pan ydych yn taro, mae streic fel gormeswyr.

trans-unit.source: So fear Allah and obey me.
trans-unit.target: Felly ofn Allah ac ufuddhau i mi.

trans-unit.source: And fear He who provided you with that which you know,
trans-unit.target: Ac ef a rhoi i chi a ydych yn gwybod, yn ofni

trans-unit.source: Provided you with grazing livestock and children
trans-unit.target: Rhoi i chi bori da byw a phlant

trans-unit.source: And gardens and springs.
trans-unit.target: A gerddi a'r springs.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day."
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, mae arnaf ofn ichi y gosb o ddiwrnod ofnadwy."

trans-unit.source: They said, "It is all the same to us whether you advise or are not of the advisors.
trans-unit.target: Maent yn dweud, "Mae pob yr un ohonom a chi gynghori neu nad ydynt yn y cynghorwyr.

trans-unit.source: This is not but the custom of the former peoples,
trans-unit.target: Nid yw hyn ond y ddefod o bobloedd gynt,

trans-unit.source: And we are not to be punished."
trans-unit.target: Ac yr ydym ni i gael eu cosbi."

trans-unit.source: And they denied him, so We destroyed them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
trans-unit.target: A oedd yn gwadu iddo, felly rydym yn eu dinistrio. Yn wir yn hynny yn arwydd, ond nid oedd rhan fwyaf ohonynt yn gredinwyr.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, eich Arglwydd-mae'n Exalted yn efallai, y Merciful.

trans-unit.source: Thamud denied the messengers
trans-unit.target: Gwadodd Thamud y Negeswyr erbyn

trans-unit.source: When their brother Salih said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?
trans-unit.target: Pan ddywedodd Salih eu brawd iddynt, "Bydd ydych nid ofni Allah?

trans-unit.source: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, yr wyf i chi negesydd dibynadwy.

trans-unit.source: So fear Allah and obey me.
trans-unit.target: Felly ofn Allah ac ufuddhau i mi.

trans-unit.source: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid wyf yn gofyn ichi amdano unrhyw daliad. Fy taliad yn unig gan yr Arglwydd y byd.

trans-unit.source: Will you be left in what is here, secure [from death],
trans-unit.target: Byddwch yn gadael yn yr hyn sydd yma, diogel [o farwolaeth],

trans-unit.source: Within gardens and springs
trans-unit.target: O fewn gerddi a'r springs

trans-unit.source: And fields of crops and palm trees with softened fruit?
trans-unit.target: A'r caeau cnydau a choed palmwydd gyda ffrwythau wedi meddalu?

trans-unit.source: And you carve out of the mountains, homes, with skill.
trans-unit.target: Ac mae gennych gerfio allan o'r mynyddoedd, cartrefi, gyda sgiliau.

trans-unit.source: So fear Allah and obey me.
trans-unit.target: Felly ofn Allah ac ufuddhau i mi.

trans-unit.source: And do not obey the order of the transgressors,
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oes ufuddhau Gorchymyn y transgressors,

trans-unit.source: Who cause corruption in the land and do not amend."
trans-unit.target: Sy'n achosi llygredd yn y tir a Peidiwch â diwygio.

trans-unit.source: They said, "You are only of those affected by magic.
trans-unit.target: Maent yn dweud, "yr ydych yn unig o'r rhai yr effeithir arnynt drwy hud a lledrith.

trans-unit.source: You are but a man like ourselves, so bring a sign, if you should be of the truthful."
trans-unit.target: Yr ydych yn ond dyn fel ein hunain, felly ddod â arwydd, os dylai fod o y geirwir."

trans-unit.source: He said, "This is a she-camel. For her is a [time of] drink, and for you is a [time of] drink, [each] on a known day.
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "Dyma hi-camel. Hi yw diod [amser], ac i chi [amser o] yfed, [bob] ar ddiwrnod hysbys.

trans-unit.source: And do not touch her with harm, lest you be seized by the punishment of a terrible day."
trans-unit.target: A Peidiwch â chyffwrdd hi â niwed, rhag ofn fod chi yn hatafaelu gan y gosb o ddiwrnod ofnadwy.

trans-unit.source: But they hamstrung her and so became regretful.
trans-unit.target: Ond maent yn rhwystro hi ac felly daeth yn destun gofid.

trans-unit.source: And the punishment seized them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
trans-unit.target: Ac roedd y gosb yn hatafaelu iddynt. Yn wir yn hynny yn arwydd, ond nid oedd rhan fwyaf ohonynt yn gredinwyr.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, eich Arglwydd-mae'n Exalted yn efallai, y Merciful.

trans-unit.source: The people of Lot denied the messengers
trans-unit.target: Gwadodd y bobl o lawer y Negeswyr erbyn

trans-unit.source: When their brother Lot said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?
trans-unit.target: Pan ddywedodd llawer eu brawd iddynt, "Bydd ydych nid ofni Allah?

trans-unit.source: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, yr wyf i chi negesydd dibynadwy.

trans-unit.source: So fear Allah and obey me.
trans-unit.target: Felly ofn Allah ac ufuddhau i mi.

trans-unit.source: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid wyf yn gofyn ichi amdano unrhyw daliad. Fy taliad yn unig gan yr Arglwydd y byd.

trans-unit.source: Do you approach males among the worlds
trans-unit.target: Ydych chi'n dynion dull ymhlith y byd

trans-unit.source: And leave what your Lord has created for you as mates? But you are a people transgressing."
trans-unit.target: A gadael hyn wedi creu eich Arglwydd i chi fel ffrindiau? Ond yr ydych yn bobl tramgwyddus."

trans-unit.source: They said, "If you do not desist, O Lot, you will surely be of those evicted."
trans-unit.target: Maent yn dweud, "Os nad ydych yn ymatal, O lawer, byddwch yn sicr yn rhai troi allan."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Indeed, I am, toward your deed, of those who detest [it].
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "yn wir, yr wyf, tuag at eich gweithred, y rhai sydd yn ffieiddio'r [TG].

trans-unit.source: My Lord, save me and my family from [the consequence of] what they do."
trans-unit.target: Fy Arglwydd, arbed mi a 'm teulu o [o ganlyniad i] beth y maent yn ei wneud. "

trans-unit.source: So We saved him and his family, all,
trans-unit.target: Felly rydym yn arbed iddo ef a'i deulu, pob,

trans-unit.source: Except an old woman among those who remained behind.
trans-unit.target: Ac eithrio hen wraig ymhlith y rhai sy'n aros ar ôl.

trans-unit.source: Then We destroyed the others.
trans-unit.target: Yna rydym yn dinistrio'r eraill.

trans-unit.source: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones], and evil was the rain of those who were warned.
trans-unit.target: Ac rydym yn bwrw glaw arnynt glaw [o gerrig], a drygioni oedd y glaw o'r rheini a oedd yn rhybuddio.

trans-unit.source: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir yn hynny yn arwydd, ond nid oedd rhan fwyaf ohonynt yn gredinwyr.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, eich Arglwydd-mae'n Exalted yn efallai, y Merciful.

trans-unit.source: The companions of the thicket denied the messengers
trans-unit.target: Gwadodd chymdeithion y thicket y Negeswyr erbyn

trans-unit.source: When Shu'ayb said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?
trans-unit.target: Pan ddywedodd Shu'ayb iddynt, "Bydd ydych nid ofni Allah?

trans-unit.source: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, yr wyf i chi negesydd dibynadwy.

trans-unit.source: So fear Allah and obey me.
trans-unit.target: Felly ofn Allah ac ufuddhau i mi.

trans-unit.source: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid wyf yn gofyn ichi amdano unrhyw daliad. Fy taliad yn unig gan yr Arglwydd y byd.

trans-unit.source: Give full measure and do not be of those who cause loss.
trans-unit.target: Rhoi Mesur llawn a Peidiwch â bod yn rhai sy'n achosi colli.

trans-unit.source: And weigh with an even balance.
trans-unit.target: A phwyso gyda cydbwysedd hyd yn oed.

trans-unit.source: And do not deprive people of their due and do not commit abuse on earth, spreading corruption.
trans-unit.target: A wneud Nid amddifadu pobl eu dyledus ac nid oes ymrwymo cam-drin ar y ddaear, gwasgaru llygredd.

trans-unit.source: And fear He who created you and the former creation."
trans-unit.target: Ac ef a greodd chi a chreu hen ofn.

trans-unit.source: They said, "You are only of those affected by magic.
trans-unit.target: Maent yn dweud, "yr ydych yn unig o'r rhai yr effeithir arnynt drwy hud a lledrith.

trans-unit.source: You are but a man like ourselves, and indeed, we think you are among the liars.
trans-unit.target: Ydych ond dyn fel ein hunain, ac yn wir, credwn ydych ymhlith y celwyddgwn.

trans-unit.source: So cause to fall upon us fragments of the sky, if you should be of the truthful."
trans-unit.target: Felly achosi i syrthio ar ein darnau o'r awyr, os dylai fod o y geirwir."

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord is most knowing of what you do."
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "Fy Arglwydd yn gwybod rhan fwyaf o'r hyn yr ydych yn ei wneud."

trans-unit.source: And they denied him, so the punishment of the day of the black cloud seized them. Indeed, it was the punishment of a terrible day.
trans-unit.target: A oedd yn gwadu iddo, felly roedd y gosb o ddiwrnod y cwmwl DU yn hatafaelu iddynt. Yn wir, oedd y gosb o ddiwrnod ofnadwy.

trans-unit.source: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir yn hynny yn arwydd, ond nid oedd rhan fwyaf ohonynt yn gredinwyr.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, eich Arglwydd-mae'n Exalted yn efallai, y Merciful.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, the Qur'an is the revelation of the Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, y Qur'an yw'r datgeliad o Arglwydd y byd.

trans-unit.source: The Trustworthy Spirit has brought it down
trans-unit.target: Daeth yr ysbryd dibynadwy i lawr

trans-unit.source: Upon your heart, [O Muhammad] - that you may be of the warners -
trans-unit.target: Ar eich calon, [O Muhammad]-a allai fod yn chi o y warners-

trans-unit.source: In a clear Arabic language.
trans-unit.target: Mewn iaith glir Arabeg.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, it is [mentioned] in the scriptures of former peoples.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, ei Mae [at] yn yr ysgrythurau o bobloedd hen.

trans-unit.source: And has it not been a sign to them that it is recognized by the scholars of the Children of Israel?
trans-unit.target: Ac ni fu yn arwydd iddynt y cydnabyddir gan yr ysgolheigion plant Israel?

trans-unit.source: And even if We had revealed it to one among the foreigners
trans-unit.target: A hyd yn oed os ydym wedi datgelu ei i un ymysg y tramorwyr

trans-unit.source: And he had recited it to them [perfectly], they would [still] not have been believers in it.
trans-unit.target: Ac wedi iddo ei roi iddynt yn [berffaith], [o hyd] ni buasai credinwyr yn ei.

trans-unit.source: Thus have We inserted disbelief into the hearts of the criminals.
trans-unit.target: Felly yr ydym wedi gosod anghrediniaeth calonnau y troseddwyr.

trans-unit.source: They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Ni byddant yn credu ynddo nes iddynt weld y gosb poenus.

trans-unit.source: And it will come to them suddenly while they perceive [it] not.
trans-unit.target: A daw iddynt yn sydyn tra welant [TG] ni.

trans-unit.source: And they will say, "May we be reprieved?"
trans-unit.target: A byddant yn dweud, "Efallai inni fod yn reprieved?"

trans-unit.source: So for Our punishment are they impatient?
trans-unit.target: Felly ar gyfer ein cosbi yr ydynt yn ddiamynedd?

trans-unit.source: Then have you considered if We gave them enjoyment for years
trans-unit.target: Wedyn a ydych wedi ystyried os ydym yn rhoi iddynt fwynhau am flynyddoedd

trans-unit.source: And then there came to them that which they were promised?
trans-unit.target: Ac yna mae daeth iddynt a addawyd iddynt?

trans-unit.source: They would not be availed by the enjoyment with which they were provided.
trans-unit.target: Byddai eu ni fod wedi manteisio ar gan y mwynhad a roddwyd iddynt.

trans-unit.source: And We did not destroy any city except that it had warners
trans-unit.target: Ac nad ydym yn dinistrio unrhyw ddinas heblaw ei fod yn cael warners

trans-unit.source: As a reminder; and never have We been unjust.
trans-unit.target: Fel nodyn atgoffa; ac byth ein bod wedi bod yn anghyfiawn.

trans-unit.source: And the devils have not brought the revelation down.
trans-unit.target: Ac wedi y devils y datgeliad ni i lawr.

trans-unit.source: It is not allowable for them, nor would they be able.
trans-unit.target: Nid yw'n a ganiateir iddynt, ac ni fyddent yn gallu.

trans-unit.source: Indeed they, from [its] hearing, are removed.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir gan [ei] clyw, eu, dileu.

trans-unit.source: So do not invoke with Allah another deity and [thus] be among the punished.
trans-unit.target: Felly wneud galw'r ag Allah Dduwdod arall a [felly], fod ymhlith y cosbi.

trans-unit.source: And warn, [O Muhammad], your closest kindred.
trans-unit.target: A rhybuddio, [O Muhammad], eich kindred agosaf.

trans-unit.source: And lower your wing to those who follow you of the believers.
trans-unit.target: A eich adain i'r rhai sy'n dilyn chi y credinwyr yn is.

trans-unit.source: And if they disobey you, then say, "Indeed, I am disassociated from what you are doing."
trans-unit.target: Ac os ydynt yn torri'r chi, wedyn yn dweud, "Yn wir, yr wyf yr datgysylltu o beth yr ydych yn ei wneud."

trans-unit.source: And rely upon the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,
trans-unit.target: Ac yn dibynnu ar y Exalted yn efallai, Merciful,

trans-unit.source: Who sees you when you arise
trans-unit.target: Sydd yn eich gweld chi pan ydych yn codi

trans-unit.source: And your movement among those who prostrate.
trans-unit.target: A eich symud ymhlith y rhai a prostrate.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, ei fod yn y gwrandawiad, y mae gwybod.

trans-unit.source: Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?
trans-unit.target: Bydd yn hysbysu'r chi ar bwy mae y devils ddisgyn?

trans-unit.source: They descend upon every sinful liar.
trans-unit.target: Mae iddynt ddisgyn ar bob celwyddgi sinful.

trans-unit.source: They pass on what is heard, and most of them are liars.
trans-unit.target: Maen nhw'n pasio ar hyn a glywir, a'r rhan fwyaf ohonynt yn gelwyddgwn.

trans-unit.source: And the poets - [only] the deviators follow them;
trans-unit.target: Ac y beirdd-[ond] y deviators yn eu dilyn;

trans-unit.source: Do you not see that in every valley they roam
trans-unit.target: Nid ydych yn gweld fod ym mhob Cwm maent yn crwydro'n

trans-unit.source: And that they say what they do not do? -
trans-unit.target: Ac y maent yn dweud beth nad ydynt yn gwneud? -

trans-unit.source: Except those [poets] who believe and do righteous deeds and remember Allah often and defend [the Muslims] after they were wronged. And those who have wronged are going to know to what [kind of] return they will be returned.
trans-unit.target: Ac eithrio hynny [beirdd] sy'n credu wneud gweithredoedd cyfiawn cofio Allah yn aml a amddiffyn [y Moslemiaid] ar ôl yn eu cam. Ac mae rhai sydd wedi cam yn mynd i wybod i beth [math o] dychwelyd cânt eu dychwelyd.

trans-unit.source: Ta, Seen. These are the verses of the Qur'an and a clear Book
trans-unit.target: Dreth gyngo, gweld. Mae'r rhain yn y penillion y Qur'an a llyfr clir

trans-unit.source: As guidance and good tidings for the believers
trans-unit.target: Fel canllawiau a tidings da y credinwyr

trans-unit.source: Who establish prayer and give zakah, and of the Hereafter they are certain [in faith].
trans-unit.target: Sy'n sefydlu gweddi a rhoi zakah, ac o hyn ymlaen y maent yn rhai [mewn ffydd].

trans-unit.source: Indeed, for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have made pleasing to them their deeds, so they wander blindly.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, ar gyfer y rhai nad ydynt yn credu mewn o hyn ymlaen, yr ydym wedi gwneud eu gweithredoedd sy'n ddymunol iddynt, felly iddyn nhw grwydro ddall.

trans-unit.source: Those are the ones for whom there will be the worst of punishment, and in the Hereafter they are the greatest losers.
trans-unit.target: Dyma'r rhai am bwy fydd y gwaethaf o gosb, ac o hyn ymlaen y maent yn fwyaf ar eu colled.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, [O Muhammad], you receive the Qur'an from one Wise and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, [O Muhammad], byddwch yn derbyn y Qur'an gan un Wise a gwybod.

trans-unit.source: [Mention] when Moses said to his family, "Indeed, I have perceived a fire. I will bring you from there information or will bring you a burning torch that you may warm yourselves."
trans-unit.target: [Cyfeiriad] pan ddywedodd Moses at ei deulu, "yn wir, yr wyf o'r farn bod tân. I bydd yn dod â chi o wybodaeth yno neu bydd yn dod â chi ffagl llosgi y gall eich gynnes eich hunain."

trans-unit.source: But when he came to it, he was called, "Blessed is whoever is at the fire and whoever is around it. And exalted is Allah, Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Ond pan ddaeth ato, oedd iddo o'r enw, "bendithio yw pwy bynnag ar y tân a phwy bynnag o'i amgylch. Ac i'w mawrygu yn Allah, Arglwydd y byd.

trans-unit.source: O Moses, indeed it is I - Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise."
trans-unit.target: O Moses, yn wir yn I-Allah, Exalted yn efallai, yn y doeth.

trans-unit.source: And [he was told], "Throw down your staff." But when he saw it writhing as if it were a snake, he turned in flight and did not return. [Allah said], "O Moses, fear not. Indeed, in My presence the messengers do not fear.
trans-unit.target: A [dywedwyd wrtho], "daflu i lawr eich staff." Ond pan welodd ei writhing fel pe bai'n neidr, trodd yn hedfan ac ni ddychwelodd. [Dywedodd Allah,] "O Moses, ofn na. Yn wir, yn fy mhresenoldeb nid y negeswyr yn ofni.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, he who wrongs, then substitutes good after evil - indeed, I am Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Fel arall, ef a camweddau, wedyn disodli da ar ôl drygioni-yn wir, yr wyf yn Forgiving a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: And put your hand into the opening of your garment [at the breast]; it will come out white without disease. [These are] among the nine signs [you will take] to Pharaoh and his people. Indeed, they have been a people defiantly disobedient."
trans-unit.target: A rhowch eich llaw yn agor eich ddilledyn [yn y fron]; Bydd yn dod allan Gwyn heb clefyd. [Mae'r rhain] ymysg yr arwyddion naw [Byddwch yn cymryd] i Ffaro a ei bobl. Yn wir, maent wedi bod yn bobl defiantly anufudd."

trans-unit.source: But when there came to them Our visible signs, they said, "This is obvious magic."
trans-unit.target: Ond pan y deuai iddynt ein arwyddion gweladwy, dywedodd, "Dyma hud amlwg."

trans-unit.source: And they rejected them, while their [inner] selves were convinced thereof, out of injustice and haughtiness. So see how was the end of the corrupters.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn gwrthod iddynt, tra roedd eu hunain [mewnol] yn argyhoeddedig ohono, allan o anghyfiawnder a haughtiness. Felly weld sut yr oedd diwedd y corrupters.

trans-unit.source: And We had certainly given to David and Solomon knowledge, and they said, "Praise [is due] to Allah, who has favored us over many of His believing servants."
trans-unit.target: Ac yn sicr rydym wedi rhoi gwybodaeth David a Solomon, a dywedodd, "[yn] canmoliaeth i Allah, sydd wedi ffafriol ohonom dros lawer o'r ei weision believing."

trans-unit.source: And Solomon inherited David. He said, "O people, we have been taught the language of birds, and we have been given from all things. Indeed, this is evident bounty."
trans-unit.target: A etifeddodd Solomon David. Dywedodd, "O bobl, wedi cael eu haddysgu iaith adar, a roddwyd inni o'r holl bethau. Yn wir, dyma bounty amlwg.

trans-unit.source: And gathered for Solomon were his soldiers of the jinn and men and birds, and they were [marching] in rows.
trans-unit.target: Ac a gasglwyd ar gyfer Solomon oedd ei filwyr jinn a dynion a adar, a nhw oedd [yn gorymdeithio] yn rhesi.

trans-unit.source: Until, when they came upon the valley of the ants, an ant said, "O ants, enter your dwellings that you not be crushed by Solomon and his soldiers while they perceive not."
trans-unit.target: Tan pan ddaethant ar y Dyffryn o forgrug, morgrugyn yn dweud, "O forgrug, rhowch eich anheddau hynny ydych nid gwasgu gan Solomon a ei filwyr tra maent yn teimlo nad."

trans-unit.source: So [Solomon] smiled, amused at her speech, and said, "My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents and to do righteousness of which You approve. And admit me by Your mercy into [the ranks of] Your righteous servants."
trans-unit.target: Felly y mae [Solomon] gwenu, yn ddoniol yn ei haraith, a dywedodd, "fy Arglwydd, fy ngalluogi i fod yn ddiolchgar am eich favor a ydych wedi rhoi'r ar mi ac ar fy rhieni a chyfiawnder i cymeradwywch y. Ac mi gyfaddef gan eich drugaredd i [rhengoedd y] eich gweision hoes dabloid. "

trans-unit.source: And he took attendance of the birds and said, "Why do I not see the hoopoe - or is he among the absent?
trans-unit.target: A cymerodd presenoldeb yr adar a dweud, "Pam fi nid gweler y hoopoe-neu ef ymhlith y absennol?

trans-unit.source: I will surely punish him with a severe punishment or slaughter him unless he brings me clear authorization."
trans-unit.target: Rwy'n bydd siawns cosbi ef â chosbi difrifol neu ladd ef oni bai y daw ef mi awdurdodi clir.

trans-unit.source: But the hoopoe stayed not long and said, "I have encompassed [in knowledge] that which you have not encompassed, and I have come to you from Sheba with certain news.
trans-unit.target: Ond y hoopoe a arhosodd nid hir a dweud, "yr wyf yn cwmpasu [mewn gwybodaeth] a yr ydych nid yn cwmpasu, ac wedi dod i chi o Sheba gyda rhai newyddion.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, I found [there] a woman ruling them, and she has been given of all things, and she has a great throne.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, cefais [Mae] menyw dyfarniad iddynt, ac wedi cael yr holl bethau, ac mae ganddi Orsedd fawr.

trans-unit.source: I found her and her people prostrating to the sun instead of Allah, and Satan has made their deeds pleasing to them and averted them from [His] way, so they are not guided,
