trans-unit.target: Yr oedd hi a phobl ei prostrating i'r haul yn hytrach na Allah, a Satan wedi gwneud eu gweithredoedd yn dda iddynt ac osgoi iddynt o [ei] ffordd, felly nid yn eu harwain,

trans-unit.source: [And] so they do not prostrate to Allah, who brings forth what is hidden within the heavens and the earth and knows what you conceal and what you declare -
trans-unit.target: [A] felly nid ydynt yn gwneud prostrate i Allah, sy'n dod â blaen beth yn guddiedig o fewn y nefoedd a'r ddaear ac yn gwybod beth yr ydych yn ei guddio a beth yr ydych yn ei ddatgan-

trans-unit.source: Allah - there is no deity except Him, Lord of the Great Throne."
trans-unit.target: Allah-nid oes unrhyw Dduwdod ac eithrio ef, yr Arglwydd o'r Orsedd mawr."

trans-unit.source: [Solomon] said, "We will see whether you were truthful or were of the liars.
trans-unit.target: [Solomon] yn dweud, "Byddwn yn gweld chi a oedd eirwir neu a oedd y celwyddgwn.

trans-unit.source: Take this letter of mine and deliver it to them. Then leave them and see what [answer] they will return."
trans-unit.target: Gymryd y llythyr hwn o 'm hetholwyr a ei ddarparu iddynt. Yna gadael iddynt a gweld pa [ateb] byddant yn dychwelyd. "

trans-unit.source: She said, "O eminent ones, indeed, to me has been delivered a noble letter.
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "i mi mae O rai enwog, yn wir, wedi'i gyflwyno llythyr aruchel.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, it is from Solomon, and indeed, it reads: 'In the name of Allah, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful,
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, mae gan Solomon, ac yn wir, mae'n darllen: ' enw Allah, llwyr tosturiol, enwedig tosturiol,

trans-unit.source: Be not haughty with me but come to me in submission [as Muslims].' "
trans-unit.target: Fod nid Cymro'n gyda mi ond dod i mi yn y cyflwyniad [fel y Moslemiaid].' "

trans-unit.source: She said, "O eminent ones, advise me in my affair. I would not decide a matter until you witness [for] me."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "O rai enwog, yn fy nghynghori yn fy ddigwyddiad. Byddai nid yn penderfynu mater hyd nes y byddwch chi'n gweld [i] mi."

trans-unit.source: They said, "We are men of strength and of great military might, but the command is yours, so see what you will command."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, 'Rydym yn ddynion o gryfder a allai milwrol mawr, ond y Gorchymyn yn gywir, felly weld beth y bydd ei ennyn."

trans-unit.source: She said, "Indeed kings - when they enter a city, they ruin it and render the honored of its people humbled. And thus do they do.
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "yn wir brenhinoedd-pan fyddant yn dechrau yn ddinas, maent ei ddifetha a rendr honored ei phobl yn ostyngedig. Ac felly maent yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: But indeed, I will send to them a gift and see with what [reply] the messengers will return."
trans-unit.target: Ond yn wir, bydd yn anfon rhodd iddynt ac yn gweld pa [ateb] Bydd y negeswyr yn dychwelyd."

trans-unit.source: So when they came to Solomon, he said, "Do you provide me with wealth? But what Allah has given me is better than what He has given you. Rather, it is you who rejoice in your gift.
trans-unit.target: Felly pan y daethant i Solomon, meddai ef, "ydych chi'n darparu mi gyda Cyfoeth? Ond Allah wedi rhoi imi yn well na hyn wedi rhoi ichi. Yn hytrach, mae'n chi sy'n llawenhau yn eich rhodd.

trans-unit.source: Return to them, for we will surely come to them with soldiers that they will be powerless to encounter, and we will surely expel them therefrom in humiliation, and they will be debased."
trans-unit.target: Yn dychwelyd iddynt, bydd Rydym yn sicr yn dod atynt gyda milwyr y byddant yn ddi-rym i ddod ar eu traws, a bydd gennym siawns ddiarddel eu thelir yn sarhad, a bydd eu danseilio."

trans-unit.source: [Solomon] said, "O assembly [of jinn], which of you will bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?"
trans-unit.target: [Solomon] dywedodd, "O Cynulliad [o jinn], a chi fydd yn dwyn imi ei Orsedd cyn iddynt ddod i mi yn y cyflwyniad?"

trans-unit.source: A powerful one from among the jinn said, "I will bring it to you before you rise from your place, and indeed, I am for this [task] strong and trustworthy."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd un o blith y jinn, pwerus "bydd yn ei gyflwyno i chi cyn ichi godi eich lle, ac yr wyf yn wir, ar gyfer y dasg cryf a dibynadwy."

trans-unit.source: Said one who had knowledge from the Scripture, "I will bring it to you before your glance returns to you." And when [Solomon] saw it placed before him, he said, "This is from the favor of my Lord to test me whether I will be grateful or ungrateful. And whoever is grateful - his gratitude is only for [the benefit of] himself. And whoever is ungrateful - then indeed, my Lord is Free of need and Generous."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd un a oedd â gwybodaeth o'r ysgrythur, "fe'i cyflwynaf i chi cyn i chi ddychwelyd eich cipolwg." Pan welodd [Solomon] Rhoddodd cyn iddo, dywedodd, "Dyma o favor o fy Arglwydd i mi brofi a bydd yn ddiolchgar neu anniolchgar. A pwy bynnag ddiolchgar-ei ddiolchgarwch am yn unig [budd] ei hun. A phwy bynnag anniolchgar-yna yn wir, fy Arglwydd yn rhydd o angen a hael."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Disguise for her her throne; we will see whether she will be guided [to truth] or will be of those who is not guided."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "yn celu iddi ei Orsedd; Byddwn yn gweld hi a bydd yn llywio [i gwir] neu fydd y rhai sydd yn eu harwain ni."

trans-unit.source: So when she arrived, it was said [to her], "Is your throne like this?" She said, "[It is] as though it was it." [Solomon said], "And we were given knowledge before her, and we have been Muslims [in submission to Allah].
trans-unit.target: Felly pan gyrhaeddodd, dywedwyd bod [iddi], "Yn eich Orsedd fel hyn?" Dywedodd hi, "[Mae'n] fel pe bai'n ei." [Dywedodd Solomon,] "a rhoddwyd gwybodaeth cyn iddi, ac yr ydym wedi Moslemiaid [yn y cyflwyniad i Allah].

trans-unit.source: And that which she was worshipping other than Allah had averted her [from submission to Him]. Indeed, she was from a disbelieving people."
trans-unit.target: Ac yr oedd iddi addoli eraill na Allah wedi osgoi hi [gan gyflwyno iddo]. Yn wir, hi oedd gan bobl disbelieving."

trans-unit.source: She was told, "Enter the palace." But when she saw it, she thought it was a body of water and uncovered her shins [to wade through]. He said, "Indeed, it is a palace [whose floor is] made smooth with glass." She said, "My Lord, indeed I have wronged myself, and I submit with Solomon to Allah, Lord of the worlds."
trans-unit.target: Dywedwyd wrthi, "Rhowch y palas." Ond pan welodd ei, roedd hi'n meddwl oedd corff o ddŵr a datgelu ei grimog [i ymlafnio drwy'r]. Dywedodd, "yn wir, mae'n Palas [yn eu llawr] gwneud esmwyth gyda gwydr." Meddai, "fy Arglwydd, yn wir wedi cam ar fy hun, ac awgrymaf gyda Solomon i Allah, Arglwydd y byd.

trans-unit.source: And We had certainly sent to Thamud their brother Salih, [saying], "Worship Allah," and at once they were two parties conflicting.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn sicr roedd Rydym yn anfon eu Thamud eu brawd Salih, [dweud], "Addoli Allah," ac ar unwaith yn ddwy blaid sy'n gwrthdaro.

trans-unit.source: He said, "O my people, why are you impatient for evil instead of good? Why do you not seek forgiveness of Allah that you may receive mercy?"
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "O fy pobl, pam yr ydych yn ddiamynedd i ddrygioni yn hytrach na da? Pam nid ydych yn ceisio maddeuant Allah y gallech dderbyn drugaredd?"

trans-unit.source: They said, "We consider you a bad omen, you and those with you." He said, "Your omen is with Allah. Rather, you are a people being tested."
trans-unit.target: Maent yn dweud, "credwn ichi beth drwg, chi, a'r rhai gyda chi." Meddai, "yn eich beth ag Allah. Yn hytrach, yr ydych yn bobl yn cael eu profi."

trans-unit.source: And there were in the city nine family heads causing corruption in the land and not amending [its affairs].
trans-unit.target: Ac roedd penaethiaid teulu naw achosi llygredd yn y tir ac nid diwygio [ei faterion] yn y ddinas.

trans-unit.source: They said, "Take a mutual oath by Allah that we will kill him by night, he and his family. Then we will say to his executor, 'We did not witness the destruction of his family, and indeed, we are truthful.' "
trans-unit.target: Maent yn dweud, "yn cymryd llw cydfuddiannol gan Allah y bydd ei ladd gan nos, ef a'i deulu. Yna bydd yn dweud i ei ysgutor, 'nad oeddem yn dyst yn dinistrio ei deulu, ac yn wir, yr ydym yn dweud y gwir.' "

trans-unit.source: And they planned a plan, and We planned a plan, while they perceived not.
trans-unit.target: Ac roeddent yn cynllunio cynllun, ac rydym yn cynllunio cynllun, tra eu bod yn credu nad.

trans-unit.source: Then look how was the outcome of their plan - that We destroyed them and their people, all.
trans-unit.target: Yna edrych sut yr oedd y canlyniad eu cynllun-bod yn dinistrio eu ac eu pobl, bob.

trans-unit.source: So those are their houses, desolate because of the wrong they had done. Indeed in that is a sign for people who know.
trans-unit.target: Felly mae rhai yn eu tai, llwm oherwydd y anghywir wedi gwneud. Yn wir yn hynny yn arwydd i bobl sydd yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: And We saved those who believed and used to fear Allah.
trans-unit.target: A ydym yn arbed rhai sydd yn credu a ddefnyddir i ofni Allah.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] Lot, when he said to his people, "Do you commit immorality while you are seeing?
trans-unit.target: [Yn sôn am] llawer, pan ddywedodd ei bobl, "a ydych yn ymrwymo'r anfoesoldeb tra yr ydych yn gweld?

trans-unit.source: Do you indeed approach men with desire instead of women? Rather, you are a people behaving ignorantly."
trans-unit.target: Yn wir chi agwedd dynion ag awydd yn hytrach na menywod? Yn hytrach, yr ydych yn bobl sy'n ymddwyn yn ignorantly."

trans-unit.source: But the answer of his people was not except that they said, "Expel the family of Lot from your city. Indeed, they are people who keep themselves pure."
trans-unit.target: Ond yr oedd yr ateb ei bobl nid heblaw y maent yn dweud, "Expel y teulu o lawer gan eich dinas. Yn wir, maent yn bobl sy'n cadw eu hunain yn pur."

trans-unit.source: So We saved him and his family, except for his wife; We destined her to be of those who remained behind.
trans-unit.target: Felly yr ydym yn arbed iddo ef a'i deulu, ac eithrio ei wraig; Rydym yn tynghedu iddi fod yn rhai sy'n aros ar ôl.

trans-unit.source: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones], and evil was the rain of those who were warned.
trans-unit.target: Ac rydym yn bwrw glaw arnynt glaw [o gerrig], a drygioni oedd y glaw o'r rheini a oedd yn rhybuddio.

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "Praise be to Allah, and peace upon His servants whom He has chosen. Is Allah better or what they associate with Him?"
trans-unit.target: Dweud, [O Muhammad], "canmoliaeth yn Allah, a heddwch ar ei weision ef a ddewiswyd ganddo. Yw Allah gwell neu beth maent cysylltiol ag ef?

trans-unit.source: [More precisely], is He [not best] who created the heavens and the earth and sent down for you rain from the sky, causing to grow thereby gardens of joyful beauty which you could not [otherwise] have grown the trees thereof? Is there a deity with Allah? [No], but they are a people who ascribe equals [to Him].
trans-unit.target: [Fwy union], mae ef [nid gorau] sy'n creu y nefoedd a'r ddaear a anfonwyd i lawr ar gyfer mae bwrw glaw o'r awyr, yn peri i dyfu gerddi o harddwch llawen a allech felly [fel arall] wedi tyfu coed ohono? A oes Dduwdod ag Allah? [Na], ond eu bod yn bobl sy'n priodoli equals [iddo ef].

trans-unit.source: Is He [not best] who made the earth a stable ground and placed within it rivers and made for it firmly set mountains and placed between the two seas a barrier? Is there a deity with Allah? [No], but most of them do not know.
trans-unit.target: Ef [nid gorau] a wnaeth y ddaear Sefydlog ddaear a gosod o fewn ei afonydd a wnaed ar gyfer ei gadarn yn gosod mynyddoedd a gosod rhwystr rhwng y ddwy moroedd? A oes Dduwdod ag Allah? [Na], ond nid rhan fwyaf ohonynt yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: Is He [not best] who responds to the desperate one when he calls upon Him and removes evil and makes you inheritors of the earth? Is there a deity with Allah? Little do you remember.
trans-unit.target: Mae ef [nid gorau] sy'n ymateb i'r un dybryd pan yn galw arno a dileu'r drwg ac yn gwneud i chi etifeddu y ddaear? A oes Dduwdod ag Allah? Ychydig a ydych yn cofio.

trans-unit.source: Is He [not best] who guides you through the darknesses of the land and sea and who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy? Is there a deity with Allah? High is Allah above whatever they associate with Him.
trans-unit.target: Mae ef [nid gorau] sydd yn eich tywys chi drwy y darknesses y tir a'r môr ac sydd yn anfon y gwyntoedd fel tidings da cyn ei drugaredd? A oes Dduwdod ag Allah? Uchel yw Allah uchod beth bynnag maent cysylltiol ag ef.

trans-unit.source: Is He [not best] who begins creation and then repeats it and who provides for you from the heaven and earth? Is there a deity with Allah? Say, "Produce your proof, if you should be truthful."
trans-unit.target: Yn ei [nid gorau] sydd yn dechrau creu a wedyn yn ailadrodd ei a phwy sy'n darparu i chi gan y nefoedd a'r ddaear? A oes Dduwdod ag Allah? Dweud, "Gynhyrchu eich prawf, os dylai fod yn onest."

trans-unit.source: Say, "None in the heavens and earth knows the unseen except Allah, and they do not perceive when they will be resurrected."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "ni wyr yr un yn y nefoedd a'r ddaear unseen ac eithrio Allah, ac nad oeddent yn gweld pan maent yn atgyfodi."

trans-unit.source: Rather, their knowledge is arrested concerning the Hereafter. Rather, they are in doubt about it. Rather, they are, concerning it, blind.
trans-unit.target: Yn hytrach, bod eu gwybodaeth yn cael ei atal yn ymwneud ag y o hyn ymlaen. Yn hytrach, maent yn amheuaeth yn ei gylch. Yn hytrach, maent yn destun pryder iddo, yn ddall.

trans-unit.source: And those who disbelieve say, "When we have become dust as well as our forefathers, will we indeed be brought out [of the graves]?
trans-unit.target: A rhai a chredu yn dweud, "pan rydym wedi dod yn llwch yn ogystal â ein cyndeidiau, yr ydym yn wir ddaw [o feddau]?

trans-unit.source: We have been promised this, we and our forefathers, before. This is not but legends of the former peoples."
trans-unit.target: Addawyd hyn, inni ac yn ein cyndadau, o'r blaen. Nid yw hyn ond chwedlau o bobloedd gynt."

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "Travel through the land and observe how was the end of the criminals."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, [O Muhammad], "yn teithio drwy y tir ac arsylwi sut oedd diwedd y troseddwyr.

trans-unit.source: And grieve not over them or be in distress from what they conspire.
trans-unit.target: A grieve nid drostynt neu fod mewn trallod o'r hyn mae eu cynllwynio.

trans-unit.source: And they say, "When is [the fulfillment of] this promise, if you should be truthful?"
trans-unit.target: Ac maent yn dweud, "pan [flawd o] hwn addewid, os dylai fod yn eirwir?"

trans-unit.source: Say, "Perhaps it is close behind you - some of that for which you are impatient.
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "efallai ei bod yn agos tu ôl i chi-rhai o'r eich bod yn dyheu amdanynt.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, your Lord is full of bounty for the people, but most of them do not show gratitude."
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, eich Arglwydd yn llawn bounty ar gyfer pobl, ond nid rhan fwyaf ohonynt yn dangos gwerthfawrogiad."

trans-unit.source: And indeed, your Lord knows what their breasts conceal and what they declare.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, mae eich Arglwydd yn gwybod beth a guddio eu bronnau a beth y maent yn ei ddatgan.

trans-unit.source: And there is nothing concealed within the heaven and the earth except that it is in a clear Register.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oedd dim yn cuddio o fewn y nefoedd a'r ddaear ac eithrio ei fod mewn cofrestr clir.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, this Qur'an relates to the Children of Israel most of that over which they disagree.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, Mae'r Qur'an hwn yn ymwneud â plant Israel rhan fwyaf y dros y maent yn anghytuno.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, it is guidance and mercy for the believers.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, mae'r canllawiau a'r drugaredd y credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, your Lord will judge between them by His [wise] judgement. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, bydd eich Arglwydd yn barnu rhwng iddynt gan ei ddyfarniad [doeth]. Ac ef yw Exalted yn gwybod y gallai.

trans-unit.source: So rely upon Allah; indeed, you are upon the clear truth.
trans-unit.target: Felly yn dibynnu ar Allah; yn wir, yr ydych yn y gwirionedd clir.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, you will not make the dead hear, nor will you make the deaf hear the call when they have turned their backs retreating.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, ni wnewch hear marw, nac y byddwch yn gwneud y byddar yn clywed yr alwad pan maent wedi troi eu cefnau encilio.

trans-unit.source: And you cannot guide the blind away from their error. You will only make hear those who believe in Our verses so they are Muslims [submitting to Allah].
trans-unit.target: A ni ellir eich tywys y Deillion i ffwrdd oddi wrth eu gwall. A wnewch dim ond clywed rhai sy'n credu yn ein penillion fel eu bod yn Foslemiaid [cyflwyno i Allah].

trans-unit.source: And when the word befalls them, We will bring forth for them a creature from the earth speaking to them, [saying] that the people were, of Our verses, not certain [in faith].
trans-unit.target: A pan mae y gair yn befalls iddynt, byddwn yn cyflwyno iddynt greadur o'r ddaear a siarad â nhw, [dweud] bod y bobl yn ein penillion, nid rhai [mewn ffydd].

trans-unit.source: And [warn of] the Day when We will gather from every nation a company of those who deny Our signs, and they will be [driven] in rows
trans-unit.target: A [rhybuddio] y dydd pan fydd yn ei chasglu gan bob cenedl cwmni o'r rhai sydd yn gwadu ein arwyddion, ac maent [gyrrir] yn rhesi

trans-unit.source: Until, when they arrive [at the place of Judgement], He will say, "Did you deny My signs while you encompassed them not in knowledge, or what [was it that] you were doing?"
trans-unit.target: Hyd nes y, pan fyddant yn cyrraedd [yn y lle o barn], bydd yn dweud, "oedd wadu fy arwyddion tra roedd yn cwmpasu iddynt mewn gwybodaeth, na beth [oedd a] ydych yn ei wneud?"

trans-unit.source: And the decree will befall them for the wrong they did, and they will not [be able to] speak.
trans-unit.target: A fydd yr ordinhad yn digwydd iddynt am y drwg a wnaethant, ac ni wnânt [yn gallu] siarad.

trans-unit.source: Do they not see that We made the night that they may rest therein and the day giving sight? Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.
trans-unit.target: Nid ydynt yn gweld ein bod wedi gwneud y noson y gall fyddant yn weithredol ac yn y dydd yn rhoi golwg? Yn wir yn hynny yn arwyddion ar gyfer pobl sydd yn credu.

trans-unit.source: And [warn of] the Day the Horn will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth will be terrified except whom Allah wills. And all will come to Him humbled.
trans-unit.target: A [rhybuddio] y dydd bydd chwythu y corn, a bwy bynnag sydd yn y nefoedd a bydd bwy bynnag sydd ar y ddaear yn brawychu ac eithrio bwy mae wills Allah. A bydd pob un yn dod ato yn ostyngedig.

trans-unit.source: And you see the mountains, thinking them rigid, while they will pass as the passing of clouds. [It is] the work of Allah, who perfected all things. Indeed, He is Acquainted with that which you do.
trans-unit.target: A ydych yn gweld y mynyddoedd, meddwl iddynt yn anhyblyg, tra bydd eu pasio fel pasio cymylau. [Mae'n] gwaith Allah, a holl bethau ei berffeithio. Yn wir, yw ei fod yn gyfarwydd â hynny a ydych.

trans-unit.source: Whoever comes [at Judgement] with a good deed will have better than it, and they, from the terror of that Day, will be safe.
trans-unit.target: Bwy bynnag a ddaw [ar dyfarniad] gyda gweithred dda bydd wedi gwell nag ydyw, a rhag terfysg y diwrnod hwnnw, byddant, yn ddiogel.

trans-unit.source: And whoever comes with an evil deed - their faces will be overturned into the Fire, [and it will be said], "Are you recompensed except for what you used to do?"
trans-unit.target: Pwy bynnag sy'n dod gyda'r weithred anfad-bydd gwrthdroi eu hwynebau yn tân [a bydd rhai yn dweud], "Yn eich had-dalu ac eithrio beth yr ydych yn ei defnyddio i wneud?"

trans-unit.source: [Say, O Muhammad], "I have only been commanded to worship the Lord of this city, who made it sacred and to whom [belongs] all things. And I am commanded to be of the Muslims [those who submit to Allah]
trans-unit.target: [Dweud, Muhammad O], "dim ond wedi yr wyf wedi'i enillodd i addoli yr Arglwydd y ddinas hon, sy'n ei gwneud yn sanctaidd, ac i bwy [perthyn] holl bethau. Ac yr wyf yr enillodd yn y Moslemiaid [y rheini sydd yn cyflwyno i Allah]

trans-unit.source: And to recite the Qur'an." And whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] himself; and whoever strays - say, "I am only [one] of the warners."
trans-unit.target: Ac adrodd y Qur'an. A dim ond mae pwy bynnag sy'n cael ei arwain dan arweiniad ar gyfer [budd] ei hun; a pwy bynnag crwydro-dweud, "I am unig [un] y warners."

trans-unit.source: And say, "[All] praise is [due] to Allah. He will show you His signs, and you will recognize them. And your Lord is not unaware of what you do."
trans-unit.target: A dweud, "canmoliaeth [bob] [] i Allah. Bydd ef yn dangos arwyddion ei, a bydd yn eu hadnabod. Ac nid yw eich Arglwydd yn ymwybodol o'r hyn yr ydych yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: Ta, Seen, Meem.
trans-unit.target: Dreth gyngo, gweld, Meem.

trans-unit.source: These are the verses of the clear Book.
trans-unit.target: Mae'r rhain yn y penillion y llyfr clir.

trans-unit.source: We recite to you from the news of Moses and Pharaoh in truth for a people who believe.
trans-unit.target: Inni adrodd i chi gan y newyddion am Moses a Ffaro mewn gwirionedd ar gyfer pobl sydd yn credu.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Pharaoh exalted himself in the land and made its people into factions, oppressing a sector among them, slaughtering their [newborn] sons and keeping their females alive. Indeed, he was of the corrupters.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, mae Ffaro exalted ei hun yn y tir a gwneud ei phobl i garfanau, yn gorthrymu y sector yn eu plith, lladd eu meibion [newydd-anedig] a cadw eu benywod yn fyw. Yn wir, ef oedd y corrupters.

trans-unit.source: And We wanted to confer favor upon those who were oppressed in the land and make them leaders and make them inheritors
trans-unit.target: Ac roeddem eisiau rhoi favor ar y rhai sy'n eu gormesu yn y tir a sicrhau eu bod yn arweinwyr a'u gwneud yn etifeddu

trans-unit.source: And establish them in the land and show Pharaoh and [his minister] Haman and their soldiers through them that which they had feared.
trans-unit.target: A sefydlu iddynt yn y tir a dangos Ffaro a [ei Weinidog] Haman a eu milwyr drwy iddynt a oedd eu bod yn ofni.

trans-unit.source: And We inspired to the mother of Moses, "Suckle him; but when you fear for him, cast him into the river and do not fear and do not grieve. Indeed, We will return him to you and will make him [one] of the messengers."
trans-unit.target: Ac yn ein hysbrydoli i mam Moses, "yn sugno iddo; ond pan eich bod yn ofni iddo, bwrw ef i'r afon ac nid ofni a wneud nid galaru. Yn wir, ein bydd iddo ddychwelyd i chi ac yn gwneud iddo [un] am y negeswyr."

trans-unit.source: And the family of Pharaoh picked him up [out of the river] so that he would become to them an enemy and a [cause of] grief. Indeed, Pharaoh and Haman and their soldiers were deliberate sinners.
trans-unit.target: Ac roedd y teulu o Ffaro sylwi iddo [allan o'r afon] fel y byddai ef yn dod iddynt yn elyn a galar [achos]. Yn wir, Ffaro a Haman a eu milwyr yn fwriadol pechaduriaid.

trans-unit.source: And the wife of Pharaoh said, "[He will be] a comfort of the eye for me and for you. Do not kill him; perhaps he may benefit us, or we may adopt him as a son." And they perceived not.
trans-unit.target: A gwraig Ffaro a dweud, "[fydd] cysur y llygad i mi ac i chi. Nid oes lladd ef; Efallai gall fod o fudd inni, neu efallai inni fabwysiadu iddo fel mab. Ac eu bod yn credu nad.

trans-unit.source: And the heart of Moses' mother became empty [of all else]. She was about to disclose [the matter concerning] him had We not bound fast her heart that she would be of the believers.
trans-unit.target: A daeth y galon mam Moses' gwag [o bawb arall]. Roedd hi ar fin datgelu [ynghylch mater] ef nid ydym wedi rhwymo cyflym ei galon y byddai hi'n y credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: And she said to his sister, "Follow him"; so she watched him from a distance while they perceived not.
trans-unit.target: A dywedodd hi at ei chwaer, "Dilyn ef"; Felly gwyliodd ef o bell tra eu bod yn credu nad.

trans-unit.source: And We had prevented from him [all] wet nurses before, so she said, "Shall I direct you to a household that will be responsible for him for you while they are to him [for his upbringing] sincere?"
trans-unit.target: Ac wedi ein hatal rhag iddo Mae [holl] gwlyb nyrsys cyn, fel y dywedodd, "Bydd eich cyfeirio i aelwyd a fydd yn gyfrifol am iddo i chi tra maent iddo [am ei fagwraeth] ddiffuant?"

trans-unit.source: So We restored him to his mother that she might be content and not grieve and that she would know that the promise of Allah is true. But most of the people do not know.
trans-unit.target: Felly rydym yn adfer iddo i fam a allai hi fod yn fodlon a nid galaru ac y byddai hi'n gwybod bod addewid y bydd Allah yn wir. Ond nid rhan fwyaf o bobl yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: And when he attained his full strength and was [mentally] mature, We bestowed upon him judgement and knowledge. And thus do We reward the doers of good.
trans-unit.target: A pan mae'n cyrraedd ei gryfder llawn ac yn aeddfed [feddyliol], dod inni i'w barn a gwybodaeth. Ac felly nid ydym yn gwobrwyo phoenwn da.

trans-unit.source: And he entered the city at a time of inattention by its people and found therein two men fighting: one from his faction and one from among his enemy. And the one from his faction called for help to him against the one from his enemy, so Moses struck him and [unintentionally] killed him. [Moses] said, "This is from the work of Satan. Indeed, he is a manifest, misleading enemy."
trans-unit.target: A gofnodir y ddinas ar adeg o ddim cymryd sylw gan ei bobl ef a geir ynddo dau ddyn yn ymladd: un o garfan ei ac un o blith ei elyn. Ac un o garfan ei galw am help iddo erbyn yr un o ei elyn, felly mae Moses yn daro ac [anfwriadol] ladd ef. [Moses] yn dweud, "Mae hwn o waith Satan. Yn wir, mae'n amlwg, yn gamarweiniol gelyn."

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, indeed I have wronged myself, so forgive me," and He forgave him. Indeed, He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "Fy Arglwydd, yn wir yr wyf yn cam fy hun, felly maddeuwch i mi", a dywedodd ei fod yn forgave iddo. Yn wir, ei fod yn y Forgiving, y Merciful.

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, for the favor You bestowed upon me, I will never be an assistant to the criminals."
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "Fy Arglwydd, ar gyfer y favor Roedd chi roi i mi, bydd byth yn gynorthwy-ydd i y troseddwyr."

trans-unit.source: And he became inside the city fearful and anticipating [exposure], when suddenly the one who sought his help the previous day cried out to him [once again]. Moses said to him, "Indeed, you are an evident, [persistent] deviator."
trans-unit.target: A daeth tu mewn y ddinas ofnus a rhagweld [amlygiad], pan yn sydyn Roedd un sy'n gofyn am ei gymorth y diwrnod blaenorol crio iddo [unwaith eto]. Dywedodd Moses wrtho, "yn wir, byddwch yn deviator amlwg, [parhaus]."

trans-unit.source: And when he wanted to strike the one who was an enemy to both of them, he said, "O Moses, do you intend to kill me as you killed someone yesterday? You only want to be a tyrant in the land and do not want to be of the amenders."
trans-unit.target: A pan fod am streic yr un a oedd yn elyn i'r ddau ohonynt, dywedodd, "O Moses, ydych yn bwriadu lladd fi fel yr ydych wedi lladd rhywun ddoe? Mae chi dim ond am fod tyrant yn y tir ac nid am fod y amenders."

trans-unit.source: And a man came from the farthest end of the city, running. He said, "O Moses, indeed the eminent ones are conferring over you [intending] to kill you, so leave [the city]; indeed, I am to you of the sincere advisors."
trans-unit.target: A daeth dyn o'r pen pella y ddinas, yn rhedeg. Dywedodd, "Moses O, yn wir yr enwog yn rhai sy'n rhoi dros chi [bwriadu] lladd chi, felly adael [y ddinas]; yn wir, yr wyf y cynghorwyr diffuant atoch."

trans-unit.source: So he left it, fearful and anticipating [apprehension]. He said, "My Lord, save me from the wrongdoing people."
trans-unit.target: Felly y gadawodd ei, ofnus a ragweld [restio]. Meddai, "Fy Arglwydd, fy arbed rhag y bobl gamwedd."

trans-unit.source: And when he directed himself toward Madyan, he said, "Perhaps my Lord will guide me to the sound way."
trans-unit.target: A pan roedd yn cyfeirio ei hun tuag at Madyan, dywedodd, "bydd efallai fy Arglwydd canllaw mi y ffordd gadarn."

trans-unit.source: And when he came to the well of Madyan, he found there a crowd of people watering [their flocks], and he found aside from them two women driving back [their flocks]. He said, "What is your circumstance?" They said, "We do not water until the shepherds dispatch [their flocks]; and our father is an old man."
trans-unit.target: A pan ddaeth i dda o Madyan, canfu yno dorf o bobl a dyfrio [eu diadellau], ac ei chael ar wahân iddynt dwy fenyw yrru yn ôl [eu diadellau]. Dywedodd, "Beth yw eich amgylchiadau?" Dywedodd, "a ydym nid dŵr hyd nes y mae y bugail yn anfon [eu diadellau]; a thad ein hen ddyn.

trans-unit.source: So he watered [their flocks] for them; then he went back to the shade and said, "My Lord, indeed I am, for whatever good You would send down to me, in need."
trans-unit.target: Felly roedd ganddo dŵr [eu diadellau] ar eu cyfer; Yna aeth yn ôl i gysgod a dweud, "Fy Arglwydd, yn wir yr wyf, ar gyfer beth bynnag da fyddai eich anfon i lawr i mi, mewn angen."

trans-unit.source: Then one of the two women came to him walking with shyness. She said, "Indeed, my father invites you that he may reward you for having watered for us." So when he came to him and related to him the story, he said, "Fear not. You have escaped from the wrongdoing people."
trans-unit.target: Yna daeth un o ferched dau iddo gerdded gyda swildod. Meddai, "Yn wir, mae fy nhad yn gwahodd chi y gallai eich gwobrwyo ar gyfer cael dŵr i ni." Felly pan ddaeth ato a sy'n gysylltiedig ag ef y stori, meddai ef, "ofni nad. Yr ydych wedi dianc o bobl gamwedd."

trans-unit.source: One of the women said, "O my father, hire him. Indeed, the best one you can hire is the strong and the trustworthy."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd un o'r merched, "O fy nhad, llogi ef. Yn wir, yr un gorau, gallwch logi yn cryf ac y gellir ymddiried ynddo."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Indeed, I wish to wed you one of these, my two daughters, on [the condition] that you serve me for eight years; but if you complete ten, it will be [as a favor] from you. And I do not wish to put you in difficulty. You will find me, if Allah wills, from among the righteous."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "yn wir, yr wyf yn dymuno dydd Mercher chi un o'r rhain, fy ddwy ferch, ar [y cyflwr] y maent yn gwasanaethu mi am wyth mlynedd; ond os ydych yn llenwi deg, bydd yn [fel favor] oddi wrthych. Ac nid wyf am eich rhoi mewn anhawster. Gwelwch fi, os bydd Allah yn wills, o blith y righteous."

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "That is [established] between me and you. Whichever of the two terms I complete - there is no injustice to me, and Allah, over what we say, is Witness."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd [Moses], "y mae [sefydlu] rhwng fi a chi. Pa un bynnag o'r ddau dymor I gwblhau'r-nid oes unrhyw anghyfiawnder i mi, a Allah, dros beth yr ydym yn ei ddweud, yn dyst."

trans-unit.source: And when Moses had completed the term and was traveling with his family, he perceived from the direction of the mount a fire. He said to his family, "Stay here; indeed, I have perceived a fire. Perhaps I will bring you from there [some] information or burning wood from the fire that you may warm yourselves."
trans-unit.target: Ac ef pan oedd Moses yn cwblhau y tymor ac yn teithio gyda ei deulu, roedd canfyddiad o gyfeiriad y mount tân. Dywedodd ei deulu, "aros yma; yn wir, wedi i canfyddiad bod tân. Efallai deuaf ydych oddi yno [rai] gwybodaeth neu llosgi coed rhag tân y gall eich gynnes eich hunain."

trans-unit.source: But when he came to it, he was called from the right side of the valley in a blessed spot - from the tree, "O Moses, indeed I am Allah, Lord of the worlds."
trans-unit.target: Ond pan ddaeth ato, iddo gael ei alw o'r ochr dde y Cwm yn y fan a'r lle Bendigaid-o'r goeden, 'O Moses, yn wir I 'm Allah, Arglwydd y byd.'

trans-unit.source: And [he was told], "Throw down your staff." But when he saw it writhing as if it was a snake, he turned in flight and did not return. [Allah said], "O Moses, approach and fear not. Indeed, you are of the secure.
trans-unit.target: A [dywedwyd wrtho], "daflu i lawr eich staff." Ond pan welodd ei writhing fel pe bai neidr, trodd yn hedfan ac ni ddychwelodd. [Dywedodd Allah], "Mae O Moses, ymagwedd a ofni nad. Yn wir, yr ydych yn ddiogel.

trans-unit.source: Insert your hand into the opening of your garment; it will come out white, without disease. And draw in your arm close to you [as prevention] from fear, for those are two proofs from your Lord to Pharaoh and his establishment. Indeed, they have been a people defiantly disobedient."
trans-unit.target: Rhowch eich llaw yn agor eich dilledyn; Bydd yn dod allan Gwyn, heb clefyd. Ac yn tynnu yn eich braich agos atoch [fel atal] gan ofn, ar gyfer rheini yn ddau proflenni gan eich Arglwydd Ffaro a ei sefydlu. Yn wir, maent wedi bod yn bobl defiantly anufudd."

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, indeed, I killed from among them someone, and I fear they will kill me.
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "fy Arglwydd, yn wir, fy lladd o blith eu rhywun, ac ofnaf y byddant yn eu lladd fi.

trans-unit.source: And my brother Aaron is more fluent than me in tongue, so send him with me as support, verifying me. Indeed, I fear that they will deny me."
trans-unit.target: A fy mrawd Aaron yn fwy rhugl na mi yn tafod, felly anfon ato gyda mi fel cymorth, mi dilysu. Yn wir, mae arnaf ofn y bydd gwrthod mi."

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "We will strengthen your arm through your brother and grant you both supremacy so they will not reach you. [It will be] through Our signs; you and those who follow you will be the predominant."
trans-unit.target: [Allah] dywedodd, "Bydd inni gryfhau eich braich drwy eich brawd a grant chi ddau goruchafiaeth felly ni fyddant yn cyrraedd eich. [Fydd] drwy ein arwyddion; chi a'r rhai sy'n eich dilyn fydd y gryfaf."

trans-unit.source: But when Moses came to them with Our signs as clear evidences, they said, "This is not except invented magic, and we have not heard of this [religion] among our forefathers."
trans-unit.target: Ond pan Moses ddaeth iddynt ein arwyddion yn dangos yn glir, dywedodd, "Nid yw hyn ac eithrio ddyfeisio'n hud, ac nid ydym wedi clywed hwn [crefydd] ymysg ein cyndadau."

trans-unit.source: And Moses said, "My Lord is more knowing [than we or you] of who has come with guidance from Him and to whom will be succession in the home. Indeed, wrongdoers do not succeed."
trans-unit.target: A Moses a ddywedodd, "fy Arglwydd yn gwybod mwy [nag ydym neu chi] o pwy sydd wedi dod â chanllawiau oddi wrtho a phwy fydd yn olynu yn y cartref. Yn wir, tramgwyddo na fyddant yn llwyddo."

trans-unit.source: And Pharaoh said, "O eminent ones, I have not known you to have a god other than me. Then ignite for me, O Haman, [a fire] upon the clay and make for me a tower that I may look at the God of Moses. And indeed, I do think he is among the liars."
trans-unit.target: A Ffaro a dywedodd, "O rai enwog, wedi yn anhysbys i chi gael Duw heblaw fi. Yna ignite i mi, O Haman, [tân] ar y clai, a gwneud i mi Tŵr y gall edrych ar Duw Moses. Ac yn wir, a yn credu ei fod yn ymhlith y celwyddgwn.

trans-unit.source: And he was arrogant, he and his soldiers, in the land, without right, and they thought that they would not be returned to Us.
trans-unit.target: Ac yr oedd yn drahaus, ef a ei milwyr, yn y tir, heb hawl, ac yn credu y byddai iddynt ddychwelyd i ni.

trans-unit.source: So We took him and his soldiers and threw them into the sea. So see how was the end of the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Felly cymerodd ef a ei filwyr, ac eu taflu i'r môr. Felly weld sut yr oedd diwedd y tramgwyddo.

trans-unit.source: And We made them leaders inviting to the Fire, and on the Day of Resurrection they will not be helped.
trans-unit.target: A gwnaethom wahodd y tân, ac ar dydd atgyfodi a byddant yn cael help nid arweinwyr.

trans-unit.source: And We caused to overtake them in this world a curse, and on the Day of Resurrection they will be of the despised.
trans-unit.target: Ac rydym yn achosi iddynt oddiweddyd yn y byd hwn, yn felltith, ac ar ddiwrnod yr atgyfodiad byddant o y gadwyni.

trans-unit.source: And We gave Moses the Scripture, after We had destroyed the former generations, as enlightenment for the people and guidance and mercy that they might be reminded.
trans-unit.target: A rhoesom Moses yr ysgrythur, ar ôl inni wedi dinistrio y cenedlaethau blaenorol, fel eglurhad ar gyfer y bobl a'r canllawiau a'r drugaredd y gellid eu hatgoffa.

trans-unit.source: And you, [O Muhammad], were not on the western side [of the mount] when We revealed to Moses the command, and you were not among the witnesses [to that].
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oedd chi, [O Muhammad], ar ochr orllewinol [mount] pan datgelasom i Moses y Gorchymyn, ac nad oeddech ymysg y tystion [i].

trans-unit.source: But We produced [many] generations [after Moses], and prolonged was their duration. And you were not a resident among the people of Madyan, reciting to them Our verses, but We were senders [of this message].
trans-unit.target: Ond cynhyrchwyd gennym genedlaethau [llawer o] [ar ôl Moses], ac estynedig yn eu para. Ac nid oeddech yn byw ymysg pobl Madyan, adrodd iddynt ein penillion, ond roeddem yn anfonwyr [ar y neges hon].

trans-unit.source: And you were not at the side of the mount when We called [Moses] but [were sent] as a mercy from your Lord to warn a people to whom no warner had come before you that they might be reminded.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oeddech ar ochr y mount pan ydym o'r enw [Moses] ond [Anfonwyd] fel drugaredd oddi wrth eich Arglwydd i rybuddio pobl i bwy roedd unrhyw warner yn dod ger eich bron y gellid eu hatgoffa.

trans-unit.source: And if not that a disaster should strike them for what their hands put forth [of sins] and they would say, "Our Lord, why did You not send us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses and been among the believers?"...
trans-unit.target: Ac os nid y dylai trychineb streic iddynt ar gyfer eu dwylo pa rhoi blaen [o bechodau] a byddai dweud, "Ein Arglwydd, pam oedd na anfonwch atom negesydd felly gallem wedi dilyn eich penillion ac ymhlith y credinwyr?" ...

trans-unit.source: But when the truth came to them from Us, they said, "Why was he not given like that which was given to Moses?" Did they not disbelieve in that which was given to Moses before? They said, "[They are but] two works of magic supporting each other, and indeed we are, in both, disbelievers."
trans-unit.target: Ond pan ddaeth y gwir iddynt oddi wrthym ni, dywedodd, "pam na rhoddwyd iddo fel hynny a roddwyd i Moses?" Oedd iddynt na chredu yn hynny a roddwyd i Moses cyn? Dywedodd, "[maent ond] gwaith dau o hud yn cefnogi eu gilydd, ac yn wir yr ydym, yn ddau, disbelievers."

trans-unit.source: Say, "Then bring a scripture from Allah which is more guiding than either of them that I may follow it, if you should be truthful."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "yna dwyn ysgrythur gan Allah sy'n fwy arweiniol na'r naill na'r llall y gall ddilyn, os y dylech fod yn onest."

trans-unit.source: But if they do not respond to you - then know that they only follow their [own] desires. And who is more astray than one who follows his desire without guidance from Allah? Indeed, Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
trans-unit.target: Ond os nad ydynt yn ymateb i chi-yna yn gwybod bod dim ond yn dilyn eu [ei hun] dyheadau. A phwy sydd ar gyfeiliorn yn fwy nag un sy'n dilyn ei awydd heb arweiniad gan Allah? Yn wir, yw Allah nid canllaw y bobl gamwedd.

trans-unit.source: And We have [repeatedly] conveyed to them the Qur'an that they might be reminded.
trans-unit.target: Ac wedi [dro ar ôl tro] cyfleu iddynt y Qur'an y gellid eu hatgoffa.

trans-unit.source: Those to whom We gave the Scripture before it - they are believers in it.
trans-unit.target: Y rhai y rhoesom yr ysgrythur cyn ei-maent yn gredinwyr yn ei.

trans-unit.source: And when it is recited to them, they say, "We have believed in it; indeed, it is the truth from our Lord. Indeed we were, [even] before it, Muslims [submitting to Allah]."
trans-unit.target: Ac pan yn ei roi iddynt, maent yn dweud, "yr ydym wedi credu ynddo; yn wir, mae'n y gwir gan ein Arglwydd. Yn wir yr oeddem, [hyd yn oed] ger ei fron, Moslemiaid [cyflwyno i Allah]. "

trans-unit.source: Those will be given their reward twice for what they patiently endured and [because] they avert evil through good, and from what We have provided them they spend.
trans-unit.target: Bydd rhai yn cael eu gwobrwyo ddwywaith ar gyfer yr hyn y maent yn ei ddioddef amyneddgar a [oherwydd] maent yn osgoi drygioni drwy da, ac o'r hyn yr ydym wedi ei darparu iddynt eu gwariant.

trans-unit.source: And when they hear ill speech, they turn away from it and say, "For us are our deeds, and for you are your deeds. Peace will be upon you; we seek not the ignorant."
trans-unit.target: A pan fyddant yn clywed araith sâl, eu troi oddi wrtho a dweud, "i ni yn ein gweithredoedd, ac i chi yn eich gweithredoedd. Bydd heddwch ar chi; Rydym yn ceisio nid anwybodus."

trans-unit.source: Indeed, [O Muhammad], you do not guide whom you like, but Allah guides whom He wills. And He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, [O Muhammad], chi wneud nid canllaw bwy ydych yn hoffi, ond canllawiau Allah bwy mae ef wills. Ac mae'n gwybod fwyaf o dan arweiniad [iawn].

trans-unit.source: And they say, "If we were to follow the guidance with you, we would be swept from our land." Have we not established for them a safe sanctuary to which are brought the fruits of all things as provision from Us? But most of them do not know.
trans-unit.target: Ac maent yn dweud, "Pe baem yn dilyn y canllawiau gyda chi, byddai gennym gael eu hysgubo oddi ar ein tir." Yr ydym wedi sefydlu ar eu cyfer nid noddfa ddiogel y dygir ffrwyth yr holl bethau fel darpariaeth oddi wrthym ni? Ond nid rhan fwyaf ohonynt yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: And how many a city have We destroyed that was insolent in its [way of] living, and those are their dwellings which have not been inhabited after them except briefly. And it is We who were the inheritors.
trans-unit.target: A sut y sawl dinas wedi eu dinistrio a oedd digywilydd yn ei [ffordd o] byw, a'r rheini yn eu anheddau a ni wedi byw ar ôl iddynt ac eithrio fyr. Ac mae gennym a oedd yn etifeddu.

trans-unit.source: And never would your Lord have destroyed the cities until He had sent to their mother a messenger reciting to them Our verses. And We would not destroy the cities except while their people were wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: A byth byddai eich Arglwydd wedi dinistrio y dinasoedd nes oedd wedi'i anfon at eu mam negesydd adrodd iddynt ein penillion. A byddai nid yn dinistrio y dinasoedd ac eithrio tra roedd eu pobl yn tramgwyddo.

trans-unit.source: And whatever thing you [people] have been given - it is [only for] the enjoyment of worldly life and its adornment. And what is with Allah is better and more lasting; so will you not use reason?
trans-unit.target: A beth bynnag peth [pobl] a roddwyd i chi-mae'n [dim ond ar gyfer] y mwynhad o fywyd worldly a ei addurn. A beth sy'n ag Allah yw gwell a mwy parhaol; Felly nid byddwch yn defnyddio'r rheswm?

trans-unit.source: Then is he whom We have promised a good promise which he will obtain like he for whom We provided enjoyment of worldly life [but] then he is, on the Day of Resurrection, among those presented [for punishment in Hell]?
trans-unit.target: Yna mae ganddo ef yr ydym wedi addo addewid da y bydd yn ei gael fel ei fod yn darparu ein mwynhad o fywyd worldly ar eu cyfer [ond] yna y mae, ar y dydd atgyfodi, ymhlith y rhai a gyflwynwyd [ar gyfer cosbi yn uffern]?

trans-unit.source: And [warn of] the Day He will call them and say, "Where are My 'partners' which you used to claim?"
trans-unit.target: A [rhybuddio] Bydd y dydd yn galw iddynt a dweud, "Ble mae fy 'partneriaid' a ddefnyddiwyd gennych i hawlio?"

trans-unit.source: Those upon whom the word will have come into effect will say, "Our Lord, these are the ones we led to error. We led them to error just as we were in error. We declare our disassociation [from them] to You. They did not used to worship us."
trans-unit.target: Bydd y rhai ar bwy fydd y gair wedi dod i rym yn dweud, "ein Arglwydd, mae'r rhain yn y rhai a gennym yn arwain at gwall. Harwain inni gwall yn unig fel yr oeddem mewn camgymeriad. Rydym yn datgan ein disassociation [ohonynt] i chi. Oedd eu ni ddefnyddir i addoli ohonom."

trans-unit.source: And it will be said, "Invoke your 'partners' " and they will invoke them; but they will not respond to them, and they will see the punishment. If only they had followed guidance!
trans-unit.target: Ac yn dweud, "Galw'r eich 'partneriaid'" a bydd eu galw'r iddynt; ond nid byddant yn ymateb iddynt, a byddant yn gweld y gosb. Os mai dim ond wedi dilyn canllawiau!

trans-unit.source: And [mention] the Day He will call them and say, "What did you answer the messengers?"
trans-unit.target: [Yn sôn am] y dydd bydd eu galw ac yn dweud, "beth wnaethoch ateb y negeswyr?"

trans-unit.source: But the information will be unapparent to them that Day, so they will not [be able to] ask one another.
trans-unit.target: Ond bydd y wybodaeth yn unapparent iddynt y diwrnod hwnnw, felly ni wnânt [yn gallu] ofyn un arall.

trans-unit.source: But as for one who had repented, believed, and done righteousness, it is promised by Allah that he will be among the successful.
trans-unit.target: Ond fel un sydd wedi edifarhau, credu a chyfiawnder i wneud, yn addo gan Allah ei fod ymhlith y llwyddiannus.

trans-unit.source: And your Lord creates what He wills and chooses; not for them was the choice. Exalted is Allah and high above what they associate with Him.
trans-unit.target: A creu eich Arglwydd beth ef wills ac yn dewis; Nid iddynt hwy oedd y dewis. I'w mawrygu yw Allah ac uchel uchod beth yr oeddent yn cysylltu ag ef.

trans-unit.source: And your Lord knows what their breasts conceal and what they declare.
trans-unit.target: A eich Arglwydd a ŵyr beth a guddio eu bronnau a beth y maent yn ei ddatgan.

trans-unit.source: And He is Allah; there is no deity except Him. To Him is [due all] praise in the first [life] and the Hereafter. And His is the [final] decision, and to Him you will be returned.
trans-unit.target: Ac ef yw Allah; Nid oes unrhyw Dduwdod ac eithrio ef. Iddo yn [oherwydd holl] ganmoliaeth yn y cyntaf [bywyd] a y o hyn ymlaen. Ac ef yw y benderfyniad [terfynol], ac iddo ef y bydd eich dychwelyd.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Have you considered: if Allah should make for you the night continuous until the Day of Resurrection, what deity other than Allah could bring you light? Then will you not hear?"
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "ydych chi wedi ystyried: os dylai Allah yn gwneud i chi nos parhaus tan ddiwrnod yr atgyfodiad, pa Dduwdod ac eithrio Allah gallai ddod â chi yn ysgafn? Yna ni fyddwch yn clywed?"

trans-unit.source: Say, "Have you considered: if Allah should make for you the day continuous until the Day of Resurrection, what deity other than Allah could bring you a night in which you may rest? Then will you not see?"
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "ydych chi wedi ystyried: os dylai Allah yn gwneud i chi ddiwrnod parhaus tan ddiwrnod yr atgyfodiad, pa Dduwdod ac eithrio Allah gallai ddod â chi noson y gallwch fod? Yna ni welwch?"

trans-unit.source: And out of His mercy He made for you the night and the day that you may rest therein and [by day] seek from His bounty and [that] perhaps you will be grateful.
trans-unit.target: Ac allan ei drugaredd a wnaeth i chi y nos ac yn y dydd y gall orffwys ynddo a'i [gan dydd] geisio gan ei bounty a hynny efallai y byddwch yn ddiolchgar.

trans-unit.source: And [warn of] the Day He will call them and say, "Where are my 'partners' which you used to claim?"
trans-unit.target: A [rhybuddio] Bydd y dydd yn galw iddynt a dweud, "Ble mae fy 'partneriaid' a ddefnyddiwyd gennych i hawlio?"

trans-unit.source: And We will extract from every nation a witness and say, "Produce your proof," and they will know that the truth belongs to Allah, and lost from them is that which they used to invent.
trans-unit.target: A bydd ein dyfyniad o bob cenedl yn dyst ac yn dweud, "cynhyrchu eich prawf", a byddant yn gwybod bod y gwir yn perthyn i Allah, ac yn colli oddi wrthynt yw hynny a ddefnyddiwyd ganddynt i ddyfeisio.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Qarun was from the people of Moses, but he tyrannized them. And We gave him of treasures whose keys would burden a band of strong men; thereupon his people said to him, "Do not exult. Indeed, Allah does not like the exultant.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, roedd Qarun o bobl Moses, ond dywedodd ei fod yn tyrannized iddynt. A rhoesom iddo o drysorau a byddai ei allweddau baich band o ddynion cryf; rhydd ei bobl a ddywedodd wrtho, "wneud nid exult. Yn wir, nid yw Allah fel y llusgo.

trans-unit.source: But seek, through that which Allah has given you, the home of the Hereafter; and [yet], do not forget your share of the world. And do good as Allah has done good to you. And desire not corruption in the land. Indeed, Allah does not like corrupters."
trans-unit.target: Ond yn ceisio, drwy'r hyn a Allah wedi rhoi i chi, yn gartref o hyn ymlaen; a [eto], peidiwch ag anghofio eich cyfran chi o'r byd. A da ei wneud fel Allah wedi gwneud yn dda i chi. Ac awydd na llygredd yn y tir. Yn wir, nid Allah yn hoffi corrupters."

trans-unit.source: He said, "I was only given it because of knowledge I have." Did he not know that Allah had destroyed before him of generations those who were greater than him in power and greater in accumulation [of wealth]? But the criminals, about their sins, will not be asked.
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "dim ond cefais ei oherwydd gwybodaeth gennyf." Nid oedd yn gwybod bod fod Allah eu dinistrio cyn iddo cenedlaethau'r rhai sydd fwy nag ef mewn grym ac yn fwy mewn cyfoethocaf []? Ond am eu pechodau, y troseddwyr, ni ofynnir.

trans-unit.source: So he came out before his people in his adornment. Those who desired the worldly life said, "Oh, would that we had like what was given to Qarun. Indeed, he is one of great fortune."
trans-unit.target: Felly daeth cyn ei bobl yn ei addurn. Dywedodd rhai a ddymunir bywyd worldly, "o, fyddai bod gawsom fel hyn oedd rhoi i Qarun. Yn wir, ef yw un o'r ffortiwn gwych. "

trans-unit.source: But those who had been given knowledge said, "Woe to you! The reward of Allah is better for he who believes and does righteousness. And none are granted it except the patient."
trans-unit.target: Ond y rhai a oedd wedi cael gwybodaeth yn dweud, "gwae i chi! Y wobr Allah yn well ar gyfer AU sy'n credu a chyfiawnder i yw. A dim rhoddir ac eithrio y claf.

trans-unit.source: And We caused the earth to swallow him and his home. And there was for him no company to aid him other than Allah, nor was he of those who [could] defend themselves.
trans-unit.target: A achoswyd inni y ddaear i lyncu iddo ac yn ei gartref. Ac nid oedd iddo unrhyw gwmni i'w gynorthwyo ac eithrio Allah, nac ychwaith y rheini [gellid] amddiffyn eu hunain.

trans-unit.source: And those who had wished for his position the previous day began to say, "Oh, how Allah extends provision to whom He wills of His servants and restricts it! If not that Allah had conferred favor on us, He would have caused it to swallow us. Oh, how the disbelievers do not succeed!"
trans-unit.target: A dechreuodd y rhai a oedd yn dymuno ar gyfer ei safbwynt y diwrnod blaenorol i ddweud, "o, sut mae'r Allah yn ymestyn darpariaeth i bwy mae'n wills ei gweision ac yn cyfyngu ar ei! Os oedd nid y Allah a roddwyd favor arnom, a fyddai ei fod wedi peri i lyncu ein. O, sut y disbelievers na fyddant yn llwyddo!"

trans-unit.source: That home of the Hereafter We assign to those who do not desire exaltedness upon the earth or corruption. And the [best] outcome is for the righteous.
trans-unit.target: Mae cartref hwnnw y byddwn o hyn ymlaen yn cael ei neilltuo i'r rheini nad oes awydd exaltedness ar y ddaear neu lygredd. A'r canlyniad [gorau] yw y righteous.

trans-unit.source: Whoever comes [on the Day of Judgement] with a good deed will have better than it; and whoever comes with an evil deed - then those who did evil deeds will not be recompensed except [as much as] what they used to do.
trans-unit.target: Pwy bynnag ddaw [ar y diwrnod dyfarniad] gyda gweithred dda bydd wedi gwell nag ydyw; a bwy bynnag a ddaw gyda'r weithred anfad-yna bydd rhai wnaeth gweithredoedd anfad heb eu had-dalu ac eithrio [cymaint] beth y maen nhw'n ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, [O Muhammad], He who imposed upon you the Qur'an will take you back to a place of return. Say, "My Lord is most knowing of who brings guidance and who is in clear error."
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, [O Muhammad], ef a osodir ar eich y Qur'an fydd mynd yn ôl i le dychwelyd. Dweud, "Fy Arglwydd yn gwybod fwyaf sy'n dwyn canllawiau a pwy sydd mewn camgymeriad amlwg."

trans-unit.source: And you were not expecting that the Book would be conveyed to you, but [it is] a mercy from your Lord. So do not be an assistant to the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Ac nad oeddech yn disgwyl y byddai y llyfr gael ei chyfleu i chi, ond [Mae'n] drugaredd oddi wrth eich Arglwydd. Felly peidiwch â bod cynorthwy-ydd i y disbelievers.

trans-unit.source: And never let them avert you from the verses of Allah after they have been revealed to you. And invite [people] to your Lord. And never be of those who associate others with Allah.
trans-unit.target: A gadewch iddynt osgoi chi o'r penillion Allah ar ôl maent wedi'u datgelu i chi byth. A gwahodd [pobl] i eich Arglwydd. Ac byth yn rhai sy'n cysylltu eraill â Allah.

trans-unit.source: And do not invoke with Allah another deity. There is no deity except Him. Everything will be destroyed except His Face. His is the judgement, and to Him you will be returned.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid yw galw'r ag Allah Dduwdod arall. Nid oes unrhyw Dduwdod ac eithrio ef. Bydd dinistrio popeth ac eithrio ei wyneb. Ef yn y dyfarniad, ac iddo ef y bydd eich dychwelyd.

trans-unit.source: Alif, Lam, Meem
trans-unit.target: Meem Alif, Lam,

trans-unit.source: Do the people think that they will be left to say, "We believe" and they will not be tried?
trans-unit.target: Wneud pobl yn meddwl bod bydd eu gadael i ddweud, "Credwn" a ceisiasant ni?

trans-unit.source: But We have certainly tried those before them, and Allah will surely make evident those who are truthful, and He will surely make evident the liars.
trans-unit.target: Ond yr ydym yn sicr wedi ceisio rheini ger eu bron, ac bydd Allah yn sicr yn gwneud amlwg sydd eirwir, ac yn sicr wnaiff amlwg y celwyddgwn.

trans-unit.source: Or do those who do evil deeds think they can outrun Us? Evil is what they judge.
trans-unit.target: Neu wneud rhai sydd a gweithredoedd drwg yn credu gall eu outrun inni? Drygioni yw beth y maent yn ei farnu.

trans-unit.source: Whoever should hope for the meeting with Allah - indeed, the term decreed by Allah is coming. And He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Dylai pwy bynnag sy'n gobeithio ar gyfer y cyfarfod gyda Allah-yn wir, y tymor a ddyfarnwyd gan Allah yn dod. Ac mae y gwrandawiad, y mae gwybod.

trans-unit.source: And whoever strives only strives for [the benefit of] himself. Indeed, Allah is free from need of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Ac mae pwy bynnag sy'n ymdrechu ond ymdrechu i [budd] ei hun. Yn wir, Allah yn rhydd o angen o fyd.

trans-unit.source: And those who believe and do righteous deeds - We will surely remove from them their misdeeds and will surely reward them according to the best of what they used to do.
trans-unit.target: A'r rhai sy'n credu ac wneud gweithredoedd cyfiawn-ydym bydd siawns cael gwared ohonynt eu camweddau a'u bydd siawns gwobrwyo yn ôl y gorau o'r hyn y maen nhw'n ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: And We have enjoined upon man goodness to parents. But if they endeavor to make you associate with Me that of which you have no knowledge, do not obey them. To Me is your return, and I will inform you about what you used to do.
trans-unit.target: Ac yr ydym yn enjoined ar dyn Duw i rieni. Mae ond os yn gwneud pob ymdrech i wneud i chi gysylltu â mi bod y mae gennych unrhyw wybodaeth, nid ydych yn ufuddhau iddynt. I mi mae eich ffurflen, a fydd yn eich hysbysu am beth yr ydych yn ei defnyddio i wneud.

trans-unit.source: And those who believe and do righteous deeds - We will surely admit them among the righteous [into Paradise].
trans-unit.target: A'r rhai sy'n credu ac wneud gweithredoedd cyfiawn-bydd ein siawns yn cyfaddef iddynt ymhlith y righteous [i baradwys].

trans-unit.source: And of the people are some who say, "We believe in Allah," but when one [of them] is harmed for [the cause of] Allah, they consider the trial of the people as [if it were] the punishment of Allah. But if victory comes from your Lord, they say, "Indeed, We were with you." Is not Allah most knowing of what is within the breasts of all creatures?
trans-unit.target: Ac o bobl yn rhai sy'n dweud, "Rydym yn credu mewn Allah", ond pan y mae un [ohonynt] niweidio am [achos] Allah, maent yn ystyried y prawf y bobl fel [pe bai'n] cosbi Allah. Ond os daw buddugoliaeth o eich Arglwydd, maent yn dweud, "yn wir, roeddem yn gyda chi." Yw Allah ni wybod rhan fwyaf o'r hyn sydd o fewn y bronnau o holl greaduriaid?

trans-unit.source: And Allah will surely make evident those who believe, and He will surely make evident the hypocrites.
trans-unit.target: A bydd Allah yn sicr yn gwneud amlwg rhai sy'n credu, ac yn sicr wnaiff amlwg y rhagrithwyr.

trans-unit.source: And those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Follow our way, and we will carry your sins." But they will not carry anything of their sins. Indeed, they are liars.
trans-unit.target: A dywed rhai a chredu i'r rhai sy'n credu, "ddilyn ein ffordd, a byddwn yn parhau eich pechodau." Ond ni fydd yn gwneud unrhyw beth o eu pechodau. Yn wir, maent yn gelwyddgwn.

trans-unit.source: But they will surely carry their [own] burdens and [other] burdens along with their burdens, and they will surely be questioned on the Day of Resurrection about what they used to invent.
trans-unit.target: Ond bydd ganddynt siawns eu [ei hun] beichiau a beichiau [arall] ynghyd â eu beichiau, ac yn sicr bydd eu cwestiynu ynghylch y dydd atgyfodi am beth maent yn ei defnyddio i ddyfeisio.

trans-unit.source: And We certainly sent Noah to his people, and he remained among them a thousand years minus fifty years, and the flood seized them while they were wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: A ydym yn sicr yn anfon Noah at ei bobl, ac arhosodd eu mysg mil o flynyddoedd minws hanner can mlynedd, ac roedd y llifogydd yn hatafaelu iddynt er eu bod yn tramgwyddo.

trans-unit.source: But We saved him and the companions of the ship, and We made it a sign for the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Ond rydym yn arbed iddo ef a'i gyd-deithwyr y llong, ac rydym yn gwneud yn arwydd am fyd.

trans-unit.source: And [We sent] Abraham, when he said to his people, "Worship Allah and fear Him. That is best for you, if you should know.
trans-unit.target: A [Anfonwyd] Abraham, pan y dywedodd wrth ei bobl, "addoli Allah ac ofn iddo. Dyna'r gorau i chi, os dylech wybod.

trans-unit.source: You only worship, besides Allah, idols, and you produce a falsehood. Indeed, those you worship besides Allah do not possess for you [the power of] provision. So seek from Allah provision and worship Him and be grateful to Him. To Him you will be returned."
trans-unit.target: Mae eich unig addoli, ar wahân i Allah, dod ynghyd, a fyddwch yn cynhyrchu anwiredd. Yn wir, wneud rhai ydych yn addoli ar wahân i Allah nid yn meddu ar ar gyfer darpariaeth chi [pŵer]. Felly geisio gan ddarpariaeth Allah ac addoli ef ac yn ddiolchgar iddo. Iddo bydd eich dychwelyd."

trans-unit.source: And if you [people] deny [the message] - already nations before you have denied. And there is not upon the Messenger except [the duty of] clear notification.
trans-unit.target: Ac os mae [pobl] wadu [neges]-Cenhedloedd cyn i chi eisoes wedi gwadu. Ac nid oes ar y negesydd ac eithrio [dyletswydd] hysbysiad yn glir.

trans-unit.source: Have they not considered how Allah begins creation and then repeats it? Indeed that, for Allah, is easy.
trans-unit.target: Nid ydynt wedi ystyried sut Allah yn dechrau creu ac yna ei ailadrodd? Yn wir, i Allah, mae'n hawdd.

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "Travel through the land and observe how He began creation. Then Allah will produce the final creation. Indeed Allah, over all things, is competent."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, [O Muhammad], 'teithio drwy'r tir ac arsylwi sut Dechreuodd greu. Yna bydd Allah yn cynhyrchu greu terfynol. Yn wir Allah, dros holl bethau, yn gymwys. "

trans-unit.source: He punishes whom He wills and has mercy upon whom He wills, and to Him you will be returned.
trans-unit.target: Mae ef yn cosbi bwy mae'n wills ac wedi drugaredd ar bwy mae ef wills, ac iddo ef y bydd eich dychwelyd.

trans-unit.source: And you will not cause failure [to Allah] upon the earth or in the heaven. And you have not other than Allah any protector or any helper.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid ydych yn achosi methiant [i Allah] ar wyneb y ddaear neu yn y nefoedd. Ac mae gennych nid heblaw Allah unrhyw protector neu unrhyw gynorthwy-ydd.

trans-unit.source: And the ones who disbelieve in the signs of Allah and the meeting with Him - those have despaired of My mercy, and they will have a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: A rhai a chredu yn arwyddion Allah ac y cyfarfod gydag ef-rhai wedi despaired o fy drugaredd, a bydd ganddynt cosb poenus.

trans-unit.source: And the answer of Abraham's people was not but that they said, "Kill him or burn him," but Allah saved him from the fire. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oedd yr ateb o bobl Abraham Mae ond y dywedodd, "ei ladd neu losgi ef", ond achubodd Allah ef o'r tân. Yn wir yn hynny yn arwyddion ar gyfer pobl sydd yn credu.

trans-unit.source: And [Abraham] said, "You have only taken, other than Allah, idols as [a bond of] affection among you in worldly life. Then on the Day of Resurrection you will deny one another and curse one another, and your refuge will be the Fire, and you will not have any helpers."
trans-unit.target: A [Abraham] dywedodd, "dim ond a gymerasoch, heblaw Allah, dod ynghyd fel [bond o] hoffter eich plith mewn bywyd worldly. Wedyn ar y dydd atgyfodi bydd un arall yn gwadu a melltithio un a'r llall, a bydd eich lloches yn y tân, ac ni fydd gennych unrhyw gynorthwywyr."

trans-unit.source: And Lot believed him. [Abraham] said, "Indeed, I will emigrate to [the service of] my Lord. Indeed, He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise."
trans-unit.target: Ac roedd llawer yn credu iddo. Dywedodd [Abraham], "yn wir, y bydd yr ymfudo i [gwasanaeth] fy Arglwydd. Yn wir, mae'n Exalted yn efallai, yn y doeth."

trans-unit.source: And We gave to Him Isaac and Jacob and placed in his descendants prophethood and scripture. And We gave him his reward in this world, and indeed, he is in the Hereafter among the righteous.
trans-unit.target: A roddodd ef Isaac a Jacob a roddir yn ei ddisgynyddion prophethood a ysgrythur. Ac fe gafodd ei wobrwyo yn y byd hwn, ac yn wir, y mae ef yn y o hyn ymlaen ymysg y righteous.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] Lot, when he said to his people, "Indeed, you commit such immorality as no one has preceded you with from among the worlds.
trans-unit.target: [Yn sôn am] llawer, pan ddywedodd ei bobl, "yn wir, a wnewch ymrwymo o'r fath anfoesoldeb fel unrhyw un wedi rhagflaenu i chi o blith y fyd.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, you approach men and obstruct the road and commit in your meetings [every] evil." And the answer of his people was not but they said, "Bring us the punishment of Allah, if you should be of the truthful."
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, eich ymagwedd dynion a rhwystr ar y ffordd a ymrwymo yn eich cyfarfodydd [bob] drygioni." Ac nid oedd yr ateb ei bobl, ond maent yn dweud, "Dwyn ein cosbi Allah, os dylai fod o y geirwir."

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, support me against the corrupting people."
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "Fy Arglwydd, fy nghefnogi erbyn pobl corrupting."

trans-unit.source: And when Our messengers came to Abraham with the good tidings, they said, "Indeed, we will destroy the people of that Lot's city. Indeed, its people have been wrongdoers."
trans-unit.target: A phan y daeth ein negeswyr i Abraham y tidings da, maent yn dweud, "yn wir, bydd dinistrio pobl y ddinas honno llawer. Yn wir, ei bobl wedi tramgwyddo."

trans-unit.source: [Abraham] said, "Indeed, within it is Lot." They said, "We are more knowing of who is within it. We will surely save him and his family, except his wife. She is to be of those who remain behind."
trans-unit.target: [Abraham] dywedodd, "Yn wir, o fewn mae'n lawer." Maent yn dweud, "Rydym yn gwybod mwy am y sydd o fewn ei. Byddwn yn sicr yn arbed iddo ef a'i deulu, ac eithrio ei wraig. Hi yw fod y rhai sy'n dal i fod ar ei hôl hi.

trans-unit.source: And when Our messengers came to Lot, he was distressed for them and felt for them great discomfort. They said, "Fear not, nor grieve. Indeed, we will save you and your family, except your wife; she is to be of those who remain behind.
trans-unit.target: A pan ddaeth ein negeswyr i lawer, yr oedd yn ofid iddynt ac yn teimlo iddynt anghysur mawr. Maent yn dweud, "nid yn ofni, nac yn galaru. Yn wir, byddwn yn arbed chi ac yn eich teulu, ac eithrio eich gwraig; Mae hi i fod y rhai sy'n dal i fod ar ei hôl hi.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, we will bring down on the people of this city punishment from the sky because they have been defiantly disobedient."
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, byddwn yn dwyn i lawr ar bobl y gosb hon Dinas o'r awyr oherwydd maent wedi defiantly anufudd."

trans-unit.source: And We have certainly left of it a sign as clear evidence for a people who use reason.
trans-unit.target: A ydym yn sicr yn weddill ohono arwydd fel tystiolaeth glir ar gyfer pobl sy'n defnyddio'r rheswm.

trans-unit.source: And to Madyan [We sent] their brother Shu'ayb, and he said, "O my people, worship Allah and expect the Last Day and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption."
trans-unit.target: Ac i Madyan [anfonasom] eu brawd Shu'ayb, a dywedodd, "O Mae fy pobl, addoli Allah a disgwyl y diwrnod diwethaf ac wneud nid ymrwymo cam-drin ar y ddaear, gwasgaru llygredd."

trans-unit.source: But they denied him, so the earthquake seized them, and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.
trans-unit.target: Ond maent gwadodd iddo, felly roedd y daeargryn yn hatafaelu iddynt, a daeth y maent yn eu cartref [cyrff] wedi gostwng yn dueddol o.

trans-unit.source: And [We destroyed] 'Aad and Thamud, and it has become clear to you from their [ruined] dwellings. And Satan had made pleasing to them their deeds and averted them from the path, and they were endowed with perception.
trans-unit.target: A [dinistrio ein] ' Aad a Thamud, ac wedi dod yn amlwg i chi gan eu anheddau [adfeilion]. A Satan wedi gwneud eu gweithredoedd sy'n ddymunol iddynt ac osgoi iddynt gan y llwybr, ac maent yn hanesyddol canfyddiad.

trans-unit.source: And [We destroyed] Qarun and Pharaoh and Haman. And Moses had already come to them with clear evidences, and they were arrogant in the land, but they were not outrunners [of Our punishment].
trans-unit.target: A [dinistrio ein] Qarun a Ffaro a Haman. A oedd Moses eisoes yn dod atynt gyda dangos glir, ac roeddent yn drahaus yn y tir, ond nad oeddent yn outrunners [o ein cosbi].

trans-unit.source: So each We seized for his sin; and among them were those upon whom We sent a storm of stones, and among them were those who were seized by the blast [from the sky], and among them were those whom We caused the earth to swallow, and among them were those whom We drowned. And Allah would not have wronged them, but it was they who were wronging themselves.
trans-unit.target: Felly pob Rydym yn hatafaelu ar gyfer ei pechod; ac yn eu plith yr oedd rhai ar bwy ydym anfon storm o gerrig, ac yn eu plith oedd y rhai a oedd yn hatafaelu gan y chwyth [gan y sky], a eu plith yr oedd rhai yr ydym yn achosi y ddaear i lyncu, ac yn eu plith oedd y rhai ohonynt ein boddi. Ac ni byddai Allah fod wedi cam iddynt, ond hwy a oedd yn wronging eu hunain.

trans-unit.source: The example of those who take allies other than Allah is like that of the spider who takes a home. And indeed, the weakest of homes is the home of the spider, if they only knew.
trans-unit.target: Yn yr enghraifft o'r rhai sy'n cymryd cynghreiriaid heblaw Allah fel y Corryn sy'n cymryd gartref. Ac yn wir, y gwannaf o gartrefi yw cartref y Corryn, os gwyddent yn unig.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah knows whatever thing they call upon other than Him. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, mae Allah yn gwybod peth beth bynnag maent yn galw ar wahân iddo. Ac ef yw Exalted yn efallai, yn y doeth.

trans-unit.source: And these examples We present to the people, but none will understand them except those of knowledge.
trans-unit.target: Ac enghreifftiau hyn rydym yn ei gyflwyno i bobl, ond bydd yr un yn eu deall ac eithrio'r rhai hynny o wybodaeth.

trans-unit.source: Allah created the heavens and the earth in truth. Indeed in that is a sign for the believers.
trans-unit.target: Creodd Allah y nefoedd a'r ddaear mewn gwirionedd. Yn wir yn hynny yn arwydd y credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: Recite, [O Muhammad], what has been revealed to you of the Book and establish prayer. Indeed, prayer prohibits immorality and wrongdoing, and the remembrance of Allah is greater. And Allah knows that which you do.
trans-unit.target: Adrodd, [O Muhammad], beth wedi cael ei ddatgelu i chi o'r llyfr a sefydlu gweddi. Yn wir, mae gweddi yn gwahardd anfoesoldeb a'r gamwedd, a cofio Allah yn fwy. A gwyr Allah hynny sydd gennych.

trans-unit.source: And do not argue with the People of the Scripture except in a way that is best, except for those who commit injustice among them, and say, "We believe in that which has been revealed to us and revealed to you. And our God and your God is one; and we are Muslims [in submission] to Him."
trans-unit.target: A gwneud nid dadlau â phobl yr ysgrythur ac eithrio mewn ffordd gorau, ar wahân i'r rheini sy'n ymrwymo anghyfiawnder yn eu plith, a dweud, "Credwn yn hynny sydd wedi cael ei datgelu i ni ac yn dangos i chi. A ein Duw a eich Duw yn un; a ydym yn Foslemiaid [yn Cyflwyniad] iddo ef.

trans-unit.source: And thus We have sent down to you the Qur'an. And those to whom We [previously] gave the Scripture believe in it. And among these [people of Makkah] are those who believe in it. And none reject Our verses except the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Ac felly yr ydym wedi anfon i lawr i chi y Qur'an. Ac mae rhai y rhoesom [gynt] y ysgrythur yn credu ynddo. Ac ymysg hyn [pobl o blentyndod] yw'r rhai sydd yn credu ynddo. Ac mae yr un yn gwrthod ein penillion ac eithrio y disbelievers.

trans-unit.source: And you did not recite before it any scripture, nor did you inscribe one with your right hand. Otherwise the falsifiers would have had [cause for] doubt.
trans-unit.target: Ac oedd ni adrodd cyn unrhyw ysgrythur, nac chi oedd inscribe un gyda eich llaw dde. Fel arall, byddai y falsifiers wedi cael amheuaeth [achos].

trans-unit.source: Rather, the Qur'an is distinct verses [preserved] within the breasts of those who have been given knowledge. And none reject Our verses except the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Yn hytrach, y Qur'an yw penillion penodol [gadwedig] o fewn y bronnau o'r rhai sydd wedi cael gwybodaeth. Ac mae yr un yn gwrthod ein penillion ac eithrio y tramgwyddo.

trans-unit.source: But they say, "Why are not signs sent down to him from his Lord?" Say, "The signs are only with Allah, and I am only a clear warner."
trans-unit.target: Ond maent yn dweud, "pam na arwyddion anfonir i lawr iddo ef gan ei Arglwydd?" Dweud, "Mae'r arwyddion yn unig gyda Allah, ac yr wyf yn unig warner clir."

trans-unit.source: And is it not sufficient for them that We revealed to you the Book which is recited to them? Indeed in that is a mercy and reminder for a people who believe.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid yw yn ddigonol ar eu cyfer a ydym yn dangos i chi y llyfr sy'n ei roi iddynt? Yn wir yn hynny yn drugaredd ac atgoffa ar gyfer pobl sydd yn credu.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Sufficient is Allah between me and you as Witness. He knows what is in the heavens and earth. And they who have believed in falsehood and disbelieved in Allah - it is those who are the losers."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "digonol yw Allah rhwng fi a chi fel tyst. Gwyr ef beth sydd yn y nefoedd a'r ddaear. A nhw sy'n credu mewn anwiredd a ddysgais yn Allah-y mae'n rhai sydd ar eu colled.

trans-unit.source: And they urge you to hasten the punishment. And if not for [the decree of] a specified term, punishment would have reached them. But it will surely come to them suddenly while they perceive not.
trans-unit.target: Ac maent yn annog chi i brysuro y gosb. Ac, os nad ar gyfer [yr ordinhad o] tymor penodedig, cosbi byddai wedi eu cyrraedd. Ond yn sicr daw iddynt sydyn tra maent yn teimlo nad.

trans-unit.source: They urge you to hasten the punishment. And indeed, Hell will be encompassing of the disbelievers
trans-unit.target: Maent yn annog chi i brysuro y gosb. Ac yn wir, y bydd cwmpasu uffern o y disbelievers

trans-unit.source: On the Day the punishment will cover them from above them and from below their feet and it is said, "Taste [the result of] what you used to do."
trans-unit.target: Ar y diwrnod y bydd y gosb yn cwmpasu eu Fry a dan eu traed ac yn dweud, "blas [canlyniad] beth yr ydych yn ei defnyddio i wneud."

trans-unit.source: O My servants who have believed, indeed My earth is spacious, so worship only Me.
trans-unit.target: O mae 'm gweision sydd wedi credu, yn wir yn y ddaear fy eang, felly addoli dim ond Me.

trans-unit.source: Every soul will taste death. Then to Us will you be returned.
trans-unit.target: Bydd pob enaid yn blasu marwolaeth. Yna i ni Bydd chi eu dychwelyd.

trans-unit.source: And those who have believed and done righteous deeds - We will surely assign to them of Paradise [elevated] chambers beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. Excellent is the reward of the [righteous] workers
trans-unit.target: A'r rhai sydd wedi credu ac wedi gwneud gweithredoedd cyfiawn-bydd ein siawns neilltuo iddynt o siambrau paradwys [dyrchafu'n] o dan y llif afonydd, lle eu bod yn cadw fythol. Rhagorol yw gwobrwyo gweithwyr [hoes dabloid]

trans-unit.source: Who have been patient and upon their Lord rely.
trans-unit.target: Sydd wedi bod yn amyneddgar ac yn eu Arglwydd yn dibynnu arnynt.

trans-unit.source: And how many a creature carries not its [own] provision. Allah provides for it and for you. And He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
trans-unit.target: A nid y ddarpariaeth ei [ei hun] faint o greadur sy'n cyflawni'r. Mae'r Allah yn darparu ar ei gyfer ac i chi. Ac mae y gwrandawiad, y mae gwybod.

trans-unit.source: If you asked them, "Who created the heavens and earth and subjected the sun and the moon?" they would surely say, "Allah." Then how are they deluded?
trans-unit.target: Pe baech yn gofyn iddynt, "Sydd yn creu y nefoedd a'r ddaear a dioddef yr haul a'r lleuad?" fyddai siawns dywedant, "Allah." Yna sut y maent yn deluded?

trans-unit.source: Allah extends provision for whom He wills of His servants and restricts for him. Indeed Allah is, of all things, Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Mae'r Allah yn ymestyn darpariaeth ar eu cyfer mae'n wills ei gweision ac yn cyfyngu ar ei gyfer. Yn wir yn Allah, yr holl bethau, mae gwybod.

trans-unit.source: And if you asked them, "Who sends down rain from the sky and gives life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness?" they would surely say " Allah." Say, "Praise to Allah "; but most of them do not reason.
trans-unit.target: Pe baech yn gofyn iddynt, "sydd yn anfon yn glaw o'r awyr ac yn rhoi bywyd y ddaear ac felly ar ôl ei lifelessness?" byddent yn sicr yn dweud "Allah." Dweud, "Canmoliaeth i Allah"; ond nid oes rhan fwyaf ohonynt yn rheswm.

trans-unit.source: And this worldly life is not but diversion and amusement. And indeed, the home of the Hereafter - that is the [eternal] life, if only they knew.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid yw bywyd worldly hwn ond dargyfeirio a diddanwch. Ac yn wir, yn gartref i o hyn ymlaen-hynny yw bywyd [tragwyddol], os mai dim ond eu bod yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: And when they board a ship, they supplicate Allah, sincere to Him in religion. But when He delivers them to the land, at once they associate others with Him
trans-unit.target: A pan mae nhw'n Bwrdd llong, mae supplicate Allah, diffuant iddo mewn crefydd. Ond pan fydd yn traddodi eu ar y tir, ar unwaith mae maent cysylltiol eraill gydag ef

trans-unit.source: So that they will deny what We have granted them, and they will enjoy themselves. But they are going to know.
trans-unit.target: Fel y maent yn gwadu hyn rydym wedi caniatáu iddynt, a bydd eu mwynhau eu hunain. Ond maent yn mynd i wybod.

trans-unit.source: Have they not seen that We made [Makkah] a safe sanctuary, while people are being taken away all around them? Then in falsehood do they believe, and in the favor of Allah they disbelieve?
trans-unit.target: Nid ydynt wedi gweld ein bod wedi gwneud [blentyndod] noddfa ddiogel, tra mae pobl yn cael eu cymryd i ffwrdd o'u cwmpas? Yna ydynt yn credu mewn anwiredd, ac mae eu chredu in the favor of Allah?

trans-unit.source: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah or denies the truth when it has come to him? Is there not in Hell a [sufficient] residence for the disbelievers?
trans-unit.target: Ac sydd yn anghyfiawn fwy nag un sy'n dyfeisio celwydd am Allah neu yn gwadu y gwir pan wedi dod iddo? Mae yna nid yn uffern preswylfa [digon o] ar gyfer y disbelievers?

trans-unit.source: And those who strive for Us - We will surely guide them to Our ways. And indeed, Allah is with the doers of good.
trans-unit.target: A'r rhai sy'n ymdrechu i ni-Onid ydym i'w tywys ein ffyrdd. Ac yn wir, yw Allah â phoenwn da.

trans-unit.source: Alif, Lam, Meem.
trans-unit.target: Alif, Lam, Meem.
