trans-unit.target: A byddwch yn gweld pob cenedl benlinio [rhag ofn]. Bydd galw i ei record pob cenedl [a dweud], "heddiw bydd chi eu had-dalu am beth yr ydych yn ei defnyddio i wneud.

trans-unit.source: This, Our record, speaks about you in truth. Indeed, We were having transcribed whatever you used to do."
trans-unit.target: Mae hyn, ein record, yn siarad am yr ydych mewn gwirionedd. Yn wir, ein yn cael trawsgrifio beth bynnag yr ydych yn ei defnyddio i wneud. "

trans-unit.source: So as for those who believed and did righteous deeds, their Lord will admit them into His mercy. That is what is the clear attainment.
trans-unit.target: Felly ag i'r rhai sy'n credu a oedd gweithredoedd cyfiawn, bydd yr Arglwydd eu cyfaddef iddynt yn ei drugaredd. Dyna beth yw cyrhaeddiad clir.

trans-unit.source: But as for those who disbelieved, [it will be said], "Were not Our verses recited to you, but you were arrogant and became a people of criminals?
trans-unit.target: Ond o ran y rhai a ddysgais, [bydd dweud], "oedd nid ein penillion yn ei roi i chi, ond byddwch yn drahaus a daeth pobl o droseddwyr?

trans-unit.source: And when it was said, 'Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth and the Hour [is coming] - no doubt about it,' you said, 'We know not what is the Hour. We assume only assumption, and we are not convinced.' "
trans-unit.target: A pan ddywedwyd, 'Yn wir, yr addewid o Allah yw gwir ac yr awr [yn]-Nid oes amheuaeth am hynny,' dywedasoch, ' Gwyddom ni beth yw yr awr. Rydym yn tybio mai dim ond rhagdybiaeth, ac nid ydym yn argyhoeddedig.' "

trans-unit.source: And the evil consequences of what they did will appear to them, and they will be enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
trans-unit.target: A bydd canlyniadau'r anfad hyn a wnaethant yn ymddangos iddynt, a bydd lyncu'r iddynt gan beth roedden nhw'n arfer gwawdio.

trans-unit.source: And it will be said, "Today We will forget you as you forgot the meeting of this Day of yours, and your refuge is the Fire, and for you there are no helpers.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn dweud, "heddiw bydd anghofio chi fel ichi anghofio y cyfarfod ar y diwrnod hwn o eich un chi, ac i'ch lloches yn y tân, ac i chi, nid oes unrhyw gynorthwywyr.

trans-unit.source: That is because you took the verses of Allah in ridicule, and worldly life deluded you." So that Day they will not be removed from it, nor will they be asked to appease [Allah].
trans-unit.target: Dyna oherwydd y cymerasoch penillion Allah mewn gwawd, ac roedd bywyd worldly deluded chi." Fel y dydd ni bydd iddynt eu tynnu ohoni, ac ni bydd gofyn i dawelu [Allah].

trans-unit.source: Then, to Allah belongs [all] praise - Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Yna, i Allah yn perthyn [bob] canmoliaeth-yr Arglwydd y nefoedd a'r Arglwydd y ddaear, yr Arglwydd y byd.

trans-unit.source: And to Him belongs [all] grandeur within the heavens and the earth, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Ac iddo ef y perthyn gwychder [bob] o fewn y nefoedd a'r ddaear, ac ef yw Exalted yn efallai, yn y doeth.

trans-unit.source: Ha, Meem.
trans-unit.target: Ha, Meem.

trans-unit.source: The revelation of the Book is from Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Mae y datgeliad y llyfr gan Allah, Exalted yn efallai, yn y doeth.

trans-unit.source: We did not create the heavens and earth and what is between them except in truth and [for] a specified term. But those who disbelieve, from that of which they are warned, are turning away.
trans-unit.target: Nid oedd yn creu y nefoedd a ddaear a beth yw'r rhyngddynt ac eithrio mewn gwirionedd a [i] tymor penodedig. Ond mae rhai a chredu, o hynny ac yn rhybuddio, yn troi i ffwrdd.

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "Have you considered that which you invoke besides Allah? Show me what they have created of the earth; or did they have partnership in [creation of] the heavens? Bring me a scripture [revealed] before this or a [remaining] trace of knowledge, if you should be truthful."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, [O Muhammad], "ydych wedi ystyried hynny a ydych yn galw'r ar wahân i Allah? Dangos i mi beth y maent wedi ei greu y ddaear; neu oedd ganddynt partneriaeth yn [creu] y nefoedd? Ddod â mi ysgrythurau [yn dangos] cyn hyn neu hybrin [arall] gwybodaeth, os y dylech fod yn onest."

trans-unit.source: And who is more astray than he who invokes besides Allah those who will not respond to him until the Day of Resurrection, and they, of their invocation, are unaware.
trans-unit.target: A pwy sydd ar gyfeiliorn yn fwy nag ef a rhyw ar wahân i Allah rhai na bydd ymateb iddo tan ddiwrnod yr atgyfodiad, ac maent, o eu gallu, yn anymwybodol.

trans-unit.source: And when the people are gathered [that Day], they [who were invoked] will be enemies to them, and they will be deniers of their worship.
trans-unit.target: A pan mae pobl yn casglu [y diwrnod hwnnw], [pwy oedd galw'r rym] byddant yn elynion iddynt, a byddant yn llosg eu addoli.

trans-unit.source: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who disbelieve say of the truth when it has come to them, "This is obvious magic."
trans-unit.target: Ac wrth roi ein penillion iddynt fel dangos clir, dywed rhai a chredu y gwirionedd pan wedi dod iddynt, "Dyma hud amlwg."

trans-unit.source: Or do they say, "He has invented it?" Say, "If I have invented it, you will not possess for me [the power of protection] from Allah at all. He is most knowing of that in which you are involved. Sufficient is He as Witness between me and you, and He is the Forgiving the Merciful."
trans-unit.target: Neu nid ydynt yn dweud, "wedi ei ddyfeisio?" Dweud, "os wyf wedi ei ddyfeisio, byddwch nid yn meddu ar i mi [y pŵer o amddiffyn] gan Allah o gwbl. Mae rhan fwyaf o wybod hynny y byddwch yn cymryd rhan. Digon o ef fel tyst rhwng fi a chi, ac ef yw y Forgiving y Merciful. "

trans-unit.source: Say, "I am not something original among the messengers, nor do I know what will be done with me or with you. I only follow that which is revealed to me, and I am not but a clear warner."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Nid wyf rhywbeth gwreiddiol ymhlith y negeswyr, na wn beth a wneir â mi neu â chi. Dilynaf hynny a ddatgelir yn unig i mi, ac nid wyf ond warner clir."

trans-unit.source: Say, "Have you considered: if the Qur'an was from Allah, and you disbelieved in it while a witness from the Children of Israel has testified to something similar and believed while you were arrogant...?" Indeed, Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "ydych chi wedi ystyried: os oedd y Qur'an oddi wrth Allah, a oedd eich ddysgais ynddo tra mae tyst o blant Israel yn tystio i rhywbeth tebyg a Credai tra oeddech yn drahaus...?" Yn wir, yw Allah nid canllaw y bobl gamwedd.

trans-unit.source: And those who disbelieve say of those who believe, "If it had [truly] been good, they would not have preceded us to it." And when they are not guided by it, they will say, "This is an ancient falsehood."
trans-unit.target: A dywed rhai a chredu y rhai sydd yn credu, "Os [yn wir] wedi bod yn dda, byddai eu nid wedi rhagflaenu inni iddo." Pan maent yn nid harwain ganddo, byddant yn dweud, "Dyma anwiredd hynafol."

trans-unit.source: And before it was the scripture of Moses to lead and as a mercy. And this is a confirming Book in an Arabic tongue to warn those who have wronged and as good tidings to the doers of good.
trans-unit.target: A cyn hynny roedd yr ysgrythur Moses i arwain ac fel drugaredd. A dyma lyfr cadarnhau mewn tafod Arabic i rybuddio rhai sydd wedi cam ac fel tidings da i phoenwn da.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who have said, "Our Lord is Allah," and then remained on a right course - there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, y rheini sydd wedi dweud, "Ein Arglwydd yw Allah," ac yna aros ar y cwrs cywir-ni fydd unrhyw ofn ynghylch eu, ac ni bydd iddynt alaru.

trans-unit.source: Those are the companions of Paradise, abiding eternally therein as reward for what they used to do.
trans-unit.target: Mae'r rheini'n chymdeithion o baradwys, ufudd i'r fythol ynddo fel gwobr am beth y maen nhw'n ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: And We have enjoined upon man, to his parents, good treatment. His mother carried him with hardship and gave birth to him with hardship, and his gestation and weaning [period] is thirty months. [He grows] until, when he reaches maturity and reaches [the age of] forty years, he says, "My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents and to work righteousness of which You will approve and make righteous for me my offspring. Indeed, I have repented to You, and indeed, I am of the Muslims."
trans-unit.target: Ac yr ydym yn enjoined ar ddyn, at ei rieni, triniaeth dda. Mae ei fam yn ei wneud gyda caledi a rhoddodd enedigaeth iddo gyda caledi, ac ei beichiogrwydd a diddyfnu [cyfnod] yn dri deg mis. [Mae tyfu] hyd nes, pan yn cyrraedd aeddfedrwydd a yn cyrraedd [oed] ddeugain mlynedd, meddai, "fy Arglwydd, fy ngalluogi i fod yn ddiolchgar am eich favor a ydych wedi rhoi'r ar mi ac ar fy rhieni a chyfiawnder i a ydych yn cymeradwyo ac yn gwneud yn hoes dabloid i mi fy epil yn gweithio. Yn wir, rwyf wedi edifarhau i chi, ac yn wir, yr wyf y Moslemiaid."

trans-unit.source: Those are the ones from whom We will accept the best of what they did and overlook their misdeeds, [their being] among the companions of Paradise. [That is] the promise of truth which they had been promised.
trans-unit.target: Dyma'r rhai gan y byddwn yn derbyn y gorau o'r hyn a wnaethant ac anwybyddu eu camweddau, [bod] ymhlith y cymdeithion o baradwys. [Mae] yr addewid o wirionedd a addawyd iddynt.

trans-unit.source: But one who says to his parents, "Uff to you; do you promise me that I will be brought forth [from the earth] when generations before me have already passed on [into oblivion]?" while they call to Allah for help [and to their son], "Woe to you! Believe! Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth." But he says, "This is not but legends of the former people" -
trans-unit.target: Ond un sy'n dweud wrth ei rieni, "Uff i chi; wneud addewid imi y bydd yr ddwyn ymlaen [o ddaear] pan cenedlaethau cyn imi eisoes wedi mynd heibio [i ebargofiant]? "tra maent yn galw i Allah am help [a eu mab],"gwae i chi! Credu! Yn wir, yr addewid o Allah yw gwir." Ond meddai, "Hwn nid yw ond chwedlau y bobl hen"-

trans-unit.source: Those are the ones upon whom the word has come into effect, [who will be] among nations which had passed on before them of jinn and men. Indeed, they [all] were losers.
trans-unit.target: Dyma'r rhai ar bwy mae y gair yn dod i rym, [fydd] ymysg cenhedloedd sydd wedi pasio cyn iddynt jinn a dynion. Yn wir, roeddent [holl] yn ar eu colled.

trans-unit.source: And for all there are degrees [of reward and punishment] for what they have done, and [it is] so that He may fully compensate them for their deeds, and they will not be wronged.
trans-unit.target: Ac ar gyfer pob ceir graddau [o wobrwyo a chosbi] am yr hyn y maent wedi ei wneud, a [Mae'n] fel y gall ef llawn eu digolledu am eu gweithredoedd, ac ni Bydd maent yn cam.

trans-unit.source: And the Day those who disbelieved are exposed to the Fire [it will be said], "You exhausted your pleasures during your worldly life and enjoyed them, so this Day you will be awarded the punishment of [extreme] humiliation because you were arrogant upon the earth without right and because you were defiantly disobedient."
trans-unit.target: A diwrnod y rhai a ddysgais yn agored i'r tân [bydd dweud], "ydych wedi ymlâdd eich pleserau yn ystod eich bywyd worldly ac yn mwynhau eu, felly diwrnod hwn ichi dyfernir cosbi cywilydd [eithafol] oherwydd eich bod yn haerllug ar y ddaear heb hawl a oeddech yn defiantly anufudd."

trans-unit.source: And mention, [O Muhammad], the brother of 'Aad, when he warned his people in the [region of] al-Ahqaf - and warners had already passed on before him and after him - [saying], "Do not worship except Allah. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day."
trans-unit.target: A sôn am, [O Muhammad], y brawd o ' Aad, pan, rhybuddiodd ei bobl yn al-Ahqaf [rhanbarth]-a warners wedi pasio eisoes cyn iddo ac ar ôl iddo-[dweud], "wneud nid addoli ac eithrio Allah. Yn wir, mae arnaf ofn ichi y gosb o ddiwrnod ofnadwy."

trans-unit.source: They said, "Have you come to delude us away from our gods? Then bring us what you promise us, if you should be of the truthful."
trans-unit.target: Maent yn dweud, "rydych wedi cyrraedd ein twyllo'u oddi wrth ein duwiau? Yna dwyn inni eich addewid inni, os dylai fod o y geirwir."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Knowledge [of its time] is only with Allah, and I convey to you that with which I was sent; but I see you [to be] a people behaving ignorantly."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "gwybodaeth am [amser] dim ond gyda Allah, a chyfleu eich bod y wyf anfon; ond gwelaf chi [fod] yn bobl sy'n ymddwyn yn ignorantly. "

trans-unit.source: And when they saw it as a cloud approaching their valleys, they said, "This is a cloud bringing us rain!" Rather, it is that for which you were impatient: a wind, within it a painful punishment,
trans-unit.target: Pan roeddent yn ei weld fel cwmwl agosáu at eu Cymoedd, dywedodd, "Dyma cwmwl ddwyn ein glaw!" Yn hytrach, mae'n eich bod yn ddiamynedd y: gwynt, o fewn ei cosb boenus,

trans-unit.source: Destroying everything by command of its Lord. And they became so that nothing was seen [of them] except their dwellings. Thus do We recompense the criminal people.
trans-unit.target: Dinistrio popeth ar Orchymyn ei Arglwydd. A daeth maent fel y gwelwyd dim [ohonynt] ac eithrio eu anheddau. Felly inni wneud taliad y bobl troseddol.

trans-unit.source: And We had certainly established them in such as We have not established you, and We made for them hearing and vision and hearts. But their hearing and vision and hearts availed them not from anything [of the punishment] when they were [continually] rejecting the signs of Allah; and they were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn sicr rydym wedi sefydlu arnynt mewn fel yr ydym ni wedi sefydlu chi, ac yr ydym yn gwneud ar eu cyfer gwrandawiad a gweledigaeth a calonnau. Ond roedd eu gwrandawiad a gweledigaeth a calonnau wedi manteisio ar eu nid o unrhyw beth [o gosb y] pan fydd [barhaus] maent yn gwrthod yr arwyddion Allah; ac roedd eu lyncu'r gan beth roedden nhw'n arfer gwawdio.

trans-unit.source: And We have already destroyed what surrounds you of [those] cities, and We have diversified the signs [or verses] that perhaps they might return [from disbelief].
trans-unit.target: Eisoes Rydym wedi dinistrio'r hyn amgylchynu eich dinasoedd [hynny], ac yr ydym wedi arallgyfeirio arwyddion [neu penillion] Efallai y gallai dychwelyd [o anghrediniaeth].

trans-unit.source: Then why did those they took besides Allah as deities by which to approach [Him] not aid them? But they had strayed from them. And that was their falsehood and what they were inventing.
trans-unit.target: Wedyn pam oedd y rhai aethant ar wahân i Allah fel duwdod y dull [ef] nid cymorth iddynt? Ond maent wedi crwydro oddi wrthynt. Ac yr oedd eu anwiredd a beth y cafodd ei dyfeisio.

trans-unit.source: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We directed to you a few of the jinn, listening to the Qur'an. And when they attended it, they said, "Listen quietly." And when it was concluded, they went back to their people as warners.
trans-unit.target: A [sôn, O Muhammad], pan ydym wedi cyfeirio atoch ychydig o'r jinn, gwrando ar y Qur'an. A pan yn mynychu, dywedodd, "Gwrando ar dawel." A pan daethpwyd i'r casgliad, aethant yn ôl i eu pobl fel warners.

trans-unit.source: They said, "O our people, indeed we have heard a [recited] Book revealed after Moses confirming what was before it which guides to the truth and to a straight path.
trans-unit.target: Maent yn dweud, "O ein pobl, yn wir yr ydym wedi clywed llyfr [recited] Datgelodd ar ôl Moses cadarnhau beth oedd ger ei fron sy'n arwain at y gwirionedd ac i lwybr syth.

trans-unit.source: O our people, respond to the Messenger of Allah and believe in him; Allah will forgive for you your sins and protect you from a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: O Mae ein pobl, yn ymateb i Messenger Allah ac yn credu ynddo; Bydd Allah yn maddau i chi eich pechodau ac yn eich amddiffyn rhag cosb poenus.

trans-unit.source: But he who does not respond to the Caller of Allah will not cause failure [to Him] upon earth, and he will not have besides Him any protectors. Those are in manifest error."
trans-unit.target: Ond na fydd ef a nad yw'n ymateb i galwr Allah yn achosi methiant [iddo ef] ar y ddaear, ac bydd ganddo heblaw iddo unrhyw diogelwyr. Mae'r rheini'n mewn camgymeriad amlwg."

trans-unit.source: Do they not see that Allah, who created the heavens and earth and did not fail in their creation, is able to give life to the dead? Yes. Indeed, He is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: Nid ydynt yn gweld bod Allah, sydd wedi creu y nefoedd a'r ddaear a fethodd yn eu creu, yn gallu rhoi bywyd y meirw? Ydw. Yn wir, mae dros holl bethau yn gymwys.

trans-unit.source: And the Day those who disbelieved are exposed to the Fire [it will be said], "Is this not the truth?" They will say, "Yes, by our Lord." He will say, "Then taste the punishment because you used to disbelieve."
trans-unit.target: A dydd y rhai a ddysgais yn agored i'r tân [bydd dweud], "Hwn nid yw y gwir?" Maent yn dweud, "Ie, gan ein Arglwydd." Ef fydd yn dweud, "yna blas y cosbi oherwydd rydych yn defnyddio beidio â chredu."

trans-unit.source: So be patient, [O Muhammad], as were those of determination among the messengers and do not be impatient for them. It will be - on the Day they see that which they are promised - as though they had not remained [in the world] except an hour of a day. [This is] notification. And will [any] be destroyed except the defiantly disobedient people?
trans-unit.target: Felly byddwch yn amyneddgar, [O Muhammad], fel oedd y rhai y benderfyniad ymhlith y negeswyr a Peidiwch â bod yn ddiamynedd ar eu cyfer. Bydd yn-ar y diwrnod maent yn gweld bod y maent yn addo-fel pe na baent wedi parhau [yn y byd] ac eithrio awr o'r dydd. [Mae hwn] hysbysiad. A bydd [unrhyw] ei ddinistrio ac eithrio pobl defiantly anufudd?

trans-unit.source: Those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of Allah - He will waste their deeds.
trans-unit.target: Mae rhai a chredu ac osgoi [pobl] o'r ffordd o Allah-AU bydd gwastraff eu gweithredoedd.

trans-unit.source: And those who believe and do righteous deeds and believe in what has been sent down upon Muhammad - and it is the truth from their Lord - He will remove from them their misdeeds and amend their condition.
trans-unit.target: A rhai sydd yn credu a wneud gweithredoedd cyfiawn ac yn credu yn yr hyn y mae wedi'i anfon i lawr ar Muhammad-ac mae'n y gwir gan yr Arglwydd eu-bydd yn tynnu oddi ar eu eu camweddau ac yn diwygio eu cyflwr.

trans-unit.source: That is because those who disbelieve follow falsehood, and those who believe follow the truth from their Lord. Thus does Allah present to the people their comparisons.
trans-unit.target: Mae hynny oherwydd mae rhai a chredu yn dilyn anwiredd, ac mae'r rhai sy'n credu yn dilyn y gwir Arglwydd eu. Felly yw Allah yn bresennol i bobl eu cymharu.

trans-unit.source: So when you meet those who disbelieve [in battle], strike [their] necks until, when you have inflicted slaughter upon them, then secure their bonds, and either [confer] favor afterwards or ransom [them] until the war lays down its burdens. That [is the command]. And if Allah had willed, He could have taken vengeance upon them [Himself], but [He ordered armed struggle] to test some of you by means of others. And those who are killed in the cause of Allah - never will He waste their deeds.
trans-unit.target: Felly pan fyddwch yn cyfarfod rhai a chredu [mewn brwydr], taro [eu] gyddfau tan, pan ydych wedi achoswyd lladd arnynt, ac yna sicrhau eu bondiau, a naill ai [rhoi] favor wedyn neu pridwerth [eu] hyd nes y mae y rhyfel yn gosod ei beichiau. Y [yn y Gorchymyn]. Ac os oedd Allah ewyllysio iddi, gallai fod wedi cymryd groch arnynt [ei hun], ond [gorchmynnodd ef yn frwydr arfog] i roi prawf ar rai ohonoch drwy gyfrwng eraill. A'r rhai sy'n cael eu lladd yn achos Allah-byth y bydd ef gwastraff eu gweithredoedd.

trans-unit.source: He will guide them and amend their condition
trans-unit.target: Bydd yn tywys ac yn diwygio eu cyflwr

trans-unit.source: And admit them to Paradise, which He has made known to them.
trans-unit.target: Ac iddynt gyfaddef i baradwys, sydd wedi ei gwneud yn hysbys iddynt.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, if you support Allah, He will support you and plant firmly your feet.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, os ydych yn cefnogi Allah, bydd yn eich cefnogi ac yn plannu eich traed yn gadarn.

trans-unit.source: But those who disbelieve - for them is misery, and He will waste their deeds.
trans-unit.target: Ond y rhai sy'n chredu-iddynt yw trallod, a bydd ef yn gwastraff eu gweithredoedd.

trans-unit.source: That is because they disliked what Allah revealed, so He rendered worthless their deeds.
trans-unit.target: Mae hynny oherwydd oeddynt yn hoffi beth a datgelodd Allah, fel ei rendro ddiwerth eu gweithredoedd.

trans-unit.source: Have they not traveled through the land and seen how was the end of those before them? Allah destroyed [everything] over them, and for the disbelievers is something comparable.
trans-unit.target: Wedi iddynt nid un drwy y tir a gweld sut yr oedd diwedd y rheini cyn iddynt? Mae'r Allah yn dinistrio [popeth] drostynt, a rhywbeth tebyg ar gyfer y disbelievers yw.

trans-unit.source: That is because Allah is the protector of those who have believed and because the disbelievers have no protector.
trans-unit.target: Dyna oherwydd bod Allah yn protector y rhai sydd wedi credu ac oherwydd bod y disbelievers yn oes protector.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah will admit those who have believed and done righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow, but those who disbelieve enjoy themselves and eat as grazing livestock eat, and the Fire will be a residence for them.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, bydd Allah yn cyfaddef Mae rhai sydd wedi credu ac wedi gwneud gweithredoedd cyfiawn i gerddi o dan afonydd Mae llif, ond rhai a chredu yn mwynhau eu hunain ac yn bwyta fel pori da byw yn ei fwyta, a bydd y tân yn preswylio ar eu cyfer.

trans-unit.source: And how many a city was stronger than your city [Makkah] which drove you out? We destroyed them; and there was no helper for them.
trans-unit.target: A faint o Dinas oedd yn gryfach na'r eich Dinas [blentyndod] a fu'n gyrru chi allan? Yr ydym yn dinistrio iddynt; ac nid oedd unrhyw gynorthwy-ydd ar eu cyfer.

trans-unit.source: So is he who is on clear evidence from his Lord like him to whom the evil of his work has been made attractive and they follow their [own] desires?
trans-unit.target: Felly mae ef sydd ar dystiolaeth glir gan ei Arglwydd fel ef i bwy y drygioni ei waith a wnaed deniadol ac maent yn dilyn eu [ei hun] dyheadau?

trans-unit.source: Is the description of Paradise, which the righteous are promised, wherein are rivers of water unaltered, rivers of milk the taste of which never changes, rivers of wine delicious to those who drink, and rivers of purified honey, in which they will have from all [kinds of] fruits and forgiveness from their Lord, like [that of] those who abide eternally in the Fire and are given to drink scalding water that will sever their intestines?
trans-unit.target: Mae disgrifiad o baradwys, a y righteous yr addawodd, lle mae afonydd dŵr heb eu newid, afonydd o laeth a bydd y Flas sydd byth yn newid, afonydd o win blasus i bobl sy'n yfed, ac afonydd wedi'u puro mêl, y bydd ganddynt o'r holl [math o] ffrwythau a maddeuant gan eu yr Arglwydd, fel [yr] rheini gadw at fythol yn y tân, a rhoddir i yfed dŵr a bydd hollti'r eu coluddion sgaldio?

trans-unit.source: And among them, [O Muhammad], are those who listen to you, until when they depart from you, they say to those who were given knowledge, "What has he said just now?" Those are the ones of whom Allah has sealed over their hearts and who have followed their [own] desires.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn eu plith, [O Muhammad], yw'r rhai sydd yn gwrando arnoch chi, tan pan symudant oddi wrthych chi, eu dweud i'r rheini y rhoddwyd gwybodaeth, "Beth ddywedodd yn awr?" Dyma'r rhai o bwy Allah wedi selio dros eu calonnau ac sydd wedi dilyn eu [ei hun] dyheadau.

trans-unit.source: And those who are guided - He increases them in guidance and gives them their righteousness.
trans-unit.target: A'r rhai sy'n cael eu harwain-mae'n eu cynyddu yn y canllawiau ac yn rhoi iddynt eu chyfiawnder i.

trans-unit.source: Then do they await except that the Hour should come upon them unexpectedly? But already there have come [some of] its indications. Then what good to them, when it has come, will be their remembrance?
trans-unit.target: Yna maent yn disgwyl heblaw y dylai yr awr yn dod iddynt yn annisgwyl? Ond eisoes mae wedi dod [rhai o'r] ei arwyddion. Wedyn beth da iddynt, pan mae'n dod, a fydd yn eu cofio?

trans-unit.source: So know, [O Muhammad], that there is no deity except Allah and ask forgiveness for your sin and for the believing men and believing women. And Allah knows of your movement and your resting place.
trans-unit.target: Felly wybod, [O Muhammad], nad oes dim Dduwdod ac eithrio Allah a gofyn maddeuant ar gyfer eich pechod ac am gredu dynion a menywod gredu. A gwyr Allah eich mudiad a eich lle gorffwys.

trans-unit.source: Those who believe say, "Why has a surah not been sent down? But when a precise surah is revealed and fighting is mentioned therein, you see those in whose hearts is hypocrisy looking at you with a look of one overcome by death. And more appropriate for them [would have been]
trans-unit.target: Rhai sy'n credu yn dweud, "pam mae surah nid wedi'i anfon i lawr? Ond pan mae surah union wedi datgelu ac ymladd yn crybwyll ynddo, gwelwch hynny yn eu calonnau rhagrith yw edrych ar eich gyda golwg un goresgyn gan farwolaeth. [Mwy priodol ar eu cyfer wedi]

trans-unit.source: Obedience and good words. And when the matter [of fighting] was determined, if they had been true to Allah, it would have been better for them.
trans-unit.target: Ufudddod a geiriau da. A pan fydd y mater [o ymladd] oedd yn benderfynol, os ydynt wedi bod yn wir i Allah, byddai wedi bod yn well iddynt.

trans-unit.source: So would you perhaps, if you turned away, cause corruption on earth and sever your [ties of] relationship?
trans-unit.target: Felly byddai chi efallai, pe baech yn troi i ffwrdd, achosi llygredd ar y ddaear ac yn gwahanu eich perthynas [Cysylltiadau]?

trans-unit.source: Those [who do so] are the ones that Allah has cursed, so He deafened them and blinded their vision.
trans-unit.target: Rheini [hynny] yw'r rhai a felltithio Allah, felly mae'n byddaru iddynt ac wedi'u dallu eu gweledigaeth.

trans-unit.source: Then do they not reflect upon the Qur'an, or are there locks upon [their] hearts?
trans-unit.target: Yna nid ydynt yn adlewyrchu ar y Qur'an, neu a oes cloeon ar [eu] calonnau?

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who reverted back [to disbelief] after guidance had become clear to them - Satan enticed them and prolonged hope for them.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, mae rhai sy'n mynd yn ôl [anghrediniaeth] ar ôl canllawiau wedi dod yn glir iddynt-llwyddwyd i annog eu Satan a hir gobeithio amdanynt.

trans-unit.source: That is because they said to those who disliked what Allah sent down, "We will obey you in part of the matter." And Allah knows what they conceal.
trans-unit.target: Mae hynny oherwydd dywedodd i'r rhai sy'n hoffi beth Allah yn ei hanfon i lawr, "bydd gennym ufuddhau ydych yn rhan o'r mater." Ac mae Allah yn gwybod beth y maent yn ei guddio.

trans-unit.source: Then how [will it be] when the angels take them in death, striking their faces and their backs?
trans-unit.target: Yna sut [fydd] pan y mae yr angylion yn eu cymryd yn farwolaeth, yn drawiadol eu hwynebau a eu cefnau?

trans-unit.source: That is because they followed what angered Allah and disliked [what earns] His pleasure, so He rendered worthless their deeds.
trans-unit.target: Dyna oherwydd roeddent yn dilyn beth Allah yn ddig ac yn casáu [beth sy'n ennill] ei bleser, fel ei rendro ddiwerth eu gweithredoedd.

trans-unit.source: Or do those in whose hearts is disease think that Allah would never expose their [feelings of] hatred?
trans-unit.target: Neu a rhai yn eu calonnau Mae clefyd yn credu y byddai Allah byth ddatgelu eu casineb [teimladau o]?

trans-unit.source: And if We willed, We could show them to you, and you would know them by their mark; but you will surely know them by the tone of [their] speech. And Allah knows your deeds.
trans-unit.target: Ac os ydym yn ewyllysio iddi, gallem iddynt ddangos i chi, a byddech yn gwybod iddynt gan eu marc; ond oni gwyddoch amdanynt gan naws [eu] araith. A gwyr Allah eich gweithredoedd.

trans-unit.source: And We will surely test you until We make evident those who strive among you [for the cause of Allah] and the patient, and We will test your affairs.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn sicr byddwn yn profi chi nes inni wneud amlwg rhai sy'n ymdrechu ymhlith chi [am achos Allah] a'r claf, a byddwn yn profi eich materion.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who disbelieved and averted [people] from the path of Allah and opposed the Messenger after guidance had become clear to them - never will they harm Allah at all, and He will render worthless their deeds.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, rhai sy'n osgoi [pobl] gan y llwybr Allah a gwrthwynebu y negesydd ar ôl canllawiau ddysgais ac wedi dod yn glir iddynt-byth y bydd niwed Allah bob, a bydd iddo rendr ddiwerth eu gweithredoedd.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, obey Allah and obey the Messenger and do not invalidate your deeds.
trans-unit.target: O Mae chi sydd wedi credu, ufuddhau Allah ac ufuddhau y negesydd a wneud na all eich gweithredoedd.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who disbelieved and averted [people] from the path of Allah and then died while they were disbelievers - never will Allah forgive them.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, y rhai a ddysgais ac osgoi [pobl] gan y llwybr Allah ac wedyn yn marw tra eu bod yn disbelievers-byth bydd Allah yn maddau iddynt.

trans-unit.source: So do not weaken and call for peace while you are superior; and Allah is with you and will never deprive you of [the reward of] your deeds.
trans-unit.target: Felly peidiwch â gwanhau a galw am heddwch tra byddwch yn rhagorach; a Allah gyda chi a bydd byth yn eich amddifadu o [y wobr o] eich gweithredoedd.

trans-unit.source: [This] worldly life is only amusement and diversion. And if you believe and fear Allah, He will give you your rewards and not ask you for your properties.
trans-unit.target: [Hwn] bywyd worldly yn unig difyrion a dargyfeirio. Ac os ydych yn credu ac yn ofni Allah, bydd yn rhoi chi eich gwobrau ac ni ofyn i chi am eich eiddo.

trans-unit.source: If He should ask you for them and press you, you would withhold, and He would expose your unwillingness.
trans-unit.target: Os dylai ofyn i chi am iddynt a bwyso arnoch, byddai eich atal, a byddai ef yn amlygu eich amharodrwydd.

trans-unit.source: Here you are - those invited to spend in the cause of Allah - but among you are those who withhold [out of greed]. And whoever withholds only withholds [benefit] from himself; and Allah is the Free of need, while you are the needy. And if you turn away, He will replace you with another people; then they will not be the likes of you.
trans-unit.target: Dyma chi-y rhai a wahoddir i wario yn achos Allah-ond ymysg chi yw'r rhai sy'n atal [allan o trachwant]. Ac mae pwy bynnag sy'n atal dim ond atal [budd] gan ei hun; ac Allah yn rhad ac am ddim o angen, tra byddwch yn yr anghenus. Ac os ydych yn galluogi i ffwrdd, bydd eich lle gyda phobl arall; yna ni fydd maent yn gwneud yr un peth.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We have given you, [O Muhammad], a clear conquest
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, yr ydym wedi rhoi ichi, [O Muhammad], goresgyniad clir

trans-unit.source: That Allah may forgive for you what preceded of your sin and what will follow and complete His favor upon you and guide you to a straight path
trans-unit.target: Roedd y gall Allah yn maddau i chi beth rhagflaenu eich pechod a beth bydd dilyn a chwblhau ei favor arnoch chi ac yn eich arwain i lwybr syth

trans-unit.source: And [that] Allah may aid you with a mighty victory.
trans-unit.target: Ac efallai y bydd Allah [honno] i'ch cynorthwyo gyda'r fuddugoliaeth mighty.

trans-unit.source: It is He who sent down tranquillity into the hearts of the believers that they would increase in faith along with their [present] faith. And to Allah belong the soldiers of the heavens and the earth, and ever is Allah Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Mae'n ef a anfonwyd i lawr llonyddwch calonnau credinwyr y byddent yn cynyddu mewn ffydd ynghyd â eu ffydd [bresennol]. A Allah yn perthyn iddynt y milwyr y nefoedd a'r ddaear, a byth yn gwybod Allah a Wise.

trans-unit.source: [And] that He may admit the believing men and the believing women to gardens beneath which rivers flow to abide therein eternally and remove from them their misdeeds - and ever is that, in the sight of Allah, a great attainment -
trans-unit.target: [A] y gall dderbyn y believing dynion a merched believing gerddi y mae afonydd yn llifo i lynu ynddo fythol a chael gwared ohonynt eu camweddau-a erioed yw, yng ngolwg Allah, cyrhaeddiad mawr-

trans-unit.source: And [that] He may punish the hypocrite men and hypocrite women, and the polytheist men and polytheist women - those who assume about Allah an assumption of evil nature. Upon them is a misfortune of evil nature; and Allah has become angry with them and has cursed them and prepared for them Hell, and evil it is as a destination.
trans-unit.target: A [y] caiff ei gosbi y rhagrithiwr dynion a menywod rhagrithiwr, ac y polytheist dynion a menywod polytheist-rhai sy'n tybio am Allah dybiaeth o natur drygioni. Arnynt yn anffawd o natur drygioni; a Allah wedi dod yn ddig gyda nhw ac wedi eu melltithio ac yn paratoi ar gyfer eu Mae uffern, ac anfad ydyw fel cyrchfan.

trans-unit.source: And to Allah belong the soldiers of the heavens and the earth. And ever is Allah Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Ac i Allah yn perthyn y milwyr y nefoedd a'r ddaear. Ac byth yn Allah i'w mawrygu yn allai a Wise.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We have sent you as a witness and a bringer of good tidings and a warner
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, rydym wedi anfon atoch fel tyst a bringer o tidings da a warner

trans-unit.source: That you [people] may believe in Allah and His Messenger and honor him and respect the Prophet and exalt Allah morning and afternoon.
trans-unit.target: Bod chi [pobl] efallai yn credu mewn Allah a Messenger ei anrhydedd honno iddo barchu y Proffwyd a exalt Allah y bore a'r prynhawn.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who pledge allegiance to you, [O Muhammad] - they are actually pledging allegiance to Allah. The hand of Allah is over their hands. So he who breaks his word only breaks it to the detriment of himself. And he who fulfills that which he has promised Allah - He will give him a great reward.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, y rheini sy'n addo teyrngarwch i chi, [O Muhammad]-mewn gwirionedd maent yn addo teyrngarwch i Allah. Y llaw Allah yn eu dwylo. Felly mae ef a torri ei air dim ond torri ei draul ei hun. Ac ef a cyflawni sydd wedi addo Allah-a wnaiff ef roi gwobr mawr.

trans-unit.source: Those who remained behind of the bedouins will say to you, "Our properties and our families occupied us, so ask forgiveness for us." They say with their tongues what is not within their hearts. Say, "Then who could prevent Allah at all if He intended for you harm or intended for you benefit? Rather, ever is Allah, with what you do, Acquainted.
trans-unit.target: Bydd rhai sy'n aros tu ôl i o y bedouins yn dweud i chi, "Roedd ein heiddo ac ein teuluoedd yn meddiannu inni, felly gofyn maddeuant i ni." Maent yn dweud â eu dafod nad yw hyn o fewn eu calonnau. Dweud, "yna mae pwy allai atal Allah o gwbl os oedd yn bwriadu i chi niweidio neu y bwriedir ar gyfer byddwch chi'n elwa? Yn hytrach, erioed yn Allah, gyda beth yr ydych yn ei wneud, yn gyfarwydd.

trans-unit.source: But you thought that the Messenger and the believers would never return to their families, ever, and that was made pleasing in your hearts. And you assumed an assumption of evil and became a people ruined."
trans-unit.target: Ond yr oeddech yn credu y byddai y negesydd ac y credinwyr byth ddychwelyd at eu teuluoedd, erioed, a gwnaed hynny'n braf yn eich calonnau. A ydych yn tybio dybiaeth o ddrygioni ac Daeth pobl yn adfail."

trans-unit.source: And whoever has not believed in Allah and His Messenger - then indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers a Blaze.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid pwy bynnag wedi credu yn Allah ac ei negesydd-yna yn wir, rydym wedi paratoi ar gyfer y disbelievers tanbaid.

trans-unit.source: And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ac i Allah yn perthyn ddominiwn y nefoedd a'r ddaear. Mae ef yn maddau bwy mae'n wills ac yn cosbi bwy mae ef wills. Ac byth yn maddeugar Allah a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: Those who remained behind will say when you set out toward the war booty to take it, "Let us follow you." They wish to change the words of Allah. Say, "Never will you follow us. Thus did Allah say before." So they will say, "Rather, you envy us." But [in fact] they were not understanding except a little.
trans-unit.target: Bydd rhai sy'n aros tu ôl i ddweud pan nodwyd gennych tuag at y rhyfel booty i gymryd ei, "Gadewch inni dilyn chi." Ydynt yn dymuno newid y geiriau Allah. Dweud, "byth bydd ydych yn ein dilyn. Felly oedd Allah ddweud cyn." Felly byddant yn dweud, "yn hytrach, mae eich eiddigeddus ohonom." Ond [yn wir] oedd heb ddeall ac eithrio ychydig.

trans-unit.source: Say to those who remained behind of the bedouins, "You will be called to [face] a people of great military might; you may fight them, or they will submit. So if you obey, Allah will give you a good reward; but if you turn away as you turned away before, He will punish you with a painful punishment."
trans-unit.target: Dweud i'r rhai sy'n parhau i fod ar ei hôl hi o bedouins, "Bydd y cewch eich galw i [wynebu] pobl y gallai milwrol mawr; Efallai byddwch yn ymladd iddynt, neu byddant yn cyflwyno. Felly os yw eich bod yn ufuddhau, bydd Allah yn rhoi eich gwobr da; ond os ydych yn galluogi i ffwrdd fel y trodd chi i ffwrdd cyn, bydd eich cosbi â chosbi poenus.

trans-unit.source: There is not upon the blind any guilt or upon the lame any guilt or upon the ill any guilt [for remaining behind]. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger - He will admit him to gardens beneath which rivers flow; but whoever turns away - He will punish him with a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Nid oes ar y Deillion unrhyw euogrwydd neu ar y cloff unrhyw euogrwydd neu ar y wael unrhyw euogrwydd [am aros tu ôl i]. A pwy bynnag ufudd i Allah a ei negesydd-ef bydd gyfaddef iddo gerddi o dan y llif afonydd; ond pwy bynnag sydd yn troi i ffwrdd-ef wedi bydd yn cosbi ef â chosbi poenus.

trans-unit.source: Certainly was Allah pleased with the believers when they pledged allegiance to you, [O Muhammad], under the tree, and He knew what was in their hearts, so He sent down tranquillity upon them and rewarded them with an imminent conquest
trans-unit.target: Yn sicr oedd Allah y credinwyr yn fodlon pan maent addawodd deyrngarwch i chi, [O Muhammad], o dan y goeden, a gwyddai beth oedd yn eu calonnau, fel mae ei hanfon i lawr llonyddwch arnynt a'u gwobrwyo â goresgyniad ar fin

trans-unit.source: And much war booty which they will take. And ever is Allah Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: A llawer o booty rhyfel a byddant yn cymryd. Ac byth yn Allah i'w mawrygu yn allai a Wise.

trans-unit.source: Allah has promised you much booty that you will take [in the future] and has hastened for you this [victory] and withheld the hands of people from you - that it may be a sign for the believers and [that] He may guide you to a straight path.
trans-unit.target: Allah wedi addo llawer o booty [yn y dyfodol] ewch chi ac wedi cyflymu i chi hwn [buddugoliaeth] ac yn ei ddal yn ôl i ddwylo pobl oddi wrthych – y gallai fod yn arwydd y credinwyr a [y] Efallai y bydd ef yn eich tywys i lwybr syth.

trans-unit.source: And [He promises] other [victories] that you were [so far] unable to [realize] which Allah has already encompassed. And ever is Allah, over all things, competent.
trans-unit.target: A [Mae'n addo] wedi eraill [buddugoliaethau] nad oeddech yn gallu i [wireddu'r] Pa Allah [o hyd] eisoes yn cwmpasu. Ac byth yn Allah, dros holl bethau, cymwys.

trans-unit.source: And if those [Makkans] who disbelieve had fought you, they would have turned their backs [in flight]. Then they would not find a protector or a helper.
trans-unit.target: Ac os hynny [Makkans] a chredu wedi ymladd ei chi, byddai wedi troi eu cefnau [yn hedfan]. Yna byddai ddim canfod protector neu'n gynorthwy-ydd.

trans-unit.source: [This is] the established way of Allah which has occurred before. And never will you find in the way of Allah any change.
trans-unit.target: [Mae hyn] y dull sefydledig o Allah sydd wedi digwydd cyn. A byth yn rhwystro Allah unrhyw newid.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who withheld their hands from you and your hands from them within [the area of] Makkah after He caused you to overcome them. And ever is Allah of what you do, Seeing.
trans-unit.target: Ac ef a gadwyd yn ôl eu dwylo oddi arnoch ac yn eich dwylo ohonynt o fewn [ardal] blentyndod ar ôl achosodd iddo chi i'w goresgyn. A yw Allah yr hyn yr ydych yn ei wneud, yn erioed weld.

trans-unit.source: They are the ones who disbelieved and obstructed you from al-Masjid al-Haram while the offering was prevented from reaching its place of sacrifice. And if not for believing men and believing women whom you did not know - that you might trample them and there would befall you because of them dishonor without [your] knowledge - [you would have been permitted to enter Makkah]. [This was so] that Allah might admit to His mercy whom He willed. If they had been apart [from them], We would have punished those who disbelieved among them with painful punishment
trans-unit.target: Hwy yw'r rhai sy'n rhwystro chi rhag al-Masjid al-Haram tra oedd y cynnig yn cael ei atal rhag cyrraedd ei le o aberth a ddysgais. Ac os nad ar gyfer dynion gredu a gredu menywod bwy nad oeddech yn gwybod-y gallai eu sathru a fyddai'n digwydd yno mae chi oherwydd eu dishonor heb wybodaeth [ch]-[byddai ydych wedi caniatáu i blentyndod]. [Hwn oedd hynny] y gallai Allah yn cyfaddef ei drugaredd ef oedd ei fod yn ewyllysio iddi. Pe baent wedi bod yn ddarnau [ohonynt], byddai wedi cosbi rhai a ddysgais yn eu plith â chosbi boenus

trans-unit.source: When those who disbelieved had put into their hearts chauvinism - the chauvinism of the time of ignorance. But Allah sent down His tranquillity upon His Messenger and upon the believers and imposed upon them the word of righteousness, and they were more deserving of it and worthy of it. And ever is Allah, of all things, Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Pan fydd rhai a ddysgais oedd rhoi yn siofinyddiaeth eu calonnau-siofinyddiaeth o'r amser o anwybodaeth. Ond mae'r Allah yn anfon i lawr ei llonyddwch ar ei negesydd ac ar y credinwyr a orfodir arnynt y gair o chyfiawnder i, ac roeddent yn fwy haeddiannol ohono ac yn deilwng ohono. Ac erioed yw Allah, yr holl bethau, yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: Certainly has Allah showed to His Messenger the vision in truth. You will surely enter al-Masjid al-Haram, if Allah wills, in safety, with your heads shaved and [hair] shortened, not fearing [anyone]. He knew what you did not know and has arranged before that a conquest near [at hand].
trans-unit.target: Yn sicr mae Allah yn dangos i Messenger ei weledigaeth mewn gwirionedd. Bydd eich siawns Rhowch al-Masjid al-Haram, os oedd ewyllys Allah, mewn diogelwch, gyda eich pennau siafio a [wallt] byrhau, nid ofni [rhywun]. Gwyddai beth ydych nad oedd yn gwybod ac wedi trefnu cyn y goresgyniad ger [wrth law].

trans-unit.source: It is He who sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth to manifest it over all religion. And sufficient is Allah as Witness.
trans-unit.target: Mae'n ef a anfonwyd negesydd ei gyda'r canllawiau a chrefydd o wirionedd i amlygu ei dros pob crefydd. Ac mae digon o Allah fel tyst.

trans-unit.source: Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah; and those with him are forceful against the disbelievers, merciful among themselves. You see them bowing and prostrating [in prayer], seeking bounty from Allah and [His] pleasure. Their mark is on their faces from the trace of prostration. That is their description in the Torah. And their description in the Gospel is as a plant which produces its offshoots and strengthens them so they grow firm and stand upon their stalks, delighting the sowers - so that Allah may enrage by them the disbelievers. Allah has promised those who believe and do righteous deeds among them forgiveness and a great reward.
trans-unit.target: Muhammad yn negesydd Allah; a rhai gydag ef yn rymus yn erbyn y disbelievers, tosturiol ymysg eu hunain. Ydych yn eu gweld consortia a prostrating [yn gweddi], ceisio bounty gan Allah a [ei] bleser. Mae eu marc ar eu hwynebau gan hybrin o prostration. Mae ei ddisgrifiad yn y Torah. Ac eu disgrifiad yn yr efengyl fel planhigion sy'n cynhyrchu ei offshoots ac yn eu cryfhau er mwyn iddynt dyfu yn gadarn a sefyll ar eu coesynnau, difyrru y sowers-felly efallai bod Allah yn enrage gan y disbelievers. Mae Allah wedi addo rhai sydd yn credu ac yn gwneud gweithredoedd cyfiawn yn eu plith maddeuant a gwobr mawr.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not put [yourselves] before Allah and His Messenger but fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, peidiwch â rhoi [eich hunain] gerbron Allah a Messenger ei ond ofn Allah. Yn wir, Allah yw gwrandawiad a gwybod.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet or be loud to him in speech like the loudness of some of you to others, lest your deeds become worthless while you perceive not.
trans-unit.target: O ydych sydd wedi credu, codi eich lleisiau uchod llais y Proffwyd nac yn groch ato yn araith fel cryfder rhai ohonoch i eraill, rhag ofn eich gweithredoedd yn ddiwerth yn eich barn chi ni.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who lower their voices before the Messenger of Allah - they are the ones whose hearts Allah has tested for righteousness. For them is forgiveness and great reward.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, y rheini sy'n is eu lleisiau cyn Messenger Allah-hwy yw'r rhai y mae eu calonnau Allah wedi profi am chyfiawnder i. Ar eu cyfer yw maddeuant a gwobrwyo mawr.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who call you, [O Muhammad], from behind the chambers - most of them do not use reason.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, nid rhai sy'n galw chi, [O Muhammad], o'r tu ôl y siambrau-rhan fwyaf ohonynt yn defnyddio'r rheswm.

trans-unit.source: And if they had been patient until you [could] come out to them, it would have been better for them. But Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ac os ydynt wedi claf nes [gellid] dod allan iddynt, byddai wedi bod yn well iddynt. Ond Allah yn Forgiving a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, if there comes to you a disobedient one with information, investigate, lest you harm a people out of ignorance and become, over what you have done, regretful.
trans-unit.target: O sydd wedi credu, os daw un anufudd gyda gwybodaeth, i chi ymchwilio i, rhag ofn y byddwch yn niweidio pobl allan o anwybodaeth ac yn dod, dros yr hyn yr ydych wedi'i wneud, destun gofid.

trans-unit.source: And know that among you is the Messenger of Allah. If he were to obey you in much of the matter, you would be in difficulty, but Allah has endeared to you the faith and has made it pleasing in your hearts and has made hateful to you disbelief, defiance and disobedience. Those are the [rightly] guided.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn gwybod bod eich plith yn negesydd Allah. Pe bai'n i ufuddhau i chi mewn llawer o'r mater, byddai chi yn anhawster, ond mae Allah endeared i chi ffydd ac wedi gwneud yn dda yn eich calonnau ac wedi gas i chi anghrediniaeth, herio'r ac anufudd-dod. Mae'r rheini'n dan arweiniad [iawn].

trans-unit.source: [It is] as bounty from Allah and favor. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: [Mae'n] fel bounty gan Allah a favor. Ac Allah yn gwybod a Wise.

trans-unit.source: And if two factions among the believers should fight, then make settlement between the two. But if one of them oppresses the other, then fight against the one that oppresses until it returns to the ordinance of Allah. And if it returns, then make settlement between them in justice and act justly. Indeed, Allah loves those who act justly.
trans-unit.target: Ac os dylai garfanau ddwy ymhlith y credinwyr yn ymladd, yna gwneud setliad rhwng y ddau. Ond os mae un ohonynt yn gormesu'r llall, yna ymladd yn erbyn yr un sy'n gormesu'r hyd nes y bydd yn dychwelyd i'r Ordnans Allah. Ac os bydd yn dychwelyd, wedyn gwneud setliad rhyngddynt mewn cyfiawnder a Deddf gyfiawn. Yn wir, mae'r Allah wrth ei bodd yn rhai sydd yn gweithredu'n gyfiawn.

trans-unit.source: The believers are but brothers, so make settlement between your brothers. And fear Allah that you may receive mercy.
trans-unit.target: Yn y credinwyr, ond brodyr, felly gwnewch yn setliad rhwng eich brodyr. Ac ofn Allah y gallech dderbyn drugaredd.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, let not a people ridicule [another] people; perhaps they may be better than them; nor let women ridicule [other] women; perhaps they may be better than them. And do not insult one another and do not call each other by [offensive] nicknames. Wretched is the name of disobedience after [one's] faith. And whoever does not repent - then it is those who are the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, gadewch i ni yn bobl a gwawdio pobl [arall]; Efallai y gall fod yn well na hwy; nac yn gadael menywod a gwawdio [arall] menywod; Efallai eu bod yn well na hwy. Peidiwch â difro un arall a Peidiwch â galw'r gilydd gan lysenwau bychanol [sarhaus]. Truenus yw enw'r anufudd-dod ar ôl [un] ffydd. A pwy bynnag nad yw'n edifarhau-yna mae'n rheini y tramgwyddo.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, avoid much [negative] assumption. Indeed, some assumption is sin. And do not spy or backbite each other. Would one of you like to eat the flesh of his brother when dead? You would detest it. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is Accepting of repentance and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, osgoi llawer o rhagdybiaeth [negyddol]. Yn wir, mae rhai rhagdybiaeth yw pechod. Ac nid ysbïo nac yn backbite gilydd. Hoffai un ohonoch ei fwyta cnawd ei frawd pan yn marw? Byddai ffieiddio at ei. Ac ofn Allah; yn wir, Allah yn dderbyn pedair a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: O mankind, indeed We have created you from male and female and made you peoples and tribes that you may know one another. Indeed, the most noble of you in the sight of Allah is the most righteous of you. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Acquainted.
trans-unit.target: O dynolryw, yn wir ydym wedi creu eich gwryw a benyw ac wedi eich pobl a llwythau y gwyddoch efallai un arall. Yn wir, noble fwyaf ohonoch yng ngolwg Allah yn fwyaf hoes dabloid ohonoch. Yn wir, Allah yn gwybod a Acquainted.

trans-unit.source: The bedouins say, "We have believed." Say, "You have not [yet] believed; but say [instead], 'We have submitted,' for faith has not yet entered your hearts. And if you obey Allah and His Messenger, He will not deprive you from your deeds of anything. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful."
trans-unit.target: Y bedouins yn dweud, "yr ydym yn credu." Dweud, "Mae ydych nid [eto] yn credu; ond dweud [yn hytrach], 'yr ydym wedi cyflwyno,' i ffydd nad yw eto wedi eich calonnau. Ac os yw eich bod yn ufuddhau Allah a ei negesydd, ef fydd amddifadu chi gan eich gweithredoedd o unrhyw beth. Yn wir, Allah yn Forgiving a Merciful."

trans-unit.source: The believers are only the ones who have believed in Allah and His Messenger and then doubt not but strive with their properties and their lives in the cause of Allah. It is those who are the truthful.
trans-unit.target: Y credinwyr yn unig y rhai sydd wedi credu yn Allah ac yn ei negesydd ac wedyn yn amau nad ond ymdrechu gyda eu heiddo a'u bywydau yn achos Allah. Mae'n rhai sy'n y geirwir.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Would you acquaint Allah with your religion while Allah knows whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, and Allah is Knowing of all things?"
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "byddai archebion Allah gyda eich crefydd er bod gwyr Allah beth bynnag yn y nefoedd a beth bynnag sydd ar y ddaear, a bod Allah yn gwybod am yr holl bethau?"

trans-unit.source: They consider it a favor to you that they have accepted Islam. Say, "Do not consider your Islam a favor to me. Rather, Allah has conferred favor upon you that He has guided you to the faith, if you should be truthful."
trans-unit.target: Maent yn ystyried ei favor i chi fod wedi derbyn Islam. Dweud, "nid yn ystyried eich Islam favor i mi. Yn hytrach, mae'r Allah a roddwyd favor arnoch y mae wedi'i dywys chi i'r y ffydd, os y dylech fod yn onest."

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah knows the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. And Allah is Seeing of what you do.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, gwyr Allah unseen [agweddau] y nefoedd a'r ddaear. A yw Allah yn gweld yr hyn yr ydych yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: Qaf. By the honored Qur'an...
trans-unit.target: Fframwaith sicrhau. Gan y Qur'an honored...

trans-unit.source: But they wonder that there has come to them a warner from among themselves, and the disbelievers say, "This is an amazing thing.
trans-unit.target: Ond maent yn tybied fod yno wedi dod iddynt warner o blith eu hunain, ac y disbelievers yn dweud, "Mae hwn yn beth rhyfeddol.

trans-unit.source: When we have died and have become dust, [we will return to life]? That is a distant return."
trans-unit.target: Pan ydym wedi marw ac wedi dod yn llwch, [Byddwn yn dychwelyd at fywyd]? Yn dychwelyd pell.

trans-unit.source: We know what the earth diminishes of them, and with Us is a retaining record.
trans-unit.target: Gwyddom beth y ddaear a lleihau ohonynt, a gyda ni yw cadw cofnod.

trans-unit.source: But they denied the truth when it came to them, so they are in a confused condition.
trans-unit.target: Ond gwadwyd y gwir pan ddaeth iddynt, fel eu bod mewn cyflwr dryslyd.

trans-unit.source: Have they not looked at the heaven above them - how We structured it and adorned it and [how] it has no rifts?
trans-unit.target: Nid ydynt wedi edrych ar y nefoedd uwch eu-sut y byddwn yn ei strwythuro ac addurno'r ei a [sut] Mae rhwygiadau oes?

trans-unit.source: And the earth - We spread it out and cast therein firmly set mountains and made grow therein [something] of every beautiful kind,
trans-unit.target: Y ddaear-ein lledaenu allan a cast weithredol gadarn mynyddoedd a dyfu ynddo [rhywbeth] o bob math hardd,

trans-unit.source: Giving insight and a reminder for every servant who turns [to Allah].
trans-unit.target: Rhoi mewnwelediad a nodyn atgoffa i bob gwas sydd yn troi [i Allah].

trans-unit.source: And We have sent down blessed rain from the sky and made grow thereby gardens and grain from the harvest
trans-unit.target: A ydym wedi anfon i lawr glaw Bendigaid gan y sky ac wedi tyfu gan gerddi a grawn y cynhaeaf

trans-unit.source: And lofty palm trees having fruit arranged in layers -
trans-unit.target: A threfnir goed palmwydd canmoladwy yn cael ffrwyth mewn haenau-

trans-unit.source: As provision for the servants, and We have given life thereby to a dead land. Thus is the resurrection.
trans-unit.target: Mae fel darpariaeth ar gyfer y gweision, ac yr ydym wedi rhoi bywyd ac felly i dir marw. Felly yn yr atgyfodiad.

trans-unit.source: The people of Noah denied before them, and the companions of the well and Thamud
trans-unit.target: Gwadodd y bobl o Noah cyn iddynt, a chymdeithion y dda a Thamud

trans-unit.source: And 'Aad and Pharaoh and the brothers of Lot
trans-unit.target: A ' Aad a Ffaro a brodyr llawer

trans-unit.source: And the companions of the thicket and the people of Tubba'. All denied the messengers, so My threat was justly fulfilled.
trans-unit.target: A chymdeithion y thicket a phobl Tubba'. Gwadodd holl negeswyr, fel oedd fy bygythiad gyfiawn bodlon.

trans-unit.source: Did We fail in the first creation? But they are in confusion over a new creation.
trans-unit.target: Oedd yn methu yn creu cyntaf? Ond maent yn ddryswch dros greu newydd.

trans-unit.source: And We have already created man and know what his soul whispers to him, and We are closer to him than [his] jugular vein
trans-unit.target: A ydym eisoes wedi creu dyn ac yn gwybod beth y mae ei enaid yn ei sibrwd wrtho, ac yr ydym yn agosach ato nag gwythiennau ceffyl [ei]

trans-unit.source: When the two receivers receive, seated on the right and on the left.
trans-unit.target: Pan gânt y derbynwyr dau, yn eistedd ar y dde ac ar y chwith.

trans-unit.source: Man does not utter any word except that with him is an observer prepared [to record].
trans-unit.target: Nid yw dyn yn yngan unrhyw air ac eithrio bod gydag ef yn sylwedydd yn barod [i gofnodi].

trans-unit.source: And the intoxication of death will bring the truth; that is what you were trying to avoid.
trans-unit.target: A ddaw y meddwdod o farwolaeth y gwir; Dyna beth yr oeddech yn ceisio ei osgoi.

trans-unit.source: And the Horn will be blown. That is the Day of [carrying out] the threat.
trans-unit.target: A bydd chwythu y corn. Hynny yw, y diwrnod [cynnal] y bygythiad.

trans-unit.source: And every soul will come, with it a driver and a witness.
trans-unit.target: A bob enaid ddaw, â gyrrwr a'r tyst.

trans-unit.source: [It will be said], "You were certainly in unmindfulness of this, and We have removed from you your cover, so your sight, this Day, is sharp."
trans-unit.target: [Bydd dweud], "eich bod yn sicr yn unmindfulness o hyn, ac rydym wedi dileu gennych eich gorchudd, felly eich golwg, y dydd hwn, yn sydyn."

trans-unit.source: And his companion, [the angel], will say, "This [record] is what is with me, prepared."
trans-unit.target: Ac a'i gydymaith, [yr angel], bydd yn dweud, "hwn [Cofnod] yw beth yw gyda mi, yn barod."

trans-unit.source: [Allah will say], "Throw into Hell every obstinate disbeliever,
trans-unit.target: [Bydd Allah yn dweud], "daflu i uffern bob disbeliever obstinate,

trans-unit.source: Preventer of good, aggressor, and doubter,
trans-unit.target: Preventer da, aggressor, a doubter,

trans-unit.source: Who made [as equal] with Allah another deity; then throw him into the severe punishment."
trans-unit.target: Pwy wnaeth [yn gyfartal] gyda Allah Dduwdod arall; wedyn taflu ef y gosb difrifol."

trans-unit.source: His [devil] companion will say, "Our Lord, I did not make him transgress, but he [himself] was in extreme error."
trans-unit.target: Bydd a'i gydymaith [diafol] yn dweud, "Ein Arglwydd, nid, oedd yn gwneud iddo camddefnyddio'u, ond ef [ei hun] oedd mewn camgymeriad eithafol."

trans-unit.source: [Allah] will say, "Do not dispute before Me, while I had already presented to you the warning.
trans-unit.target: Bydd [Allah] yn dweud, "Nid amau cyn imi, tra roedd yr wyf eisoes wedi cyflwyno i chi y rhybudd.

trans-unit.source: The word will not be changed with Me, and never will I be unjust to the servants."
trans-unit.target: Ddim yn newid y gair gyda mi, a byth bydd yn anghyfiawn y gweision."

trans-unit.source: On the Day We will say to Hell, "Have you been filled?" and it will say, "Are there some more,"
trans-unit.target: Ar y diwrnod a bydd yn dweud i uffern, bydd "Ydych wedi'u llenwi?" ac mae'n dweud, "A oes rhai mwy"

trans-unit.source: And Paradise will be brought near to the righteous, not far,
trans-unit.target: A bydd paradwys yn dod ger y righteous, nid llawer,

trans-unit.source: [It will be said], "This is what you were promised - for every returner [to Allah] and keeper [of His covenant]
trans-unit.target: [Bydd dweud], "Dyma'r hyn yr ydych yn addo-ar gyfer pob dychwelyd [i Allah] a ceidwad [ei cyfamod]

trans-unit.source: Who feared the Most Merciful unseen and came with a heart returning [in repentance].
trans-unit.target: Sy'n ofni unseen mwyaf tosturiol a ddaeth gyda chalon dychwelyd [mewn pedair].

trans-unit.source: Enter it in peace. This is the Day of Eternity."
trans-unit.target: Ymuno mewn heddwch. Dyma ddiwrnod Eternity.

trans-unit.source: They will have whatever they wish therein, and with Us is more.
trans-unit.target: Bydd ganddynt beth bynnag maent yn dymuno ynddo, a gyda ni yn fwy.

trans-unit.source: And how many a generation before them did We destroy who were greater than them in [striking] power and had explored throughout the lands. Is there any place of escape?
trans-unit.target: A sawl cenhedlaeth cyn iddynt oedd dinistrio sydd yn fwy na hwy mewn pŵer [trawiadol] ac wedi edrych ar draws y tiroedd. A oes unrhyw waith dianc?

trans-unit.source: Indeed in that is a reminder for whoever has a heart or who listens while he is present [in mind].
trans-unit.target: Yn wir yn hynny yn ein hatgoffa am bwy bynnag sydd â chalon neu sy'n gwrando tra ei fod yn bresennol [mewn cof].

trans-unit.source: And We did certainly create the heavens and earth and what is between them in six days, and there touched Us no weariness.
trans-unit.target: A oedd yn sicr yn creu y nefoedd a ddaear a beth yn rhyngddynt yn chwe diwrnod, ac mae wedi ein cyffwrdd ni flinder.

trans-unit.source: So be patient, [O Muhammad], over what they say and exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting,
trans-unit.target: Felly byddwch yn amyneddgar, [O Muhammad], dros beth maen nhw'n ddweud a exalt [Allah] gyda chanmoliaeth eich Arglwydd cyn codi yr haul a cyn ei lleoliad,

trans-unit.source: And [in part] of the night exalt Him and after prostration.
trans-unit.target: Ac [yn rhannol] ef yn exalt y nos ac ar ôl prostration.

trans-unit.source: And listen on the Day when the Caller will call out from a place that is near -
trans-unit.target: A gwrando ar y diwrnod pan fydd y galwr yn galw allan o le sydd yn agos at-

trans-unit.source: The Day they will hear the blast [of the Horn] in truth. That is the Day of Emergence [from the graves].
trans-unit.target: Y diwrnod a byddant yn clywed y chwyth [o gorn] mewn gwirionedd. Dyna'r diwrnod ymddangosiad [o feddau].

trans-unit.source: Indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and to Us is the destination
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, ni sydd yn rhoi bywyd ac achosi marwolaeth, ac i ni yn y gyrchfan

trans-unit.source: On the Day the earth breaks away from them [and they emerge] rapidly; that is a gathering easy for Us.
trans-unit.target: Ar y diwrnod y mae y ddaear yn torri oddi arnynt [ac iddynt ymddangos] gyflym; Mae casglu yn hawdd i ni.

trans-unit.source: We are most knowing of what they say, and you are not over them a tyrant. But remind by the Qur'an whoever fears My threat.
trans-unit.target: Rydym yn gwybod fwyaf am yr hyn y maent yn ei ddweud, ac nid ydych dros eu tyrant. Ond atgoffa gan y Qur'an pwy bynnag sy'n ofni fy bygythiad.

trans-unit.source: By those [winds] scattering [dust] dispersing
trans-unit.target: Gan hynny [gwyntoedd] scattering [llwch] wasgaru

trans-unit.source: And those [clouds] carrying a load [of water]
trans-unit.target: A hynny [cymylau] cario llwyth [o dŵr]

trans-unit.source: And those [ships] sailing with ease
trans-unit.target: A hynny llongau hwylio yn rhwydd

trans-unit.source: And those [angels] apportioning [each] matter,
trans-unit.target: A hynny [angylion] mater dosrannu [bob],

trans-unit.source: Indeed, what you are promised is true.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, addawyd gennych yn wir.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, the recompense is to occur.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, yn ad-dalu i ddigwydd.

trans-unit.source: By the heaven containing pathways,
trans-unit.target: Gan y nefoedd sy'n cynnwys llwybrau,

trans-unit.source: Indeed, you are in differing speech.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, yr ydych yn araith gwahanol.

trans-unit.source: Deluded away from the Qur'an is he who is deluded.
trans-unit.target: Eich oddi wrth y Qur'an yw ef a yw eich.

trans-unit.source: Destroyed are the falsifiers
trans-unit.target: Dinistrio yn y falsifiers

trans-unit.source: Who are within a flood [of confusion] and heedless.
trans-unit.target: Ydynt o fewn llifogydd [o ddryswch] a heedless.

trans-unit.source: They ask, "When is the Day of Recompense?"
trans-unit.target: Maent yn gofyn, "Pryd y mae y dydd o iawndal?"

trans-unit.source: [It is] the Day they will be tormented over the Fire
trans-unit.target: [Mae'n] y dydd iddynt a bydd yn parhau'n dros y tân

trans-unit.source: [And will be told], "Taste your torment. This is that for which you were impatient."
trans-unit.target: [A bydd yn cael gwybod], "blas eich boen. Dyma y eich bod yn ddiamynedd.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and springs,
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, fydd y righteous ymhlith gerddi a'r springs,

trans-unit.source: Accepting what their Lord has given them. Indeed, they were before that doers of good.
trans-unit.target: Dderbyn eu Arglwydd wedi rhoi iddynt. Yn wir, yr oeddent cyn y phoenwn da.

trans-unit.source: They used to sleep but little of the night,
trans-unit.target: Defnyddiwyd i gysgu ond ychydig o'r nos,

trans-unit.source: And in the hours before dawn they would ask forgiveness,
trans-unit.target: Ac yn yr oriau cyn dawn byddent yn gofyn maddeuant,

trans-unit.source: And from their properties was [given] the right of the [needy] petitioner and the deprived.
trans-unit.target: Ac o'u heiddo oedd [gan] hawl y deisebydd [anghenus] a y difreintiedig.

trans-unit.source: And on the earth are signs for the certain [in faith]
trans-unit.target: Ac ar y ddaear arwyddion ar gyfer rhai [mewn ffydd]

trans-unit.source: And in yourselves. Then will you not see?
trans-unit.target: Ac yn eich hunain. Yna ni welwch?

trans-unit.source: And in the heaven is your provision and whatever you are promised.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn y nefoedd yn eich darpariaeth a beth bynnag yr ydych yn ei addo.

trans-unit.source: Then by the Lord of the heaven and earth, indeed, it is truth - just as [sure as] it is that you are speaking.
trans-unit.target: Yna gan yr Arglwydd y nefoedd a'r ddaear, yn wir, mae'n wirionedd-dim ond fel [siwr fel] Mae'n eich bod yn siarad.

trans-unit.source: Has there reached you the story of the honored guests of Abraham? -
trans-unit.target: Wedi cyrraedd eich Mae stori y gwesteion honored o Abraham? -

trans-unit.source: When they entered upon him and said, "[We greet you with] peace." He answered, "[And upon you] peace, [you are] a people unknown.
trans-unit.target: Pan fyddant yn dechrau arno a dywedodd, "[Rydym yn cyfarch chi gyda] heddwch." Atebodd, "[a chi] heddwch, [ydych] yn bobl anhysbys.

trans-unit.source: Then he went to his family and came with a fat [roasted] calf
trans-unit.target: Yna aeth at ei deulu a ddaeth gyda'r lloi [rhost] braster

trans-unit.source: And placed it near them; he said, "Will you not eat?"
trans-unit.target: Ac yn agos atynt; Dywedodd, "Bydd yn bwyta?"

trans-unit.source: And he felt from them apprehension. They said, "Fear not," and gave him good tidings of a learned boy.
trans-unit.target: A theimlai eu pryder. Maent yn dweud, "Ofni nad", ac iddo'n tidings da bachgen dysgedig.

trans-unit.source: And his wife approached with a cry [of alarm] and struck her face and said, "[I am] a barren old woman!"
trans-unit.target: A'i wraig wedi cysylltu â â chri [o larwm] a taro ei hwyneb a dywedodd, "[Rwy'n] menyw hen hesb!"

trans-unit.source: They said, "Thus has said your Lord; indeed, He is the Wise, the Knowing."
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "felly mae dweud eich Arglwydd; yn wir, ef yw y Wise, y mae gwybod."

trans-unit.source: [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd [Abraham], "yna beth yw eich busnes [yma], O negeswyr?"

trans-unit.source: They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals
trans-unit.target: Maent yn dweud, "yn wir, rydym wedi ei anfon at bobl o droseddwyr

trans-unit.source: To send down upon them stones of clay,
trans-unit.target: Anfon i lawr ar eu cerrig clai,

trans-unit.source: Marked in the presence of your Lord for the transgressors."
trans-unit.target: Amlwg ym mhresenoldeb eich Arglwydd am y transgressors."

trans-unit.source: So We brought out whoever was in the cities of the believers.
trans-unit.target: Felly daethom allan pwy bynnag oedd yn y dinasoedd y credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: And We found not within them other than a [single] house of Muslims.
trans-unit.target: Ac ni welsom ni ynddynt ac eithrio [un] tŷ o Foslemiaid.

trans-unit.source: And We left therein a sign for those who fear the painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: A gadael yr ydym ynddo arwydd ar gyfer y rhai sy'n ofni y gosb poenus.

trans-unit.source: And in Moses [was a sign], when We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn Moses [yr oedd yn arwydd], pan ydym anfon ato i Ffaro gyda'r awdurdod clir.

trans-unit.source: But he turned away with his supporters and said," A magician or a madman."
trans-unit.target: Ond trodd ef i ffwrdd gyda ei gefnogwyr a dweud,"consuriwr neu madman."

trans-unit.source: So We took him and his soldiers and cast them into the sea, and he was blameworthy.
trans-unit.target: Felly cymerasom ef a ei filwyr a eu bwrw i'r môr, ac ef oedd mae'r bai'n.

trans-unit.source: And in 'Aad [was a sign], when We sent against them the barren wind.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn ' Aad [yr oedd yn arwydd], pan ydym wedi anfon yn eu herbyn y gwynt hesb.

trans-unit.source: It left nothing of what it came upon but that it made it like disintegrated ruins.
trans-unit.target: Mae ei bod wedi gadael dim o'r hyn a ddaeth ar ond y gwnaeth ei hoffi adfeilion ymddatodedig.

trans-unit.source: And in Thamud, when it was said to them, "Enjoy yourselves for a time."
trans-unit.target: Ac yn Thamud, pan ddywedwyd iddynt, "yn mwynhau amser."

trans-unit.source: But they were insolent toward the command of their Lord, so the thunderbolt seized them while they were looking on.
trans-unit.target: Ond roeddent yn digywilydd tuag at y feistrolaeth ar eu yr Arglwydd, felly roedd y daranfollt yn hatafaelu iddynt tra roeddent yn edrych.

trans-unit.source: And they were unable to arise, nor could they defend themselves.
trans-unit.target: A oeddent yn gallu codi, nac gellid eu hamddiffyn eu hunain.

trans-unit.source: And [We destroyed] the people of Noah before; indeed, they were a people defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: A [dinistrio ein] bobl Noah cyn; yn wir, yr oeddent yn bobl defiantly anufudd.

trans-unit.source: And the heaven We constructed with strength, and indeed, We are [its] expander.
trans-unit.target: Ac y Duw eu hadeiladu gyda nerth, ac yn wir, yr ydym yn expander [ei].

trans-unit.source: And the earth We have spread out, and excellent is the preparer.
trans-unit.target: Ac y ddaear yr ydym wedi lledu, ac ardderchog yn y preparer.

trans-unit.source: And of all things We created two mates; perhaps you will remember.
trans-unit.target: Ac am yr holl bethau rydym wedi creu dau ffrindiau; Efallai y byddwch yn cofio.

trans-unit.source: So flee to Allah. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.
trans-unit.target: Felly ffoi i Allah. Yn wir, yr wyf i chi oddi wrtho warner clir.

trans-unit.source: And do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid yn gwneud [yn gyfartal] gyda Allah Dduwdod arall. Yn wir, yr wyf i chi oddi wrtho warner clir.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, there came not to those before them any messenger except that they said, "A magician or a madman."
trans-unit.target: Yn yr un modd, mae ddaeth nid i'r rheini cyn iddynt unrhyw negesydd heblaw y maent yn dweud, "consuriwr neu madman."

trans-unit.source: Did they suggest it to them? Rather, they [themselves] are a transgressing people.
trans-unit.target: Oedd awgrymu hynny iddynt? Yn hytrach, maent [eu hunain] yn bobl sy'n camweddu sawl gwaith.

trans-unit.source: So leave them, [O Muhammad], for you are not to be blamed.
trans-unit.target: Felly gadael iddynt, [O Muhammad], ar gyfer ydych nid i'w beio.

trans-unit.source: And remind, for indeed, the reminder benefits the believers.
trans-unit.target: Ac atgoffa, i yn wir, y mae y nodyn atgoffa yn fudd y credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: And I did not create the jinn and mankind except to worship Me.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oedd creu jinn a dynolryw ac eithrio i addoli.

trans-unit.source: I do not want from them any provision, nor do I want them to feed Me.
trans-unit.target: Nid wyf am unrhyw ddarpariaeth oddi wrthynt, ac ni ddymunaf i fwydo Me.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, it is Allah who is the [continual] Provider, the firm possessor of strength.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, mae'n Allah sy'n y darparwr [parhaus], possessor cadarn o gryfder.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, for those who have wronged is a portion [of punishment] like the portion of their predecessors, so let them not impatiently urge Me.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, ar gyfer y rhai sydd wedi cam yw dogn [o gosb] fel y gyfran o eu rhagflaenwyr, felly gadewch iddynt yn ddiamynedd annog Me.

trans-unit.source: And woe to those who have disbelieved from their Day which they are promised.
trans-unit.target: A gwae i'r rhai sydd wedi ddysgais eu diwrnod y maent yn ei addo.

trans-unit.source: By the mount
trans-unit.target: Gan mount

trans-unit.source: And [by] a Book inscribed
trans-unit.target: A [gan] llyfr arsgrifio

trans-unit.source: In parchment spread open
trans-unit.target: Yn femrwn lledaenu agored

trans-unit.source: And [by] the frequented House
trans-unit.target: A [gan] frequented House

trans-unit.source: And [by] the heaven raised high
trans-unit.target: Ac [gan] y nefoedd codi uchel

trans-unit.source: And [by] the sea filled [with fire],
trans-unit.target: A [gan] y môr yn llawn [tân],

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the punishment of your Lord will occur.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, bydd y gosb o eich Arglwydd yn digwydd.

trans-unit.source: Of it there is no preventer.
trans-unit.target: Nid oes unrhyw preventer ohono.

trans-unit.source: On the Day the heaven will sway with circular motion
trans-unit.target: Ar y diwrnod y bydd y nefoedd yn siglo gyda'r cynnig Cylchlythyr

trans-unit.source: And the mountains will pass on, departing -
trans-unit.target: A bydd y mynyddoedd yn pasio ar ymadael-

trans-unit.source: Then woe, that Day, to the deniers,
trans-unit.target: Yna gwae, y diwrnod hwnnw, llosg,

trans-unit.source: Who are in [empty] discourse amusing themselves.
trans-unit.target: Ydynt mewn disgwrs [gwag] ddoniol eu hunain.

trans-unit.source: The Day they are thrust toward the fire of Hell with a [violent] thrust, [its angels will say],
trans-unit.target: Y dydd yn maent yn gwthio tuag at y tân uffern â byrdwn [treisgar], [bydd ei angylion yn dweud],

trans-unit.source: "This is the Fire which you used to deny.
trans-unit.target: Dyma y tân a ddefnyddiwyd gennych i wadu.

trans-unit.source: Then is this magic, or do you not see?
trans-unit.target: Yna mae hud hwn, neu nid ydych yn gweld?

trans-unit.source: [Enter to] burn therein; then be patient or impatient - it is all the same for you. You are only being recompensed [for] what you used to do."
trans-unit.target: [[Rhowch i] losgi ynddo; yna yn claf neu ddiamynedd-mae'n holl yr un peth i chi. Mae chi dim ond cael ei had-dalu am beth yr ydych yn ei defnyddio i wneud."

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and pleasure,
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, bydd y righteous mewn gerddi a phleser,

trans-unit.source: Enjoying what their Lord has given them, and their Lord protected them from the punishment of Hellfire.
trans-unit.target: Wedi mwynhau pa Arglwydd eu rhoi iddynt, ac roedd eu yr Arglwydd yn eu hamddiffyn rhag cosbi Hellfire.

trans-unit.source: [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do."
trans-unit.target: [Bydd wrthynt], "Bwyta ac yfed mewn boddhad am beth yr ydych yn ei defnyddio i wneud."

trans-unit.source: They will be reclining on thrones lined up, and We will marry them to fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes.
trans-unit.target: Bydd ledorwedd gyda hi ar thrones bediatrig, a bydd gennym iddynt briodi i fenywod deg gyda llygaid mawr, [hardd].

trans-unit.source: And those who believed and whose descendants followed them in faith - We will join with them their descendants, and We will not deprive them of anything of their deeds. Every person, for what he earned, is retained.
trans-unit.target: A'r rhai sydd yn credu ac mae eu disgynyddion yn eu dilyn yn ffydd-byddwn yn ymuno â nhw a'u disgynyddion, a byddwn ni yn amddifadu iddynt am unrhyw beth o eu gweithredoedd. Ar gyfer beth y mae wedi ei ennill, cedwir pob person.

trans-unit.source: And We will provide them with fruit and meat from whatever they desire.
trans-unit.target: A byddwn yn rhoi ffrwythau a cig o beth bynnag yn eu dymuno.

trans-unit.source: They will exchange with one another a cup [of wine] wherein [results] no ill speech or commission of sin.
trans-unit.target: Bydd eu cyfnewid â'i gilydd Cwpan [o win] lle [canlyniadau] unrhyw araith sâl neu Comisiwn pechod.

trans-unit.source: There will circulate among them [servant] boys [especially] for them, as if they were pearls well-protected.
trans-unit.target: Yna bydd yn dosbarthu ymysg eu [was] bechgyn [enwedig] iddynt, fel pe baent yn pearls cael ei ddiogelu'n dda.

trans-unit.source: And they will approach one another, inquiring of each other.
trans-unit.target: A bydd yn mynd at un a'r llall, holi pob un arall.

trans-unit.source: They will say, "Indeed, we were previously among our people fearful [of displeasing Allah].
trans-unit.target: Byddant yn dweud, "yn wir, yr oeddem o'r blaen ymysg ein pobl yn ofni [displeasing Allah].

trans-unit.source: So Allah conferred favor upon us and protected us from the punishment of the Scorching Fire.
trans-unit.target: Felly Allah a roddwyd favor ar ein gwarthaf, ac ein hamddiffyn rhag y gosb y tân Scorching.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, we used to supplicate Him before. Indeed, it is He who is the Beneficent, the Merciful."
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, rydym yn defnyddio i supplicate ef o'r blaen. Yn wir, mae'n ef sydd yn y Beneficent, y Merciful."

trans-unit.source: So remind [O Muhammad], for you are not, by the favor of your Lord, a soothsayer or a madman.
trans-unit.target: Felly atgoffa [O Muhammad], ar gyfer yr ydych nid, gan favor eich Arglwydd, soothsayer neu madman.

trans-unit.source: Or do they say [of you], "A poet for whom we await a misfortune of time?"
