trans-unit.target: Nid ydych wedi ystyried rhai sy'n ymarfer ragrith, yn dweud wrth eu brodyr sydd wedi ddysgais ymhlith pobl yr ysgrythur, "Os ydych yn ei ddiarddel, byddwn yn sicr yn gadael gyda chi, a bydd gennym ni ufuddhau, mewn perthynas â chi, neb-erioed; ac os ydych yn ymladd, rydym yn sicr yn gymorth ichi. Ond bydd Allah yn tystio eu bod yn gelwyddgwn.

trans-unit.source: If they are expelled, they will not leave with them, and if they are fought, they will not aid them. And [even] if they should aid them, they will surely turn their backs; then [thereafter] they will not be aided.
trans-unit.target: Os cânt eu diarddel, na fydd gadael gyda hwy, ac os ydynt yn ymladd, fydd maent yn gymorth iddynt. A [hyd yn oed] os dylid eu cynorthwyo, maent yn sicr yn troi eu cefnau; yna [hynny] bydd iddynt nad yw fod o gymorth.

trans-unit.source: You [believers] are more fearful within their breasts than Allah. That is because they are a people who do not understand.
trans-unit.target: [Credinwyr] yr ydych yn fwy ofnus o fewn eu bronnau na Allah. Mae hynny oherwydd eu bod yn bobl nad ydynt yn deall.

trans-unit.source: They will not fight you all except within fortified cities or from behind walls. Their violence among themselves is severe. You think they are together, but their hearts are diverse. That is because they are a people who do not reason.
trans-unit.target: Ni byddant yn ymladd eich pob un ac eithrio o fewn dinasoedd caerog neu o'r tu ôl i waliau. Eu trais ymysg eu hunain yn ddifrifol. Ydych yn meddwl eu bod gyda'i gilydd, ond eu calonnau yn amrywiol. Mae hynny oherwydd eu bod yn bobl sydd nid oes reswm.

trans-unit.source: [Theirs is] like the example of those shortly before them: they tasted the bad consequence of their affair, and they will have a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: [Hwy yw'r] fel yr enghraifft o hynny cyn bo hir ger eu bron: Roedd eu blasu gwael o ganlyniad i ddigwyddiad eu, a bydd ganddynt cosb poenus.

trans-unit.source: [The hypocrites are] like the example of Satan when he says to man, "Disbelieve." But when he disbelieves, he says, "Indeed, I am disassociated from you. Indeed, I fear Allah, Lord of the worlds."
trans-unit.target: [Yn y rhagrithwyr] fel yr enghraifft o Satan pan y dywed i dyn, a "Chredu." Ond pan y mae ef yn ei disbelieves, meddai, "yn wir, yr wyf yr datgysylltu oddi wrthych. Yn wir, mae arnaf ofn Allah, Arglwydd y byd."

trans-unit.source: So the outcome for both of them is that they will be in the Fire, abiding eternally therein. And that is the recompense of the wrong-doers.
trans-unit.target: Felly y canlyniad ar gyfer y ddau ohonynt y byddant yn y tân, yn ufudd i'r fythol ynddo. A dyna iawndal phoenwn anghywir.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, fear Allah. And let every soul look to what it has put forth for tomorrow - and fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, ofn Allah. A gadewch bob enaid edrych i hyn wedi rhoi blaen ar gyfer yfory-ac ofn Allah. Yn wir, yw Allah yn gyfarwydd â beth yr ydych yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: And be not like those who forgot Allah, so He made them forget themselves. Those are the defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid fel y rhai sydd wedi anghofio Allah, felly mae'n gwneud iddynt anghofio eu hunain. Rhai yn defiantly anufudd.

trans-unit.source: Not equal are the companions of the Fire and the companions of Paradise. The companions of Paradise - they are the attainers [of success].
trans-unit.target: Nid cyfartal yn y cymdeithion y tân a chymdeithion o baradwys. Chymdeithion o baradwys-maent yn gyrraeddwyr [o lwyddiant].

trans-unit.source: If We had sent down this Qur'an upon a mountain, you would have seen it humbled and coming apart from fear of Allah. And these examples We present to the people that perhaps they will give thought.
trans-unit.target: Pe baem wedi anfon i lawr y Qur'an ar Fynydd, byddech wedi gweld ei teimlwn yn wylaidd yng a dod ar wahân i ofn Allah. Ac enghreifftiau hyn rydym yn eu cyflwyno i bobl sydd efallai y bydd rhoi meddwl.

trans-unit.source: He is Allah, other than whom there is no deity, Knower of the unseen and the witnessed. He is the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ef yw Allah, heblaw ef nid oes dim Dduwdod, Knower unseen y a y a welir. Mae y cwbl tosturiol, enwedig tosturiol.

trans-unit.source: He is Allah, other than whom there is no deity, the Sovereign, the Pure, the Perfection, the Bestower of Faith, the Overseer, the Exalted in Might, the Compeller, the Superior. Exalted is Allah above whatever they associate with Him.
trans-unit.target: Ef yw Allah, heblaw ef nid oes dim Dduwdod, sofran, y Pure, y perffeithrwydd, Bestower ffydd, y goruchwylydd, Exalted efallai, y Compeller, Rhagori. I'w mawrygu yw Allah uchod beth bynnag maent cysylltiol ag ef.

trans-unit.source: He is Allah, the Creator, the Inventor, the Fashioner; to Him belong the best names. Whatever is in the heavens and earth is exalting Him. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Ei fod yn Allah, y crëwr, y dyfeisiwr, y Fashioner; perthyn yr enwau gorau iddo. Beth bynnag sydd yn y nefoedd a'r ddaear yn exalting iddo. Ac ef yw Exalted yn efallai, yn y doeth.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not take My enemies and your enemies as allies, extending to them affection while they have disbelieved in what came to you of the truth, having driven out the Prophet and yourselves [only] because you believe in Allah, your Lord. If you have come out for jihad in My cause and seeking means to My approval, [take them not as friends]. You confide to them affection, but I am most knowing of what you have concealed and what you have declared. And whoever does it among you has certainly strayed from the soundness of the way.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, nid ydynt yn fy gelynion a eich gelynion fel cynghreiriaid, ymestyn eu hoffter tra maent wedi ddysgais yn beth ddaeth i chi am y gwir, yn cael eu gyrru allan y Proffwyd a chi [ond] am y credwch yn Allah, eich Arglwydd. Os ydych wedi dod allan ar gyfer jihad yn fy achos ac yn chwilio am ffordd i 'm cymeradwyaeth, [cymryd nid fel ffrindiau]. Mae eich ymddiried iddynt hoffter, ond yr wyf yn gwybod rhan fwyaf o'r hyn yr ydych wedi ei chuddio a beth yr ydych wedi ei datgan. A pwy bynnag sy'n gwneud eich plith wedi crwydro yn sicr o gadernid y ffordd.

trans-unit.source: If they gain dominance over you, they would be to you as enemies and extend against you their hands and their tongues with evil, and they wish you would disbelieve.
trans-unit.target: Os ydynt yn cael goruchafiaeth dros chi, byddent yn i chi fel gelynion ac ymestyn yn eich erbyn eu dwylo ac eu dafod â drygioni, a dymunant byddech chi yn ei chredu.

trans-unit.source: Never will your relatives or your children benefit you; the Day of Resurrection He will judge between you. And Allah, of what you do, is Seeing.
trans-unit.target: Byth y bydd eich perthnasau neu eich plant fudd chi; Bydd dydd atgyfodi ef yn barnu rhwng chi. A yw Allah, yr hyn yr ydych yn ei wneud, yn ei gweld.

trans-unit.source: There has already been for you an excellent pattern in Abraham and those with him, when they said to their people, "Indeed, we are disassociated from you and from whatever you worship other than Allah. We have denied you, and there has appeared between us and you animosity and hatred forever until you believe in Allah alone" except for the saying of Abraham to his father, "I will surely ask forgiveness for you, but I have not [power to do] for you anything against Allah. Our Lord, upon You we have relied, and to You we have returned, and to You is the destination.
trans-unit.target: Eisoes wedi i chi batrwm rhagorol yn Abraham a rhai gydag ef, pan y dywedodd eu pobl, "yn wir, rydym yn datgysylltu oddi wrthych chi ac eraill na Allah yn addoli o beth bynnag. Rydym wedi gwadu ichi, ac mae wedi ymddangos rhwng ni a chi drwgdeimlad a chasineb am byth nes yr ydych yn credu mewn Allah unig"ac eithrio dweud Abraham i'w dad," bydd yn sicr o ofyn maddeuant i chi, ond nid wyf wedi [pŵer i wneud] i chi unrhyw beth erbyn Allah. Ein Arglwydd, yr ydym wedi dibynnu arnoch chi, ac i chi wedi dychwelyd, ac i chi yn y gyrchfan.

trans-unit.source: Our Lord, make us not [objects of] torment for the disbelievers and forgive us, our Lord. Indeed, it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise."
trans-unit.target: Ein Arglwydd, yn ein gwneud ni [gwrthrychau] boen ar gyfer y disbelievers a maddau inni, ein Arglwydd. Yn wir, mae'n chi sydd Exalted yn efallai, yn y doeth."

trans-unit.source: There has certainly been for you in them an excellent pattern for anyone whose hope is in Allah and the Last Day. And whoever turns away - then indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.
trans-unit.target: Yn sicr bu i chi yn eu patrwm ardderchog ar gyfer unrhyw un eu gobaith yw Allah yn y dydd diwethaf. A pwy bynnag sydd yn troi i ffwrdd-ac yna yn wir, Allah yn rhad ac am ddim o angen, y Praiseworthy.

trans-unit.source: Perhaps Allah will put, between you and those to whom you have been enemies among them, affection. And Allah is competent, and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Efallai y bydd Allah yn rhoi, rhyngoch chi a rhai i bwy ydych wedi bod yn elynion yn eu plith, hoffter. A Allah yn gymwys, a bod Allah yn Forgiving ac yn Merciful.

trans-unit.source: Allah does not forbid you from those who do not fight you because of religion and do not expel you from your homes - from being righteous toward them and acting justly toward them. Indeed, Allah loves those who act justly.
trans-unit.target: Allah nid yn gwaredo chi gan y rheini sy'n wneud nid ymladd chi oherwydd crefydd ac nid oes ddiarddel chi eich cartrefi-yn cael eu hoes dabloid tuag atynt a gweithredu yn gyfiawn tuag at y. Yn wir, mae'r Allah wrth ei bodd yn rhai sydd yn gweithredu'n gyfiawn.

trans-unit.source: Allah only forbids you from those who fight you because of religion and expel you from your homes and aid in your expulsion - [forbids] that you make allies of them. And whoever makes allies of them, then it is those who are the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Dim ond mae'r Allah yn gwahardd chi gan y rhai sy'n ymladd ei chi oherwydd crefydd a ddiarddel chi gan eich cartrefi a chymorth yn eich diarddel-[gwahardd] eich bod yn gwneud cynghreiriaid ohonynt. A pwy bynnag sy'n gwneud cynghreiriaid ohonynt, yna mae'n rheini y tramgwyddo.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when the believing women come to you as emigrants, examine them. Allah is most knowing as to their faith. And if you know them to be believers, then do not return them to the disbelievers; they are not lawful [wives] for them, nor are they lawful [husbands] for them. But give the disbelievers what they have spent. And there is no blame upon you if you marry them when you have given them their due compensation. And hold not to marriage bonds with disbelieving women, but ask for what you have spent and let them ask for what they have spent. That is the judgement of Allah; He judges between you. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, pan ddaw menywod believing i chi fel ymfudwyr o Gymru, ei archwilio. Allah yn gwybod rhan fwyaf o ran eu ffydd. Ac os ydych yn gwybod eu bod yn gredinwyr, wedyn wneud Nid dychwelyd i'r disbelievers; Maent nid yn gyfreithlon [gwragedd] iddynt, ac nid ydynt yn gyfreithlon [gwŷr] ar eu cyfer. Ond yn rhoi y disbelievers hyn wedi cael ei wario. Ac nid oes unrhyw fai arnoch os mae chi briodi iddynt pan ydych wedi rhoi eu iawndal sydd yn ddyledus iddynt. A dal beidio â bondiau priodas gyda menywod disbelieving, ond yn gofyn am yr hyn yr ydych wedi ei wario a gadewch iddyn nhw ofyn am beth y maent wedi treulio. Dyna y dyfarniad Allah; Mae ef yn barnu rhwng chi. Ac Allah yn gwybod a Wise.

trans-unit.source: And if you have lost any of your wives to the disbelievers and you subsequently obtain [something], then give those whose wives have gone the equivalent of what they had spent. And fear Allah, in whom you are believers.
trans-unit.target: Ac os ydych wedi colli unrhyw un o'r eich gwragedd i y disbelievers ac wedyn cewch [rhywbeth], yna rhoi rhai wedi eu gwragedd sy'n cyfateb i hyn wedi cael ei wario. Ac ofn Allah, yn bwy ydych credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: O Prophet, when the believing women come to you pledging to you that they will not associate anything with Allah, nor will they steal, nor will they commit unlawful sexual intercourse, nor will they kill their children, nor will they bring forth a slander they have invented between their arms and legs, nor will they disobey you in what is right - then accept their pledge and ask forgiveness for them of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: O broffwyd, pan ddaw menywod believing i chi addo i chi y bydd nid oeddent yn cysylltu unrhyw beth â Allah, nac Bydd dwyn, nac maent yn ymrwymo cyfathrach rywiol anghyfreithlon, nac byddant yn eu lladd eu plant, nac byddant yn dod â blaen enllib wedi eu dyfeisio rhwng eu breichiau a choesau, nac Bydd torri'r ydych yn beth sy'n iawn-yna yn derbyn eu haddewid ac yn gofyn maddeuant iddynt Allah. Yn wir, Allah yn Forgiving a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not make allies of a people with whom Allah has become angry. They have despaired of [reward in] the Hereafter just as the disbelievers have despaired of [meeting] the inhabitants of the graves.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, nid gwneud cynghreiriaid o bobl gydag ef Daeth Allah yn ddig. Wedi eu despaired o [gwobrwyo yn] y o hyn ymlaen fel y disbelievers yn unig wedi despaired [cyfarfod] y trigolion o'r Beddau.

trans-unit.source: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth exalts Allah, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Beth bynnag sydd yn y nefoedd ac mae beth bynnag sydd ar y ddaear exalts Allah, ac mae'n Exalted yn efallai, yn y doeth.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, why do you say what you do not do?
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, pam ydych chi'n dweud beth wneud na chi?

trans-unit.source: Great is hatred in the sight of Allah that you say what you do not do.
trans-unit.target: Mawr yw casineb yng ngolwg Allah eich bod yn dweud beth ydych yn peidio.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah loves those who fight in His cause in a row as though they are a [single] structure joined firmly.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, mae Allah wrth fodd rhai sy'n ymladd yn ei achos ef yn olynol fel pe baent yn strwythur [un] ymunodd gadarn.

trans-unit.source: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Moses said to his people, "O my people, why do you harm me while you certainly know that I am the messenger of Allah to you?" And when they deviated, Allah caused their hearts to deviate. And Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
trans-unit.target: A [sôn, O Muhammad], pan y dywedodd Moses wrth ei bobl, "O 'm pobl, pam wneud niwed imi tra yn sicr y gwyddoch yr wyf yn negesydd Allah i chi?" A pan roedd eu gwyro, achosodd Allah eu calonnau i wyro. Ac nid yw Allah yn arwain y bobl defiantly anufudd.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when Jesus, the son of Mary, said, "O children of Israel, indeed I am the messenger of Allah to you confirming what came before me of the Torah and bringing good tidings of a messenger to come after me, whose name is Ahmad." But when he came to them with clear evidences, they said, "This is obvious magic."
trans-unit.target: A [sôn am] pan Iesu, fab i Mary, a dywedodd, "O plant Israel, yn wir yr wyf yn negesydd Allah atoch yn cadarnhau'r hyn a ddaeth cyn imi am y Torah a dod â tidings da o negesydd i ddod ar fy ôl, ei enw yn Ahmad." Ond pan ddaeth iddynt gyda dangos clir, dywedodd, "Dyma hud amlwg."

trans-unit.source: And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allah untruth while he is being invited to Islam. And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
trans-unit.target: A phwy sy'n anghyfiawn fwy nag un sy'n dyfeisio am Allah untruth tra ei fod yn cael eu gwahodd i Islam. Ac nid yw Allah yn arwain y bobl gamwedd.

trans-unit.source: They want to extinguish the light of Allah with their mouths, but Allah will perfect His light, although the disbelievers dislike it.
trans-unit.target: Maent am i ddiffodd golau Allah â'u cegau, ond bydd Allah yn berffaith ei golau, er mae y disbelievers yn ei hoffi.

trans-unit.source: It is He who sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth to manifest it over all religion, although those who associate others with Allah dislike it.
trans-unit.target: Mae'n ef a anfonodd ei negesydd gyda'r canllawiau a chrefydd o wirionedd i amlygu ei dros pob crefydd, er mae rhai sy'n cysylltu eraill â Allah yn casáu ei.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, shall I guide you to a transaction that will save you from a painful punishment?
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, bydd eich cyfeirio at drafodiad a fydd yn eich arbed rhag cosb boenus?

trans-unit.source: [It is that] you believe in Allah and His Messenger and strive in the cause of Allah with your wealth and your lives. That is best for you, if you should know.
trans-unit.target: [Mae'n] ydych yn credu mewn Allah a Messenger ei ac ymdrechu yn achos Allah gyda eich cyfoeth a eich bywydau. Dyna'r gorau i chi, os dylech wybod.

trans-unit.source: He will forgive for you your sins and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow and pleasant dwellings in gardens of perpetual residence. That is the great attainment.
trans-unit.target: Bydd eich pechodau yn maddau i chi ac chi gyfaddef i gerddi o dan y llif afonydd ac anheddau dymunol mewn gerddi preswyl parhaol. Mae cyrhaeddiad mawr.

trans-unit.source: And [you will obtain] another [favor] that you love - victory from Allah and an imminent conquest; and give good tidings to the believers.
trans-unit.target: A [Bydd chi gasglu] arall [ffafrio] bod wrth eich bodd-buddugoliaeth gan Allah a goresgyniad ar fin; a rhoi tidings da y credinwyr.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, be supporters of Allah, as when Jesus, the son of Mary, said to the disciples, "Who are my supporters for Allah?" The disciples said, "We are supporters of Allah." And a faction of the Children of Israel believed and a faction disbelieved. So We supported those who believed against their enemy, and they became dominant.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, fod cefnogwyr Allah, fel pan ddywedodd Iesu, fab i Mary, i disciples, "pwy yw fy cefnogwyr ar gyfer Allah?" Dywedodd y disciples, "Rydym yn gefnogwyr Allah." Credai carfan o blant Israel a ddysgais carfan. Felly rydym yn cefnogi'r rhai hynny a gredai erbyn eu gelyn, a daethant yn amlwg.

trans-unit.source: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth is exalting Allah, the Sovereign, the Pure, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Beth bynnag yn y nefoedd a beth bynnag sydd ar y ddaear yn exalting Allah, sofran, y Pure, Exalted yn efallai, yn y doeth.

trans-unit.source: It is He who has sent among the unlettered a Messenger from themselves reciting to them His verses and purifying them and teaching them the Book and wisdom - although they were before in clear error -
trans-unit.target: Ef sydd wedi anfon ymysg y unlettered negesydd o'r eu hunain yn adrodd iddynt ei penillion a phwmpio iddynt a'u haddysgu y llyfr a doethineb-er eu bod cyn mewn camgymeriad amlwg-

trans-unit.source: And [to] others of them who have not yet joined them. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: A [i] eraill ohonynt sydd wedi nid eto ymuno â nhw. Ac ef yw Exalted yn efallai, yn y doeth.

trans-unit.source: That is the bounty of Allah, which He gives to whom He wills, and Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
trans-unit.target: Dyna bounty Allah, y mae'n ei rhoi i bwy mae ef wills, a Allah yw y possessor o'r bounty mawr.

trans-unit.source: The example of those who were entrusted with the Torah and then did not take it on is like that of a donkey who carries volumes [of books]. Wretched is the example of the people who deny the signs of Allah. And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
trans-unit.target: Yn yr enghraifft o'r rheini a oedd yn ymddiried y Torah ac wedyn ni fanteisiodd mae'n fel asynnod sy'n rhedeg cyfrolau [o lyfrau]. Truenus yw yr enghraifft o bobl sydd yn gwadu yr arwyddion Allah. Ac nid yw Allah yn arwain y bobl gamwedd.

trans-unit.source: Say, "O you who are Jews, if you claim that you are allies of Allah, excluding the [other] people, then wish for death, if you should be truthful."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "O sy'n Iddewon, os ydych yn honni eich bod yn gynghreiriaid Allah, ac eithrio pobl [arall], yna ydych chi am farwolaeth, os y dylech fod yn onest."

trans-unit.source: But they will not wish for it, ever, because of what their hands have put forth. And Allah is Knowing of the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Ond bydd nad oeddent am iddo, erioed, oherwydd beth y mae eu dwylo wedi ei rhoi ymlaen. Ac Allah yn gwybod y tramgwyddo.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Indeed, the death from which you flee - indeed, it will meet you. Then you will be returned to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, and He will inform you about what you used to do."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "yn wir, y farwolaeth gan y mae eich ffoi-yn wir, mae'n bydd eich cyfarfod. Yna bydd y Knower unseen y a y welir eu dychwelyd ichi, a bydd ef yn eich hysbysu am beth yr ydych yn ei defnyddio i wneud."

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when [the adhan] is called for the prayer on the day of Jumu'ah [Friday], then proceed to the remembrance of Allah and leave trade. That is better for you, if you only knew.
trans-unit.target: O Mae chi sydd wedi credu, pan elwir am y weddi [yr adhan] ar ddiwrnod Jumu'ah [Gwener], wedyn yn mynd ymlaen i cofio Allah a gadael masnach. Mae hynny'n well i chi, os ydych yn gwybod yn unig.

trans-unit.source: And when the prayer has been concluded, disperse within the land and seek from the bounty of Allah, and remember Allah often that you may succeed.
trans-unit.target: Ac pan gwblhawyd y weddi, wasgaru o fewn y tir a geisio gan bounty Allah, a Cofiwch Allah yn aml efallai byddwch yn llwyddo.

trans-unit.source: But when they saw a transaction or a diversion, [O Muhammad], they rushed to it and left you standing. Say, "What is with Allah is better than diversion and than a transaction, and Allah is the best of providers."
trans-unit.target: Ond pan welsant trafodiad neu gwyriad, [O Muhammad], maent yn rhuthro iddo ac yn gadael ichi sefyll. Dweud, "beth yw ag Allah yn well na dargyfeirio ac na trafodiad, ac Allah yw'r gorau o ddarparwyr."

trans-unit.source: When the hypocrites come to you, [O Muhammad], they say, "We testify that you are the Messenger of Allah." And Allah knows that you are His Messenger, and Allah testifies that the hypocrites are liars.
trans-unit.target: Pan ddaw y rhagrithwyr i chi, [O Muhammad], maent yn dweud, "Rydym yn tystio bod chi'n Messenger Allah." Ac mae Allah yn gwybod eich bod yn ei negesydd, ac mae'r Allah yn tystio bod y rhagrithwyr yn gelwyddgwn.

trans-unit.source: They have taken their oaths as a cover, so they averted [people] from the way of Allah. Indeed, it was evil that they were doing.
trans-unit.target: Maent wedi cymryd eu llwon fel gorchudd, felly roedd maent yn osgoi [pobl] o'r ffordd o Allah. Yn wir, roedd drygioni yr oeddent yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: That is because they believed, and then they disbelieved; so their hearts were sealed over, and they do not understand.
trans-unit.target: Mae hynny oherwydd eu bod yn credu, ac yna roedd eu ddysgais; Felly y mae eu calonnau yn selio dros, ac nid ydynt yn deall.

trans-unit.source: And when you see them, their forms please you, and if they speak, you listen to their speech. [They are] as if they were pieces of wood propped up - they think that every shout is against them. They are the enemy, so beware of them. May Allah destroy them; how are they deluded?
trans-unit.target: Ac pan ydych yn eu gweld, mae eu ffurflenni yn plesio chi, ac os ydynt yn siarad, gwrandewch ar eu lleferydd. [Maent] fel pe baent yn darnau o bren yn cael ei chynnal-y credant bod pob gweiddi yn eu herbyn. Maent yn y gelyn, felly byddwch yn ofalus ohonynt. Efallai y bydd Allah yn dinistrio; sut y maent yn deluded?

trans-unit.source: And when it is said to them, "Come, the Messenger of Allah will ask forgiveness for you," they turn their heads aside and you see them evading while they are arrogant.
trans-unit.target: A pan ddywedir iddynt, "Bydd dod, y negesydd Allah yn gofyn maddeuant i chi", maent yn troi eu pennau o'r neilltu, a ydych yn eu gweld i'w hosgoi tra eu bod yn haerllug.

trans-unit.source: It is all the same for them whether you ask forgiveness for them or do not ask forgiveness for them; never will Allah forgive them. Indeed, Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
trans-unit.target: Mae'n gyd yr un fath ar eu cyfer a chi ofyn maddeuant iddynt neu nid gofyn maddeuant iddynt; byth bydd Allah yn maddau iddynt. Yn wir, yw Allah nid canllaw y bobl defiantly anufudd.

trans-unit.source: They are the ones who say, "Do not spend on those who are with the Messenger of Allah until they disband." And to Allah belongs the depositories of the heavens and the earth, but the hypocrites do not understand.
trans-unit.target: Hwy yw'r rhai sy'n dweud, "Wneud nid gwario ar y rhai sydd gyda negesydd Allah nes mae iddynt ddiddymu'r." Ac i Allah yn perthyn i'r depositories y nefoedd a'r ddaear, ond nid y rhagrithwyr yn deall.

trans-unit.source: They say, "If we return to al-Madinah, the more honored [for power] will surely expel therefrom the more humble." And to Allah belongs [all] honor, and to His Messenger, and to the believers, but the hypocrites do not know.
trans-unit.target: Maent yn dweud, "Os ydym yn dychwelyd i al-Madinah, bydd fwy honored [ar gyfer pŵer] Onid ddiarddel thelir fwy gostyngedig." Ac i Allah yn perthyn [holl] Mae anrhydedd honno, a Messenger ei, ac i gredinwyr, ond nid y rhagrithwyr yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, let not your wealth and your children divert you from remembrance of Allah. And whoever does that - then those are the losers.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, gadewch i ni eich cyfoeth a Mae eich plant yn eich dargyfeirio o cofio Allah. A pwy bynnag sy'n gwneud y-yna mae rhai ar eu colled.

trans-unit.source: And spend [in the way of Allah] from what We have provided you before death approaches one of you and he says, "My Lord, if only You would delay me for a brief term so I would give charity and be among the righteous."
trans-unit.target: A gwario [rhwystro Allah] o'r hyn yr ydym wedi darparu chi cyn marwolaeth dulliau un ohonoch, ac meddai, "fy Arglwydd, os mai dim ond byddai oedi mi ar gyfer y tymor byr felly byddai rhoi elusen a ymhlith y righteous."

trans-unit.source: But never will Allah delay a soul when its time has come. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
trans-unit.target: Ond byth bydd Allah yn oedi enaid wrth ei amser wedi dod. A yw Allah yn gyfarwydd â beth yr ydych yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth is exalting Allah. To Him belongs dominion, and to Him belongs [all] praise, and He is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: Beth bynnag yn y nefoedd a beth bynnag sydd ar y ddaear yn exalting Allah. Iddo ef y perthyn ddominiwn, ac iddo ef y perthyn [bob] canmoliaeth, ac ef yw'r dros holl bethau yn gymwys.

trans-unit.source: It is He who created you, and among you is the disbeliever, and among you is the believer. And Allah, of what you do, is Seeing.
trans-unit.target: Ef a greodd chi, ac ymhlith chi yn y disbeliever, ac ymhlith chi yw y gredwr. A yw Allah, yr hyn yr ydych yn ei wneud, yn ei gweld.

trans-unit.source: He created the heavens and earth in truth and formed you and perfected your forms; and to Him is the [final] destination.
trans-unit.target: Mae'n creu y nefoedd a'r ddaear yn wirionedd a ffurfio chi ac berffeithio eich ffurflenni; ac iddo ef yn y [daith].

trans-unit.source: He knows what is within the heavens and earth and knows what you conceal and what you declare. And Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts.
trans-unit.target: Mae'n gwybod beth yw o fewn y nefoedd a'r ddaear ac yn gwybod beth yr ydych yn ei guddio a beth yr ydych yn ei ddatgan. Ac Allah yn gwybod hynny o fewn y bronnau.

trans-unit.source: Has there not come to you the news of those who disbelieved before? So they tasted the bad consequence of their affair, and they will have a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Mae yno nid ddod atoch y newyddion o'r rhai a ddysgais cyn? Felly roedd eu blasu gwael o ganlyniad i ddigwyddiad eu, a bydd ganddynt cosb poenus.

trans-unit.source: That is because their messengers used to come to them with clear evidences, but they said, "Shall human beings guide us?" and disbelieved and turned away. And Allah dispensed [with them]; and Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy.
trans-unit.target: Mae hynny oherwydd eu negeswyr arfer dod atynt gyda dangos clir, ond maent yn dweud, "Bydd bodau dynol yn arweiniad inni?" a troi ymaith a ddysgais. A Allah terfynu'ch [eu]; ac Allah yn rhad ac am ddim o angen a Praiseworthy.

trans-unit.source: Those who disbelieve have claimed that they will never be resurrected. Say, "Yes, by my Lord, you will surely be resurrected; then you will surely be informed of what you did. And that, for Allah, is easy."
trans-unit.target: Mae rhai a chredu yn honni y bydd eu atgyfodi o byth. Ddweud, "Ydw, gan fy Arglwydd, bydd eich siawns atgyfodi; yna bydd eich siawns cael gwybod beth a wnaethoch chi. Ac mae hynny, i Allah, yn hawdd.

trans-unit.source: So believe in Allah and His Messenger and the Qur'an which We have sent down. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
trans-unit.target: Felly yn credu mewn Allah a Messenger ei ac y Qur'an yr ydym wedi'u hanfon i lawr. A yw Allah yn gyfarwydd â beth yr ydych yn ei wneud.

trans-unit.source: The Day He will assemble you for the Day of Assembly - that is the Day of Deprivation. And whoever believes in Allah and does righteousness - He will remove from him his misdeeds and admit him to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. That is the great attainment.
trans-unit.target: Yn y dydd yn ymgynnull chi ar gyfer diwrnod y Cynulliad-sydd yn y dydd o amddifadedd. A pwy bynnag sy'n credu mewn chyfiawnder i Allah a yw-bydd yn tynnu ei camweddau oddi wrtho ac yn cyfaddef iddo gerddi o dan y llif afonydd, lle y bydd iddynt gadw am byth. Mae cyrhaeddiad mawr.

trans-unit.source: But the ones who disbelieved and denied Our verses - those are the companions of the Fire, abiding eternally therein; and wretched is the destination.
trans-unit.target: Ond y rhai sydd yn gwadu ein penillion-a ddysgais yn rhai cymdeithion y tân, yn ufudd i'r fythol ynddo; a truenus yn y gyrchfan.

trans-unit.source: No disaster strikes except by permission of Allah. And whoever believes in Allah - He will guide his heart. And Allah is Knowing of all things.
trans-unit.target: Taro unrhyw drychineb heblaw drwy ganiatâd Allah. A pwy bynnag sy'n credu mewn Allah-bydd ef wedi arwain ei galon. A gwybod am yr holl bethau yw Allah.

trans-unit.source: And obey Allah and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away - then upon Our Messenger is only [the duty of] clear notification.
trans-unit.target: Ac ufuddhau Allah ac ufuddhau y negesydd; ond os ydych yn galluogi i ffwrdd-wedyn ar ein Messenger yn unig [dyletswydd] hysbysiad yn glir.

trans-unit.source: Allah - there is no deity except Him. And upon Allah let the believers rely.
trans-unit.target: Allah-nid oes unrhyw Dduwdod ac eithrio ef. A gadewch Allah Mae y credinwyr yn dibynnu arnynt.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, indeed, among your wives and your children are enemies to you, so beware of them. But if you pardon and overlook and forgive - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, yn wir, ymhlith eich gwragedd a phlant eich gelynion i chi, felly byddwch yn ofalus ohonynt. Ond os maddeuwch ac anwybyddu a maddau-yn wir, yna Allah yn Forgiving a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: Your wealth and your children are but a trial, and Allah has with Him a great reward.
trans-unit.target: Eich cyfoeth a eich plant ond treial, ac mae Allah gydag ef gwobr mawr.

trans-unit.source: So fear Allah as much as you are able and listen and obey and spend [in the way of Allah]; it is better for your selves. And whoever is protected from the stinginess of his soul - it is those who will be the successful.
trans-unit.target: Felly yn ofni Allah fel chi yn gallu gwrando ar ufuddhau a gwario [rhwystro Allah]; Mae'n well i chi. A pwy bynnag y caiff ei ddiogelu rhag y stinginess ei enaid-mae'n rhai a fydd yn llwyddiannus.

trans-unit.source: If you loan Allah a goodly loan, He will multiply it for you and forgive you. And Allah is Most Appreciative and Forbearing.
trans-unit.target: Os Mae eich benthyciad Allah benthyciad reit dda, bydd ei lluosi i chi ac yn maddau ichi. Ac Allah yn werthfawrogol mwyaf a Forbearing.

trans-unit.source: Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Knower y unseen a welir, Exalted yn efallai, yn y doeth.

trans-unit.source: O Prophet, when you [Muslims] divorce women, divorce them for [the commencement of] their waiting period and keep count of the waiting period, and fear Allah, your Lord. Do not turn them out of their [husbands'] houses, nor should they [themselves] leave [during that period] unless they are committing a clear immorality. And those are the limits [set by] Allah. And whoever transgresses the limits of Allah has certainly wronged himself. You know not; perhaps Allah will bring about after that a [different] matter.
trans-unit.target: Proffwyd O, pan y mae eich [Moslemiaid] ysgariad menywod, ysgariad iddynt ar gyfer [Cychwyn] eu cyfrif cyfnod a chadw aros y cyfnod aros, ac ofn Allah, eich Arglwydd. Heb iddynt droi allan o dai eu [gwŷr], [eu] ni ddylent ychwaith [yn ystod y cyfnod hwnnw] oni bai eu bod wedi ymrwymo anfoesoldeb clir. A rhai yn y terfynau [set gan] Allah. Ac yn sicr wedi pechu pwy bynnag y terfynau Allah yn cam ei hun. Gwyddoch nad; Efallai bydd Allah yn cyflwyno ar ôl hynny fater [gwahanol].

trans-unit.source: And when they have [nearly] fulfilled their term, either retain them according to acceptable terms or part with them according to acceptable terms. And bring to witness two just men from among you and establish the testimony for [the acceptance of] Allah. That is instructed to whoever should believe in Allah and the Last day. And whoever fears Allah - He will make for him a way out
trans-unit.target: A pan maent wedi cyflawni eu tymor [bron], naill ai eu cadw yn ôl telerau derbyniol neu rhan gyda nhw yn ôl delerau derbyniol. A dwyn i dyst dynion dim ond dau o blith chi a sefydlu dyst ar gyfer [derbyn] Allah. Hynny yw cyfarwyddo i bwy bynnag dylai gredu yn Allah ac yn y dydd diwethaf. A pwy bynnag ofni Allah-bydd yn gwneud iddo ffordd allan

trans-unit.source: And will provide for him from where he does not expect. And whoever relies upon Allah - then He is sufficient for him. Indeed, Allah will accomplish His purpose. Allah has already set for everything a [decreed] extent.
trans-unit.target: A bydd yn darparu ar ei gyfer o os yw'n disgwyl. A pwy bynnag yn dibynnu ar Allah-yna ei fod yn ddigonol iddo. Yn wir, bydd Allah yn cyflawni ei diben. Mae Allah wedi gosod eisoes ar gyfer popeth raddau [decreed].

trans-unit.source: And those who no longer expect menstruation among your women - if you doubt, then their period is three months, and [also for] those who have not menstruated. And for those who are pregnant, their term is until they give birth. And whoever fears Allah - He will make for him of his matter ease.
trans-unit.target: A'r rhai sydd bellach yn disgwyl mislif ymhlith eich merched-os ydych yn amau, yna eu cyfnod fod yn dri mis, ac [hefyd am] rhai sydd wedi menstruated ni. Ac i'r rhai sy'n feichiog, yn eu tymor hyd nes iddynt roi genedigaeth. A pwy bynnag ofni Allah-bydd yn gwneud iddo o hwylustod ei fater.

trans-unit.source: That is the command of Allah, which He has sent down to you; and whoever fears Allah - He will remove for him his misdeeds and make great for him his reward.
trans-unit.target: Dyna y Gorchymyn Allah, sef ei fod wedi anfon i lawr i chi; a pwy bynnag ofni Allah-bydd dileu iddo ei camweddau ac yn gwneud yn iawn iddo ef ei wobrwyo.

trans-unit.source: Lodge them [in a section] of where you dwell out of your means and do not harm them in order to oppress them. And if they should be pregnant, then spend on them until they give birth. And if they breastfeed for you, then give them their payment and confer among yourselves in the acceptable way; but if you are in discord, then there may breastfeed for the father another woman.
trans-unit.target: Lodge nhw [mewn adran] o'r lle rydych yn aros allan yn golygu eich ac heb wneud niwed iddynt er mwyn eu gormesu. Ac os dylai fod yn feichiog, yna ei wario arnynt nes iddynt roi genedigaeth. Ac os byddant yn bwydo ar y fron i chi, yna yn rhoi iddynt eu taliad ac yn rhoi ymysg eich gilydd y ffordd dderbyniol; ond os ydych mewn anghydfod, yna efallai y bydd bwydo ar y fron am y tad menyw arall.

trans-unit.source: Let a man of wealth spend from his wealth, and he whose provision is restricted - let him spend from what Allah has given him. Allah does not charge a soul except [according to] what He has given it. Allah will bring about, after hardship, ease.
trans-unit.target: Gadewch i ddyn cyfoeth wario gan ei gyfoeth, ac mae eu darpariaeth yn gyfyngedig-Gadewch iddo wario gan Allah wedi rhoi iddo. Nid yw Allah Nid codi tâl enaid ac eithrio ôl beth wedi ei gael. Bydd Allah yn dwyn, ar ôl caledi, hwylustod.

trans-unit.source: And how many a city was insolent toward the command of its Lord and His messengers, so We took it to severe account and punished it with a terrible punishment.
trans-unit.target: A faint o ddinas oedd digywilydd tuag at y Gorchymyn ei Arglwydd ac a'i negeswyr, felly byddwn yn cymryd i ystyriaeth ddifrifol ac mae'n cosbi â chosbi ofnadwy.

trans-unit.source: And it tasted the bad consequence of its affair, and the outcome of its affair was loss.
trans-unit.target: Ac roedd ei blasu gwael o ganlyniad i ddigwyddiad ei, ac canlyniad ei ddigwyddiad oedd colli.

trans-unit.source: Allah has prepared for them a severe punishment; so fear Allah, O you of understanding who have believed. Allah has sent down to you the Qur'an.
trans-unit.target: Mae'r Allah yn paratoi ar gyfer eu cosb difrifol; felly yn ofni Allah, O eich dealltwriaeth sydd wedi credu. Mae Allah yn anfon i lawr i chi y Qur'an.

trans-unit.source: [He sent] a Messenger [Muhammad] reciting to you the distinct verses of Allah that He may bring out those who believe and do righteous deeds from darknesses into the light. And whoever believes in Allah and does righteousness - He will admit him into gardens beneath which rivers flow to abide therein forever. Allah will have perfected for him a provision.
trans-unit.target: [Anfonodd] negesydd [Muhammad] adrodd i chi y penillion penodol Allah efallai y bydd yn dod â rhai sydd yn credu ac yn gwneud gweithredoedd cyfiawn o darknesses i oleuni. A pwy bynnag sy'n credu mewn Allah a yw'n chyfiawnder i-bydd yn cyfaddef iddo i erddi o dan y llif afonydd i gadw at erthyglau am byth. Bydd Allah wedi berffeithio iddo darpariaeth.

trans-unit.source: It is Allah who has created seven heavens and of the earth, the like of them. [His] command descends among them so you may know that Allah is over all things competent and that Allah has encompassed all things in knowledge.
trans-unit.target: Mae'n Allah sydd wedi creu saith nefoedd a'r ddaear, tebyg iddynt. Mae [ei] Gorchymyn yn disgyn yn eu plith, felly efallai y gwyddoch fod Allah dros holl bethau yn gymwys a bod Allah wedi cwmpasu holl bethau mewn gwybodaeth.

trans-unit.source: O Prophet, why do you prohibit [yourself from] what Allah has made lawful for you, seeking the approval of your wives? And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Proffwyd O, pam ydych chi gwahardd [eich hun o'r] Beth Allah wedi gwneud gyfreithlon i chi, geisio cymeradwyaeth eich gwragedd? Ac Allah yn Forgiving a Merciful.

trans-unit.source: Allah has already ordained for you [Muslims] the dissolution of your oaths. And Allah is your protector, and He is the Knowing, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Eisoes mae Allah hordeinio i chi [Moslemiaid] diddymu eich llwon. A Allah yn eich protector, ac mae'n gwybod y, yn y doeth.

trans-unit.source: And [remember] when the Prophet confided to one of his wives a statement; and when she informed [another] of it and Allah showed it to him, he made known part of it and ignored a part. And when he informed her about it, she said, "Who told you this?" He said, "I was informed by the Knowing, the Acquainted."
trans-unit.target: A [cofio] pan oedd y Proffwyd ydyw'n un o'r gwragedd ei datganiad; a pan hysbysodd [arall] Mae'n a Allah yn dangos iddo, gwnaeth hysbys rhan ohono ac anwybyddu rhan. A pan hysbysodd iddi am hynny, dywedodd, "sy'n dweud wrthych hyn?" Meddai, "Fe 'm hysbyswyd gan y gwybod, y Acquainted."

trans-unit.source: If you two [wives] repent to Allah, [it is best], for your hearts have deviated. But if you cooperate against him - then indeed Allah is his protector, and Gabriel and the righteous of the believers and the angels, moreover, are [his] assistants.
trans-unit.target: Os Mae eich dau [gwragedd] edifarhau i Allah, [Mae'n gorau], ar gyfer yr eich calonnau yn gwyro. Ond os mae chi gydweithredu erbyn iddo-yna yn wir Allah yn ei protector, a Gabriel a righteous y credinwyr ac angylion, ar ben hynny, mae [ei] cynorthwywyr.

trans-unit.source: Perhaps his Lord, if he divorced you [all], would substitute for him wives better than you - submitting [to Allah], believing, devoutly obedient, repentant, worshipping, and traveling - [ones] previously married and virgins.
trans-unit.target: Efallai os oedd ef wedi ysgaru chi [bob], byddai ei Arglwydd, rhodder iddo gwragedd yn well na chi-cyflwyno [i Allah], gan gredu, daer obedient, edifeiriol, addoli, a hudol-[rai] yn briod o'r blaen a virgins.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, protect yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is people and stones, over which are [appointed] angels, harsh and severe; they do not disobey Allah in what He commands them but do what they are commanded.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, diogelu eich hunain a eich teuluoedd rhag tân eu tanwydd yn bobl a cherrig, a dros y [Penodir] angylion, llym a difrifol; Maent nid yn torri'r Allah yn ei ennyn eu ond beth y maent yn ei wneud yn gyfrifol.

trans-unit.source: O you who have disbelieved, make no excuses that Day. You will only be recompensed for what you used to do.
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi ddysgais, wneud dim esgusodion y dydd. Bydd eich iawndal dim ond am beth yr ydych yn ei defnyddio i wneud.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, repent to Allah with sincere repentance. Perhaps your Lord will remove from you your misdeeds and admit you into gardens beneath which rivers flow [on] the Day when Allah will not disgrace the Prophet and those who believed with him. Their light will proceed before them and on their right; they will say, "Our Lord, perfect for us our light and forgive us. Indeed, You are over all things competent."
trans-unit.target: O chi sydd wedi credu, edifarhau i Allah gyda pedair diffuant. Efallai y bydd eich Arglwydd dynnu oddi ar eich eich camweddau a chi gyfaddef i erddi o dan y llif afonydd [ar] y dydd pan na bydd Allah yn disgrace y Proffwyd a rhai a gredai gydag ef. Bydd eu golau yn mynd rhagddo cyn iddynt ac ar eu hawl; byddant yn dweud, 'Mae ein Arglwydd, yn berffaith i ni ein golau ac yn maddau inni. Yn wir, yr ydych yn dros holl bethau cymwys."

trans-unit.source: O Prophet, strive against the disbelievers and the hypocrites and be harsh upon them. And their refuge is Hell, and wretched is the destination.
trans-unit.target: O broffwyd, yn ymdrechu yn erbyn y disbelievers ac y rhagrithwyr ac yn llym arnynt. Ac eu lloches yn uffern, a truenus yn y gyrchfan.

trans-unit.source: Allah presents an example of those who disbelieved: the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. They were under two of Our righteous servants but betrayed them, so those prophets did not avail them from Allah at all, and it was said, "Enter the Fire with those who enter."
trans-unit.target: Mae'r Allah yn cyflwyno enghraifft o rhai a ddysgais: gwraig Noah a gwraig lot. Eu bod dan ddau o weision ein hoes dabloid ond hwy, yn bradychu felly oedd y proffwydi hynny nid fanteisio ar iddynt gan Allah o gwbl, a dywedwyd, "Rhowch y tân gyda'r rhai sy'n mynd i mewn."

trans-unit.source: And Allah presents an example of those who believed: the wife of Pharaoh, when she said, "My Lord, build for me near You a house in Paradise and save me from Pharaoh and his deeds and save me from the wrongdoing people."
trans-unit.target: Ac mae'r Allah yn cyflwyno enghraifft o rhai a oedd yn credu: y wraig o Ffaro, pan ddywedodd, "fy Arglwydd, adeiladu i mi ger eich tŷ yn baradwys ac arbed mi Ffaro a ei gweithredoedd a fy arbed rhag y bobl gamwedd."

trans-unit.source: And [the example of] Mary, the daughter of 'Imran, who guarded her chastity, so We blew into [her garment] through Our angel, and she believed in the words of her Lord and His scriptures and was of the devoutly obedient.
trans-unit.target: A [enghraifft] Mary, merch ' Imran, sy'n gwarchod ei diweirdeb, felly rydym yn chwythu i [ei ddilledyn] drwy ein angel, ac hi yn credu yn y geiriau ei Arglwydd a ei ysgrythurau ac roedd o daer obedient.

trans-unit.source: Blessed is He in whose hand is dominion, and He is over all things competent -
trans-unit.target: Bendithio yw ei fod yn eu llaw yn ddominiwn, ac mae dros holl bethau yn gymwys-

trans-unit.source: [He] who created death and life to test you [as to] which of you is best in deed - and He is the Exalted in Might, the Forgiving -
trans-unit.target: [Mae'n] pwy a greodd marwolaeth a bywyd i chi brofi [pa] ohonoch sydd orau yn weithred-ac mae'n Exalted yn efallai, y Forgiving-

trans-unit.source: [And] who created seven heavens in layers. You do not see in the creation of the Most Merciful any inconsistency. So return [your] vision [to the sky]; do you see any breaks?
trans-unit.target: [A] sy'n creu saith nefoedd mewn haenau. Nid ydych yn gweld yn creu y mwyaf tosturiol unrhyw anghysondeb. Felly yn dychwelyd [ch] gweledigaeth [i sky]; welwch chi unrhyw wyliau?

trans-unit.source: Then return [your] vision twice again. [Your] vision will return to you humbled while it is fatigued.
trans-unit.target: Yna dychwelyd [ch] gweledigaeth ddwywaith eto. Bydd gweledigaeth [ch] yn dychwelyd i chi wylaidd er ei bod yn fatigued.

trans-unit.source: And We have certainly beautified the nearest heaven with stars and have made [from] them what is thrown at the devils and have prepared for them the punishment of the Blaze.
trans-unit.target: Ac rydym yn sicr wedi beautified y nefoedd agosaf gyda sêr ac wedi gwneud [ohonynt] Beth yw taflu y devils ac wedi paratoi ar gyfer eu cosbi y tanbaid.

trans-unit.source: And for those who disbelieved in their Lord is the punishment of Hell, and wretched is the destination.
trans-unit.target: Ac ar gyfer rhai a ddysgais yn eu Arglwydd yw'r gosb o uffern, a truenus yn y gyrchfan.

trans-unit.source: When they are thrown into it, they hear from it a [dreadful] inhaling while it boils up.
trans-unit.target: Pan maent yn taflu i mewn iddo, glywant gan ei anadlu [ofnadwy] tra mae ei hanfod.

trans-unit.source: It almost bursts with rage. Every time a company is thrown into it, its keepers ask them, "Did there not come to you a warner?"
trans-unit.target: Mae hynny bron yn orlawn o dicter. Bob tro y cwmni yn cael ei daflu i mewn iddo, mae ei geidwaid yn gofyn iddynt, "Mae na ddaeth i chi warner?"

trans-unit.source: They will say," Yes, a warner had come to us, but we denied and said, 'Allah has not sent down anything. You are not but in great error.'"
trans-unit.target: Byddant yn dweud,"ie, roedd warner yn dod atom ni, ond rydym yn gwrthod ac yn dweud, ' yw Allah wedi anfon i lawr unrhyw beth. Nid ydych ond yn gamgymeriad mawr.'"

trans-unit.source: And they will say, "If only we had been listening or reasoning, we would not be among the companions of the Blaze."
trans-unit.target: A byddant yn dweud, "os mai dim ond rydym wedi gwrando neu rhesymu, ni fyddem ymysg chymdeithion y tanbaid."

trans-unit.source: And they will admit their sin, so [it is] alienation for the companions of the Blaze.
trans-unit.target: A bydd eu cyfaddef eu pechod, felly [Mae'n] dieithrio ar gyfer y cymdeithion yr ymrafael.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who fear their Lord unseen will have forgiveness and great reward.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, bydd y rhai sy'n ofni eu unseen yr Arglwydd yn cael maddeuant a gwobrwyo mawr.

trans-unit.source: And conceal your speech or publicize it; indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn cuddio eich araith neu fewnblyg yn wir, ei fod yn gwybod hynny o fewn y bronnau.

trans-unit.source: Does He who created not know, while He is the Subtle, the Acquainted?
trans-unit.target: A greodd ni wyr, er ei fod yn y Subtle, y Acquainted?

trans-unit.source: It is He who made the earth tame for you - so walk among its slopes and eat of His provision - and to Him is the resurrection.
trans-unit.target: Mae'n ef a wnaeth y ddaear ddofi i chi-felly gerdded ymysg ei llethrau a bwyta ei ddarpariaeth-a iddo yn yr atgyfodiad.

trans-unit.source: Do you feel secure that He who [holds authority] in the heaven would not cause the earth to swallow you and suddenly it would sway?
trans-unit.target: Ydych chi'n teimlo yn ddiogel iddo sy'n [dal awdurdod] yn y nef fyddai yn peri y ddaear i lyncu chi a sydyn y byddai ei siglo?

trans-unit.source: Or do you feel secure that He who [holds authority] in the heaven would not send against you a storm of stones? Then you would know how [severe] was My warning.
trans-unit.target: Neu ydych chi'n teimlo yn ddiogel iddo sy'n [dal awdurdod] yn y nefoedd y byddai nid yn anfon yn eich erbyn storm o gerrig? Yna byddech yn gwybod sut oedd [difrifol] fy rhybudd.

trans-unit.source: And already had those before them denied, and how [terrible] was My reproach.
trans-unit.target: Ac eisoes wedi cael rhai cyn eu gwadu, a sut oedd [ofnadwy] fy gwbl ddi-fai.

trans-unit.source: Do they not see the birds above them with wings outspread and [sometimes] folded in? None holds them [aloft] except the Most Merciful. Indeed He is, of all things, Seeing.
trans-unit.target: Nid ydynt yn gweld yr adar uchod nhw ag adenydd outspread a [weithiau] yn cael ei phlygu? Mae'r dim dal nhw [aloft] ac eithrio mwyaf tosturiol. Yn wir mae ef, o'r holl bethau, weld.

trans-unit.source: Or who is it that could be an army for you to aid you other than the Most Merciful? The disbelievers are not but in delusion.
trans-unit.target: Neu pwy a allai fod yn fyddin i chi i'ch cynorthwyo ac eithrio mwyaf tosturiol? Nid yw y disbelievers ond mewn rhithdyb.

trans-unit.source: Or who is it that could provide for you if He withheld His provision? But they have persisted in insolence and aversion.
trans-unit.target: Neu pwy y gallai ei ddarparu i chi os oedd ef yn dal ei ddarpariaeth? Ond maent wedi parhau yn haerllugrwydd a gwrthwynebiad.

trans-unit.source: Then is one who walks fallen on his face better guided or one who walks erect on a straight path?
trans-unit.target: Yna yw un sy'n cerdded yn syrthio ar ei wyneb yn well arweiniad neu un sy'n cerdded godi ar lwybr syth?

trans-unit.source: Say, "It is He who has produced you and made for you hearing and vision and hearts; little are you grateful."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "Mae'n ef sydd wedi cynhyrchu chi a gwneud i chi glywed a gweledigaeth a calonnau; ychydig ydych chi'n ddiolchgar."

trans-unit.source: Say, "It is He who has multiplied you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "ef sydd wedi lluosi â chi drwy gydol y ddaear, ac iddo ef y bydd eich casglu."

trans-unit.source: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"
trans-unit.target: Ac maent yn dweud, "pryd y mae hwn addewid, os dylai fod yn eirwir?"

trans-unit.source: Say, "The knowledge is only with Allah, and I am only a clear warner."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "y gwybodaeth yn unig gyda Allah, ac yr wyf yn unig warner clir."

trans-unit.source: But when they see it approaching, the faces of those who disbelieve will be distressed, and it will be said, "This is that for which you used to call."
trans-unit.target: Ond pan y maent yn ei weld yn agosáu at, bydd drallodus wynebau rhai a chredu, a bydd rhai yn dweud, "Dyma y Defnyddiasoch alw."

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "Have you considered: whether Allah should cause my death and those with me or have mercy upon us, who can protect the disbelievers from a painful punishment?"
trans-unit.target: Dweud, [O Muhammad], "ydych chi wedi ystyried: a dylai Allah achosi marwolaeth fy a'r rhai â mi neu wedi drugaredd arnom ni, sy'n gallu amddiffyn y disbelievers rhag cosb boenus?"

trans-unit.source: Say, "He is the Most Merciful; we have believed in Him, and upon Him we have relied. And you will [come to] know who it is that is in clear error."
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "ei fod yn fwyaf Merciful; yr ydym wedi credu ynddo, ac yr ydym wedi dibynnu arno. A ydych yn [dod i] wybod pwy yw hynny mewn camgymeriad amlwg. "

trans-unit.source: Say, "Have you considered: if your water was to become sunken [into the earth], then who could bring you flowing water?"
trans-unit.target: Dweud, "ydych chi wedi ystyried: os oedd eich dŵr i suddo [i'r ddaear], yna, a gallai ddod â dŵr sy'n llifo'n chi?"

trans-unit.source: Nun. By the pen and what they inscribe,
trans-unit.target: Nun. Gan y lloc a beth y maent yn ei inscribe,

trans-unit.source: You are not, [O Muhammad], by the favor of your Lord, a madman.
trans-unit.target: Nid ydych yn [O Muhammad], gan favor o eich Arglwydd, madman.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, for you is a reward uninterrupted.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, ar gyfer eich gwobr ddi-baid.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, you are of a great moral character.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, mae o gymeriad moesol mawr.

trans-unit.source: So you will see and they will see
trans-unit.target: Felly fe welwch a byddant yn gweld

trans-unit.source: Which of you is the afflicted [by a devil].
trans-unit.target: Sydd gennych yn y cystuddio [gan y diafol].

trans-unit.source: Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has gone astray from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, eich Arglwydd yn gwybod fwyaf o pwy sydd wedi mynd ar gyfeiliorn oddi wrth ei ffordd, ac mae'n gwybod fwyaf o dan arweiniad [iawn].

trans-unit.source: Then do not obey the deniers.
trans-unit.target: Yna ufuddhau y llosg.

trans-unit.source: They wish that you would soften [in your position], so they would soften [toward you].
trans-unit.target: Dymunant chi y byddai meddalu [yn eich sefyllfa], felly byddai eu meddalu [tuag at eich].

trans-unit.source: And do not obey every worthless habitual swearer
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oes ufuddhau bob swearer arferol ddiwerth

trans-unit.source: [And] scorner, going about with malicious gossip -
trans-unit.target: [A] scorner, mynd gyda straeon maleisus-

trans-unit.source: A preventer of good, transgressing and sinful,
trans-unit.target: Preventer da, sy'n camweddu sawl gwaith a sinful,

trans-unit.source: Cruel, moreover, and an illegitimate pretender.
trans-unit.target: Creulon, ymhellach, a llygadu'r anghywir.

trans-unit.source: Because he is a possessor of wealth and children,
trans-unit.target: Oherwydd ei fod yn possessor o gyfoeth a plant,

trans-unit.source: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."
trans-unit.target: Pan y mae ein penillion roi iddo, meddai, "Chwedlau o bobloedd gynt."

trans-unit.source: We will brand him upon the snout.
trans-unit.target: Bydd ein brand ef ar y snout.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We have tried them as We tried the companions of the garden, when they swore to cut its fruit in the [early] morning
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, yr ydym wedi ceisio eu fel y ceisiasom cymdeithion yr ardd, pan roedd eu arnyn i dorri ei ffrwythau yn y bore [cynnar]

trans-unit.source: Without making exception.
trans-unit.target: Heb wneud eithriad.

trans-unit.source: So there came upon the garden an affliction from your Lord while they were asleep.
trans-unit.target: Felly mae dod ar yr ardd cystuddiau'n o eich Arglwydd tra eu bod yn cysgu.

trans-unit.source: And it became as though reaped.
trans-unit.target: A daeth yn fel pe elwa.

trans-unit.source: And they called one another at morning,
trans-unit.target: A galwodd un arall yn y bore,

trans-unit.source: [Saying], "Go early to your crop if you would cut the fruit."
trans-unit.target: [Dweud], "ewch gynnar i eich cnydau os byddech yn torri ffrwythau."

trans-unit.source: So they set out, while lowering their voices,
trans-unit.target: Maent yn pennu, tra'n gostwng eu lleisiau,

trans-unit.source: [Saying], "There will surely not enter it today upon you [any] poor person."
trans-unit.target: [Dweud], "yna bydd siawns nad ymuno heddiw arnoch [unrhyw] person gwael."

trans-unit.source: And they went early in determination, [assuming themselves] able.
trans-unit.target: Ac aethant yn gynnar yn y penderfyniad, [dybio eu hunain] gallu.

trans-unit.source: But when they saw it, they said, "Indeed, we are lost;
trans-unit.target: Ond pan welsant, dywedodd, "yn wir, rydym yn colli;

trans-unit.source: Rather, we have been deprived."
trans-unit.target: Yn hytrach, rydym wedi'u hamddifadu."

trans-unit.source: The most moderate of them said, "Did I not say to you, 'Why do you not exalt [Allah]?' "
trans-unit.target: Mwyaf cymedrol ohonynt yn dweud, "Ni ddywedais i chi, 'Pam ydych chi na exalt [Allah]?' "

trans-unit.source: They said, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."
trans-unit.target: Maent yn dweud, "i'w mawrygu yn ein Arglwydd! Yn wir, roeddem yn tramgwyddo."

trans-unit.source: Then they approached one another, blaming each other.
trans-unit.target: Yna aethant at un arall, beio ei gilydd.

trans-unit.source: They said, "O woe to us; indeed we were transgressors.
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "O wae i ni; yn wir, roeddem yn transgressors.

trans-unit.source: Perhaps our Lord will substitute for us [one] better than it. Indeed, we are toward our Lord desirous."
trans-unit.target: Efallai bydd ein Arglwydd rhodder i ni [un] well nag. Yn wir, yr ydym tuag at ein Arglwydd ddymunol."

trans-unit.source: Such is the punishment [of this world]. And the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.
trans-unit.target: O'r fath yw'r gosb [y byd hwn]. Ac yn cosbi y o hyn ymlaen yn fwy, os gwyddent yn unig.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, for the righteous with their Lord are the Gardens of Pleasure.
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, ar gyfer righteous gyda eu yr Arglwydd yn y gerddi pleser.

trans-unit.source: Then will We treat the Muslims like the criminals?
trans-unit.target: Yna byddwn yn trin y Moslemiaid fel y troseddwyr?

trans-unit.source: What is [the matter] with you? How do you judge?
trans-unit.target: Beth yw [y mater] â chi? Sut ydych yn barnu?

trans-unit.source: Or do you have a scripture in which you learn
trans-unit.target: Neu a oes gennych ysgrythur y byddwch yn dysgu

trans-unit.source: That indeed for you is whatever you choose?
trans-unit.target: Yn wir i chi Mae hynny'n beth bynnag yr ydych yn ei ddewis?

trans-unit.source: Or do you have oaths [binding] upon Us, extending until the Day of Resurrection, that indeed for you is whatever you judge?
trans-unit.target: Neu a oes gennych llwon [rhwymol] arnom, yn ymestyn tan dydd atgyfodi, yn wir i chi bod beth bynnag yr ydych yn ei farnu?

trans-unit.source: Ask them which of them, for that [claim], is responsible.
trans-unit.target: Gofynnwch iddyn nhw pa un ohonynt, ar gyfer hwnnw [hawliad], yn gyfrifol.

trans-unit.source: Or do they have partners? Then let them bring their partners, if they should be truthful.
trans-unit.target: Neu a oes ganddynt bartneriaid? Yna gadewch iddynt ddod â'u partneriaid, os dylai fod yn onest.

trans-unit.source: The Day the shin will be uncovered and they are invited to prostration but the disbelievers will not be able,
trans-unit.target: Y dydd y sicrhau fydd datgelu ac fe'u gwahoddir i prostration ond ni fydd y disbelievers yn gallu,

trans-unit.source: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. And they used to be invited to prostration while they were sound.
trans-unit.target: Eu llygaid yn wylaidd, bychanu bydd ymdrin â hwy. A ddefnyddiwyd ganddynt i gael eu gwahodd i prostration tra eu bod yn gadarn.

trans-unit.source: So leave Me, [O Muhammad], with [the matter of] whoever denies the Qur'an. We will progressively lead them [to punishment] from where they do not know.
trans-unit.target: Felly mi, [O Muhammad], yn gadael gyda [y mater o] pwy bynnag sydd yn gwadu y Qur'an. Yn raddol arwain iddynt [i gosbi] o'r lle nad ydynt yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: And I will give them time. Indeed, My plan is firm.
trans-unit.target: A bydd yn rhoi amser iddynt. Yn wir, mae fy cynllun yn gadarn.

trans-unit.source: Or do you ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?
trans-unit.target: Neu a ydych yn gofyn iddynt gael taliad, felly maent yn gan ddyled yn faich i lawr?

trans-unit.source: Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?
trans-unit.target: Neu wedi eu [gwybodaeth o] y unseen, felly maent yn ysgrifennu [TG] i lawr?

trans-unit.source: Then be patient for the decision of your Lord, [O Muhammad], and be not like the companion of the fish when he called out while he was distressed.
trans-unit.target: Wedyn fod yn amyneddgar dros benderfyniad eich Arglwydd, [O Muhammad], ac yn nid fel cydymaith y pysgod pan alwodd tra ei fod yn ofidus.

trans-unit.source: If not that a favor from his Lord overtook him, he would have been thrown onto the naked shore while he was censured.
trans-unit.target: Os nad y dywedodd favor gan ei Arglwydd barhau'n iddo, ef byddai wedi wedi eu taflu ar y lan noeth tra oedd ef yn ceryddu.

trans-unit.source: And his Lord chose him and made him of the righteous.
trans-unit.target: Ac mae ei Arglwydd yn dewis iddo a gwneud iddo o y righteous.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, those who disbelieve would almost make you slip with their eyes when they hear the message, and they say, "Indeed, he is mad."
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, byddai rhai a chredu bron yn gwneud ichi ymadael gyda'u llygaid pan fyddant yn clywed y neges, ac maent yn dweud, "Yn wir, ei fod yn wallgof."

trans-unit.source: But it is not except a reminder to the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Ond nid yw'n ac eithrio nodyn atgoffa i fyd.

trans-unit.source: The Inevitable Reality -
trans-unit.target: Y realiti anochel-

trans-unit.source: What is the Inevitable Reality?
trans-unit.target: Beth yw realiti anochel?

trans-unit.source: And what can make you know what is the Inevitable Reality?
trans-unit.target: A gall hyn wneud ichi wybod beth yw realiti anochel?

trans-unit.source: Thamud and 'Aad denied the Striking Calamity.
trans-unit.target: Thamud a ' gwadodd Aad y drychineb yn drawiadol.

trans-unit.source: So as for Thamud, they were destroyed by the overpowering [blast].
trans-unit.target: Felly o ran Thamud, eu dinistrio gan overpowering [chwyth].

trans-unit.source: And as for 'Aad, they were destroyed by a screaming, violent wind
trans-unit.target: Ac fel i ' Aad, oedd eu dinistrio gan gwynt cyforiog, treisgar

trans-unit.source: Which Allah imposed upon them for seven nights and eight days in succession, so you would see the people therein fallen as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.
trans-unit.target: A dywedodd Allah a osodir arnynt ar gyfer nosweithiau saith ac wyth diwrnod yn olynol, fel y byddech yn gweld y bobl ynddynt wedi disgyn fel pe baent yn wag o foncyffion coed palmwydd.

trans-unit.source: Then do you see of them any remains?
trans-unit.target: Yna y gwelwch ohonynt unrhyw olion?

trans-unit.source: And there came Pharaoh and those before him and the overturned cities with sin.
trans-unit.target: Ac yna daeth Ffaro a rhai cyn iddo a'r dinasoedd gwyrdroi â phechod.

trans-unit.source: And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with a seizure exceeding [in severity].
trans-unit.target: Ac roedd eu disobeyed y negesydd o eu yr Arglwydd, felly achubodd iddynt gyda ragori ymafael [yn difrifoldeb].

trans-unit.source: Indeed, when the water overflowed, We carried your ancestors in the sailing ship
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, pan oedd y dŵr yn overflowed, gwnaethom eich cyndeidiau yn y llong hwylio

trans-unit.source: That We might make it for you a reminder and [that] a conscious ear would be conscious of it.
trans-unit.target: Y gallai wneud ei i chi atgoffa a [y] Byddai clust ymwybodol yn ymwybodol ohono.

trans-unit.source: Then when the Horn is blown with one blast
trans-unit.target: Yna pan y cyrn yn chwythu gyda un chwyth

trans-unit.source: And the earth and the mountains are lifted and leveled with one blow -
trans-unit.target: Ac y ddaear a mynyddoedd yn codi ac ati gydag un ergyd-

trans-unit.source: Then on that Day, the Resurrection will occur,
trans-unit.target: Yna ar y diwrnod hwnnw, bydd yr atgyfodiad yn digwydd,

trans-unit.source: And the heaven will split [open], for that Day it is infirm.
trans-unit.target: A bydd y nefoedd yn cael ei rannu yn [agored], ar gyfer y diwrnod hwnnw mae'n eiddil.

trans-unit.source: And the angels are at its edges. And there will bear the Throne of your Lord above them, that Day, eight [of them].
trans-unit.target: Ac angylion ar ei ymylon. A bydd dwyn yr Orsedd o eich Arglwydd uchod, y diwrnod hwnnw, wyth [ohonynt].

trans-unit.source: That Day, you will be exhibited [for judgement]; not hidden among you is anything concealed.
trans-unit.target: Y diwrnod hwnnw, bydd arddangos chi [ar gyfer dyfarniad]; Nid cudd ymhlith chi unrhyw beth cuddio.

trans-unit.source: So as for he who is given his record in his right hand, he will say, "Here, read my record!
trans-unit.target: Felly ag ef sy'n cael ei gofnodi yn ei law dde, bydd yn dweud, "yma, darllen fy record!

trans-unit.source: Indeed, I was certain that I would be meeting my account."
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, yr oeddwn yn sicr y byddai yn cyfarfod fy nghyfrif."

trans-unit.source: So he will be in a pleasant life -
trans-unit.target: Felly fydd ef yn bywyd dymunol-

trans-unit.source: In an elevated garden,
trans-unit.target: Mewn gardd dyrchafedig,

trans-unit.source: Its [fruit] to be picked hanging near.
trans-unit.target: Ei [ffrwythau] yn pigo hongian ger.

trans-unit.source: [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you put forth in the days past."
trans-unit.target: [Bydd wrthynt], "Bwyta ac yfed mewn boddhad ar gyfer beth ydych yn ei rhoi ymlaen yn y dyddiau diwethaf."

trans-unit.source: But as for he who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, "Oh, I wish I had not been given my record
trans-unit.target: Ond ag ef sy'n cael ei gofnodi yn ei law chwith, bydd yn dweud, "o, dymunaf oedd ddim wedi cael fy record

trans-unit.source: And had not known what is my account.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oedd yn hysbys beth yw fy nghyfrif.

trans-unit.source: I wish my death had been the decisive one.
trans-unit.target: Dymunaf fy marwolaeth wedi bod yn un pendant.

trans-unit.source: My wealth has not availed me.
trans-unit.target: Mae fy cyfoeth nad oedd wedi manteisio ar mi.

trans-unit.source: Gone from me is my authority."
trans-unit.target: Mynd oddi wrthyf yn fy awdurdod.

trans-unit.source: [Allah will say], "Seize him and shackle him.
trans-unit.target: [Bydd Allah yn dweud], "iddo ymafael a gefyn iddo.

trans-unit.source: Then into Hellfire drive him.
trans-unit.target: Yna i Hellfire yrru ef.

trans-unit.source: Then into a chain whose length is seventy cubits insert him."
trans-unit.target: Wedyn i'r gadwyn Mae eu hyd yn saith deg cubits mewnosoder ef."

trans-unit.source: Indeed, he did not used to believe in Allah, the Most Great,
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, ni ei defnyddio yn credu mewn Allah, mawr,

trans-unit.source: Nor did he encourage the feeding of the poor.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oedd ef yn annog bwydo y tlawd.

trans-unit.source: So there is not for him here this Day any devoted friend
trans-unit.target: Felly mae nid yw ef yma hyn ddiwrnod neilltuodd unrhyw ffrind

trans-unit.source: Nor any food except from the discharge of wounds;
trans-unit.target: Nac unrhyw fwyd ac eithrio o gyflawni clwyfau;

trans-unit.source: None will eat it except the sinners.
trans-unit.target: Bydd unrhyw un yn ei fwyta ac eithrio pechaduriaid.

trans-unit.source: So I swear by what you see
trans-unit.target: Tyngaf felly beth yr ydych yn ei weld

trans-unit.source: And what you do not see
trans-unit.target: A hyn nad ydych yn ei weld

trans-unit.source: [That] indeed, the Qur'an is the word of a noble Messenger.
trans-unit.target: [Bod] yn wir, y Qur'an yw'r gair negesydd aruchel.

trans-unit.source: And it is not the word of a poet; little do you believe.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid yw y gair bardd; ychydig a ydych yn credu.

trans-unit.source: Nor the word of a soothsayer; little do you remember.
trans-unit.target: Nac y gair o soothsayer; ychydig a ydych yn cofio.

trans-unit.source: [It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: [Mae'n] datguddiad gan yr Arglwydd y byd.

trans-unit.source: And if Muhammad had made up about Us some [false] sayings,
trans-unit.target: Ac os oedd Muhammad yn cynnwys amdanom rhai dywediadau [anwir],

trans-unit.source: We would have seized him by the right hand;
trans-unit.target: Byddai wedi yn hatafaelu ef gan y dde;

trans-unit.source: Then We would have cut from him the aorta.
trans-unit.target: Yna byddai gennym wedi torri oddi wrtho yr aorta.

trans-unit.source: And there is no one of you who could prevent [Us] from him.
trans-unit.target: Ac nid oes unrhyw un ohonoch a gallai atal [ein] oddi wrtho.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, the Qur'an is a reminder for the righteous.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, y Qur'an yn ein hatgoffa am y righteous.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, We know that among you are deniers.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, gwyddom fod eich plith llosg.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, it will be [a cause of] regret upon the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, bydd yn [achos] Mae'n ddrwg ar y disbelievers.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, it is the truth of certainty.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, mae'n y gwir o sicrwydd.

trans-unit.source: So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
trans-unit.target: Felly exalt enw eich Arglwydd, mwyaf mawr.

trans-unit.source: A supplicant asked for a punishment bound to happen
trans-unit.target: Gofynnodd ddeisyfydd am gosb rhwym o ddigwydd

trans-unit.source: To the disbelievers; of it there is no preventer.
trans-unit.target: I y disbelievers; Nid oes unrhyw preventer ohono.

trans-unit.source: [It is] from Allah, owner of the ways of ascent.
trans-unit.target: [Mae'n] gan Allah, perchennog y ffyrdd i ddringo'r mynydd.

trans-unit.source: The angels and the Spirit will ascend to Him during a Day the extent of which is fifty thousand years.
trans-unit.target: Bydd yr angylion ac ysbryd rhedfa iddo yn ystod y dydd y mae hanner can mil o flynyddoedd.

trans-unit.source: So be patient with gracious patience.
trans-unit.target: Felly byddwch yn amyneddgar gyda amynedd graslon.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, they see it [as] distant,
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, maent yn ei weld [fel] pell,

trans-unit.source: But We see it [as] near.
trans-unit.target: Ond gwelwn ei [fel] ger.

trans-unit.source: On the Day the sky will be like murky oil,
trans-unit.target: Ar y diwrnod fydd y sky fel olew tywyll,

trans-unit.source: And the mountains will be like wool,
trans-unit.target: A fydd y mynyddoedd fel gwlân,

trans-unit.source: And no friend will ask [anything of] a friend,
trans-unit.target: A bydd unrhyw ffrind yn gofyn [beth] ffrind,

trans-unit.source: They will be shown each other. The criminal will wish that he could be ransomed from the punishment of that Day by his children
trans-unit.target: Maent yn dangos gilydd. Bydd y troseddol am y gallai ransomed o gosb y diwrnod hwnnw gan ei blant

trans-unit.source: And his wife and his brother
trans-unit.target: Ac ei wraig a'i frawd

trans-unit.source: And his nearest kindred who shelter him
trans-unit.target: Ac yn ei agosaf kindred sy'n cysgod iddo

trans-unit.source: And whoever is on earth entirely [so] then it could save him.
trans-unit.target: A phwy bynnag ar y ddaear gyfan gwbl [felly] yna gallai arbed iddo.

trans-unit.source: No! Indeed, it is the Flame [of Hell],
trans-unit.target: na! Yn wir, mae'n y Fflam [o uffern],

trans-unit.source: A remover of exteriors.
trans-unit.target: Remover o'r tu allan.

trans-unit.source: It invites he who turned his back [on truth] and went away [from obedience]
trans-unit.target: Mae'n gwahodd iddo sydd wedi troi ei gefn [ar gwirionedd] ac aeth i ffwrdd [o ufudddod]

trans-unit.source: And collected [wealth] and hoarded.
trans-unit.target: A gasglwyd [cyfoeth] a gronni.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, mankind was created anxious:
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, crëwyd dynolryw yn awyddus iawn:

trans-unit.source: When evil touches him, impatient,
trans-unit.target: Pan anfad cyffwrdd ag ef, yn ddiamynedd,

trans-unit.source: And when good touches him, withholding [of it],
trans-unit.target: A pan mae da yn cyffwrdd ag ef, celu [TG],

trans-unit.source: Except the observers of prayer -
trans-unit.target: Ac eithrio yr arsylwyr y weddi-

trans-unit.source: Those who are constant in their prayer
trans-unit.target: Rhai sydd yn gyson yn eu gweddi

trans-unit.source: And those within whose wealth is a known right
trans-unit.target: A rhai o fewn eu cyfoeth yn hysbys iawn

trans-unit.source: For the petitioner and the deprived -
trans-unit.target: Ar gyfer y deisebydd a difreintiedig-

trans-unit.source: And those who believe in the Day of Recompense
trans-unit.target: A rhai sy'n credu yn y dydd o ad-dalu

trans-unit.source: And those who are fearful of the punishment of their Lord -
trans-unit.target: A'r rhai sydd yn ofni cosbi eu Arglwydd-

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the punishment of their Lord is not that from which one is safe -
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, nid yw cosbi yr Arglwydd eu bod yr un yn ddiogel-

trans-unit.source: And those who guard their private parts
trans-unit.target: A'r rheini sy'n gwarchod eu rhannau preifat

trans-unit.source: Except from their wives or those their right hands possess, for indeed, they are not to be blamed -
trans-unit.target: Ac eithrio rhag eu gwragedd neu rhai yn eu dwylo hawl meddu ar, ar gyfer yn wir, nid ydynt yn beio-

trans-unit.source: But whoever seeks beyond that, then they are the transgressors -
trans-unit.target: Ond pwy bynnag yn ceisio tu hwnt i hynny, yna maent yn y transgressors-

trans-unit.source: And those who are to their trusts and promises attentive
trans-unit.target: A'r rhai sy'n eu ymddiriedolaethau ac addewidion sylwgar

trans-unit.source: And those who are in their testimonies upright
trans-unit.target: A'r rhai sydd yn eu dystiolaethau unionsyth

trans-unit.source: And those who [carefully] maintain their prayer:
trans-unit.target: A'r rhai sy'n cynnal eu gweddi [ofalus]:

trans-unit.source: They will be in gardens, honored.
trans-unit.target: Byddant mewn gerddi, honored.

trans-unit.source: So what is [the matter] with those who disbelieve, hastening [from] before you, [O Muhammad],
trans-unit.target: Felly beth yw'r [y mater] gyda'r rheini a chredu, prysuro [o] cyn i chi, [O Muhammad],

trans-unit.source: [To sit] on [your] right and [your] left in separate groups?
trans-unit.target: [I eistedd] ar [ch] hawl a [ch] chwith mewn grwpiau ar wahân?

trans-unit.source: Does every person among them aspire to enter a garden of pleasure?
trans-unit.target: Yw pob unigolyn yn eu plith yn anelu i fynd gardd o bleser i?

trans-unit.source: No! Indeed, We have created them from that which they know.
trans-unit.target: na! Yn wir, yr ydym wedi creu eu o hynny y maent yn gwybod.

trans-unit.source: So I swear by the Lord of [all] risings and settings that indeed We are able
trans-unit.target: Tyngaf felly gan yr Arglwydd [bob] risings a lleoliadau yn wir ein bod yn gallu

trans-unit.source: To replace them with better than them; and We are not to be outdone.
trans-unit.target: Eu disodli â gwell na hwy; ac yr ydym at ei.

trans-unit.source: So leave them to converse vainly and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised -
trans-unit.target: Felly gadael iddyn nhw sgwrsio yn ofer ac yn difyrru eu hunain nes eu bod yn bodloni eu diwrnod y maent yn addo-

trans-unit.source: The Day they will emerge from the graves rapidly as if they were, toward an erected idol, hastening.
trans-unit.target: Y dydd iddynt a fydd yn deillio o'r Beddau gyflym fel pe baent, tuag at idol wedi'i chodi, prysuro.

trans-unit.source: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. That is the Day which they had been promised.
trans-unit.target: Eu llygaid yn wylaidd, bychanu bydd ymdrin â hwy. Dyna'r diwrnod y maent wedi cael ei addo.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, [saying], "Warn your people before there comes to them a painful punishment."
trans-unit.target: Yn wir, anfonwyd Noah at ei bobl, [dweud], "Rhybuddio eich pobl cyn yno yn dod iddynt gosbi boenus."

trans-unit.source: He said, "O my people, indeed I am to you a clear warner,
trans-unit.target: Dywedodd, "Mae O 'm pobl, yn wir yr wyf i chi warner clir,

trans-unit.source: [Saying], 'Worship Allah, fear Him and obey me.
trans-unit.target: [Dweud], ' mae addoli Allah, yn ofni ef ac yn ufuddhau i mi.

trans-unit.source: Allah will forgive you of your sins and delay you for a specified term. Indeed, the time [set by] Allah, when it comes, will not be delayed, if you only knew.' "
trans-unit.target: Bydd Allah yn maddau ichi am eich pechodau ac yn oedi eich am dymor penodedig. Yn wir, yr amser [] Allah, pan ddaw, bydd nid oedi, pe gwyddech unig.' "

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, indeed I invited my people [to truth] night and day.
trans-unit.target: Meddai, "fy Arglwydd, yn wir y gwahoddais fy bobl [gwir] nos a dydd.

trans-unit.source: But my invitation increased them not except in flight.
trans-unit.target: Ond cynyddodd fy gwahoddiad iddynt nid ac eithrio ar yr awyren.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, every time I invited them that You may forgive them, they put their fingers in their ears, covered themselves with their garments, persisted, and were arrogant with [great] arrogance.
trans-unit.target: Ac yn wir, bob tro y gwahoddwyd hwy hynny efallai y byddwch yn maddau iddynt, yn rhoi eu bysedd yn eu clustiau, eu hunain wedi eu gorchuddio â eu gwisgoedd, parhau, a'u bod yn drahaus gyda thrahauster [mawr].

trans-unit.source: Then I invited them publicly.
trans-unit.target: Yna gwahoddwyd hwy i'r cyhoedd.
